hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל המנחות שנקמצו שלא לשמן כשירות אלא שלא עלו לבעלים לשם חובה חוץ ממנחת חוטא ומנחת קנאות
human_translation: All the meal offerings which a handful was removed not for their sake are fit But did not satisfy the obligation of the owner, except for the meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy,
llm_translation: Mishnah: All meal-offerings that became leavened not for their sake are valid, except that they did not ascend to the owners for the sake of obligation, except for the meal-offering of a sinner and the meal-offering of jealousy.

hebrew_text: מנחת חוטא ומנחת קנאות שקמצן שלא לשמן נתן בכלי והלך והקטיר שלא לשמן או לשמן ושלא לשמן או שלא לשמן ולשמן פסולות
human_translation: the meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy which removed a handful not for their sake, he placed in a vessel, or conveyed or burned not for their sake, or for their sake and not for their sake, or not for their sake and for their sake, are disqualified.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text you provided translates into English as follows: "The meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy, if one took a handful of them not for its oil, placed it in a vessel, and went and offered it, whether not for its oil, or for its oil, or whether not for its oil and for its oil, they are invalid."

hebrew_text: כיצד לשמן ושלא לשמן לשם מנחת חוטא ולשם מנחת נדבה שלא לשמן ולשמן לשם מנחת נדבה ולשם מנחת חוטא:
human_translation: How for their sake and not for their sake? For the sake of the meal offering of a sinner and for the sake of a voluntary meal offering. not for their sake and for their sake? For the sake of a voluntary meal offering and for the sake of the meal offering of a sinner.
llm_translation: How for oil and not for oil for the sake of a sin offering and for the sake of a voluntary offering not for oil and for oil for the sake of a voluntary offering and for the sake of a sin offering.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ למה למיתנא אלא ליתני ולא עלו לבעלים לשם חובה
human_translation: Why do I to teach: But [ ella Let it teach And they did not [ velo ] satisfy the obligation of the owner.
llm_translation: Gemara: Why was it taught? Rather, let it teach, "and they did not ascend to the owners for the purpose of obligation."

hebrew_text: הא קמ"ל לבעלים הוא דלא עלו לשום חובה הא מנחה גופה כשרה ואסור לשנויי כדרבא דאמר רבא עולה ששחטה שלא לשמה אסור לזרוק דמה שלא לשמה
human_translation: teaches us they did not satisfy the obligation of the owner; but the meal offering itself valid and prohibited to deviate in accordance with of Rava, as Rava says: a burnt offering that one slaughtered not for its own sake, prohibited to sprinkle its blood not for its own sake.
llm_translation: This teaches that for the owners, it is that they did not ascend for any obligation. This is like a meal-offering itself is valid, and it is forbidden to change it, as Rava said: an offering that was slaughtered not for its sake, it is forbidden to sprinkle its blood not for its sake.

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא סברא ואיבעית אימא קרא איבעית אימא סברא משום דמשני בה כל הני לישני בה וניזיל
human_translation: If you wish, propose a logical argument and if you wish, cite a verse If you wish, propose a logical argument: because one deviated in its he should continue to deviate in all
llm_translation: If you wish, say a logical argument; and if you wish, say a Scriptural verse; if you wish, say a logical argument, because he taught in it, all these we learn in it, and we go out.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא קרא (דברים כג, כד) מוצא שפתיך תשמור ועשית כאשר נדרת ליי' אלהיך נדבה נדבה נדר הוא קרי ליה נדר וקרי ליה נדבה אלא אם כמה שנדרת עשית יהא נדר ואם לאו יהא נדבה
human_translation: And if you wish, cite a verse: “That which has gone out of your lips you shall observe and do; according to what you have vowed as a gift offering to the Lord your God, a gift It is a vow call it a vow and call it a gift Rather, if you acted in accordance with how you vowed, vow will be but if not will be a gift
llm_translation: And if you will say, bring a verse (Deuteronomy 23:24) "You shall keep and perform what has passed your lips, just as you vowed to the Lord your God, a freewill offering," it is called a vow, and it is called a freewill offering. Rather, if you fulfilled what you vowed, it shall be a vow; and if not, it shall be a freewill offering.

hebrew_text: ונדבה מי שרי לשנויי בה
human_translation: And a gift is it permitted to deviate its
llm_translation: And a voluntary offering is permitted for changing it.

hebrew_text: לימא מתני' דלא כר' שמעון דתניא ר' שמעון אומר כל המנחות שנקמצו שלא לשמן כשירות ועלו לבעלים לשם חובה
human_translation: Let us say that the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: All the meal offerings which a handful was removed not for their sake are fit and they satisfy the obligation of the owner.
llm_translation: Let us say a teaching that is not like Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, all meal offerings that became leavened not for their sake are valid, and they ascended to the owners as a debt.

hebrew_text: שאין המנחות דומות לזבחים שהקומץ מחבת לשום מרחשת מעשיה מוכיחין עליה לשום מחבת חריבה לשום בלולה מעשיה מוכיחין עליה לשום חריבה
human_translation: as meal offerings are not similar to slaughtered offerings. that one removes a handful a pan for the sake of a deep-pan its mode of preparation proves it for the sake of a pan a dry for the sake of mixed its mode of preparation proves it for the sake of a dry
llm_translation: The meal offerings are not similar to sacrifices, for when the handful is taken from the pan, for the sake of anointing, its actions prove it; for the sake of burning, its actions prove it; for the sake of mixing, its actions prove it; for the sake of burning.

hebrew_text: אבל בזבחים אינו כן שחיטה אחת לכולן וזריקה אחת לכולן וקבלה אחת לכולן
human_translation: But with regard to slaughtered offerings it is not so, as one slaughter for all and one sprinkling for all and one collection for all
llm_translation: But in sacrifices not so, one slaughtering for all of them, and one sprinkling for all of them, and one receiving for all of them.

hebrew_text: הניחא לרב אשי דאמר כאן בקומץ מחבת לשום מרחשת כאן בקומץ מנחת מחבת לשום מנחת מרחשת
human_translation: This works out well, according to Rav Ashi, who says Here, where removing a handful a pan for the sake of a deep pan, there, where removing a handful a pan meal offering for the sake of a deep-pan meal offering.
llm_translation: It is preferable according to Rav Ashi who said here with a handful of a pan of garlic for a meal-offering of a pan of incense, here with a handful of a meal-offering of a pan of garlic for a meal-offering of incense.

hebrew_text: מתניתין מנחה לשום מנחה היא אלא לרבה ורבא מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: the mishna is a meal offering for the sake of meal offering, But according to Rabba and Rava, what can be said?
llm_translation: Mishnah: "Minchah" is for the sake of "minchah." Rather, what can be said for Rabah and Rava?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא כדקא משני רבה כאן בשינוי קדש כאן בשינוי בעלים
human_translation: And if you would say as Rabba answers, Here, to a change of sanctity, there, to a change of owner,
llm_translation: And if you will say, as Rabah explained here regarding a change in sanctity, and there regarding a change in ownership.

hebrew_text: הא מתניתין שינוי קודש הוא דקתני כיצד לשמן ושלא לשמן לשום מנחת חוטא ולשום מנחת נדבה
human_translation: The mishna is a change of sanctity, as it teaches: How for their sake and not for their sake, for the sake of the meal offering of a sinner and for the sake of a voluntary meal offering.
llm_translation: This is a Mishnah teaching: it is a change of sanctity, as it teaches: how so? For the sake of its oil and not for the sake of its oil, for the sake of a sin offering and for the sake of a voluntary offering.

hebrew_text: ואי נמי כדקא משני רבא כאן בקומץ מנחה לשום מנחה כאן בקומץ מנחה לשום זבח
human_translation: And alternatively, as Rava answers, Here, where one removes a handful a meal offering for the sake of meal offering, there, where one removes a handful a meal offering for the sake of a slaughtered offering.
llm_translation: And if not, as Rava taught: here with the handful of the meal-offering for the sake of the meal-offering, here with the handful of the meal-offering for the sake of the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: הא מתניתין מנחה לשום מנחה היא דקתני שלא לשמן ולשמן לשם מנחת נדבה לשם מנחת חוטא אלא לרבה ורבא מחוורתא מתני' דלא כר"ש
human_translation: The mishna is a meal offering for the sake of meal offering, as it teaches: not for their sake and for their sake? for the sake of a voluntary meal offering for the sake of the meal offering of a sinner. Rather, according to Rabba and Rava, it is clear the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: This is the Mishnah: A Minchah offering for the sake of a Minchah offering, as it teaches, not for oil, and for oil, for the sake of a voluntary Minchah offering, for the sake of a sin offering Minchah offering, rather, for Rabba and Rava from Mahuza teach that it is not like Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: ורמי דר"ש אדר"ש דתניא ר' שמעון אומר  קדש קדשים היא כחטאת וכאשם יש מהן כחטאת ויש מהן כאשם
human_translation: And raises a contradiction of Rabbi Shimon and of Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon says “It is most sacred, as the sin offering, and as the guilt offering” there are some like a sin offering, and there are some like a guilt offering.
llm_translation: And it was raised in a homiletical interpretation: as it was taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Shimon says, "Most holy it is, like a sin offering and like a guilt offering. Some of them are like a sin offering, and some of them are like a guilt offering."

hebrew_text: מנחת חוטא הרי היא כחטאת לפיכך קמצה שלא לשמה פסולה כחטאת מנחת נדבה הרי היא כאשם לפיכך קמצה שלא לשמה כשירה
human_translation: the meal offering of a sinner is like a sin offering. Therefore, removed a handful it not for its own sake, disqualified, like a sin offering a voluntary meal offering is like a guilt offering. Therefore, removed a handful it not for its own sake, valid,
llm_translation: The offering of a sin-offering, behold it is like a sin-offering; therefore, if one took a handful not for its sake, it is invalid like a sin-offering. The offering of a voluntary meal-offering, behold it is like a guilt-offering; therefore, if one took a handful not for its sake, it is valid.

hebrew_text: וכאשם מה אשם כשר ואינו מרצה אף מנחת נדבה כשירה ואינה מרצה
human_translation: And like a guilt offering Just as a guilt offering valid but it does not effect acceptance, so too, a voluntary meal offering valid but it does not effect acceptance.
llm_translation: "And like an asham, what is an asham valid but not pleasing, so too a minchat nedavah is valid but not pleasing."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה לא קשיא כאן בשינוי קודש כאן בשינוי בעלים
human_translation: Rabba said not difficult. Here, to a change of sanctity, there, to a change of owner,
llm_translation: Rabbah said: It is not difficult. Here it is a change of sanctity, here it is a change of ownership.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי מכדי מחשבה דפסל רחמנא הקישא היא מה לי שינוי קודש מ"ל שינוי בעלים
human_translation: Abaye said to Now that the Merciful One disqualifies intent is comparison what to me a change of sanctity, what to me a change of owner?
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Since the thought of the Merciful One is considered as an action, it is compared to the actual action; just as I am liable for a change in the sanctity of an item, so too am I liable for a change in ownership.

hebrew_text: א"ל מעשיה מוכיחין דקאמר ר"ש סברא היא דר"ש דריש טעמא דקרא
human_translation: said to its mode of preparation proves which Rabbi Shimon states is logical reasoning, as Rabbi Shimon interprets the reason in the verse
llm_translation: He said to Ma'ashiya: "Proofs that Rabbi Shimon is saying a logical argument, for Rabbi Shimon interprets the reason of the verse."

hebrew_text: מחשבה דלא מינכרא פסל רחמנא מחשבה דמינכרא לא פסל רחמנא
human_translation: the Merciful One disqualifies intent that is not recognizably The Merciful One does not disqualify intent that is recognizably
llm_translation: Thought that is not recognizable, the Merciful One disqualifies; thought that is recognizable, the Merciful One does not disqualify.

hebrew_text: (סי' עולה עולה מלק ומיצה חטאת העוף קדשי קדשים קדשים קלים)
human_translation: a mnemonic: Burnt offering, burnt offering, pinched and squeezed, bird sin offering, offerings of the most sacred order, offerings of lesser sanctity.
llm_translation: Chapter: Ola, Ola, Miluk, and Mitzvah, Chatat of the Bird, Kodshei Kodashim, Kodashim, Kalim.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה עולת העוף שמלקה למעלה משום חטאת העוף תרצה מעשיה מוכיחין עליה דעולת העוף היא דאי חטאת העוף היא למטה הוי עביד לה
human_translation: if that is so, a bird burnt offering where one pinched its above for the sake of a bird sin offering, should effect acceptance the actions on it prove that it is a bird burnt offering. Because if it is a bird sin offering, he would have performed below
llm_translation: Rather now, the burnt offering of a bird that is sprinkled above for the sin offering of a bird, its actions prove concerning it that the burnt offering of a bird it is, for if the sin offering of a bird were below, it would perform for it.

hebrew_text: אטו חטאת העוף למעלה מי ליתא האמר מר מליקה בכל מקום במזבח כשרה
human_translation: Is that to say a bird sin offering above is not Didn’t the Master say: pinching in any place on the altar valid
llm_translation: Is then the sin-offering of a bird above water not valid? The Master said: Melikah is valid anywhere on the altar.

hebrew_text: עולת העוף שמיצה דמה למעלה לשם חטאת העוף תרצה מעשיה מוכיחין עליה דעולת העוף היא דאי חטאת העוף היא למטה הוה עביד לה הזאה
human_translation: a bird burnt offering where squeezed its blood above for the sake of a bird sin offering should effect acceptance, the actions on it prove that it is a bird burnt offering. Because if it is a bird sin offering, he would have performed sprinkling below
llm_translation: The burnt offering of a bird, its blood is squeezed above, for the sin offering of a bird, its actions are acceptable. We prove regarding it that the burnt offering of a bird is it, for if the sin offering of a bird were below, it would have required sprinkling.

hebrew_text: אמרי דילמא מיצוי דבתר הזאה הוא דאמר מר מיצה דמה בכל מקום במזבח כשירה
human_translation: say: Perhaps It is the squeezing that follows sprinkling, As the Master said: squeezed the blood of in any place on the altar, valid.
llm_translation: They said: Perhaps the removal after sprinkling is what the Master said, the removal is valid everywhere on the altar.

hebrew_text: חטאת העוף שהזה דמה למטה לשם עולת העוף תרצה דמעשיה מוכיחין עליה דחטאת עוף היא דאי עולת העוף היא למעלה הוה עביד לה ומיצוי הוה עביד ליה
human_translation: a bird sin offering whose blood sprinkled below for the sake of a bird burnt offering should effect acceptance, as the actions on it prove that it is a bird sin offering. Because if it is a bird burnt offering, he would have performed it above and he would have performed squeezing
llm_translation: Sin-offering of bird that sprinkled its blood below for the sake of burnt-offering of bird, acceptable, its actions prove regarding it that it is a sin-offering of bird, for if it were a burnt-offering of bird, it would have done it above and the wringing out would have been done for it.

hebrew_text: ה"נ אלא לפי שאין המנחות דומות לזבחים קאמר לזבחים ולא לעופות:
human_translation: Indeed, Rather, he said: Because meal offerings are not similar to slaughtered offerings, to slaughtered offerings, but not to bird
llm_translation: So it was taught: Rather, because the meal offerings are not similar to the sacrifices, it is stated regarding the sacrifices and not regarding the birds.

hebrew_text: קדשי קדשים ששחטן בצפון לשם קדשים קלים לירצו מעשיהן מוכיחין עליהן דקדשי קדשים נינהו דאי קדשים קלים בדרום הוה עביד להו
human_translation: offerings of the most sacred order that one slaughtered in the northern for the sake of offerings of lesser sanctity, should effect acceptance the actions on them prove that they are offerings of the most sacred order. Because if offerings of lesser sanctity, he would have performed their in the southern
llm_translation: Holy of Holies that slaughtered in the north for the sake of lesser holies to be accepted, their actions prove concerning them that they are Holy of Holies, for if they were lesser holies in the south, it would be effective for them.

hebrew_text: אימור דאמר רחמנא אף בדרום בדרום ולא בצפון מי אמר דתנן שחיטתן בכל מקום בעזרה
human_translation: say that the Merciful One states even in the southern Did say in the southern and not in the northern as we learned the slaughter of in any place within the courtyard.
llm_translation: Statement: The Merciful One said, "Even in the south, in the south, and not in the north." Who said this? As we learned in a Mishnah: Their slaughtering is valid anywhere in the Temple courtyard.

hebrew_text: קדשים קלים ששחטן בדרום לשם קדשי קדשים לירצו מעשיהן מוכיחין עליהן דקדשים קלים נינהו דאי קדשי קדשים בצפון הוה עביד להו
human_translation: offerings of lesser sanctity that one slaughtered in the southern for the sake of offerings of the most sacred order should effect acceptance the actions on them prove that they are offerings of lesser sanctity. Because if offerings of the most sacred order, he would have performed their in the northern
llm_translation: Holy things light that slaughtered in the south for the sake of holy of holies to be accepted their actions prove upon them that holy things light they are for if holy of holies in the north would be made for them

hebrew_text: אמרי קדשי קדשים נינהו ומיעבר הוא דעבר ושחט להו בדרום
human_translation: say: They are offerings of the most sacred order, but transgressed and slaughtered them in the southern
llm_translation: They said: "They are the Holy of Holies, and it is permissible to pass over, and he slaughtered for them in the south."

hebrew_text: אי הכי מחבת לשם מרחשת נמי האי דקא קמיץ לה למרחשת אמר האי במרחשת נדר והא דמייתי לה במחבת דמרחשת היא ומעבר הוא דעבר ואתייה במחבת
human_translation: If so, a pan for the sake of a deep-pan as well, that this removes a handful for a deep-pan say: This took a vow in a deep pan, and that he brings it in a pan, it is of a deep pan and transgressed and brought it in a pan.
llm_translation: If so, a frying pan for the sake of a griddle is also considered this one object that he is designating for a griddle. He said, "This object is for a griddle." And that which he brought for it to designate with a frying pan, it is considered for a griddle, and it is a transgression of his vow, and he brings it with a frying pan.

hebrew_text: התם כי נמי במרחשת נדר כי מייתי לה במחבת מחבת הויא
human_translation: There, even if took a vow in a deep pan, when he brings it in a pan it is pan
llm_translation: There too, for also in Marḥeshet, a vow, for I brought to her in a pot, a pot it was.

hebrew_text: כדתנן האומר הרי עלי במחבת והביא במרחשת במרחשת והביא במחבת מה שהביא הביא וידי נדרו לא יצא
human_translation: as we learned One who says: It upon me in a pan, and he brought in a deep pan, in a deep pan, and he brought in a pan, that he brought, he brought, but he did not fulfill his vow,
llm_translation: As we have learned in the Mishnah: One who says, "I undertake to bring a meal-offering in a pan," and then brings it in a pot, or says, "in a pot" and then brings it in a pan, what he brought, he brought, but he has not fulfilled his vow.

hebrew_text: ודילמא אמר זו להביא במחבת והביא במרחשת כדתנן זו להביא במחבת והביא במרחשת במרחשת והביא במחבת הרי זו פסולה
human_translation: But Perhaps said: This bring in a pan, and he brought in a deep pan. as we learned This bring in a pan, and he brought in a deep pan, in a deep pan, and he brought in a pan, it is disqualified,
llm_translation: Perhaps one might say, this case is when one intended to bring the offering in a frying pan, and instead brought it in a pot. As we learned in a Mishnah: this case is when one intended to bring the offering in a frying pan, and instead brought it in a pot. But if one intended in a pot, and instead brought it in a frying pan, behold, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: לרבנן ה"נ לר"ש כיון דאמר ר"ש אף ידי נדרו יצא אלמא קביעותא דמנא ולא כלום הוא ולא שנא אמר זו ולא שנא אמר עלי
human_translation: According to the Rabbis, indeed according to Rabbi Shimon since Rabbi Shimon says: He has fulfilled even his vow. Evidently, the designation of the vessel is nothing and is no difference he said: This and there is no difference he said: upon me
llm_translation: To the Rabbis: Thus said Rabbi Shimon: Since Rabbi Shimon said, "Even his hands have fulfilled his vow," it follows that the establishment of a count is nothing, and it is no different whether he said this or he said that.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה עולה ששחט לשם חטאת תרצה דהאי זכר והאי נקבה כיון דאיכא שעיר נשיא דזכר הוא לא ידיע
human_translation: If that is so, a burnt offering that one slaughtered for the sake of a sin offering should effect acceptance. as this, male, and that, female. Since there is the goat of Nasi , which is male, it is unknown
llm_translation: Rather now, an offering that was slaughtered for the sake of a sin-offering is acceptable, for this one is male and that one is female, since there is a male goat designated as a sin-offering, it is not known.

hebrew_text: אמר לשם חטאת יחיד מאי איכא למימר ותו חטאת יחיד ששחטה לשם עולה תרצה דחטאת נקבה ועולה זכר מיכסיא באליה
human_translation: said: for the sake of a sin offering of an individual, what can be said? And furthermore, a sin offering of an individual that one slaughtered for the sake of a burnt offering should effect acceptance, as a sin offering female, and a burnt offering male. covered by tail.
llm_translation: He said to there sin-offering individual what is there to say and furthermore sin-offering individual that slaughtered it for the sake of burnt-offering will be acceptable for a female sin-offering and a male burnt-offering will be sufficient for it.

hebrew_text: התינח היכא דאייתי כבשה אייתי שעירה מאי איכא למימר אלא בין זכרים לנקבות לאו אדעתייהו דאינשי
human_translation: works out well where one brought a female lamb brought a female goat, what can be said? Rather, between males and females is not on people’s minds,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Where it is stated 'bring a female sheep,' one may bring a female goat. What can be said about this? Rather, between males and females, do people not distinguish?"

hebrew_text: פסח ששחטו לשם אשם לירצי דהאי בן שנה והאי בן שתים כיון דאיכא אשם נזיר ואשם מצורע לא פסיקא ליה
human_translation: A Paschal offering that one slaughtered for the sake of a guilt offering should effect acceptance, as this, in its year, and that, in its second Since there are the guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper it is not definitively to
llm_translation: Passover sacrifice that slaughtered for the sake of guilt offering for the satisfaction of this one year old and this two year old, once there is a guilt offering of a Nazirite and a guilt offering of a leper, it does not interrupt for him.

hebrew_text: אמר לשום אשם גזילות ולשום אשם מעילות מאי איכא למימר ותו אשם גזילות ואשם מעילות ששחטן לשום פסח לירצו דפסח בן שנה והני בן שתי שנים
human_translation: said: for the sake of a guilt offering for robbery, or for the sake of a guilt offering for misuse what can be said? And furthermore, a guilt offering for robbery or a guilt offering for misuse that one slaughtered for the sake of a Paschal offering should effect acceptance, as a Paschal offering is in its year, and these are in their second year.
llm_translation: He said regarding a guilt offering for thefts and regarding a guilt offering for trespasses, what can be said? And furthermore, a guilt offering for thefts and a guilt offering for trespasses, if one slaughtered them for the sake of the Passover, they are acceptable, for the Passover sacrifice is valid from one year old, and these offerings are two years old.

hebrew_text: אלא בין בן שנה לבין בן שתי שנים לאו אדעתייהו דאינשי דאיכא בן שנה דמיחזי כבן שתים ואיכא בן שתים דמיחזי כבן שנה
human_translation: Rather, between in its year and in its second year is not on people’s minds, as there be in its year that appears as in its second and there be in its second that appears as in its year.
llm_translation: Rather, between one year old and two years old, one cannot discern the minds of people, for there is a one-year-old who appears as though he were two, and there is a two-year-old who appears as though he were one.

hebrew_text: שעיר ששחטו לשום אשם לירצי דהאי צמר והאי שיער אמרי דיכרא אוכמא הוא
human_translation: A goat that one slaughtered for the sake of a guilt offering should effect acceptance. as this, wool, and that, hair. say is a black ram,
llm_translation: The goat that was slaughtered as a guilt-offering for the residents of this city, whether it is of wool or of hair, they say it is considered like a male.

hebrew_text: עגל ופר ששחטן לשום פסח ואשם לירצו דעגל ופר בפסח ואשם ליכא אין הכי נמי
human_translation: A calf or a bull that one slaughtered for the sake of a Paschal offering or a guilt offering should effect acceptance. as a calf or bull is not as a Paschal offering or a guilt offering. Yes, is indeed so,
llm_translation: Calf and bull slaughtered for the sake of Passover and guilt offering to be acceptable, calf and bull on Passover and guilt offering not so, indeed.

hebrew_text: ומאי זבחים רוב זבחים
human_translation: And what slaughtered offerings? most slaughtered offerings.
llm_translation: And what is the meaning of "zvachim" - the majority of sacrifices?

hebrew_text: רבא אמר ל"ק כאן בקומץ מנחה לשום מנחה כאן בקומץ מנחה לשום זבח
human_translation: Rava said: not difficult. Here, where one removes a handful a meal offering for the sake of a meal offering. There, where one removes a handful a meal offering for the sake of a slaughtered offering.
llm_translation: Rava said to Rav Kahana: Here, with the handful of the meal-offering, for the sake of the meal-offering; here, with the handful of the meal-offering, for the sake of the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: מנחה לשום מנחה (ויקרא ו, ז) וזאת תורת המנחה תורה אחת לכל המנחות מנחה לשום זבח וזאת תורת המנחה וזבח לא כתיב
human_translation: a meal offering for the sake of meal offering “And this is the law of the meal offering” one law for all the meal offerings, a meal offering for the sake of a slaughtered offering, And this is the law of the meal offering and a slaughtered offering, is not written
llm_translation: Mincha for the sake of a mincha (Leviticus 6:7) "And this is the law of the mincha" - one law for all minchot. A mincha for the sake of a sacrifice, and "And this is the law of the mincha," but a sacrifice is not written.

hebrew_text: והא תנא מפני שמעשיה מוכיחין עליה קאמר הכי קאמר אע"ג דמחשבה דלא מינכרא היא ותיפסל וזאת תורת המנחה תורה אחת לכל המנחות
human_translation: But doesn’t the tanna , say that its mode of preparation proves it this is saying: Even though where it is not recognizable intention and should be disqualified, “And this is the law of the meal offering,” one law for all the meal offerings.
llm_translation: And is it not taught: "Because her actions testify against her," is what it means when it says so. Even though her intention is not recognizable, it becomes disqualified. "And this is the law of the meal offering," one law for all meal offerings.

hebrew_text: ומאי אבל בזבחים אינו כן
human_translation: And what But with regard to slaughtered offerings it is not so?
llm_translation: And what is the meaning of "but not in sacrifices"?

hebrew_text: אע"ג דשחיטה אחת לכולן וזאת תורת המנחה וזבח לא כתיב
human_translation: Even though one slaughter for all And this is the law of the meal offering and a slaughtered offering, is not written.
llm_translation: Although one slaughter for all of them, and this is the law of the meal offering, and sacrifice is not written.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה חטאת חלב ששחטה לשם חטאת דם לשום חטאת עבודת כוכבים לשום חטאת נזיר לשום חטאת מצורע תהא כשירה ותרצה דאמר רחמנא (ויקרא ו, יח) וזאת תורת החטאת תורה אחת לכל חטאות
human_translation: If that is so, a sin offering fat that one slaughtered for the sake of a sin offering blood, for the sake of a sin offering idol worship, for the sake of a sin offering of a nazirite, for the sake of a sin offering of a leper should be valid and effect acceptance. As the Merciful One states: “And this is the law of the sin offering” one law for all sin offerings.
llm_translation: Rather now, sin-offering fat that slaughtered for the sake of sin-offering blood for the sake of idolatrous worship for the sake of a Nazirite sin-offering should be valid and acceptable, for the Merciful One said, "And this is the law of the sin-offering: one law for all sin-offerings."

hebrew_text: לר"ש ה"נ לרבנן הא אמר [רבא] חטאת חלב ששחטה לשם חטאת דם לשום חטאת עבודת כוכבים כשירה לשם חטאת נזיר [לשם חטאת] מצורע פסולה דהני עולות בהדייהו נינהו
human_translation: According to Rabbi Shimon, indeed According to the Rabbis, says: A sin offering fat that one slaughtered for the sake of a sin offering blood for the sake of a sin offering idol worship valid. for the sake of a sin offering of a nazirite a leper disqualified, as these there are burnt offerings with them.
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon it was taught, to the Rabbis it was taught: This is what Rava said - a sin-offering of fat, if one slaughtered it for the sake of a sin-offering, its blood for the sake of idol worship, it is valid; for the sake of a nazirite sin-offering, it is invalid. Because these burnt-offerings are with them.

hebrew_text: רב אחא בריה דרבא מתני ליה לכולהו לפסולא ושחט אותה לחטאת לשם אותו חטאת
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, teaches all of these disqualification “And slaughter it for a sin offering” for the sake of that sin offering,
llm_translation: Rav Acha, son of Rava, teaches for all of them to disqualify, and slaughter it for a sin-offering for the sake of that sin-offering.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר ל"ק כאן בקומץ (מנחת) מחבת לשום מרחשת כאן בקומץ מנחת מחבת לשום מנחת מרחשת
human_translation: Rav Ashi said not difficult. Here, where removing a handful a pan meal offering for the sake of a deep pan, There, where he removing a handful a pan meal offering for the sake of a deep-pan meal offering.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to the Tanna Kamma: Here in the handful of the Minchah offering, one is obligated for garlic of the mortar. Here in the handful of the Minchah offering, one is obligated for the garlic of the Minchah offering.

hebrew_text: (מנחת) מחבת לשום מרחשת במנא קא מחשב ומחשבה במנא לא פסלה מנחת מחבת לשום מנחת מרחשת במנחה דפסלה בה מחשבה קא מחשב
human_translation: a pan meal offering for the sake of a deep pan, he has intent with regard to vessel, and intention with regard to vessel does not disqualify a pan meal offering for the sake of a deep-pan meal offering, he has intent with regard to meal offering, which intention does disqualify.
llm_translation: (Minchat) machavat le'shom maracheshet b'mana ka machshevet u'machshava b'mana lo paslah minchat machavat le'shom minchat maracheshet b'mincha d'paslah bah machsheva ka machshev.

hebrew_text: והא תנא מפני שמעשיה מוכיחין עליה קאמר הכי קאמר אע"ג דמחשבה מינכר היא תיפסל
human_translation: But doesn’t the tanna , say that its mode of preparation proves it this is saying: Even though intention is recognizable should be disqualified,
llm_translation: And, is it not taught: "Because her actions testify against her," is what it means when it says so, saying, "Even though her intention is recognizable, she will be disqualified."

hebrew_text: ומאי אבל בזבחים אינו כן אע"ג דשחיטה אחת לכולן זריקה אחת לכולן קבלה אחת לכולן בזביחה דפסלה ביה מחשבה קא מחשב
human_translation: And what But with regard to slaughtered offerings it is not so? even though one slaughter for all one sprinkling for all one collection for all has intent with regard to slaughtering, which intention does disqualify.
llm_translation: And what is the case of mourning in sacrifices not so? Even though there is one slaughtering for all, one sprinkling for all, one receiving for all, in the case of a sacrifice, if there was a disqualifying thought involved, he is considering a disqualification.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי חרבה משום בלולה אמאי אמר ר"ש א"ל לשום בילה בעלמא
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: a dry for the sake of mixed why did Rabbi Shimon say said to him: merely for the sake of mixing,
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rava, to Rav Ashi: "Why is the sword hollow?" Rabbi Shimon said to him: "For the sake of the handle itself."

hebrew_text: אי הכי לשום שלמים נמי לשום שלמים בעלמא
human_translation: If so, for the sake of a peace offering as well, merely for the sake of peace [ shelamim ]
llm_translation: If so, for the sake of peace, also for the sake of peace in general.

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם זבח גופה איקרי שלמים דכתיב (ויקרא ז, לג) המקריב את דם השלמים הזורק את דם השלמים הכא מנחה גופה מי איקרי בלולה (ויקרא ז, י) וכל מנחה בלולה בשמן כתיב בלולה בשמן איקרי בלולה סתמא לא איקרי
human_translation: How can be compared? There, offering itself is called shelamim , as it is written: “Who sacrifices the blood of the peace offering [ shelamim ]” “Who sprinkles the blood of the peace offering” Here, is a meal offering itself called mixed? is written: “And every meal offering, mixed with oil” is called: Mixed with oil, it is not simply called: Mixed.
llm_translation: So now there, a sacrifice itself is called "shelamim," as it is written (Leviticus 7:33), "The one who offers the flesh of the shelamim, he shall offer the blood of the shelamim." But here, a meal-offering itself, what is it called? "Belulah" (mixed), as it is written (Leviticus 7:10), "And every meal-offering mixed with oil." It is written "mixed with oil," so it is called "belulah." If it is unspecified, it is not called "belulah."

hebrew_text: כולהו כרבה לא אמרי דאדרבה מחשבה דמנכרא פסל רחמנא
human_translation: All do not say as Rabba that on the contrary, the Merciful One disqualifies recognizably intent.
llm_translation: All of them like Rava did not say, rather on the contrary, the thought of a non-Jew is considered by the Merciful One as idolatry.

hebrew_text: כרבא לא אמרי וזאת תורת לא משמע להו
human_translation: do not say as Rava “And this is the law does not indicate to them
llm_translation: As Rava did not say, "And this is the teaching they do not infer."

hebrew_text: כרב אשי לא אמרי משום קושיא דרב אחא בריה דרבא
human_translation: did not say as Rav Ashi because of the difficulty by Rav Aḥa, son of Rava,
llm_translation: Like Rav Ashi did not say because of the difficulty of Rav Acha, son of Rava.

hebrew_text: מילתא דפשיטא ליה לרבה להאי גיסא ולרבא להאי גיסא מיבעיא ליה לרב הושעיא דבעי רב הושעיא ואמרי לה בעא מיניה רב הושעיא מרבי אסי מנחה לשום זבח
human_translation: The matter that is obvious to Rabba in one way, and to Rava in the other way, is a dilemma for Rav Hoshaya. As Rav Hoshaya raises a dilemma, and some say Rav Hoshaya raises dilemma before Rav Asi: a meal offering for the sake of a slaughtered offering,
llm_translation: The matter that is clear to Rabah for this case, and to Rava for that case, it is asked of Rav Hoshaya. Rav Hoshaya requires, and some say he requested from him, Rav Hoshaya from Rabbi Asi, a Mincha offering for the sake of a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: מה לי א"ר שמעון טעמא דר' שמעון משום מחשבה דמינכרא לא פסלה והא מחשבה דמינכרא הוא
human_translation: what I Rabbi Shimon says the reason of Rabbi Shimon, that intent that is recognizably does not disqualify And this is intent that is recognizably
llm_translation: What is it to me? Rabbi Shimon said: The reason of Rabbi Shimon is because of thought, that it is not considered a disqualifying factor, but thought is indeed a disqualifying factor.

hebrew_text: או דילמא טעמא דר"ש משום דכתיב (ויקרא ו, ז) וזאת תורת המנחה וזבח לא כתיב אמר ליה כלום הגענו לסוף דעתו של ר"ש
human_translation: Or perhaps the reason of Rabbi Shimon is that it is written: “And this is the law of the meal offering” is not written: and a slaughtered offering. said to Have we ascertained the depth of the opinion of Rabbi Shimon
llm_translation: Or perhaps the reason for Rabbi Shimon's opinion is because it is written (Leviticus 6:7), "This is the law of the meal offering and the sacrifice," but it does not say "and the offering." He said to him, "Have we not reached the end of Rabbi Shimon's opinion?"

hebrew_text: כרבה לא משני ליה משום קושיא דאביי
human_translation: did not resolve with Rabba, because of the difficulty Abaye
llm_translation: Rabah did not change it because of the difficulty of Abaye.

hebrew_text: כרבא לא משני ליה משום קושיא וזאת תורת החטאת
human_translation: did not resolve in accordance with Rava, because of the difficulty “And this is the law of the sin offering”
llm_translation: Rava does not change it because of a difficulty, "And this is the law of the sin offering."

hebrew_text: כרב אשי לא משני ליה משום קושיא דרב אחא בריה דרבא:
human_translation: did not resolve in accordance with Rav Ashi, because of the difficulty Rav Aḥa, son of Rava.
llm_translation: Like Rav Ashi did not teach it because of the difficulty of Rav Acha, son of Rava.

hebrew_text: חוץ ממנחת חוטא ומנחת קנאות: בשלמא מנחת חוטא חטאת קרייה רחמנא (ויקרא ה, יא) לא ישים עליה שמן ולא יתן עליה לבונה כי חטאת היא וגו' אלא מנחת קנאות מנלן
human_translation: except for the meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy. Granted, the meal offering of a sinner the Merciful One calls it a sin offering, “He shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put any frankincense upon it, for it is a sin offering. But the meal offering of jealousy, from where do we
llm_translation: Except for the meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy: Regarding the meal offering of a sinner, the Merciful One calls it a sin offering (Leviticus 5:11) "He shall not put oil upon it, nor shall he place frankincense upon it, for it is a sin offering," etc. But as for the meal offering of jealousy, from where do we derive it?

hebrew_text: דתני תנא קמיה דרב נחמן מנחת קנאות מותרה נדבה
human_translation: as a tanna taught before Rav Naḥman: a meal offering of jealousy, its surplus, gift
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita before Rav Nahman: A Minchat Kena'ot is permitted as a voluntary offering.

hebrew_text: א"ל שפיר קאמרת (במדבר ה, טו) מזכרת עון כתיב בה ובחטאת כתיב (ויקרא י, יז) ואותה נתן לכם לשאת את עון העדה מה חטאת מותרה נדבה אף מנחת קנאות מותרה נדבה וכחטאת מה חטאת פסולה שלא לשמה אף מנחת קנאות פסולה שלא לשמה
human_translation: said to him: You are saying well, it is written with regard to “Bringing iniquity to remembrance” and it is written with regard to a sin offering: “And He has given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation” just as a sin offering, its surplus gift so too, a meal offering of jealousy, its surplus gift And like a sin offering Just as a sin offering is disqualified not for its own sake, so too, a meal offering of jealousy is disqualified not for its own sake.
llm_translation: He said to her, "You are speaking well." It is written "mentioning sin" and it is written "sin offering." "And He gave it to you to carry the sin of the congregation." Just as a sin offering is permissible as a voluntary offering, so too a meal offering of jealousy is permissible as a voluntary offering. And just as a sin offering is invalid if not for its sake, so too a meal offering of jealousy is invalid if not for its sake.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה אשם יהא פסול שלא לשמו דגמר עון עון מחטאת
human_translation: If that is so, a guilt offering should be disqualified not for its own sake, as derived from iniquity [ avon ] a sin offering, iniquity”
llm_translation: Rather now, an Asham should be invalid if not for its sake, as it is learned: "guilt guilt from sin offering."

hebrew_text: דנין עון מעון ואין דנין עונו מעון
human_translation: One derives “iniquity” from “iniquity,” but one does not derive “his iniquity [ avono ]” from “iniquity.”
llm_translation: We judge a sin from a sin, but we do not judge his sin from his punishment.

hebrew_text: מאי נפקא מינה והא תנא דבי ר' ישמעאל (ויקרא יד, לט) ושב הכהן ובא הכהן זו היא שיבה זו היא ביאה
human_translation: What difference is Didn’t the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach “And the priest shall return [ veshav ] “And the priest shall come [ uva ] This returning this coming
llm_translation: What is derived from this? But didn't the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach: "And the priest shall return and the priest shall come" (Leviticus 14:39) - this is returning, this is coming.

hebrew_text: ועוד ליגמר עונו עונו מעון דשמיעת הקול דכתיב (ויקרא ה, א) אם לא יגיד ונשא עונו
human_translation: And furthermore, let one derive “his iniquity” “his iniquity” from iniquity for hearing the voice, as it is written: “If he does not utter it, then he shall bear his iniquity”
llm_translation: And furthermore, to complete his transgression, transgression is attributed to the dwelling of the voice, as it is written (Leviticus 5:1), "If a person sins and does not declare it, he shall bear his iniquity."

hebrew_text: אלא כי גמרי גזירה שוה למותר נדבה הוא דגמרי
human_translation: Rather, when the verbal analogy was derived, it was derived to surplus gift
llm_translation: Rather, when they complete a gezeirah shavah for something permitted, it is considered a gezeirah shavah.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא אין גזירה שוה למחצה גלי רחמנא גבי חטאת (ויקרא ד, לג) ושחט אותה לחטאת אותה לשמה כשירה שלא לשמה פסולה אבל כל קדשים בין לשמן בין שלא לשמן כשרים
human_translation: And if you would say there is no partial verbal analogy, the Merciful One revealed with regard to a sin offering “And slaughter it for a sin offering” it, for its own sake valid, not for its own sake disqualified. But all sacrificial whether for their sake or not for their sake, are valid.
llm_translation: And if you were to say, is there not a gezeirah shavah for half of the revealed mercy of the Merciful One regarding the sin offering (Leviticus 4:33), "And he shall slaughter it for the sin offering"? Slaughtering it for its intended purpose is valid; slaughtering it not for its intended purpose is invalid. But all consecrated items, whether for their intended purpose or not for their intended purpose, are valid.

hebrew_text: אלא מנחת חוטא ומנחת קנאות דפסולין שלא לשמן מנלן
human_translation: But from where do we that the meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy are disqualified not for their sake?
llm_translation: Rather, the meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy are disqualified, how do we know this?

hebrew_text: חטאת טעמא מאי משום דכתיב בה היא ה"נ הא כתיב בהו היא
human_translation: a sin offering, what is the reason because it is written with regard to “It,” So too, it is written with regard to them, “It.”
llm_translation: Sin offering, what is the reason? Because it is written about it "it is she." Now, it is written about them "it is she."

hebrew_text: אשם נמי הא כתיב ביה הוא ההוא הוא לאחר הקטרת אימורין הוא דכתיב
human_translation: a guilt offering as well, it is written about “It,” That “it” is written with regard to after the burning of sacrificial portions [ eimurin ]
llm_translation: Guilt-offering also this written in it he he he after the burning incense-offerings he is that written

hebrew_text: כדתניא אבל אשם לא נאמר בו הוא אלא לאחר הקטרת אימורין הוא עצמו שלא הוקטרו אימוריו כשר
human_translation: As it is taught But a guilt offering, it is stated about “It only after the burning of sacrificial portions. itself valid its sacrificial portions were not burned
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: But "guilt-offering" was not stated regarding it, rather, only after the burning of its portions itself that were not burned, its portions are valid.

hebrew_text: ואלא הוא למה לי לכדרב הונא אמר רב אשם שניתק לרעייה ושחטו סתם כשר לשום עולה
human_translation: But why do I “it” for that which Rav Huna Rav says: a guilt offering that was consigned to grazing slaughtered it without specification fit as a burnt offering.
llm_translation: And rather, why do I need it? According to Rav Huna, Rav said: A guilt-offering that was detached for its fellow and slaughtered it without specific intent is valid for a burnt-offering.

hebrew_text: ניתק אין לא ניתק לא אמר קרא הוא בהוייתו יהא:
human_translation: it was consigned yes, it was not consigned not The verse states: “It it shall as it is,
llm_translation: He was cut off, he was not cut off, as the verse says, "In his lifetime, may he be."

hebrew_text: אמר רב מנחת העומר שקמצה שלא לשמה פסולה הואיל ובאת להתיר ולא התירה וכן אתה אומר באשם נזיר
human_translation: Rav says: the omer meal offering, removed a handful not for its own sake disqualified. since came to permit and did not permit And so you say with regard to the guilt offering of a nazirite
llm_translation: Rav said: "A Minchat HaOmer that was kneaded not for its sake is invalid, since you came to permit it and did not permit it. Similarly, you say regarding the Asham Nazir."

hebrew_text: ואשם מצורע ששחטן שלא לשמן פסולין הואיל ובאו להכשיר ולא הכשירו
human_translation: and the guilt offering of a leper, that slaughtered not for their sake, they are disqualified. since came to render fit, and did not render fit.
llm_translation: "And a guilt-offering of a leper, if one slaughtered it not for its sake, it is invalid, since they came to render it fit, and they did not render it fit."

hebrew_text: תנן כל המנחות שנקמצו שלא לשמן כשירות אלא שלא עלו לבעלים לשום חובה חוץ ממנחת חוטא ומנחת קנאות ואם איתא ליתני נמי חוץ ממנחת העומר
human_translation: We learned all the meal offerings which a handful was removed not for their sake are fit but they did not satisfy the obligation of the owner, except for the meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy. And if it is so let also teach: Except for the omer meal offering.
llm_translation: We learned: all meal-offerings that became leavened not for their sake are valid, except that they did not fulfill the obligation for the owners, except for the meal-offering of a sinner and the meal-offering of jealousy. And if it is so, let it also teach except for the meal-offering of the Omer.

hebrew_text: כי קתני באה יחיד באה צבור לא קתני כי תני באה בגלל עצמה באה בגלל זבח לא קתני
human_translation: When teaches come an individual. does not teach come community. when teaches comes on account of itself, does not teach comes on account of, a slaughtered offering,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "When it taught 'she comes' - she comes alone, it did not teach 'she comes' - she comes with the congregation. When it taught 'she comes' for her own sake, it did not teach 'she comes' for the sake of a sacrifice."

hebrew_text: כי קתני הנך שאין קבוע להן זמן הא דקבוע לה זמן לא קתני:
human_translation: when teaches those whose time is not set, does not teach this whose time is set
llm_translation: For it was taught: these, that do not have a fixed time, this one that has a fixed time it does not teach.

hebrew_text: אמר מר וכן אתה אומר באשם נזיר ואשם מצורע ששחטן שלא לשמן פסולין הואיל ובאו להכשיר ולא הכשירו
human_translation: The Master said: And so you say with regard to the guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper, that slaughtered not for their sake, they are disqualified. since came to render fit, and they did not render fit.
llm_translation: The Master said: And similarly you say regarding the guilt-offering of a Nazirite and the guilt-offering of a leper, if they were slaughtered not for their sake, they are invalid. Since they came to render them fit, and they did not render them fit.

hebrew_text: תנן כל הזבחים ששחטן שלא לשמן כשרין אלא שלא עלו לבעלים לשום חובה חוץ מפסח וחטאת ואם איתא ליתני נמי חוץ מאשם נזיר ואשם מצורע דבאו להכשיר ולא הכשירו
human_translation: We learned All slaughtered offerings that one slaughtered not for their sake are fit, but they did not satisfy the obligation of the owner. except for the Paschal offering and the sin offering, And if it is so let also teach: Except for the guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper, since they came to render fit and they did not render fit.
llm_translation: We have learned: all sacrifices that were slaughtered not for their sake are valid, except that they did not fulfill the obligation for the owners, except for the Passover offering and the sin offering. And if it is necessary, it should also be taught: except for the guilt offering of a Nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper, which came to validate but did not validate.

hebrew_text: כיון דאיכא אשם גזילות ואשם מעילות דלכפרה אתו לא פסיקא ליה
human_translation: Since there the guilt offering for robbery, and the guilt offering for misuse that come for atonement, not an absolute
llm_translation: Since there is an Asham for thefts and an Asham for trespasses, for atonement they do not interrupt him.

hebrew_text: מאי שנא אשם נזיר ואשם מצורע דבאו להכשיר ולא הכשירו הני נמי באו לכפרה ולא כפרו
human_translation: What is different the guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper? since they came to render fit and they did not render fit? These, likewise came for atonement and they did not atone.
llm_translation: What is the difference between the guilt offering of a Nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper? They came to permit and did not permit. These also came for atonement and did not atone.

hebrew_text: א"ר ירמיה מצינו שחלק הכתוב בין מכפרים ובין מכשירין מכפרין אית בהו דאתו לאחר מיתה מכשירין לית בהו דאתו לאחר מיתה דתנן האשה שהביאה חטאתה ומתה יביאו יורשין עולתה עולתה ומתה לא יביאו יורשין חטאתה
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said We find that the Torah differentiates between atone and render fit, atone, there are among them that come after death, render fit, there are none among them that come after death. As we learned a woman who brought her sin offering and died, the heirs shall bring her burnt offering, her burnt offering and died, the heirs shall not bring her sin offering,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said: We found that the Scripture distinguishes between offerings that atone and offerings that validate. Those that atone, if they came after death, are valid; those that validate, if they came after death, are not valid. As we learned in a Mishnah: If a woman brought her sin offering and then died, her heirs should bring her burnt offering; if she brought her burnt offering and then died, her heirs should not bring her sin offering.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה ר' יהודה בריה דר' שמעון בן פזי מכשירין נמי מי לית בהו דאתו לאחר מיתה והתנן המפריש מעות לנזירותו לא נהנין ולא מועלין מפני שראויין לבא כולן שלמים
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, objects to this: render fit as well, are there not among them that come after death? But didn’t we learn one who separates funds for his naziriteship, may not derive benefit but not misuse because are all fit for bringing peace offerings,
llm_translation: Challenges him Rabbi Yehudah son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi: "Do they also not have in them that they come after death?" And we learned in a Mishnah: "One who separates money for his Nazirite vow does not benefit from them, nor are they considered a trespass offering, because they are fitting to come all complete."

hebrew_text: מת והיו לו מעות סתומין יפלו לנדבה מפורשין דמי חטאת יוליך לים המלח לא נהנין ולא מועלין דמי עולה יביא בהן עולה ומועלין בהן
human_translation: died and he had undesignated funds they will be allocated for gift allocated the money for a sin offering, take into the Dead Sea; one may not benefit but not misuse the money for a burnt offering, one brings with it a burnt offering, and misusing them.
llm_translation: A person who dies and has hidden money, it shall fall to charity. Explicit money for a sin offering shall be taken to the Dead Sea, not benefiting nor causing a blemish. Money for a burnt offering shall be brought for a burnt offering, causing a blemish.

hebrew_text: דמי שלמים יביא בהן שלמים ונאכלין ליום אחד ואין טעונין לחם והא עולה ושלמים דנזיר דמכשירים נינהו וקא אתו לאחר מיתה
human_translation: the money for a peace offering, one brings a peace offering with it, and are eaten for one day, and do not require loaves But burnt offering and peace offering of a nazirite are that render fit and they come after death.
llm_translation: The price of peace offerings should be brought with peace offerings, and they are eaten in one day and do not require bread. But aren't burnt offerings and peace offerings of a Nazirite valid? And they came after death.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא הכי קא אמר ר' ירמיה לא מצינו הכשר קבוע דבא לאחר מיתה ודנזיר הכשר שאינו קבוע הוא
human_translation: Rav Pappa said this is what Rabbi Yirmeya is saying: We do not find a fixed rendering fit that comes after death, And of a nazirite rendering fit that is not fixed,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said thus: Rabbi Yirmeya said, "We did not find a permanent qualification in one who comes after death, and a Nazirite is a qualification that is not permanent."

hebrew_text: דאמר מר גילח על א' משלשתן יצא
human_translation: as the Master said shaved after one of the three of them, he has fulfilled
llm_translation: The Master said: "He who shaves over one of the three has fulfilled his obligation."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי אשם מצורע שנשחט שלא לשמו או שלא ניתן מדמו ע"ג בהונות ה"ז עולה לגבי מזבח וטעון נסכים וצריך אשם אחר להכשירו תיובתא דרב
human_translation: raises an objection the guilt offering of a leper that was slaughtered not for its own sake, or none of its blood was placed on thumb and big toe, this is offered up upon the altar and it requires libations, But must another guilt offering to render him fit a conclusive refutation of Rav,
llm_translation: The question was raised: If a guilt-offering of a leper was slaughtered not for its sake, or if it was not given from its blood, it ascends upon the altar, requires libations, and needs another guilt-offering to validate it. This is a refutation of Rav.

hebrew_text: ורשב"ל אמר מנחת העומר שקמצה שלא לשמה כשירה ושיריה אין נאכלין עד שתביא מנחת העומר אחרת ותתירנה
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says, an omer meal offering which removed a handful not for its own sake, valid But its remainder may not be consumed until brings another omer meal offering and permits
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: The Omer offering, if it was kneaded not for its sake, is valid, but its leftovers may not be eaten until another Omer offering is brought and permits them.

hebrew_text: (ששיריה אין נאכלין עד שתביא מנחת העומר אחרת) מקרב היכי קרבה (יחזקאל מה, טו) ממשקה ישראל מן המותר לישראל
human_translation: its remainder may not consumed until bring another omer meal offering, how can be sacrificed “From the well-watered pastures of Israel; from which is permitted to the Jewish people.
llm_translation: (Shirayha ein ne'echalin ad she'tavi'a minchat ha'omer acheret) mikrev heich krovah (Yechezkel 45:15) mimashkeh Yisrael min ha'mutar l'Yisrael.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אדא בר אהבה קסבר ר"ל אין מחוסר זמן לבו ביום
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said Reish Lakish holds not whose time has not yet on that day.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: "Rabbi Eliezer holds that there is no deficiency of time in one's heart during the day."

hebrew_text: מתיב רב אדא בריה דרב יצחק יש בעופות שאין במנחות יש במנחות שאין בעופות יש בעופות שהעופות באין בנדבת שנים (אבל מנחות נפש כתיבא)
human_translation: Rav Adda, son of Rav Yitzḥak, raises an objection There is to birds that not to meal offerings, there is to meal offerings that not to birds. There is to birds as birds brought as a gift of two But meal offerings is written: one
llm_translation: Rav Adda, son of Rav Yitzchak, raised an objection: There are birds that are not found in meal offerings, there are meal offerings that are not found in birds, there are birds that come with a voluntary offering of two, but meal offerings are explicitly written as a soul offering.

hebrew_text: ומחוסרי כפרה (זב וזבה יולדת ומצורע)
human_translation: And has not yet atonement a man who experienced a gonorrhea-like discharge [ zav ], or woman who experienced a discharge of uterine blood after her menstrual period [ zava ], or a woman after childbirth, or a leper,
llm_translation: And from those lacking atonement (a male and a female with a discharge, a woman who gave birth, and a leper).

hebrew_text: והותרו מכלל איסורן בקודש משא"כ במנחות
human_translation: And their general prohibition was permitted when consecrated, which is not so with regard to meal offerings,
llm_translation: And they were permitted from the general prohibition in matters of sanctity, in contrast to meal offerings.

hebrew_text: ויש במנחות שהמנחות טעונות כלי ותנופה והגשה וישנן בציבור כביחיד מה שאין כן בעופות
human_translation: And there is to meal offerings As meal offerings require vessel, and waving and bringing, And there are of the community just as of individuals, which is not so with regard to birds.
llm_translation: And there are in Minchah offerings that the Minchah offerings require vessels and waving and presenting, and they are in public like an individual, which is not the case with bird offerings.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא במנחות נמי משכחת לה דהותרו מכלל איסורן בקודש ומאי ניהו מנחת העומר
human_translation: And if it is so with regard to meal offerings as well, you find that their general prohibition was permitted when consecrated. And what is this the omer meal offering
llm_translation: And if it is found in the context of meal-offerings, you also find it, that their permission is from the general prohibition in matters of holiness. And what are they? The meal-offering of the Omer.

hebrew_text: כיון דאין מחוסר זמן לבו ביום לאו איסורא הוא
human_translation: Since not whose time has not yet on that day, is not a prohibition
llm_translation: Since there is no deficiency of time in his heart during the day, it is not considered forbidden.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב ששת הקדים מתן שמן למתן דם ימלאנו שמן ויחזור ויתן שמן אחר מתן דם מתן בהונות למתן שבע ימלאנו שמן ויחזור ויתן מתן בהונות אחר מתן ז'
human_translation: Rav Sheshet raises an objection performed the placement of oil before the placement of blood he fills oil and he puts oil again after the placement of blood. performed the placement of thumb and big toe before the placement of seven he fills oil and he again puts thumb and big toe after the placement of seven
llm_translation: The Gemara raises an objection: Rav Sheshet posed a dilemma. If one first placed oil before placing blood, let him fill it with oil and then go back and place oil after placing blood. If one first placed frankincense before placing oil, let him fill it with oil and then go back and place frankincense after placing oil.

hebrew_text: ואי אמרת אין מחוסר זמן לבו ביום אמאי יחזור ויתן מאי דעבד עבד
human_translation: And if you say not whose time has not yet on that day, why should place again? What he performed, he performed,
llm_translation: And if you say there is no deficiency of time in his heart during the day, why would he return and give what he did?

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא שאני הלכות מצורע דכתיבא בהו הוייה דאמר הכתוב (ויקרא יד, ב) זאת תהיה תורת המצורע תהיה בהוייתה תהא
human_translation: Rav Pappa said The halakhot of a leper are different, as is written concerning them being, as the verse states: “This shall be the law of the leper” “shall be” it shall be as it is,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The laws of the metzora are different, as it is written in them "havayah." For the verse says (Leviticus 14:2), "This shall be the Torah of the metzora on the day of his cleansing."

hebrew_text: מתיב רב פפא הקדים חטאתו לאשמו לא יהיה אחר ממרס בדמה אלא תעובר צורתה ותצא לבית השריפה
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises an objection performed sin offering before his guilt offering, there not be another stirring the blood of Rather, its form decays, and taken out to the place for burning.
llm_translation: A question was raised: Rav Papa posed a dilemma - if one designated his sin-offering as a guilt-offering, should it not be disqualified from being offered up on the altar? Rather, its form should be altered, and it should be taken out to the place of burning.

hebrew_text: אמאי קא מותיב רב פפא והא רב פפא הוא דאמר שאני הלכות מצורע דכתיבא בהו הוייה אלא רב פפא הכי קא קשיא ליה אימא ה"מ עבודה שחיטה לאו עבודה היא ואי אין מחוסר זמן לבו ביום יהא אחר ממרס בדמה ולקריב אשם והדר ליקרב חטאת
human_translation: Why does Rav Pappa raise objection? But isn’t it Rav Pappa who said: The halakhot of a leper are different, as is written concerning them being, Rather, this is what is difficult to Rav Pappa say this statement, rite, slaughter is not a rite. And if not whose time has not yet on that day, another should be stirring the blood of and should sacrifice guilt offering and afterward he should sacrifice sin offering.
llm_translation: Why is Rav Papa posing a question? But Rav Papa himself said, "The laws of the leper are different, as it is written about them 'a happening.' Rather, Rav Papa is troubled by this: Say, 'If so, slaughtering is not considered an act of service. And if he is not lacking in time, let him wait until the next day to sprinkle its blood and then bring the guilt-offering, and afterwards bring the sin-offering.'"

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב פפא היינו טעמא דר"ל דקסבר האיר מזרח מתיר דרבי יוחנן ור"ל דאמרי תרוייהו אפילו בזמן שבית המקדש קיים
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: This is the reason of Reish Lakish, that he holds the illumination of eastern permits as Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say: Even when the Temple is standing,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Papa said: This is the reasoning of Rabbi Eliezer, who holds that the east wind is beneficial, as Rabbi Yochanan permits, and Rabbi Levi, who both say that even when the Temple is standing.

hebrew_text: האיר מזרח מתיר
human_translation: the illumination of eastern permits
llm_translation: The light of the east permits.

hebrew_text: והא דריש לקיש לאו בפירוש איתמר אלא מכללא איתמר דתנן אין מביאין מנחת בכורים ומנחת בהמה קודם לעומר (דבעינן ממשקה ישראל) ואם הביא פסול
human_translation: And this of Reish Lakish was not stated explicitly; rather, it was stated by inference, As we learned One may not bring a meal offering, the first fruits, or the meal offering an animal prior to the omer . that we require “from the well-watered pastures of Israel,” And if he brought unfit.
llm_translation: And this that Reish Lakish said, is it not stated explicitly, but rather it was derived from a general principle, as we learned in a Mishnah: One does not bring the offering of first fruits and the offering of an animal before the Omer offering (as we require the moistening of the Israelite produce), and if one brought them, they are invalid.

hebrew_text: קודם לשתי הלחם לא יביא (משום דאיקרו בכורים) ואם הביא כשר
human_translation: prior to the two loaves one may not bring because are called first fruits, But if he brought fit.
llm_translation: Before the two loaves, one may not bring (because they are called firstfruits), and if one brought, it is valid.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי יצחק אמר ריש לקיש לא שנו אלא בארבעה עשר ובחמשה עשר אבל בששה עשר אם הביא כשר (וקשיא לי ליהוו כמחוסר זמן) אלמא קסבר האיר המזרח מתיר
human_translation: And Rav Yitzḥak says Reish Lakish says: taught only on the fourteenth or on the fifteenth But on the sixteenth, if he brought valid. And a difficulty for me: Let them be like whose time has not yet Apparently, holds the illumination of the eastern permits
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak said, Resh Lakish said: They only taught this regarding fourteen and fifteen, but regarding sixteen, if he brought it valid (and it is difficult for me that they should be like one who is lacking time), apparently he holds that the eastern light permits.

hebrew_text: ורבא אמר מנחת העומר שקמצה שלא לשמה כשירה ושיריה נאכלין ואינה צריכה מנחת העומר אחרת להתירה שאין מחשבה מועלת אלא במי שראוי לעבודה ובדבר הראוי לעבודה ובמקום הראוי לעבודה
human_translation: And Rava says: an omer meal offering which removed a handful not for its own sake, valid and its remainder is consumed, and it does not require another omer meal offering to permit it that intent is effective [ mo’elet ] only by one who is fit for the service, and with regard to an item that is fit for the service, and in a place that is fit for the service.
llm_translation: Rava said: The Omer offering, if it was kneaded not for its sake, is valid, and its remnants may be eaten, and it does not require another Omer offering to permit it, for improper intent is only significant in one who is fit for the service, and in a matter fit for the service, and in a place fit for the service.

hebrew_text: במי שראוי לעבודה לאפוקי כהן בעל מום ובדבר הראוי לעבודה לאפוקי מנחת העומר דלא חזיא דחדוש הוא ובמקום הראוי לעבודה לאפוקי נפגם המזבח:
human_translation: by one who is fit for the service to exclude a blemished priest, with regard to an item that is fit for the service to exclude the omer meal offering, which unfit as it is a novelty, And in a place that is fit for the service to exclude the altar was damaged.
llm_translation: In one who is fit for service, excluding a blemished priest, and in a matter fit for service, excluding the Omer offering, for it is not seen as a novelty. And in a place fit for service, excluding a damaged altar.

hebrew_text: ת"ר כשהוא אומר (ויקרא א, ב) מן הבקר למטה שאין ת"ל אלא להוציא את הטרפה
human_translation: The Sages taught When it states later, of the herd” as no the verse to state Rather, to exclude an animal with a wound that will cause it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ]
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: When it says (Leviticus 1:2), "from the cattle," below, it is not necessary to teach except to exclude the trefah.

hebrew_text: והלא דין הוא ומה בעל מום שמותרת להדיוט אסורה לגבוה טריפה שאסורה להדיוט אין דין שאסורה לגבוה חלב ודם יוכיחו שאסורין להדיוט ומותרין לגבוה
human_translation: But could this not inference? And if a blemished which is permitted to an ordinary person [ lehedyot ] prohibited for the Most High a tereifa , which is forbidden to an ordinary person is it not logical that it is prohibited for the Most High? Fat [ ḥelev ] and blood prove as they are forbidden to an ordinary person and they are permitted for the Most High.
llm_translation: "And isn't it the same law? Just as a blemished animal that is permitted for a commoner is forbidden for a priest, a treifah that is forbidden for a commoner, there is no law that it is forbidden for a priest. Milk and blood will prove that they are forbidden for a commoner and permitted for a priest."

hebrew_text: מה לחלב ודם שכן באין מכלל היתר תאמר בטריפה שכולה אסורה ולא תהא מותרת לגבוה
human_translation: What about fat and blood? in that they come from generally permitted, you say with regard to a tereifa , which is entirely forbidden and should not be permitted for the Most High?
llm_translation: "What for milk and blood that they come in from the general permission you will say in treifah that all of it is forbidden and not will be permitted to the owner."

hebrew_text: מליקה תוכיח שכולה איסור ואסורה להדיוט ומותרת לגבוה
human_translation: pinching will prove As entirely forbidden, and forbidden to an ordinary person, permitted for the Most High,
llm_translation: Plucking (of fruit on Shabbat) proves that it is entirely prohibited, and it is prohibited for a commoner but permitted for a distinguished person.

hebrew_text: מה למליקה שכן קדושתה אוסרתה (בשעת קדושתה למזבח היא נאסרה להדיוט דהיינו מליקתה אבל קודם לכן לא נאסרה להדיוט) מה שאין כן בטריפה שאין קדושתה אוסרתה
human_translation: What about pinching? in that its sanctity prohibits it, at the time it sanctified for the altar it prohibited to an ordinary person, which is its pinching. But before this not prohibited to an ordinary person is not the case with regard to a tereifa , as its sanctity does not prohibit it
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "What is the case of salting that its sanctity prohibits it (at the time of its sanctity to the altar it is prohibited to a layman, that is its salting, but before that it is not prohibited to a layman), which is not the case with an animal that is mortally wounded, its sanctity does not prohibit it."

hebrew_text: ואם השבתה כשהוא אומר מן הבקר למטה שאין ת"ל להוציא את הטריפה
human_translation: And if you have responded, when states later: “Of the herd” as no the verse to state to exclude a tereifa .
llm_translation: And if he returned it when he said "from the morning downward," it does not say to exclude the treifah.

hebrew_text: מה אם השבתה (סי' רקיח מר אדא לשישי"ה)
human_translation: What If you have responded? mnemonic: Rekiaḥ , Mar , Adda , Leshisheih .
llm_translation: What if she returned (See: R'kiach from Master Ada to Shishiya)?

hebrew_text: אמר רב משום דאיכא למימר מנחת העומר תוכיח שאסורה להדיוט ומותרת לגבוה מה למנחת העומר שכן מתרת חדש
human_translation: Rav said because it may be said the omer meal offering proves as prohibited to an ordinary person, and permitted for the Most High. What about the omer meal offering? in that renders new permitted
llm_translation: Rav said in the name of, because there is to say, the meal offering of the Omer proves that it is forbidden for a commoner and permitted for a distinguished person. Just as the meal offering of the Omer is thus, so too the new grain offering is permitted.

hebrew_text: בשביעית שביעית נמי שכן מתרת ספיחין בשביעית כר' עקיבא דאמר ספיחין אסורים בשביעית
human_translation: during a Sabbatical Year a Sabbatical Year also as it permits produce that grew without being purposely planted [ sefiḥin ] during the Sabbatical Year. in accordance with Rabbi Akiva, who says sefiḥin are prohibited during the Sabbatical Year,
llm_translation: In the seventh year, the seventh year also, it is permitted to sow crops in the seventh year, according to Rabbi Akiva who said that sowing crops is prohibited in the seventh year.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בר אבא לרב אשי לרבי עקיבא נמי לפרוך מה למנחת העומר שכן מתרת חדש בחוצה לארץ
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Abba said to Rav Ashi: According to Rabbi Akiva as well, let us refute what about the omer meal offering? in that permits new outside of Eretz
llm_translation: Rav Ahah bar Abba said to Rav Ashi, to Rabbi Akiva also, to explain: What about the Omer offering, for it is permitted on the new month outside the land.

hebrew_text: ואפילו למ"ד חדש בחו"ל לאו דאורייתא שכן באה להתיר לאו שבתוכה
human_translation: And even according to the one who says new outside of Eretz not by Torah law, in that comes to permit a prohibition that within it,
llm_translation: And even according to the opinion that a new moon is established based on witnesses from outside of Israel, it is not a biblical law, for it comes to permit a prohibition contained within it.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא מדיפתי לרבינא א"ה טריפה נמי תקריב ותתיר לאו שבתוכה אלא פריך הכי מה למנחת העומר שכן מצותה בכך
human_translation: Rav Aḥa of Difti said to Ravina: if that is so, a tereifa as well, you should sacrifice and you will permit a prohibition that within it, Rather, refute like this: What about the omer meal offering? in that its mitzva is in this
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha from Diphti to Ravina: "Is a treifah also brought near, and it is permitted? Rather, ask thus: What about the Omer offering, for its commandment is likewise in this manner."

hebrew_text: ריש לקיש אמר משום דאיכא למימר מפטם הקטרת יוכיח שאסור להדיוט ומותר לגבוה מפטם גברא הוא
human_translation: Reish Lakish said because it can be said the one who prepares the incense proves as prohibited to an ordinary person, and permitted for the Most High. the one who prepares is a person.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said in the name of, because there is to say, "From the incense spoon it shall prove that it is forbidden for a layman and permitted for a priest, for the incense spoon is a man's vessel."

hebrew_text: אלא פטום הקטרת יוכיח שאסור להדיוט ומותר לגבוה מה לפטום הקטרת שכן מצותו בכך
human_translation: Rather, the preparation of the incense proves as prohibited by an ordinary person and permitted for the Most High. What about preparation of the incense? in that its mitzva is in this
llm_translation: Rather, the "Pitom HaKetoret" proves that it is prohibited for a layperson and permitted for a High Priest. Just as with the "Pitom HaKetoret," for such is its commandment.

hebrew_text: מר בריה דרבינא אמר משום דאיכא למימר שבת תוכיח שאסורה להדיוט ומותרת לגבוה
human_translation: Mar, son of Ravina, said because it can be said Shabbat proves as it is prohibited for an ordinary person and permitted for the Most High.
llm_translation: Mar, the son of Ravina, said in the name of there is to say, "Shabbat shall prove that it is forbidden for the commoner and permitted for the distinguished."

hebrew_text: מה לשבת שכן הותרה מכללה אצל הדיוט במילה
human_translation: What about Shabbat? in that the general prohibition was permitted with regard to an ordinary person in circumcision,
llm_translation: "What for Shabbat neighbor was permitted from its general rule by a layman in circumcision."

hebrew_text: אטו מילה צורך הדיוט הוא מילה מצוה היא אלא מה לשבת שכן מצותה בכך
human_translation: Is that to say circumcision is a requirement of an ordinary person, Circumcision is a mitzva. Rather, What about Shabbat? in that its mitzva is in this
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Atu milah tzorech hadeyot hu milah mitzvah hi ela mah leShabbat sheken mitzvatah bakh." English translation: "Is circumcision for the sake of the layman? It is a commandment. Rather, what about Shabbat, for its commandment is in this."

hebrew_text: רב אדא בר אבא אמר משום דאיכא למימר כלאים תוכיח שאסורין להדיוט ומותרין לגבוה
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Abba said because it can be said diverse kinds proves as it is prohibited for an ordinary person and permitted for the Most High,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Abba said in the name of, because there is to say, "Kilayim" will prove that they are forbidden to the layman and permitted to the scholar.

hebrew_text: מה לכלאים שכן הותרו מכללן אצל הדיוט בציצית אטו ציצית צורך הדיוט היא מצוה היא אלא
human_translation: What about diverse kinds? in that general prohibition was permitted in an ordinary person with regard to ritual fringes, Is that to say ritual fringes a requirement of an ordinary person, is a mitzva. Rather,
llm_translation: What about kilayim, that they were permitted from the general rule by the commoner regarding tzitzit? Do tzitzit require the commoner's need, it is a mitzvah, rather.

hebrew_text: מה לכלאים שמצותו בכך
human_translation: What about diverse kinds? in that its mitzva is in this
llm_translation: What is the case of a "Kela'im" whose commandment is thus:

hebrew_text: רב שישא בריה דרב אידי אמר משום דאיכא למימר ליהדר דינא ותיתי במה הצד מה למליקה שכן קדושתה אוסרתה חלב ודם יוכיחו
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: because it can be said: Let be derived by the common element What about pinching? in that its sanctity prohibits it, Fat and blood prove
llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: Because there is something to say to return the law, and come with what? For salting, as its holiness prohibits it, milk and blood will prove it.

hebrew_text: מה לחלב ודם שכן באים מכלל היתר מליקה תוכיח
human_translation: What about fat and blood? in that they come from generally permitted, Pinching proves
llm_translation: What about milk and blood that come from the category of permissible, licking will prove.

hebrew_text: וחזר הדין לא ראי זה כראי זה ולא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שאסורין להדיוט ומותרין לגבוה אף אני אביא טרפה אף על פי שאסורה להדיוט תהא מותרת לגבוה מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן מצותה בכך
human_translation: And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this their common element that they are prohibited to an ordinary person and are permitted for the Most High. I will also bring a tereifa Even though is it prohibited to an ordinary person, it should be permitted for the Most High. What about their common element? that its mitzva in this
llm_translation: And the law returned, not like this is like this, and not like this is like this, the equal side in them that are forbidden to the layman and permitted to the scholar. So too, I will bring a treifah, even though it is forbidden to the layman, it should be permitted to the scholar. Just as the equal side in them, so too its commandment is in this.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב אשי משום דאיכא למימר מעיקרא דדינא פרכא מהיכא קא מייתית לה מבעל מום
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: because one can say refutation of the inference from the outset. From where do you derive from a blemished
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said, because there is to say from the outset of the law, the verse comes from where? From a blemished owner.

hebrew_text: מה לבעל מום שכן עשה בו מקריבין כקריבין
human_translation: What about a blemished in that with regard to rendered those who sacrifice like that which is sacrificed,
llm_translation: What for a Ba'al Mum that thus did in him they bring near as they bring near.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא סבא לרב אשי יוצא דופן יוכיח שלא עשה בו מקריבין כקריבין ומותר להדיוט ואסור לגבוה
human_translation: Rav Aḥa Sava said to Rav Ashi: born by caesarean section proves as with regard to it did not render those who sacrifice like that which is sacrificed, And permitted to an ordinary person and prohibited for the Most High.
llm_translation: Rav Acha the Elder said to Rav Ashi: "One who goes out of the threshold shall prove that he did not perform the offering as offerings, and it is permitted for a layman but forbidden for a priest."

hebrew_text: מה ליוצא דופן שכן אינו קדוש בבכורה
human_translation: What about born by caesarean section? in that is not sanctified with firstborn
llm_translation: What is the case of a firstborn son who is not holy?

hebrew_text: בעל מום יוכיח מה לבעל מום שכן עשה בו מקריבין כקריבין יוצא דופן יוכיח
human_translation: A blemished proves What about a blemished in that with regard to it rendered those who sacrifice like that which is sacrificed, born by caesarean section proves
llm_translation: A blemished one shall prove what to a blemished one, for thus he did to him; they offer him as they offer, he is deemed fit. A blemished one shall prove his worth.

hebrew_text: וחזר הדין לא ראי זה כראי זה ולא ראי זה כראי זה הצד השוה שבהן שמותרים להדיוט ואסורים לגבוה וכ"ש טרפה שאסורה להדיוט תהא אסורה לגבוה
human_translation: And the inference has reverted The aspect of this is not like the aspect of that and the aspect of that is not like the aspect of this their common element that they are permitted to an ordinary person and prohibited for the Most High. And all the more so a tereifa , which is prohibited to an ordinary person, should be prohibited for the Most High.
llm_translation: And the law returned: not this proof like this proof, and not this proof like this proof. The equal side in them, permitted for the layman and forbidden for the priest, and all the more so a treifah, which is forbidden for the layman, should be forbidden for the priest.

hebrew_text: מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן לא הותרו מכללן תאמר בטריפה שהותרה מכללה
