human_translation: What about their common element? in that their general prohibition was not permitted, Will you say to a tereifa , whose general prohibition was permitted,
llm_translation: What is the equalizing factor in them that they were not permitted from their category? You shall say in the case of a treifah that it was permitted from its category.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי טרפה שהותרה מכללה מאי היא אילימא מליקה דעולת העוף לגבוה בעל מום נמי בעופות אשתרויי אשתרי תמות וזכרות בבהמה ואין תמות וזכרות בעופות
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: tereifa whose general prohibition was permitted, what is it, If we say pinching of a bird burnt offering for the Most High, a blemished as well. with regard to birds permitted unblemished and male to animal but there is no unblemished and male in bird
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: "A ṭereifah that was permitted from its category, what is it?" If you will say, "Melikah of a bird offering above its required height," also in blemished birds it is permitted. Blemished females and males in animals are permitted, but blemished females and males in birds are not permitted.

hebrew_text: אלא מליקה דחטאת העוף לכהנים כהנים משולחן גבוה קא זכו
human_translation: Rather, pinching of a bird sin offering to the priests priests receive from the table of the Most High,
llm_translation: Rather, the removal of the sin offering of a bird for the priests, the priests have acquired from a high table.

hebrew_text: ואלא פריך הכי מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן מומן ניכר תאמר בטריפה שכן אין מומה ניכר מש"ה איצטריך קרא
human_translation: Rather, refute like this: What about their common element? in that their blemish is noticeable, Will you say of a tereifa , whose blemish is not noticeable? Due to that the verse: was necessary,
llm_translation: And rather, ask thus: What about the case of the equal side among them, where the blemish is recognizable? You would say in the case of treifah, where the blemish is not recognizable. From here, the verse is needed.

hebrew_text: וטריפה מהכא נפקא מהתם נפקא (יחזקאל מה, טו) ממשקה ישראל מן המותר לישראל
human_translation: But a tereifa derived from here? It is derived from there, “From the well-watered pastures of Israel” from which is permitted to the Jewish people.
llm_translation: "And 'treifah' is derived from here, derived from there (Ezekiel 45:15) 'from the possession of Israel, from what is permitted to Israel.'"

hebrew_text: (ויקרא כז, כח) מכל אשר יעבור תחת השבט נפקא פרט לטריפה שאינה עוברת
human_translation: derived from “Whatever passes under the rod, excluding a tereifa , as it does not pass
llm_translation: "And from all that passes under the rod, the tenth shall be holy to the Lord." (Leviticus 27:32) - It is derived: an exclusion for treifah, which does not pass.

hebrew_text: צריכי דאי ממשקה ישראל ה"א למעוטי היכא דלא היתה לה שעת הכושר דומיא דערלה וכלאי הכרם אבל היתה לה שעת הכושר אימא תתכשר כתב רחמנא כל אשר יעבור
human_translation: are necessary, because if from “the well-watered pastures of Israel,” I would say to exclude where it did not have a period of fitness, similar to the fruit of a tree during the first three years after its planting [ orla ] and diverse kinds in a vineyard, But had a period of fitness, say it should be fit. the Merciful One writes: “Whatever passes
llm_translation: In need of clarification: If it is from the liquid of Israel, this excludes a case where it did not have a time of fitness, which is similar to uncircumcision and mixed plantings. But if it had a time of fitness, say it becomes fit. The Merciful One wrote, "All that will pass."

hebrew_text: ואי כתב רחמנא כל אשר יעבור הוה אמינא למעוטי היכא דנטרפה ולבסוף הקדישה דומיא דמעשר אבל הקדישה ולבסוף נטרפה דבעידנא דאקדשה הוה חזיא אימא תתכשר כתב רחמנא מן הבקר צריכי:
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written “Whatever passes I would say to exclude where it was rendered a tereifa and subsequently sanctified it. similar to tithes, But sanctified it and it was subsequently rendered a tereifa , that at the time when it was sanctified it was fit, say it should be fit. the Merciful One wrote: “Of the herd,” are necessary.
llm_translation: "And if the Merciful One had written 'everything that passes,' I would have said to exclude where it was damaged. But ultimately, the sanctification is similar to tithing. However, the sanctification, when ultimately damaged, in the time of sanctification, it was seen, say it should be rectified. The Merciful One needs to write 'from the morning.'"

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אחד מנחת חוטא ואחד כל המנחות שקמצן זר אונן טבול יום מחוסר בגדים מחוסר כיפורים שלא רחץ ידיו ורגליו ערל טמא יושב עומד על גבי כלים על גבי בהמה ע"ג רגלי חבירו פסול
human_translation: Both the meal offering of a sinner and all meal offerings which removed their handful a non-priest, an acute mourner, who immersed that day lacking vestments, who had not yet an atonement who did not wash his hands and feet an uncircumcised a ritually impure sitting, standing upon vessels, upon an animal, upon the feet of another unfit
llm_translation: Mishnah: One is the Minchat Chotei and one is all the Minchot that their Kemitzah was done by a Zar, an Onen, a Tevul Yom, one lacking garments, one lacking atonements, one who did not wash his hands and feet, one who is uncircumcised, one who is impure, one who is sitting, standing, on top of vessels, on top of an animal, on top of his fellow's feet - they are disqualified.

hebrew_text: קמץ בשמאל פסול בן בתירא אומר יחזיר ויחזור ויקמוץ בימין
human_translation: removed the handful with left unfit. Ben Beteira says: He must return and again remove the handful, with right
llm_translation: He gathered with his left hand - invalid. Ben Beteira says: he should gather and gather again and gather with his right hand.

hebrew_text: קמץ ועלה בידו צרור או גרגר מלח או קורט של לבונה פסול מפני שאמרו הקומץ היתר והחסר פסול ואיזהו היתר שקמצו מבורץ וחסר שקמצו בראשי אצבעותיו:
human_translation: removed the handful and a stone, a grain of salt, or a pinch [ koret ] of frankincense emerged in his hand, unfit due to that said: The handful that is outsized or that is lacking unfit. And which is the outsized where he removed the handful overflowing [ mevoratz ] And lacking where he removed the handful with the tips of his fingers.
llm_translation: He gathered and in his hand a handful or a grain of salt or a piece of frankincense - invalid, because they said: the gathered portion is permitted, and the lacking portion is invalid. And what is the permitted portion? That which he gathered with the tips of his fingers.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ למה לי למתנא אחד מנחת חוטא ואחד כל המנחות ליתני כל המנחות שקמצן זר ואונן
human_translation: Why do I to teach: Both the meal offering of a sinner and all meal offerings? Let it teach: All the meal offerings which removed their handful a non-priest or an acute mourner.
llm_translation: Gemara: Why do I need one Mishna to teach about the sin-offering meal offering and one for all meal offerings? Let it teach all meal offerings that their handful is invalid if a non-priest or one in a state of impurity performs the service.

hebrew_text: לר"ש איצטריך דתניא א"ר שמעון בדין הוא שתהא מנחת חוטא טעונה שמן ולבונה שלא יהא חוטא נשכר ומפני מה אינה טעונה שלא יהא קרבנו מהודר ובדין הוא שתהא חטאת חלב טעונה נסכים
human_translation: It was necessary in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: By right the meal offering of a sinner should require oil and frankincense so that sinner will not profit. And for what it not require that his offering will not be of superior quality. And by right sin offering of fat, should require libations
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon it was necessary, for it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, it is proper that the sin offering should require oil and frankincense, so that the sinner should not benefit. And why is it not required? So that his offering should not be enhanced. And it is proper that the sin offering of the fat should require libations.

hebrew_text: שלא יהא חוטא נשכר ומפני מה אינה טעונה שלא יהא קרבנו מהודר סד"א הואיל ואמר ר"ש שלא יהא קרבנו מהודר כי קמצי לה פסולין נמי תתכשר קמ"ל
human_translation: so that sinner will not profit. And for what does not require that his offering will not be of superior quality. enter your mind to say since Rabbi Shimon says: that his offering will not be of superior quality, when the handful is removed unfit should also be valid, teaches us
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "That a sinner should not be rewarded, and why is it not necessary? Because his offering should not be honored. Since Rabbi Shimon said that his offering should not be honored, for if it is diminished, it is also disqualified. This teaches us."

hebrew_text: ומי אמר רבא הכי והא אתמר קומץ שחלקו בשני כלים רב נחמן אמר אינו קדוש ורבא אמר קדוש ואם איתא לילף מדם הדר ביה רבא מההיא
human_translation: And did Rava say this, But it was stated: a handful that divided in two vessels, Rav Naḥman says it is not sanctified, and Rava says sanctified. And if it is so let derive from blood Rava retracted that
llm_translation: Rava said thus: But was it not stated: If one divided the handful into two vessels, Rav Nahman said: It is not sanctified, and Rava said: It is sanctified. And if it is necessary, we can resolve it from the following: Rava retracted his opinion.

hebrew_text: ודם מנלן דלא קדוש לחצאין דתני רב תחליפא בן שאול קידש פחות מכדי הזאה בכלי זה ופחות מכדי הזאה בכלי זה לא קידש
human_translation: And blood, from where do we that it is not sanctified in halves, that Rav Taḥlifa ben Shaul teaches sanctified less than the amount of sprinkling in this vessel, and less than the amount of sprinkling in that vessel, he has not sanctified
llm_translation: And blood - from where do we derive that it is not sanctified for half-measures? For Rav Tahalifa son of Sha'ul taught: He sanctified less than the amount of a hazah in this vessel, and less than the amount of a hazah in that vessel - it is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: ואיבעיא להו בדם מאי הלכתא היא ומהלכתא לא ילפינן
human_translation: And a dilemma was raised before With regard to blood what Is a halakha we do not derive from a halakha
llm_translation: And it was asked of them: with blood, what is the halakha, and we do not learn from a tradition.

hebrew_text: או דלמא התם מאי טעמא דכתיב (במדבר יט, יח) וטבל במים הכא נמי הכתיב (ויקרא ד, ו) וטבל בדם
human_translation: Or perhaps, there, what is the reason that it is written “And dip it in the water” here too, isn’t it written: “And shall dip in the blood”
llm_translation: Or perhaps there, what is the reason that it is written (Numbers 19:18) "and he shall dip in water"? Here too it is written (Leviticus 4:6) "and he shall dip in blood."

hebrew_text: ואיתמר א"ר זריקא אמר רבי אלעזר אף בדם לא קידש אמר רבא תניא נמי הכי (בפני כהן מניח) וטבל ולא מספיג
human_translation: And it was stated Rabbi Zerika says Rabbi Elazar says: Even in blood, one has not sanctified Rava said this is also taught in with regard to the anointed priest. “And shall dip” and not wiping
llm_translation: And it was stated: Rabbi Zerika said, Rabbi Elazar said: Even with blood, he did not sanctify. Rava said: It was also taught likewise: (He places it before the priest) and he immerses, and it does not absorb.

hebrew_text: בדם שיהא בדם שיעור טבילה מעיקרו מן הדם מן הדם שבענין
human_translation: “in the blood” that there should initially be in the blood a measure dipping “of the blood” from the blood of the matter,
llm_translation: In the blood that should be in the blood, immersion from its inception, from the blood, in the matter of the blood.

hebrew_text: ואיצטריך למכתב וטבל ואיצטריך למכתב בדם דאי כתב רחמנא וטבל הוה אמינא אע"ג דלא קיבל שיעור טבילות (דהיינו הזאה ז' פעמים) מעיקרו כתב רחמנא בדם
human_translation: And it was necessary to write: “And shall dip,” and it was necessary to write: “In the blood,” Because if the Merciful One had written “And shall dip,” I would say even though did not initially collect a measure sprinklings, that is, sprinkle seven times. the Merciful One writes: “In the blood.”
llm_translation: And it was necessary for a writing and immersion, and it was necessary for a writing in blood. For if the Merciful One wrote and he immersed, I would say, even though he did not receive the measure of immersions (meaning sprinkling seven times) from the outset, the Merciful One wrote in blood.

hebrew_text: ואי כתב רחמנא בדם הוה אמינא אפילו מספיג כתב רחמנא וטבל
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written “In the blood,” I would say even wiping the Merciful One writes: “And shall dip,”
llm_translation: And if it were written in blood, I would say even from a sponge, it is written in blood and it is immersed.

hebrew_text: מן הדם שבענין למעוטי מאי אמר רבא למעוטי שירים שבאצבע מסייע ליה לר"א דאמר שירים שבאצבע פסולין
human_translation: from the blood of the matter. to exclude what? Rava said: to exclude remainder on finger supports of Rabbi Elazar, who says remainder that on finger is unfit
llm_translation: From the blood in the matter of exclusions - what did Rava say? To exclude the fingernails. This supports Rabbi Eliezer who said that fingernails are invalid.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבין בר רב אדא לרבא אמרי תלמידך אמר רב עמרם תניא היה מזה ונתזה הזאה מידו אם עד שלא הזה טעון כיבוס משהזה אין טעון כיבוס
human_translation: Ravin bar Rav Adda said to Rava: Your students say Rav Amram says it is taught was sprinkling and sprinkling sprayed from his hand If before he sprinkled, requires laundering, after he sprinkled, does not require laundering.
llm_translation: Rabin bar Rav Adda said to Rava: Your students said, Rav Amram said: It was taught in a Baraita: If it dripped and splattered, the splattering is considered impure immediately. If it did not splatter, it requires pressing until it splatters.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו עד שלא גמר הזאתו ומשגמר הזאתו ש"מ דשירים שבאצבע כשרים
human_translation: What, is it not before he completed his sprinkling, and after he completed his sprinkling, conclude from that remainder that on finger fit
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "not until he finishes his sprinkling"? And from the fact that it says "when he finishes his sprinkling," we derive that the leftover of the finger is valid.

hebrew_text: לא עד שלא יצתה מידו הזאה טעון כיבוס ומשיצאה הזאה מידו ונתזה ממה שנשאר אין טעון כיבוס
human_translation: No, before sprinkling left his hand, requires laundering. But after a sprinkling left his hand, sprayed from that which remained does not require laundering,
llm_translation: Not until not exited from his hand the semen requires washing, and when exited from his hand the semen and dispersed from what remained not requires washing.

hebrew_text: איתיביה אביי גמר מלהזות מקנח ידו בגופה של פרה גמר אין לא גמר לא
human_translation: Abaye raised an objection to completed sprinkling he wipes his hand on the body of the heifer. completed yes, did not complete not
llm_translation: Abbaye raised an objection: If one completes the sprinkling by applying the oil to the body of the cow, he has completed the sprinkling; if he did not complete the sprinkling, he has not completed it.

hebrew_text: א"ל גמר מקנח ידו לא גמר מקנח אצבעו
human_translation: said to completed he wipes his hand. not completed wipe his finger
llm_translation: He said to him: "He completed anointing his hand, he did not complete anointing his finger."

hebrew_text: בשלמא גמר מקנח ידו בגופה של פרה דכתיב (במדבר יט, ה) ושרף את הפרה לעיניו אלא לא גמר מקנח אצבעו במאי מקנח (דאי אמרת בגופה של פרה איבעי ליה למיתני מקנח ידו ואצבעו בגופה של פרה מדלא קתני הכי ש"מ דלא בעי קינוח)
human_translation: Granted, he completed he wipes his hand on the body of the heifer, as it is written: “And the heifer shall be burned in his sight; But not completed he wipes his finger, with what wipe? Because if you say on the body of the heifer, should have taught: wipes his hand and his finger on the body of the heifer. from that does not teach this, conclude from that does not require wiping
llm_translation: In accordance with what is learned, he completes anointing his hand on the body of the cow, as it is written (Numbers 19:5), "And he shall burn the cow before his eyes." But if he did not complete anointing his finger, with what does he anoint? For if you say on the body of the cow, he should have taught to anoint his hand and his finger on the body of the cow. Since he did not teach this, learn from this that he requires smearing.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי בשפת מזרק כדכתיב (עזרא א, י) כפורי זהב וגו'
human_translation: Abaye said: on the edge of bowl as it is written: “Atoning bowls [ keforei ] of gold”
llm_translation: Abbaye said in the language of Mizrak, as it is written (Ezra 1:10), "gold basins, etc."

hebrew_text: ומי אמר רבי אלעזר הכי והא איתמר חביתי כהן גדול רבי יוחנן אמר אינה קדושה לחצאין רבי אלעזר אמר מתוך שקרבה לחצאין קדושה לחצאין
human_translation: And did Rabbi Elazar say this, But it was stated High Priest’s griddle-cake Rabbi Yoḥanan says it is not sanctified in halves, Rabbi Elazar says: Since it is sacrificed in halves, sanctified in halves.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Did Rabbi Elazar really say so? But wasn't it stated: "A barrel of wine belonging to the High Priest"? Rabbi Yochanan said: It is not sanctified for half-zuzim. Rabbi Elazar said: Since it is close to half-zuzim, it is sanctified for half-zuzim.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא לילף מדם וכי תימא רבי אלעזר מילתא ממילתא לא גמר והא אמר ר' אלעזר מנחה שקמצה בהיכל כשרה שכן מצינו בסילוק בזיכין
human_translation: And if it is so let him derive from blood. And if you would say Rabbi Elazar does not derive matter from matter, But doesn’t Rabbi Elazar say: A meal offering which removed a handful inside the Sanctuary valid, that we find with regard to the removal of bowls
llm_translation: "And if it comes to peel from blood, and if you say, perhaps Rabbi Elazar did not conclude one matter from another matter, but Rabbi Elazar said: A meal-offering that became crusted in the Sanctuary is valid, as we find in the removal of the ashes."

hebrew_text: מנחה ממנחה יליף מנחה מדם לא יליף
human_translation: derive a meal offering from meal offering; he does not derive a meal offering from blood.
llm_translation: Mincha mimincha yalif, mincha m'dam lo yalif.

hebrew_text: ומנחה ממנחה מי יליף והתניא עד שלא פרקה נפרס לחמה הלחם פסול ואין מקטיר עליו את הבזיכין משפרקה נפרס לחמה הלחם פסול ומקטיר עליו את הבזיכין
human_translation: And does derive meal offering from meal offering? But isn’t it taught before detached bread broke the bread unfit and does not burn the bowls on it. bread broke after detached it, the bread is unfit but burns the bowls on it.
llm_translation: "And a meal offering from a meal offering, how does one derive it? And it was taught: Until its bread is broken, its bread is invalid, and one does not offer the frankincense on it. Once its bread is broken, its bread is invalid, and one offers the frankincense on it."

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' אלעזר לא פרקה ממש אלא כיון שהגיע זמנה לפרק אע"פ שלא פרקה כמי שפרקה דמיא
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: not actually detached it. Rather, once time to detach it has arrived, even though he has not detached it it is considered as though he has detached it.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said: It did not actually split, but once its time arrived to split, even though it did not split, it is considered as if it split.

hebrew_text: ואמאי תיהוי כמנחה שחסרה קודם קמיצה
human_translation: And why It should be like a meal offering that became lacking before the removal of the handful.
llm_translation: And why should it be like a Minchah offering that lacks before the Kemitzah?

hebrew_text: הא לא קשיא מנחה לא בריר ברירה קומץ דידיה והא בריר ברירה קומץ דידה וכיון שהגיע זמנה לפרק כמאן דפרקה דמיא
human_translation: This not difficult, a meal offering its handful was not clearly designated. But its handful, was clearly designated And once time to detach has arrived, it is considered as though he has detached it.
llm_translation: This is not difficult: a Mincha offering does not have a choice in its choice, its handful is its own. But with regard to a choice in its choice, its handful is its own. And once its time has arrived, it is considered as if it has been separated.

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה תיהוי כשירים שחסרו בין קמיצה להקטרה דאין מקטירין קומץ עליהן לאו פלוגתא נינהו רבי אלעזר סבר לה כמ"ד שירים שחסרו בין קמיצה להקטרה מקטיר קומץ עליהן
human_translation: if that is so, It should be like remainder became lacking between removal of the handful and burning that does not burn the handful on Isn’t it a dispute Rabbi Elazar holds in accordance with the one who says remainder lacking between removal of the handful and burning, burns the handful on
llm_translation: Rather now, let it be that the unfit are like the fit, for there is no difference between a handful and the burning of incense, as we do not burn a handful on them. Is this not a dispute? Rabbi Eliezer holds according to the opinion of the one who says that if the unfit are missing between a handful and the burning of incense, one should burn a handful on them.

hebrew_text: גופא חביתי כהן גדול רבי יוחנן אמר אינה קדושה לחצאין ור' אלעזר אמר מתוך שקרבה לחצאין קדושה לחצאין א"ר אחא מאי טעמא דרבי יוחנן אמר קרא (ויקרא ו, יג) מנחה מחציתה הביא מנחה ואח"כ חוציהו
human_translation: the itself: griddle-cake of High Priest, Rabbi Yoḥanan says it is not sanctified in halves, and Rabbi Elazar says: Since it is sacrificed in halves, sanctified in halves. Rav Aḥa said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yoḥanan? The verse states: “A meal offering half of it bring meal offering, and afterward divide it
llm_translation: The body of the High Priest, Rabbi Yochanan said: It is not holy for the half-log measure, and Rabbi Elazar said: Since it has come close to the half-log measure, it is holy for the half-log measure. Rabbi Aḥa said: What is the reason that Rabbi Yochanan said this? Because the verse states (Leviticus 6:13): "A meal offering, half of it he shall bring as a meal offering," and afterwards its remnants.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי חביתי כהן גדול לא היו באות חצאין אלא מביא עשרון שלם וחוצהו ותניא אילו נאמר מנחה מחצית הייתי אומר מביא חצי עשרון מביתו שחרית ומקריב חצי עשרון מביתו ערבית ומקריב ת"ל מחציתה בבקר מחצה משלם הוא מביא
human_translation: raises an objection griddle-cake of High Priest did not come in halves. Rather, brings a full tenth and divides it And it is taught If it were stated: A meal offering, half I would say: He brings half of a tenth from his home morning and sacrifices half of a tenth from his home evening and sacrifices the verse states: “Half of it in the morning,” he brings a half from a whole,
llm_translation: The scholars asked: The High Priest's wine libations were not brought in half-measures, but rather he would bring a full log and pour out half of it. And it was taught in a Baraita: If it had only said "a meal offering," I would say to bring half a log from his house in the morning and offer half a log from his house in the evening. But the Torah teaches: "Its half in the morning," indicating that he brings a full half.

hebrew_text: למצוה אמר ליה רב גביהא מבי כתיל לרב אשי והא חוקה כתיב בה אמר ליה לא נצרכא אלא להביאה שלם מביתו
human_translation: for a mitzva, Rav Geviha from Bei Katil said to Rav Ashi: But “statute” is written with regard to said to him: It was necessary only with regard to bring a full from his home.
llm_translation: Regarding the commandment, Rav Gavya said to Rav Ashi, "But isn't it written in it 'statute'?" He said to him, "It is only necessary to bring it whole from his house."

hebrew_text: ומי א"ר יוחנן הכי והא איתמר הפריש חצי עשרון ודעתו להוסיף רב אמר אינו קדוש ור' יוחנן אמר קדוש ואם איתא לילף מחביתין
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yoḥanan say this? But it was stated: set aside half a tenth and his intention to add Rav says it is not sanctified, and Rabbi Yoḥanan says sanctified. And if it is so let him derive from griddle-cake
llm_translation: And who said Rabbi Yochanan so? But it was stated: One separates half a perutah, and his intention is to add. Rav said: It is not sanctified. And Rabbi Yochanan said: It is sanctified. And if it is necessary, we can derive it from the barrels.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא ר' יוחנן מילתא ממילתא לא יליף והאמר רבי יוחנן שלמים ששחטן בהיכל כשירין דכתיב (ויקרא ג, ב) ושחטו פתח אהל מועד שלא יהא טפל חמור מעיקר
human_translation: And if you would say Rabbi Yoḥanan does not derive matter from matter, But doesn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: Peace offerings that slaughtered in the Sanctuary are valid, as it is written: “And slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting” that minor should not be more stringent than major
llm_translation: And if you will say, "Rabbi Yochanan does not derive one matter from another matter," but Rabbi Yochanan said: "Offerings that were slaughtered in the Temple are valid," as it is written (Leviticus 3:2), "And he shall slaughter it at the entrance of the Tent of Meeting," so that a secondary matter should not be more stringent than the primary matter.

hebrew_text: דעתו להוסיף שאני דתניא (במדבר ז, יג) מלאים אין מלאים אלא שלמים (כלומר שאינו קדוש עד שיהא עשרון שלם) ואמר רבי יוסי אימתי בזמן שאין דעתו להוסיף אבל בזמן שדעתו להוסיף ראשון ראשון קדוש
human_translation: his intention to add is different, as it is taught full “Full” only full that is to say, is not sanctified until there is a full tenth And Rabbi Yosei said: When at a time when his intention not to add But at a time when his intention to add, each initial sanctified
llm_translation: His opinion to add, for it was taught (Numbers 7:13) "full" means only complete (meaning it is not holy until it is complete). And Rabbi Yosei said: When is this? When his intention is not to add. But when his intention is to add, each one is holy.

hebrew_text: ורב בחביתין כמאן ס"ל אי כר' אלעזר לילף מחביתין
human_translation: And Rav, with regard to a griddle-cake in accordance with whose does he hold? If in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, let him derive from griddle-cake
llm_translation: And Rav in Ḥavitein, according to whom does he hold? If according to Rabbi Elazar, he should have distinguished between Ḥavitein.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא רב מילתא ממילתא לא יליף והאמר רב מנחה קדושה בלא שמן (ובלא לבונה) שכן מצינו בלחם הפנים בלא לבונה שכן מצינו במנחת נסכים
human_translation: And if you would say Rav does not derive matter from matter, But doesn’t Rav say: meal offering, is sanctified without oil as we find with regard to the shewbread, without frankincense, as we find with regard to the meal offering libations
llm_translation: And if you will say, one matter from another matter he does not derive, but Rav said: Minchah offering is holy without oil (and without frankincense), as we find with the showbread without frankincense, as we find with the meal offering of libations.

hebrew_text: בלא שמן ובלא לבונה שכן מצינו במנחת חוטא על כרחיך רב כר' יוחנן ס"ל
human_translation: without oil and without frankincense, as we find with regard to the meal offering of a sinner, perforce, Rav holds in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan,
llm_translation: Without oil and without frankincense, for thus we find in the sin offering meal offering against his will. Rav says like Rabbi Yochanan: they disagree.

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רב מנחה קדושה בלא שמן (ואין דינה כעשרון חסר) שכן מצינו בלחם הפנים בלא לבונה שכן מצינו במנחת נסכים בלא שמן ובלא לבונה שכן מצינו במנחת חוטא
human_translation: the itself: Rav says a meal offering is sanctified without oil, and its halakha is not as a tenth lacking, as we find with regard to the shewbread, without frankincense, as we find with regard to the meal offering libations without oil and without frankincense, as we find with regard to the meal offering of a sinner,
llm_translation: The text: "Gufa Amar Rav, Mincha Kedusha b'Lo Shemen (ve'ein Dinah k'Aseron Chaser) sheken matzinu b'Lechem Hapanim b'Lo Levonah sheken matzinu b'Minchat Nesachim b'Lo Shemen u'v'Lo Levonah sheken matzinu b'Minchat Chatat." Translation: The body itself, Rav said, a Mincha offering of sanctity without oil (and its law is not like a lacking tenth), for thus we find with the showbread without frankincense, for thus we find with the meal offering of libations without oil and without frankincense, for thus we find with the meal offering of sin.

hebrew_text: ושמן ולבונה קדשי האי בלא האי והאי בלא האי שמן שכן מצינו בלוג שמן של מצורע לבונה שכן מצינו בלבונה הבאה בבזיכין ורבי חנינא אמר
human_translation: And oil and frankincense are sanctified this without that and that without this Oil as we find with regard to the log of oil of a leper, Frankincense as we find with regard to the frankincense that comes in the bowls And Rabbi Ḥanina says:
llm_translation: And oil and frankincense, sanctified with this and without this, and this with that, oil, as we find in the log of oil of the leper, frankincense, as we find in the frankincense that comes with the meal-offering. And Rabbi Chanina said:

hebrew_text: לא זו קדושה בלא זו ולא זו קדושה בלא זו
human_translation: Neither this sanctified without that, nor is that sanctified without this.
llm_translation: Not this holiness without this and not this holiness without this.

hebrew_text: ולר' חנינא עשרון למה נמשח (והלא אינו עשוי אלא למדידת קמח בלבד והקמח אינו קדוש בלא שמן) למנחת חוטא
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Ḥanina, for what a tenth anointed, was fashioned only for measuring flour, and the flour is not sanctified without oil. for meal offering of a sinner,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Chanina, why is anointing performed? (But isn't it only made for measuring flour alone, and the flour is not holy without oil) for a sin offering.

hebrew_text: ולוג למה נמשח ללוג של מצורע
human_translation: And for what log anointed? for log of a leper,
llm_translation: A log, why is it anointed for a log of a leper.

hebrew_text: ואף שמואל סבר לה להא דרב דתנן כלי הלח מקדשין את הלח ומדות היבש מקדשין את היבש ואין כלי הלח מקדשין את היבש ולא מדות היבש מקדשין את הלח
human_translation: And Shmuel also holds in accordance with this of Rav, as we learned The vessels liquids sanctify the liquids, and the dry measures sanctify the dry But the vessels liquids do not sanctify the dry and the dry measures do not sanctify the liquids.

human_translation: Rather, was necessary enter your mind to say since it is written: “And it shall be presented to the priest, and he shall bring it to the altar” “And he shall remove Just as bringing in the southwestern corner so too, removal of the handful also in the southwestern corner. teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, it was necessary for me to say, since it is written (Leviticus 2:8), "And he shall bring it to the kohen, and he shall approach it to the altar, and he shall scoop out from it from the meal offering a handful of its fine flour and its oil, with all its frankincense, and the kohen shall cause its memorial portion to go up in smoke on the altar, an offering by fire, a satisfying aroma to the Lord." Just as the offering is brought on the southwestern corner of the altar, so too the handful is also on the southwestern corner of the altar. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: גופא א"ר יוחנן שלמים ששחטן בהיכל כשרין שנאמר ושחטו פתח אהל מועד ולא יהא טפל חמור מן העיקר

hebrew_text: מיתיבי ר' יהודה בן בתירא אומר מנין שאם הקיפו עובדי כוכבים את העזרה שהכהנים נכנסין להיכל ואוכלין בקדשי קדשים ושירי מנחות ת"ל
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: From where that if gentiles surrounded the courtyard that the priests enter the Sanctuary and partake of the offerings of the most sacred order and the remainders of meal offerings The verse states:
llm_translation: The Talmudic text you provided translates into English as follows: Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: From where do we derive that if idolaters surrounded the Temple courtyard, the priests may enter the sanctuary and eat the most sacred offerings and the remnants of meal offerings? The verse states (Ezekiel 44:8), "And you have not kept charge of My holy things, but you have set others to keep charge of My sanctuary for you."

hebrew_text: (במדבר יח, י) בקדש הקדשים תאכלנו
human_translation: In the Sanctuary you shall eat them”
llm_translation: "In the Holy of Holies you shall eat it."

hebrew_text: עבודה דאדם עובד במקום רבו אמרינן שלא יהא טפל חמור מן העיקר אכילה שאין אדם אוכל במקום רבו טעמא דכתב קרא הא לא כתב קרא לא יהא טפל חמור מן העיקר לא אמרי'
human_translation: service, for a person serve in the place of his master, we say that minor should not be more stringent than the major consumption since a person may not eat in the place of his master, the reason that written the verse: Had not written the verse we not say minor should not be more stringent than the major
llm_translation: Service that a person performs in the place of his master, we say that it should not be more significant than the primary act of eating, for a person does not eat in the place of his master. The reason is that the verse wrote, "This he did not write," the verse did not write that it should not be more significant than the primary act.

Rabbi Levi said: It is valid, as it is written, "And he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense upon it, and he shall bring it to Aaron's sons, the priests, and he shall take."

hebrew_text: איתמר מנחה שחסרה קודם קמיצה ר' יוחנן אמר יביא מתוך ביתו וימלאנה ריש לקיש אמר לא יביא מתוך ביתו וימלאנה

llm_translation: It was stated: A Minchah offering that is lacking before the Kemitzah. Rabbi Yochanan said: One should bring it from inside his house and fill it. Reish Lakish said: One should not bring it from inside his house and fill it.

human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says he brings from within his home and he fills it, removal of the handful establishes it Reish Lakish says: He shall not bring from within his home and fill it, the sanctity of vessel establishes it
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: One may bring the water from within his house and fill it the mikvah with a handful of drawn water. Reish Lakish said: One may not bring the water from within his house and fill it the mikvah with the sanctity of a fixed vessel.

hebrew_text: איתיביה ר' יוחנן לרשב"ל חסר הלוג אם עד שלא יצק ימלאנו תיובתא:

And Reish Lakish said: One does not offer a handful upon them. According to Rabbi Eliezer, they do not disagree. When they do disagree, it is according to Rabbi Yehoshua.

hebrew_text: דתנן נטמאו שיריה נשרפו שיריה אבדו שיריה כמדת ר' אליעזר כשרה כמדת רבי יהושע פסולה

hebrew_text: מאן דפסל כר' יהושע ומאן דמכשר עד כאן לא אמר רבי יהושע התם אלא דלא אישתייר אבל היכא דאישתייר אפי' ר' יהושע מודה ליה
human_translation: The one who disqualifies in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua. And the one who deems fit, Rabbi Yehoshua says only there, where nothing remained But where there remained even Rabbi Yehoshua concedes to

hebrew_text: דתניא ר' יהושע אומר כל הזבחים שבתורה שנשתייר מהם כזית בשר או כזית חלב זורק הדם כחצי זית בשר כחצי זית חלב אינו זורק את הדם
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: any of the offerings that in the Torah from which there remains an olive-bulk of meat or an olive-bulk of fat, sprinkles the blood half an olive-bulk of meat half an olive-bulk of fat, he does not sprinkle the blood,
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehoshua says, regarding all the sacrifices in the Torah, if there remains from them an olive-bulk of flesh or an olive-bulk of fat, one throws the blood like half an olive-bulk of flesh and like half an olive-bulk of fat; one does not throw the blood.

hebrew_text: ובעולה אפי' כחצי זית בשר וכחצי זית חלב זורק את הדם מפני שבעולה כולה כליל ובמנחה אף על פי שכולה קיימת לא יזרוק
human_translation: And in a burnt offering, even half an olive-bulk of flesh and half an olive-bulk of fat, he sprinkles the blood, because in a burnt offering it is entirely consumed, And with regard to a meal offering, even though it entirely intact, he shall not sprinkle.
llm_translation: In an olah offering, even if there is as little as half an olive's worth of meat and half an olive's worth of fat, one must sprinkle the blood, because the entire olah offering is complete. In a mincha offering, even though it is entirely intact, one should not sprinkle the blood.

hebrew_text: מנחה מאי עבידתה אמר רב פפא מנחת נסכים
human_translation: What is a meal offering doing Rav Pappa said: a meal offering libations
llm_translation: Mincha, what is its service? Rav Papa said: A meal-offering of libations.

hebrew_text: ס"ד אמינא הואיל ובהדי זבח אתיא כי גופיה דזבח דמיא קמ"ל
human_translation: enter your mind to say since comes with a offering, it is considered like offering itself. teaches us
llm_translation: It is taught: I say, since with the offering it comes, it is considered as if the offering itself has come. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: ומאן דפסל שאני הכא דאמר קרא (ויקרא ו, ג) והרים הכהן מן המנחה את אזכרתה והקטיר המזבחה המנחה עד דאיתא לכולה מנחה לא יקטיר
human_translation: And the one who disqualifies is different here, as the verse states: “And the priest shall remove from the meal offering its memorial part, and shall make it smoke upon the altar” “the meal offering” unless the entire meal offering is shall not burn
llm_translation: And one who disqualifies, it is different here, for the verse says (Leviticus 6:3), "And the priest shall remove the memorial portion from the meal offering and shall turn it into smoke on the altar, an offering by fire of a pleasing odor to the Lord." Until the entire meal offering is brought, one may not turn it into smoke.

hebrew_text: ואידך מן המנחה מנחה שהיתה כבר (שלימה בשעת קמיצה יקטיר אע"ג דהשתא אינה שלימה)
human_translation: And the other “from the meal offering” a meal offering that was already whole at the time of the removal of handful, he shall burn even though it is currently not whole.
llm_translation: And the other opinion is regarding the Minchah offering that was already whole (that at the time of taking a handful it should be offered even though now it is not whole).

hebrew_text: איתיביה ר' יוחנן לריש לקיש עד שלא פרקה נפרס [לחמה] הלחם פסול ואין מקטיר עליו את הבזיכין ואם משפרקה נפרס לחמה הלחם פסול ומקטיר עליו את הבזיכין ואמר רבי אלעזר לא פרקה ממש אלא כיון שהגיע זמנה לפרק ואע"פ שלא פירקה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish before detached bread broke unfit and does not burn the bowls on it. And if bread broke after detached it, the bread is unfit but burns the bowls on it. And Rabbi Elazar says: not actually detached Rather, once time to detach it has arrived even though he has not detached it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: Until it has not broken its crust, the bread is invalid, and one does not burn the incense over it. But if its crust has broken, the bread is invalid, and one burns the incense over it. And Rabbi Elazar said: It has not truly broken until its time has arrived to break, even though it has not actually broken.

hebrew_text: א"ל הא מני רבי אליעזר היא א"ל אנא אמינא לך משנה שלימה ואמרת לי את רבי אליעזר
human_translation: said to whose is this? It is Rabbi Eliezer, said to him: I am stating a complete halakha to you, and you say to me Rabbi Eliezer
llm_translation: He said to him: This is from Rabbi Eliezer. He said to him: I tell you a complete Mishnah, and you tell me Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: ואמאי שתק לימא ליה צבור שאני הואיל ואישתרי טומאה לגבייהו אישתרי נמי חסרות אמר רב אדא בר אהבה זאת אומרת החסרון כבעל מום דמי ואין בעל מום בצבור:
human_translation: But why was silent? Let him say to community are different, since ritual impurity was permitted for them, was also permitted are lacking. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: that this is to say lacking is considered like a blemished and there is no a blemished in a communal
llm_translation: And why did he remain silent? Let him say to him: The congregation is different, for since impurity is permitted with regard to them, deficiencies are also permitted. Rav Adda bar Ahava said: This means that a deficiency is like a blemished animal, and a blemished animal is not suitable for the congregation.

hebrew_text: יתיב רב פפא וקאמר להא שמעתא א"ל רב יוסף בר שמעיה לרב פפא מי לא עסקינן דרבי יוחנן וריש לקיש במנחת העומר דציבור היא ופליגי
human_translation: Rav Pappa sitting and saying this halakha , Rav Yosef bar Shemaya said to Rav Pappa: Are we not dealing that Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish in the omer meal offering, which is a communal And disagree.
llm_translation: Rav Papa was sitting and saying this teaching. Rav Yosef bar Shemaya said to Rav Papa, "Did we not engage in the dispute of Rabbi Yochanan and Resh Lakish regarding the Omer offering of the public, and they disagreed."

hebrew_text: אמר רב מלכיו תנא חדא (ויקרא ב, ב) מסלתה שאם חסרה כל שהוא פסולה (ויקרא ב, ב) משמנה שאם חסרה כל שהוא פסול
human_translation: Rav Malkiyu says one taught: of its fine flour” that if lacks any amount disqualified “Of its oil” that if lacks any amount disqualified.
llm_translation: Rav Malkiyu said: One Tanna taught (Leviticus 2:2) "its meal offering," that if it is lacking even a small amount, it is invalid. (Leviticus 2:2) "its oil," that if it is lacking even a small amount, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: ותניא אידך והנותרת מן המנחה פרט למנחה שחסרה היא ושחסר קומצה ושלא הקטיר מלבונתה כלום
human_translation: And it is taught another “But that which is left of the meal offering to the exclusion of a meal offering that was lacking, or whose handful was lacking, or from which did not burn any frankincense.
llm_translation: And it was taught in another Baraita: "And that which is left over from the meal offering" - excluding a meal offering that is lacking, and one that is lacking a handful, and one that was not entirely burnt on the altar.

hebrew_text: תרי קראי בחסרות למה לי לאו חד למנחה שחסרה קודם קמיצה וחד לשירים שחסרו בין קמיצה להקטרה
human_translation: Why do I two verses to lacking? not one to a meal offering that became lacking before the removal of the handful, and one to remainder that became lacking between the removal of the handful and burning
llm_translation: Two verses in the context of lacking - why do I need them? One for the Minchah offering that is lacking before the handful, and one for the Levonah (frankincense) that is lacking between the handful and the burning.

hebrew_text: ותיובתא דר' יוחנן בתרוייהו
human_translation: And a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan in both
llm_translation: And the dispute of Rabbi Yochanan with both of them.

hebrew_text: לא חד למנחה שחסרה קודם קמיצה דאי מביא מביתו וימלאנה אין ואי לא לא וחד לשירים שחסרו בין קמיצה להקטרה דאע"ג דמקטיר קומץ עליהן אותן שירים אסורים לאכילה
human_translation: No; one to a meal offering that became lacking before the removal of the handful, that if he brings from his home and fills it yes, but if not not And one to remainder that became lacking between the removal of the handful and burning that even though burns handful on that remainder is prohibited for consumption.
llm_translation: Not one for the meal-offering that is lacking before the handful, for if one brings it from his house and fills it, it is not valid, and if not, no. And one for the songs that are lacking between the handful and the burning, for even though he burns the handful upon them, those songs are forbidden for consumption.

hebrew_text: דאיבעי' להו לדברי האומר שירים שחסרו בין קמיצה להקטרה מקטיר קומץ עליהן אותן שירים מה הן באכילה
human_translation: as a dilemma was raised before to the statement of who says that remainder became lacking between the removal of the handful and burning burns handful on remainder itself, what with regard to consumption,
llm_translation: The matter was asked of them regarding the words of one who says that songs are missing between the handful and the burning, he should burn the handful on them, those songs, what are they in eating.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי אמר קרא והנותרת ולא הנותרת מן הנותרת ורבי ינאי אמר מהמנחה מנחה שהיתה כבר:
human_translation: Ze’eiri said the verse states: “But that which is left but not the remainder of the remainder, Rabbi Yannai says “of the meal offering a meal offering that was previously
llm_translation: Za'iri said, Scripture says, "and the remainder," and not "the remainder" from the remainder. And Rabbi Yannai said, "from the meal offering, an offering that already existed."

hebrew_text: קמץ בשמאל [וכו']: מנא הני מילי אמר רבי זירא דאמר קרא (ויקרא ט, יז) ויקרב את המנחה וימלא כפו ממנה כף זה איני יודע מהו כשהוא אומר (ויקרא יד, טו) ולקח הכהן מלוג השמן ויצק על כף הכהן השמאלית כאן שמאלית הא כל מקום שנאמר כף אינו אלא ימין
human_translation: removed the handful with left From where are these matters Rabbi Zeira said that the verse states: “And the meal offering was presented; and he filled his hand from it” This hand, I do not know what it is, When states “And the priest shall take of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand” here, left any place where it is stated “hand” only right
llm_translation: Gathered in the left etc.: From where are these matters derived? Rabbi Zeira said: As the verse states (Leviticus 9:17), "And he brought the meal offering, and filled his palm from it." This one, I do not know what it is, when it says (Leviticus 14:15), "And the kohen shall take from the log of oil, and pour it upon the palm of the left kohen." Here, left; there, left; wherever it says "palm," it is only referring to the right.

hebrew_text: והא מיבעי ליה לגופיה שמאלית אחרינא כתיב
human_translation: But is necessary for itself, another left is written
llm_translation: And this, it is necessary for him, for himself, left, another, it is written.

hebrew_text: ואימא אין מיעוט אחר מיעוט אלא לרבות שמאלית אחרינא כתיב כאן שמאלית ואין אחר שמאלית
human_translation: But say restriction after restriction only to amplify, another left is written here left and there is no other left
llm_translation: And say: "Not exclusion after exclusion, but to include another left one is written here left and not another left."

hebrew_text: ואימא אדרבה מה כאן שמאלית אף בעלמא נמי שמאלית ארבעה שמאלית כתיבי תרי בעני ותרי בעשיר
human_translation: But say on the contrary, just as here left so too generally, left as well. Four left are written two with regard to a poor and two with regard to a wealthy
llm_translation: And say, on the contrary, what is here on the left, also in general, on the left, four on the left, it is written two in poverty and two in wealth.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ר' ירמיה לרבי זירא על בהן ידו הימנית ועל בהן רגלו הימנית דכתיב (בשמן דמצורע עשיר) למה לי
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said to Rabbi Zeira: “Upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the big toe of his right foot” which is written with regard to oil of a wealthy leper. Why do I
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Yirmeya to Rabbi Zeira: "On their right hand and on their right foot, as it is written (in the case of the leper): 'Why do I need them?'"

hebrew_text: (דהא כתב על דם האשם) חד להכשיר צדדין וחד לפסול צידי צדדין
human_translation: as written: “Upon the blood of the guilt offering” One to permit sides and one, to disqualify the sides of sides,
llm_translation: The one who wrote regarding the blood of the guilt-offering, one to validate the sides and one to invalidate the sides.

hebrew_text: (ויקרא יד, יז) על דם האשם על מקום דם האשם למאי אתו
human_translation: “Upon the blood of the guilt offering” “Upon the place of the blood of the guilt offering” For what do they come,
llm_translation: On the blood of the guilt offering, on the place of the blood of the guilt offering, for what purpose did they come?

hebrew_text: הני צריכי אי כתב רחמנא על דם האשם הוה אמינא איתיה אין נתקנח לא כתב רחמנא על מקום
human_translation: These are necessary, because if the Merciful One had written “Upon the blood of the guilt offering,” I would say: is yes, was wiped not the Merciful One writes: “Upon the place
llm_translation: These are necessary. If the Merciful One had written "on the blood of the guilt-offering," I would have said that it is necessary. If the Merciful One had not written "on the place"...

hebrew_text: ואי כתב רחמנא על מקום הוה אמינא דוקא נתקנח אבל איתיה אימא הוי חציצה קמ"ל על דם האשם:
human_translation: And if the Merciful One had written “Upon the place I would say: specifically was wiped But is say is an interposition teaches us “upon the blood of the guilt offering,”
llm_translation: And if the Merciful One had written the word "place," I would have said specifically it is fixed, but since it wrote "it," say it is a partition. This teaches us regarding the blood of the guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מאחר דכתיב על דם האשם ועל מקום [דם] האשם וכתיבא ימנית בדם על בהן ידו הימנית ועל בהן רגלו הימנית וכתיבי בשמן דמצורע עשיר ועני למה לי
human_translation: Rava said: Since it is written “upon the blood of the guilt offering,” and: “Upon the place of the guilt offering,” and it is written right for the blood, “Upon the thumb of his right hand, and upon the big toe of his right foot,” and is written with regard to oil of a wealthy leper and a poor Why do I
llm_translation: Rava said: Since it is written "for the blood of the guilt offering" and "for the place of the blood of the guilt offering," and it is written "with the blood on the right earlobe of the one to be purified," and "on the right thumb of the one to be purified," and it is written "with the oil of the leper, rich and poor alike," why do I need all these details?

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא יד יד לקמיצה
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: “hand” “hand” with regard to the removal of a handful,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: "Hand to hand for the Kamitza."

hebrew_text: רגל רגל לחליצה
human_translation: “foot” “foot” with regard to the ritual through which the yavam , a man whose married brother died childless, frees his brother’s widow, the yevama , of her levirate bonds [ ḥalitza ],
llm_translation: Foot foot for redemption.

hebrew_text: אוזן אוזן לרציעה
human_translation: “ear” “ear” with regard to piercing
llm_translation: Ear to ear for a tear.

hebrew_text: שמאלית (העני) למאי אתא אמר רב שישא בריה דרב אידי ליפסול ימין דכהן במצורע שלא תאמר ומה במקום שלא נתרבתה שמאל נתרבתה ימין במקום שנתרבתה שמאל אינו דין שנתרבתה ימין
human_translation: left with the poor for what does come? Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, said: to disqualify right of a priest for a leper. that you should not say: And if in a place where left is not included, right is included, in a place where left is included, isn’t it logical that right included?
llm_translation: Left (the poor) for what did he come? Said Rav Shisha son of Rav Idi: To disqualify the right hand of the priest in the case of a leper, lest you say, "Just as in a place where the left hand did not become afflicted, the right hand became afflicted, so too in a place where the left hand became afflicted, it is not the law that the right hand became afflicted."

hebrew_text: ואידך שמאלית ויד ורגל ימנית דעני למאי אתא לכדתנא דבי ר' ישמעאל כל פרשה שנאמרה ונשנית לא נשנית אלא בשביל דבר שנתחדש בה
human_translation: And the other left right hand and foot of a poor for what come? for that which the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Any passage that was stated and was repeated, was repeated only for a matter that was introduced in
llm_translation: And the other opinion is that the left hand and the right hand and the right foot are all considered to be on the left side. What is the reason? It came to teach in accordance with the teaching of the house of Rabbi Yishmael: Every passage that was stated and repeated was only repeated because of a matter that was newly introduced in it.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר ר' שמעון בן לקיש כל מקום שנאמרה אצבע וכהונה אינה אלא ימין
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish says: Any place in which is stated a finger or priesthood, only right
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said, Rabbi Shimon ben Lakish said: Any place where it is stated "finger" and "priesthood," it is only referring to the right hand.

hebrew_text: קס"ד אצבע וכהונה בעינן כדכתיב (ויקרא ד, כה) ולקח הכהן מדם החטאת באצבעו וגמר ממצורע דכתיב (ויקרא יד, טז) וטבל הכהן את אצבעו הימנית הרי קמיצה דלא כתיבא בה אלא כהונה ותנן קמץ בשמאל פסול
human_translation: enter our mind we require both a finger and priesthood as it is written: “And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger” And is derived from a leper, as it is written: “And the priest shall dip his right finger” as the removal of a handful in which only priesthood is written, and we learned removed the handful with left unfit.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "We require a finger and priesthood as it is written (Leviticus 4:25) 'And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger,' and from the case of the leper, as it is written (Leviticus 14:16) 'And the priest shall dip his right finger.' Here, 'kemitza' is mentioned, where it is not written with it, but rather 'priesthood.' And we learned: If one performs the 'kemitza' with his left hand, it is invalid."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא או אצבע או כהונה
human_translation: Rava said: either a finger or priesthood,
llm_translation: Rava said: Either a finger or priesthood.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי הרי הולכת אברים לכבש דכתיב בהו כהונה דכתיב (ויקרא א, יג) והקריב הכהן את הכל המזבחה ואמר מר זו הולכת אברים לכבש ותנן הרגל של ימין בשמאל ובית עורה לחוץ
human_translation: Abaye said to the conveyance of limbs to the ramp as priesthood is written with regard to it, as it is written: “And the priest shall sacrifice the whole upon the altar” and the Master said this the conveyance of limbs to the ramp. And we learned the foot of right in left and the place of its skin, outward.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "Behold, the limbs are going to the sheep," as it is written regarding them 'for the priesthood,' as it is written (Leviticus 1:13), 'And the priest shall offer all of it up on the altar.' And the Master said: "This is going to the sheep." And we learned: "The right leg is on the left, and the hide is outside."

hebrew_text: כי אמרי' או אצבע או כהונה בדבר המעכב כפרה
human_translation: When we say either finger or priesthood with regard to a matter that precludes atonement,
llm_translation: When they said, "either a finger or a priesthood in a matter that invalidates atonement."

hebrew_text: והרי קבלה דבר המעכב כפרה הוא וכתב בה כהונה דכתיב (ויקרא א, ה) והקריבו בני אהרן הכהנים את הדם זו קבלת הדם ותנן קבל בשמאל פסל ורבי שמעון מכשיר
human_translation: But collection which is a matter indispensable to atonement, and about which priesthood is written? As it is written: “And Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall present the blood” this the collection of the blood. And we learned one collected with left disqualified and Rabbi Shimon deems fit,
llm_translation: And behold, the tradition of a matter that delays atonement it is, and he wrote in it priesthood, as it is written (Leviticus 1:5) "And the sons of Aaron the priests shall offer the blood" - this is the receiving of the blood. And we learned: Receiving with the left hand invalidates, but Rabbi Shimon deems it valid.

hebrew_text: לר' שמעון קאמרת ר"ש תרתי בעי
human_translation: You are saying according to Rabbi Shimon? Rabbi Shimon requires both
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon you said: "Rabbi Shimon, two things you require."

hebrew_text: ומי בעי רבי שמעון תרתי והתניא ר"ש אומר כל מקום שנאמרה יד אינה אלא ימין אצבע אינה אלא ימין אצבע לא בעיא כהונה כהונ' בעי' אצבע
human_translation: And does Rabbi Shimon require both? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: any place which hand is stated, is only right finger, is only right finger, does not require priesthood priesthood, requires finger
llm_translation: "And does Rabbi Shimon require two? But it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, 'In every place where the term 'hand' is mentioned, it is only referring to the right hand; 'finger' is only the right finger. Priesthood does not require a finger, it requires a finger."

hebrew_text: אלא כהן למה לי בכהונו
human_translation: But why do I a priest in his priestly state,
llm_translation: Rather, why do I need a priest for his priesthood?

hebrew_text: והרי זריקה דלא כתב ביה אלא כהונה ותנן זרק בשמאל פסול ולא פליג ר' שמעון אמר אביי פליג בברייתא דתניא קבל בשמאל פסול ור"ש מכשיר זרק בשמאל פסול ורבי שמעון מכשיר
human_translation: But sprinkling concerning which only priesthood is written and we learned: one sprinkled with left disqualified; and Rabbi Shimon does not disagree Abaye says: He disagrees in a baraita , as it is taught one collected with left disqualified, and Rabbi Shimon deems fit. one sprinkled with left disqualified, and Rabbi Shimon deems fit.
llm_translation: And behold, the throwing, for he did not write in it except "priesthood." And we learned: If one throws with his left hand, it is invalid. And Abaye said: Rabbi Shimon does not disagree, for it was taught in a baraita: If one receives with his left hand, it is invalid, and Rabbi Shimon validates. If one throws with his left hand, it is invalid, and Rabbi Shimon validates.

hebrew_text: ואלא הא דאמר רבא יד יד לקמיצה למה לי מכהונה נפקא
human_translation: But that which Rava says “hand” “hand” with regard to the removal of a handful why do I derive from priesthood,
llm_translation: And rather, this that Rava said, "hand to hand for a kemitza," why do I need it? It is derived from the priesthood.

hebrew_text: חד לקומץ וחד לקידוש קומץ
human_translation: one for handful and one for the sanctification of handful,
llm_translation: One for the handful and one for the sanctification, handful.

hebrew_text: לרבי שמעון דלא בעי קידוש קומץ ולמאן דאמר נמי דבעי קידוש קומץ לר' שמעון ובשמאל אכשורי מכשר יד יד דרבא למה לי
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon, who does not require sanctification of handful, or according to the one who says that Rabbi Shimon also requires the sanctification of handful but he deems fit with left why do I of Rava “hand” “hand”?
llm_translation: To Rabbi Shimon, who does not require sanctification of the handful, and according to the one who says that sanctification of the handful is also required for Rabbi Shimon, and with the left hand, an invalid hand, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: אי לקמיצה גופה אליבא דר' שמעון מדר' יהודה בריה דר' חייא נפקא דאמר ר' יהודה בריה דר' חייא מאי טעמא דר"ש דאמר קרא (ויקרא ו, י) קדש קדשים היא כחטאת וכאשם
human_translation: If to removal of the handful itself derived from Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya. As Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: What is the reason that Rabbi Shimon As the verse states “It is most holy, as the sin offering, and as the guilt offering”
llm_translation: If for a handful itself according to Rabbi Shimon from Rabbi Yehuda son of Rabbi Chiya came out, as Rabbi Yehuda son of Rabbi Chiya said, what is the reason of Rabbi Shimon who said a verse (Leviticus 6:10) "It is most holy, like the sin offering and like the guilt offering."

hebrew_text: בא לעובדה ביד עובדה בימין כחטאת בא לעובדה בכלי עובדה בשמאל כאשם
human_translation: comes to perform with hand, he performs it with right like a sin offering, comes to perform it with a vessel, he perform it with left like a guilt offering,
llm_translation: He came to perform a service with a service vessel in his right hand, like a sin offering. He came to perform a service with a service vessel in his left hand, like a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: לא נצרכא אלא לקומץ דמנחת חוטא סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ואמר רבי שמעון שלא יהא קרבנו מהודר כי קמיץ לה נמי בשמאל תתכשר קמשמע לן:
human_translation: is necessary only for the handful of the meal offering of a sinner, enter your mind to say: Since Rabbi Shimon says so that offering will not be of superior quality, when removed the handful with left it should be fit as well. teaches us
llm_translation: Not needed except for the handful of the sin offering. Did you think I would say, since Rabbi Shimon said that his offering should not be honored like a handful, if he also takes a handful with his left hand, it will also be fitting for us.

hebrew_text: קמץ ועלה בידו צרור או גרגר מלח
human_translation: removed the handful and a stone or a grain of salt emerged in his hand,
llm_translation: He gathered a handful, and in his hand was a bundle or a grain of salt.

hebrew_text: או קורט לבונה פסול: כל הני למה לי
human_translation: or a pinch of frankincense unfit, Why do I all these
llm_translation: Or if he cuts the frankincense, it is invalid. What are all these for?

hebrew_text: צריכא דאי תנא צרור משום דלאו בת הקרבה היא אבל מלח דבת הקרבה היא אימא תתכשר
human_translation: necessary. Because if taught a stone, because it is not fit for sacrifice. But salt, which is fit for sacrifice, say should be fit,
llm_translation: It is necessary, for if a Mishnaic sage taught this, it is due to the fact that it is not the daughter of a close relative. But salt, since it is the daughter of a close relative, let it be fit.

hebrew_text: ואי תנא מלח דלא איקבע בהדי מנחה מעיקרא (שאינו מולח אלא הקומץ בלבד) אבל לבונה דאיקבע בהדי מנחה מעיקרא אימא תתכשר קמ"ל:
human_translation: And if taught salt, as it was not initially fixed with meal offering. that salts the handful alone. But frankincense, which was initially fixed with meal offering, say should be fit teaches us
llm_translation: And if a Tanna taught: "Salt that was not placed together with the meal offering from the outset (for it is only the handful that requires salt), but frankincense that was placed together with the meal offering from the outset, one might say it is fitting." This teaches us that it is not fitting.

hebrew_text: מפני שאמרו הקומץ החסר או היתר פסול: מאי איריא משום חסר ויתר ותיפוק ליה משום חציצה א"ר ירמיה מן הצד
human_translation: due to that said: The handful that is lacking or that is outsized unfit. Why specifically because lacking or outsized? But let derive due to an interposition Rabbi Yirmeya says: on the side
llm_translation: Because they said the lacking or the excess handful is invalid. What is the relevance of lacking and excess? And let him derive it from the issue of interposition. Rabbi Yirmeya said: from the side.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לרבא כיצד קומצין אמר ליה כדקמצי אינשי איתיביה זו זרת זו קמיצה
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: How do remove the handful said to him: as people remove handfuls, raised an objection to This a span This removal of a handful
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rava, "How does one perform Kometz?" He said to him, "Like the way people perform it." Zuzu Zara, this is Kometz.

hebrew_text: זו אמה זו אצבע זו גודל
human_translation: this a cubit, This finger this thumb
llm_translation: This is an ellipsis, this is a finger, this is a knuckle.

hebrew_text: אלא להשוות (כלומר קומץ מלא היד כדי שלא יהא חסר ואחר כך מוחק באצבע קטנה מלמטה)
human_translation: only for leveling that is to say, removes a handful a full hand, so that it should not be lacking and then he wipes with little finger from the bottom,
llm_translation: Rather, to compare (meaning a full handful, so that it is not lacking, and afterwards he wipes with his small finger from below).

hebrew_text: היכי עביד אמר רב זוטרא בר טוביה אמר רב חופה שלש אצבעותיו עד שמגיע על פס ידו וקומץ
human_translation: How performed? Rav Zutra bar Toviyya says Rav says: he bends his three fingers until reach over the palm of his hand, and removes the handful.
llm_translation: How does one perform? Said Rav Zutra bar Tobiah, said Rav Hupha: with three of his fingers until it reaches the palm of his hand, and he clenches.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי מלא קומצו יכול מבורץ ת"ל בקומצו
human_translation: that is also taught his handful” might overflowing. verse states: with his handful [ bekumtzo ]”
llm_translation: It was also taught: "If his fist is full, can he break through? (Job 15:26)" - this teaches that it is in his fist.

hebrew_text: אי בקומצו יכול בראשי אצבעותיו ת"ל מלא קומצו הא כיצד חופה שלש אצבעותיו על פס ידו וקומץ
human_translation: If “with his handful,” might with his fingertips, the verse states: “His handful,” How so? He scoops his three fingers over the palm of his hand, and takes a handful
llm_translation: If in his fist, he can hold it with the tips of his fingers, the verse teaches us "its fullness" - how so? He wraps three of his fingers around the width of his hand and clenches.

hebrew_text: במחבת ובמרחשת מוחק בגודלו מלמעלה ובאצבעו קטנה מלמטה וזו היא עבודה קשה שבמקדש
human_translation: In a pan and of a deep-pan wipes with his thumb above and with his little finger below. And this is difficult rite in the Temple,
llm_translation: In a mortar and in a pestle, one grinds from above with his large finger and from below with his small finger, and this is the most difficult task in the Temple.

hebrew_text: זהו ותו לא והאיכא מליקה והאיכא חפינה אלא זו היא אחת מעבודות קשות שבמקדש
human_translation: This one and no other? But isn’t there pinching and isn’t there scooping Rather, this is one of difficult rites in the Temple.
llm_translation: This is and not and there is salting and there is covering but this is one of the difficult labors in the Temple.

hebrew_text: א"ר פפא פשיטא לי מלא קומצו כדקמצי אינשי בעי רב פפא קמץ בראשי אצבעותיו מאי
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: obvious to me “his handful” in the manner that people remove a handful, Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: What removed a handful with his fingertips,
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is obvious to me that the measure of a kometz is like the measure of a person's fist. Rav Papa asked: If one takes a kometz with the tips of his fingers, what is the law?

hebrew_text: מן הצדדין מאי ממטה למעלה מאי תיקו
human_translation: from the sides, what downward upward what shall stand
llm_translation: From the sides, what is below, what is above, what is the resolution.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא פשיטא לי מלא חפניו כדחפני אינשי בעי רב פפא חפן בראשי אצבעותיו מהו מן הצדדין מהו חפן בזו ובזו וקרבן זו אצל זו מהו תיקו
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: obvious to me “His handful” in the manner that people scoop a handful, Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: What is scooped a handful with his fingertips? What is from the sides? What is he scooped a handful with this and with that and brought them together? shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is obvious to me that his hands are full like the hands of a person. Rav Papa asked: If one's hand is on top of his fingers, what is the ruling? Is it considered on the side or on top? And if it is on both sides, and the offering is next to it, what is the ruling? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בעי רב פפא דבקיה לקומץ בדפניה דמנא מאי תוך כלי בעינן והאיכא או דלמא הנחה בתוכו בעינן וליכא תיקו
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises dilemma: stuck the handful onto the side of vessel what we require inside vessel, and is Or perhaps we require placed inside and is not shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Papa asked: Does one need to place the handful within the vessel, or is it sufficient to have it resting on the edge of the vessel? Perhaps we require it to be inside, or maybe having it placed within is not necessary. The question remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: בעי מר בר רב אשי הפכיה למנא ודבקיה לקומץ בארעיתא דמנא מאי הנחה בתוכו בעינן והאיכא או דלמא כתיקנו בעינן וליכא תיקו:
human_translation: Mar bar Rav Ashi raises dilemma: overturned the vessel and stuck handful to the underside of the vessel, what we require placed inside and that is Or perhaps we require properly and that is not shall stand
llm_translation: Master, son of Rav Ashi, asked: He turned it into a mina and attached it to a handful in the ground of the mina. What benefit do we need within it? But there is, or perhaps we need it as it was fixed, and there is no resolution.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כיצד הוא עושה פושט את אצבעותיו על פס ידו ריבה שמנה חסר שמנה חיסר לבונתה פסולה:
human_translation: How does perform He extends his fingers onto the palm of his hand. one increased its oil, decreased its oil, decreased its frankincense, unfit.
llm_translation: Mishnah: How does one perform the ritual of stretching out his fingers on the palm of his hand? If its fat is excessive by eight handbreadths or deficient by eight handbreadths, its structure is invalid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ היכי דמי ריבה שמנה א"ר אליעזר כגון שהפריש לה שני לוגין ולוקמה כגון דעריב בה שמן דחולין ושמן דחבירתה
human_translation: What are the circumstances increased its oil? Rabbi Eliezer says: where he separated two log for And let interpret where he mixed non-sacred oil or the oil of another into
llm_translation: Gemara: How is the case of a ribah (excess interest) similar to a ribit (interest)? Rabbi Eliezer said: For example, if one set aside for her two logs of oil, and she arose, such as when he mixed in it regular oil and oil of its fellow.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא שמן דחולין ושמן דחבירתה לא פסל מתקיף לה רב זוטרא בר טוביה אלא מעתה מנחת חוטא דפסל בה שמן היכי משכחת לה
human_translation: And if you would say non-sacred oil and the oil of another do not disqualify Rav Zutra bar Toviyya objects to this If that is so, meal offering of a sinner, that oil disqualifies it, how can you find
llm_translation: And if you were to say that oil of secular use and oil of its fellow do not disqualify it, Rav Zutra bar Tobiah objects to her, but now, a sin-offering meal offering in which disqualified oil was used, how do you find it?

hebrew_text: אי דידה הא לית לה אי דחולין ודחבירת' הא אמרת לא פסל (ואי אמרת דאפריש לה שמן כיון דלית לה שמן כלל חולין נינהו)
human_translation: If its own does not have If non-sacred or of another you said does not disqualify And if you would say that he designated oil for since does not have oil at all, is non-sacred,
llm_translation: If it is hers, she does not have it; if it is from common property and from her friend, you said it is not disqualified. (And if you say that she separated oil for it, since she does not have any oil at all, they are considered common property.)

hebrew_text: ור' אליעזר לא מיבעיא קאמר לא מיבעיא דחולין ודחבירתה דפסיל אבל הפריש לה שני לוגין הואיל והאי חזי לי' והאי חזי לי' אימא לא ליפסיל קמ"ל
human_translation: and Rabbi Eliezer is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary that non-sacred and of another disqualify But separated two log for since this is fit for and that is fit for it, say it should not disqualify teaches us
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer does not need it - he is saying: It is not necessary for both mundane items and its counterpart to disqualify, but if one separated two logs for it, since this one is fit for me and this one is fit for me, say it will not disqualify. This teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: ומנא ליה לר' אליעזר הא אמר רבא מתני' קשיתיה מאי איריא דתני ריבה שמנה ליתני ריבה לה שמן אלא הא קמ"ל דאע"ג דהפריש לה שני לוגין:
human_translation: And from where does Rabbi Eliezer this Rava said: the mishna posed a difficulty for him, Why does specifically teach he increased its oil, Let teach He increased the oil. Rather, this teaches us: That even though he separated two log for
llm_translation: And how does Rabbi Eliezer count it? This is what Rava said: a Mishnah is difficult for him. What is the relevance of the fact that he taught "a quarter log"? Let him teach "a quarter log of oil"! Rather, this teaches us that even though he set aside two logs for it.

hebrew_text: חיסר לבונתה: ת"ר חסרה ועמדה על קורט אחד פסולה על שני קרטין כשרה דברי רבי יהודה רבי שמעון אומר על קורט אחד כשרה פחות מכאן פסולה
human_translation: decreased its frankincense the Sages taught decreased stood at one pinch, disqualified, at two pinches, fit; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: at one pinch, fit; less than that, disqualified.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "He lacks its corner: The Sages taught: If it is lacking and stands on one beam, it is invalid; if on two beams, it is valid. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda; Rabbi Shimon says: If it is on one beam, it is valid; if less than this, it is invalid."

hebrew_text: והתניא (ר' שמעון אומר) קומץ ולבונה שחסר כל שהוא פסול תני קורט לבונה שחסר כל שהוא פסול ואיבעית אימא כאן בלבונה הבאה עם המנחה כאן בלבונה הבאה בפני עצמה
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi Shimon says: A handful or frankincense that decreased any amount disqualified? teach A pinch of frankincense that decreased any amount disqualified. And if you wish, say here, of frankincense that comes with a meal offering, there, of frankincense that comes by itself.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: And it was taught (Rabbi Shimon says): A handful and frankincense that is lacking anything at all is invalid. It was taught: A small amount of frankincense that is lacking anything at all is invalid. And if you wish, say: Here, with the frankincense that comes with the meal-offering, here, with the frankincense that comes by itself.

hebrew_text: א"ר יצחק בר יוסף א"ר יוחנן ג' מחלוקת בדבר ר"מ סבר קומץ בתחילה וקומץ בסוף ורבי יהודה סבר קומץ בתחילה ושני קרטין בסוף ור"ש סבר קומץ בתחילה וקורט אחד בסוף
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: three disputes with regard to the matter. Rabbi Meir holds a handful at the beginning, and ultimately handful And Rabbi Yehuda holds a handful at the beginning, and ultimately two pinches And Rabbi Shimon holds a handful at the beginning and ultimately one pinch
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzhak bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: There are three disputes regarding the matter of the omer offering. Rabbi Meir holds that one should gather the barley at the beginning and gather at the end, and Rabbi Yehuda holds that one should gather at the beginning and two bundles at the end, and Rabbi Shimon holds that one should gather at the beginning and one bundle at the end.

hebrew_text: ושלשתן מקרא אחד דרשו (ויקרא ו, ח) ואת כל הלבונה אשר על המנחה ר"מ סבר עד דאיתא ללבונה דאיקבעה בהדי מנחה מעיקרא ורבי יהודה סבר כל ואפי' חד קורט את לרבות קורט אחר ור"ש את לא דריש
human_translation: And three of them interpret a single verse and [ ve’et ] all the frankincense that is upon the meal offering, Rabbi Meir holds unless there the frankincense that was initially fixed together with the meal offering. And Rabbi Yehuda holds “All [ kol ],” even a single pinch, “ Et ,” to includ-e another pinch. And Rabbi Shimon does not interpret “ et ,”
llm_translation: And the three of them interpreted one verse (Leviticus 6:8), "And all the frankincense that is upon the meal-offering." Rabbi Meir holds that until the frankincense is mentioned, it is established with the meal-offering from the outset. And Rabbi Yehuda holds that "all" includes even one handful to include another handful. And Rabbi Shimon does not interpret "and."

hebrew_text: וא"ר יצחק בר יוסף א"ר יוחנן מחלוקת בלבונה הבאה עם המנחה אבל בלבונה הבאה בפני עצמה ד"ה קומץ בתחילה וקומץ בסוף להכי איצטריך אשר על המנחה דבהדי מנחה אין בפני עצמה לא
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: dispute with regard to frankincense that comes with a meal offering. But with regard to frankincense that comes by itself, everyone, agrees a handful at the beginning, and ultimately handful For this was necessary “That is upon the meal offering,” that together with a meal offering, yes, by itself, not
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzchak bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Disagreement regarding the frankincense that comes with the meal offering, but regarding frankincense that comes by itself, this is the principle: "A handful at the beginning and a handful at the end." Therefore, it was necessary to state that the frankincense is upon the meal offering, for by itself, it is not.

hebrew_text: וא"ר יצחק בר יוסף א"ר יוחנן מחלוקת בלבונה הבאה עם המנחה אבל בלבונה הבאה בבזיכין דברי הכל שני קמצין בתחילה ושני קמצין בסוף
human_translation: And Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: dispute with regard to frankincense that comes with a meal offering. But with regard to frankincense that comes in bowls everyone, agrees two handfuls in the beginning, and ultimately two handfuls.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yitzhak son of Joseph said in the name of Rabbi Yohanan: Disagreement regarding frankincense that comes with the meal offering, but regarding frankincense that comes with the wine libations, everyone agrees: two handfuls at the beginning and two handfuls at the end.

hebrew_text: פשיטא מהו דתימא כיון דבהדי לחם אתיא כאשר על המנחה דמיא קמ"ל
human_translation: obvious lest you say since comes together with bread, considered as: that is upon the meal offering” teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious. What might you say? Since it comes together with bread, it is similar to the meal offering. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: פליגי בה רבי אמי ורבי יצחק נפחא חד אמר מחלוקת בלבונה הבאה עם המנחה אבל בלבונה הבאה בפני עצמה דברי הכל קומץ בתחילה וקומץ בסוף וחד אמר כמחלוקת בזו כך מחלוקת בזו:
human_translation: Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa disagree with regard to One says dispute with regard to frankincense that comes with a meal offering, but with regard to frankincense that comes by itself, everyone agrees a handful at the beginning and ultimately handful And one says: Just as a dispute in this so too, a dispute in that
llm_translation: They disputed it, Rabbi Ami and Rabbi Yitzchak Nafcha. One said: The disagreement is regarding the frankincense that comes with the meal offering, but regarding frankincense that comes by itself, everyone agrees that one should take a handful at the beginning and a handful at the end. And one said: Just as there is a disagreement in this case, so too there is a disagreement in that case.

hebrew_text: חיסר לבונתה [פסולה]: הא יתיר כשרה והתניא יתיר פסולה אמר רמי בר חמא כגון שהפריש לה שני קמצין
human_translation: decreased its frankincense he increased fit. But isn’t it taught increased disqualified? Rami bar Ḥama said: where he separated two handfuls for
llm_translation: Lacking its intent invalid: If there is more, it is valid, and it was taught: If there is more, it is invalid. Rami bar Hama said: For example, if one separated for it two handfuls.

hebrew_text: ואמר רמי בר חמא הפריש לה שני קמצין ואבד אחד מהן קודם קמיצה לא הוקבעו אחר קמיצה הוקבעו
human_translation: And Rami bar Ḥama says: one separated two handfuls for and lost one of them, before the removal of the handful was not fixed after the removal of the handful were fixed
llm_translation: And said Rami bar Hama: If one separated two handfuls, and one of them got lost before the handful was taken, they were not established; after the handful was taken, they were established.

hebrew_text: ואמר רמי בר חמא הפריש ארבעה קמצין לשני בזיכין ואבדו שנים מהן קודם סילוק בזיכין לא הוקבעו לאחר סילוק בזיכין הוקבעו
human_translation: And Rami bar Ḥama says: one separated four handfuls for two bowls and two of them lost, before the removal of bowls was not fixed after the removal of bowls, were fixed
llm_translation: And Rami bar Hama said: He separated four kavim of teeth for two zuzim, and two of them were lost before the removal of the teeth, they were not established; after the removal of the teeth, they were established.

hebrew_text: הא תו למה לי היינו הך
human_translation: Why do I also this? This that
llm_translation: This, what to me? This is that.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא כיון דבריר קומץ דידה כיון שהגיע זמנה לפורקה כמאן דפריקה דמיא קמ"ל:
human_translation: lest you say since handful of is designated once the time arrives for removing it is considered as though removed, teaches us
