llm_translation: What is the case? Since it is a matter of a handful of produce that belongs to her, once its time arrives for separation, it is as if she is the one who separates it. This teaches us that it is considered as if she herself is the one who separates it.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הקומץ את המנחה לאכול שיריה בחוץ או כזית משיריה בחוץ להקטיר קומצה בחוץ או כזית קומצה בחוץ או להקטיר לבונתה בחוץ פסול ואין בו כרת לאכול שיריה למחר או כזית משיריה למחר להקטיר קומצה למחר או כזית מקומצה למחר או להקטיר לבונה למחר
human_translation: one who removes a handful from the meal offering to partake its remainder outside or an olive-bulk of its remainder outside to burn its handful outside or an olive-bulk its handful outside or to burn its frankincense outside unfit, but there is no karet it. to partake its remainder on the next day or an olive-bulk of its remainder on the next day, to burn its handful on the next day or an olive-bulk of its handful on the next day, or to burn frankincense on the next day,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The handful of the meal-offering, to eat its remainder outside, or an olive's bulk from its remainder outside, to offer its handful outside, or an olive's bulk of its handful outside, or to offer its frankincense outside, is invalid, and does not incur karet. To eat its remainder the next day, or an olive's bulk from its remainder the next day, to offer its handful the next day, or an olive's bulk of its handful the next day, or to offer its frankincense the next day.

hebrew_text: פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: piggul , and one is liable karet for
llm_translation: פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת Pigul and liable upon it excision

hebrew_text: זה הכלל כל הקומץ [או] נותן בכלי המוליך המקטיר לאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שדרכו להקטיר חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת ובלבד שיקריב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: This is the principle: anyone who removes the handful, or places in the vessel, who conveys who burns to partake of an item whose manner partakes or to burn an item whose manner burns outside its area, unfit but there is no karet . beyond its time, piggul and one is liable karet on account of it, provided that the permitting was sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: This is the principle: anyone who gathers or places in a vessel that leads to smoking, to eat something whose manner is to be eaten, and to smoke something whose manner is to be smoked, outside of its proper place is invalid, and it does not incur karet unless it is outside of its proper time, in which case it is considered pigul, and one is liable for karet, provided that the one who permits it does so in accordance with his obligation.

hebrew_text: כיצד קרב המתיר כמצותו קמץ בשתיקה נתן בכלי והוליך והקטיר חוץ לזמנו או שקמץ חוץ לזמנו נתן בכלי והוליך והקטיר בשתיקה או שקמץ ונתן בכלי והוליך והקטיר חוץ לזמנו זהו שקרב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: How the permitting factor sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva? removed the handful in silence, placed in the vessel, conveyed and burned beyond its time; or removed the handful beyond its time, placed in the vessel, and conveyed and burned in silence, or removed the handful placed in the vessel, conveyed and burned beyond its time, that is whose permitting factor was sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva,
llm_translation: How does one who permits the offering of incense do so in accordance with its requirements? He takes a handful in silence, places it in a vessel, and brings it and offers it outside its designated time. Or if he took a handful outside its designated time, placed it in a vessel, brought it, and offered it in silence. Or if he took a handful, placed it in a vessel, brought it, and offered it outside its designated time. This is how one who permits the offering of incense does so in accordance with its requirements.

hebrew_text: כיצד לא קרב המתיר כמצותו קמץ חוץ למקומו נתן בכלי והוליך והקטיר חוץ לזמנו או שקמץ חוץ לזמנו נתן בכלי והוליך והקטיר חוץ למקומו או שקמץ נתן בכלי והוליך והקטיר חוץ למקומו זהו שלא קרב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: How the permitting factor not sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva? removed the handful outside its area, placed in the vessel, conveyed and burned beyond its time; or removed the handful beyond its time, placed in the vessel, conveyed and burned outside its area; or removed the handful placed in the vessel, and conveyed and burned outside its area, that is whose permitting factor was not sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: How did the one who permits not approach like his obligation? He gathered outside its place, placed it in a vessel, and carried it and burned it outside its time. Or if he gathered outside its time, placed it in a vessel, and carried it and burned it outside its place. Or if he gathered, placed it in a vessel, and carried it and burned it outside its place. This is that the one who permits did not approach like his obligation.

hebrew_text: מנחת חוטא ומנחת קנאות שקמצן שלא לשמן נתן בכלי והוליך והקטיר חוץ לזמנו או שקמץ חוץ לזמנו נתן בכלי והוליך והקטיר שלא לשמן או שקמץ ונתן בכלי והוליך והקטיר שלא לשמן זהו שלא קרב המתיר כמצותו
human_translation: The meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy that one removed their handful not for their sake placed in the vessel, conveyed and burned beyond its time; or that one removed the handful beyond its time placed in the vessel, conveyed and burned not for their sake; or that one removed the handful, and placed in the vessel, and conveyed and burned not for their sake, that is whose permitting factor was not sacrificed in accordance with its mitzva.
llm_translation: Offering of a sinner and offering of jealousy, if he scooped it not for its oil, placed in a vessel, and carried and burned outside its time, or if he scooped it outside its time, placed in a vessel, and carried and burned, not for its oil, or if he scooped and placed in a vessel, and carried and burned, not for its oil, this is that he did not bring near as his command.

hebrew_text: לאכול כזית בחוץ כזית למחר כזית למחר כזית בחוץ כחצי זית בחוץ כחצי זית למחר כחצי זית למחר כחצי זית בחוץ פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: to partake of an olive-bulk outside an olive-bulk the next day, an olive-bulk the next day an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk the next day, half an olive-bulk the next day half an olive-bulk outside unfit but there is no karet .
llm_translation: To eat an olive's bulk outside, an olive's bulk for tomorrow, an olive's bulk for tomorrow, an olive's bulk outside, like half an olive's bulk outside, like half an olive's bulk for tomorrow, like half an olive's bulk for tomorrow, like half an olive's bulk outside - it is invalid, and does not incur karet.

hebrew_text: א"ר יהודה זה הכלל אם מחשבת הזמן קדמה למחשבת המקום פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת אם מחשבת המקום קדמה למחשבת הזמן פסול ואין בו כרת וחכמי' אומרים זה וזה פסול ואין בו כרת:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says this is the principle: If the intent the time preceded the intent the area, piggul and one is liable karet on account of it. If the intent the area preceded the intent the time, unfit but there is no karet . And the Rabbis say: this and that unfit but there is no karet .
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said: This is the principle: if the intent of the time preceded the intent of the place, it is disqualified as "pigul," and one is liable to receive karet for it. If the intent of the place preceded the intent of the time, it is invalid, but there is no karet involved. And the Sages say: both scenarios are invalid, and there is no karet involved.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ איבעיא להו לדברי האומר שירים שחסרו בין קמיצה להקטרה מקטיר קומץ עליהן וקיימא לן דאותן שירים אסורים באכילה מהו דתיהני להו הקטרה למיקבעינהו בפיגול
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before According to the statement of the one who says remainder lacking between the removal of the handful and the burning burns the handful on and we maintain that that remainder is prohibited for consumption, what is Should burning be effective in establishing as piggul
llm_translation: Gemara: It was asked of them regarding the words of one who says that songs that are missing between the handful and the burning, he burns a handful over them, and it is established for us that those songs are prohibited for consumption. What is the law if one derives benefit from the burning in order to establish them as disqualified through Pigul?

hebrew_text: ולפקינהו מידי מעילה
human_translation: And in removing from misuse
llm_translation: And to redeem them from the hand of the mantle.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא אפילו לר"ע דאמר זריקה מועלת ליוצא ה"מ יוצא
human_translation: Rav Huna said: Even according to Rabbi Akiva, who says sprinkling is effective in left that statement leaving.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Even according to Rabbi Akiva who said that throwing is effective for the one who is liable to bring a sin-offering, this is effective.

hebrew_text: דאיתיה בעיניה ופסול מחמת דבר אחר הוא אבל חסרון דפסולא דגופיה הוא לא מהני ליה הקטרה
human_translation: that as is, and disqualification on account of something else, But a lack which is a disqualification of itself, burning is not effective in
llm_translation: He is present in his eyes and disqualified due to another matter, but the deficiency of his inherent disqualification does not render the incense invalid for him.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא אדרבה אפי' לר"א דאמר אין זריקה מועלת ליוצא ה"מ יוצא דליתיה בפנים אבל חסרון דאיתיה בפנים מהניא ליה הקטרה
human_translation: Rava said to On the contrary; even according to Rabbi Eliezer, who says sprinkling is not effective in left that statement leaving, as is not inside But a lack that is inside burning is effective
llm_translation: Rava said to him: On the contrary, even according to Rabbi Eliezer who says that throwing is not effective for one who is exempt, this applies to one who does not have the object inside the domain. But if he has the object inside the domain, the offering is beneficial to him.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מנא אמינא לה דתנן הקומץ את המנחה לאכול שיריה בחוץ או כזית משיריה בחוץ ותני רבי חייא הקומץ את המנחה ולא תני או כזית
human_translation: Rava said: From where do I say which we learned one who removes a handful from the meal offering to partake its remainder outside or an olive-bulk of its remainder outside And Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches One who removes a handful from the meal offering and he does not teach: Or an olive-bulk
llm_translation: Rava said: From where do I say this? As we learned in a Mishnah: If one gathered the handful of the meal-offering to eat its remnants outside, or an olive's worth of its remnants outside. And Rabbi Chiya taught: One gathers the handful of the meal-offering, but he did not teach "or an olive's worth."

hebrew_text: מ"ט לא תני או כזית לאו כגון שחסרו שירים וקמו להו אכזית וכיון דבמתן כלי בהילוך ובהקטרה לא מתני ליה
human_translation: What is the reason did not teach: Or an olive-bulk? not where remainder became lacking and stood at an olive-bulk? And since with regard to placement in a vessel, with regard to conveyance and with regard to burning he not teach
llm_translation: Why not teach the case of "or a olive's bulk"? Not a case like where they lacked barley and they arose and gave them a k'zayit, since in the giving of the vessel, in the walking, and in the burning, it does not teach it to him.

hebrew_text: או כזית אשירים בקמיצה נמי לאכול שירים לא תני או כזית וקתני סיפא פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת אלמא מהניא להו הקטרה
human_translation: Or an olive-bulk, in remainder, in removal of the handful as well, to partake its remainder, did not teach: Or an olive-bulk And the latter clause teaches piggul and one is liable karet on it. Evidently, burning is effective in
llm_translation: Or a olive-sized amount of sheratzim in a kemitza, also for eating sheratzim it did not teach, or a olive-sized amount and it taught the end of the Mishnah: pigul, and one is liable upon it to receive karet. Therefore, the burning of the incense is beneficial for them.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי לא הא מני ר"א היא דתנן הקומץ והלבונה והקטרת ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח ומנחת נסכים שהקריב מאחת מהן כזית בחוץ חייב ורבי אלעזר פוטר עד שיקריב את כולו
human_translation: Abaye said to No, whose is this It is Rabbi Elazar, as we learned the handful and the frankincense, and the incense, and the meal offering of priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest and the meal offering libations where one sacrificed an olive-bulk from one of them outside liable And Rabbi Elazar exempts until he sacrifices entirety
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: This is not the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, as we learned in a Mishnah: The handful, the frankincense, and the incense, and the meal-offering of the priests, and the meal-offering of the anointed priest, and the meal-offering of libations, if one offered from any of them an olive's bulk outside, he is liable. And Rabbi Eliezer exempts until he offers all of it.

hebrew_text: כיון דבהקטרת קמיצה לא מתני ליה או כזית מקומצה בחוץ בשירים נמי לא מתני ליה או כזית
human_translation: Since with regard to the burning of the handful he not teach: Or an olive-bulk of its handful outside with regard to remainder as well, he did not teach: Or an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Since with regard to the incense offering, the measure is not given as a handful, or an olive-bulk outside the Temple, in the inner chambers as well, the measure is not given as a handful, or an olive-bulk.

hebrew_text: אי רבי אלעזר האי להקטיר קומצה להקטיר קומצה ולבונתה מיבעי ליה דתנן הקומץ והלבונה שהקריב את אחד מהן בחוץ חייב ורבי אלעזר פוטר עד שיקריב את שניהם
human_translation: If Rabbi Elazar, this To burn its handful should have To burn its handful and its frankincense as we learned the handful and the frankincense, where one sacrificed one of them outside liable. Rabbi Eliezer exempts until he sacrifices both of them
llm_translation: If Rabbi Elazar this for burning a handful for burning a handful and its frankincense requires for him for we learned the handful and the frankincense that he offered one of them outside is liable and Rabbi Elazar exempts until he offers both of them.

hebrew_text: לא נצרכא אלא לקומץ דמנחת חוטא
human_translation: is necessary only for the handful of the meal offering of a sinner,
llm_translation: Not needed except for the handful of the sin offering.

hebrew_text: ואיכפל תנא לאשמועינן קומץ דמנחת חוטא אין וכן כי אתא רב דימי א"ר אלעזר קומץ דמנחת חוטא הוא ורבי אלעזר היא
human_translation: And did the tanna go to all that trouble [ ve’ikhpal ] to teach us the handful of the meal offering of a sinner? Yes, And similarly, when Rav Dimi came Rabbi Elazar said: it is handful of the meal offering of a sinner, and it is Rabbi Elazar.
llm_translation: "And a Tanna disputed: We need not hear the ruling regarding the handful of the sin offering. And similarly, when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Elazar said: It is the handful of the sin offering, and it is Rabbi Elazar."

hebrew_text: הדר אמר רבא לאו מילתא היא דאמרי דתניא (ויקרא כד, ט) קדש קדשים הוא שאם נפרסה אחת מהן חלותיה כולן פסולות
human_translation: Rava then said: That I said, is nothing, as it is taught “It is most holy” that if one of broke all of its loaves are disqualified,
llm_translation: Rava said: It is not a matter, as they say, as it is taught (Leviticus 24:9), "It is most holy." If one of them is uncovered, all of them are invalidated.

hebrew_text: הא יצאת הני דאיכא גוואי כשרות מאן שמעת ליה דאמר זריקה מועלת ליוצא ר"ע היא וקאמר נפרסה לא
human_translation: but left those that are inside fit. whom have you heard who says: sprinkling is effective in left It is Rabbi Akiva. And he says broke, not
llm_translation: This one, he went out, those that there are a defect, valid. Who heard to him that said, throwing is effective for the one who goes out, Rabbi Akiva, he is, and he said, it did not spread out.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי מי קתני הא יצאת דלמא הא נטמאת הנך כשרות
human_translation: Abaye said to Is taught left, Perhaps if became ritually impure, these are fit.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Does this Mishnah teach that she has fulfilled her obligation? Perhaps she has become ritually impure, those are valid.

hebrew_text: מ"ט דמרצה ציץ אבל יצאת לא ור' אליעזר היא דאמר אין זריקה מועלת ליוצא
human_translation: What is the reason that the frontplate effects acceptance But left, not And is Rabbi Eliezer, who says sprinkling is not effective to that left
llm_translation: Reasoning of Marzah: "Tzitz" - mourning, you have fulfilled; "Avel" - no. And Rabbi Eliezer, he said: "Zerikah" is not effective for fulfilling the obligation.

hebrew_text: ובדין הוא דאיבעי ליה למיתני נמי יצאת והאי דקתני נפרסה הא קמ"ל דאפי' נפרסה דאיתיה בפנים לא מהניא ליה הקטרה אבל לר"ע דאמר זריקה מועלת ליוצא אפי' חסרון נמי מהניא ליה הקטרה:
human_translation: And by right should have also taught left, And that it teaches broke, this teaches us: That even broke, which is inside burning is not effective to it. But according to Rabbi Akiva, who says sprinkling is effective to left even a lacking burning is effective to it.
llm_translation: And in the law, it is necessary for him to teach also "Yatza" (it went out). And this that it teaches "Nifresha" - this teaches that even if it is spread out inside, the incense is not beneficial to him. But according to Rabbi Akiva who says that sprinkling is effective for the one who goes out, even a deficiency is also beneficial to him for the incense.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ לאכול כחצי זית ולהקטיר כחצי זית כשר שאין אכילה והקטרה מצטרפין:
human_translation: to partake of half an olive-bulk and to burn half an olive-bulk fit, because eating and burning do not join together.
llm_translation: Mishnah: To eat like half an olive and to burn like half an olive is valid, for eating and burning combine.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ טעמא דלאכול ולהקטיר הא לאכול ולאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול מצטרף
human_translation: The reason that to partake of and to burn to partake and to partake of an item whose manner not consume join together
llm_translation: Gemara: The reason for not eating and burning the terumah that became impure is that eating and eating something that is not normally eaten combine.

hebrew_text: והקתני רישא לאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שדרכו להקטיר דבר שדרכו לאכול אין שאין דרכו לאכול לא מאן תנא
human_translation: But the first clause teaches, to partake of an item whose manner partakes or to burn an item whose manner burns an item whose manner partakes yes, whose manner is not partake not who taught
llm_translation: "And the Tanna taught in the beginning: One may eat something that is accustomed to be eaten, and one may burn something that is accustomed to be burned. Something that is accustomed to be eaten, yes; but something that is not accustomed to be eaten, no. Who is the Tanna?"

hebrew_text: א"ר ירמיה הא מני ר"א היא דאמר מחשבין מאכילת אדם [לאכילת] מזבח ומאכילת מזבח [לאכילת] אדם
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: whose is this It is Rabbi Eliezer, who says one can intent from the consumption a person to the altar, and from the consumption altar to a person.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: This is the teaching of Rabbi Eliezer, for he said, "We calculate the value of feeding a person for the sake of feeding the altar, and feeding the altar for the sake of feeding a person."

hebrew_text: דתנן הקומץ את המנחה לאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שאין דרכו להקטיר כשר ור"א פוסל
human_translation: As we learned one who removes a handful from the meal offering to consume an item whose manner is not consume or to burn an item whose manner is not burn fit. And Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit,
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: "One who scoops up the meal offering to eat, something that is not its normal way of consumption, or to burn something that is not its normal way of burning, it is valid according to the Sages, but Rabbi Eliezer deems it invalid."

hebrew_text: אביי אמר אפי' תימא רבנן לא תימא הא לאכול ולאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול אלא אימא הא לאכול ולאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול
human_translation: Abaye said: You even say the Rabbis. do not say that to partake and to partake of an item whose manner is not partake Rather, say to partake and to partake an item whose manner partakes
llm_translation: Abaye said: Even if you say it is a Rabbinic prohibition, do not say "Do not eat and eat," rather say "Do not eat and eat something that is not normally eaten," but say "Do not eat and eat something that is normally eaten."

hebrew_text: ומאי קמ"ל הא בהדיא קתני לה לאכול כזית בחוץ וכזית למחר כזית למחר וכזית בחוץ כחצי זית בחוץ וכחצי זית למחר כחצי זית למחר וכחצי זית בחוץ פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: And what is teaching us? teaches explicitly: to partake of an olive-bulk outside and an olive-bulk the next day, an olive-bulk the next day and an olive-bulk outside half an olive-bulk outside and half an olive-bulk the next day, half an olive-bulk the next day and half an olive-bulk outside unfit but there is no karet .
llm_translation: And what does he teach us? This, explicitly it teaches for him, to eat an olive's bulk outside, and an olive's bulk for tomorrow, an olive's bulk for tomorrow, and an olive's bulk outside, like half an olive's bulk outside, and half an olive's bulk for tomorrow, half an olive's bulk for tomorrow, and half an olive's bulk outside, it is invalid, and does not have karet.

hebrew_text: הא תו למה לי אי לאכול ולאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול קמ"ל דמצטרף מרישא (דסיפא) שמעת מינה (דקתני כחצי זית בחוץ כחצי זית למחר פסול הא כחצי זית למחר וכחצי זית למחר פיגול)
human_translation: why do I also this If to partake and to partake of an item whose manner partakes teaches us that join together you learn from the first clause of the latter clause as it teaches: Half an olive-bulk outside and half an olive-bulk the next day, unfit. that half an olive-bulk the next day and half an olive-bulk the next day, piggul .
llm_translation: This is why do I need? If not to eat and to eat something that is not its way to eat, it teaches us that it combines from the beginning (of the end) (as we learn from the end (of the Mishnah) - if it was taught: like half an olive size outside, like half an olive size the next day, it is invalid. But if it is like half an olive size the next day, and like half an olive size the day after, it is Pigul).

hebrew_text: אי לאכול ולהקטיר (דהיא גופא קמ"ל) מדיוקא דרישא שמעת מינה
human_translation: If to consume and to burn, that teaches us the itself, from the inference of the first clause you learn
llm_translation: If not to eat and to burn (which is the same thing) teaches specifically the first part, infer from it.

hebrew_text: דהשתא מה לאכול ולאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול אמרת לא מצטרף לאכול ולהקטיר מיבעיא
human_translation: that Now if to partake and to partake of an item whose manner is not partake of you say do not join together, is it necessary to consume and to burn
llm_translation: Currently, what about eating and eating something that is not normally eaten, you said it does not combine to eat and to burn, the question arises.

hebrew_text: אין לאכול ולהקטיר איצטריכא ליה ס"ד אמינא התם הוא דלא כי אורחיה קמחשב
human_translation: Yes; it was necessary for to eat and to burn. enter your mind to say there, is as he intended not in accordance with its manner,
llm_translation: There is no eating and offering incense - it is necessary for him. In my opinion, I say there that it is not like his usual way of thinking.

hebrew_text: אבל הכא דבהאי כי אורחיה קמחשב ובהאי כי אורחיה קא מחשב אימא לצטרף קמ"ל:
human_translation: But here, where with regard to this he intends accordance with its manner, and with regard to this he intends in accordance with its manner, say they should join together, teaches us
llm_translation: But here, in this case, when he intends he calculates, and in that case, when he intends he calculates, say to join - teaches.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך כל המנחות
llm_translation: We will return to you, all the meal offerings.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הקומץ את המנחה לאכול שיריה או להקטיר קומצה למחר מודה רבי יוסי בזה שהוא פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת להקטיר לבונתה למחר רבי יוסי אומר פסול ואין בו כרת וחכ"א פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: who removes a handful from the meal offering to partake of its remainder or to burn its handful the next day, Rabbi Yosei concedes in this that it is piggul and he is liable karet for it. to burn its frankincense the next day, Rabbi Yosei says: unfit but does not include karet . And the Rabbis say: piggul and he is liable karet for
llm_translation: Mishnah: The one who gathers the handful of the meal-offering to eat its remnant or to offer its handful the next day, Rabbi Yosei concedes that in this case it is disqualified as Pigul, and one is liable to receive Karet for it. If one offers its frankincense the next day, Rabbi Yosei says it is invalid and does not incur Karet, while the sages say it is Pigul and one is liable to receive Karet for it.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו מה שינה זה מן הזבח אמר להן שהזבח דמו ובשרו ואימוריו אחד ולבונה אינה מן המנחה:
human_translation: said to what this differ from offering, said to as the offering, its blood, and its flesh, and its portions one But frankincense is not of the meal offering.
llm_translation: They said to him, "What difference is there between this and the sacrifice?" He said to them, "That the sacrifice, its blood, and its flesh, and its offerings are one, but frankincense is not from the meal offering."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ למה לי למיתנא מודה רבי יוסי בזו
human_translation: Why do I to teach Rabbi Yosei concedes in this
llm_translation: Gemara: Why do I need to teach that Rabbi Yossi concedes in this?

hebrew_text: משום דקא בעי למיתנא סיפא להקטיר לבונתה למחר ר' יוסי אומר פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: because he wants to teach the latter clause to burn its frankincense the next day, Rabbi Yosei says unfit, but does not include karet .
llm_translation: Because it requires to teach the latter part: to burn its frankincense the next day. Rabbi Yosei says: invalid, and it does not incur karet.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא טעמא דר' יוסי משום דקסבר אין מפגלין בחצי מתיר ואפי' רישא נמי
human_translation: lest you say the reason that Rabbi Yosei because he holds cannot render piggul with half of permitting factors. And even the first clause
llm_translation: What is the reason? Perhaps the reason of Rabbi Yosei is because he holds that one does not render something disqualified in the middle of its permissibility, even at the beginning as well.

hebrew_text: קמ"ל דבהא מודה:
human_translation: teaches us that in this concedes
llm_translation: It teaches us that in this case he admits:

hebrew_text: להקטיר לבונתה למחר רבי יוסי אומר פסול ואין בו כרת: אמר ר"ל אומר היה ר' יוסי אין מתיר מפגל את המתיר
human_translation: to burn its frankincense the next day, Rabbi Yosei says unfit but does not include karet . Reish Lakish says: Rabbi Yosei would say, A permitting factor does not render permitting factor piggul .
llm_translation: To burn its frankincense the next day, Rabbi Yosei says it is invalid and does not incur karet. Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Yosei used to say, "One who permits a disqualified offering does not permit it."

hebrew_text: וכן אתה אומר בשני בזיכי לבונה של לחם הפנים שאין מתיר מפגל את המתיר
human_translation: And you say the same with regard to two bowls of frankincense of the shewbread, that a permitting factor does not render permitting factor piggul ,
llm_translation: And so you say in the two "Bazichei Levonah" of the Bread of the Presence that one does not permit the one who permits the disqualified offering.

hebrew_text: מאי וכן אתה אומר מהו דתימא טעמא דרבי יוסי בלבונה משום דלאו מינה דמנחה היא אבל בשני בזיכי לבונה דמינה דהדדי נינהו אימא מפגלי אהדדי קמ"ל
human_translation: What And you say the same lest you say the reason that Rabbi Yosei in frankincense because it is not type as a meal offering. But with regard to two bowls of frankincense, which are of the same type as each other, say they do render one another piggul . teaches us
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "And similarly you say"? What might you say is the reason for Rabbi Yosei's opinion regarding frankincense, because it is not a component of the Mincha offering, but in the case of two types of frankincense, since they are similar to each other, one might say they render each other disqualified. This teaches us that they do not.

hebrew_text: ומי מצית אמרת טעמא דר' יוסי בלבונה לאו משום דלאו מינה דמנחה היא והא קתני סיפא אמרו לו מה שינתה מן הזבח אמר להן הזבח דמו ובשרו ואימוריו אחד ולבונה אינה מן המנחה
human_translation: And can you say the reason of Rabbi Yosei in frankincense is not due to that is not type as a meal offering? But isn’t it taught the latter clause said to what differ from offering, said to the offering, its blood, and its flesh, and its portions one but frankincense is not of the meal offering?
llm_translation: "And who is the one who raised the objection? Did you say the reason of Rabbi Yosei regarding frankincense is not because it is not part of the meal-offering? But doesn't the latter clause teach: They said to him, 'What did you change from the sacrifice?' He said to them, 'Its blood, flesh, and sacrificial portions are one, and frankincense is not part of the meal-offering.'"

hebrew_text: מאי אינה מן המנחה אינה בעיכוב מנחה דלאו כי היכי דמעכב להו קומץ לשירים דכמה דלאו מתקטר קומץ לא מיתאכלי שירים ה"נ מעכב לה ללבונה אלא אי בעי האי מקטר ברישא ואי בעי האי מקטר ברישא
human_translation: What is not of the meal offering? it is not of preclusion meal offering. that not just as handful precludes remainder, that as long as handful is not burned remainder may not be consumed, so too precludes the frankincense Rather, if wants, he burns this first, and if he wants, he burns that first,
llm_translation: What is it not from the meal offering, it is not with the holding back of the meal offering, for not like how it holds back for them the handful for the songs, as much as it is not being offered, the handful is not eaten, the songs are also held back for it, rather if this one wants to offer incense first, and if this one wants to offer incense first.

hebrew_text: ורבנן כי אמרינן אין מתיר מפגל את המתיר (גבי שחט אחד מן הכבשים לאכול מחבירו למחר דאמרת שניהם כשרים) ה"מ היכא דלא איקבעו בחד מנא אבל היכא דאיקבעו בחד מנא כחד דמי
human_translation: And the Rabbis, when we say a permitting factor does not render permitting factor piggul , with regard to slaughtered one of the lambs to partake of the other the next day. When you said both are fit, this statement where they were not fixed in one vessel. But where they were fixed in one vessel, considered like one
llm_translation: The Sages: When we say "one who permits does not permit another from eating pigul" (regarding the slaughter of one of the lambs to eat from it the next day, as you said both are valid), this applies where they were not designated for one count, but where they were designated for one count, it is considered as one.

hebrew_text: א"ר ינאי ליקוט לבונה בזר פסול מ"ט א"ר ירמיה משום הולכה נגעו בה קסבר הולכה שלא ברגל שמה הולכה והולכה בזר פסולה
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai says: collection frankincense by a non-priest, not valid What is the reason? Rabbi Yirmeya said: because conveying has touched it, holds conveying without leg is called conveying, and conveying by a non-priest not valid.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai: "A gathered offering of frankincense in a foreign vessel is invalid." What is the reason? Rabbi Yirmeya said in the name of Holakha: If one touched it, he holds that 'Holakha' means not by foot there, but 'Holakha' and 'Holakha' in a foreign vessel is invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר רב מרי אף אנן נמי תנינא זה הכלל כל הקומץ ונותן בכלי והמוליך והמקטיר
human_translation: Rav Mari said: We learn as well. This is the principle: anyone who removes the handful, or places in the vessel, who conveys who burns
llm_translation: Rav Mari said: We also learned: This is the principle: Anyone who gathers and places in a vessel, and who leads and who burns.

hebrew_text: בשלמא קומץ היינו שוחט מוליך נמי היינו מוליך מקטיר היינו זורק אלא נותן בכלי מאי קא עביד
human_translation: Granted, removal of the handful is slaughter conveying is also conveying burning is sprinkling But placing in the vessel, what is he performing
llm_translation: In truth, "kometz" is equivalent to "slaughtering," "molich" is also "molich," "maktir" is "burning incense," but "zorek" is "sprinkling." Rather, he places it in a vessel. What is he doing?

hebrew_text: אילימא משום דדמי לקבלה מי דמי התם ממילא הכא קא שקיל ורמי
human_translation: If we say because is comparable to collection Are comparable? There, by itself, here, takes and casts
llm_translation: If you say that it is because it is similar to receiving, is it similar? There, it is taken automatically, but here, he takes and throws.

hebrew_text: אלא משום דכיון דלא סגיא ליה דלא עבד לה עבודה חשובה היא על כרחיך משוי לה כקבלה ה"נ כיון דלא סגיא לה דלא עבד לה עבודה חשובה היא על כרחיך משוי לה כי הולכה
human_translation: Rather, due to Since it is not possible without performing is a significant rite, perforce considered like collection Here too, since it is not possible without performing is a significant rite perforce considered like conveying.
llm_translation: Rather, because since it is not sufficient for him that he did not perform a significant service, it is necessarily considered as if he did it intentionally. So too, since it is not sufficient for him that he did not perform a significant service, it is necessarily considered as if he did it intentionally.

hebrew_text: לא לעולם דדמי לקבלה ודקא קשיא לך התם ממילא הכא קא שקיל ורמי
human_translation: No, Actually, because it is comparable to collection And as for difficulty you there by itself, here he takes and casts
llm_translation: Not forever of blood for acceptance and that difficult for you there from itself here is taking and throwing.

hebrew_text: מכדי תרוייהו קדושת כלי הוא מה לי ממילא מה לי קא שקיל ורמי:
human_translation: Now both of them, sanctity of a vessel, What to me by itself or takes and casts
llm_translation: From both of them, it is the sanctity of the vessel. What do I need from "mimila"? What do I need from "ka shakil v'rami"?

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שחט שני כבשים לאכול אחת מן החלות למחר הקטיר שני בזיכין לאכול אחד מן הסדרים למחר רבי יוסי אומר אותו החלה ואותו הסדר שחישב עליו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת והשני פסול ואין בו כרת וחכמים אומרים זה וזה פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת:
human_translation: one slaughtered two lambs to partake of one of the loaves the next day, one burned two bowls to partake of one of the arrangements the next day, Rabbi Yosei says: That loaf and that arrangement of which he intended piggul and one is liable karet for and the second unfit, but there is no karet for And the Rabbis say: This and that piggul and one is liable karet for
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters two lambs, to eat one of them the next day, and offers two handfuls of frankincense, to eat one of them the next day. Rabbi Yosei says: That loaf and that handful for which he had intent of Pigul, he is liable to receive Karet for them, and the other is invalid and does not incur Karet. And the Sages say: Both this and that are considered Pigul, and he is liable to receive Karet for them.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב הונא אומר היה רבי יוסי פיגל בירך של ימין לא נתפגל הירך של שמאל מאי טעמא איבעית אימא סברא ואיבעית אימא קרא
human_translation: Rav Huna says: Rabbi Yosei would say, had intent of piggul with regard to the right thigh, the left thigh has not become piggul What is the reason If you wish, propose a logical argument, and if you wish, cite a verse.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said, Rabbi Yosei says: If the right thigh was disqualified, the left thigh was not disqualified. What is the reason? If you wish, say it is a logical deduction, and if you wish, say it is a verse.

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא סברא לא עדיפא מחשבה ממעשה הטומאה אילו איטמי חד אבר מי איטמי ליה כוליה ואיבעית אימא קרא (ויקרא ז, יח) והנפש האוכלת ממנו עונה תשא ממנו ולא מחבירו
human_translation: If you wish, propose a logical argument: intent is no stronger than an incident of ritual impurity, if one limb became impure, did the entire become impure? And if you wish, cite a verse “And the soul that eats of it shall bear his iniquity” “of it,” and not from the other
llm_translation: If you will say reasoning is not superior to action, impurity - if one limb becomes impure, does the entire body become impure? But if you will say a verse: "And the soul that eats from it shall bear his iniquity" (Leviticus 7:18) - it is from him and not from his fellow.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רב נחמן לרב הונא (וחכמים אומרים) לעולם אין בו כרת עד שיפגל בשתיהן בכזית בשתיהן אין באחת מהן לא
human_translation: Rav Naḥman raised an objection to Huna And the Rabbis say there is never karet unless one has intent of piggul with regard to an olive-bulk of both of them, with regard to both of them, yes, with regard to one of them, no,
llm_translation: Rav Nahman raised an objection to Rav Huna: "And the sages say, 'There is never karet unless one consumes a k'zayit of each of them; if one consumes only one of them, there is no karet.'"

hebrew_text: מני אילימא רבנן אפילו באחת מהן נמי אלא פשיטא רבי יוסי אי אמרת בשלמא חד גופא הוא מש"ה מצטרף
human_translation: whose If we say the Rabbis even with regard to one of them, Rather, obvious Rabbi Yosei. granted, if you say one body, due to that combined
llm_translation: From where is this derived? If you say it is derived from the Rabbis, even with one of them it is prohibited. Rather, it is obvious. Rabbi Yosei, if you say it is derived from one entity, then it combines.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת תרי גופי נינהו מי מיצטרפי
human_translation: But if you say are two bodies, would combine
llm_translation: Rather, if you say they are two separate entities, do they combine?

hebrew_text: הא מני רבי היא דתניא השוחט את הכבש לאכול חצי זית מחלה זו וכן חבירו לאכול חצי זית מחלה זו רבי אומר אומר אני שזה כשר
human_translation: whose is this It is Rabbi as it is taught one who slaughters the lambs to consume half an olive-bulk from this loaf and similarly, the other to consume half an olive-bulk from that loaf Rabbi says: I say that this valid,
llm_translation: This is the teaching of Rabbi: as it was taught in a Baraita, one who slaughters the lamb to eat half an olive-bulk of this illness, and likewise his fellow to eat half an olive-bulk of this illness, Rabbi says: I say that this is valid.

hebrew_text: טעמא דאמר חצי חצי אבל אמר כזית משתיהן מצטרף
human_translation: the reason that said a half a half, But said an olive-bulk from both of them, combine
llm_translation: Reason of saying half half but if he said like an olive from both combine

hebrew_text: ורבי אליבא דמאן אי אליבא דרבנן אפי' באחת מהן נמי אי אליבא דר' יוסי הדרא קושיין לדוכתיה
human_translation: And Rabbi in accordance with whose If in accordance with of the Rabbis even with regard to one of them, if in accordance with of Rabbi Yosei, our difficulty returns to its place:
llm_translation: And Rabbi, according to whom? If according to the Rabbis, even with one of them also; if according to Rabbi Yosei, he raises difficulties against himself.

hebrew_text: לעולם אליבא דרבנן ולא תימא עד שיפגל בשתיהן אלא [אימא עד שיפגל] בשניהן ואפילו באחת מהן
human_translation: Actually, in accordance with of the Rabbis. And do not say unless one has intent of piggul with regard to both of them [ bishteihen ], Rather, With regard to both of them [ bishneihen ], and even one of the
llm_translation: Forever the words of the Rabbis, and do not say until he becomes proficient in both of them, rather say until he becomes proficient in both of them, and even in one of them.

hebrew_text: ולאפוקי מדר' מאיר דאמר מפגלין בחצי מתיר קמ"ל דלא
human_translation: And to exclude of Rabbi Meir, who says One renders piggul of half a permitting factor, teaches us that not
llm_translation: And to differentiate from Rabbi Meir who said, "Invalidates in the middle, permits," it teaches us that not.

hebrew_text: אי הכי מאי לעולם אי אמרת בשלמא בשתיהן ובשניהן ורבי יוסי היא ולאפוקי מדר"מ ומדרבנן קאתי היינו דקאמר לעולם
human_translation: If so, what never Granted, if you say with regard to both of the and both of the is Rabbi Yosei, and it comes to exclude of Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis, this is that states: never
llm_translation: If so, what is the meaning of "forever"? If you say it means in both of them and in both of them, then Rabbi Yosei is included, and this is to exclude the opinions of Rabbi Meir and the Rabbis. That is what it means when it says "forever."

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת רבנן ולאפוקי מדר"מ מאי לעולם
human_translation: But if you say the Rabbis and to exclude of Rabbi Meir, what never
llm_translation: Rather, if you say the Rabbis, and not R. Meir, what is the meaning of "forever"?

hebrew_text: ועוד הא אמר רב אשי ת"ש רבי אומר משום רבי יוסי פיגל בדבר הנעשה בחוץ פיגל בדבר הנעשה בפנים לא פיגל
human_translation: And furthermore, didn’t Rav Ashi say: Come hear Rabbi says in the name of Rabbi Yosei render piggul with regard to a matter that is performed outside he has rendered piggul . with regard to a matter that is performed inside he has not rendered piggul .
llm_translation: And furthermore, here is what Rav Ashi said: "Come and hear: Rabbi says in the name of Rabbi Yosei, 'Pigul applies to something done outside, but does not apply to something done inside.'"

hebrew_text: כיצד היה עומד בחוץ ואמר הריני שוחט ע"מ להזות מדמו למחר לא פיגל שמחשבה בחוץ בדבר הנעשה בפנים היה עומד בפנים ואמר הריני מזה ע"מ להקטיר אימורין למחר ולשפוך שיריים למחר לא פיגל שמחשבה בפנים בדבר הנעשה בחוץ
human_translation: How so? he was standing outside and said: I hereby slaughter with the intention of sprinkling its blood tomorrow he has not rendered piggul . that an intention outside with regard to a matter that is performed inside, was standing inside and said: I hereby sprinkle in order to burn sacrificial portions tomorrow and to pour out remainder tomorrow, he has not rendered piggul , as an intention inside with regard to a matter that is performed outside.
llm_translation: How was he standing outside and said, "Behold, I am slaughtering in order to sprinkle its blood tomorrow"? It is not disqualified due to improper intent outside for something that is done inside. He was standing inside and said, "Behold, I am offering the sacrifices tomorrow and pouring out the wine libations tomorrow." It is not disqualified due to improper intent inside for something that is done outside.

hebrew_text: היה עומד בחוץ ואמר הריני שוחט ע"מ לשפוך שיריים למחר ולהקטיר אימורין למחר פיגל שמחשבה בחוץ בדבר הנעשה בחוץ
human_translation: But he was standing outside and said: I hereby slaughter with the intention to pour out remainder tomorrow, or to burn sacrificial portions tomorrow, he has rendered piggul , as an intention outside with regard to a matter that is performed outside.
llm_translation: He was standing outside and said, "Behold, I will slaughter in order to pour out the remnants tomorrow, and to offer the sacrifices tomorrow." It is disqualified due to the intention being outside for something that is done outside.

hebrew_text: לשפוך שיריים לאיפגולי מאי אילימא לאיפגולי דם דם מי מיפגל והתנן אלו דברים שאין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול הקומץ והלבונה והקטורת ומנחת כהנים ומנחת נסכים ומנחת כהן משיח והדם
human_translation: to pour the remaining what could be rendered piggul ? If we say blood could be rendered piggul , Does blood become piggul ? But didn’t we learn These are items for which one is not liable due to piggul : The handful; the frankincense; the incense; the meal offering of priests; the meal offering libations the meal offering of anointed priest; and the blood?
llm_translation: To pour songs to the Eifugolei. What does it mean to Eifugolei? Not Eifugolei blood, whose blood is Eifugol? And we learned: These are the things that one is not liable for due to Pigul - the handful, the frankincense, the incense, the meal-offering of the priests, the meal-offering of libations, the meal-offering of the anointed priest, and the blood.

hebrew_text: אלא פשיטא לאפגולי בשר השתא ומה התם דלא חשיב ביה בבשר גופיה א"ר יוסי מיפגל הכא דחשיב ביה בזבח גופיה לא כ"ש דפיגל בירך ימין פיגל בירך שמאל
human_translation: Rather, obvious meat could be rendered piggul . Now And if there, where he did not have intent with regard to the meat itself, Rabbi Yosei said is rendered piggul ; here, where he has intent of the offering itself, not all the more so that he had intent of piggul with regard to the right thigh, he has rendered the left thigh piggul
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious that the law of invalid offerings due to improper intent applies to meat now. And what is the difference between the two cases? There, where it is not considered valid in the meat itself, as Rabbi Yosei said: It is invalid. Here, where it is considered valid in the sacrifice itself, all the more so is it invalid. If one invalidated the right thigh, it is invalid; if one invalidated the left thigh, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: ועוד האמר רבינא תא שמע הקומץ את המנחה לאכול שיריה או להקטיר קומצה למחר מודה רבי יוסי בזו שפיגל וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: And furthermore, doesn’t Ravina say: Come hear one who removes a handful from the meal offering to partake of its remainder or to burn its handful the next day, Rabbi Yosei concedes in this that he has rendered piggul and he is liable karet for it.
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbina said: Come and hear! If one gathered the meal-offering to eat its leftovers or to burn its handful the next day, Rabbi Yosei concedes that in this case it is disqualified, and one is liable to receive karet.

hebrew_text: להקטיר קומצה לאיפגולי מאי אילימא לאיפגולי קומץ קומץ מי מיפגל והתנן אלו דברים שאין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול הקומץ כו' אלא פשיטא לאיפגולי שיריים השתא ומה התם דלא חשיב בהו בשיריים גופיה
human_translation: to burn its handful, what could be rendered piggul ? If we say the handful could be rendered piggul , does the handful become piggul ? But didn’t we learn These are items for which one is not liable due to piggul : The handful, etc. Rather, obvious remainder could be rendered piggul . Now And if there, where he did not have intent with regard to remainder itself,
llm_translation: To offer a handful, will it become disqualified? What is the case? If it will become disqualified, does a handful become disqualified? But we learned: "These are the things that are not liable for Pigul, the handful, etc." Rather, it is obvious that it will not become disqualified. Now, regarding the handful itself, what is the difference?

hebrew_text: מיפגלי הכא דחשיב בהו בזביחה גופה לא כ"ש
human_translation: is rendered piggul ; here, where he has intent of offering itself, not all the more so
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Mipgalei hakka dechashiv behu bizvicha gufa lo kash."

hebrew_text: אלא א"ר יוחנן ה"ט דרבי יוסי הכתוב עשאן גוף אחד והכתוב עשאן שני גופין גוף אחד דמעכבי אהדדי שני גופין דאמר רחמנא הא לחודה עבידא והא לחודה עבידא
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan said: this is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei: The verse renders one body, and the verse renders them two bodies. one body that they preclude one another, two bodies, as the Merciful One states: This is prepared alone and that is prepared alone,
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: The opinion of Rabbi Yosei is that the verse made them one body, and the verse made them two bodies. One body impedes the other, two bodies, as the Merciful One said: This one for its own purpose, and this one for its own purpose.

hebrew_text: ערבינהו מתערבין דהכתוב עשאן גוף אחד פלגינהו מיפלגי דהכתוב עשאן שני גופין
human_translation: mixed them they are mixed as the verse renders them one body. he separated them they are separated as the verse renders them two bodies.
llm_translation: They mixed them, they mix, as the verse made them one body. They separated them, they separate, as the verse made them two bodies.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי יוחנן פיגל בלחמי תודה מהו במנחת מאפה מהו תנא ליה רב תחליפא ממערבא וכן אתה אומר בלחמי תודה וכן אתה אומר במנחת מאפה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a dilemma: had intent of piggul with regard to loaves of a thanks offering, what is with regard to baked meal offerings, what is Rav Taḥlifa from the West, taught him And likewise you say with regard to the bread of a thanks offering, and likewise you say with regard to a baked meal offering,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan inquired: What is the status of Pigul in the loaves of thanksgiving offering? What is the ruling in the meal offering of a baker? Rav Tachlifa from the West taught him: And similarly you say in the loaves of thanksgiving offering, and similarly you say in the meal offering of a baker.

hebrew_text: ת"ר בשעת שחיטה חישב לאכול חצי זית ובשעת זריקה חישב לאכול חצי זית פיגול מפני ששחיטה וזריקה מצטרפין
human_translation: The Sages taught at the time of slaughter had intent to consume half an olive-bulk and at the time of sprinkling he had intent to consume half olive-bulk piggul , as slaughter and sprinkling combine
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: At the time of slaughter, he intended to eat half an olive's worth, and at the time of sprinkling, he intended to eat half an olive's worth. It is considered disqualified due to being "pigul" because slaughter and sprinkling combine.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי שחיטה וזריקה דתרווייהו מתירין אין קבלה והולכה לא ואיכא דאמרי הנך דמרחקן וכ"ש הני דמקרבן
human_translation: Some say slaughter and sprinkling, as both of them are permitting factors yes, collection and conveying not And some say those that are distant all the more so these that are close
llm_translation: There are those who say that slaughter and sprinkling, both permit; receiving and walking, no. And there are those who say, those that are distant, and all the more so, those that are close.

hebrew_text: איני והא תני לוי ארבע עבודות אין מצטרפות לפיגול שחיטה וזריקה קבלה והולכה אמר רבא ל"ק הא רבי הא רבנן
human_translation: Is that so, But Levi teaches four rites do not combine to piggul , Slaughter and sprinkling, collection and conveying. Rava said: not difficult; this Rabbi that the Rabbis.
llm_translation: I am not, but didn't Levi teach: Four Avodot do not combine for Pigul - Shechitah, Zerikah, Kabalah, and Holakhah? Rava said: This is not so; this is Rabbi's opinion, and this is the Rabbis' opinion.

hebrew_text: דתניא השוחט את הכבש לאכול חצי זית מחלה זו וכן חבירו לאכול חצי זית מחלה זו רבי אומר אומר אני שזה כשר
human_translation: As it is taught one who slaughters the lambs to consume half an olive-bulk from this loaf and similarly, the other to consume half an olive-bulk from that loaf Rabbi says: I say that this valid.
llm_translation: As it was taught: One who slaughters the lamb to eat half an olive's worth of this illness, and likewise his fellow to eat half an olive's worth of this illness, Rabbi says, "I say that this is valid."

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי אימר דשמעת ליה לרבי חצי מתיר וחצי אכילה כולו מתיר וחצי אכילה מי שמעת ליה
human_translation: Abaye said to say that you have heard that Rabbi half a permitting factor and half consumption, an entire permitting factor, and half consumption, did you hear him
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Say that you heard from Rabbi, half permitting and half forbidding - all permitting; and half forbidding - did you hear from him?

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא בר רב חנן לאביי ואי אית ליה לרבי כולו מתיר וחצי אכילה לגזור חצי מתיר וחצי אכילה אטו כולו מתיר וחצי אכילה דהא רבי יוסי גזר ורבנן גזרי
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥanan said to Abaye: But if Rabbi is of an entire permitting factor and half consumption Let him decree half a permitting factor and half consumption due to an entire permitting factor and half consumption as Rabbi Yosei decreed and the Rabbis decreed
llm_translation: Rava bar Rav Hanan said to Abaye, "And if he has Rabbi, he entirely permits it, and half eating to decree half permits it and half eating, now entirely permits it and half eating, for Rabbi Yosei decreed and the Rabbis decreed."

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי גזר דתנן להקטיר לבונתה למחר רבי יוסי אומר פסול ואין בו כרת וחכ"א פיגול וחייבין עליה כרת
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei decreed as we learned to burn its frankincense the next day, Rabbi Yosei says: unfit, but does not include karet . And the Rabbis say: piggul and one is liable karet for
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei decreed, as we learned in a Mishnah: "To burn its frankincense the next day." Rabbi Yosei says: It is invalid, and it does not incur karet. And the sages say: It is considered pigul, and one is liable to receive karet for it.

hebrew_text: ורבנן נמי גזרי דתנן פיגל בקומץ ולא בלבונה בלבונה ולא בקומץ ר"מ אומר פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת וחכ"א אין בו כרת עד שיפגל בכל המתיר
human_translation: And the Rabbis decreed as well, as we learned intent of piggul during the handful but not during the frankincense, during the frankincense but not during the handful, Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one is liable karet for and the Rabbis say: There is no karet for unless he has intent of piggul during the entire permitting factor,
llm_translation: The Sages also decreed as we learned in a Mishnah: Pigul with the handful, but not with the frankincense; with the frankincense, but not with the handful. Rabbi Meir says: Pigul, and one is liable for it with excision. And the sages say: There is no excision until he renders it pigul in all that permits it.

hebrew_text: א"ל הכי השתא בשלמא התם גזר רבי יוסי קומץ דלבונה אטו קומץ דמנחה
human_translation: said to How can be compared? Granted there, Rabbi Yosei decreed the handful of frankincense due to the handful of the meal offering,
llm_translation: He said to him: So now, granted, there Rabbi Yosei decreed regarding the handful of frankincense of the Levonah offering, but did he decree regarding the handful of meal offering?

hebrew_text: רבנן גזרי קומץ אטו קומץ דמנחת חוטא ולבונה אטו לבונה הבאה בבזיכין
human_translation: the Rabbis decreed handful due to the handful of the meal offering of a sinner. And frankincense due to frankincense that comes in bowls
llm_translation: The sages decreed regarding a handful. Is it the handful of the sin offering, and frankincense? Is it the frankincense that comes with the meal offering?

hebrew_text: כבשים נמי כבש אטו כבש חבירו
human_translation: lambs as well lamb due to the other lamb,
llm_translation: Sheep also sheep? Rather sheep its fellow.

hebrew_text: בזך אטו בזך חבירו
human_translation: bowl due to the other bowl,
llm_translation: In the merit of Atu, in the merit of his friend.

hebrew_text: אלא הכא מי איכא חצי מתיר וחצי אכילה בעלמא דליקום וליגזר
human_translation: But here, is there in general half a permitting factor and half of consumption that will arise and decree
llm_translation: Rather, here, is there such a thing as half-permitted and half-eaten in general that he should establish a decree?

hebrew_text: הכי נמי מסתברא דטעמא דרבנן מש"ה הוא דקתני סיפא מודים חכמים לר"מ במנחת חוטא ומנחת קנאות שאם פיגל בקומץ שפיגול וחייבין עליה כרת שהקומץ הוא המתיר
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable that the reasoning of the Rabbis is due to that that is taught the latter clause The Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir in the meal offering of a sinner and the meal offering of jealousy that if one had intent of piggul during the handful, piggul and one is liable karet for as the handful is the permitting factor.
llm_translation: So too it is logical that the reason of the Rabbis is as such, for it is taught in the latter part: the Sages concede to Rabbi Meir regarding the meal-offering of a sinner and the meal-offering of jealousy, that if he had intent with the handful, it is considered as if he had intent with the entire offering, and they are liable to receive karet for it, because the handful is what permits it.

hebrew_text: הא למה לי למיתנא כלל פשיטא מי איכא מתיר אחרינא אלא לאו הא קמ"ל דטעמא דקומץ משום דאיכא קומץ דמנחת חוטא דדמי ליה:
human_translation: Why do I to teach at all? obvious is there another permitting factor Rather, is it not this teaches us, that the reason that handful because there is the handful of the meal offering of a sinner, which is similar to it
llm_translation: This is why I need to teach the general rule - it is obvious, is there another permitted one? Rather, no, this is what it teaches us: the reason for the handful is because there is a handful similar to the sin offering.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נטמאת אחת מן החלות או אחד מן הסדרים רבי יהודה אומר שניהם יצאו לבית השריפה שאין קרבן ציבור חלוק וחכמים אומרים הטמא בטומאתו והטהור יאכל:
human_translation: one of the loaves or one of the arrangements became ritually impure, Rabbi Yehuda says: Both must be taken to the place of burning as no communal offering is divided. And the Rabbis say: The impure one in its impurity and the pure one shall be eaten.
llm_translation: Mishnah: If one of the loaves or one of the rows became impure, Rabbi Yehuda says: both of them are taken out to the burning place, for a communal offering is not divided. And the Sages say: the impure one remains in its impurity, and the pure one may be eaten.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ א"ר אלעזר מחלוקת לפני זריקה אבל לאחר זריקה דברי הכל הטמא בטומאתו והטהור יאכל
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: dispute before sprinkling But after the sprinkling, everyone agrees the impure one in its impurity and the pure one shall be eaten.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Elazar said: Dispute before the sprinkling, but after the sprinkling, everyone agrees: the impure remains in its impurity, and the pure may eat.

hebrew_text: ולפני זריקה במאי פליגי אמר רב פפא בציץ מרצה על אכילות קא מיפלגי
human_translation: And before sprinkling with regard to what do they disagree? Rav Pappa said: They disagree with regard to frontplate effects acceptance for consumed
llm_translation: Before the throwing, what do they argue about? Rav Papa said: They argue about the flower of the pan that falls on the food.

hebrew_text: רבנן סברי הציץ מרצה על אכילות ורבי יהודה סבר אין הציץ מרצה על אכילות
human_translation: The Rabbis hold the frontplate effects acceptance for consumed And Rabbi Yehuda holds the frontplate does not effect acceptance for consumed
llm_translation: The sages hold: "The Tzitz (forehead plate of the High Priest) is effective for eating." And Rabbi Yehuda holds: "The Tzitz is not effective for eating."

hebrew_text: א"ל רב הונא בריה דרב נתן לרב פפא והא עולין דהציץ מרצה על העולין ופליגי
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said to Rav Pappa: But ascend that the frontplate effects acceptance for that ascend and disagree
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to Rav Pappa, "But the ascending offerings that the priest inspected from the ramp, and they disputed."

hebrew_text: דתניא נטמא אחד מן הבזיכין רבי יהודה אומר שניהם יעשו בטומאה לפי שאין קרבן ציבור חלוק וחכמים אומרים הטמא בטומאתו והטהור בטהרתו
human_translation: As it is taught one of the bowls became impure, Rabbi Yehuda says both of them may be performed in impurity, as no communal offering is divided, And the Rabbis say: The impure one in its impurity and the pure one in its purity.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: If one of the priests became impure from the sacrifices, Rabbi Yehuda says: Both of them should perform the service in a state of impurity, because a communal offering is not divided. And the Sages say: The impure one should serve in his impurity, and the pure one in his purity.

hebrew_text: ועוד אמר רב אשי ת"ש ר' יהודה אומר אפילו שבט אחד טמא וכל השבטים טהורין יעשו בטומאה לפי שאין קרבנות ציבור חלוק והכא מאי הציץ מרצה איכא
human_translation: And furthermore, Rav Ashi said: Come hear Rabbi Yehuda says: Even one tribe is ritually impure and all the tribes are pure, may perform in impurity, as no communal offerings are divided. But here, what is there the frontplate effects acceptance?
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rav Ashi said: Come and hear! Rabbi Yehuda says, even if one tribe is impure, and all the tribes are pure, they shall perform the Passover offering in a state of impurity, because communal sacrifices are not divided. And here, what is the meaning of "HaTzitz Meratzeh"? There is a dispute.

hebrew_text: ועוד האמר רבינא ת"ש נטמאת אחת מן החלות או אחת מן הסדרין רבי יהודה אומר שניהם יצאו לבית השריפה לפי שאין קרבן ציבור חלוק וחכמים אומרים הטמא בטומאתו והטהור יאכל
human_translation: And furthermore, doesn’t Ravina say: Come hear one of the loaves or one of the arrangements became ritually impure, Rabbi Yehuda says: Both must be taken to the place of burning, as no communal offering is divided. And the Rabbis say: The impure one in its impurity and the pure one may be eaten.
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbina said: Come and hear: If one of the loaves became impure or one of the rows, Rabbi Yehuda says: both of them are taken out to be burned, because a communal offering cannot be divided. And the Sages say: The impure one remains in its impurity, and the pure one may be eaten.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא לפי שאין הציץ מרצה על אכילות מיבעי ליה אלא א"ר יוחנן למוד ערוך הוא בפיו של רבי יהודה שאין קרבן ציבור חלוק:
human_translation: And if it is so, should have because the frontplate does not effect acceptance for consumed Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It is a settled tradition in the mouth of Rabbi Yehuda that no communal offering is divided,
llm_translation: And if it is so, because the forehead-plate does not facilitate eating, what does he need it for? Rather, Rabbi Yochanan said: It is a learned arrangement in the mouth of Rabbi Yehuda that the communal offering is not divided.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ התודה מפגלת את הלחם והלחם אינו מפגל את התודה כיצד שחט את התודה לאכול ממנה למחר היא והלחם מפוגלין לאכול מן הלחם למחר הלחם מפוגל והתודה אינה מפוגלת
human_translation: The thanks offering renders the loaves piggul but the loaves do not render the thanks offering piggul . How so? one slaughtered the thanks offering, to partake of it the next day, and the loaves are rendered piggul . to partake of the loaves the next day, the loaves are rendered piggul and the thanks offering is not piggul .
llm_translation: Mishnah: The thanksgiving offering invalidates the bread, but the bread does not invalidate the thanksgiving offering. How so? If one slaughtered the thanksgiving offering to eat from it the next day, it and the bread become invalidated. To eat from the bread the next day, the bread becomes invalidated, but the thanksgiving offering does not become invalidated.

hebrew_text: הכבשים מפגלין את הלחם והלחם אינו מפגל את הכבשים כיצד השוחט את הכבשים לאכול מהן למחר הם והלחם מפוגלין לאכול את הלחם למחר הלחם מפוגל והכבשים אינן מפוגלין:
human_translation: the lambs render the loaves piggul , but the loaves do not render the lambs piggul . How so? one slaughtered the lambs, to partake of them the next day, and the loaves are rendered piggul . to partake of the loaves the next day, the loaves are rendered piggul and the lambs are not piggul .
llm_translation: The sheep render the bread invalid, but the bread does not render the sheep invalid. How does one slaughter the sheep to eat from them the next day? They and the bread are rendered invalid to eat the bread the next day. The bread is rendered invalid, but the sheep are not rendered invalid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מ"ט אילימא משום דרב כהנא דאמר רב כהנא מנין ללחמי תודה שנקראו תודה שנאמר (ויקרא ז, יב) והקריב על זבח התודה חלות
human_translation: What is the reason If we say due to that Rav Kahana As Rav Kahana says: From where the loaves of a thanks offering are called a thanks offering? that is stated “Then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanks offering loaves”
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Is it because of Rav Kahana, for Rav Kahana said, "From where do we derive the loaves of thanksgiving are called thanksgiving? As it is stated (Leviticus 7:12), 'And he shall offer for the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened loaves.'"

hebrew_text: אי הכי איפכא נמי הא לא קשיא לחם איקרי תודה תודה לא איקרי לחם
human_translation: If so, the opposite as well, This not difficult, loaves are called a thanks offering, a thanks offering is not called loaves.
llm_translation: If so, the opposite is also true. This is also not difficult: bread is called "thanksgiving," thanksgiving is not called "bread."

hebrew_text: אלא הא דקתני הכבשים מפגלין את הלחם והלחם אינו מפגל את הכבשים לחם היכא אשכחן דאיקרי כבשים אלא (לאו) היינו טעמא לחם גלל תודה ואין תודה גלל דלחם לחם גלל דכבשים ואין כבשים גלל דלחם
human_translation: But that which teaches: The lambs render the loaves piggul but the loaves do not render the lambs piggul , where do we find that loaves are called lambs? Rather, is it not this is the reason bread on account of [ gelal ] thanks offering, but thanks offering is not on account of bread, bread are on account of lambs, and lambs are not on account of bread.
llm_translation: Rather, this that it was taught: the lambs render the bread disqualified, but the bread does not render the lambs disqualified. Where do we find bread being called lambs? Rather, this is not the reason: bread is considered like a thanksgiving offering, and a thanksgiving offering does not render bread disqualified, because bread is considered like bread, not like lambs, and lambs are not considered like bread.

hebrew_text: וצריכי דאי אשמעינן תודה התם הוא דכי מפגל בלחם לא מפגלא תודה משום דלא הוזקקו זה לזה בתנופה אבל כבשים דהוזקקו זה לזה בתנופה אימא כי מפגל בלחם ליפגלי נמי כבשים צריכא:
human_translation: And are necessary, as, had taught us a thanks offering, It is there, that when one renders the loaves piggul the thanks offering is not rendered piggul , because they were not bound to one another by waving, But lambs, which were bound to one another by waving, say when he renders the bread piggul , lambs should be rendered piggul as well. necessary
llm_translation: "And it is necessary, for if we were to hear 'thanksgiving' there, it is because when one invalidates a sacrifice with regard to the bread, he does not invalidate a thanksgiving offering, because they were not dependent on each other through waving. But with regard to sheep, which were dependent on each other through waving, one might say that if he invalidates a sacrifice with regard to the bread, he should also invalidate the sheep. This is necessary."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה ר"א מרב השוחט את התודה לאכול כזית ממנה ומלחמה למחר מהו לאיפגולי תודה לא מיבעיא לי השתא כולו מלחמה לא מיפגלא ממנה ומלחמה מיבעיא
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar raised a dilemma before Rav: one slaughters the thanks offering to consume an olive-bulk from it and from its loaves the next day, what is I do not raise the dilemma with regard to rendering thanks offering piggul , Now the entire from its loaves is not rendered piggul , from and from its loaves, necessary
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Eliezer: If one slaughters the thanksgiving offering to eat an olive's worth of it today and the remainder tomorrow, what is the law? Regarding the thanksgiving offering, I do not require it now. The entire offering is not disqualified from it, and regarding the remainder, it is required.

hebrew_text: כי קא מיבעיא לי לאיפגולי לחם מי מצטרפה תודה לאיפגולי ללחם או לא
human_translation: when I raise the dilemma, to rendering the loaves piggul , does thanks offering combine to render the loaves piggul , or not?
llm_translation: When it is asked: If one needs to separate the bread from the water, does the thanksgiving offering combine with the bread or not?

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אף בזו הלחם מפוגל והתודה אינה מפוגלת ואמאי לימא קל וחומר ומה (תודה) המפגל אין מתפגל הבא לפגל ולא פיגל אינו דין שלא יתפגל
human_translation: said to Even in this the loaves are rendered piggul and the thanks offering is not rendered piggul . But why Let us say a fortiori And if thanks offering, which render piggul , is not rendered piggul , which come to render piggul , but do not render piggul , is it not logical that the should not be rendered piggul ?
llm_translation: He said to him, "Even with this bread, if it becomes disqualified, the thanksgiving offering does not become disqualified. And why not say a fortiori: Just as the thanksgiving offering that is already disqualified does not become disqualified if one intends for it to become disqualified, so too, a regular offering that is not disqualified should not become disqualified."

hebrew_text: ומי אמרינן קל וחומר כי האי גוונא והתניא מעשה באחד
human_translation: And do we say an a fortiori in this way? But isn’t it taught an incident involving one
llm_translation: And did we say a fortiori reasoning in this case? And it was taught in a Baraita: There was an incident with one...

hebrew_text: שזרע כרמו של חבירו סמדר ובא מעשה לפני חכמים ואסרו את הזרעים והתירו את הגפנים ואמאי לימא קל וחומר הוא ומה האוסר אינו נאסר הבא לאסור ולא אסר אינו דין שלא יתאסר
human_translation: who planted the vineyard of an another budding, and incident came before the Sages and they deemed the seeds prohibited but they deemed the vines permitted. But why Let say a fortiori And if that which renders prohibited, is not prohibited, which come to render prohibited but did not render prohibited, is it not logical that they should not be rendered prohibited?
llm_translation: If one sows the vineyard of his fellow with sycamore seeds, and a case came before the sages, and they prohibited the seeds but permitted the vines, why not say it is a fortiori reasoning? Just as the one who prohibits does not render the existing prohibited, so too, the one who does not prohibit should not render it prohibited.

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם קנבוס ולוף אסרה תורה (דתנן היתה שדהו זרועה קנבוס ולוף לא יהא זורע על גביהם שהן עושות לשלש שנים) שאר זרעים מדרבנן הוא דאסירי האי דעביד איסורא קנסוה רבנן האי דלא עביד איסורא לא קנסוה רבנן אבל הכא לימא ק"ו
human_translation: How can be compared? There, hemp and arum prohibited Torah as we learned one’s field was sown hemp and arum, he should not sow above them, as they produce three years. Other seeds are prohibited by rabbinic this who committed a transgression the Sages penalized him that who did not commit a transgression, the Sages did not penalize him. But here, let us say an a fortiori
llm_translation: So now there, hemp and lupine, the Torah prohibited. (As we learned in a Mishnah: If one's field is sown with hemp and lupine, one may not sow other seeds on top of them, as they improve the soil for three years.) Other seeds, it is Rabbinically prohibited, for this one who does a prohibition, the Rabbis penalize him; this one who does not do a prohibition, the Rabbis do not penalize him. But here, let us say it is an equal comparison.

hebrew_text: ואיכא דמתני לה אכבשים בעא מיניה רבי אלעזר מרב השוחט את הכבשים לאכול כזית מהן ומלחמן מהו
human_translation: And there are those who teach with regard to the lambs Rabbi Elazar raised a dilemma before Rav: one slaughters the lambs to consume an olive-bulk from them and from their loaves what is
llm_translation: And there are those who teach it: Akvashim. Rabbi Elazar inquired of him: One who slaughters the akvashim to eat a kezayit of them, and their salt, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: לאיפגולי כבשים לא קא מיבעיא לי השתא כולו מלחם לא מפגלי מהן ומלחמן מיבעיא כי קא מיבעיא לי לאיפגולי לחם מי מצטרפי כבשים לאיפגולי ללחם או לא
human_translation: I do not raise the dilemma with regard to rendering lambs piggul Now an entire from the loaves are not rendered piggul , from them and from their loaves, is necessary when I raised the dilemma, with regard to rendering the loaves piggul . Does lambs combine to render the loaves piggul or not?
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Regarding whether sheep that are disqualified do not require salt, now the entire offering does not disqualify from them, and their salt does not require. What is the question? Whether sheep that are disqualified do not combine with the bread, or not."

hebrew_text: א"ל אף בזו הלחם מפוגל והכבשים אינן מפוגלין ואמאי לימא ק"ו ומה המפגל אינו מתפגל הבא לפגל ולא פיגל אינו דין שלא יתפגל
human_translation: said to Even in this the loaves are rendered piggul and the lambs are not rendered piggul . But why Let us say a fortiori And if that which renders piggul , is not rendered piggul , which come to render piggul , but do not render piggul , is it not logical that should not be rendered piggul ?
llm_translation: He said to him: Even with this bread it is disqualified, but the lambs are not disqualified. And why not say they are equal? Just as the one that is disqualified does not become disqualified, so too one that comes to disqualify but does not disqualify is not considered as if it had become disqualified.

hebrew_text: ומי אמרינן ק"ו כי האי גונא והתניא מעשה באחד שזרע כרמו של חבירו סמדר וכו' ואמאי לימא ק"ו מה האוסר אינו נאסר הבא לאסור ולא אסר אינו דין שלא יתאסר
human_translation: And do we say an a fortiori of this kind? But isn’t it taught an incident involving one who planted the vineyard of his friend budding, But why Let say a fortiori And that which renders prohibited, is not prohibited, which come to render prohibited but did not render prohibited, is it not logical that should not be rendered prohibited?
llm_translation: And do we say "is it comparable" because this case, and it was taught: There was an incident with one who planted his friend's vineyard with sycamore trees, etc. And why should he say "is it comparable"? What one forbids, the one who comes to forbid is not forbidden, and what one does not forbid, the one who forbids is not judged that it should not be forbidden.

hebrew_text: הכי השתא התם קנבוס ולוף אסרה תורה שאר זרעים מדרבנן הוא דאסירי האי דעבד איסורא קנסוה רבנן דלא עבד איסורא לא קנסוה רבנן אבל הכא לימא ק"ו
human_translation: How can be compared? There, hemp and arum prohibited Torah Other seeds are prohibited by rabbinic this who committed a transgression the Sages penalized him this who did not commit a transgression, the Sages did not penalize him. But here, let us say an a fortiori
llm_translation: So now there, hemp and lupine, the Torah prohibited other seeds, it is Rabbinically prohibited. This one who does a prohibition, the Rabbis penalize him. If one does not do a prohibition, the Rabbis do not penalize him. But here, let us say it is equal.

hebrew_text: מאן דמתני לה אתודה כל שכן אכבשים ומאן דמתני לה אכבשים כבשים הוא דהוזקקו זה לזה לתנופה אבל תודה דלא הוזקקה זה לזה בתנופה לא
human_translation: The one who teaches with regard to the thanks offering all the more so with regard to the lambs But the one who teaches with regard to the lambs was lambs as they were bound to one another by waving, But a thanks offering as they were not bound to one another by waving, not
llm_translation: One who teaches her testimony, certainly it is valid with rams. And one who teaches rams, it means rams, that they were scrutinized against each other for waving. But testimony that was not scrutinized against each other for waving, no.

hebrew_text: רבי אבא זוטי בעי לה הכי בעא מיניה ר' אלעזר מרב השוחט את הכבש לאכול כזית מחבירו למחר מהו חבירו כבש משמע ולא מפגל או דלמא לחם משמע ומפגל ליה
human_translation: Rabbi Abba the small raises the dilemma this Rabbi Elazar raised a dilemma before Rav: one slaughters the lambs to consume an olive-bulk from the other the next day, what is the other, mean lamb, and is not rendered piggul , Or perhaps means loaves, and renders it piggul ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba Zuti asked him thus: Rabbi Elazar, the son of Rabbi Shimon, if one slaughters a lamb to eat a kezayit of it tomorrow, what is the law regarding his fellow? Does his fellow lamb imply that it is not disqualified, or perhaps it implies bread, and it disqualifies it?

hebrew_text: אמר ליה תניתוה שחט אחד מן הכבשים לאכול ממנו למחר הוא פיגול וחבירו כשר לאכול מחבירו למחר שניהם כשרים אלמא חבירו כבש משמע דלמא דפריש ואמר חבירו כבש:
human_translation: said to You learned one slaughtered one of the lambs to partake of it the next day, that piggul and the other fit. to partake of the other the next day, both are fit, Evidently, The other, means lamb. Perhaps where he clarifies and says: The other lamb,
llm_translation: He said to him: "You taught that if one slaughters one of the lambs to eat from it tomorrow, it is deemed pigul, but its counterpart is fit to be eaten from tomorrow. If one eats from his counterpart tomorrow, both are fit. This implies that his counterpart is a lamb, indicating that perhaps he separated and said, 'his counterpart is a lamb.'"

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הזבח מפגל את הנסכים משקדשו בכלי דברי ר"מ הנסכים אינן מפגלים את הזבח כיצד השוחט את הזבח לאכול ממנו למחר הוא ונסכיו מפוגלין להקריב נסכיו למחר הנסכים מפוגלין הזבח אינו מפוגל:
human_translation: The offering renders the libations piggul from that they were consecrated in the vessel, the statement of Rabbi Meir. The libations do not render the offering piggul . How so? one who slaughters the offering to partake of it the next day, and its libations are rendered piggul . to sacrifice its libations the next day, the libations are rendered piggul , the offering is not piggul .
llm_translation: Mishnah: The sacrifice renders the libations disqualified. When consecrated in a vessel, according to the words of Rabbi Meir, the libations do not render the sacrifice disqualified. How so? If one slaughters the sacrifice to eat from it the next day, he and his libations become disqualified. To offer his libations the next day, the libations become disqualified, but the sacrifice does not become disqualified.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר נסכי בהמה חייבין עליהן משום פיגול מפני שדם הזבח מתירן לקרב דברי ר"מ
human_translation: The Sages taught libations of an animal one is liable for them due to piggul , as the blood of the offering permits them to be offered the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Sages taught: Animal libations are liable for Pigul, because the blood of the sacrifice permits them to be offered. This is the statement of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו לר"מ והלא אדם מביא זבחו היום ונסכיו עד י' ימים אמר להן אף אני לא אמרתי אלא בבאין עם הזבח א"ל אפשר לשנותו לזבח אחר
human_translation: said to Rabbi Meir: But a person may bring his offering today and libations from now until ten days said to them: I, too, spoke only about come with the offering said to him: it is possible to switch for another offering.
llm_translation: They said to Rabbi Meir, "But doesn't a person bring his sacrifice and libations for ten days?" He said to them, "I also only said this when they come with the sacrifice." They said to him, "Is it possible to change it to a different sacrifice?"

hebrew_text: אמר רבא קסבר ר"מ הוקבעו בשחיטה כלחמי תודה
human_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Meir holds are fixed at slaughter, like the loaves of a thanks offering,
llm_translation: Rava said: R. Meir holds that they were established through ritual slaughter, like the loaves of thanksgiving-offering.

hebrew_text: ת"ר לוג שמן של מצורע חייבין עליו משום פיגול מפני שדם אשם מתירו לבהונות דברי רבי מאיר אמרו לו לרבי מאיר והלא אדם מביא אשמו היום ולוגו מיכן ועד י' ימים
human_translation: the Sages taught: log of oil of the leper one is liable for it due to piggul as blood permits it to the thumb and big toe the statement of Rabbi Meir. said to Rabbi Meir: But a person may bring his guilt offering today and log from now until ten days
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A log of oil of a metzora, one is liable for it due to pigul, because the blood of the guilt-offering permits it for the priests. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. They said to Rabbi Meir: But does not a person bring his guilt-offering today, and his log from here until ten days.
