hebrew_text: אמר להן אף אני לא אמרתי אלא בבא עם האשם [א"ל] אפשר לשנותו לאשם אחר אמר רבא קסבר רבי מאיר הוקבעו בשחיטה כלחמי תודה:
human_translation: said to them: I, too, spoke only about comes with the guilt it is possible to switch for another guilt offering. Rava said: Rabbi Meir holds is fixed at slaughter like the loaves of a thanks offering,
llm_translation: He said to them, "I also did not say except in the case of 'coming with a guilt-offering.'" He said to him, "Is it possible to change it to a different guilt-offering?" Rava said: Rabbi Meir holds that they were established through slaughter, like the loaves of thanksgiving-offering.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ פיגל בקומץ ולא בלבונה בלבונה ולא בקומץ ר' מאיר אומר פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת וחכמים אומרים אין בו כרת עד שיפגל בכל המתיר
human_translation: render piggul during the handful but not during the frankincense, during the frankincense but not during the handful, Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one liable karet And the Rabbis say: There is no karet in this unless he renders piggul during the entire permitting factor,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Pigul with the handful, but not with the frankincense; with the frankincense, but not with the handful. Rabbi Meir says: Pigul, and one is liable for it with karet. And the Sages say: There is no karet in it until it becomes pigul in all that permits it.

hebrew_text: ומודים חכמים לר' מאיר במנחת חוטא ובמנחת קנאות שאם פיגל בקומץ שהוא פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת שהקומץ הוא המתיר
human_translation: And the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Meir in a meal offering of a sinner and in a meal offering of jealousy that if one had intent of piggul during the handful, that piggul and one is liable karet as the handful is the permitting factor.
llm_translation: The Sages concede to Rabbi Meir regarding the Minchat Chotei and the Minchat Kena'ot, that if he had intent for Pigul with the handful, it is Pigul, and one is liable to receive karet for it, as the handful is what permits it.

hebrew_text: שחט אחד מן הכבשים לאכול ב' חלות למחר הקטיר אחד מן הבזיכין לאכול ב' סדרים למחר ר"מ אומר פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת וחכמים אומרים אין בו כרת עד שיפגל בכל המתיר
human_translation: one slaughtered one of the lambs to partake of two loaves the next day, one burned one of the bowls to partake of two arrangements the next day, Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one is liable karet and the Rabbis say: There is no karet unless he has intent of piggul during the entire permitting factor.
llm_translation: One slaughters from the lambs to eat two loaves for the next day; one burns from the birds to eat two orders for the next day. Rabbi Meir says: Pigul, and one is liable for it with karet. And the sages say: There is no karet in it until it becomes pigul in all that permits.

hebrew_text: שחט אחד מן הכבשים לאכול ממנו למחר הוא פיגול וחבירו כשר לאכול מחבירו למחר שניהם כשרים:
human_translation: one slaughtered one of the lambs to partake of it the next day, that piggul and the other is a fit to partake of the other the next day, both are fit
llm_translation: One slaughters one of the lambs to eat from it the next day - it is disqualified as "pigul," but its counterpart is fit to be eaten the next day. Eating from one's counterpart the next day is permissible; both are fit.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב מחלוקת שנתן את הקומץ בשתיקה ואת הלבונה במחשבה
human_translation: Rav says: dispute when he placed the handful in silence, and the frankincense with intent
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav said, the dispute is when one placed the handful in silence and the frankincense in thought.

hebrew_text: אבל נתן הקומץ במחשבה ואת הלבונה בשתיקה דברי הכל פיגול שכל העושה על דעת ראשונה הוא עושה ושמואל אמר עדיין הוא מחלוקת
human_translation: But he placed the handful with intent and the frankincense in silence, all agree piggul , as anyone who performs performs in accordance with initial intent. And Shmuel says: is still a dispute
llm_translation: But if he placed the handful with intent and the frankincense in silence, everyone agrees it is disqualified as Pigul, for whoever acts not in accordance with the initial intent, his act is null. And Samuel said, "It is still a matter of dispute."

hebrew_text: יתיב רבא וקאמר לה להא שמעתא איתיביה רב אחא בר רב הונא לרבא בד"א בקמיצה ובמתן כלי ובהילוך
human_translation: Rava sat and stated this halakha Rav Aḥa bar Rav Huna raised an objection to Rava In what is this statement, said? during the removal of the handful, or during the placement of vessel, or during the conveying
llm_translation: Rava was sitting and saying to her, to that teaching. Rav Acha bar Rav Huna raised an objection to Rava: In what case? In the case of taking a handful, and in the case of giving a vessel, and in the case of walking.

hebrew_text: [אבל] בא לו להקטרה נתן את הקומץ בשתיקה ואת הלבונה במחשבה את הקומץ במחשבה ואת הלבונה בשתיקה ר"מ אומר פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת וחכמים אומרים אין בו כרת עד שיפגל בכל המתיר
human_translation: comes to the burning placed the handful in silence and the frankincense with intent the handful with intent and the frankincense in silence, Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one is liable karet for and the Rabbis say: There is no karet unless he has intent of piggul during the entire permitting factor.
llm_translation: But came to him to burn, he placed the handful in silence and the frankincense in thought, the handful in thought and the frankincense in silence. Rabbi Meir says: Pigul, and liable to receive karet upon it, and the Sages say: There is no karet in it until it becomes pigul in all that permits.

hebrew_text: קתני מיהא נתן את הקומץ במחשבה ואת הלבונה בשתיקה ופליגי
human_translation: In any event, teaches placed the handful with intent and the frankincense in silence, and disagree
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "He placed the handful with intent, and the frankincense quietly, and they disagree."

hebrew_text: אימא וכבר נתן את הלבונה בשתיקה מעיקרא שתי תשובות בדבר חדא דהיינו קמייתא ועוד התניא אח"כ
human_translation: Say and he had already placed the frankincense in silence from the outset, There are two refutations of statement. One that this is the first And furthermore, isn’t it taught After
llm_translation: Say, and indeed he already placed the frankincense in silence initially, two answers in one matter, that is the first part, and furthermore it was taught afterwards.

hebrew_text: תרגמא רב חנינא בב' דיעות
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina interpreted of two intentions,
llm_translation: Rav Hanina translated in two ways.

hebrew_text: ת"ש בד"א בדמים הניתנין על מזבח החיצון
human_translation: Come hear In what is this statement, said? in blood that is placed on the external altar,
llm_translation: Come and hear: In what case? In the case of blood that is placed on the outer altar.

hebrew_text: אבל דמים הניתנין על מזבח הפנימי כגון מ"ג של יום הכיפורים ואחת עשרה של פר כהן משוח ואחת עשרה של פר העלם דבר של ציבור פיגל בין בראשונה בין בשניה ובין בשלישית ר"מ אומר פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת וחכ"א אין בו כרת עד שיפגל בכל המתיר
human_translation: But blood placed on the inner altar, for example, forty-three of Yom Kippur, and the eleven of bull for anointed priest, and eleven of bull for an unwitting communal sin, render piggul , whether in the first whether in the second or whether in the third Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one is liable karet for its And the Rabbis say: There is no karet unless he render piggul during the entire permitting factor.
llm_translation: But bloods the placed on the inner altar such as the bullock of Yom Kippur and eleven of the anointed priest's bullock and eleven of the bullock of the community, a matter of public offering, if it becomes disqualified, whether in the first, second, or third offering, Rabbi Meir says it is disqualified and one is liable for it to receive karet, and the sages say it does not have karet until it becomes disqualified in all that permits it.

hebrew_text: קתני מיהא פיגל בין בראשונה בין בשניה ובין בשלישית ופליגי
human_translation: In any event, teaches: render piggul , whether in the first whether in the second or whether in the third and disagree
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Pigul is valid whether in the first, second, or third offering, and they dispute.

hebrew_text: וכי תימא ה"נ בשתי דעות הניחא למאן דאמר בפר ואפי' בדמו של פר אלא למ"ד בפר ולא בדמו של פר מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: And if you would say here too, of two intentions, This works out well according to the one who says With bull” even with the blood of a bull, But according to the one who says “with bull,” but not with the blood of a bull, what can be said?
llm_translation: And if you will say, "So too in two opinions," it is fitting according to the one who says "in the cow," and even in the blood of the cow. Rather, according to the one who says "in the cow" and not in the blood of the cow, what can be said?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הכא במאי עסקי' כגון שפיגל בראשונה ושתק בשניה ופיגל בשלישית דאמרי' אי ס"ד כל העושה על דעת ראשונה הוא עושה מיהדר פיגולי בשלישית למה לי
human_translation: Rava said: here, we are dealing with where had intent of piggul during the first and was silent during the second and had intent of piggul during the third we say: If enters your mind anyone who performs performs in accordance with his initial intention, why do I repeat piggul during the third
llm_translation: Rava said: Here, what are they dealing with? For example, if he had intent for disqualification in the first instance, remained silent in the second, and had intent for disqualification in the third, for they say: If you think that anyone who acts with the intent of the first instance, he reverts the disqualifications to the third, why do I need it?

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אשי מידי שתק קתני אלא אמר רב אשי הכא במאי עסקי' כגון שפיגל בראשונה ובשניה ובשלישית דאמרי' אי ס"ד כל העושה על דעת ראשונה הוא עושה מיהדר פגולי בשניה (ובשלישית) למה לי
human_translation: Rav Ashi objects to this Does teach silent? Rather, Rav Ashi said: Here we are dealing with where he had intent of piggul during the first, second, and third we say: If enters your mind anyone who performs performs in accordance with his initial intention, why do I repeat piggul during the second and third
llm_translation: Rav Ashi objects to him: immediately he was silent. Rather, Rav Ashi said: Here, what are we dealing with? For example, if it was disqualified in the first, second, and third offering. For they say: If you might think, anyone who acts with the intention of the first, he is making it valid in the second (and third). Why do I need it?

hebrew_text: והא בין בין קתני קשיא:
human_translation: But teaches: Whether whether a difficulty.
llm_translation: And this, between between, it is difficult.

hebrew_text: אמר מר ר"מ אומר פגול וחייבין עליו כרת מכדי כרת לא מיחייב עד שיקרבו כל המתירין
human_translation: The Master said Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one is liable karet for Now one is not liable karet unless all the permitting factors have been sacrificed,
llm_translation: Said Mar, Rabbi Meir says: "Piggul" and they are liable for it with karet. From where is karet not liable until all the permit?

hebrew_text: דאמר מר ירצה כהרצאת כשר כך הרצאת פסול מה הרצאת כשר עד שיקרבו כל המתירין אף הרצאת פסול עד שיקרבו כל המתירין
human_translation: As the Master said “It shall be accepted” the acceptance of a disqualified like the acceptance of a valid just as acceptance of a valid unless all permitting factors have been sacrificed, so too acceptance of a disqualified unless all permitting factors have been sacrificed.
llm_translation: The Master said: If one wishes, like the slaughtering of a valid animal, so shall it be considered valid; but if one wishes, like the slaughtering of an invalid animal, so shall it be considered invalid. Just as the slaughtering of a valid animal is considered valid only when all the permit-granters draw near, so too the slaughtering of an invalid animal is considered invalid only when all the permit-granters draw near.

hebrew_text: והאי כיון דחשיב בה בפנים פסליה כי מדי בהיכל מיא בעלמא הוא דקא מדי
human_translation: And this since he had intent with regard to it inside he has disqualified it. when he sprinkles in the Sanctuary, he is merely sprinkling water,
llm_translation: And this, since it is considered inside, its invalidation is like water, for it is merely water in the Temple.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה משכחת לה בארבעה פרים וארבעה שעירים
human_translation: Rabba said: You find it in four bulls and four goats,
llm_translation: Rabbah said: "She is acquired with four bulls and four he-goats."

hebrew_text: רבא אמר אפילו תימא פר אחד ושעיר אחד לפגולי מרצי
human_translation: Rava said: You even say one bull and one goat, with regard to rendering piggul , effect acceptance,
llm_translation: Rava said: Even if you were to say "one bull and one goat" for the invalid offerings of the Temple service.

hebrew_text: ארבעים ושלש והתניא ארבעים ושבע לא קשיא הא כמ"ד מערבין לקרנות והא כמ"ד אין מערבין
human_translation: forty-three But isn’t it taught forty-seven not difficult. This in accordance with the one who says mixes on the corners And that in accordance with the one who says does not mix
llm_translation: Forty and three. And it was taught: Forty and seven. There is no difficulty. Here it is referring to according to the opinion that we combine the offerings for the corners, and here it is referring to according to the opinion that we do not combine the offerings.

hebrew_text: והתניא ארבעים ושמונה לא קשיא הא כמ"ד שירים מעכבין הא כמ"ד שירים לא מעכבין:
human_translation: But isn’t it taught forty-eight not difficult. This in accordance with the one who says remainder is indispensable, That in accordance with the one who says remainder is not indispensable.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Forty-eight, it is not difficult. This one, according to the one who says that songs are prohibitive, and this one, according to the one who says that songs are not prohibitive.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו פיגל בהולכה מהו
human_translation: a dilemma was raised before had intent of piggul during conveying what is
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: "What is the ruling regarding Pigul in the case of walking?"

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יוחנן הולכה כקמיצה וריש לקיש אמר הולכה כהקטרה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: conveying like removing of the handful. And Reish Lakish says: conveying like burning.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "Holechet (going) is like a kemitza (handful)." And Reish Lakish said: "Holechet is like haketoret (incense)."

hebrew_text: בשלמא לריש לקיש איכא נמי הולכה דלבונה אלא לרבי יוחנן מ"ט
human_translation: Granted, Reish Lakish, there is also the conveying of frankincense. But for Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the reason
llm_translation: In accordance with Reish Lakish, there is also the concept of "holakhah" regarding the moon. But according to Rabbi Yochanan, what is the reason?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא קסבר רבי יוחנן כל עבודה שאינה מתרת עבודה חשובה היא לפגל עליה בפני עצמה
human_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yoḥanan holds any rite that does not permit it is a significant rite with regard to rendering piggul on account of it, by itself.
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yochanan holds that any service that is not dependent on another service is considered significant, and if one invalidates it, it becomes disqualified on its own.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי הרי שחיטת אחד מן הכבשים דעבודה שאינה מתירתה ופליגי
human_translation: Abaye said to But the slaughter of one of the lambs which a rite that does not permit and disagree
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "Behold, the slaughtering of one of the lambs for the Temple service, which does not permit it, and they dispute."

hebrew_text: דתנן שחט אחד מן הכבשים לאכול שתי חלות למחר הקטיר אחד מן הבזיכין לאכול שני סדרים למחר ר"מ אומר פגול וחייבין עליו כרת וחכ"א אין בו כרת עד שיפגל בכל המתיר
human_translation: As we learned one slaughtered one of the lambs to partake of two loaves the next day, one burned one of the bowls to partake of two arrangements the next day, Rabbi Meir says: piggul and one is liable karet for and the Rabbis say: There is no karet unless he has intent of piggul during the entire permitting factor.
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: If one slaughters one of the lambs to eat two loaves the next day, or he burns one of the birds to eat two orders the next day, Rabbi Meir says: it is disqualified as "pigul" and one is liable to receive karet for it. And the sages say: there is no karet until it becomes "pigul" in all that permits it.

hebrew_text: א"ל מי סברת לחם בתנור קדוש שחיטת כבשים מקדשא ליה והבא לקדש כבא להתיר דמי
human_translation: said to Do you maintain bread sanctified in the oven, the slaughter of the lambs sanctifies and that comes to sanctify is considered like comes to permit.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Who do you think, bread in the oven, holy, the slaughtering of lambs, sanctifies him, and one who brings to the sanctuary, as if he brings to permit the blood."

hebrew_text: מתיב רב שימי בר אשי אחרים אומרים הקדים מולים לערלים כשר הקדים ערלים למולים פסול
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi raises an objection Aḥerim say: circumcised preceded the uncircumcised valid. uncircumcised preceded circumcised disqualified.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi raised an objection: Others say, "If one circumcises before converting, it is valid; if one converts before circumcising, it is invalid."

hebrew_text: וקיי"ל דבחצי מתיר פליג  א"ל מי סברת דם בצואר בהמה קדוש דם סכין מקדשא ליה והבא לקדש כבא להתיר דמי
human_translation: And we maintain that disagree with regard to half a permitting factor said to Do you maintain blood sanctified inside the neck of animal? knife sanctifies blood, and that which comes to sanctify is considered like comes to permit.
llm_translation: And the opinion of Rabbi Yishmael the son of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean is that in the case of a half-slaughtered animal, he disputes. He said to him, "Do you think that the blood in the neck of a consecrated animal sanctifies the knife, and one who brings it to sanctify is like one who permits its blood?"

hebrew_text: תא שמע בד"א בקמיצה ובמתן כלי ובהילוך
human_translation: Come hear In what is this statement, said? during the removal of the handful, or during the placement vessel, or during the conveying.
llm_translation: Come and hear: In the case of a "kemitza," and in the case of giving a vessel, and in the case of walking.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו הילוך דהקטרה לא הילוך דמתן כלי
human_translation: What, is it not conveying for burning No; conveying of placement vessel
llm_translation: What is the difference between the walking of the incense offering and the walking of placing the vessels?

hebrew_text: אי הכי במתן כלי ובהילוך בהילוך ובמתן כלי מיבעי ליה הא לא קשיא תני הכי
human_translation: If so, During the placement a vessel or during the conveying? It should have During the conveying or during the placement a vessel. This not difficult, teach that
llm_translation: If so, in giving a vessel, and in walking, in walking, and in giving a vessel, it should require a verse? This is not difficult. It was taught thus:

hebrew_text: בא לו להקטרה בא לו להולכה מיבעי ליה הא לא קשיא כיון דהולכה צורך דהקטרה היא קרי לה הקטרה
human_translation: he comes to the burning should have he comes to the conveying This not difficult; since conveying is for the purpose of burning, it is called burning
llm_translation: He came to offer incense, he came to walk. He needs it. This is not difficult. Once he walks, the need for incense arises, it is called incense.

hebrew_text: אלא נתן את הקומץ בשתיקה הוליך מיבעי ליה קשיא:
human_translation: But placed the handful in silence, it should have he carried a difficulty.
llm_translation: Rather, he placed the handful in silence, he should have asked a question:

hebrew_text: הקטיר שומשום לאכול שומשום עד שכלה קומץ כולו רב חסדא ורב המנונא ורב ששת חד אמר פיגול וחד אמר פסול וחד אמר כשר
human_translation: burned a sesame to consume a sesame until the entire handful Rav Ḥisda, Rav Hamnuna, and Rav Sheshet. One says piggul , and one says disqualified and one says fit.
llm_translation: To burn sesame to eat sesame until finished handful whole Rav Ḥisda and Rav Hamnuna and Rav Sheshet one said pigul and one said invalid and one said valid.

hebrew_text: לימא מ"ד פיגול כר"מ ומ"ד פסול כרבנן ומ"ד כשר כרבי
human_translation: Let us say the one who says piggul in accordance with Rabbi Meir, And the one who says disqualified in accordance with the Rabbis, And the one who says fit in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: Let us say: One who holds that Pigul is like Rabbi Meir, and one who holds that it is invalid is like the Rabbis, and one who holds that it is valid is like Rabbi Yehudah.

hebrew_text: ממאי דלמא עד כאן לא קאמר ר' מאיר התם אלא דחישב בשיעורו אבל הכא דלא חישב בשיעורו לא
human_translation: From where Perhaps Rabbi Meir states only there, where he had intent with regard to its measure. But here, where he did not have intent with regard to its measure, not
llm_translation: From what source does Rabbi Meir perhaps derive the law? Until here only did Rabbi Meir say there, but if one did not calculate according to its measure here then it is not valid.

hebrew_text: ועד כאן לא קא אמרי רבנן התם אלא דלא חישב ביה בכוליה מתיר אבל הכא דחישב ביה בכוליה מתיר ה"נ דפגיל
human_translation: And the Rabbis state only there, where he did not have intent concerning it during the entire permitting factor, But here, where he had intent during the entire permitting factor, he has indeed rendered piggul ,
llm_translation: Until here, the Rabbis did not say there, except that he did not consider it at all permissible. But here, since he considered it entirely permissible, so too, it is revealed.

hebrew_text: ועד כאן לא קא אמר רבי התם אלא דלא הדר מלייה מאותה עבודה אבל הכא דהדר מלייה מאותה עבודה הכי נמי דפסיל
human_translation: And Rabbi states only there, where he did not subsequently complete from the same rite, But here, where he subsequently completed from the same rite, he has indeed disqualified
llm_translation: Until here, not said Rabbi there except that not returned words from that work but here that returned words from that work so also invalid.

hebrew_text: אלא מ"ד פיגול דברי הכל מאן דאמר פסול דברי הכל מאן דאמר כשר דברי הכל
human_translation: Rather, the one who says piggul all agree the one who says disqualified all agree the one who says fit all agree
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says "Pigul," everyone agrees; according to the one who says "Pasul," everyone agrees; according to the one who says "Kosher," everyone agrees.

hebrew_text: מאן דאמר פיגול דברי הכל קסבר דרך אכילה בכך ודרך הקטרה בכך ומ"ד פסול דברי הכל קסבר (אין) דרך אכילה בכך ואין דרך הקטרה בכך והואי לה כמנחה שלא הוקטרה ומאן דאמר כשר דברי הכל קסבר דרך הקטרה בכך ואין דרך אכילה בכך:
human_translation: The one who says all agree piggul maintains the manner of consumption in such and the manner of burning is in such And the one who says all agree disqualified holds the manner of consumption not in such And the manner of burning not in such and it is like a meal offering was not burned And the one who says all agree fit holds the manner of burning in such but the manner of consumption not in such
llm_translation: One who says Pigul, everyone agrees, holds that the manner of eating is like this and the manner of burning incense is like this. And one who says Pasul, everyone agrees, holds that the manner of eating is not like this and the manner of burning incense is not like this, and it is like a Mincha that was not burned. And one who says Kosher, everyone agrees, holds that the manner of burning incense is like this and the manner of eating is not like this.

hebrew_text: אמרי
human_translation: say
llm_translation: They said:

hebrew_text: חריפי דפומבדיתא הקטרה מפגלת הקטרה ואפילו לרבנן דאמרי אין מפגלין בחצי מתיר ה"מ היכא דחישב ביה בשירים ולבונה במילתא קיימא אבל הכא דחישב לה בלבונה כמה דחישב ביה בכוליה מתיר דמי
human_translation: the sharp of Pumbedita: Burning renders burning piggul , And even according to the Rabbis, who say one does not render piggul with half of a permitting factor, this statement where he had intent during the remainder and frankincense stands intact, But here, when he had intent with regard to the frankincense it is considered as though he had intent with regard to the entire permitting factor.
llm_translation: Fiery coals of Pompey's fire, invalidates the incense. And even according to the Rabbis who say that one does not invalidate in half, here it is different because he intended with the coals and the frankincense is secondary. But here, where he intended with the frankincense as much as he intended with all of it, it is considered valid.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אף אנן נמי תנינא זה הכלל כל הקומץ ונותן בכלי והמוליך והמקטיר לאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שדרכו להקטיר חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פגול וחייבין עליו כרת
human_translation: Rava said: We learn as well This is the principle: anyone who removes the handful, or places in the vessel, who conveys who burns to partake of an item whose manner partakes or to burn an item whose manner burns outside its area, unfit but there is no karet . beyond its time, piggul and one is liable karet on account of it.
llm_translation: Rava said: We also learned: This is the general rule: Anyone who gathers and places in a vessel, and who carries and offers to eat something that is normally eaten, and to offer something that is normally offered, outside of its proper place is invalid. There is no karet penalty for this, but if it is done outside of its proper time, it is considered pigul, and one is liable to receive karet for it.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו הקטרה דומיא דהנך מה הנך בין לאכול בין להקטיר אף הקטרה בין לאכול בין להקטיר
human_translation: What, is it not burning similar to these, just as these, whether to partake or to burn so too burning, whether to partake or to burn
llm_translation: What is the difference between the incense offering and these? Just as these, whether to eat or to burn, so too the incense offering, whether to eat or to burn.

hebrew_text: לא הנך בין לאכול בין להקטיר הקטרה לאכול אין להקטיר לא
human_translation: No, these, whether to partake or to burn burning, to partake yes, to burn not
llm_translation: Not these whether to eat whether to offer incense to eat not to offer incense not

hebrew_text: יתיב רב מנשיא בר גדא קמיה דאביי ויתיב וקא אמר משמיה דרב חסדא אין הקטרה מפגלת הקטרה ואפילו לר"מ דאמר מפגלין בחצי מתיר
human_translation: Rav Menashya bar Gadda sat before Abaye, and sitting he said in the name of Rav Ḥisda: Burning does not render burning piggul , And even according to Rabbi Meir, who says renders piggul during half a permitting factor,
llm_translation: Rav Menasheh bar Gada was sitting before Abaye, and he was sitting and saying in the name of Rav Ḥisda: The incense does not render the incense invalid, and even according to Rabbi Meir who says that they render it invalid in half the quantity.

hebrew_text: ה"מ היכא דחישב בהו בשירים דקומץ מתיר דידהו אבל הכא דקומץ לאו מתיר דלבונה הוא לא מצי מפגל ביה
human_translation: this statement where he had intent during the remainder as the handful their permitting factor. But here, as the handful is not a permitting factor of the frankincense, cannot be rendered piggul through it.
llm_translation: These are the words: "Where one intended with them in songs, if he crumpled it, he permits it for himself. But here, where he crumpled it, he does not permit it, for it is not for its intended purpose, he cannot render it disqualified."

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי עני מרי משמיה דרב א"ל אין איתמר נמי אמר רב חסדא אמר רב אין הקטרה מפגלת הקטרה
human_translation: Abaye said to Answer me, my Master, in the name of Rav? said to Yes. was also stated Rav Ḥisda says Rav says: Burning does not render burning piggul .
llm_translation: He said to him, "Abaye, my master, in the name of Rav," he said to him, "Yes, it was also stated: Rav Ḥisda said in the name of Rav, the incense does not render the incense invalid."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יעקב בר אידי משמיה דאביי אף אנן נמי תנינא שחט אחד מן הכבשים לאכול ממנו למחר הוא פיגול וחבירו כשר לאכול מחבירו למחר שניהם כשרין מ"ט לאו משום דכיון דלאו מתיר דידיה הוא לא מצי מפגל ביה
human_translation: Rav Ya’akov bar Idi said in the name of Abaye: We learn as well one slaughtered one of the lambs to partake of it the next day, that piggul and the other fit. to partake of the other the next day, both are fit. What is the reason? not due to the fact that since is not a permitting factor of it cannot render piggul ?
llm_translation: Rav Yaakov bar Idi said in the name of Abbaye: We also learned: If one slaughters one of the lambs to eat from it the next day, it is considered pigul, but its fellow is fit to be eaten the next day. If one eats from its fellow the next day, both are fit. What is the reason? Not because since it does not permit itself, it cannot render the other pigul.

hebrew_text: לא התם הוא דלא איקבע בחד מנא אבל הכא דאיקבע בחד מנא כי חד דמו
human_translation: No; It is there, as it was not fixed in one vessel But here, as were fixed in one vessel they are considered like one
llm_translation: Not there it is that not established in one count but here that established in one count like one their name

hebrew_text: אמר רב המנונא הא מילתא אבלע לי רבי חנינא ותקילא לי ככוליה תלמודאי הקטיר קומץ להקטיר לבונה (ולבונה) לאכול שירים למחר פגול
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: Rabbi Ḥanina helped me internalize this matter, and to me it is equivalent to all my learning, one burned handful to burn frankincense and frankincense to partake of remainder the next day, piggul .
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: This matter is difficult for me, Rabbi Chanina swallowed it, and it became light for me. Talmud scholars, he offered a handful to offer incense, to offer frankincense, to eat the leftovers the next day - it is disqualified.

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל אי הקטרה מפגלת הקטרה קמ"ל לימא הקטיר קומץ להקטיר לבונה אי מפגלין בחצי מתיר קמ"ל לימא הקטיר קומץ לאכול שירים למחר אי תרוייהו (אתא) קמ"ל לימא הקטיר קומץ להקטיר לבונה ולאכול שירים למחר
human_translation: What teaching us? If is teaching us burning renders burning piggul , let him say: burned handful to burn frankincense, If is teaching us renders piggul during half of a permitting factor, let him say: burned handful to partake of remainder the next day, If is coming teach us both of let him say: burned handful to burn frankincense or to partake of remainder the next day,
llm_translation: What is the verse teaching us? If the incense is disqualified, the incense teaches us to say: One who offers a handful to offer incense, if they become disqualified in the middle, the verse teaches us to say: One who offers a handful to eat the leftovers the next day. If both scenarios come, the verse teaches us to say: One who offers a handful to offer incense, to offer incense, to offer frankincense, and to eat the leftovers the next day.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אדא בר אהבה לעולם קסבר אין הקטרה מפגלת הקטרה ואין מפגלין בחצי מתיר ושאני הכא דפשטא ליה מחשבה בכולה מנחה
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Actually, holds burning does not render burning piggul , And does not render piggul during half of a permitting factor, But is different here, as intent extended over the entire meal offering,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: Always he holds that the incense does not render the incense disqualified, and one does not disqualify with half of the permitted amount. And it is different here, for thought is effective throughout the entire meal offering.

hebrew_text: תני תנא קמיה דרב יצחק בר אבא הקטיר קומץ לאכול שירים לדברי הכל פגול והא מיפלג פליגי אלא אימא לדברי הכל פסול
human_translation: a tanna taught before Rav Yitzḥak bar Abba: one burned handful to partake of remainder everyone agrees piggul . But don’t disagree Rather, say Everyone agrees disqualified,
llm_translation: A Tanna taught before Rav Yitzchak bar Abba: One who offered a handful of meal offering to eat it - according to everyone it is disqualified. But they dispute this - rather say, according to everyone it is invalid.

hebrew_text: ולימא ה"ז פגול ור"מ היא תנא דברי הכל אתניוה פיגול בפסול מיחלף ליה הרי זה בדברי הכל לא מיחלף ליה:
human_translation: But let him say It is piggul , and it is Rabbi Meir. tanna taught everyone agrees, exchanged piggul for disqualified. he would not confuse This is with Everyone agrees.
llm_translation: And say this is piggul, and Rabbi Meir he is a Tanna, the words of all they taught him piggul in disqualification, he interchanges it, behold this in the words of all he does not interchange it.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך הקומץ את המנחה
llm_translation: The Kometz returns to you the Mincha.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הקומץ את המנחה לאכול דבר שאין דרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שאין דרכו להקטיר כשר ר"א פוסל
human_translation: one who removes a handful from the meal offering to consume an item whose manner not consume or to burn, an item whose manner not burn fit. Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The one who gathers the meal offering to eat, something that is not its way to be eaten, and to burn, something that is not its way to be burned, it is valid. Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies it.

hebrew_text: לאכול דבר שדרכו לאכול ולהקטיר דבר שדרכו להקטיר פחות מכזית כשר לאכול כחצי זית ולהקטיר כחצי זית כשר שאין אכילה והקטרה מצטרפין:
human_translation: to consume, an item whose manner consume or to burn, an item whose manner burn less than an olive-bulk, fit. to consume half an olive-bulk and to burn half an olive-bulk fit, because eating and burning do not join together.
llm_translation: To eat a thing that its way is to eat, and to burn a thing that its way is to burn, less than the size of an olive is fit to eat, like half an olive, and to burn like half an olive is fit, for eating and burning combine.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ א"ר אסי א"ר יוחנן מ"ט דר"א אמר קרא (ויקרא ז, יח) ואם האכל יאכל מבשר זבח שלמיו בשתי אכילות הכתוב מדבר אחד אכילת אדם ואחד אכילת מזבח לומר לך כשם שמחשבין באכילת אדם כך מחשבין באכילת מזבח
human_translation: Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer The verse states “And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace offerings is at all consumed [ he’akhol ye’akhel ]” the verse is speaking of two consumption: One the consumption by a person, and one is the consumption by altar. to tell you just as intention with regard to the consumption of a person so too, intention with regard to the consumption of altar
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer's opinion? He said: The verse states (Leviticus 7:18), "And if any of the flesh of the sacrifice of his peace-offerings be eaten on the third day, it shall not be accepted, neither shall it be imputed unto him that offers it; it shall be an abomination, and the soul that eats of it shall bear his iniquity." The Scripture speaks of two eatings: one is the eating of a person, and one is the eating of the sacrifice. This teaches you that just as one is held accountable for the eating of a person, so too one is held accountable for the eating of the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: וכשם שמחשבין מאכילת אדם לאכילת אדם ומאכילת מזבח לאכילת מזבח כך מחשבין מאכילת אדם למזבח ומאכילת מזבח לאדם
human_translation: And just as intention consumption by a person consumed by a person and intention consumption of altar consumed by altar so too, intention consumption by a person consumed on altar and consumption of altar consumed by a person
llm_translation: And just as we calculate from the eating of a person to the eating of a person, and from the eating of the altar to the eating of the altar, so do we calculate from the eating of a person to the altar, and from the eating of the altar to a person.

hebrew_text: מ"ט מדאפקינהו רחמנא להקטרה בלשון אכילה
human_translation: What is the reason from that the Merciful One expresses burning using the language of consumption.
llm_translation: Reason why the Merciful One engaged them in dispute to burn the incense in the language of eating.

hebrew_text: ורבנן האי דאפקינהו רחמנא בלשון אכילה
human_translation: And the Rabbis, This that the Merciful One expresses using the language of consumption
llm_translation: And the Rabbis, this one that the Merciful One has designated with the language of eating.

hebrew_text: דלא שנא כי מחשב בלשון אכילה למזבח ול"ש כי מחשב בלשון הקטרה למזבח
human_translation: that there is no difference if one expresses his intention using the language of: Consumption on altar, and there is no difference if one expresses his intention using the language of: Burning on altar.
llm_translation: It is not different when one intends with the language of eating for the altar, and when one intends with the language of burning for the altar.

hebrew_text: א"נ מה אכילה בכזית אף הקטרה בכזית ולעולם אכילה דאורחא משמע
human_translation: Alternatively, just as consumption of an olive-bulk, so too, burning of an olive-bulk. But actually, consumption indicates in the usual manner,
llm_translation: So too, just as eating on Yom Kippur is forbidden with the size of an olive, so too, burning incense is forbidden with the size of an olive. And indeed, eating on Yom Kippur is forbidden as it is commonly understood.

hebrew_text: ור"א א"כ לכתוב רחמנא אם האכל האכל א"נ אם יאכל יאכל מאי האכל יאכל שמעת מינה תרתי
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer if that were so, let the Merciful One write If he’akhol he’akhol , or: If ye’akhel ye’akhel , What “ he’akhol ye’akhel ,” Learn from two
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said: "Therefore, the Merciful One should write, 'If he ate, he ate.' Alternatively, if he will eat, he will eat. What is the meaning of 'he will eat'? Learn from this two things."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי זירא לרב אסי ואי טעמא דר"א משום הכי הוא כרת נמי ליחייב וכי תימא ה"נ והא את הוא דאמרת משמיה דרבי יוחנן מודה ר"א שאין ענוש כרת
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Asi: But if the reasoning of Rabbi Eliezer is due to that let one also be liable to karet And if you would say indeed, But aren’t you the one who said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Rabbi Eliezer concedes that not punishable by karet ?
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said to Rav Asi: And if the reason of Rabbi Eliezer is because of this, then cutting off should also render one liable. And if you say, "So too," but didn't you say in the name of Rabbi Yochanan that Rabbi Eliezer concedes that the punishment of cutting off does not apply.

hebrew_text: א"ל תנאי היא אליבא דר"א איכא למ"ד פסולה דאורייתא ואיכא למ"ד פסולה דרבנן
human_translation: said to him: It is tanna’im as to of Rabbi Eliezer. There is one who says unfit by Torah law And there is one who says unfit by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: He said to him: It is a dispute according to Rabbi Akiva. There is one who says it is biblically invalid, and there is one who says it is rabbinically invalid.

hebrew_text: דתניא השוחט את הזבח לשתות מדמו למחר להקטיר מבשרו למחר לאכול מאימוריו למחר כשר ור"א פוסל להניח מדמו למחר רבי יהודה פוסל אמר ר"א אף בזו ר"א פוסל וחכמים מכשירין
human_translation: As it is taught one who slaughters the offering to drink of its blood, on the next day, to burn of its meat, on the next day, to eat of its sacrificial portions, on the next day, fit, But Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit. to leave of its blood for the next day, Rabbi Yehuda deems unfit. Rabbi Elazar said: Even in this Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit, and the Rabbis deem fit.
llm_translation: As it was taught: One who slaughters the sacrifice to drink its blood the next day, to burn its flesh the next day, to eat from its innards the next day - it is valid according to Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies if one leaves its blood until the next day. Rabbi Yehuda disqualifies. Rabbi Eliezer said: Even in this case Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies, and the Sages deem it valid.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אליבא דמאן אילימא אליבא דרבנן השתא ומה התם דקא מחשב בלשון אכילה מכשרי רבנן הכא לא כל שכן
human_translation: In accordance with whose Rabbi Yehuda If we say in accordance with of the Rabbis, now And if there, where expresses his intention using the language of consumption, the Rabbis deem fit, not all the more so here,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda according to whom? According to the Rabbis now. But there, where it calculates with the language of eating, the Rabbis permit, here, all the more so.

hebrew_text: אלא אליבא דר"א ואמר ר' אלעזר אף בזו ר"א פוסל וחכמים מכשירין ר' אלעזר היינו ר' יהודה
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with of Rabbi Eliezer. And Rabbi Elazar said: Even in this Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit, and the Rabbis deem fit. Rabbi Elazar is Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: Rather, according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi Elazar said: Even in this case, Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies, and the Sages deem it permissible. Rabbi Elazar is the same as Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו כרת איכא בינייהו דר' יהודה (דת"ק) סבר להניח פסולא בעלמא בהנך כרת נמי מיחייב ואתא ר' אלעזר למימר אידי ואידי פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: Rather, is it not between karet ? that Rabbi Yehuda holds to leave only unfit, in those liable karet as well. And Rabbi Elazar comes to say this and that unfit but there is no karet for it.
llm_translation: Rather, there is a distinction between them. Rabbi Yehuda (of the School of Rabbi Akiva) holds that leaving a mere invalid item in those cases also incurs karet. And Rabbi Elazar came to say: Both this and that are invalid, yet neither incurs karet.

hebrew_text: לא דכולי עלמא כרת ליכא והכא ג' מחלוקת בדבר ת"ק סבר בהנך פליגי להניח דברי הכל כשר
human_translation: No, that everyone agrees there is no karet . And here three disputes with regard to the matter. The first tanna holds disagree in those to leaving everyone agrees fit.
llm_translation: Not all the world agrees, that there is a cutting off, and here in this case three opinions are in dispute in the matter of the first Tanna. One opinion is that in those cases they disagree, and to leave the matter is valid according to the words of everyone.

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה סבר בהנך פליגי להניח דברי הכל פסול מאי טעמא גזירה מקצת דמו אטו כל דמו וכל דמו פסולא דאורייתא
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds disagree in those to leave everyone agrees unfit. What is the reason decree some of its blood due to all of its blood, and all of its blood unfit by Torah law.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds in those cases they argue about to leave it, the words of everyone are invalid. What is the reason? It is a decree against some of its blood, to include all of its blood, and all of its blood is invalid by Torah law.

hebrew_text: דתניא אמר להם רבי יהודה אי אתם מודים לי שאם הניחו למחר שפסול חישב להניחו למחר נמי פסול
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Yehuda said to Do you not concede to me that if he left until the next day that unfit? he intended to leave until the next day, also unfit.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda said to them, "If you do not agree with me that if they left it for tomorrow it is invalid, he intended to leave it for tomorrow is also invalid."

hebrew_text: ואתא ר' אלעזר למימר אף בזו ר' אליעזר פוסל וחכמים מכשירין
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar comes to say even in this Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit and the Rabbis deem fit,
llm_translation: And came Rabbi Elazar to say, even in this case Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies, and the sages validate.

hebrew_text: וסבר ר' יהודה להניח מדמו למחר דברי הכל פסול והתניא אמר רבי כשהלכתי למצות מדותי אצל ר' אלעזר בן שמוע ואמרי לה למצות מדותיו של ר' אלעזר בן שמוע מצאתי יוסף הבבלי יושב לפניו והיה חביב לו ביותר עד לאחת אמר לו רבי השוחט את הזבח להניח מדמו למחר מהו
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda hold to leave of the blood until the next day, everyone agrees unfit? But isn’t it taught Rabbi said: When I went to Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua to clarify my knowledge, and some say to clarify the knowledge of, Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua, I found Yosef the Babylonian sitting before And was especially dear to him, until one said to him: My teacher, one who slaughters the offering to leave of its blood for the next day, what is
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds to leave from its blood until the next day, the words of all are invalid. And it was taught: Rabbi said, "When I went to learn the measurements from Rabbi Elazar ben Shamua, and some say, to learn his measurements, I found Yosef the Babylonian sitting before him, and he was very dear to him. Until one time he said to him, 'Rabbi, if one slaughters the sacrifice to leave from its blood until the next day, what is the law?'"

hebrew_text: אמר לו כשר ערבית אמר לו כשר שחרית אמר לו כשר  צהרים אמר לו כשר מנחה אמר לו כשר אלא שר' אליעזר פוסל צהבו פניו של יוסף הבבליא
human_translation: said to him: fit. evening, said to him fit. morning, said to him fit. noon, said to him fit. afternoon, said to him: fit, but Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit. Yosef the Babylonian’s face lit up [ tzahavu panav ]
llm_translation: He said to him: "Kosher evening." He said to him: "Kosher morning." He said to him: "Kosher afternoon." He said to him: "Kosher Mincha." He said to him: "Kosher." Rather, Rabbi Eliezer disqualifies the gold of the face of Joseph the Babylonian.

hebrew_text: אמר לו  יוסף כמדומה אני שלא כיווננו שמועתינו עד עתה אמר לו רבי הן אלא שר' יהודה פסול שנה לי וחזרתי על כל תלמידיו ובקשתי לי חבר ולא מצאתי עכשיו ששנית לי פסול החזרת לי אבידתי
human_translation: said to him: Yosef, it seems to me that our, halakhot were not accurate until now, said to him: My teacher, yes, But that Rabbi Yehuda taught me unfit, and I went around to all of disciples, seeking another but I could not find Now that you have taught me unfit, you have returned to me that which I had lost.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Yosef, I am like a person who has not directed our hearing until now." He said to him, "Rabbi, yes, but Rabbi Yehuda disqualified me, I repeated it for a year and reviewed all his students, and sought a colleague for myself but did not find. Now that you have disqualified me again, you have caused my loss."

hebrew_text: זלגו עיניו דמעות של רבי אלעזר בן שמוע אמר אשריכם תלמידי חכמים שדברי תורה חביבין עליכם ביותר קרא עליו המקרא הזה (תהלים קיט, צז) מה אהבתי תורתך כל היום היא שיחתי וגו' הא מפני שר' יהודה בנו של ר' אלעאי ורבי אלעאי תלמידו של ר' אליעזר לפיכך שנה לך משנת רבי אליעזר
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua’s eyes streamed with tears, he said: Happy are you, Torah scholars, for whom matters of Torah are exceedingly dear. recited this verse about “O how I love Your Torah; it is my meditation all the day” Because Rabbi Yehuda the son of Rabbi Elai, and Rabbi Elai the student of Rabbi Eliezer, therefore taught you the mishna of Rabbi Eliezer
llm_translation: His eyes shed tears, Rabbi Elazar ben Shamu'a said, "Fortunate are you, students of the sages, for the words of Torah are beloved to you the most." This verse was recited about him (Psalms 119:97), "How I love your Torah! It is my meditation all day." Why? Because Rabbi Yehudah, the son of Rabbi Elai, and Rabbi Elai's student Rabbi Eliezer, therefore, study for you from the teachings of Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: ואי סלקא דעתך דברי הכל פסול אתנייה מאי החזרת לי אבידתי איהו פלוגתא קאמר ליה
human_translation: And if it enters your mind taught all agree unfit, what You have returned to me that which I had lost? had said to him a dispute,
llm_translation: And if it should enter your mind that the words of everyone are invalid, he teaches it to him, "What have you returned to me my lost item?" He is stating a dispute to him.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי כשר ור' אליעזר פסול פוסל אתנייה אי הכי מאי הא מפני (פלוגתא) אנן נמי פלוגתא קא מתנינן
human_translation: Rather, what teach him fit and Rabbi Eliezer deems unfit? If that is so, what that because dispute? we too teach dispute.
llm_translation: Rather, what is the ruling if Rabbi Eliezer deems it invalid? He invalidates it. If so, why does it state, "due to a dispute"? We also are discussing a dispute.

hebrew_text: אלא לעולם דברי הכל פסול אתנייה ומאי החזרת לי אבידתי דהדר ליה מיהא שום פסלות בעולם:
human_translation: Rather, actually, taught all agree unfit; and what You have returned to me that which I had lost? that had in any event returned to him some in the world unfitness
llm_translation: Rather, the words of everyone are invalid. It teaches it to him. And what is "return to me my lost item"? That he should return it to him in any case. He should place idols in the world.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ לא יצק לא בלל ולא פתת ולא מלח ולא הניף לא הגיש או שפתתן פתים מרובות ולא משחן כשירה:
human_translation: did not pour did not mix or did not break or did not salt, or did not wave did not bring or that broke greater pieces or did not smear fit.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One may not pour, mix, knead, or salt, nor lift up, bring near, or spread out their dough in many pieces, nor anoint it with oil that is fit.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי לא יצק אילימא לא יצק כלל עיכובא כתב בה אלא לא יצק כהן אלא זר אי הכי לא בלל נמי לא בלל כהן אלא זר הא לא בלל כלל פסולה
human_translation: What did not pour If we say he did not pour at all, write with regard to indispensable? Rather, a priest did not pour but a non-priest If so, did not mix also a priest did not mix but a non-priest This did not mix at all, unfit.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the meaning of "he shall not pour"? If you say he shall not pour at all, the delay is written in it. Rather, he shall not pour, not a priest, but a non-priest. If so, he also did not mix, not a priest, but a non-priest. But did he not mix at all? It is invalid.

hebrew_text: והתנן ששים נבללין ששים וא' אין נבללין והוינן בה כי אינם נבללין מאי הוי והתנן לא בלל כשרה
human_translation: But didn’t we learn sixty can be mixed sixty-one cannot be mixed And we discussed it if do not mix what of it? But didn’t we learn one did not mix fit?
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: If there are sixty pieces mixed with sixty-one pieces, they are not mixed. And we asked about this: When they are not mixed, what is the ruling? And we learned in a Mishnah: If it was not mixed, it is valid.

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' זירא כל הראוי לבילה אין בילה מעכבת בו וכל שאינו ראוי לבילה בילה מעכבת בו
human_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said any that suitable for mixing mixing does not invalidate And any that not suitable for mixing mixing invalidates
llm_translation: And Rabbi Zeira said: Anything fitting for intercourse, menstruation does not impede upon it, and anything not fitting for intercourse, menstruation does impede upon it.

hebrew_text: מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא לא יצק לא יצק כהן אלא זר לא בלל לא בלל כלל:
human_translation: Are the cases comparable? This as it is, and that as it is. did not pour a priest did not pour but a non-priest did not mix he did not mix at all.
llm_translation: From Irya's statement: This is as it was stated, and this is as it was stated. A non-priest may not pour, a priest may not pour. Only a non-priest may not mix, a priest may not mix at all.

hebrew_text: או שפתת' פתים מרובות כשרה: השתא לא פתת כלל כשרה פתין מרובות מיבעיא מאי פתין מרובות שריבה בפתיתין
human_translation: Or that broke greater pieces [ pittim merubbot ] fit. Now did not break at all fit, is necessary greater pieces What pittin merubbot that he increased [ ribba ] pieces
llm_translation: Or if she baked many loaves, it is valid. Now, if she did not bake at all, are many loaves necessary? What are many loaves? It means she mixed in crumbs.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא לעולם פתים מרובות ממש ומהו דתימא התם הוא דאיכא תורת חלות עליהן אבל הכא דלא תורת חלות איכא ולא תורת פתיתין איכא קמ"ל
human_translation: And if you wish, say actually literally large pieces [ pittim merubbot ], and lest you say is there, since they have the status of loaves, but here, when no have the status of loaves, but do not have the status of pieces, teach us
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: Indeed, there are many actual loaves. And what might you say? There, where there is the law of loaves upon them, but here, where there is no law of loaves and there are no laws of fine flour, it teaches us.

hebrew_text: לימא מתניתין דלא כרבי שמעון דתניא רבי שמעון אומר כל כהן שאינו מודה בעבודה אין לו חלק בכהונה שנאמר (ויקרא ז, לג) המקריב את דם השלמים ואת החלב מבני אהרן לו תהיה שוק הימין למנה מודה בעבודה יש לו חלק בכהונה שאינו מודה בעבודה אין לו חלק בכהונה
human_translation: Let us say the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon. As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: Any priest who does not admit to the rites has no portion in the priesthood. As it is stated: “He among the sons of Aaron, that offers the blood of the peace offerings, and the fat, shall have the right thigh for a portion” admits to the rites has a portion in the priestly who does not admit to the rites does not have a portion in the priestly
llm_translation: Let us say the Mishnah that is not like Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, "Any priest who does not acknowledge the service, he has no portion in the priesthood, as it is stated (Leviticus 7:33), 'The one who offers the flesh of the peace offering and the right thigh among the sons of Aaron, it shall be his.' One who acknowledges the service has a portion in the priesthood; one who does not acknowledge the service has no portion in the priesthood."

hebrew_text: ואין לי אלא זו בלבד מנין לרבות ט"ו עבודות
human_translation: And I have only these alone, From where includes fifteen rites
llm_translation: And I have only this, how do I know to include the fifteen types of labor?

hebrew_text: היציקות והבלילות והפתיתות והמליחות והתנופות וההגשות והקמיצות והקטרות והמליקות והקבלות והזאות והשקאת סוטה ועריפת עגלה וטהרת מצורע ונשיאות כפים בין מבפנים בין מבחוץ מנין
human_translation: the pouring the mixing, the breaking, the salting, the waving, the bringing the removal of the handful, and the burning And The pinching and the receiving and the sprinkling and the giving of water to a woman suspected by her husband of having been unfaithful [ sota ], and the breaking a heifer’s neck, and the purification of a leper, and lifting of the hands whether inside or outside From where
llm_translation: The libations, the mixtures, the doughs, the saltings, the wave offerings, the presentations, the handfuls, the incenses, the offerings of meal, the burnings, the sprinklings, the giving to drink of the Sotah, the breaking of the heifer's neck, the purification of the leper, and the waving of hands, whether from within or from without, how are they derived?

hebrew_text: ת"ל מבני אהרן עבודה המסורה לבני אהרן כל כהן שאינו מודה בה אין לו חלק בכהונה
human_translation: The verse states: “Among the sons of Aaron,” rite that is entrusted to the sons of Aaron, any priest who does not admit to its does not have a portion in the priestly
llm_translation: The verse teaches: "From the sons of Aaron, the assigned service." The service assigned to the sons of Aaron. Any priest who does not acknowledge it, does not have a portion in the priesthood.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן לא קשיא כאן במנחת כהנים כאן במנחת ישראל מנחת ישראל דבת קמיצה היא מקמיצה ואילך מצות כהונה לימד על יציקה ובלילה שכשירה בזר מנחת כהנים דלאו בת קמיצה היא מעיקרא בעיא כהונה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: not difficult. There, the meal offering of priests, here, a meal offering of an Israelite. a meal offering of an Israelite, which is requires the removal of a handful from the removal of the handful onward, the mitzva of priesthood. teaches that pouring and mixing, are valid by a non-priest. the meal offering of priests, which is does not require the removal of a handful, requires from the outset priesthood;
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: It is not difficult here, regarding the Minchat Kohanim, and here, regarding the Minchat Yisrael. The Minchat Yisrael is considered a proper Minchah offering from the point of Kemitzah onwards, whereas the mitzvah of the Kohanim is learned from the act of pouring. And at night, it is valid for a non-priest. The Minchat Kohanim, which is not a proper Minchah offering from the outset, requires the priesthood initially.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא מכדי מנחת כהנים מהיכא איתרבי ליציקה ממנחת ישראל מה התם כשירה בזר אף הכא נמי כשירה בזר
human_translation: Rava said to him: After all, the meal offering of priests, from where included to pour from the meal offering of an Israelite, just as there valid by a non-priest, so too here, also valid by a non-priest.
llm_translation: Rava said to him: From where do we derive that the libation of the priests is mixed with the meal-offering of Israel? Just as there it is valid when performed by a non-priest, so too here it is valid when performed by a non-priest.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי אמר רב נחמן לא קשיא כאן בנקמצות כאן בשאין נקמצות
human_translation: There are who say Rav Naḥman said: not difficult. Here, from which a handful is removed, there, from which a handful is not removed.
llm_translation: There are those who say, Rav Nachman said: It is not difficult. Here, we are dealing with niktzot, here we are dealing with she'ein niktzot.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא מכדי שאין נקמצות מהיכא איתרבי ליציקה מנקמצות כנקמצות מה התם כשירה בזר אף הכא נמי כשירה בזר אלא מחוורתא מתניתין דלא כר' שמעון
human_translation: Rava said to him: After all, from which a handful is not removed, from where was it included to pour from from which a handful is removed, is like from which a handful is removed; just as there, valid by a non-priest, so too here, also valid by a non-priest. Rather, it is clear the mishna is not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rava said to him: From where do we derive that if they are not mixed together, they are considered as mixed together? Just as there, it is valid with a non-priest, so too here, it is also valid with a non-priest. Rather, it is a clear teaching of the Mishnah that does not follow the opinion of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: מ"ט דרבנן אמר קרא (ויקרא ב, א) ויצק עליה שמן ונתן עליה לבונה והביאה אל בני אהרן הכהן וקמץ מקמיצה ואילך מצות כהונה לימד על יציקה ובלילה שכשירה בזר
human_translation: What is the reasoning of the Rabbis, The verse states: “And he shall pour oil upon it and put frankincense upon it. And he shall bring it to Aaron’s sons, the priests; and he shall remove from the removal of the handful onward, the mitzva of the priesthood. teaches pouring and mixing, are valid by a non-priest.
llm_translation: Reason of the Rabbis said Scripture (Leviticus 2:1) "And he shall pour oil upon it, and put frankincense thereon, and he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests, and he shall take thereout his handful of the meal offering thereof, and shall make the memorial portion thereof to go up in smoke upon the altar, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor unto the Lord."

hebrew_text: ורבי שמעון בני אהרן
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon “Aaron’s sons,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon son of Aharon.

hebrew_text: הכהנים מקרא נדרש לפניו ולאחריו
human_translation: the priests,” verse is interpreted to precedes it and to succeeds it.
llm_translation: The priests, a verse is expounded before him and after him.

hebrew_text: וסבר ר"ש מקרא נדרש לפניו ולאחריו והתניא (ויקרא ד, כה) ולקח הכהן מדם החטאת באצבעו ונתן על קרנות המזבח באצבעו ולקח מלמד שלא תהא קבלה אלא בימין באצבעו ונתן מלמד שלא תהא נתינה אלא בימין
human_translation: And does Rabbi Shimon hold a verse is interpreted to precedes it and to succeeds it? But isn’t it taught “And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin offering with his finger and put it upon the corners of the altar” “with his finger” “and shall take.” teaches that collection shall be only with right “with his finger” “and put it.” teaches that the placing shall be only with right
llm_translation: And R. Shimon holds that the verse is expounded before Him and after Him. And it was taught: "And the priest shall take of the blood of the sin-offering with his finger, and put it upon the horns of the altar with his finger." "With his finger" teaches that acceptance should only be with the right hand with his finger, and "put" teaches that the placing should only be with the right hand.

hebrew_text: אר"ש וכי נאמר יד בקבלה הואיל ולא נאמר יד בקבלה קיבל בשמאל כשר
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: But is hand stated with regard to collection Since hand is not stated with regard to collection collected with left fit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon: "And is it stated 'hand' in the context of receiving? Since it is not stated 'hand' in the context of receiving, receiving with the left hand is valid."

hebrew_text: ואמר אביי במקרא נדרש לפניו ולאחריו קא מיפלגי (ור"ש סבר לאחריו נדרש ולפניו אין נדרש)
human_translation: And Abaye said: disagree with regard to a verse is interpreted to precedes it and to succeeds it. And Rabbi Shimon holds is interpreted to succeeds it, but is not interpreted to precedes it.
llm_translation: And Abaye said: In the Scripture, they dispute whether it is expounded before Him and after Him. (And Rabbi Shimon holds that after Him is expounded, and before Him is not expounded.)

hebrew_text: אלא ה"ט דר"ש והביאה וי"ו מוסיף על ענין ראשון
human_translation: Rather, this is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon: And he shall bring it vav , adds to the previous matter,
llm_translation: Rather, the "Tzaddik" of Rabbi Shimon, and he brought it, and the "Vav" adds to the first matter.

hebrew_text: וסבר ר"ש וי"ו מוסיף על ענין ראשון אלא מעתה דכתיב (ויקרא א, ה) ושחט את בן הבקר והקריבו בני אהרן הכהנים את הדם וזרקו את הדם מקבלה ואילך מצות כהונה מלמד על שחיטה שכשירה בזר אי לר"ש וי"ו מוסיף על ענין ראשון שחיטה ה"נ בזר תהא פסולה
human_translation: But does Rabbi Shimon hold vav adds to the previous matter? If that is so, which is written: “And he shall slaughter the bull and Aaron’s sons, the priests, shall sacrifice the blood and sprinkle the blood” from collection and onward, it is the mitzva of priesthood. teaches that slaughter valid by a non-priest. If according to Rabbi Shimon vav adds to the previous matter, slaughter by a non-priest, should also be unfit.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon holds that the "vav" adds to the first matter. Rather, now that it is written (Leviticus 1:5), "And he shall slaughter the bull before the Lord; and Aaron's sons, the priests, shall present the blood and dash the blood against the altar," from here onward, the commandment of the priesthood teaches about proper slaughter, that it is valid when performed by a non-priest. If so, according to Rabbi Shimon, the "vav" adds to the first matter, that slaughter by a non-priest should also be invalid.

hebrew_text: שאני התם דאמר קרא וסמך ושחט מה סמיכה בזרים אף שחיטה בזרים

human_translation: And if you would say one cannot derive possible from impossible, the Merciful One revealed in Yom Kippur “And he shall slaughter the bull of the sin offering which is for himself” By inference, that usually slaughter does not require owner.

The Merciful One revealed on Yom Kippur (Leviticus 16:11), "And he shall slaughter the bull of the sin offering that is for himself." From the inference that we do not require owners merely for the act of slaughter.

hebrew_text: אמר רב כל מקום שנאמר תורה וחוקה אינו אלא לעכב קא ס"ד תרתי בעיא כדכתיב (במדבר יט, ב) זאת חוקת התורה

human_translation: a mnemonic Nun , tav , tzadi ; yod , kuf , mem , lamed .
llm_translation: Tractate: Niddah, Chapter 1, Mishnah 30 אָמַר רַבִּי יוֹחָנָן: כָּל הַמַּגִּיעַ לְזִמָּה, עוֹבֵר עַל כָּל עֲבֵרוֹת שֶׁבַּתּוֹרָה, שֶׁנֶּאֱמַר: "וְלֹא תַקְרִבוּ אֶל הַעֹבְרֹת" (ויקרא יח,ג).

hebrew_text: והרי נזיר דלא כתיבא ביה אלא תורה ואמר רב תנופה בנזיר מעכבא שאני התם כיון דכתיב כן יעשה כמאן דכתיבא בהו חוקה דמי

llm_translation: And behold, regarding a Nazirite, it is not written in it except "Torah." And Rav said: "The waving is a hindrance in a Nazirite." It is different there, for since it is written, "So shall he do," it is as if it is written about them, it is similar to a statute.

hebrew_text: הרי תודה דלא כתיבא ביה אלא תורה ותנן ארבעה שבתודה מעכבין זה את זה שאני תודה דאיתקש לנזיר דכתיב (ויקרא ז, יג) על זבח תודת שלמיו ואמר מר שלמיו לרבות שלמי נזיר

llm_translation: Behold, "thanksgiving" is not written in it except "Torah." And we learned: Four types of thanksgiving offerings impede one another. For thanksgiving is different, as it is compared to a Nazirite, as it is written (Leviticus 7:13), "For his thanksgiving offering of peace sacrifices." And the Master said: "Of his peace sacrifices" to include the peace sacrifices of a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: והרי מצורע דלא כתיב ביה אלא תורה ותנן ארבעה מינין שבמצורע מעכבין זה את זה שאני התם כיון דכתיב (ויקרא יד, ב) זאת תהיה תורת המצורע כמאן דכתיב ביה חוקה דמי

For there, it is different, since it is written (Leviticus 14:2), "This shall be the Torah of the leper," it is like one in which a decree is written in it.

hebrew_text: והרי יוה"כ דלא כתיב ביה אלא חוקה ותנן שני שעירי יוה"כ מעכבין זה את זה אלא או תורה או חוקה
human_translation: But Yom Kippur, about which it is written only “statute,” and we learn the two goats of Yom Kippur, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other? Rather, either law or statute

hebrew_text: והרי שאר קרבנות דכתיב בהו תורה ולא מעכבי תורה בעיא חוקה וחוקה לא בעיא תורה

llm_translation: And behold, the other sacrifices that the Torah writes about them, and not those that the Torah does not write about them, require a statute, and a statute does not require the Torah.

hebrew_text: והא תורה וחוקה קא אמר ה"ק אף על גב דכתיב תורה אי כתיבא חוקה אין ואי לא לא
human_translation: But doesn’t say: law and statute This is saying: Even where law is written, if statute is written yes, but if not not
