human_translation: the itself: Ze’eiri says Rabbi Ḥanina says: blood that one cooked, one does not transgress by it. Rava was sitting and saying this halakha . Abaye raised an objection to one curdled blood and consumed it, or where one melted fat and swallowed it, liable.
llm_translation: The text: "Gufa Amar Zeiri Amar Chanina, dam shebishelu einu over alav." Yatav Rava v'ka amar la la shemata. Ityivei Abaye, hakefah et hadam v'achalo o shehichah et hachalav v'gama chayav.

hebrew_text: לא קשיא כאן שהקפה באור כאן שהקפה בחמה באור לא הדר בחמה הדר
human_translation: not difficult, here, where he curdled by the fire, there, he curdled by the sun. by a fire cannot return by the sun can return
llm_translation: Not difficult here that it encircled in light, here that it encircled in heat; in light it did not return, in heat it returned.

hebrew_text: בחמה נמי לימא הואיל ואידחי אידחי דהא בעא מיניה רבי מני מר' יוחנן דם שקרש ואכלו מהו אמר ליה הואיל ונדחה ידחה אישתיק
human_translation: even by the sun, let us say since it was disqualified it was disqualified, as Rabbi Mani inquired of Rabbi Yoḥanan: blood that was congealed and one ate it, what is since it was disqualified it shall be disqualified was silent
llm_translation: In anger also let us say, since it is pushed aside, it is pushed aside, for Rabbi Meni asked Rabbi Yochanan: "Blood that congealed and he ate it, what is the ruling?" He said to him, "Since it is pushed aside, let him remain silent."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה דלמא ודאי כאן בחטאות החיצוניות (החיצונות) כאן בחטאות הפנימיות
human_translation: said to him: Perhaps here certainly to the external sin offerings, there to the inner sin offerings,
llm_translation: He said to him, perhaps indeed here in the outer sins, here in the inner sins.

hebrew_text: אמר אדכרתן מילתא דאמר רב חסדא דם שקרש בחטאות ואכלו חייב (ויקרא ד, כה) ולקח ונתן אמר רחמנא [והאי] בר לקיחה ונתינה הוא בחטאות הפנימיות ואכלו פטור וטבל והזה אמר רחמנא והאי לאו בר טבילה והזאה הוא
human_translation: said You have reminded me of a matter, as Rabbi Ḥisda says: blood that became congealed, of the sin offerings and one ate it, liable, the Merciful One states “And shall take and place it is suitable for taking and placing, of the inner sin offerings and one ate it, exempt, the Merciful One states “And shall dip and sprinkle and this is not suitable for dipping and sprinkling.
llm_translation: Said Adkarta: The matter that Rav Ḥisda said, "Blood that coagulated in sin-offerings and one ate, liable" (Leviticus 4:25). The Merciful One said, "And the priest shall take and give." This act of taking and giving is in regard to the inner sin-offerings, and one who ate them is exempt. If he immersed and sprinkled, the Merciful One said, "And this act of sprinkling is not in regard to immersion."

hebrew_text: ורבא דידיה אמר אפילו בחטאות הפנימיות ואכלו חייב הואיל וכנגדו ראוי בחטאות החיצונות אמר רב פפא הלכך דם חמור שקרש ואכלו חייב הואיל וכנגדו ראוי בחטאות החיצונות
human_translation: And Rava himself says: Even of the inner sin offerings and one ate it, liable, since corresponding to suitable in the external sin offerings. Rav Pappa says: Therefore, the blood of a donkey that became congealed and one ate it, liable, since corresponding to is suitable in the external sin offerings.
llm_translation: And Rava of his own said even in internal sins and they ate, liable he is since corresponding to him fitting in external sins said Rav Papa therefore blood of a donkey that was torn and they ate, liable he is since corresponding to him fitting in external sins.

hebrew_text: אמר רב גידל אמר זעירי דם בין לח בין יבש חוצץ מיתיבי הדם והדיו והדבש והחלב יבשין חוצצין לחין אינן חוצצין לא קשיא הא דסריך הא דלא סריך:
human_translation: Rav Giddel says Ze’eiri says: Blood, whether moist or dry, interposes raises an objection blood, ink, honey, or milk they are dry, they interpose they are moist, they do not interpose. not difficult; this where adheres That where did not adhere
llm_translation: Rav Giddel said Zairi: Blood, whether wet or dry, is a barrier. It was asked: Blood, ink, honey, and milk, when dry, are barriers; when wet, they are not barriers. This is not difficult: here, where it is necessary, and here, where it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: תמלח למאי אתא לכדתניא במלח יכול תבונהו ת"ל תמלח אי תמלח יכול במי מלח ת"ל במלח
human_translation: For what “you shall season” come? for that which is taught with salt, might tevonehu , the verse states: “You shall season.” had “You shall season,” might by salt water. the verse states “with salt.”
llm_translation: Salt for what? It came to teach, as it was taught in a baraita: With salt, one might have thought it refers to its taste; therefore, the verse states "salt." If it refers to salt, one might have thought it means with saltwater; therefore, the verse states "with salt."

hebrew_text: (ויקרא ב, יג) ולא תשבית מלח הבא מלח שאינה שובתת ואיזו זו מלח סדומית ומנין שאם לא מצא מלח סדומית שמביא מלח איסתרוקנית ת"ל תקריב תקריב כל שהוא תקריב מכל מקום תקריב ואפילו בשבת תקריב ואפילו בטומאה
human_translation: “And you shall not omit [ tashbit ] salt one should bring salt that never rests [ shovetet ], And what is this? This salt of Sodom. And from where that if one did not find salt of Sodom that he should bring salt of istrokanit , The verse states you shall sacrifice you should sacrifice any you should sacrifice from any place, you should sacrifice even on Shabbat; you should sacrifice even in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Leviticus 2:13) "And you shall not let the salt of the covenant of your God be lacking from your meal offering; with all your offerings you shall offer salt." And which salt does not cease? That is the salt of Sodom. And from where do we derive that if one does not find salt of Sodom, he brings Egyptian salt? It is stated: "You shall offer, you shall offer" - offer any type of salt. "You shall offer from any place" - offer even on Shabbat, offer even in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: מאי תבונהו אמר רבה בר עולא הכי קאמר יכול יתבוננו כתבן בטיט אמר ליה אביי אי הכי יתבוננו מיבעי ליה אלא אמר אביי יכול יעשנו כבנין אמר ליה רבא אי הכי יבננו מיבעי ליה אלא אמר רבא יכול תבונהו
human_translation: What tevonehu ? Rabba bar Ulla said: This is saying: might one should mix into it [ yitabonenu ] just as straw [ teven ] into clay. Abaye said to him: If so, should have said: Yitabonenu , Rather, Abaye said: might one should form just as a building [ binyan ], Rava said to him: If so, should have said: He should build it [ yivnenu ] Rather, Rava said: might tevonehu .
llm_translation: "What is his understanding?" Rabbah bar Ulla said thus: He might think to understand it as bricks of clay. Abaye said to him: If so, he should understand it. Rather, Abaye said: He might think to make it like a building. Rava said to him: If so, he should build it. Rather, Rava said: He might think of his understanding.

hebrew_text: מאי תבונהו אמר רב אשי יכול יתן בו טעם כבינה תלמוד לומר תמלח כיצד הוא עושה מביא האבר ונותן עליו מלח וחוזר והופכו ונותן עליו מלח ומעלהו
human_translation: What tevonehu ? Rav Ashi said: might one should infuse taste just as understanding [ bina ] the verse states: “You shall season.” How does he act? He brings the limb and applies salt, and then turns it over and again applies salt, and brings it up
llm_translation: What is his understanding? Rav Ashi said: He can give it reasoning like understanding. The Torah says, "You shall salt." How does he do it? He brings the limb and puts salt on it, then turns it over and puts salt on it and raises it.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי וכן לקדירה
human_translation: Abaye says: And similarly into a pot.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: And similarly for a pot.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן מלח שעל גבי האבר מועלין בו שע"ג הכבש ושבראשו של מזבח אין מועלין בו ואמר רב מתנה מאי קראה (יחזקאל מג, כד) והקרבתם לפני ה' והשליכו הכהנים עליהם מלח והעלו אותם עולה לה':
human_translation: The Sages taught salt that is on the limb from it misuse that is on the ramp or that is on top of the altar, from it not misuse And Rav Mattana said: What is the verse “And you shall sacrifice them before the Lord, and the priests shall cast salt upon them, and they shall offer them up for a burnt offering to the Lord”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Salt that is on top of the organ is effective for it, but salt that is on the head of the altar is not effective for it. And Rav Mattana said: What is the verse? "And you shall offer them before the Lord, and the priests shall cast salt upon them, and they shall offer them up as a burnt offering to the Lord." (Ezekiel 43:24)

hebrew_text: תנן התם על המלח ועל העצים שיהו הכהנים נאותין בהן אמר שמואל לא שנו אלא לקרבנם אבל לאכילה לא
human_translation: we learned elsewhere about the salt and about the wood that the priests may derive benefit from them. Shmuel says: They taught only for their offerings, but not for eating
llm_translation: We learned there (in a Mishnah) regarding salt and wood that the priests may benefit from them. Shmuel said: They only did not teach this regarding their sacrifices, but not for eating.

hebrew_text: קא ס"ד מאי לקרבנם למלוח קרבנם לאכול אכילת קדשים השתא למלוח עורות קדשים יהבינן לאכילת קדשים לא יהבינן
human_translation: It enters our mind What For their offerings? to salt their offerings. for eating eating of sacrificial Now, we give to salt the hides of sacrificial we do not give them to eat sacrificial
llm_translation: It is thought: What is the reason for their offering the sacrifices? For salting them. Their offering is for eating them. The eating of holy items. Now, for salting the hides of holy items we give permission, for eating items we do not give permission.

hebrew_text: דתניא נמצאת אתה אומר בשלשה מקומות המלח נתונה בלשכת המלח ועל גבי הכבש ובראשו של מזבח בלשכת המלח ששם מולחין עורות קדשים על גבי הכבש ששם מולחים את האברים בראשו של מזבח ששם מולחין הקומץ והלבונה והקטורת ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח ומנחת נסכים ועולת העוף
human_translation: As it is taught You are found saying the salt is placed in three locations In the Chamber of the Salt, and on the ramp, and on top of altar. in the Chamber of the Salt, since salted there the hides of sacrificial on the ramp, since salted there the limbs. on top of altar, since salted there the handful the frankincense, the incense, the meal offering of priests, the meal offering of anointed priest, the meal offering libations, and the bird burnt offering.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: You find that you say in three places, the salt is placed - in the Salt Chamber, on the back of the ramp, and on the head of the altar. In the Salt Chamber, where they salt the hides of the holy animals; on the back of the ramp, where they salt the limbs; on the head of the altar, where they salt the handful, the frankincense, the incense, the meal offering of the priests, the meal offering of the anointed priest, the drink offerings, and the burnt offering of birds.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי לקרבנם לאכילת קרבנם ומאי לאכילה אכילה דחולין
human_translation: Rather, what For their offerings? to eat their offerings, And what for eating eating non-sacred
llm_translation: Rather, what is the purpose of their offering sacrifices? For the consumption of their sacrifices. And what is meant by consumption? The consumption of mundane food.

hebrew_text: חולין פשיטא מאי בעו התם אע"ג דאמר מר יאכלו שיאכלו עמה חולין ותרומה כדי שתהא נאכלת על השובע אפילו הכי מלח דקדשים לא יהבינן להו
human_translation: obvious non-sacred What doing there Even though the Master says shall eat” that shall eat non-sacred and teruma along with so that will be eaten in satiated even so we do not give them consecrated salt.
llm_translation: Tractate Chulin: It is obvious, what is the need there? Even though the Master said, "They may eat with it Chulin and Terumah so that it will be eaten on a full stomach," nevertheless, we do not give them salt of Kodshim.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי ה"נ מסתברא דאי סלקא דעתך מאי לקרבנם למלוח טעמא דאתני בית דין הא לא אתני בית דין לא השתא לישראל יהבינן לכהנים לא יהבינן
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: So too, it is reasonable As, if it enters your mind What For their offerings? to salt the reason that the court stipulated but had the court not stipulated not now we give to Israelites we not give to priests
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "It is logical that if you were to say, 'What is their offering for the purpose of salting?' since the court teaches, but the court does not teach now, to Israel we give, to the priests we do not give."

hebrew_text: דתניא יכול האומר הרי עלי מנחה יביא מלח מתוך ביתו כדרך שמביא לבונה מתוך ביתו ודין הוא נאמר הביא מנחה והביא מלח ונאמר הביא מנחה והביא לבונה מה לבונה מתוך ביתו אף מלח מתוך ביתו
human_translation: As it is taught might one who says: It upon me a meal offering, must bring salt from his home, just as he brings frankincense from his home And a logical inference: is stated bring a meal offering, and bring salt, and is stated bring a meal offering, and bring frankincense. just as frankincense from his home, so too, salt from his home.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Can one who says, "I am obligated to bring a meal-offering" bring salt from within his house, just as one brings frankincense from within his house? It is a valid argument. It says, "He shall bring a meal-offering," and he brought salt. And it says, "He shall bring a meal-offering," and he brought frankincense. Just as frankincense is from within his house, so too salt is from within his house.

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו נאמר הביא מנחה והביא מלח ונאמר הביא מנחה והביא עצים מה עצים משל ציבור אף מלח משל ציבור
human_translation: Or go this way: is stated bring a meal offering and bring salt, and is stated bring a meal offering and bring wood, just as wood from communal so too, salt from communal
llm_translation: Or, go along this path, it is stated, "He brought a meal offering and he brought salt," and it is stated, "He brought a meal offering and he brought wood." Just as the wood is communal property, so too the salt is communal property.

hebrew_text: נראה למי דומה דנין דבר הנוהג בכל הזבחים מדבר הנוהג בכל הזבחים ואל תוכיח לבונה שאינה נוהגת בכל הזבחים
human_translation: Let us see to which is similar, We derive a matter that applies to all offerings, from a matter that applies to all offerings. And not frankincense prove as it does not apply to all offerings,
llm_translation: It appears to whom is similar, the law that applies to all sacrifices, from the law that applies to all sacrifices, and do not prove to the builder that it does not apply to all sacrifices.

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו דנין דבר הבא עמה בכלי אחד מדבר הבא עמה בכלי אחד ואל יוכיחו עצים שאינן באין עמה בכלי אחד
human_translation: Or go this way: We derive a matter that accompanies in one vessel, from a matter that accompanies in one vessel. And not wood prove as it does not accompany in one vessel.
llm_translation: Or, go along this way, we judge a matter that comes with it in one vessel, from a matter that comes with it in one vessel, and do not prove trees that are not with it in one vessel.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (במדבר יח, יט) ברית מלח עולם הוא ולהלן הוא אומר (ויקרא כד, ח) מאת בני ישראל ברית עולם מה להלן משל ציבור אף כאן משל ציבור
human_translation: The verse states: “It is an everlasting covenant of salt” and there, it states: “It is from the children of Israel, an everlasting covenant” just as there: from communal so too here, from communal
llm_translation: The Talmudic text states: "It is taught (Numbers 18:19), 'It is an eternal covenant of salt.' And there it says (Leviticus 24:8), 'From the children of Israel, an eternal covenant.' Just as there (referring to the verse in Leviticus) it is an analogy of the community, so too here (referring to the verse in Numbers) it is an analogy of the community."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב מרדכי לרב אשי הכי קאמר רב שישא בריה דרב אידי לא נצרכא אלא לבן בוכרי
human_translation: Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: This Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, says: is necessary only according to ben Bukhri,
llm_translation: Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi: This is what Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, meant - it is only necessary for a firstborn son.

hebrew_text: דתנן אמר רבי יהודה העיד בן בוכרי ביבנה כל כהן ששוקל אינו חוטא אמר לו רבן יוחנן בן זכאי לא כי אלא כל כהן שאינו שוקל חוטא אלא שהכהנים דורשין מקרא זה לעצמן
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Yehuda said ben Bukhri testified in Yavne: Any priest who contributes his shekel is not a sinner, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said to That is not rather, any priest who does not contribute his shekel a sinner, But the priests interpret this verse to their own
llm_translation: As we learned in a Mishnah, Rabbi Yehudah said: Ben Bukhri testified in Yavneh, "Every Kohen who weighs is not sinning." Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai said to him, "Not so! Rather, every Kohen who does not weigh is sinning, because the Kohanim interpret this verse for themselves."

hebrew_text: (ויקרא ו, טז) וכל מנחת כהן כליל תהיה לא תאכל הואיל ועומר ושתי הלחם ולחם הפנים שלנו היא היאך נאכלין
human_translation: “And every meal offering of the priest shall be wholly made to smoke; it shall not be eaten” Since omer and the two loaves, and the shewbread ours, How, can they be eaten?
llm_translation: "And every meal offering of a priest shall be wholly burnt; it shall not be eaten." (Leviticus 6:16) Since the Omer, the Two Loaves, and the Showbread are ours, how are they eaten?"

hebrew_text: ולבן בוכרי כיון דלכתחילה לא מיחייב לאיתויי כי מייתי נמי חוטא הוא דקא מעייל חולין לעזרה דמייתי ומסר להון לציבור
human_translation: But according to ben Bukhri, Since he is not obligated to bring ab initio , when he brings he is also a sinner, since he is bringing a non-sacred into the courtyard. brings and transfers to the community,
llm_translation: And for the firstborn son, since initially he is not obligated to bring an offering, when he does bring it, it is also considered a sin offering, for he brings secular money to the Temple courtyard, brings the offering, and hands it over to the public.

hebrew_text: סלקא דעתך אמינא
human_translation: enter your mind to say
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "סלקא דעתך אמינא" Translation: "It has been raised to your opinion, I say."

hebrew_text: כי זכי להו רחמנא לישראל דאית להו לשכה לכהנים דלית להו לשכה לא זכי להו רחמנא קמ"ל
human_translation: when the Merciful One granted to Israelites, who have chamber, to the priests, who do not have chamber, the Merciful One did not grant them teaches us
llm_translation: When the Merciful One granted merit to the Israelites that they have a chamber for the priests, if they do not have a chamber, the Merciful One did not grant them merit. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: ועצים דפשיטא ליה לתנא דמשל ציבור מנלן דתניא יכול האומר הרי עלי עולה יביא עצים מתוך ביתו כדרך שמביא נסכים מתוך ביתו ת"ל (ויקרא א, ח) על העצים אשר על האש אשר על המזבח מה מזבח משל ציבור אף עצים ואש משל ציבור דברי רבי אלעזר בר ר"ש
human_translation: And wood, which obvious to the tanna that from communal from where do we As it is taught might one who says: It upon me a burnt offering, must bring wood from his home just as he brings libations from his home the verse states “On the wood that is on the fire which is upon the altar” just as altar from communal so too, wood and fire from communal the statement of Rabbi Elazar bar Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: And wood, it is obvious to the Tanna of the Mishnah, from where? As it was taught: One might think that one who says, "I am obligated to bring a burnt offering," should bring wood from his house, just as one brings libations from his house. It is stated (Leviticus 1:8), "Upon the wood that is upon the fire that is upon the altar." Just as the altar is communal, so too, wood and fire are communal. These are the words of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר בן שמוע אומר מה מזבח שלא נשתמש בו הדיוט אף עצים ואש שלא נשתמש בהן הדיוט מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו חדתי
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua says: Just as altar was not used by an ordinary so too, wood and fire not have been used by an ordinary What between between is whether new,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Shamu'a says: What is the difference between an altar that the commoner did not use, and wood and fire that the commoner did not use? The difference between them is distinct.

hebrew_text: ועתיקי לא והכתיב (שמואל ב כד, כב) ויאמר ארונה אל דוד יקח ויעל אדוני המלך הטוב בעיניו ראה הבקר לעולה והמוריגים וכלי הבקר לעצים הכא נמי בחדתי
human_translation: And old, not But isn’t it written: “And Araunah said to David: Let my lord the king take and offer up what seems good to him; behold the oxen for the burnt offering, and the threshing instruments [ morigim ] and the equipment of the oxen for the wood” Here too, of new
llm_translation: The elders did not, and it is written (2 Samuel 24:22), "And Araunah said to David, 'Let my lord the king take and offer up what seems good to him. Here are the oxen for the burnt offering and the threshing sledges and the yokes of the oxen for wood.'" Here too, in my opinion.

hebrew_text: מאי מוריגים אמר עולא מטה של טרבל מאי מטה של טרבל אמר רב יהודה עיזא דקורקסא דדשו בה דשתאי אמר רב יוסף מאי קראה (ישעיהו מא, טו) הנה שמתיך למורג חרוץ חדש בעל פיפיות תדוש הרים:
human_translation: What morigim Ulla said: a turbal bed. What a turbal bed? Rav Yehuda said: a serrated [ dekurkesa ] board that the threshers use for threshing, Rav Yosef said: What is the verse “Behold, I have made you a new threshing sledge [ morag ] having sharp teeth; you shall thresh the mountains”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: What is "morigim"? Ula said: The staff of trabel. What is the staff of trabel? Rav Yehudah said: A goat of the courtyard that grazed on the grass of the field. Rav Yosef said: What is its verse? (Isaiah 41:15) "Behold, I have made you a new, sharp threshing sledge with double edges; you shall thresh the mountains and crush them, and you shall make the hills like chaff."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נתערב קומצה בקומץ חבירתה במנחת כהנים במנחת כהן משיח במנחת נסכים כשרה
human_translation: a handful was intermingled with a handful of another with the meal offering of priests, with the meal offering of anointed priest, with the meal offering of libations fit
llm_translation: Mishnah: If a handful became mixed with another handful in the meal offering of the priests, in the meal offering of the anointed priest, or in the meal offering of libations, it is valid.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר במנחת כהן משיח במנחת נסכים פסולה שזו בלילתה עבה וזו בלילתה רכה והן בולעות זו מזו:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: with the meal offering of anointed priest, with the meal offering of libations, unfit because this, its mixture is thick, and that, its mixture is loose, And absorb from each other,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: In the Minchat Kohen Mashiach, in the Minchat Nesachim, it is disqualified, for this one is thick at night and this one is thin at night, and they swallow each other.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנן התם דם שנתערב במים אם יש בו מראית דם כשר נתערב ביין רואין אותו כאילו הוא מים נתערב בדם בהמה או בדם חיה רואין אותו כאילו הוא מים רבי יהודה אומר אין דם מבטל דם
human_translation: We learned there blood that was mixed with water, if has the appearance of blood, fit was mixed with wine, one views as though it were water. was mixed with the blood of domesticated animal or the blood of undomesticated animal, one considers as though it were water. Rabbi Yehuda says: Blood does not nullify blood.
llm_translation: Gemara: We learned there (in a Mishnah): If blood became mixed with water, if it has the appearance of blood, it is valid. If it became mixed with wine, we view it as though it is water. If it became mixed with the blood of an animal or the blood of a wild beast, we view it as though it is water. Rabbi Yehuda says: Blood does not nullify blood.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן ושניהם מקרא אחד דרשו (ויקרא טז, יח) ולקח מדם הפר ומדם השעיר הדבר ידוע שדמו של פר מרובה מדמו של שעיר רבנן סברי
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And both derived from one verse. “And he shall take of the blood of the bull and of the blood of the goat It is a known matter that the blood of the bull is more than the blood of a goat. The Rabbis, hold:
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan: "And both of them Moses and Aaron derived their teaching from one verse, as it is stated (Leviticus 16:18): 'And he shall take from the blood of the bull and from the blood of the goat.' It is a known matter that the blood of the bull is more in quantity than the blood of the goat. The Sages hold this opinion."

hebrew_text: מכאן לעולין שאין מבטלין זה את זה ורבי יהודה סבר מכאן למין במינו שאינו בטל
human_translation: From here that ascend do not nullify one another. And Rabbi Yehuda holds: From here that substance with same substance is not nullified.
llm_translation: From here to Eulin that do not nullify each other. And Rabbi Yehuda holds from here to its own kind that is not nullified.

hebrew_text: רבנן סברי מכאן לעולין שאין מבטלין זה את זה ודלמא משום דמין במינו הוא
human_translation: the Rabbis hold: From here that ascend do not nullify one another, But perhaps due to that it is a substance with same substance.
llm_translation: The sages hold: from here to the upper realms, they do not annul one another. But perhaps it is because it is of its kind.

hebrew_text: אי אשמעינן מין במינו ולא אשמעינן עולין כדקא אמרת השתא דאשמעינן עולין משום דעולין
human_translation: Had taught us a substance with same substance, and not taught us ascend as you said. now that taught us ascend due to that ascend
llm_translation: If we hear from its kind, and we do not hear about ascending, as you said, now that we hear about ascending because of ascending.

hebrew_text: ודלמא עד דאיכא מין במינו ועולין קשיא
human_translation: But perhaps until are a substance with same substance and ascend difficult.
llm_translation: And perhaps until there is a species within its own kind, and they ascend, it is difficult.

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה סבר מכאן למין במינו שאינו בטל ודלמא משום דעולין הוא
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds: From here that substance with same substance is not nullified, But perhaps due to that it is ascend
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds: from here to its kind, that is not nullified. But perhaps it is because it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: אי אשמעינן עולין מין בשאינו מינו כדקאמרת השתא דאשמעינן מין במינו משום דמין במינו הוא
human_translation: Had taught us ascend substance with a different substance, as you say. now that taught us a substance with same substance, due to that it is a substance with same substance.
llm_translation: If we would hear that they ascend a species not in its species, as you said, now that we hear a species in its species because it is a species in its species.

hebrew_text: ודילמא עד דאיכא מין במינו ועולין קשיא:
human_translation: But perhaps until are a substance with same substance and ascend difficult.
llm_translation: And perhaps until there is a species within its own kind, and they ascend, it is difficult.

hebrew_text: תנן רבי יהודה אומר (במנחת כהנים) במנחת כהן משיח ובמנחת נסכים פסולה שזו בלילתה עבה וזו בלילתה רכה והן בולעות זו מזו וכי בולעות זו מזו מה הוי מין במינו הוא
human_translation: We learned Rabbi Yehuda says: with the meal offering of priests, with the meal offering of anointed priest, or with the meal offering of libations, unfit because this, its mixture is thick, and that, its mixture is loose. And absorb from each other, But when absorb from each other, what of it? is a substance with same substance,
llm_translation: We have learned: Rabbi Yehudah says (in the tractate of Minchat Kohanim), in the Minchat of the anointed Kohen and in the Minchat of libations it is disqualified, for this one is thick in its night and this one is soft in its night, and they absorb from each other, and when they absorb from each other, what is it? It is a mingling of its kind.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא קסבר רבי יהודה כל שהוא מין במינו ודבר אחר סלק את מינו כמי שאינו ושאינו מינו רבה עליו ומבטלו:
human_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda holds any that consists of a substance with same substance as well as another substance, disregard same substance, as though it were not and different substance is more than nullifies
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda holds that anything which is its own species, and another thing of a different species comes out, its own species prevails as if it is not there, and the other species is nullified.

hebrew_text: איתמר קומץ דמנחת חוטא ששמנו רבי יוחנן אומר פסול וריש לקיש אמר הוא עצמו משכשכו בשירי הלוג ומעלהו
human_translation: It was stated where one added oil to the handful the meal offering of a sinner, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: unfit, and Reish Lakish says: itself wipe it, in the remainder of the log and brings it up
llm_translation: It was stated: The handful of the sin-offering meal offering, if Rabbi Yochanan priced it, he says it is invalid, and Reish Lakish says: It itself, if it was kneaded with the leavened bread of the Log, it is elevated.

hebrew_text: והכתיב (ויקרא ה, יא) לא ישים עליה שמן ולא יתן עליה לבונה ההוא שלא יקבע לה שמן כחברותיה
human_translation: But isn’t it written “He shall put no oil upon it, neither shall he put any frankincense on it” That that one should not designate oil for it as other
llm_translation: And the Scripture says (Leviticus 5:11), "He shall not put oil on it, nor shall he put frankincense on it," that it should not be fixed with oil like its companions.

hebrew_text: איתיביה ר' יוחנן לריש לקיש חרב שנתערב בבלול יקריב רבי יהודה אומר לא יקריב מאי לאו קומץ דמנחת חוטא דאיערב בקומץ דמנחת נדבה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish a dry that was intermingled with mixed shall sacrifice Rabbi Yehuda says: shall not sacrifice What, is not a handful of the meal offering of a sinner that was intermingled with a handful of a voluntary meal offering,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan raised an objection to Reish Lakish: A sword that became mixed with a mixture, Rabbi Yehuda says it should be offered. What is it? Is it not the handful of the sin offering that became mixed with the handful of the voluntary meal offering.

hebrew_text: לא מנחת פרים ואילים במנחת כבשים
human_translation: No, the meal offering of bulls or rams, with the meal offering of sheep,
llm_translation: Not the meal offering of bulls and rams in the meal offering of lambs.

hebrew_text: והא בהדיא קתני לה מנחת פרים ואילים במנחת כבשים וחרב שנתערב בבלול יקרב רבי יהודה אומר לא יקרב פירושי קמפרש לה
human_translation: But teaches this explicitly the meal offering of bulls or rams with the meal offering of sheep, and a dry that was intermingled with mixed shall be sacrificed. Rabbi Yehuda says: It shall not be sacrificed. is explaining
llm_translation: And this is explicit that it teaches regarding the meal offerings of bulls and rams, in the meal offering of lambs, and a sword that became mixed in, shall be brought near. Rabbi Yehuda says: The interpretations are not to be explained.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא קומץ שמיצה שמנו על גבי עצים מהו חיבורי עולין כעולין דמו או לאו כעולין דמו אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי לאו היינו דרבי יוחנן וריש לקיש
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: a handful whose oil squeezed onto the wood what is contiguous to ascend considered as ascend Or not considered as ascend Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Is this not as Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish?
llm_translation: Rava asked: "If one gathers the oil that dripped onto wood, what is the status of the resulting congealed oil? Is it considered like the oil itself or not?" Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "Is this not the same question that Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish debated?"

hebrew_text: דאיתמר המעלה אבר שאין בו כזית ועצם משלימו לכזית רבי יוחנן אמר חייב ריש לקיש אמר פטור
human_translation: As it was stated: one who offers up, a limb that contains less than an olive-bulk but bone completes to an olive-bulk, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: liable, Reish Lakish says: exempt.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who removes a limb that does not contain a kezayit, and a bone completes it to a kezayit. Rabbi Yochanan said: liable. Reish Lakish said: exempt.

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אמר חייב חיבורי עולין כעולין דמו ור"ל אמר פטור חיבורי עולין לאו כעולין דמו
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable contiguous to ascend considered as ascend And Reish Lakish says exempt contiguous to ascend are not considered as ascend
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "One is liable for the connection of 'Olin' as the 'Olin' itself." And Reish Lakish said: "One is exempt, for the connection of 'Olin' is not like the 'Olin' itself."

hebrew_text: תיבעי לר' יוחנן ותיבעי לריש לקיש תיבעי לר' יוחנן עד כאן לא קא אמר ר' יוחנן התם אלא בעצם דמינא דבשר הוא אבל האי דלאו דמינא דקומץ הוא לא
human_translation: dilemma can be raised according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, and dilemma can be raised according to Reish Lakish. dilemma can be raised according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, Rabbi Yoḥanan says only there, in a bone, because is type as meat, But this which is not type as handful, not
llm_translation: It shall be inquired of Rabbi Yochanan, and it shall be inquired of Reish Lakish. It shall be inquired of Rabbi Yochanan: Until here, Rabbi Yochanan did not say there, but rather in the essence of the blood of the flesh it is. But this, which is not in the essence of the blood, it is not.

hebrew_text: או דלמא אפי' לריש לקיש לא קא אמר אלא בעצם דבר מפרש הוא ואי פריש לאו מצוה לאהדורי אבל שמן דלאו בר מפרש הוא לא או דלמא לא שנא תיקו:
human_translation: Or perhaps, even according to Reish Lakish, he says only in bone, that is able to be separated and if it separated, no mitzva to return it But oil, which is not able to be separated not Or perhaps there is no difference shall stand
llm_translation: Or perhaps even Reish Lakish did not say this, rather, it is an explicit matter. And if it is explicit, it is not a mitzvah to return. But oil, if it is not explicit, it is not a mitzvah to return. Or perhaps it is not different. This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שתי מנחות שלא נקמצו ונתערבו זו בזו אם יכול לקמוץ מזו בפני עצמה ומזו בפני עצמה כשירות ואם לאו פסולות
human_translation: two meal offerings from which a handful was not removed and were intermingled with each other, if can remove a handful from this by itself and from that by itself, they are fit but if not, they are unfit,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Two Minchah offerings that were not crumbled and became mixed with each other, if one can crumble from this one separately and from that one separately, they are valid. But if not, they are invalid.

hebrew_text: קומץ שנתערב במנחה שלא נקמצה לא יקטיר ואם הקטיר זו שנקמצה עולה לבעלים וזו שלא נקמצה לא עולה לבעלים
human_translation: a handful that was intermingled with a meal offering from which a handful was not removed, should not burn And if he burned this from which the handful was taken satisfies the obligation of the owner and that from which the handful was not taken does not satisfy the obligation of the owner.
llm_translation: A handful that became mixed in an uncrushed meal-offering should not be offered up in smoke. And if it was offered up in smoke, the one that became crushed ascends to the owners, and the one that did not become crushed does not ascend to the owners.

hebrew_text: נתערב קומצה בשיריה או בשיריה של חבירתה לא יקטיר ואם הקטיר עולה לבעלים:
human_translation: its handful was intermingled with its remainder or with the remainder of another should not burn but if he burned it satisfies the obligation of the owner.
llm_translation: Intermingled a handful in its measure or in the measure of its fellow, one may not offer it up, and if one did offer it up, it is credited to the owners.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב חסדא נבילה בטילה בשחוטה שאי אפשר לשחוטה שתעשה נבילה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: animal carcass nullified in a slaughtered because a slaughtered cannot attain the status of a carcass,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Chisda said, a carcass is nullified in a slaughtered animal, for it is impossible for a slaughtered animal to become a carcass.

hebrew_text: ושחוטה אינה בטילה בנבילה שאפשר לנבילה שתעשה שחוטה דלכי מסרחה פרחה טומאתה
human_translation: slaughtered is not nullified in carcass, as it is possible for a carcass to attain the status of a slaughtered because when rots it loses its impure
llm_translation: And a slaughtered animal is not nullified in a carcass, for it is possible for a carcass to become a slaughtered animal, as its impurity is removed.

hebrew_text: ורבי חנינא אמר כל שאפשר לו להיות כמוהו אינו בטל וכל שאי אפשר לו להיות כמוהו בטל
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina says Any that can possibly become like not nullified but any that cannot possibly become like nullified
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chanina said: "Anyone who can be like Him is not nullified, and anyone who cannot be like Him is nullified."

hebrew_text: אליבא דמאן אי אליבא דרבנן הא אמרי עולין הוא דלא מבטלי אהדדי אבל מין במינו בטל
human_translation: In accordance with whose If in accordance with of the Rabbis, Didn’t say it is ascend that do not nullify one another, but a substance with same substance nullified?
llm_translation: On the side of whom? If on the side of the Rabbis, here they say: "Olin" is not nullified to each other, but a species to its own species is nullified.

hebrew_text: אי אליבא דרבי יהודה והא
human_translation: If in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, But
llm_translation: If according to Rabbi Yehuda, but.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה בתר חזותא אזיל ואידי ואידי מין במינו הוא
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda follows the appearance And this and that a substance with same substance,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah after seeing went and went, and each one from its kind is.

hebrew_text: אלא אליבא דרבי חייא דתני רבי חייא נבילה ושחוטה בטילות זו בזו
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with of Rabbi Ḥiyya. As Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: animal carcass and a slaughtered are nullified one in the other.
llm_translation: Rather, according to the opinion of Rabbi Chiya, as taught by Rabbi Chiya: "A neveilah (carcass) and a shechutah (properly slaughtered animal) nullify each other."

hebrew_text: רבי חייא אליבא דמאן אי אליבא דרבנן הא אמרי עולין הוא דלא מבטלי אהדדי הא מין במינו בטיל ואי אליבא דר' יהודה כל מין במינו לר' יהודה לא בטיל
human_translation: in accordance with whose Rabbi Ḥiyya If in accordance with of the Rabbis, Didn’t say it is ascend that do not nullify one another, but a substance with same substance nullified? And if in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, According to Rabbi Yehuda any substance with same substance not nullified.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya according to whom? If according to the Rabbis, they say: "Species do not nullify each other." If according to Rabbi Yehuda, every species nullifies its own kind, but according to Rabbi Yehuda, it is not nullified.

hebrew_text: לעולם אליבא דר' יהודה וכי קא אמר ר' יהודה מין במינו לא בטל ה"מ היכא דאפשר ליה למיהוי כוותיה אבל היכא דלא אפשר ליה למיהוי כוותיה בטל
human_translation: Actually, in accordance with of Rabbi Yehuda, and when Rabbi Yehuda says a substance with same substance not nullified, this statement where it is possible for one to become like But where it is not possible for one to become like nullified,
llm_translation: Forever according to Rabbi Yehuda, and when did Rabbi Yehuda say "a species with its own kind is not nullified"? This is the case where it is possible for it to establish its identity. But where it is not possible for it to establish its identity, it is nullified.

hebrew_text: ובהא קא מיפלגי דרב חסדא סבר בתר מבטל אזלינן
human_translation: And disagree with regard to this, as Rav Ḥisda holds we follow the nullifying
llm_translation: And in this, they dispute: Rav Ḥisda holds, he thinks after nullification we go.

hebrew_text: ור' חנינא סבר בתר בטל אזלינן
human_translation: And Rabbi Ḥanina holds we follow nullified
llm_translation: And Rabbi Chanina holds: after the nullification, we go.

hebrew_text: תנן שתי מנחות שלא נקמצו ונתערבו זו בזו אם יכול לקמוץ מזו בפני עצמה ומזו בפני עצמה כשרות ואם לאו פסולות והא הכא כיון דקמיץ ליה מחדא אידך הוה ליה שירים ולא קא מבטלי שירים לטיבלא
human_translation: We learned two meal offerings from which a handful was not removed and were intermingled with each other, if can remove a handful from this by itself and from that by itself, they are fit but if not, they are unfit, And here, once he removes a handful from one, the rest becomes remainder, and remainder does not nullify meal offering from which a handful has not yet been removed.
llm_translation: We learned: Two unblemished meal offerings that became mixed together. If one can separate one from the other individually, they are valid. If not, they are invalid. But here, since he separated one of them, the other should have been nullified for immersion.

hebrew_text: מני אי רבנן הא אמרי עולין הוא דלא מבטלי הדדי הא מין במינו בטל אלא פשיטא רבי יהודה
human_translation: whose If the Rabbis, Didn’t say it is ascend that do not nullify one another, but a substance with same substance nullified? Rather, obvious Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: From where do the Rabbis say this? This is what they say: "Olin" is not nullifying each other. This species with its own kind is nullified. Rather, it is obvious, Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למ"ד בתר בטל אזלינן בטל הוי כמבטל דלכי קמיץ מאידך הוו להו שירים כי הני
human_translation: granted, according to the one who says we follow nullified nullified become like nullifying as when removes the handful from the other will become a remainder like that
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion of the one who holds that after something is nullified, we go after the nullification, it is as if it is nullified. For they are like one who nullifies a handful from another, they have songs like these.

hebrew_text: אלא למ"ד בתר מבטל אזלינן שירים מי קא הוו טיבלא לימא (אליבא דרב חסדא) דלא כרבי חייא
human_translation: But according to the one who says we follow nullifying can remainder become a meal offering from which a handful has not yet been removed? shall we say according to Rav Ḥisda is not in accordance with Rabbi Ḥiyya
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who holds that after the meal we recite songs, who is the one who immersed in a mikveh? Let him say it is (according to Rav Ḥisda) that it is not like Rabbi Ḥiyya.

hebrew_text: התם כדר' זירא דא"ר זירא נאמרה הקטרה בקומץ ונאמרה הקטרה בשירים
human_translation: There, in accordance with of Rabbi Zeira, as Rabbi Zeira says burning is stated with regard to handful and burning is stated with regard to remainder
