hebrew_text: מתני׳ נטמא הקומץ והקריבו הציץ מרצה יצא והקריבו אין הציץ מרצה שהציץ מרצה על הטמא ואינו מרצה על היוצא:
human_translation: the handful became ritually impure and sacrificed it, the frontplate effects acceptance left and sacrificed it, the frontplate does not effect acceptance. that the frontplate effects acceptance for ritually impure and does not effect acceptance for that leave
llm_translation: Mishnah: If the handful became impure, and he offered it, the frankincense is acceptable. He fulfilled his obligation. But if the frankincense became impure, and he offered it, the frankincense is not acceptable. For the frankincense is acceptable when it is offered on the impure handful, but it is not acceptable when it is offered on what is to be taken out of the Temple.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן (שמות כח, לח) ונשא אהרן את עון הקדשים וכי איזה עון הוא נושא אם תאמר עון פיגול הרי כבר נאמר לא יחשב א"ת עון נותר הרי כבר נאמר לא ירצה
human_translation: The Sages taught and Aaron shall bear the sin committed with the sacred items, But which sin does he bear? If you say the sin of piggul , is already stated: “It shall not be credited If you say the sin of notar , is already stated “It shall not be accepted.”
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught (Exodus 28:38), "And Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the holy things." And what iniquity does he bear? If you say the iniquity of Pigul, it has already been stated, "It shall not be reckoned." If you say the iniquity of what is left over, it has already been stated, "It shall not be accepted."

hebrew_text: הא אינו נושא אלא עון טומאה שהותרה מכללה בציבור
human_translation: bears only the sin of impurity as its general prohibition was permitted in community,
llm_translation: This one does not carry except the sin of impurity that was permitted from its general prohibition in public.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רבי זירא אימא עון יוצא שהותר מכללו בבמה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira objects to this: say sin leave as its general prohibition was permitted in altar
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira objects to him: Say, "A sin that emerges, which was permitted from its general prohibition on the altar."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי אמר קרא (שמות כח, לח) לרצון להם לפני ה' עון דלפני ה' אין עון דיוצא לא
human_translation: Abaye said to him: The verse states that they may be accepted before the Lord” a sin before the Lord, yes, sin that leave not
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: The verse says (Exodus 28:38), "For acceptance for them before the Lord; sin that is before the Lord, there is no sin that is greater."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רבי אילעא אימא עון שמאל שהותר מכללו ביום הכפורים
human_translation: Rabbi Ile’a objects to this: say sin left as its general prohibition was permitted in Yom Kippur,
llm_translation: Rabbi Ela raised an objection: Say, "The sin of the left that is permitted from its entirety on Yom Kippur."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי אמר קרא עון עון שהיה בו ודחיתיו לאפוקי יוה"כ דהכשירו בשמאל הוא
human_translation: Abaye said to him: The verse states: the sin a sin that was with and I deferred it. to exclude Yom Kippur, since its proper is with left
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "It says in the verse, 'Iniquity, iniquity, that was in it, and I drove it out to the wilderness on Yom Kippur, for it is permitted with the left hand."

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר עון הקדשים ולא עון המקדישין
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: the sin committed with the sacred items [ hakodashim ],” and not a sin those who bring the offering [ hamakdishin ].
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: "The sin of the holy things, and not the sin of the sanctifiers."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב סימא בריה דרב אידי לרב אשי ואמרי לה רב סימא בריה דרב אשי לרב אשי ואימא עון בעל מום שהותר מכללו בעופות דאמר מר תמות וזכרות בבהמה ואין תמות וזכרות בעופות
human_translation: Rav Sima, son of Rav Idi, said to Rav Ashi; and some say Rav Sima, son of Rav Ashi, to Rav Ashi: But say the sin of a blemished animal as its general prohibition was permitted in birds? As the Master says: unblemished and male with regard to animal but no unblemished and male with regard to birds.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Sima son of Rav Idi said to Rav Ashi, and some say Rav Sima son of Rav Ashi said to Rav Ashi, and say: "The sin of a blemished animal that is permitted from its category is said regarding domestic animals, but it is not said regarding birds."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה עליך אמר קרא לא ירצה (ויקרא כב, כ) כי לא לרצון יהיה לכם:
human_translation: said to him: With regard to your the verse states “It shall not be accepted” for it shall not be acceptable for you”
llm_translation: He said to him, "Upon you it is said, 'He will not accept' (Leviticus 22:20), for it will not be acceptable for you."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן דם שנטמא וזרקו בשוגג הורצה במזיד לא הורצה במה דברים אמורים ביחיד אבל בציבור בין בשוגג בין במזיד הורצה ובעובד כוכבים בין בשוגג בין במזיד בין באונס בין ברצון
human_translation: The Sages taught blood that became impure and sprinkled it unwittingly, accepted intentionally, not accepted. In what is this statement said? In an individual. But in a communal whether unwittingly whether intentionally, accepted. And in a gentile whether unwittingly whether intentionally, whether due to circumstances beyond his control whether willingly,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If blood became impure and was sprinkled unintentionally, it is accepted; if intentionally, it is not accepted. This applies to an individual, but in the case of a congregation, whether unintentional or intentional, it is accepted. And with a non-Jew, whether unintentional or intentional, whether coerced or willingly.

hebrew_text: לא הורצה
human_translation: not accepted,
llm_translation: Not accepted.

hebrew_text: ורמינהי על מה הציץ מרצה על הדם ועל הבשר ועל החלב שנטמא בין בשוגג בין במזיד בין באונס בין ברצון בין ביחיד בין בציבור
human_translation: And raises a contradiction For what does the frontplate effect acceptance? for the blood, for the flesh, and for the fat that became impure whether unwittingly or intentionally, whether due to circumstances beyond one’s control or willfully, whether in an individual or in a communal
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: On what did the High Priest sprinkle? On the blood, and on the flesh, and on the fat that became impure, whether accidentally or intentionally, whether by force or willingly, whether for an individual or for the community.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף לא קשיא הא ר' יוסי הא רבנן דתניא אין תורמין מן הטמא על הטהור ואם תרם בשוגג תרומתו תרומה במזיד אין תרומתו תרומה ר' יוסי אומר בין בשוגג בין במזיד תרומתו תרומה
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: not difficult. This Rabbi Yosei, that the Rabbis. As it is taught One may not separate teruma from ritually impure for ritually pure And if he separated teruma unwittingly, his teruma is teruma , intentionally, his teruma is not teruma . Rabbi Yosei says: Whether unwittingly or intentionally, his teruma is teruma .
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is not difficult - here we have Rabbi Yossi, and here we have the Rabbis. As it was taught: One does not separate terumah from the impure onto the pure. And if one separated it unintentionally, his separation is valid. But if intentionally, his separation is not valid. Rabbi Yossi says: Whether unintentional or intentional, his separation is valid.

hebrew_text: אימר דשמעת ליה לר' יוסי דלא קניס דמרצה ציץ על אכילות מי שמעת ליה והתניא ר' אליעזר אומר הציץ מרצה על אכילות רבי יוסי אומר אין הציץ מרצה על אכילות
human_translation: say that you heard Rabbi Yosei that do not penalize Did you hear him that frontplate effects acceptance for eaten? But isn’t it taught Rabbi Eliezer says: The frontplate effects acceptance for eaten, Rabbi Yosei says: The frontplate does not effect acceptance for eaten?
llm_translation: Say to him, to Rabbi Yossi, that he did not enter the chamber of the forehead-plate regarding the eating. Did you hear him? And it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, "The forehead-plate atones for eating." Rabbi Yossi says, "The forehead-plate does not atone for eating."

hebrew_text: איפוך רבי אליעזר אומר אין הציץ מרצה על אכילות רבי יוסי אומר הציץ מרצה על אכילות
human_translation: Reverse Rabbi Eliezer says: The frontplate does not effect acceptance for eaten, Rabbi Yosei says: The frontplate does effect acceptance for eaten.
llm_translation: Reversal. Rabbi Eliezer says, "The forehead-plate does not atone for eating." Rabbi Yosi says, "The forehead-plate atones for eating."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב ששת ומי מצית אפכת לה והתניא יכול בשר שנטמא לפני זריקת דמים יהו חייבין עליהן משום טומאה
human_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to this: And are you able to reverse But isn’t it taught might that impure sacrificial meat, before the sprinkling of the blood liable for it due to ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet objects to her: And do you find it repulsive? But it was taught in a Baraita: One might have thought that if the flesh became impure before the sprinkling of the blood, they should be liable for it due to impurity.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא ז, יט) כל טהור יאכל בשר והנפש אשר תאכל בשר מזבח השלמים אשר ליי' וטומאתו עליו ונכרתה הניתר לטהורין חייבין עליו משום טומאה
human_translation: the verse states: “Every one that is ritually pure may eat of it” “But the soul that eats of the meat of the sacrifice of peace offerings, that belong to the Lord, having his impurity upon him, shall be cut off that which has become permitted to those who are ritually pure, liable for it due to ritually impure.
llm_translation: The text states (Leviticus 7:19): "Every pure one shall eat meat, and the soul that eats meat from the peace offering sacrifice to the Lord, and his impurity is upon him, and the remainder shall be cut off for the pure ones are obligated regarding it due to impurity."

hebrew_text: ושאינו ניתר לטהורין אין חייבין עליו משום טומאה
human_translation: But that which is not permitted to those who are pure, not liable for it due to ritually impure.
llm_translation: And one who is not separated for purity, they are not obligated upon him because of impurity.

hebrew_text: או אינו אלא נאכל לטהורין חייבין עליו משום טומאה ושאינו נאכל לטהורין אין חייבין עליו משום טומאה אוציא אני את הלן ואת היוצא שאינן נאכלין לטהורים
human_translation: Or is only is eaten by those who are ritually pure, liable for it due to ritually impure; but where that which is not eaten by those who are ritually pure, not liable for it due to ritually impure I would exclude that left overnight and that leaves which are not eaten by those who are ritually pure,
llm_translation: Or if it is only fit for consumption by the ritually pure, those who are impure are liable on account of impurity, and if it is not fit for consumption by the ritually pure, they are not liable on account of impurity. I will exclude here the produce and the derivative that are not fit for consumption by the ritually pure.

hebrew_text: ת"ל אשר ליי' ריבה
human_translation: the verse states: “That belong to the Lord,” included
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "ת"ל אשר ליי' ריבה" English translation: "It is taught: 'Asher L'Yah Rivah.'"

hebrew_text: יכול שאני מרבה את הפיגולין ואת הנותרות
human_translation: might that I include the piggul and the notar .
llm_translation: It is possible that I increase the disqualified offerings and the remaining portions.

hebrew_text: נותרות היינו לן אלא אף הפיגולין כנותרות ת"ל מזבח השלמים מיעט
human_translation: Isn’t notar left overnight, Rather, even the piggul , as notar the verse states: “Of the meat of the sacrifice of peace offerings,” excluded
llm_translation: The remnants are for us, but even the disqualified offerings are like remnants. The verse teaches: "from the altar of the peace offerings, he shall take a handful."

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות את אלו ולהוציא את אלו אחר שריבה הכתוב ומיעט אמרת מרבה אני את אלו שהיתה להן שעת הכושר ומוציא אני את אלו שלא היתה להן שעת הכושר
human_translation: And what did you see to include these, and to exclude those, After the verse included and excluded you say I include these, as they had a period of fitness And I exclude those, as they never had a period of fitness,
llm_translation: And what did you see to include these and to exclude those after the Scripture has made a comparison and limited it? You said, "I include these that had the time of fitness, and I exclude those that did not have the time of fitness."

hebrew_text: וא"ת בשר שנטמא לפני זריקת דמים ואכלו לאחר זריקת דמים מפני מה חייבין עליו משום טומאה מפני שהציץ מרצה
human_translation: And if you say meat that became impure before the sprinkling of the blood, and ate it after the sprinkling of the blood, for what liable for it due to ritually impure because the frontplate effects acceptance
llm_translation: And if you will ask: meat that became impure before the sprinkling of the blood, and one ate it after the sprinkling of the blood, why are they liable regarding it due to impurity? Because he glanced at the floor.

hebrew_text: נטמא אין יוצא לא
human_translation: became impure, yes, leaves does not
llm_translation: He became impure - not he goes out.

hebrew_text: מאן שמעת ליה דאמר אין זריקה מועלת ליוצא רבי אליעזר וקתני דמרצה ציץ על אכילות
human_translation: Who did you hear who says sprinkling not effective leaves Rabbi Eliezer, and teaches that frontplate effects acceptance for eaten.
llm_translation: Who heard him say that throwing is not effective for the one who is leaving? Rabbi Eliezer and it is taught in the Mishnah: "A flowerpot is susceptible to impurity through contact with food."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב חסדא לא קשיא הא רבי אליעזר הא רבנן
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisda said: not difficult. This Rabbi Eliezer, that the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ḥisda said: It is not difficult. Here, it is Rabbi Eliezer; there, it is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אימר דשמעת ליה לר' אליעזר דמרצה ציץ על אכילות דלא קניס מי שמעת ליה אין כי היכי דשמעת ליה לר' יוסי שמעת ליה לרבי אליעזר דתניא רבי אליעזר אומר בין בשוגג בין במזיד תרומתו תרומה
human_translation: say that you heard Rabbi Eliezer that frontplate effects acceptance for eaten, did you hear him that did not penalize Yes. Just as you heard Rabbi Yosei you heard Rabbi Eliezer as it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: Whether unwittingly or intentionally, his teruma is teruma .
llm_translation: Say that you heard from Rabbi Eliezer of Marzeh: "A flower blooms on non-sacred food." If you heard from him, good. If not, how will you hear from Rabbi Yossi? You heard from Rabbi Eliezer, as it is taught: Rabbi Eliezer says, whether unintentionally or intentionally, his contribution is a contribution.

hebrew_text: אימר דשמעת ליה לרבי אליעזר בתרומה דקילא בקדשים דחמירי מי שמעת ליה א"כ הא אמאן תרמייה
human_translation: say that you heard Rabbi Eliezer with regard to teruma , which lenient, did you hear him with regard to consecrated which severe? If so to whom will you attribute this
llm_translation: Say that you heard from Rabbi Eliezer regarding terumah of kilayim in holy things, which are stringent - did you hear from him? If so, who should separate it?

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר טומאתו בין בשוגג בין במזיד הורצה זריקתו בשוגג הורצה במזיד לא הורצה
human_translation: Ravina said its ritual impurity, unwittingly or intentionally, accepted, the sprinkling of unwittingly accepted, intentionally not accepted,
llm_translation: Ravina said: His impurity, whether accidental or intentional, his sprinkling is accepted if accidental, not accepted if intentional.

hebrew_text: ורב שילא אמר זריקתו בין בשוגג בין במזיד הורצה טומאתו בשוגג הורצה במזיד לא הורצה
human_translation: And Rabbi Sheila said the sprinkling of whether unwittingly or intentionally, accepted. its ritual impurity, unwittingly accepted, intentionally not accepted.
llm_translation: And Rav Shila said: Its throwing, whether done inadvertently or intentionally, its impurity is accepted. If it was done inadvertently, it is accepted; if it was done intentionally, it is not accepted.

hebrew_text: ולרב שילא [הא] דקתני שנטמא בין בשוגג בין במזיד ה"ק נטמא בשוגג וזרקו בין בשוגג בין במזיד
human_translation: And according to Rav Sheila, which is taught that was rendered impure whether unwittingly or intentionally, this it is saying: was rendered impure unwittingly and one sprinkled whether unwittingly or intentionally,
llm_translation: And for Rav Shila, that which was taught: Whether he became impure inadvertently or intentionally, this is what it means - he became impure inadvertently, and he sprinkled, whether inadvertently or intentionally.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דם שנטמא וזרקו בשוגג הורצה במזיד לא הורצה הכי קאמר דם שנטמא וזרקו בין בשוגג בין במזיד נטמא בשוגג הורצה במזיד לא הורצה:
human_translation: Come hear: blood that became impure and sprinkled it unwittingly, accepted intentionally, not accepted. this is saying: blood that became impure and sprinkled it, whether unwittingly or intentionally, rendered impure unwittingly accepted, intentionally not accepted.
llm_translation: Come and hear: Blood that became impure and was sprinkled unintentionally is accepted; if intentionally, it is not accepted. This is what it means: Blood that became impure and was sprinkled, whether unintentionally or intentionally, becomes impure unintentionally, it is accepted intentionally.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נטמאו שיריה נשרפו שיריה אבדו שיריה כמדת ר' אליעזר כשירה וכמדת רבי יהושע פסולה:
human_translation: the remainder of became ritually impure, the remainder of was burned, the remainder of was lost, according to the principle of Rabbi Eliezer, fit, But according to the principle of Rabbi Yehoshua, unfit
llm_translation: Mishnah: If its strings became ritually impure, its strings are burned; if its strings were lost, its strings are considered according to the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer - if it is fit, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Joshua - it is invalid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב והוא שנטמאו כל שיריה אבל מקצת שיריה לא
human_translation: Rav says: And this when all of its remainder became impure. But a part of its remainder not
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav said, "And this is only if all its hairs became impure, but if some of its hairs became impure, no it is not considered impure."

hebrew_text: קא סלקא דעתך נטמא אין אבוד ושרוף לא מאי קסבר אי קסבר שיורא מילתא היא אפילו אבוד ושרוף נמי אי קסבר שיורא לאו מילתא היא ונטמא מאי טעמא דמרצה ציץ אי הכי כל שיריה נמי
human_translation: enters your mind became impure, yes, was lost or burned, not What does hold? If he holds what remains is significant, even was lost or burned? if he holds what remains is not significant, And what is the reason became impure? because frontplate effects acceptance if that is so, even all of the remainder
llm_translation: Your mind has arisen: impure, lost, and burned, no. What does he hold? If he holds that it is a significant matter, even impure and burned also. If he holds that it is not a significant matter, and impure, what is the reason that the forehead-plate is acceptable? If so, all its flesh is also.

hebrew_text: לעולם קסבר שיורא מילתא היא ונטמא והוא הדין לאבוד ושרוף והאי דקאמר נטמא רישייהו נקט
human_translation: Actually, he holds what remains is significant, and became impure the same is true to was lost or burned. And that he stated became impure he employed the beginning of
llm_translation: Forever he holds that it is a matter of doubt and he becomes impure, and it is the same for lost and burnt items, and this that he said, "they become impure, their heads are taken."

hebrew_text: כדתני' רבי יהושע אומר כל הזבחים שבתורה שנשתייר מהן כזית בשר או כזית חלב זורק את הדם
human_translation: as it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua says: all the offerings in the Torah from which there remains an olive-bulk of meat or an olive-bulk of fat sprinkles the blood.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua says, "Regarding all the sacrifices in the Torah, if there remains from them an olive's worth of flesh or an olive's worth of fat, one should sprinkle the blood."

hebrew_text: כחצי זית בשר וכחצי זית חלב אינו זורק את הדם ובעולה אפי' כחצי זית בשר וכחצי זית חלב זורק את הדם מפני שכולה כליל ובמנחה אפי' כולה קיימת לא יזרוק
human_translation: half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of fat, does not sprinkle the blood. And with regard to a burnt offering, even half an olive-bulk of meat and half an olive-bulk of fat, sprinkles the blood, because it is consumed in its entirety. And with regard to a meal offering, although all of it remains shall not sprinkle
llm_translation: Like half an olive's worth of meat and like half an olive's worth of milk, one does not sprinkle the blood on the altar. But in the case of a burnt offering, even if it is like half an olive's worth of meat and like half an olive's worth of milk, one sprinkles the blood because it is entirely consumed. And in the case of a meal offering, even if it is entirely intact, one should not sprinkle the blood.

hebrew_text: מנחה מאי עבידתה אמר רב פפא מנחת נסכים ס"ד הואיל ובהדי זבח קא אתיא כגופיה דזיבחא דמיא קמ"ל
human_translation: What is a meal offering doing Rav Pappa said: the meal offering libations enter your mind Since accompanies offering, comparable to the offering itself, teaches us
llm_translation: Mincha, what is its service? Rav Papa said: A meal-offering of libations. It is obvious, since it comes along with a sacrifice, it is like the body of the sacrifice. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: מנהני מילי אמר רבי יוחנן משום רבי ישמעאל ומטו בה משום רבי יהושע בן חנניא אמר קרא (ויקרא יז, ו) והקטיר החלב לריח ניחוח לה' חלב ואע"פ שאין בשר
human_translation: From where is this matter Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, and determined it in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Ḥananya: The verse states: and he shall make the fat smoke for a pleasing aroma to the Lord” fat, even if there is no meat,
llm_translation: The matter from where? Rabbi Yochanan said in the name of Rabbi Yishmael, and they came with it in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Chananya. It is said in the verse (Leviticus 17:6), "And he shall burn the fat for a sweet savor unto the Lord." Fat, even though there is no meat.

hebrew_text: ואשכחן חלב יותרת ושתי כליות מנלן דקתני ובמנחה אפילו כולה קיימת לא יזרוק מנחה הוא דלא יזרוק הא יותרת ושתי כליות יזרוק
human_translation: And we found fat From where do we lobe or two kidneys, that is taught And with regard to a meal offering, although all of it remains shall not sprinkle it is a meal offering that shall not sprinkle but lobe or two kidneys sprinkles
llm_translation: And we found excess fat and two kidneys. From where do we derive that it was taught: "And in a meal offering, even if it is entirely intact, one should not discard the meal offering"? This is referring to not discarding the meal offering, but the excess fat and two kidneys should be discarded.

hebrew_text: מנלן רבי יוחנן דידיה אמר לריח ניחוח כל שאתה מעלה לריח ניחוח
human_translation: From where do we Rabbi Yoḥanan himself says: “For a pleasing aroma anything that you offer up for a pleasing aroma
llm_translation: From where do we derive that Rabbi Yochanan himself said regarding a pleasant aroma, "Any offering that you bring up is a pleasant aroma"?

hebrew_text: ואיצטריך למכתב חלב ואיצטריך למיכתב לריח ניחוח דאי כתב חלב הוה אמינא חלב אין יותרת ושתי כליות לא כתב רחמנא ריח ניחוח ואי כתב רחמנא לריח ניחוח הוה אמינא אפילו מנחה כתב רחמנא חלב:
human_translation: And was necessary to write “fat” and was necessary to write “for a pleasing aroma.” As, if had written “fat,” I would say fat yes, lobe or two kidneys not the Merciful One wrote “for a pleasing aroma.” And if the Merciful One had written “for a pleasing aroma,” I would say even a meal offering the Merciful One wrote “fat,”
llm_translation: And it was necessary to write "fat," and it was necessary to write "for a pleasing aroma." For if it had written "fat," I would have said, fat that is left over, and the two kidneys are not written. The Merciful One wrote "for a pleasing aroma," and if it had written "for a pleasing aroma," I would have said, even for a meal offering, the Merciful One wrote "fat."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שלא בכלי שרת פסול ורבי שמעון מכשיר הקטיר קומצה פעמים כשרה:
human_translation: that was not in a service vessel unfit, and Rabbi Shimon deems fit. burned the handful of twice, fit.
llm_translation: Mishnah: "Not in a service vessel invalid, and Rabbi Shimon deems fit to offer the handful twice valid."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רבי יהודה בריה דרבי חייא מאי טעמא דר' שמעון אמר קרא (ויקרא ז, א) קדש קדשים היא כחטאת וכאשם בא לעובדה ביד (כחטאת) עובדה בימין כחטאת בכלי עובדה בשמאל כאשם
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, says: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon? The verse states “It is most holy, as the sin offering, and as the guilt offering” comes to perform the rites of with hand, as a sin offering, he must perform its rites with right like the sin offering. with a vessel, he may perform its rites with left like the guilt offering.
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Yehudah, son of Rabbi Chiya, said: What is the reason that Rabbi Shimon said? It is because the verse states (Leviticus 7:1), "It is most holy, like the sin offering and like the guilt offering." He came to perform the service with the right hand (like the sin offering) - he performs the service with the right hand, with the vessel. He performs the service with the left hand (like the guilt offering).

hebrew_text: ורבי ינאי אמר כיון שקמצו מכלי שרת מעלהו ומקטירו אפילו בהמיינו ואפילו במקידה של חרש רב נחמן בר יצחק אמר הכל מודים בקומץ שטעון קידוש
human_translation: And Rabbi Yannai says: once removed the handful from a service vessel, he may bring it up and burn it even in his belt, or even in an earthenware vessel. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: All concede that handful requires sanctification
llm_translation: Rabbi Yannai said: Once they have taken a handful from the vessel of the service, one may elevate it and burn it, even with bare hands and even in a pottery vessel. Rav Nahman bar Yitzhak said: Everyone agrees that the handful requires sanctification.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי הקטר חלבים ואברים ועצים שהעלן בין ביד בין בכלי בין בימין ובין בשמאל כשרין הקומץ והקטורת והלבונה שהעלן בין ביד בין בכלי בין בימין בין בשמאל כשרין תיובתא דרבי יהודה בריה דרבי חייא
human_translation: raises an objection the burning of fats, and limbs, and wood that brought them up whether by hand or with a vessel, whether with right or with left they are fit. the handful, and the incense, and the frankincense, that brought them up whether by hand or with a vessel, whether with right or with left they are fit. a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya,
llm_translation: The question was raised: The incense, fats, limbs, and wood, whether they were brought in the hand or in a vessel, whether with the right hand or with the left, are valid. The handful, the incense, and the frankincense, whether they were brought in the hand or in a vessel, whether with the right hand or with the left, are valid. This is the refutation of Rabbi Yehuda, the son of Rabbi Chiya.

hebrew_text: אמר לך רבי יהודה בריה דרבי חייא לצדדין קתני ביד בימין בכלי בין בימין בין בשמאל:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, say to you teaches disjunctively, by hand, with right with a vessel, whether with right or with left,
llm_translation: Said to you Rabbi Yehuda son of Rabbi Chiya to the sides it teaches in hand in right in vessel whether in right whether in left:

hebrew_text: תא שמע קמצו שלא מכלי שרת וקידשו שלא בכלי שרת והעלו והקטירו שלא בכלי שרת פסול רבי אלעזר ורבי שמעון מכשירין במתן כלי
human_translation: Come hear removed the handful, not from a service vessel, and sanctified it, not in a service vessel, and brought it up and burned it, not in a service vessel, unfit. Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon deem fit in placed vessel.
llm_translation: Come and hear: their handful of meal-offering is invalid if not from sacred vessels, and they sanctified it if not in sacred vessels, and they offered and burned it if not in sacred vessels - it is invalid. Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Shimon deem it valid with the giving of vessels.

hebrew_text: אימא ממתן כלי ואילך
human_translation: Say from placed vessel and onward,
llm_translation: Say from the giving of a vessel and onward.

hebrew_text: תא שמע וחכמים אומרים קומץ טעון כלי שרת כיצד קומצו מכלי שרת ומקדשו בכלי שרת ומעלו ומקטירו בכלי שרת ר' שמעון אומר כיון שקמצו מכלי שרת מעלו ומקטירו שלא בכלי שרת ודיו
human_translation: Come hear: And the Rabbis say: handful requires a service vessel. How removes the handful from a service vessel, and sanctifies it in a service vessel, and brings it up and burns it in a service vessel. Rabbi Shimon says: Once the handful is removed from a service vessel, bring it up and burn it not in a service vessel, and is sufficient for it.
llm_translation: Come and hear: The sages say, "A handful requires a vessel of service." How so? They would gather it from a vessel of service, sanctify it in a vessel of service, elevate it, and offer it up in a vessel of service. Rabbi Shimon says, "Once they gathered it from a vessel of service, they may elevate and offer it up not in a vessel of service, and it suffices."

hebrew_text: אימא כיון שקמצו וקדשו בכלי שרת מעלו ומקטירו ודיו
human_translation: Say once removes the handful and sanctifies it in a service vessel, bring it up and burn it, and is sufficient for it.
llm_translation: Say: once they crumbled and sanctified in the sacred vessels, they would elevate and offer it up, and enough.

hebrew_text: תא שמע קמץ בימינו ונתן בשמאלו יחזיר לימינו בשמאלו
human_translation: Come hear: removed the handful with his right and put in his left he shall return it to his right in his left
llm_translation: Come and hear: He gathered in his right hand and placed in his left, he shall return to his right hand with his left.

hebrew_text: וחישב עליה בין חוץ למקומו בין חוץ לזמנו פסול ואין בו כרת
human_translation: and he intended of whether outside its area or beyond its time, not valid, but there is no karet of it.
llm_translation: And he calculated upon it, whether outside its place or outside its time, it is invalid, and it does not incur karet.

hebrew_text: (ל"א) חישב עליה חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת דברי ר' אלעזר ור"ש
human_translation: he intended of outside its area, not valid, but there is no karet of it. beyond its time, piggul and is liable karet . the statement of Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: (31a) Calculated upon it outside its place invalid and does not have karet outside its time pigul and liable upon it karet the words of Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: וחכ"א כיון שנתנו לשמאל פסלתו מתנתו מ"ט משום דבעי קדושה בכלי וכיון שנתנו לשמאל נעשה כדם שנשפך מצואר בהמה על הרצפה ואספו שפסול
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Once he put in left placing renders it unfit What is the reason? because it requires sanctification in vessel, and once he put it in left it is considered like blood that spilled from an animal’s neck onto the floor and one gathered it, which unfit
llm_translation: And the sages of blessed memory: once it was placed on the left, its gift is disqualified. What is the reason? Because it requires sanctity in a vessel. And once it was placed on the left, it becomes like blood that is spilled from the neck of an animal onto the ground, and it is rendered invalid.

hebrew_text: מכלל דר"א ור"ש לא בעו מתן כלי תיובתא דרב נחמן תיובתא
human_translation: By inference, that Rabbi Elazar and Rabbi Shimon do not require placing vessel. a conclusive refutation of Rav Naḥman a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: From the principle of Rabbi Akiva and Rabbi Shimon, they did not require the gift of the vessel of refutation of Rav Nachman's refutation.

hebrew_text: לרבי יהודה בריה דרבי חייא מסייעא לי' לרבי ינאי לימא תיהוי תיובתא
human_translation: supports Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ḥiyya, Shall we say is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yannai,
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Chiya, it is a support for Rabbi Yannai to say: Let it be a refutation.

hebrew_text: אמר לך רבי ינאי אנא דאמרי כתנא דהקטר ולאו לצדדים קתני:
human_translation: Rabbi Yannai say to you: I stated in accordance with the tanna that burning And does not teach disjunctively,
llm_translation: Said to you Rabbi Yannai: "I, who say like the Tanna of the incense offering, and not like the Tziddeim he teaches:"

hebrew_text: הקטיר קומצה פעמים כשרה: אמר רבי יהושע בן לוי פעמים ולא פעמי פעמים ור' יוחנן אמר פעמים ואפילו פעמי פעמים
human_translation: burned the handful of twice, fit. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: twice, but not several times, And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: twice, and even several times.
llm_translation: The burning of the handful is valid. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: "times" and not "times of times," and Rabbi Yochanan said: "times" and even "times of times."

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו א"ר זירא יש קומץ פחות משני זיתים ויש הקטרה פחותה מכזית איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What between Rabbi Zeira said: between is there is a handful less than two olives and whether there is burning less than an olive-bulk
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rabbi Zeira said: There is a handful less than two olives, and there is a burning less than a log. This is the difference between them.

hebrew_text: ריב"ל סבר אין קומץ פחות משני זיתים ואין הקטרה פחותה מכזית ורבי יוחנן סבר יש קומץ פחות משני זיתים ויש הקטרה פחותה מכזית:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi holds there is no a handful less than two olives and there is no burning less than an olive-bulk And Rabbi Yoḥanan holds there is a handful less than two olives and there is burning less than an olive-bulk
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi holds: A kometz is not less than two olives, and the ketoret is not less than a k'zayit. And Rabbi Yochanan holds: There is a kometz less than two olives, and there is a ketoret less than a k'zayit.

hebrew_text: איתמר קומץ מאימתי מתיר שירים באכילה רבי חנינא אומר משמשלה בו את האור רבי יוחנן אמר משתצית בו את האור ברובו
human_translation: It was stated: From when does handful render permitted remainder for consumption Rabbi Ḥanina says: From when the fire takes hold of it, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: From when the fire consumes most of
llm_translation: It was stated: From when is one permitted to recite the Shema during a meal? Rabbi Chanina says: When one can benefit from its light. Rabbi Yochanan says: When one can discern its light by its abundance.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב יהודה לרבה בר רב יצחק אסברה לך טעמא דר' יוחנן אמר קרא (בראשית יט, כח) והנה עלה קיטור הארץ כקיטור הכבשן אין כבשן מעלה קיטור עד שתצית האור ברובו
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said to Rabba bar Rav Yitzḥak: I will explain to you the reasoning of Rabbi Yoḥanan. The verse states: “And behold, the smoke of the land went up as the smoke of a furnace” a furnace does not release smoke until the fire takes hold of the majority of
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Yehudah to Rabba bar Rav Yitzchak, "I will explain to you the reasoning of Rabbi Yochanan who said: 'And smoke went up from the land like the smoke of a furnace' (Genesis 19:28) - a furnace does not emit smoke until the fire is kindled in its majority."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבין בר רב אדא לרבא אמרי תלמידיך אמר רב עמרם תניא אין לי אלא דברים שדרכן ליקרב בלילה כגון אברים ופדרים שמעלן ומקטירן מבוא השמש ומתעכלין והולכין כל הלילה כולה
human_translation: Ravin bar Rav Adda said to Rava: Your students say Rav Amram said it is taught I have only items whose manner to be sacrificed at night, for example, limbs and fats [ pedarim ] that may bring them up and burn them after sunset and they are consumed throughout the entire night.
llm_translation: Rabin son of Rav Adda said to Rava: Your disciples said, Rav Amram said: It was taught in a Baraita: I only have things whose way is to approach at night, such as limbs and fats that are offered and burned from the entrance of the sun until they are consumed, and they walk the entire night.

hebrew_text: דברים שדרכן ליקרב ביום כגון הקומץ והלבונה והקטרת ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משוח ומנחת נסכים שמעלן ומקטירן מבוא השמש
human_translation: items whose manner is to be sacrificed during the day, for example, the handful the frankincense, the incense, the meal offering of priests, the meal offering of anointed priest, and the meal offering libations, that may bring them up and burn them after sunset?
llm_translation: Matters that their way is to bring close during the day, such as the incense offering, frankincense, the ketoret, the meal offering of the priests, the meal offering of an anointed priest, and the meal offering of libations, they elevate and burn them at the entrance of the sun.

hebrew_text: והא אמרת דרכן ליקרב ביום אלא עם בא השמש שמתעכלין והולכין כל הלילה מנין ת"ל (ויקרא ו, ב) זאת תורת העולה ריבה
human_translation: But didn’t you say whose manner is to be sacrificed during the day? Rather, From where with the setting of the sun, which they are consumed throughout the entire night The verse states: “This is the law of the burnt offering” included
llm_translation: And behold, you said their way is to come close during the day, but with the setting of the sun they become despicable and go away all night. From where do we derive this? It is written (Leviticus 6:2), "This is the law of the burnt offering, it is the burnt offering that stays on the firewood upon the altar all night."

hebrew_text: והא עם בא השמש לא משכחת לה שתצית האור ברובו לא קשיא כאן לקלוט כאן להתיר
human_translation: But with the setting of the sun, you do not find that the majority of it is consumed by the fire not difficult. Here, to receive There, to render permitted
llm_translation: And the ah, with the coming of the sun, you do not forget to place the light in its majority, it is not difficult here to receive, here to permit.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר מתני לה מבוא השמש ומוקים לה בפוקעין וכן כי אתא רב דימי אמר רבי ינאי בפוקעין
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar teaches after sunset. And he interprets to dislodged And similarly, when Rav Dimi came Rabbi Yannai said to dislodged
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar teaches her: "From the entrance of the sun, and establish for her in Puk'in." And similarly, when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Yannai said: "In Puk'in."

hebrew_text: ומי אמר רבי ינאי הכי והא א"ר ינאי קטרת שפקעה מעל גבי המזבח אפילו קרטין שבה אין מחזירין אותן ותני רב חנינא בר מניומי בדבי ר"א בן יעקב (ויקרא ו, ג) אשר תאכל האש את העולה על המזבח עיכולי עולה אתה מחזיר ואי אתה מחזיר עיכולי קטרת סמי מיכן קטרת
human_translation: And did Rabbi Yannai say this? But doesn’t Rabbi Yannai say: incense that was dislodged from on top of the altar, may not return even small lumps of it And Rav Ḥanina bar Minyumi from the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov taught “That which the fire will consume of the burnt offering on the altar” of a burnt offering consumed you shall return but you do not return incense consumed Remove from here incense,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Did Rabbi Yannai say so? But didn't Rabbi Yannai say: If the incense was removed from on top of the altar, even the smallest amount in it is not returned? And Rav Chanina bar Minyumi taught in the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: "The fire shall consume the burnt offering on the altar" (Leviticus 6:3) - you return the remains of a burnt offering, but if you do not return the remains of a burnt offering, you return the remains of incense. From here, incense is similar to a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: א"ר אסי כי פשיט רבי אלעזר במנחות בעי הכי (בעי ר' אלעזר) קומץ שסידרו וסידר עליו את המערכה מהו דרך הקטרה בכך או אין דרך הקטרה בכך תיקו:
human_translation: Rabbi Asi said: When Rabbi Elazar would explain of meal offerings, raise dilemma: Rabbi Elazar raises a dilemma: a handful that arranged and he arranged the arrangement on top of it, what is this manner of burning, or this not manner of burning, shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Assi said: When Rabbi Elazar asked thus regarding the Minchah offering: "If one arranged the handful and then arranged the arrangement upon it, what is the law - is this the proper way of offering incense or not the proper way of offering incense?" - Teiku.

hebrew_text: בעי חזקיה אברין שסידרן וסידר עליהן את המערכה מהו על העצים אמר רחמנא דוקא על העצים או דלמא כיון דכתיב קרא אחרינא אשר תאכל האש את העולה על המזבח אי בעי הכי עביד אי בעי הכי עביד תיקו:
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya raises a dilemma: limbs that arranged and arranged the arrangement on top of them, what is the Merciful One states: upon the wood specifically upon the wood? Or perhaps, since it is written another verse: “That which the fire will consume of the burnt offering on the altar” if desires this do and if desires that do shall stand
llm_translation: Inquired Hezekiah: "Regarding the limbs that he arranged and placed the arrangement upon them, what is the ruling concerning the wood?" Said the Merciful One: Specifically on the wood, or perhaps since it is written another verse, 'which the fire shall consume, the burnt-offering upon the altar,' if he desires, he may do so; if he desires, he may do so. The matter stands undecided.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי יצחק נפחא אברין שסידרן בצידי המערכה מהו אליבא דמ"ד על ממש לא תיבעי לך
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak Nappaḥa raises a dilemma: limbs that arranged adjacent to the arrangement what is Do not raise the dilemma according to of the one who says “upon [ al ] literally,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzhak Nafḥa asked: "Regarding the limbs that were arranged on the sides of the altar, what is the halakha according to the opinion of Rabbi Meir? You do not need to ask about the actual limbs."

hebrew_text: דעל העצים כתיב
human_translation: as “upon [ al ] is written,
llm_translation: On the trees it is written.

hebrew_text: כי תיבעי לך אליבא דמ"ד על בסמוך מאי ה"נ על בסמוך או דלמא על העצים דומיא דעל המזבח מה התם על ממש אף ה"נ על ממש תיקו:
human_translation: When should you raise the dilemma? according to of the one who says “upon [ al ]” adjacent to. what here, too, “upon [ al ] adjacent to Or perhaps, “upon the wood” similar to “upon the altar”: Just as there “upon literally, so too here, “upon literally. shall stand
llm_translation: When it is necessary for you according to the opinion of Rabbi Meir, regarding the adjacent laws, what is the ruling? Is it regarding the adjacent laws, or perhaps regarding the wood that is similar to the altar? Just as there it is on the actual altar, so too here it is on the actual wood. The matter remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הקומץ מיעוטו מעכב את רובו עשרון מיעוטו מעכב את רובו היין מיעוטו מעכב את רובו השמן מיעוטו מעכב את רובו
human_translation: the handful, the minority of it prevents the majority of it, a tenth the minority of it prevents the majority of it, the wine the minority of it prevents the majority of it, the oil the minority of it prevents the majority of it,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The handful of meal-offering - its minority impedes its majority. The tenth of an animal tithe - its minority impedes its majority. The wine - its minority impedes its majority. The oil - its minority impedes its majority.

hebrew_text: הסולת והשמן מעכבין זה את זה הקומץ והלבונה מעכבין זה את זה:
human_translation: the fine flour and the oil, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. the handful and the frankincense, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other.
llm_translation: The fine flour and the oil impede each other; the handful and the frankincense impede each other.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מ"ט אמר קרא (ויקרא ב, ב) מלא קומצו תרי זימני
human_translation: What is the reason the verse states “his handful” twice,
llm_translation: The Gemara: "The Sage said: The verse states (Leviticus 2:2), 'His handful of fine flour, twice.'"

hebrew_text: עשרון מיעוטו מעכב את רובו מאי טעמא אמר קרא (ויקרא ב, ב) מסלתה שאם חסרה כל שהוא פסולה
human_translation: a tenth the minority of it prevents the majority of it What is the reason? The verse states: of its fine flour” that if any amount was missing, not valid.
llm_translation: The tenth of its minority impedes its majority. What is the reason? The verse says (Leviticus 2:2), "Its meal offering, if it lacks anything, it is invalid."

hebrew_text: היין מיעוטו מעכב את רובו ככה
human_translation: the wine the minority of it prevents the majority of it “So
llm_translation: The wine, its minority, impedes its majority, thus.

hebrew_text: השמן מיעוטו מעכב את רובו דמנחת נסכים ככה ומנחת נדבה אמר קרא (ויקרא ב, ב) ומשמנה שאם חסר כל שהוא פסולה
human_translation: the oil the minority of it prevents the majority of it of the meal offering libations, “So” And a voluntary meal offering, the verse states: “And of its oil” that if any amount missing, not valid.
llm_translation: The oil, its small quantity, impedes its majority of the meal-offering of libations thus and meal-offering of voluntary offering said the verse (Leviticus 2:2) "and from its oil if it is lacking anything at all it is disqualified."

hebrew_text: השמן והסולת מעכבין זה את זה מסלתה ומשמנה מגרשה ומשמנה
human_translation: the fine flour and the oil, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. of its fine flour and of its oil” “Of its groats, and of its oil”
llm_translation: The oil and the flour prevent each other from becoming leavened, from being separated, and from being anointed.

hebrew_text: הקומץ והלבונה מעכבין זה את זה (ויקרא ב, ב) על כל לבונתה (ויקרא ו, ח) ואת כל הלבונה אשר על המנחה:
human_translation: the handful and the frankincense, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. as well as all of its frankincense” “And all the frankincense which is upon the meal offering”
llm_translation: The handful and the frankincense inhibit each other (Leviticus 2:2) for all its frankincense (Leviticus 6:8) and all its frankincense that is upon the meal offering.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שני שעירי יה"כ מעכבין זה את זה שני כבשי עצרת מעכבין זה את זה ב' חלות מעכבות זו את זו
human_translation: the two goats of Yom Kippur, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. the two sheep Shavuot , each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. two loaves each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Two goats of Yom Kippurim impede each other. Two lambs of Shavuot impede each other. Two loaves impede each other.

hebrew_text: שני סדרין מעכבין זה את זה שני בזיכין מעכבין זה את זה הסדרין והבזיכין מעכבין זה את זה
human_translation: two arrangements each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. two bowls each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. the arrangements and the bowls each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other.
llm_translation: Two orders impede one another, two compartments impede one another, the orders and the compartments impede one another.

hebrew_text: ב' מינים שבנזיר ג' שבפרה וד' שבתודה וד' שבלולב וארבע שבמצורע מעכבין זה את זה
human_translation: two types that of a nazirite: three that of the heifer: and four that the thanks offering: and four of the lulav : and four that are in the leper: each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others.
llm_translation: Two minims of a Nazir, three of a cow, four of a thanksgiving offering, and four of a lulav, and four of a leper, they impede each other.

hebrew_text: שבעה הזאות שבפרה מעכבות זו את זו ז' הזיות שעל בין הבדים שעל הפרכת שעל מזבח הזהב מעכבות זו את זו:
human_translation: seven sprinklings of the heifer each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others. seven sprinklings that on between the staves that on the Curtain that on the golden altar each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others.
llm_translation: Seven sprinklings in the heifer that impede one another, seven sprinklings between the staves on the partition, on the golden altar, impede one another.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ שני שעירי יה"כ מעכבין זה את זה חוקה
human_translation: the two goats of Yom Kippur, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. a statute
llm_translation: Gemara: Two Sa'ir goats of Yom Kippur impede each other statute.

hebrew_text: שני כבשי עצרת מעכבין זה את זה הויה שתי חלות הויה
human_translation: the two sheep Shavuot , each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. being two loaves being.
llm_translation: Two lambs of Shavuot delay each other - it is a "havayah"; two loaves - it is a "havayah."

hebrew_text: שני סדרין חוקה שני בזיכין חוקה הסדרין והבזיכין חוקה
human_translation: two arrangements statute two bowls statute the arrangements and the bowls statute
llm_translation: Two orders, a red heifer is an order, two bazichin is an order, the red heifer and the bazichin is an order.

hebrew_text: שני מינים שבנזיר דכתיב כן יעשה ג' שבפרה חוקה
human_translation: two types that of a nazirite, as it is written “So he must do three that of the heifer, statute
llm_translation: Two types in a Nazirite, as it is written, "So shall he do; three in the heifer of the statute."

hebrew_text: ארבעה שבתודה דאיתקש לנזיר דכתיב (ויקרא ז, יג) על זבח תודת שלמיו ואמר מר שלמיו לרבות שלמי נזיר
human_translation: four that the thanks offering, since is juxtaposed to a nazirite, as it is written “With the sacrifice of his peace offerings for thanksgiving” And the Master said: “his peace offerings” to include the peace offering of a nazirite,
llm_translation: Four thanksgiving offerings that are compared to a Nazirite, as it is written (Leviticus 7:13), "For his thanksgiving offering, with which he gives thanks." And the Master said, "His thanksgiving offering" includes the thanksgiving offering of a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: וארבעה שבמצורע דכתי' (ויקרא יד, ב) זאת תהיה תורת המצורע וד' שבלולב (ויקרא כג, מ) ולקחתם לקיחה תמה
human_translation: And four that are in the leper, as it is written: “This shall be the law of the leper” And four of the lulav , “And you shall take” [ ulkaḥtem ]” A complete taking [ lekiḥa tamma ],
llm_translation: "And four in the case of a metzora, as it is written (Leviticus 14:2), 'This shall be the law of the metzora,' and four in the case of a lulav (Leviticus 23:40), 'And you shall take for yourselves on the first day the fruit of a beautiful tree.'"

hebrew_text: אמר רב חנן בר רבא ל"ש אלא שאין לו אבל יש לו אין מעכבין
human_translation: Rav Ḥanan bar Rava says: taught only where one did not have but one has does not prevent
llm_translation: Rav Hanan bar Rava said: "Lo shanu ela she'ein lo aval yesh lo ein ma'akvin."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי ד' מינין שבלולב ב' מהן עושין פירות וב' מהם אין עושין פירות העושין פירות יהיו זקוקין לשאין עושין ושאין עושין פירות יהיו זקוקין לעושין פירות ואין אדם יוצא ידי חובתו בהן עד שיהו כולן באגודה אחת
human_translation: raises an objection four species of the lulav , two of them, produce fruit, and two of them, do not produce fruit. Those that produce fruit have a bond with those that do not produce fruit, and those that do not produce fruit have a bond with those that produce fruit. And a person does not fulfill his obligation until they are all in a single bundle.
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: Four species in the lulav, two of them produce fruits and two of them do not produce fruits. Those that produce fruits will be dependent on those that do not produce, and those that do not produce fruits will be dependent on those that produce fruits. And a person does not fulfill his obligation with them until all of them are bound together in one bundle.

hebrew_text: וכן ישראל בהרצאה עד שיהו כולן באגודה אחת שנאמר (עמוס ט, ו) הבונה בשמים מעלותיו ואגודתו על ארץ יסדה
human_translation: And so too, the Jewish people for acceptance until they are all in a single bundle, as it is stated: “It is He that builds His upper chambers in the Heaven, and has established His bundle upon the earth”
llm_translation: And so too Israel in assembly until they all are in one group, as it is stated (Amos 9:6), "He who builds His upper chambers in the heavens and has founded His group on the earth."

hebrew_text: תנאי היא דתניא לולב בין אגוד בין שאינו אגוד כשר ר' יהודה אומר אגוד כשר שאינו אגוד פסול
human_translation: is tanna’im ; as it is taught A lulav , whether bound whether not bound, fit. Rabbi Yehuda says: bound, fit; not bound, unfit.
llm_translation: It is a Tannaitic teaching as it was taught: A lulav, whether bound or unbound, is valid. Rabbi Yehuda says: A bound lulav is valid, an unbound one is invalid.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דר' יהודה גמר קיחה קיחה מאגודת אזוב
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda? derives taking, from taking the bundle of hyssop.
llm_translation: What is the reason that Rabbi Yehuda concluded the law of taking the ashes of the Red Heifer from a bundle of hyssop?

hebrew_text: מה להלן באגודה אף כאן באגודה ורבנן לא גמרי קיחה קיחה
human_translation: Just as there, in a bundle, so too here, in a bundle. And the Rabbis? They do not derive taking taking
llm_translation: What is the case there with regard to a bundle, so too here with regard to a bundle, and the Rabbis did not conclude definitively regarding the acquisition of each individual item.

hebrew_text: כמאן אזלא הא דתניא לולב מצוה לאוגדו ואם לא אגדו כשר כמאן אי כרבי יהודה לא אגדו אמאי כשר אי רבנן מאי מצוה
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which is taught a mitzva to bind lulav , but if one did not bind it, fit? In accordance with whose If in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, one did not bind it, why fit? If the Rabbis, what mitzva
llm_translation: As to whom does this go according to? This is as it was taught: "The lulav is a mitzvah to bind, and if not bound, it is valid." According to whom? If according to Rabbi Yehuda, if not bound, why is it valid? If according to the Rabbis, what is the mitzvah?

hebrew_text: לעולם רבנן ומאי מצוה משום (שמות טו, ב) זה אלי ואנוהו:
human_translation: Actually, the Rabbis. And what mitzva due to “This is my God and I will beautify Him”
llm_translation: Always the sages, and what is the commandment because (Exodus 15:2) "This is my God and I will glorify Him."

hebrew_text: שבע הזאות שבפרה מעכבות זו את זו חוקה
human_translation: seven sprinklings of the heifer each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others, statute
llm_translation: Seven splashes in a heifer impede one another, a statute.

hebrew_text: שבע הזאות שעל בין הבדים ושעל מזבח הזהב ושעל הפרוכת מעכבות זו את זו דיה"כ כתיב חוקה
human_translation: seven sprinklings that on between the staves, and that on the golden altar and that on the Curtain each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others. of Yom Kippur, “statute” is written
llm_translation: Seven splashes that are on between the poles and on the golden altar and on the curtain impede one another. Regarding this, it is written: "A statute for the Day of Atonement."

hebrew_text: דפר כהן משוח ודפר העלם דבר של ציבור ודשעירי עבודת כוכבים כדתניא (ויקרא ד, כ) ועשה לפר כאשר עשה לפר מה ת"ל לכפול בהזאות
human_translation: of the bull of anointed priest, and of the bull for an unwitting communal sin, and of the goats of idol worship, as it is taught “So shall he do with the bull; as he did with the bull Why the verse state to repeat of the sprinklings,
llm_translation: The priest anointed and the priest who speaks on behalf of the public, and the he-goats of idol worship, as it was taught (Leviticus 4:20), "And he shall do with the bull as he did with the bull." What is the teaching for? To include in sprinklings.

hebrew_text: שאם חיסר אחת מן המתנות לא עשה כלום:
human_translation: that if one omitted one of the placements he has done nothing.
llm_translation: If he omitted one of the gifts, he has done nothing.

hebrew_text: ת"ר שבע הזאות שבפרה שעשאן בין שלא לשמן בין שלא מכוונות (אל נכח פני אוהל מועד) פסולות
human_translation: The Sages taught performed the seven sprinklings of the heifer either not for their sake or not precisely toward the entrance of the Tent of Meeting they are not valid.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The seven sprinklings of the heifer, whether performed with intent or without intent, are invalid.

hebrew_text: ושבפנים ושבמצורע שלא לשמן פסולות שלא מכוונות כשרות
human_translation: But that inside and that of the leper, not for their sake, they are not valid. not precisely they are valid.
llm_translation: And inwards and in the leper, if not for the sake, invalid; if not directed, valid.

hebrew_text: והתניא גבי פרה שלא לשמן פסולות שלא מכוונות כשרות אמר רב חסדא ל"ק הא רבי יהודה הא רבנן
human_translation: But isn’t it taught concerning heifer not for their sake, they are not valid, not precisely they are valid? Rav Ḥisda said: not difficult; this Rabbi Yehuda, that the Rabbis.
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita regarding a cow that was not designated for anointing - disqualified; those that were not designated - valid. Rav Chisda said: This is not a dispute; this is Rabbi Yehuda, and this is the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דתניא מחוסרי כפרה שנכנסו לעזרה בשוגג חייב חטאת במזיד ענוש כרת ואין צ"ל טבול יום ושאר כל הטמאים
human_translation: As it is taught those who have not yet an atonement who entered the courtyard unwittingly, liable a sin offering. intentionally, punishable by karet . And needless to say, one who immersed that day and all the others who are ritually impure
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: Regarding those lacking atonement who entered the Temple courtyard unintentionally, they are liable for a sin offering; if intentionally, they incur the punishment of excision. This does not apply to one who has immersed in a mikveh that day or to other impure individuals.

hebrew_text: וטהורים שנכנסו לפנים ממחיצתן להיכל כולו בארבעים מבית לפרכת אל פני הכפרת במיתה רבי יהודה אומר כל היכל כולו ומבית לפרכת בארבעים ואל פני הכפרת במיתה
human_translation: And pure who entered beyond their boundaries, any of the Sanctuary, to forty within the Curtain before the Ark Cover, to death Rabbi Yehuda says: any of the Sanctuary or within the Curtain to forty but before the Ark Cover, to death
llm_translation: And the pure ones who entered inside from their partition to the entire sanctuary in forty cubits from the house to the veil, facing the ark cover, if they entered in a state of impurity, Rabbi Yehudah says: the entire sanctuary, and in forty cubits from the house to the veil, and facing the ark cover, they are liable to death.

hebrew_text: במאי קא מיפלגי בהאי קרא (ויקרא טז, ב) ויאמר יי' אל משה דבר אל אהרן אחיך ואל יבוא בכל עת אל הקודש מבית לפרוכת אל פני הכפורת אשר על הארון ולא ימות רבנן סברי אל הקודש בלא יבא מבית לפרכת ואל פני הכפרת בלא ימות
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? with regard to this verse: “And the Lord said to Moses: Speak to Aaron your brother, that he not come at all times into the holy place, within the Curtain, before the Ark Cover which is upon the Ark, that he not die” The Rabbis hold into the holy place, subject to He shall not come, within the Curtain and before the Ark Cover subject to He shall not die,
llm_translation: With what do they argue in this verse (Leviticus 16:2), "And the Lord said to Moses, speak to Aaron your brother, that he should not come at all times into the Holy Place within the veil before the mercy seat which is upon the ark, so that he does not die"? The Rabbis hold that "into the Holy Place" means without coming from within the veil, and "before the mercy seat" means without dying.

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה סבר אל הקודש ומבית לפרכת בלא יבא ואל פני הכפרת בלא ימות
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds into the holy place, and within the Curtain subject to He shall not come, before the Ark Cover subject to He shall not die,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds: "To the Holy Place and to the inside of the curtain one may not enter, and to the face of the atonement cover one may not die."

hebrew_text: מ"ט דרבנן אי ס"ד כדקאמר ר' יהודה לכתוב רחמנא אל הקודש ואל פני הכפרת ולא בעי מבית לפרכת ואנא אמינא היכל מיחייב מבית לפרכת מבעיא מבית הפרכת דכתב רחמנא למה לי ש"מ במיתה
human_translation: What is the reason of the Rabbis? If enter your mind as Rabbi Yehuda says, let the Merciful One write: into the holy place and before the Ark Cover and there is no need “within the Curtain,” and I would say: becomes liable Sanctuary, is necessary within the Curtain? Why do I “within the Curtain” that the Merciful One wrote? Learn from by death
llm_translation: Reason of the Rabbis: If you will say, as Rabbi Yehuda said, to write "the Merciful One" towards the Holy and towards the Atonement Cover, and it does not require from the House to the Partition, and I say, the Sanctuary is obligated from the House to the Partition, it requires from the House of the Partition. For the Merciful One wrote, "Why do I need it?" - infer from this regarding a death penalty.

hebrew_text: ור' יהודה אי כתב רחמנא אל הקודש ולא כתב מבית לפרכת הוה אמינא מאי קודש מבית לפרכת אבל היכל לאו נמי לא ורבנן ההוא לא מצית אמרת דהיכל כולו איקרי קודש שנאמר (שמות כו, לג) והבדילה הפרכת לכם בין הקודש ובין קדש הקדשים
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda If the Merciful One had written “into the holy place” and did not write “within the Curtain,” I would say: What holy place? within the Curtain, but Sanctuary not even a prohibition. And the Rabbis You cannot say that, as the entire Sanctuary is called holy place,” as it is stated: “And the Curtain shall divide for you between the holy place and the Holy of Holies”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda: If the Merciful One wrote "to the Holy" and did not write "from the house to the partition," I would say, what is considered holy from the house to the partition? But the Sanctuary is not considered holy either. And the Rabbis: That one did not kindle, you said, that the entire Sanctuary is called holy, as it is stated (Exodus 26:33), "And you shall separate the partition to yourselves between the holy and the Holy of Holies."

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה מ"ט אי ס"ד כדקא אמרי רבנן לכתוב רחמנא אל הקודש ומבית לפרכת ולא בעי אל פני הכפרת ואנא אמינא מבית לפרוכת במיתה אל פני הכפרת מיבעיא אל פני הכפרת דכתב רחמנא למה לי ש"מ אל פני הכפרת במיתה מבית לפרכת באזהרה
human_translation: And what is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? if enter your mind as the Rabbis say, let the Merciful One write: into the holy place and within the Curtain and there is no need “before the Ark Cover.” And I would say: within the Curtain, with death is necessary before the Ark Cover? Why do I “before the Ark Cover” that the Merciful One wrote? Learn from before the Ark Cover by death within the Curtain a prohibition.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda: What is the reason? If you say, as the Rabbis said, to write "the Merciful One" towards the Holy Ark and from the House to the Parochet, and it does not require "towards the Kaporet," but I say, from the House to the Parochet with death towards the Kaporet, it is necessary "towards the Kaporet." Why did the Merciful One write "towards the Kaporet"? Learn from this, "towards the Kaporet" with death, from the House to the Parochet with a warning.

hebrew_text: ורבנן ה"נ דלא צריך והאי דכתב רחמנא אל פני הכפרת למעוטי דרך משופש
human_translation: And the Rabbis Indeed, that is not necessary And that the Merciful One wrote “before [ el penei ] the Ark Cover” to exclude a roundabout path,
llm_translation: And the Rabbis say: This is not necessary. And this that the Merciful One wrote "before the cover" is to exclude the way of the shovel.

hebrew_text: כדתנא דבי ר"א בן יעקב אל פני הכפרת קדמה זה בנה אב כל מקום שנאמר פני אינו אלא פני קדים
human_translation: as the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov taught: before [ el penei ] the Ark Cover to the east” this established a paradigm any place where it is stated: “Before [ penei ],” nothing other than before eastern
llm_translation: As taught in the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Jacob, "In front of the kapporet, eastward" - this teaches that in every place where it says "face," it means eastward.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה לימא קרא פני מאי אל ש"מ אל דוקא ורבנן אל לאו דוקא
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda let the verse say: Before [ penei ] What el ? Learn from specifically before And the Rabbis “ el ” not specifically
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said: "What is the meaning of the verse 'El Shem'? 'El' specifically, and the Rabbis say: not specifically."

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה דאמר אל פני הכפרת דוקא (במדבר יט, ד) והזה אל נכח נמי דוקא

llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda said: "Before the cover specifically" (Numbers 19:4), "and sprinkle towards the front" also specifically.

human_translation: Rav Yosef objects to this According to Rabbi Yehuda, from that el specifically, before [ al also specifically But of the Second Temple, where there was no Ark or Ark Cover, indeed sprinklings were not performed?
llm_translation: Rav Yosef objects to Rabbi Yehuda: "From where do you derive that specifically (before) Him (Al Nakhakh) (is required)? Also specifically (before) Him (Al Nakhakh) (is required)? Rather, (it is) regarding the Second Temple, for there was no Ark and Cover (Ark and Kaporet). So too, (it is) that (it) does not make (the) sprinkling."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר עולא אמר קרא (ויקרא טז, לג) וכפר את מקדש הקודש מקום המקודש לקודש
human_translation: Rabba bar Ulla said The verse states “And he shall make atonement for the most holy place [ mikdash hakodesh ]” the place that is dedicated [ hamkudash ] for the Ark [ lakodesh ].
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Ulla said, the verse says (Leviticus 16:33), "And he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary, from the place of the Holy to the Holy."

hebrew_text: אמר מר ושבפנים ושבמצורע שלא לשמן פסולות שלא מכוונות כשרות והתניא בין שלא לשמן בין שלא מכוונות כשרות
human_translation: The Master says But that inside and that of the leper, not for their sake, they are not valid. not precisely they are valid. But isn’t it taught whether not for their sake or not precisely they are valid?
llm_translation: The Master said: "And those inside and those with tzara'at that are not for anointing are invalid, those that are not directed are valid. And it was taught: whether not for anointing or not directed, they are valid."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף לא קשיא הא רבי אליעזר והא רבנן רבי אליעזר דמקיש אשם לחטאת מקיש נמי לוג לאשם רבנן לא מקשי
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: not difficult. This Rabbi Eliezer, and that the Rabbis. Rabbi Eliezer who juxtaposes guilt offering to a sin offering, also juxtaposes log to guilt offering the Rabbis do not juxtapose
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is not difficult. Here, Rabbi Eliezer, and here, the Rabbis. Rabbi Eliezer, who compares an Asham (guilt offering) to a Chatat (sin offering), also compares a Log to an Asham. The Rabbis do not compare.

hebrew_text: ולרבי אליעזר וכי דבר הלמד בהיקש חוזר ומלמד בהיקש
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Eliezer, is it so that a matter derived via juxtaposition then teaches via juxtaposition?
llm_translation: And to Rabbi Eliezer, is it that a matter learned through a comparison returns and teaches through a comparison.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא הא והא רבנן כאן להכשיר (הקרבן) כאן להרצות (שלא עלו לבעלים לשום חובה):
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: this and that the Rabbis. Here, in rendering the offering valid there, effect acceptance, as they do not satisfy the obligation of the owner,
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: Here and here the Rabbis are present - here to validate the offering, here to appease so that the owners are not obligated.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שבעה קני מנורה מעכבין זה את זה שבעה נרותיה מעכבין זה את זה שתי פרשיות שבמזוזה מעכבות זו את זו אפילו כתב אחד מעכבן
human_translation: seven branches of the Candelabrum each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others. its seven lamps each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others. two passages that are in the mezuza , each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the other. even one letter prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with them.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Seven branches of the menorah impede one another; its seven lamps impede one another; two sections in the mezuzah impede one another; even if one wrote them together, they impede.

hebrew_text: ד' פרשיות שבתפילין מעכבין זו את זו אפילו כתב אחד מעכבן ד' ציציות מעכבות זו את זו שארבעתן מצוה אחת רבי ישמעאל אומר ארבעתן ארבע מצות:
human_translation: four passages that are in the phylacteries, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others. even one letter prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with them. four ritual fringes each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others, as the four of them one mitzva. Rabbi Yishmael says: The four of them are four mitzvot,
llm_translation: Four portions of the Tefillin impede one another; even if one wrote only one portion, they impede one another. Four Tzitzit impede one another; the four of them are one commandment. Rabbi Yishmael says: The four of them are four commandments.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מ"ט הויה כתיב בהו
human_translation: What is the reason It is written concerning them being:
llm_translation: Gemara: ma'at haviyah kativ behu

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן מנורה היתה באה מן העשת ומן הזהב עשאה מן הגרוטאות פסולה משאר מיני מתכות כשרה מאי שנא מן הגרוטאות פסולה דכתיב (שמות כה, לא) מקשה והויה שאר מיני מתכות נמי זהב והויה
human_translation: The Sages taught Candelabrum was fashioned from block [ ha’eshet ] and from gold. fashioned it from fragments [ hagerutaot ] unfit, from other types of metal fit. What different from fragments unfit? As it is written “beaten [ miksha ]” and being, other types of metal as well, gold and being.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A menorah that was made from wood or from gold, if made from nutshells it is invalid, but if made from other types of metals it is valid. What is the difference between nutshells that make it invalid? Because it is written (Exodus 25:31), "beaten work." And other types of metals also include gold, and it is valid.

hebrew_text: אמר קרא תיעשה לרבות שאר מיני מתכות ואימא לרבות גרוטאות לא ס"ד דאמקשה כתיבה הויה
human_translation: The verse states: will be made” to include other types of metal. But say to include fragments It cannot enter your mind as being, is written with regard to a beaten work,
llm_translation: The verse said: "shall be made" to include other types of metals. And say to include small coins. It is not so, for the writing is difficult.

hebrew_text: תיעשה נמי אמקשה כתיב מקשה מקשה לעכב
human_translation: “will be made” is also written with regard to a beaten work, “beaten work” “beaten work” to indispensable.
llm_translation: It shall be done also a difficult verse is written difficult difficult to delay.

hebrew_text: זהב זהב נמי לעכב
human_translation: “gold” “gold” as well to indispensable?
llm_translation: Gold, gold, also for the anchor.

hebrew_text: האי מאי אי אמרת בשלמא מן הגרוטאות פסולה משאר מיני מתכות כשרה היינו זהב זהב מקשה מקשה לדרשא אלא אי אמרת מן הגרוטאות כשרה משאר מיני מתכות פסולה זהב זהב מקשה מקשה מאי דרשת ביה
human_translation: What this Granted, if you say from fragments unfit from other types of metal fit, this is “gold,” “gold” “a beaten work,” “a beaten work” to an interpretation, But if you say from fragments fit from other types of metal unfit, what do you interpret from “gold,” “gold” “a beaten work,” “a beaten work”?
llm_translation: This what? If you say, "From the dross, it is invalid; from other types of metals, it is valid," that is, gold is like gold, and hard metal is like hard metal, for interpretation. But if you say, "From the dross, it is valid; from other types of metals, it is invalid," gold is like gold, and hard metal is like hard metal. What do you interpret in it?

hebrew_text: מאי דרשא דתניא (שמות כה, לט) ככר זהב טהור יעשה אותה את כל הכלים האלה באה זהב באה ככר אינה באה זהב אינה באה ככר (שמות כה, לא) גביעיה כפתוריה ופרחיה באה זהב באה גביעים כפתורים ופרחים אינה באה זהב אינה באה גביעים כפתורים ופרחים
human_translation: What interpretation As it is taught “Of a talent of pure gold will it be made, with all these vessels” fashioned gold, fashioned a talent; not fashioned gold not fashioned a talent. its goblets, its knobs, and its flowers” fashioned gold fashioned goblets, knobs, and flowers, not fashioned gold not fashioned goblets, knobs, and flowers.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: What is the interpretation of that which is taught (Exodus 25:39): "A talent of pure gold shall be used to make it, with all these utensils"? If gold came, it came by a talent; if a talent did not come, gold did not come. (Exodus 25:31) "Its cups, knobs, and flowers" - if gold came, cups, knobs, and flowers came; if a talent did not come, cups, knobs, and flowers did not come.

hebrew_text: ואימא נמי באה זהב באה קנים אינה באה זהב אינה באה קנים ההוא פמוט מיקרי
human_translation: But also say fashioned gold fashioned branches, not fashioned gold not fashioned branches? that is called a candlestick [ pamot ],
llm_translation: And say also, "If it comes, gold comes; if it does not come, reeds do not come." That one is called a "pamut."

hebrew_text: (במדבר ח, ד) וזה מעשה המנורה מקשה זהב באה זהב באה מקשה אינה באה זהב אינה באה מקשה
human_translation: “And this was the work of the Candelabrum, beaten work of gold, fashioned gold fashioned a beaten work, not fashioned gold not fashioned a beaten work
llm_translation: "And this is the work of the menorah: hammered work of gold; from its base to its flower, it is hammered work; according to the pattern that the Lord had shown Moses, so he made the menorah."

hebrew_text: מקשה דסיפא למאי אתא למעוטי חצוצרות דתניא חצוצרות היו באים מן העשת מן הכסף עשאם מן הגרוטאות כשרים משאר מיני מתכות פסולים
human_translation: For what “beaten work” in the latter clause come? to exclude trumpets, As it is taught trumpets were fashioned from block from silver. fashioned them from fragments they are fit, from other types of metal they are unfit.
llm_translation: The difficulty of the latter clause - for what purpose did it come to exclude trumpets? For it was taught: Trumpets used to come from the city of Asht, made of silver; he made them from the peelings of nuts, they are valid; from other types of metals, they are invalid.

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא משאר מיני מתכות פסולים דכתיב כסף והויה מן הגרוטאות נמי מקשה והויה מיעט רחמנא גבי מנורה מקשה היא היא ולא חצוצרות
human_translation: And what different from other types of metal they are unfit? As it is written silver and being, from fragments as well, beaten work and being. The Merciful One excludes with regard to Candelabrum: “It was beaten work” it but not trumpets,
llm_translation: And what is different about other types of metals that they are disqualified? As it is written "silver," and it must be from coins. Also, it is difficult to make it and it must be minimal. The Merciful One was stringent regarding the menorah, it must be difficult, and not trumpets.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן כל הכלים
human_translation: The Sages taught All of the vessels
llm_translation: The Sages taught: all the vessels

hebrew_text: שעשה משה כשרים לו וכשרים לדורות חצוצרות כשרות לו ופסולות לדורות
human_translation: that Moses fashioned fit for his and fit for generations. trumpets fit for his but unfit for generations.
llm_translation: Moses made fit for himself and fit for generations; trumpets fit for himself and unfit for generations.

hebrew_text: חצוצרות מ"ט אילימא דאמר קרא (במדבר י, ב) עשה לך לך ולא לדורות אלא מעתה (דברים י, א) ועשית לך ארון עץ הכי נמי דלך ולא לדורות
human_translation: What is the reason trumpets If we say that the verse states: “Make for you for you, but not for generations, if that is so, “Make for you an Ark of wood” also that for you, but not for generations.
llm_translation: Trumpets, what is the reason? If you say because the verse states (Numbers 10:2) "Make for yourself," and not for future generations, then now (Deuteronomy 10:1) "And you shall make for yourself an ark of wood," the same reasoning applies - for yourself and not for future generations.

hebrew_text: אלא אי למאן דאמר לך משלך אי למ"ד כביכול בשלך אני רוצה יותר משלהם האי נמי מיבעי ליה להכי שאני התם דאמר קרא לך לך תרי זימני עשה לך והיו לך
human_translation: Rather, either according to the one who says “for you” from your own or according to the one who says I desire, as it were, from your more than from of here too, should be this There, it is different, as the verse states “for you” twice: “Make for you and they shall be for you
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says to you, "From yours," if according to the one who seemingly prefers yours over theirs, this one also requires it for this reason: for there, the verse says, "Go, go twice, make for yourself, and they shall be for you."

hebrew_text: תני רב פפא בריה דרב חנין קמיה דרב יוסף מנורה היתה באה מן העשת מן הזהב עשאה של כסף כשרה של בעץ ושל אבר ושל גיסטרון רבי פוסל ור' יוסי ברבי יהודה מכשיר של עץ ושל עצם ושל זכוכית דברי הכל פסולה
human_translation: Rav Pappa, son of Rav Ḥanin, taught before Rav Yosef: Candelabrum fashioned from block from gold. fashioned it from silver, fit. from tin, or from lead, or from other types of metal [ gisteron ], Rabbi deems unfit, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, deems fit. from wood, or from bone, or from glass, everyone agrees unfit.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Papa, son of Rav Haninah, taught before Rav Yosef: A lamp that was made from gold, if one made it from silver it is valid, if made from wood, bone, or glass, Rabbi Posel disqualifies it, and Rabbi Yosi, son of Rabbi Yehuda, validates it. All agree that if made from wood, bone, or glass, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: א"ל מאי דעתך א"ל בין מר ובין מר כללי ופרטי דרשי
human_translation: said to him: What, your opinion, said to him: Both Sage and Sage interpret generalizations and details.
llm_translation: He said to him: What is your opinion? He said to him: Both Master and Master, expound general and specific principles.

hebrew_text: מיהו מר סבר מה הפרט מפורש של מתכת אף כל של מתכת ומר סבר מה הפרט מפורש דבר חשוב אף כל דבר חשוב אמר ליה סמי דידך מקמי דידי
human_translation: But Sage, holds just as the detail defined of metal, so too, all of metal And Sage, holds just as the detail defined an item of substantial value, so too, all items of substantial value said to him: Remove your in light of my
llm_translation: Who is the Master who holds that what is explicitly specified regarding metal, so too is everything made of metal? And who is the Master who holds that what is explicitly specified regarding an important matter, so too is every important matter? He said to him: "Place your name before mine."

hebrew_text: דתניא כלי שרת שעשאן של עץ רבי פוסל ורבי יוסי ברבי יהודה מכשיר במאי קא מיפלגי רבי דריש כללי ופרטי ורבי יוסי בר' יהודה דריש ריבויי ומיעוטי
human_translation: As it is taught service vessels that fashioned from wood, Rabbi deems unfit and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, deems fit. With regard to what do they disagree? Rabbi interprets generalizations and details, and Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, interprets amplifications and restrictions.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Vessels of service made of wood - Rabbi posits invalid, and Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda deems them valid. What do they dispute? Rabbi employs general and specific principles, while Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda employs amplifications and limitations.

hebrew_text: רבי דריש כללי ופרטי (שמות כה, לא) ועשית מנורת כלל זהב טהור פרט מקשה תיעשה המנורה חזר וכלל כלל ופרט וכלל אי אתה דן אלא כעין הפרט מה הפרט מפורש של מתכת אף כל של מתכת
human_translation: Rabbi interprets generalizations and details. “And you will make a Candelabrum of” a generalization, “pure gold” a detail, “Of beaten work will the Candelabrum be made,” then makes a generalization. a generalization and a detail and a generalization, you may deduce only similar to the detail, Just as the detail defined of metal, so too, all of metal
