llm_translation: Rabbi expounded: General and specific (Exodus 25:31) "And you shall make a menorah of pure gold." General, specific, difficult - the menorah shall be made. He went back and expounded: General, specific, general. You can only judge in a manner similar to the specific. Just as the specific is explicitly of metal, so too all of it is of metal.

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי בר' יהודה דריש ריבויי ומיעוטי ועשית מנורת ריבה זהב טהור מיעט מקשה תיעשה המנורה חזר וריבה ריבה ומיעט וריבה ריבה הכל ומאי רבי רבי כל מילי ומאי מיעט מיעט של חרס
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, interprets amplifications and restrictions. “And you will make a Candelabrum of” an amplification, “pure gold” a restriction, “Of beaten work will the Candelabrum be made,” repeated and amplified. amplified and restricted and amplified, it amplified everything And what did include? It includes all materials, And what did exclude It excluded from earthenware,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, expounded: "Multiplicity and minority, and you shall make a menorah of pure gold." (Exodus 25:31) If it is diminished, it becomes difficult. The menorah should be made. He repeated and multiplied, and diminished and repeated. All of this. And what is "Rabbi, Rabbi"? Everything. And what is "minority, minority"? Of earthenware.

hebrew_text: אדרבה סמי דידך מקמי דידי לא ס"ד דתניא אין לו זהב מביא אף של כסף של נחשת של ברזל ושל בדיל ושל עופרת רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה מכשיר אף בשל עץ
human_translation: On the contrary, remove your in light of my cannot enter your mind, as it is taught has no gold, he may bring even of silver, of copper, of iron, of tin, or of lead. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, deems fit even from wood.
llm_translation: On the contrary, my potion is effective before yours, as it is taught: If one does not have gold, he may bring silver, copper, iron, lead, or tin. Rabbi Yosi, son of Rabbi Yehuda, deems even wood acceptable.

hebrew_text: ותניא אידך לא יעשה אדם בית תבנית היכל אכסדרה כנגד אולם חצר כנגד עזרה שלחן כנגד שלחן מנורה כנגד מנורה אבל עושה הוא של חמשה ושל ששה ושל שמנה ושל שבעה לא יעשה ואפילו משאר מיני מתכות
human_translation: And it is taught another A person may not construct a house form of Sanctuary, a portico [ akhsadra ] corresponding to Entrance Hall a courtyard corresponding to courtyard, a table corresponding to Table a candelabrum corresponding to Candelabrum But one may fashion of five or of six or of eight And may not fashion of seven and even from other kinds of metal
llm_translation: And it was taught in another Baraita: A person should not construct a house in the form of the Temple, with a hall corresponding to the Sanctuary, a porch corresponding to the Ulam, a courtyard corresponding to the Azarah, a table corresponding to the Table, a lampstand corresponding to the Lampstand. But if he does so with five, or six, or eight, or seven, he should not do so, even with other types of metals.

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי בר רבי יהודה אומר אף של עץ לא יעשה כדרך שעשו מלכי בית חשמונאי אמרו לו משם ראיה שפודים של ברזל היו וחיפום בבעץ העשירו עשאום של כסף חזרו והעשירו עשאום של זהב
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: may not even fashion from wood, in the manner that the kings of the Hasmonean monarchy did said to a proof from there? spits [ shappudim ] of iron, and they covered them with tin. they grew richer they fashioned from silver. they again grew richer, they fashioned from gold.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda says: Even a tool of wood should not be made in the manner that the kings of the Hasmonean house made it. They said to him: From there is proof, for they were using iron axes and they would sharpen them with a tree. They made them axes of silver, they became rich, they made them axes of gold.

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל משמיה דסבא גובהה של מנורה שמנה עשר טפחים הרגלים והפרח ג' טפחים וטפחיים חלק וטפח שבו גביע וכפתור ופרח וטפחיים חלק וטפח כפתור
human_translation: Shmuel says in the name of elder: The height of Candelabrum eighteen handbreadths. The base and the flower three handbreadths; and two handbreadths bare; and one handbreadth, which a goblet, knob, and flower on it. And two handbreadths bare, and one handbreadth a knob.
llm_translation: Samuel said in the name of Seba: The height of the menorah is eighteen handbreadths, the legs and the flower three handbreadths, and the handbreadths are divided, and a handbreadth of it is a cup, a knob, a flower, and the handbreadths are divided, and a handbreadth is a knob.

hebrew_text: ושני קנים יוצאין ממנו אחד אילך ואחד אילך ונמשכין ועולין כנגד גובהה של מנורה וטפח חלק וטפח כפתור ושני קנים יוצאין ממנו אחד אילך ואחד אילך נמשכין ועולין כנגד גובהה של מנורה וטפח חלק וטפח כפתור ושני קנים יוצאין ממנו אחד אילך ואחד אילך ונמשכין ועולין כנגד גובהה של מנורה וטפחיים חלק נשתיירו שם ג' טפחים שבהן ג' גביעין וכפתור ופרח
human_translation: And two branches emerge from one toward this and one toward that and they extend and rise up to the height of the Candelabrum. And one handbreadth bare, and one handbreadth a knob. And two branches emerge from one toward this and one toward that and they extend and rise up to the height of Candelabrum. And handbreadth bare, and handbreadth a knob. And two branches emerge from one toward this and one toward that and they extend and rise up to the height of Candelabrum. And two handbreadths bare. remained there three handbreadths in which three goblets, and a knob, and a flower.
llm_translation: And two branches come out from it, one here and one there, and they extend and rise opposite the height of the menorah, a handbreadth long and a handbreadth wide. And two branches come out from it, one here and one there, they extend and rise opposite the height of the menorah, a handbreadth long and a handbreadth wide. And two branches come out from it, one here and one there, they extend and rise opposite the height of the menorah, two handbreadths long. Three handbreadths remain there, in which are three cups, a knob, and a flower.

hebrew_text: וגביעין למה הן דומין כמין כוסות אלכסנדריים כפתורים למה הן דומין כמין תפוחי הכרתיים פרחים למה הן דומין כמין פרחי העמודין ונמצאו גביעין עשרים ושנים כפתורים אחד עשר פרחים תשעה
human_translation: And goblets to what are they similar? like Alexandrian goblets, knobs, to what are they similar? like the apples of the Cherethites. flowers, to what are they similar? like the ornaments columns. And are found to be twenty-two goblets, eleven knobs, nine flowers
llm_translation: "And goblets, why are they likened to Alexandrian cups? Buttons, why are they likened to Carthaginian apples? Flowers, why are they likened to the flowers of the pillars? And it was found: twenty goblets, and two buttons, eleven flowers, nine."

hebrew_text: גביעים מעכבין זה את זה כפתורים מעכבין זה את זה פרחים מעכבין זה את זה גביעים כפתורים ופרחים מעכבין זה את זה
human_translation: goblets, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others; knobs, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others; flowers, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others. goblets, knobs, and flowers, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others.
llm_translation: Cups impede one another, buttons impede one another, flowers impede one another; cups, buttons, and flowers impede one another.

hebrew_text: בשלמא גביעים עשרים ושנים דכתיב (שמות כה, לד) ובמנורה ארבעה גביעים וגו' וכתיב (שמות כה, לג) שלשה גביעים משוקדים בקנה האחד כפתור ופרח וגו' ארבעה דידה
human_translation: Granted, twenty-two goblets as it is written: “And in the Candelabrum four goblets and it is written: “Three goblets made like almond blossoms in one branch, a knob, and a flower; four of its
llm_translation: In the matter of goblets twenty and two, as it is written (Exodus 25:34), "And in the menorah four goblets, etc." And it is written (Exodus 25:33), "Three goblets shaped like almonds in one branch, a knob and a flower, etc." Four on its branches.

hebrew_text: ותמני סרי דקנים הא עשרין ותרתין כפתורין נמי אחד עשר כפתורין תרי דידה וששה דקנים וכפתר וכפתר וכפתר הא חד סר
human_translation: and eighteen of the branches; this twenty-two knobs as well, eleven two knobs of its and six of branches, “And a knob and a knob and a knob this eleven
llm_translation: And eight rows of palm trees, twenty and eight palm trees also; a palm tree for a cubit, and a palm tree for a cubit, and the palm trees were upon the posts thereof, and the arches thereof were upon the posts thereof; and it was a cubit long.

hebrew_text: אלא פרחים תשעה מנלן פרחים תרי דידה וששה דקנים תמניא הוו אמר רב שלמן כתיב (במדבר ח, ד) עד ירכה עד פרחה מקשה היא
human_translation: But from where do we nine flowers? two flowers of its and the six of branches, there are eight, Rav Shalman said It is written: “It was a beaten work, from the base to the flower”
llm_translation: Rather, flowers - nine. From where do we derive that flowers are two? His flowers and six reeds are eight. Rav Shlomo said: It is written (Numbers 8:4), "Until its base, until its flower." It is a difficulty.

hebrew_text: אמר רב גובהה של מנורה תשעה טפחים איתיביה רב שימי בר חייא לרב אבן היתה לפני מנורה ובה שלש מעלות שעליה הכהן עומד ומטיב את הנרות
human_translation: Rav says: The height of Candelabrum nine handbreadths. Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya raised an objection to Rav: There was a stone before Candelabrum and it had three steps, upon which the priest stand and prepare the lamps
llm_translation: Rav said: "The height of the Menorah is nine handbreadths." Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya raised an objection to Rav: "There was a stone in front of the Menorah, and on it were three steps, upon which the priest would stand and kindle the lamps."

hebrew_text: א"ל שימי את כי קאמינא משפת קנים ולמעלה
human_translation: said to him: Shimi, you When I said from the point branches and above.
llm_translation: He said to him, "Place it, for I am saying from the lip of reeds and above."

hebrew_text: כתיב (דברי הימים ב ד, כא) והפרח והנרות והמלקחים זהב הוא מיכלות זהב מאי מיכלות זהב אמר רב אמי שכילתו לכל זהב סגור של שלמה דא"ר יהודה אמר רב עשר מנורות עשה שלמה וכל אחת ואחת הביא לה אלף ככר זהב והכניסוהו אלף פעמים לכור והעמידוהו על ככר
human_translation: It is written: “And the flowers, and the lamps, and the tongs, of gold, and that perfect gold [ mikhlot zahav ]” What mikhlot zahav ? Rav Ami says: that exhausted [ kilattu ] all of Solomon’s pure [ sagur ] gold [ zahav ], As Rav Yehuda says Rav said: Solomon made ten Candelabrums, and for each and every one he brought one thousand talents of gold, and they placed in the furnace one thousand times, until they reduced to talent
llm_translation: It is written (1 Chronicles 4:20), "and the flowers, the lamps, and the tongs are made of gold." What are "flowers of gold"? Rav Ami said: The wisdom of all gold. Sealed gold of Solomon. As Rabbi Yehudah said in the name of Rav, Solomon made ten menorahs, and for each one he brought a thousand talents of gold, and he inserted it a thousand times into the crucible, and he stood it on a talent.

hebrew_text: איני והכתיב (מלכים א י, כא) וכל כלי משקה המלך שלמה זהב וכל כלי בית יער הלבנון זהב סגור אין כסף נחשב בימי שלמה למאומה זהב סגור קא אמרינן
human_translation: Is that so But isn’t it written: “And all King Solomon’s drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold;silver was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon” We are saying pure gold
llm_translation: I am not, and it is written (1 Kings 10:21), "And all the drinking vessels of King Solomon were of gold, and all the vessels of the House of the Forest of Lebanon were of pure gold; none were of silver, it was not considered valuable in the days of Solomon, for the gold was of great value."

hebrew_text: ומי חסר כולי האי והתניא ר' יוסי בר' יהודה אומר מעשה והיתה [מנורת] בית המקדש יתירה על של משה בדינר זהב קורדיקיני והכניסוה פ' פעמים לכור והעמידוה על ככר כיון דקאי קאי
human_translation: And would reduce to this extent, But isn’t it taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: An incident the Candelabrum of the Temple was greater than of Moses by Kordikini gold dinar, and they placed it in the furnace eighty times until stood at talent. Once it is standing, it is standing,
llm_translation: And who is lacking all this? And it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: There was an incident, and the Menorah of the Temple was more than that of Moses, with a dinar of gold, Cordicini, and they inserted it the gold into the crucible three times, and they stood it on a square. Once it stood, it stood.

hebrew_text: א"ר שמואל בר נחמני אמר ר' יונתן מאי דכתיב (ויקרא כד, ד) על המנורה הטהורה שירדו מעשיה ממקום טהרה אלא מעתה (ויקרא כד, ו) על השלחן הטהור שירדו מעשיו ממקום טהור אלא טהור מכלל שהוא טמא הכא נמי טהורה מכלל שהיא טמאה
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: What which is written: “Upon the pure Candelabrum” that fashioning it descended, from the place of purity, If that is so, “upon the pure Table” that fashioning it from the place of purity? Rather, pure by inference, that it is ritually impure. Here too, pure by inference, that it is ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Samuel bar Nahmani said, Rabbi Jonathan said: What is the meaning of what is written (Leviticus 24:4), "Upon the pure menorah they shall arrange the lamps before the Lord continually"? Rather, now (Leviticus 24:6), "Upon the pure table they shall arrange the showbread before the Lord continually." Just as the table, even though it is called pure, can be impure, so too here, the menorah, even though it is called pure, can be impure.

hebrew_text: בשלמא התם כדריש לקיש דאמר ריש לקיש מאי דכתיב על השולחן הטהור מכלל שהוא טמא כלי עץ העשוי לנחת הוא וכל כלי עץ העשוי לנחת אינו מקבל טומאה אלא מלמד שמגביהין אותו לעולי רגלים ומראים להם לחם הפנים ואומר להם ראו חיבתכם לפני המקום
human_translation: Granted, there in accordance with which Reish Lakish as Reish Lakish says: What which is written: “Upon the pure Table” by inference, that it is ritually impure, a wooden vessel designated to rest and any wooden vessel that is designated to rest is not susceptible to ritually impure? Rather, teaches that lift to display the shewbread to the pilgrims and say to them: See your affection before the Omnipresent.
llm_translation: In truth there, as according to Reish Lakish who said, "What is the meaning of what is written, 'Upon the pure table'? This implies that it is susceptible to impurity, but any wooden vessel made for resting is not susceptible to impurity. Rather, it teaches that they lift it up for the pilgrims and show them the showbread, saying to them, 'Behold your belovedness before the Omnipresent.'"

hebrew_text: מאי חיבתכם כדריב"ל דא"ר יהושע בן לוי נס גדול נעשה בלחם הפנים סילוקו כסידורו שנאמר (שמואל א כא, ז) לשום לחם חם ביום הלקחו
human_translation: What your affection in accordance with which Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi as Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: A great miracle was performed with the shewbread: its removal like its arrangement as it is stated: “To place hot bread on the day when it was taken away”
llm_translation: What is your obligation like? Like Rabbi Eliezer said in the name of Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi: A great miracle was performed with the showbread - its removal was like its arrangement, as it is stated (1 Samuel 21:7), "To set hot bread on the day it is taken away."

hebrew_text: אלא הכא טהורה מכלל שהיא טמאה פשיטא כלי מתכות נינהו וכלי מתכות מקבלין טומאה אלא שירדו מעשיה ממקום טהרה
human_translation: But here, pure by inference, that it is ritually impure; obvious, are metal vessels, and metal vessels are susceptible to ritually impure Rather, that fashioning it descended, from the place of purity.
llm_translation: Rather here pure from the general that it is impure obvious metal vessels they are and metal vessels receive impurity rather their actions descended from a place of purity.

hebrew_text: תניא רבי יוסי ברבי יהודה אומר ארון של אש ושלחן של אש ומנורה של אש ירדו מן השמים וראה משה ועשה כמותם שנאמר (שמות כה, מ) וראה ועשה כתבניתם אשר אתה מראה בהר
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: An Ark of fire and a Table of fire and a Candelabrum of fire descended from the Heavens, and Moses saw and fashioned in their likeness. As it is stated “And see that you make them after their pattern, which is being shown to you in the mount”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: The Ark of Fire, the Table of Fire, and the Menorah of Fire descended from the heavens, and Moses saw and made them as they were, as it is stated (Exodus 25:40), "And see and make according to their pattern that you are shown on the mountain."

hebrew_text: אלא מעתה (שמות כו, ל) והקמת את המשכן כמשפטו אשר הראית בהר הכי נמי הכא כתיב כמשפטו התם כתיב כתבניתם
human_translation: If that is so, “And you shall set up the Tabernacle according to its fashion which has been shown to you in the mount” also Here, it is written: “According to its fashion,” there, it is written: “After their pattern,”
llm_translation: Rather now (Exodus 26:30) "And you shall erect the Tabernacle according to its pattern that you were shown on the mountain." So too here it is written "according to its pattern." There it is written "according to their form."

hebrew_text: א"ר חייא בר אבא אמר ר' יוחנן גבריאל חגור כמין פסיקיא היה והראה לו למשה מעשה מנורה דכתיב וזה מעשה המנורה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Gabriel girded with a type of belt [ pesikiyya ] And he showed way to fashion the Candelabrum to Moses, as it is written: “And this is the work of the Candelabrum”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Gabriel appeared like a type of knife and showed Moses the work of the menorah, as it is written, "And this is the work of the menorah."

hebrew_text: תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל שלשה דברים היו קשין לו למשה עד שהראה לו הקב"ה באצבעו ואלו הן מנורה וראש חדש ושרצים מנורה דכתיב (במדבר ח, ד) וזה מעשה המנורה ראש חודש דכתיב (שמות יב, ב) החודש הזה לכם ראש חדשים שרצים דכתיב (ויקרא יא, כט) וזה לכם הטמא ויש אומרים אף הלכות שחיטה שנאמר (שמות כט, לח) וזה אשר תעשה על המזבח:
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Three matters were difficult for Moses until the Holy One, Blessed be He, showed him with His finger, and these are Candelabrum, and new moon, and creeping animals. Candelabrum as it is written: “And this is the work of the Candelabrum” new moon as it is written: “This month shall be for you the beginning of months” creeping animals as it is written: “And these are they which are unclean for you And there are who say also the halakhot of slaughtering, as it is stated: “Now this is that which you shall sacrifice upon the altar”
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Three things were difficult for Moses until the Holy One, blessed be He, showed him with His finger, and these are: the Menorah, the New Moon, and the Slaughtering of the Paschal Lamb. Menorah, as it is written (Numbers 8:4), "This is the workmanship of the Menorah." New Moon, as it is written (Exodus 12:2), "This month shall be unto you the beginning of months." Slaughtering, as it is written (Leviticus 11:29), "And this is the unclean thing to you." And some say also the laws of ritual slaughter, as it is said (Exodus 29:38), "And this is that which you shall offer upon the altar."

hebrew_text: שתי פרשיות שבמזוזה מעכבות זו את זו ואפילו כתב אחד מעכבן: פשיטא
human_translation: two passages that are in the mezuza , each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others. And even one letter prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with them. obvious
llm_translation: Two portions in the mezuzah that obstruct each other, and even if one wrote them, they obstruct: It is obvious.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב לא נצרכה אלא לקוצה של יוד והא נמי פשיטא אלא לכאידך דרב יהודה אמר רב דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב כל אות שאין גויל מוקף לה מארבע רוחותיה פסולה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: was necessary only the thorn, of yod But this also obvious, Rather, according to another that Rav Yehuda says Rav as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Any letter that is not encircled with parchment on four of its sides, unfit.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said, Rav said: It was only necessary for the tip of the yud. And this is also obvious, but for the statement of Rav Yehudah who said in the name of Rav: For Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Any letter that is not surrounded by its four sides is invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר אשיאן בר נדבך משמיה דרב יהודה ניקב תוכו של ה"י כשר יריכו פסול א"ר זירא לדידי מפרשה לי מיניה דרב הונא ורבי יעקב אמר לדידי מפרשה לי מיניה דרב יהודה ניקב תוכו של ה"י כשר יריכו אם נשתייר בו כשיעור אות קטנה כשר ואם לאו פסול
human_translation: Ashiyan bar Nadbakh says in the name of Rav Yehuda: the inner of heh was perforated fit, the leg of unfit. Rabbi Zeira says: explained to me by Rav Huna, and Rabbi Ya’akov says: explained to me by Rav Yehuda: the inner of heh was perforated fit. the leg of if there remained in the equivalent of the measure of a small letter, fit. But if not, unfit.
llm_translation: Said Ashian son of Nedavak in the name of Rav Yehudah: If the inside of the letter "Yod" is pierced, it is valid; if its leg is severed, it is invalid. Rava said: According to my understanding, Rav Huna explained it to me, and Rabbi Yaakov said: According to my understanding, Rav Yehudah explained it to me: If the inside of the letter "Yod" is pierced, it is valid; if a small part of it remains the size of a barley grain, it is valid, but if not, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: אגרא חמוה דר' אבא
human_translation: Agra, the father-in-law of Rabbi Abba,
llm_translation: The reward of the father-in-law of Rabbi Abba

hebrew_text: איפסיקא ליה כרעא דה"י דהעם בניקבא אתא לקמיה דר' אבא א"ל אם משתייר בו כשיעור אות קטנה כשר ואם לאו פסול:
human_translation: leg of heh in “The nation [ ha’am ]” severed by a perforation. He came before Rabbi Abba said to him: If there remains in the equivalent of the measure of a small letter, fit. But if not, unfit.
llm_translation: He stopped the foot of the letter Yud of the word "Ha'am" (the people) with a hole. He came before Rabbi Abba. He said to him: If a small letter remains in it, it is valid. But if not, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: ראמי בר תמרי דהוא חמוה דרמי בר דיקולי איפסיקא ליה כרעא דוי"ו דויהרג בניקבא אתא לקמיה דרבי זירא א"ל זיל אייתי ינוקא דלא חכים ולא טפש אי קרי ליה ויהרג כשר אי לא יהרג הוא ופסול
human_translation: Rami bar Tamrei, who the father-in-law of Rami bar Dikkulei, leg of vav in “And slew [ vayaharog ] severed by a perforation. He came before Rabbi Zeira said to him: Go bring a child who is neither wise nor stupid, if he reads “And slew [ vayaharog ]” fit, if not, were: Will be slain [ yehareg ], and unfit.
llm_translation: Rami bar Tamari, who is the brother-in-law of Rami bar Dikuli, his foot was cut off. He came before Rabbi Zeira. He said to him, "Go bring a child who is neither wise nor foolish. If he reads and is killed, he is valid. If not, he is not killed, and he is invalid."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב בשעה שעלה משה למרום מצאו להקב"ה שיושב וקושר כתרים לאותיות אמר לפניו רבש"ע מי מעכב על ידך אמר לו אדם אחד יש שעתיד להיות בסוף כמה דורות ועקיבא בן יוסף שמו שעתיד לדרוש על כל קוץ וקוץ תילין תילין של הלכות
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: When Moses ascended on High, he found the Holy One, Blessed be He, sitting and tying crowns on the letters said before Master of the Universe, who is preventing You said to him: There is a man who is destined to be after several generations, and Akiva ben Yosef his name; he is destined to derive from each and every thorn mounds mounds of halakhot .
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah said Rav: When Moses ascended on high, he found the Holy One, blessed be He, sitting and weaving crowns to the letters. He said before Him: "Master of the Universe, who is delaying You?" He said to him: "There is a man who is destined to be at the end of many generations, and Akiva ben Yosef is his name, who is destined to expound upon every thorn and thorn, tefillin, tefillin of laws."

hebrew_text: אמר לפניו רבש"ע הראהו לי אמר לו חזור לאחורך הלך וישב בסוף שמונה שורות ולא היה יודע מה הן אומרים תשש כחו כיון שהגיע לדבר אחד אמרו לו תלמידיו רבי מנין לך אמר להן הלכה למשה מסיני נתיישבה דעתו
human_translation: said before Master of the Universe, show him to me. said to him: Return behind you. went and sat at the end of the eighth row and did not understand what they were saying. strength waned, When arrived at one matter, his students said to him: My teacher, from where do you said to them: a halakha to Moses from Sinai. his mind was put at ease,
llm_translation: He said before Him, the Lord of Hosts, "Show it to me." He said to him, "Turn back." He went and sat at the end of eight rows and did not know what they were saying. "His strength weakened." Once he reached a certain matter, his disciples said to him, "Rabbi, how many are there?" He said to them, "It is a halacha given to Moses at Sinai." His mind was put at ease.

hebrew_text: חזר ובא לפני הקב"ה אמר לפניו רבונו של עולם יש לך אדם כזה ואתה נותן תורה ע"י אמר לו שתוק כך עלה במחשבה לפני אמר לפניו רבונו של עולם הראיתני תורתו הראני שכרו אמר לו חזור [לאחורך] חזר לאחוריו ראה ששוקלין בשרו במקולין אמר לפניו רבש"ע זו תורה וזו שכרה א"ל שתוק כך עלה במחשבה לפני
human_translation: returned and came before the Holy One, Blessed be He, said before Him: Master of the Universe, You have a man as this and You give the Torah through me. said to him: Be silent; this intention arose before Me. said before Master of the Universe, You have shown me Torah, show me his reward. said to him: Return went back saw that they were weighing flesh in a butcher shop [ bemakkulin ], said before Him: Master of the Universe, this is Torah and this is its reward? said to him: Be silent; this intention arose before Me.
llm_translation: He returned and came before the Holy One, blessed be He, and said before Him: Master of the Universe, do You have such a person, and You give the Torah through him? He said to him: Be silent. So it arose in thought before Him. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, You have shown me His Torah, show me His reward. He said to him: Turn back. He turned back and saw them weighing his flesh in the marketplaces. He said before Him: Master of the Universe, this is Torah, and this is its reward. He said to him: Be silent. So it arose in thought before Him.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא שבעה אותיות צריכות שלשה זיונין ואלו הן שעטנ"ז ג"ץ אמר רב אשי חזינא להו לספרי דווקני דבי רב דחטרי להו לגגיה דחי"ת ותלו ליה לכרעיה דה"י
human_translation: Rava says: Seven letters require three crowns [ ziyyunin ], and they are shin , ayin , tet , nun , zayin ; gimmel tzadi . Rav Ashi says: I have seen that the exacting scribes of the study hall of Rav would put a hump-like stroke on the roof of ḥet and they would suspend the leg of heh ,
llm_translation: Rava said: Seven letters require three adornments, and they are: shin, ayin, tet, nun, zayin, gimel, tzadi. Rav Ashi said: I have seen in the books of the scribes of the school of Rav that they would carve them on the roof with chet, and hang it on the leg with hey.

hebrew_text: חטרי להו לגגיה דחי"ת כלומר חי הוא ברומו של עולם ותלו ליה לכרעיה דה"י כדבעא מיניה רבי יהודה נשיאה מר' אמי מאי דכתיב (ישעיהו כו, ד) בטחו ביי' עדי עד כי ביה יי' צור עולמים אמר ליה כל התולה בטחונו בהקב"ה הרי לו מחסה בעולם הזה ולעולם הבא
human_translation: They would put a hump-like stroke on the roof of ḥet as if to say: He, lives [ ḥai ] in the heights of the universe. And they would suspend the leg of heh , as Rabbi Yehuda Nesia asked Rabbi Ami: What which is written: “Trust in the Lord forever, for in the Lord [ beYah ] is God, an everlasting [ olamim ] Rock” said to him: Anyone who puts their trust in the Holy One, Blessed be He, his refuge in this world and in the World-to-Come.
llm_translation: They dug for him a hole in the roof of the chamber, meaning, he is alive in the height of the world, and they hung him by his heels, as it is said about him, "Trust in the Lord forever, for in Yah, the Lord, is the Rock of Ages." Rabbi Yehudah the Prince said to Rabbi Ami, what is the meaning of the verse, "Trust in the Lord forever, for in Yah, the Lord, is the Rock of Ages"? He said to him, anyone who relies on the Holy One, blessed be He, has a refuge in this world and in the world to come.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אנא הכי קא קשיא לי מאי שנא דכתיב ביה ולא כתיב יה
human_translation: said to this is a difficulty for me: What is different which is written: in the Lord [ beYah ],” and it is not written: the Lord [ Yah ]?
llm_translation: He said to him, "I thus find it difficult: What is the difference that it is written in it 'and it is not written 'Yah''?"

hebrew_text: כדדרש ר' יהודה בר ר' אילעאי אלו שני עולמות שברא הקב"ה אחד בה"י ואחד ביו"ד ואיני יודע אם העולם הבא ביו"ד והעולם הזה בה"י אם העולם הזה ביו"ד והעולם הבא בה"י
human_translation: as Rabbi Yehuda bar Rabbi Elai taught: These two worlds that the Holy One, Blessed be He, created; one with [ be ] heh and one with [ be ] yod . And I do not know whether the World-to-Come with yod and this world with heh , whether this world with yod and the World-to-Come with heh .
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yehudah son of Rabbi Ilai expounded: These are the two worlds that the Holy One, blessed be He, created, one with the letter Hei and one with the letter Yud. And I do not know if the World to Come is with the letter Yud and this world with the letter Hei, or if this world is with the letter Yud and the World to Come with the letter Hei.

hebrew_text: כשהוא אומר (בראשית ב, ד) אלה תולדות השמים והארץ בהבראם אל תקרי בהבראם אלא בה"י בראם [הוי אומר העולם הזה בה"י והעולם הבא ביו"ד]
human_translation: When states: “These are the generations of the heaven and of the earth when they were created [ behibare’am ]” do not read behibare’am , rather, beheh bera’am ,
llm_translation: When it says (Genesis 2:4), "These are the generations of the heavens and the earth when they were created," do not read it as "when they were created" but rather as "with the letter 'Yud' they were created." This teaches that this world was created with the letter 'Yud' and the World to Come with the letter 'Hei'.

hebrew_text: ומפני מה נברא העולם הזה בה"י מפני שדומה לאכסדרה שכל הרוצה לצאת יצא ומ"ט תליא כרעיה דאי הדר בתשובה מעיילי ליה
human_translation: And for what was this world created with heh ? because which a similar to a portico, where anyone who wishes to leave may leave, And what is the reason leg of is suspended, because if one repents, he is brought in
llm_translation: And for what reason was this world created with the letter "hey"? Because it is similar to a theater, where anyone who wishes to leave can leave, and the reason is dependent on the repentance, for if one repents, they elevate him.

hebrew_text: וליעייל בהך לא מסתייעא מילתא כדריש לקיש דאמר ריש לקיש מאי דכתיב (משלי ג, לד) אם ללצים הוא יליץ ולענוים יתן חן בא לטהר מסייעין אותו בא לטמא פותחין לו ומ"ט אית ליה תאגא אמר הקב"ה אם חוזר [בו] אני קושר לו קשר
human_translation: But let him enter through that not be effective, in accordance with of Reish Lakish. As Reish Lakish says: What which is written: “If it concerns the scorners, He scorns them, but to the humble He gives grace” comes to become pure, he is assisted comes to become impure, he is provided with an opening And what is the reason has a crown The Holy One, Blessed be He, says: If returns, I tie for him
llm_translation: And to bring with it not supported matter as Reish Lakish said Reish Lakish what is written if to scoffers he will scoff but to the humble he gives grace comes to purify they assist him comes to defile they open for him and what is the reason he has a crown said the Holy One, blessed be He if he returns I will bind him with a bond.

hebrew_text: מפני מה נברא העולם הבא ביו"ד מפני שצדיקים שבו מועטים ומפני מה כפוף ראשו מפני שצדיקים שבו כפוף ראשיהם מפני מעשיהן שאינן דומין זה לזה
human_translation: For what was the World-to-Come created with yod , because the righteous of are few. And for what the top of bent because the righteous who are in hang their heads since the actions of one are not similar to those of another.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Why was the World to Come created with a Yud? Because the righteous in it are few. And why is one's head bent? Because the righteous in it bend their heads due to their deeds, which are not similar to one another."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף הני תרתי מילי אמר רב בספרים ותניא תיובתיה חדא הא דאמר רב ס"ת שיש בו שתי טעיות בכל דף ודף יתקן שלש יגנז
human_translation: Rav Yosef says: Rav states these two matters with regard to scrolls, and is taught a refutation of his One that which Rav says: A Torah scroll that contains two errors on each and every column may be corrected, three shall be interred.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: These two matters Rav said in the books, and it was taught in a Baraita in support of one of them. This is what Rav said: A Torah scroll that has two mistakes on every page, he should correct three and store away.

hebrew_text: ותניא תיובתיה שלש יתקן ארבע יגנז תנא אם יש בו דף אחת שלימה מצלת על כולו: א"ר יצחק בר שמואל בר מרתא משמיה דרב והוא דכתיב רוביה דספרא שפיר
human_translation: And is taught a refutation of his three may be corrected, four shall be interred. taught If contains one complete column it saves the entire Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta says in the name of Rav: And this when the majority of the scroll is written properly
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If it has three, repair it; if it has four, hide it away. It was taught: If it contains one complete page, cover it entirely. Rabbi Yitzhak bar Shmuel bar Marta said in the name of Rav, and this is what is written: "The majority of the book is good."

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי לרב יוסף אי אית בההוא דף שלש טעיות מאי א"ל הואיל ואיתיהיב לאיתקוני מיתקן וה"מ חסירות אבל יתירות לית לן בה חסירות מ"ט לא אמר רב כהנא משום דמיחזי כמנומר:
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: If that column contained three errors, what said to him: Since may be corrected, enables the correction And this statement are missing But extraneous we have no with it, What is the reason missing not Rav Kahana said: Because it would look speckled
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Yosef: If there are three mistakes on that page, what is the ruling? He said to him: Since it was given, it is corrected. And what if there are deficiencies? But if there are excesses, we do not have a concern with deficiencies. What is the reason? Rav Kahana said: Because it appears as if it is deliberate.

hebrew_text: אגרא חמוה דרבי אבא הוה ליה יתירות בסיפריה אתא לקמיה דרבי אבא א"ל לא אמרן אלא בחסירות
human_translation: Agra, the father-in-law of Rabbi Abba, had extraneous in his scroll. He came before Rabbi Abba said to him: We said only in missing.
llm_translation: The reward of the brother-in-law of Rabbi Abba was in his books. He came before Rabbi Abba and said to him, "I only said it in terms of lacking."

hebrew_text: אבל יתרות לית לן בה
human_translation: But extraneous we have no with it,
llm_translation: But Yitrot we do not have in it.

hebrew_text: אידך דאמר רב הכותב ס"ת ובא לגמור גומר ואפילו באמצע הדף מיתיבי הכותב ס"ת בא לו לגמור לא יגמור באמצע הדף כדרך שגומר בחומשין אלא מקצר והולך עד סוף הדף כי קא אמר רב בחומשין
human_translation: The other which Rav says: One who writes a Torah scroll and comes to finish may finish and even in the middle of the column. raises an objection One who writes a Torah scroll comes to finish may not finish in the middle of the column in the manner that one finishes five Rather, progressively shorten until end of the column. When Rav says to five
llm_translation: The other opinion is that of Rav who says: One who writes a Sefer Torah and comes to complete it, he completes it, and even if he comes in the middle of the page, it was taught: One who writes a Sefer Torah and comes to complete it, he should not complete it in the middle of the page, as one completes it in the Five Books of Moses, rather he should shorten the text and proceed until the end of the page, for Rav said this regarding the Five Books of Moses.

hebrew_text: והא ס"ת קאמר בחומשין של ס"ת איני והא"ר יהושע בר אבא אמר רב גידל אמר רב לעיני כל ישראל באמצע הדף ההיא באמצע שיטה איתמר
human_translation: But doesn’t say a Torah scroll? to five that a Torah scroll. Is that so? But doesn’t Rabbi Yehoshua bar Abba say Rav Giddel says Rav says: “In the sight of all Israel” in the middle of the column? That was stated with regard to in the middle of line,
llm_translation: And this is what the Talmud said regarding the scrolls of the Torah, "I am not in the scrolls of the Torah." And Rabbi Yehoshua bar Abba said in the name of Rav Giddel who said in the name of Rav, "In the eyes of all Israel, in the middle of the page, that was stated in the middle of the discussion."

hebrew_text: רבנן אמרי אף באמצע שיטה רב אשי אמר באמצע שיטה דווקא והלכתא באמצע שיטה דווקא
human_translation: The Rabbis say even in the middle of line, Rav Ashi says specifically in the middle of line. And the halakha specifically in the middle of line.
llm_translation: The sages said: Even in the middle of a row. Rav Ashi said: Specifically in the middle of a row. And the halakha is specifically in the middle of a row.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יהושע בר אבא אמר רב גידל אמר רב שמנה פסוקים שבתורה יחיד קורא אותן בבהכ"נ כמאן דלא כר"ש
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua bar Abba says Rav Giddel says Rav says: eight verses of the Torah individual reads them in the synagogue, In accordance with whose not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua bar Abba said, Rabbi Giddel said, Rav Shmna said: One who reads the eight verses in the Torah individually should read them in the synagogue, in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: דתניא (דברים לד, ה) וימת שם משה עבד יי' אפשר משה חי וכתב וימת שם משה אלא עד כאן כתב משה מכאן ואילך כתב יהושע בן נון דברי רבי יהודה ואמרי לה רבי נחמיה
human_translation: As it is taught “And Moses the servant of the Lord died there” Is it possible Moses died, he wrote: “And Moses died there”? Rather, Moses wrote until this Joshua bin Nun wrote from this forward; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. And some say Rabbi Neḥemya
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita (Deuteronomy 34:5), "And Moses, the servant of the Lord, died." Is it possible that Moses is alive and wrote, 'And Moses died there'? Rather, up to this point Moses wrote, from here onward Joshua son of Nun wrote. These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah, and some say it was Rabbi Nehemiah.

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר"ש אפשר ס"ת חסר אות אחת וכתיב (דברים לא, כו) לקוח את ספר התורה הזה ושמתם אותו וגו'
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said to him: Is it possible Torah scroll missing a single letter? But it is written “Take this Torah scroll and put it
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Shimon: Is it possible for a Torah scroll to be missing one letter, yet it is written (Deuteronomy 31:26): "Take this book of the Torah and place it..."

hebrew_text: אלא עד כאן הקב"ה אומר ומשה כותב ואומר מכאן ואילך הקב"ה אומר ומשה כותב בדמע כמה שנאמר להלן (ירמיהו לו, יח) ויאמר להם ברוך מפיו יקרא אלי את כל הדברים האלה ואני כותב על הספר בדיו
human_translation: Rather, until this the Holy One, Blessed be He, dictated and Moses wrote and repeated From this forward, the Holy One, Blessed be He, dictated and Moses wrote with tears As it is stated there “And Baruch said to them: He dictated all these words to me, and I wrote them with ink in the scroll”
llm_translation: Rather, until here the Holy One, blessed be He, speaks and Moses writes and says. From here onward, the Holy One, blessed be He, speaks and Moses writes with tears, as it is said below (Jeremiah 36:18), "And Baruch read from the scroll the words of the Lord in the house of the Lord, in the chamber of Gemariah the son of Shaphan the scribe, in the upper court, at the entry of the New Gate of the Lord's house, in the ears of all the people."

hebrew_text: לימא דלא כר"ש אפי' תימא ר"ש הואיל ואישתני אישתני
human_translation: Shall we say that not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, You even say Rabbi Shimon; since they differ they differ
llm_translation: Let us say that it is not like Rabbi Shimon, even if you say it is like Rabbi Shimon, since it has been taught, it has been taught.

hebrew_text: וא"ר יהושע בר אבא אמר רב גידל אמר רב הלוקח ס"ת מן השוק כחוטף מצוה מן השוק כתבו מעלה עליו הכתוב כאילו קיבלו מהר סיני אמר רב ששת אם הגיה אפי' אות אחת מעלה עליו כאילו כתבו
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua bar Abba says Rav Giddel says Rav says: One who purchases a Torah scroll in the marketplace is akin to one who snatches a mitzva in the marketplace, writes the verse ascribes him as though he received it at Mount Sinai. Rav Sheshet says: If he emended even a single letter ascribes him as though he had written it
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehoshua bar Abba said, Rav Giddel said, Rav said: One who buys a Torah scroll from the market is like one who snatches a commandment from the market. The Scripture regards him as if he received it from Mount Sinai. Rav Sheshet said: If he read it aloud, even just one letter, the Scripture regards him as if he wrote it.

hebrew_text: (סי' סגלם) ת"ר עושה אדם יריעה מבת שלש דפין ועד בת שמנה דפין פחות מיכן ויתר על כן לא יעשה
human_translation: a mnemonic Samekh , gimmel , lamed , mem . The Sages taught: A person may prepare a sheet from three columns and until eight columns, one may not prepare less than or more than
llm_translation: Tractate: (Seder Kodashim, Masechet Menachot) The Rabbis taught: A person may make a curtain from three handbreadths to eight handbreadths. Less than this or more than this, he should not make.

hebrew_text: ולא ירבה בדפין מפני שנראה אגרת ולא ימעט בדפין מפני שעיניו משוטטות אלא כגון למשפחותיכם (למשפחותיכם למשפחותיכם) ג' פעמים
human_translation: And he may not increase of columns, since has the appearance of a missive And he may not decrease of columns, since eyes wander, Rather, for example, “ lemishpeḥoteikhem ,” “ lemishpeḥoteikhem ,” “ lemishpeḥoteikhem ,” three times.
llm_translation: And one should not increase in slaps because it appears like a letter, and one should not decrease in slaps because his eyes are wandering, rather like "to your families" (to your families, to your families) three times.

hebrew_text: נזדמנה לו יריעה בת תשע דפים לא יחלוק שלש לכאן ושש לכאן אלא ארבע לכאן וחמש לכאן
human_translation: happened a sheet has nine columns, he should not divide three here and six there; rather, four here and five there,
llm_translation: A sheet of nine cubits came his way, he shall not divide three here and six there, rather four here and five there.

hebrew_text: בד"א בתחלת הספר אבל בסוף הספר אפי' פסוק אחד ואפי' דף אחד פסוק אחד ס"ד אלא אימא פסוק אחד בדף אחד
human_translation: In what is this statement said? at the beginning of the scroll. But at the end of the scroll, even one verse, and even one column. enter your mind one verse? Rather, say one verse on one column.
llm_translation: In the beginning of the book, yes, but at the end of the book, even one verse, and even one page, one verse suffice. Rather say, one verse on one page.

hebrew_text: שיעור גליון מלמטה טפח מלמעלה ג' אצבעות ובין דף לדף כמלא ריוח רוחב שתי אצבעות ובחומשין מלמטה שלש אצבעות מלמעלה שתי אצבעות ובין דף לדף כמלא ריוח רוחב גודל
human_translation: The measure of margin lower one handbreadth [ tefaḥ ]. upper three fingerbreadths [ etzba’ot ], and between each column equal to the full width of two fingerbreadths. And with regard to the five lower three fingerbreadths, upper two fingerbreadths, and between each column equal to the full width of a thumb-breadth [ gudal ].
llm_translation: Measurement of a scroll: from below, a handbreadth; from above, three fingers. And between column and column, the width of two fingers. And in fifths: from below, three fingers; from above, two fingers. And between column and column, the width of a palm.

hebrew_text: ובין שיטה לשיטה כמלא שיטה ובין תיבה לתיבה כמלא אות קטנה ובין אות לאות כמלא חוט השערה
human_translation: And between line and line equal to a full line, and between word and word equal to a full small letter, and between letter and letter, equal to a full hairbreadth.
llm_translation: And between one opinion and another is like a full opinion, and between one word and another is like a small letter, and between one letter and another is like a hair's breadth.

hebrew_text: אל ימעט אדם את הכתב לא מפני ריוח של מטה ולא מפני ריוח של מעלה ולא מפני ריוח שבין שיטה לשיטה ולא מפני ריוח שבין פרשה לפרשה
human_translation: a person may not reduce the writing not in order to space for the lower nor in order to space for the upper nor in order to space between line and line, nor in order to space between passage and passage,
llm_translation: A person should not diminish the writing, neither due to the space below, nor due to the space above, nor due to the space between line and line, nor due to the space between section and section.

hebrew_text: נזדמנה לו תיבה בת חמש אותיות לא יכתוב שתים בתוך הדף ושלש חוץ לדף
human_translation: one happens upon a word that comprises five letters he may not write two within the column and three outside of the column,
llm_translation: A case arose for him, a box of five letters, he shall not write two within the page and three outside the page.

hebrew_text: אלא שלש בתוך הדף ושתים חוץ לדף נזדמנה לו תיבה בת שתי אותיות לא יזרקנה לבין הדפין אלא חוזר וכותב בתחילת השיטה
human_translation: Rather, three in the column and two outside of the column. he happens a word that comprises two letters he may not cast it between the columns; rather, he should return and write at the beginning of the line.
llm_translation: Rather, three within the page and two outside the page. If a word consisting of two letters happened to him, he should not throw it between the pages, but rather go back and write it at the beginning of the line.

hebrew_text: הטועה בשם גורר את מה שכתב ותולה את מה שגרר וכותב את השם על מקום הגרר דברי רבי יהודה רבי יוסי אומר אף תולין את השם רבי יצחק אומר אף מוחק וכותב
human_translation: One who mistakenly the name scrape off that which he wrote, and suspend that he scraped off and write the name upon the place that had been scraped; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: One may even suspend the name Rabbi Yitzḥak says: even wipe away and write
llm_translation: The one who makes a mistake in a name, drags what he wrote, and hangs what he dragged, and writes the name in the place of the dragged. These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah. Rabbi Yossi says, "One may even hang the name." Rabbi Yitzchak says, "One may even erase and write."

hebrew_text: ר"ש שזורי אומר כל השם כולו תולין מקצתו אין תולין ר"ש בן אלעזר אומר משום ר"מ אין כותבין את השם לא על מקום הגרר ולא על מקום המחק ואין תולין אותו כיצד עושה מסלק את היריעה כולה וגונזה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: may suspend the entire name may not suspend part of Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: may not write the name either upon the place that had been scraped or upon the place that had been wiped away, and may not suspend it What should do? He should remove the entire sheet and inter it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: "Any name in its entirety, some of it is suspended, part of it is not suspended." Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says in the name of Rabbi Meir: "One does not write the name neither on a place of erasure nor on a place of rubbing out, and one does not suspend it. How does one do it? He removes the entire cloth and hides it."

hebrew_text: איתמר רב חננאל אמר רב הלכה תולין את השם רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יצחק בר שמואל הלכה מוחק וכותב
human_translation: It was stated Rav Ḥananel says Rav halakha suspends the name Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Shmuel halakha wipe away and write
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav Hananel said in the name of Rav: The halacha is that one may suspend the name of God. Rabbah bar bar Hana said in the name of R. Yitzchak bar Shmuel: The halacha is to erase and write.

hebrew_text: ולימא מר הלכה כמר ומר הלכה כמר משום דאפכי להו
human_translation: And Let Sage, say halakha in accordance with Sage, and Sage, halakha in accordance with Sage, Since who reverse
llm_translation: And let the Master say, the halakha is like the Master, and the Master's halakha is like the Master, because they are accustomed to each other.

hebrew_text: אמר רבין בר חיננא אמר עולא א"ר חנינא הלכה כר"ש שזורי ולא עוד אלא כל מקום ששנה ר"ש שזורי הלכה כמותו
human_translation: Ravin bar Ḥinnana says Ulla says Rabbi Ḥanina says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri; and moreover, any place where Rabbi Shimon Shezuri taught halakha in accordance with his
llm_translation: Rabin bar Chinana said Ula said Rabbi Chanina: The halacha follows Rabbi Shimon Shezuri, and not only that, but in every place where Rabbi Shimon Shezuri taught, the halacha follows his opinion.

hebrew_text: אהייא אילימא אהא ר"ש שזורי אומר כל השם כולו תולין מקצתו אין תולין והא איתמר עלה אמר רב חננאל אמר רב הלכה תולין את השם ורבה בר בר חנה אמר רב יצחק בר שמואל הלכה מוחק וכותב
human_translation: To which If we say to here, Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: may suspend the entire name may not suspend part of But wasn’t it stated with regard to that Rav Ḥananel says Rav says: halakha suspends the name and Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Shmuel halakha wipe away and write
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: If you wish, you may say, "Aha, Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: All of the name, its entirety is suspended; part of it is not suspended." But wasn't it stated: Up above, Rav Chanana said in the name of Rav, the halacha is to suspend the name? And Rabbah bar bar Channah said in the name of Rav Yitzchak bar Shmuel, the halacha is to erase and write.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא הוא נמי לימא
human_translation: And if it is so let also say
llm_translation: And if it is so, let it also be said.

hebrew_text: אלא אהא ר"ש שזורי אומר אפי' בן חמש שנים וחורש בשדה שחיטת אמו מטהרתו
human_translation: Rather, with regard to this Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: even five years old and plowing the field the slaughter of its mother renders it permitted,
llm_translation: Rather, Ahah Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says, even a five-year-old who plows in the field, his mother's slaughtering purifies him.

hebrew_text: הא איתמר עלה זעירי א"ר חנינא הלכה כר"ש שזורי ואם איתא הוא נמי לימא
human_translation: But wasn’t it stated with regard to that Ze’eiri says Rabbi Ḥanina halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri? And if it is so let also say
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: Talmudic text: It was stated: concerning the matter of the small basket, Rabbi Chanina said: the halacha is according to Rabbi Shimon Shezuri. And if you wish, you may also say:

hebrew_text: אלא אהא בראשונה היו אומרים היוצא בקולר ואמר כתבו גט לאשתי הרי אלו יכתבו ויתנו חזרו לומר אף המפרש והיוצא בשיירא ר"ש שזורי אומר אף המסוכן
human_translation: Rather, with regard to this Initially would say: one who was taken out in a collar [ kolar ] and said: Write a bill of divorce for my wife, these should write and give They then said even one who sets sail and one who departs with a caravan Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Even one who is dangerously ill
llm_translation: Rather, in the beginning, they would say: "One who goes out with a collar and says, 'Write a bill of divorce for my wife,' these should be written and given." They returned to say: "Also one who is explicit and goes out with a handkerchief." Rabbi Shimon ben Zorai says: "Also one who is in danger."

hebrew_text: אי נמי אהא תרומת מעשר של דמאי שחזרה למקומה ר"ש שזורי אומר אף בחול שואלו ואוכלו על פיו
human_translation: Alternatively, with regard to this teruma of the tithe of demai , that returned to its place, Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: one may ask him and eat based on his even on a weekday.
llm_translation: If also, ahah, the terumah of ma'aser of demai that returned to its place, Rabbi Shimon Zuri says, "Even on a weekday, one should inquire and eat according to his ruling."

hebrew_text: והא איתמר עלה א"ר יוחנן הלכה כר"ש שזורי במסוכן ובתרומת מעשר של דמאי ואם איתא הוא נמי לימא
human_translation: But wasn’t it stated with regard to Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri in dangerously ill, and in teruma of the tithe of demai ? And if it is so let also say
llm_translation: And it was stated: It was said by Rabbi Yochanan, the halacha is in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri regarding a needle found in a dangerous place and concerning the terumah of demai. And if you wish, you may also say:

hebrew_text: אלא אהא רבי יוסי בן כיפר אומר משום ר"ש שזורי פול המצרי שזרעו לזרע מקצתו השריש לפני ר"ה ומקצתו אחר ר"ה אין תורמין מזה על זה לפי שאין תורמין ומעשרין לא מן החדש על הישן ולא מן הישן על החדש
human_translation: Rather, with regard to this Rabbi Yosei ben Keifar says in the name of Rabbi Shimon Shezuri: planted a cowpea for seed, some of took root before Rosh HaShana, while some of after Rosh HaShana, one may not separate teruma from this for that, as one may not separate teruma or tithes from the new for the old or from the old for the new.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yosei ben Kipper says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: "The Egyptian who sowed his field, part of which took root before Rosh Hashanah and part of which took root after Rosh Hashanah, one does not separate terumah from one part for the other, because one does not separate and tithe from the new onto the old, nor from the old onto the new."

hebrew_text: כיצד יעשה צובר גרנו לתוכו ונמצא תורם ומעשר מן החדש שבו על החדש שבו ומן הישן שבו על הישן שבו
human_translation: How, shall one act pile his threshing floor, into it, and it will turn out separated teruma and tithes from the new in for the new in it, and from the old in for the old in it.
llm_translation: How should one make a storage pit in his granary, and he finds terumah and ma'aser from the new month on the new month, and from the old month on the old month.

hebrew_text: הא איתמר עלה אמר רבי שמואל בר נחמני אמר רבי יוחנן הלכה כרבי שמעון שזורי ואם איתא הוא נמי לימא
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to that Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says that Rabbi Yoḥanan says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri? And if it is so let also say
llm_translation: This is what was said: It was stated. Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The halacha follows Rabbi Shimon Shezuri. And if you wish, you may also say:

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב פפא אשידה רב נחמן בר יצחק אמר איין רב פפא אמר
human_translation: Rather, Rav Pappa said: with regard to a chest. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said with regard to wine. Rav Pappa said
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Papa said: Ashida. Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: Ayein. Rav Papa said.

hebrew_text: אשידה דתנן [השידה] ב"ש אומרים נמדדת מבפנים ובית הלל אומרים מבחוץ ומודים אלו ואלו שאין עובי הרגלים ועובי הלבזבזין נמדד
human_translation: with regard to a chest, as we learned Beit Shammai say it is measured on the inside, and Beit Hillel say it is measured on the outside And and concede that the volume of the legs and the volume of the rims [ halevazbazin ] not measured.
llm_translation: The text: "Ashidah d'tnan hashidah Beit Shammai omerim nimdadet mebifnim u'beit Hillel omerim mebachutz u'modim elu ve'elu she'ein uvi hargalim ve'uvei halavzavin nimdad."

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי אומר מודים שעובי הרגלים ועובי הלבזבזין נמדד וביניהן אין נמדד ר"ש שזורי אומר אם היו רגלים גבוהות טפח אין ביניהן נמדד ואם לאו ביניהן נמדד
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: They concede that the volume of the legs and the volume of the rims measured, but between is not measured. Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: If legs were handbreadth high between is not measured, but if not between is measured
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: "We acknowledge that the thickness of the legs and the thickness of the claws are measured, but the space between them is not measured." Rabbi Shimon ben Zuri says: "If the legs are raised a handbreadth high, the space between them is not measured; but if not, the space between them is measured."

hebrew_text: רב נחמן בר יצחק אמר איין דתנן רבי מאיר אומר שמן תחלה לעולם וחכ"א אף הדבש ר"ש שזורי אומר אף היין מכלל דת"ק סבר יין לא אימא רבי שמעון שזורי אומר יין
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said with regard to wine, as we learned Rabbi Meir says: Oil, always first And the Rabbis say even honey. Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: even wine. By inference, that the first tanna holds wine not say Rabbi Shimon Shezuri says: Wine
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "Ain d'tannan, Rabbi Meir says: 'Oil initially always,' and the sages say: 'Also honey.' Rabbi Shimon ben Zorai says: 'Also wine.' From the fact that the first tanna holds that wine is not included, I would say Rabbi Shimon ben Zorai says wine."

hebrew_text: תניא אמר ר"ש שזורי פעם אחת נתערב לי טבל בחולין ובאתי ושאלתי את רבי טרפון ואמר לי לך קח לך מן השוק ועשר עליו
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon Shezuri said: Once, my untithed produce became mixed together with non-sacred, produce, and I came and asked Rabbi Tarfon And he said to me: Go and take from the market and separate tithes from it on behalf of
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon said, "Once, a time, mixed for me, immersed in mundane matters, and I came and asked Rabbi Tarfon, and he said to me, 'Go, take for yourself from the market and tithe upon it.'"

hebrew_text: קסבר דאורייתא ברובא בטל ורוב עמי הארץ מעשרים הן והוה ליה כתורם מן הפטור על הפטור
human_translation: holds by Torah law nullified in the majority And the majority of those who are unreliable with regard to tithes [ amei ha’aretz ] do separate tithes, And he is considered to be separating tithes from exempt on behalf of exempt
llm_translation: He holds that the Torah is nullified by the majority, and the majority of the common people tithe, and it becomes like their tithes from the exempt for the exempt.

hebrew_text: ולימא ליה לך קח מן העובד כוכבים קסבר אין קנין לעובד כוכבים בארץ ישראל להפקיע מיד מעשר והוה ליה מן החיוב על הפטור
human_translation: But let say to him: Go and take from a gentile. holds a gentile has no acquisition in Eretz Yisrael to abrogate from tithe And considered to be from that is obligated on behalf of exempt
llm_translation: And let him say to him, "Go take from the idolater." He holds that there is no acquisition for an idolater in the land of Israel to exempt from tithe, and it will be for him from the obligation upon the exempt.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי אמר ליה לך קח מן העובד כוכבים קסבר יש קנין לעובד כוכבים בארץ ישראל להפקיע מיד מעשר והוה ליה מן הפטור על הפטור
human_translation: There are who say said to him: Go and take from a gentile holds a gentile has acquisition in Eretz Yisrael to abrogate from tithe And he is considered, to be from exempt on behalf of exempt
llm_translation: There are those who say: he said to him, "Go take from the idolater." He holds that there is acquisition for an idolater in the land of Israel to exempt from tithe, and it becomes for him from the exempt on the exempt.

hebrew_text: ולימא ליה קח מהשוק קסבר אין רוב עמי הארץ מעשרין
human_translation: But let say to him: take from the market holds the majority of amei ha’aretz do not separate tithes,
llm_translation: And let him say to him, "Take from the market." He holds that the majority of the common people do not tithe.

hebrew_text: שלח ליה רב יימר בר שלמיא לרב פפא הא דאמר רבין בר חיננא אמר עולא א"ר חנינא הלכה כר"ש שזורי ולא עוד אלא כל מקום ששנה רבי שמעון שזורי הלכה כמותו אף בנתערב ליה טבל בחולין
human_translation: Rav Yeimar bar Shelamya sent to Rav Pappa: That which Ravin bar Ḥinnana said Ulla says Rabbi Ḥanina says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon Shezuri, and moreover, any place where Rabbi Shimon Shezuri taught halakha in accordance with his even with regard to one whose untithed produce became mixed together with non-sacred, produce,
llm_translation: Sent to him Rav Yeimar son of Shalmiya to Rav Pappa: This that Ravin son of Chinana said in the name of Ula, Rabbi Chanina said: The halakha is like Rabbi Shimon Shezuri. And not only that, but in every place that Rabbi Shimon Shezuri changed, the halakha is like him. Even if he would mix in with him, he would immerse in ordinary water.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אין אמר רב אשי אמר לי מר זוטרא קשי בה ר' חנינא מסורא פשיטא
human_translation: said to him: Yes, Rav Ashi said: Mar Zutra said to me: Rabbi Ḥanina of Sura raised a difficulty with this: obvious?
llm_translation: He said to him: "No," said Rav Ashi, "Mar Zutra told me: 'Rabbi Chanina of Sura is strict in this matter, it is obvious.'"

hebrew_text: מי קאמר במשנתינו כל מקום ששנה קאמר
human_translation: Does say in our Mishna he says any place where he taught
llm_translation: Who said in our Mishnah, "Every place where it says"?

hebrew_text: אמר רב זעירא אמר רב חננאל אמר רב קרע הבא בשני שיטין יתפור בשלש אל יתפור א"ל רבה זוטי לרב אשי הכי אמר רבי ירמיה מדיפתי משמיה דרבא הא דאמרינן בשלש אל יתפור לא אמרן אלא בעתיקתא אבל חדתתא לית לן בה
human_translation: Rav Ze’eira says Rav Ḥananel says Rav says: a tear extends into two lines, one can sew into three one cannot sew Rabba Zuti said to Rav Ashi: This Rabbi Yirmeya of Difti said in the name of Rava: That which we say, into three one cannot sew we say only with regard to old But new we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rav Zeira said, Rav Hananel said, Rav Kra said: One who comes with two rows should stitch with three; he should not stitch with two. Rabbah Zuti said to Rav Ashi: So said Rabbi Yirmiyah in the name of Rava: What we said, "he should not stitch with two," was said only in the olden days, but in the present times, we do not have such a restriction.

hebrew_text: ולא עתיקתא עתיקתא ממש ולא חדתתא חדתתא ממש אלא הא דלא אפיצן הא דאפיצן וה"מ בגידין אבל בגרדין לא
human_translation: And old not literally old, and new not literally new. Rather, those that are not processed with gall those that are processed with gall And this statement, with sinew; but with thread [ bigradin ], not
llm_translation: And not ancient ancient really, and not new new really, rather this not spread out this spread out and say in sinews but in tendons not

hebrew_text: בעי רב יהודה בר אבא בין דף לדף בין שיטה לשיטה מאי תיקו
human_translation: Rav Yehuda bar Abba asks: between column and column between line and line what shall stand
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah bar Abba inquired: Between page to page, between opinion to opinion, what is the resolution?

hebrew_text: אמר ר' זעירי אמר רב חננאל אמר רב מזוזה שכתבה שתים שתים כשרה איבעיא להו שתים ושלש ואחת מהו אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק כל שכן שעשאה כשירה מיתיבי עשאה כשירה או שירה כמותה פסולה כי תניא ההיא בס"ת
human_translation: Rabbi Ze’eiri says Rav Ḥananel says Rav says: A mezuza that one wrote two two, fit. A dilemma was raised before two and three and one what is Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: All the more so as he prepared it as a poem raises an objection one wrote it as a poem or if one wrote a poem as unfit. When that is taught, to a Torah scroll,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeiri, said Rav Hananel, said Rav: A mezuzah that was written two by two is valid. The question was raised: What if it was written two, three, and one? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: All the more so if he made it valid. It was raised: If he made it valid or similar to it, it is invalid. For it was taught in a Baraita concerning a Torah scroll.

hebrew_text: אתמר נמי אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן ואמרי לה אמר רב אחא בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן מזוזה שעשאה שתים ושלש ואחת כשרה ובלבד שלא יעשנה כקובה ובלבד שלא יעשנה כזנב
human_translation: was stated as well: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says, and some say Rav Aḥa bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a mezuza that one prepared two and three and one fit, provided that he does not prepare it like a tent, and provided that he does not prepare it like a tail,
llm_translation: It was also stated: Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan, and some say it was said by Rav Aḥa bar bar Ḥana in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: A mezuzah that one made two, three, or four is valid, as long as one does not make it like a barrel and as long as one does not make it like a tail.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא על הארץ בשיטה אחרונה א"ד בסוף שיטה ואיכא דאמרי בתחלת שיטה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: al ha’aretz , on the final line, Some say at the end of line, and some say at the beginning of line.
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: "Regarding the land, in the final opinion, some say at the end of the opinion, and there are those who say at the beginning of the opinion."

hebrew_text: מ"ד בסוף שיטה (תהלים קג, יא) כגבוה שמים על הארץ ומ"ד בתחילת שיטה כי היכי דמרחקא שמים מארץ
human_translation: The one who says at the end of line “For as the heaven is high above the earth” And the one who says at the beginning of line Just as heaven is far from the earth.
llm_translation: One opinion at the end of the discussion (Psalms 103:11) "As the heavens are high above the earth," and one opinion at the beginning of the discussion, "so that the heavens are far from the earth."

hebrew_text: א"ר חלבו חזינא ליה לרב הונא דכריך לה מאחד כלפי שמע ועושה פרשיותיה סתומות
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥelbo said: I saw Rav Huna wrap from eḥad to shema , And prepared passages of closed
llm_translation: Rabbi Chalbo said: We saw that Rav Huna would wrap himself with one garment facing towards the north and make its fringes hidden.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי אמר רשב"א ר"מ היה כותבה על דוכסוסטוס כמין דף
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar said: Rabbi Meir would write on dokhsostos , like a column
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Resh Lakish said, Rabbi Meir used to write it on a parchment like a page.

hebrew_text: ועושה ריוח מלמעלה וריוח מלמטה ועושה פרשיותיה פתוחות אמרתי לו רבי מה טעם אמר לי הואיל ואין סמוכות מן התורה
human_translation: And he would make a space above and a space below and would prepare the passages of open I said to him: My teacher, what reason He said to me: Since are not adjacent in the Torah,
llm_translation: And making a space from above and a space from below, and making its openings wide. I said to him, "Rabbi, what is the reason?" He said to me, "Since there is no proximity from the Torah."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לרב יוסף ואת לא תסברא דכי אמר רב אריוח והא רב אית ליה מנהגא והאידנא נהוג עלמא בסתומות
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: And you, do you not hold that when Rav said to space, But Rav is of custom and nowadays the general custom in closed
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Yosef, "And you do not agree, for Rav Aryukh said, 'But Rav has a custom, and now the custom is prevalent in secret.'"

hebrew_text: דאמר רבה אמר רב כהנא אמר רב אם יבא אליהו ויאמר חולצין במנעל שומעין לו אין חולצין בסנדל אין שומעין לו שכבר נהגו העם בסנדל
human_translation: as Rabba says Rav Kahana says Rav says: If Elijah comes and says one performs ḥalitza with a shoe, listen to him. one may not perform ḥalitza with a sandal, they do not listen to him, as the people are already accustomed with a sandal.
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rav Kahana said, Rav said: If Elijah should come and say, "We should remove our shoes," we listen to him. But if he says, "We should remove our sandals," we do not listen to him, for the people are accustomed to wearing sandals.

hebrew_text: ורב יוסף אמר רב כהנא אמר רב אם יבא אליהו ויאמר אין חולצין במנעל שומעין לו אין חולצין בסנדל אין שומעין לו שכבר נהגו העם בסנדל
human_translation: And Rav Yosef says Rav Kahana says Rav says: If Elijah comes and says one may not perform ḥalitza with a shoe, listen to him; one may not perform ḥalitza with a sandal, they do not listen to him, as the people are already accustomed with a sandal.
llm_translation: And Rav Yosef said, Rav Kahana said, Rav said: If Elijah should come and say, "One may not remove the shoe with the sandal," we do not listen to him. If he says, "One may not remove the shoe with the sandal," we do not listen to him, for the people have already accustomed themselves to removing the shoe with the sandal.

hebrew_text: ואמרינן מאי בינייהו מנעל לכתחילה איכא בינייהו אלא לאו שמע מינה אריוח ש"מ
human_translation: And we say, What between difference is a shoe ab initio . Rather, not conclude from it of space, Conclude from it
llm_translation: And we say, what is the difference between them? There is a difference between them, but not that they are prohibited from the outset. Rather, infer from this that it is permitted.

hebrew_text: רב נחמן בר יצחק אמר מצוה לעשותן סתומות ואי עבדינהו פתוחות שפיר דמי ומאי פתוחות דקאמר רשב"א אף פתוחות
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: a mitzva to prepare closed but if one prepared them open permitted And what is Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar saying open even open
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is a mitzvah to make them closed, and if one made them open, it is good. And what are open? As Resh Lakish said: Even open.

hebrew_text: לימא מסייע ליה כיוצא בו ספר תורה שבלה ותפילין שבלו אין עושין מהן מזוזה לפי שאין מורידין מקדושה חמורה לקדושה קלה הא מורידין עושין
human_translation: Let us say supports his Similarly, a Torah scroll that became worn and phylacteries that became worn, one may not fashion them into a mezuza because one does not reduce from greater sanctity, to lesser sanctity, reduce fashion
llm_translation: Let him say, a similar case is a Torah scroll that became worn out and phylacteries that became worn out, they do not make from them a mezuzah because we do not lower from a stringent sanctity to a lenient sanctity. However, if we do lower, we make.

hebrew_text: אמאי הכא סתומות והכא פתוחות דלמא להשלים
human_translation: why here, closed but there, open Perhaps to complete
llm_translation: Why here are the laws of concealed objects and here are the laws of exposed objects? Perhaps it is to complete the understanding.

hebrew_text: הא מורידין עושין והתניא הלכה למשה מסיני תפילין על הקלף ומזוזה על דוכסוסטוס קלף במקום בשר דוכסוסטוס במקום שער למצוה
human_translation: that reduce fashion But isn’t it taught a halakha to Moses from Sinai phylacteries on parchment, and a mezuza on dokhsostos , parchment, on the side of flesh; dokhsostos , on the side of hair? as a mitzva,
llm_translation: This is the teaching: We may lower and make the parchment for tefillin. And it was taught in a Baraita: The halacha is in accordance with the opinion of Moses from Sinai, that tefillin should be written on parchment, and mezuzah should be written on duchsustos. Parchment in place of flesh, duchsustos in place of hair, for the fulfillment of the mitzvah.

hebrew_text: והתניא שינה פסול בתפילין והתניא שינה בין בזה ובין בזה פסול אידי ואידי בתפילין והא דכתבינהו אקלף במקום שער והא
human_translation: But isn’t it taught changed unfit? to phylacteries But isn’t it taught changed whether in this or in that unfit? this and that to phylacteries, and this where one wrote them on parchment on the side of hair, and that
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: If one tooth is missing, the Tefillin are invalid. And it was taught: If one tooth is missing, whether on this side or on that side, it is invalid. Both this and that are invalid in Tefillin. But as for the one who wrote them on parchment in place of hair...

hebrew_text: דכתבינהו אדוכסוסטוס במקום בשר
human_translation: where one wrote them on dokhsostos on the side flesh.
llm_translation: The text reads: "D'katveinhu Adokhsustos b'makom basar."

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא שינה בזה ובזה תנאי היא דתניא שינה בזה ובזה פסול ר' [אחא מכשיר משום רבי] אחאי ברבי חנינא ואמרי לה משמיה דרבי עקיבא ברבי חנינא
human_translation: And if you wish, say changed whether in this or in that is tanna’im , as it is taught changed in this or in that unfit. Rabbi Aḥa, in the name of Rabbi Aḥai, son of Rabbi Ḥanina, deems fit; and some say in the name of Rabbi Akiva, son of Rabbi Ḥanina.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: "Sleeping in this and in that is a dispute of Tannaim, as it was taught: Sleeping in this and in that is invalid." Rabbi Ahah permits it in the name of Rabbi Ahai, son of Rabbi Hanina, and some say in the name of Rabbi Akiva, son of Rabbi Hanina.

hebrew_text: הא מורידין עושין והא בעיא שרטוט דאמר רב מניומי בר חלקיה אמר רב חמא בר גוריא אמר רב כל מזוזה שאינה משורטטת פסולה ורב מנימין בר חלקיה דידיה אמר שרטוט של מזוזה הלכה למשה מסיני
human_translation: that reduce make But requires scoring, as Rav Minyumi bar Ḥilkiya says Rav Ḥama bar Gurya says Rav says: Any mezuza that is not scored unfit, and Rav Minyumi bar Ḥilkiya himself says The scoring of a mezuza a halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: The Gemara: This one (case of) lowering (the coffin) they do, and that one (case of) needing to be marked (with a line) - for Rav Minyumi son of Chalqya said in the name of Rav Ḥama son of Gurya said Rav: Every mezuzah that is not marked (with a line) is invalid. And Rav Minyamin son of Chalqya himself said: The marking of a mezuzah is a halakha from Moses at Sinai.

hebrew_text: תנאי היא דתניא ר' ירמיה אומר משום רבינו תפילין ומזוזות נכתבות שלא מן הכתב ואין צריכות שירטוט
human_translation: is tanna’im , as it is taught Rabbi Yirmeya says in the name of our teacher, Phylacteries and mezuzot may be written not from a written and does not require scoring.
llm_translation: It is a dispute as it was taught: Rabbi Yirmeya says in the name of our teacher, Tefillin and Mezuzot are written not from memory, and do not require erasure.

hebrew_text: והילכתא תפילין לא בעי שרטוט ומזוזה בעיא שירטוט ואידי ואידי נכתבות שלא מן הכתב מ"ט מיגרס גריסין
human_translation: And the halakha phylacteries does not require scoring, but a mezuza requires scoring. And these and those, may be written not from a written What is the reason are well known
llm_translation: The law regarding tefillin does not require scribing, while a mezuzah does require scribing. Both tefillin and mezuzah must be written not from memory. What is the reason? Because of the verse, "You shall read them" (Deuteronomy 6:9).

hebrew_text: אמר רב חלבו אנא חזיתיה לרב הונא דהוה יתיב אפוריא דס"ת עליה וכף לכדא אארעא ואנח עליה ס"ת והדר יתיב במיטה קסבר אסור לישב על גבי מיטה שס"ת מונח עליה
human_translation: Rav Ḥelbo says: I saw Rav Huna as to sit on his bed, which had a Torah scroll on it. And he overturned a jug on the ground and placed the Torah scroll on it, and then sat on the bed. he holds prohibited to sit on a bed upon which a Torah scroll is placed.
llm_translation: Rav Chalbo said: I saw Rav Huna who was sitting in the town of Aporya with a Sefer Torah on his lap, and he covered it with a cloth, and he leaned on it, and he read from the Sefer Torah, and then he sat on a bed. He holds that it is forbidden to sit on a bed upon which a Sefer Torah is placed.

hebrew_text: ופליגא דרבה בר בר חנה דאמר רבה בר בר חנה א"ר יוחנן מותר לישב על גבי מיטה שספר תורה מונח עליה ואם לחשך אדם לומר מעשה בר' אלעזר שהיה יושב על המיטה ונזכר שס"ת מונח עליה ונשמט וישב ע"ג קרקע ודומה כמי שהכישו נחש התם ס"ת על גבי קרקע הוה
human_translation: And disagrees of Rabba bar bar Ḥana, as Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It is permitted to sit on a bed upon which a Torah scroll is placed. And if a person whispers to you, saying: an incident involving Rabbi Elazar, who was sitting on a bed and realized that a Torah scroll was placed on it, and slipped off and sat upon the ground, and like one who had been bitten by a snake, There, Torah scroll was on the ground.
llm_translation: And there is a dispute of Rabba bar bar Ḥana, for Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Yoḥanan: It is permitted to sit on a bed upon which a Torah scroll is placed. And if a person forgot and said a matter, behold what happened with Rabbi Elazar who was sitting on the bed and remembered that a Torah scroll was placed on it, and he slipped off and sat on the ground, resembling one who was bitten by a snake. There, the Torah scroll was on the ground.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל כתבה אגרת פסולה מ"ט אתיא כתיבה כתיבה מספר
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: wrote a missive unfit. What is the reason? derived “writing,” “writing,” from a scroll,
llm_translation: Said Rav Yehudah, said Shmuel: If one wrote a letter, it is invalid. What is the reason? The writing is written from a book.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל תלאה במקל פסולה מ"ט בשעריך בעינן תניא נמי הכי תלאה במקל או שהניחה אחר הדלת סכנה ואין בה מצוה
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: one hung on a stick unfit. What is the reason? We require upon your gates” This is also taught one hung on a stick, or placed it behind the door danger, and it not mitzva.
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: A hanging sukkah with a stick is invalid. What is the reason? We require it to be in your gates. It was also taught likewise in a baraita: A hanging sukkah with a stick, or if one placed it behind the door, is a danger and does not contain a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: של בית מונבז המלך היו עושין בפונדקותיהן כן זכר למזוזה
human_translation: of the household of King Munbaz would do so, in their inns, in remembrance of mezuza .
llm_translation: The text in English: "Of the house of Monbaz the king, they would do in their inns so, as a remembrance for the mezuzah."

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל מצוה להניחה בתוך חללו של פתח פשיטא בשעריך אמר רחמנא ס"ד אמינא הואיל ואמר רבא מצוה להניחה
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: a mitzva to place within the airspace of the entrance, obvious? the Merciful One states: upon your gates,” enter your mind to say since Rava says: a mitzva to place
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: It is a mitzvah to place it within the hollow of the opening. Is it not obvious? In your gates, the Merciful One said. I would say, since Rava said it is a mitzvah to place it.

hebrew_text: בטפח הסמוך לרשות הרבים כמה דמרחק מעלי קמ"ל
human_translation: in the handbreadth adjacent to the public domain, the further better, teaches us
llm_translation: In the span of a handbreadth adjacent to the public domain, how much distance from above me? This teaches us.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל כתבה על שני דפין פסולה מיתיבי כתבה על שני דפין והניחה בשני סיפין פסולה הא בסף אחד כשרה ראויה לשני סיפין קאמר
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: wrote on two sheets unfit. raises an objection wrote on two sheets and placed it on two doorposts unfit. on one doorpost, fit, is saying fit to two doorposts,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: If she wrote it on two pages, it is invalid. It was raised: If she wrote it on two pages and placed it in two thresholds, it is invalid. But if on one threshold, it is valid; fit for two thresholds is what he is saying.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל במזוזה הלך אחר היכר ציר מאי היכר ציר אמר רב אדא אבקתא היכי דמי כגון פיתחא דבין תרי בתי בין בי גברי לבי נשי
human_translation: And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: With regard to a mezuza , follow the indication of hinge. What the indication of hinge? Rav Adda said: The socket What are the circumstances, where an entrance that is between two houses, between a room for men and a room for women,
llm_translation: And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: In regards to a mezuzah, one should follow the recognizable side. What is the recognizable side? Rav Adda said: The side with the mezuzah case. How is it recognizable? Like the entrance of a house, whether it is between two houses or between a man's house and a woman's house.
