hebrew_text: ריש גלותא בנא ביתא אמר ליה לרב נחמן קבע לי מזוזתא א"ר נחמן תלי דשי ברישא
human_translation: The Exilarch built house. He said to Rav Naḥman: Affix mezuzot for me Rav Naḥman said: First erect the doors,
llm_translation: The head of the exile, the son of the house, said to Rav Nachman, "Establish a mezuzah for me." Rav Nachman said to him, "Hang a lentil at the beginning."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב עשאה כמין נגר פסולה איני והא כי אתא רב יצחק בר יוסף אמר כולהו מזוזתא דבי רבי כמין נגר הוו עבידן וההיא פיתחא דעייל ביה רבי לבי מדרשא לא הוה לה מזוזה לא קשיא הא דעבידא כסיכתא הא דעבידא כאיסתוירא
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: fashioned like a bolt, unfit. Is that so? But when Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef came he said: All the mezuzot in the house of Rabbi were fashioned like a bolt, and That entrance by which Rabbi entered the study hall did not have a mezuza . not difficult. This where it is prepared like a peg, That where it is prepared like an ankle [ ke’istevira ],
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: If one made it like a carpenter, it is invalid. Is it not so? When Rav Yitzchak, son of Yosef, came, he said: All the mezuzot in the house of Rabbi were made like a carpenter, and that doorpost to which Rabbi would go from his house to the study hall did not have a mezuzah. There is no difficulty: this one was made for a partition, that one was made for a window.

hebrew_text: איני והא ההוא פיתחא דהוה עייל בה רב הונא לבי מדרשא והויא לה מזוזה ההוא רגיל הוה דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב במזוזה הלך אחר הרגיל
human_translation: Is that so? But that entrance by which Rav Huna would enter the study hall, which had a mezuza ? That was accustomed as Rav Yehuda says Rav says: With regard to a mezuza , follow the accustomed
llm_translation: I am not, but there was a certain opening that Rav Huna used to enter the study hall, and there was a mezuzah there. That one was accustomed, as Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav, "With the mezuzah, one should follow the accustomed."

hebrew_text: א"ר זירא אמר רב מתנא אמר שמואל מצוה להניחה בתחלת שליש העליון ורב הונא אמר מגביה מן הקרקע טפח ומרחיק מן הקורה טפח וכל הפתח כולו כשר למזוזה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rav Mattana says Shmuel says: a mitzva to place at the beginning of the upper third And Rav Huna says: raises a handbreadth from the ground, or distances from the beam, a handbreadth, and the entire entrance fit for mezuza .
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said, Rav Matna said Shmuel said: It is a mitzvah to place it at the beginning of the upper third. And Rav Huna said: One raises it from the ground a handbreadth and distances it from the lintel a handbreadth, and the entire doorway is valid for a mezuzah.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי מגביה מן הקרקע טפח ומרחיק מן הקורה טפח וכל הפתח כולו כשר למזוזה דברי רבי יהודה רבי יוסי אומר וקשרתם וכתבתם מה קשירה בגובה אף כתיבה בגובה
human_translation: raises an objection raises a handbreadth from the ground, or distances from the beam a handbreadth, and the entire entrance fit for mezuza ; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: “And you shall bind them “And you shall write them Just as binding on upper so too, writing, on upper
llm_translation: The scholars raised from the ground a handbreadth and distanced from the beam a handbreadth, and the entire doorway is fit for a mezuzah. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda; Rabbi Yossi says, "And you shall bind them and inscribe them" - just as binding is at a height, so too inscription is at a height.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרב הונא הוא דאמר כר' יהודה אלא לשמואל דאמר כמאן לא כר' יהודה ולא כר' יוסי
human_translation: Granted, according to Rav Huna, he states in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda; but according to Shmuel, in accordance with whose does he state not in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda, and not in accordance with Rabbi Yosei.
llm_translation: To Rav Huna it is, who said like Rabbi Yehuda. But to Shmuel, who said not like Rabbi Yehuda and not like Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ה בריה דרב נתן לעולם כרבי יוסי
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said: Actually, in accordance with Rabbi Yosei,
llm_translation: Said Reish Lakish son of Rav Nathan: "Always be like Rabbi Yossi."

hebrew_text: ומאי תחילת שליש העליון דקא אמר להרחיקה שלא להרחיקה מן הקורה של מעלה יותר משליש
human_translation: and what The beginning of the upper third that says? to distancing of that one should not distance it from the upper beam more than one-third
llm_translation: And what is the beginning of the upper third that it said to distance it, not to distance it from the upper beam more than a third.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מצוה להניחה בטפח הסמוך לרה"ר מאי טעמא רבנן אמרי כדי שיפגע במזוזה מיד רב חנינא מסורא אומר כי היכי דתינטריה
human_translation: Rava says: a mitzva to place in the handbreadth adjacent to the public domain. What is the reason The Rabbis say in order that one encounter the mezuza immediately Rav Ḥanina from Sura says: in order that protect
llm_translation: Rava said: It is a mitzvah to place it within a handbreadth near the public domain. What is the reason? The Rabbis said: So that one will come into contact with the mezuzah immediately. Rav Chanina of Sura said: So that it will be protected.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי חנינא בוא וראה שלא כמדת הקב"ה מדת בשר ודם מדת בשר ודם מלך יושב מבפנים ועם משמרין אותו מבחוץ מדת הקב"ה אינו כן עבדיו יושבין מבפנים והוא משמרן מבחוץ שנאמר (תהלים קכא, ה) ה' שומרך ה' צלך על יד ימינך
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: Come and see that the attribute of flesh and blood is not like the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He. The attribute of flesh and blood a king sits inside and people protect him from the outside, the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He, not so. His servants, sit inside and He protects them from the outside. As it is stated: “The Lord is your keeper, the Lord is your shade upon your right hand”
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chanina: Come and see, not like the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood, a king sits inside while the people guard him from outside. The measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not so; His servants sit inside while He guards them from outside, as it is stated (Psalms 121:5), "The Lord is your keeper; the Lord is your shade upon your right hand."

hebrew_text: דרש רב יוסף בריה דרבא משמיה דרבא העמיק לה טפח פסולה לימא מסייעא ליה הניחה בפצין או שטלה עליה מלבן אם יש שם טפח צריך מזוזה אחרת אם לאו אינו צריך מזוזה אחרת
human_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rava, taught in the name of Rava: dug one handbreadth deep unfit. Let us say supports his affixed in the wooden doorpost or added [ tala ] framework [ malben ] to it if there is one handbreadth there, requires another mezuza , if not, does not require another mezuza .
llm_translation: Rav Yosef, son of Rava, expounded in the name of Rava: If one deepened it by a handbreadth, it is invalid. Let him say: It is supported by the following - if one placed it in a crack or plastered it with white plaster, if there is a handbreadth there, another mezuzah is required; if not, another mezuzah is not required.

hebrew_text: כי תניא ההיא בפתח שאחורי הדלת
human_translation: When that is taught, to an entrance that is behind the door,
llm_translation: As it was taught: That one at the entrance behind the door.

hebrew_text: הא בהדיא קתני לה פתח שאחורי הדלת אם יש שם טפח צריך מזוזה אחרת ואם לאו אינו צריך מזוזה אחרת כיצד קתני
human_translation: teaches explicitly an entrance that is behind the door, if there is one handbreadth there, requires another mezuza , but if not, does not require another mezuza . teaching which
llm_translation: This is what it explicitly teaches: If the backside of the doorpost has a handbreadth there, another mezuzah is required. But if not, another mezuzah is not required. How is this taught?

hebrew_text: תנא העמיד לה מלבן של קנים חותך שפופרת ומניחה אמר רב אחא בריה דרבא לא שנו אלא שהעמיד ולבסוף חתך והניחה אבל חתך והניח ולבסוף העמיד פסולה תעשה ולא מן העשוי
human_translation: taught positions a framework of reeds, carves tube and places Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, says: They taught only where one positioned and ultimately carved and placed it. But carved and placed and ultimately positioned unfit. Prepare and not from what has already been prepared.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "**Tanna**: He established for it a support of reeds, cuts a chip and places it. **Rav Acha, son of Rava, said**: They only taught that he should establish it and in the end cut and place it. But if he cut and placed it, and in the end established it, it is invalid. It should be made, not from what is already made."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא הני פיתחי שימאי פטורין מן המזוזה מאי פיתחי שימאי פליגי בה רב ריחומי ואבא יוסי חד אמר דלית להו תקרה וחד אמר דלית להו שקופי
human_translation: And Rava says: these broken entrances [ pitḥei shima’ei ], exempt from the a mezuza . What are broken entrances? Rav Riḥumi and Abba Yosei disagree with regard to this. One says that they do not have ceiling, and one says that they do not have lintels [ shakofei ]
llm_translation: And Rava said: These doorways of Shammai are exempt from the mezuzah. What are the doorways of Shammai? Shammai and Hillel disagree about them. Rav Richumi and Abba Yosef, one said that they do not have a lintel, and one said that they do not have doorposts.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר שילא אמר רב חסדא אכסדרה פטורה מן המזוזה לפי שאין לה פצימין הא יש לה פצימין חייב לחיזוק תקרה הוא דעבידי
human_translation: Rabba bar Sheila says Rav Ḥisda says: a portico, exempt from the a mezuza , because it does not have doorposts [ patzimin ] that it has doorposts, obligated they are made to strengthen the ceiling.
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Shila said, Rav Ḥisda said: A balcony is exempt from a mezuzah because it does not have doorposts. But if it has doorposts, one is obligated to strengthen the ceiling.

hebrew_text: הכי קאמר אע"פ שיש לה פצימין פטורה שאין עשויין אלא לחיזוק לתקרה אמר אביי חזינא להו לאיספלידי דבי מר דאית להו פצימי ולית להו מזוזתא קסבר לחיזוק תקרה הוא דעבידי
human_translation: This is saying: Even if it has doorposts, exempt because they are made only to strengthen the ceiling, Abaye said: I saw the porticos [ le’ispelidei ] of the house of the Master, that they had doorposts but they did not have mezuzot . holds are made to strengthen the ceiling.
llm_translation: So it is saying, even though it has battens, it is exempt, as they are only made for strengthening the ceiling. Abaye said: I have seen the craftsmen of the house of the Master who have battens but do not have a mezuzah. He holds that they are made for strengthening the ceiling.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי בית שער אכסדרה ומרפסת חייבין במזוזה באכסדרה דבי רב אכסדרה דבי רב כאינדרונא מעלייתא הוא באכסדרה רומיתא
human_translation: raises an objection a gatehouse, a portico, and a balcony, obligated to a mezuza . with regard to the portico of a study hall, A portico of a study hall is like a full-fledged room [ inderona ], with regard to a Roman portico,
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: A gatehouse, a roofed balcony, and a balcony are obligated in a mezuzah. In the case of a roofed balcony in the house of Rav, the roofed balcony of the house of Rav is like an upper story. In the case of a Roman roofed balcony.

hebrew_text: אמר רחבה אמר רב יהודה בי הרזיקי חייב בשתי מזוזות מאי בי הרזיקי אמר רב פפא סבא משמיה דרב בית שער הפתוח לחצר ובתים פתוחין לבית שער
human_translation: Raḥava says Rav Yehuda says: a bei harziki , obligated to two mezuzot . What a bei harziki ? Rav Pappa the Elder says in the name of Rav: a gatehouse that opens to a courtyard, and houses open to gatehouse.
llm_translation: Said Rachbah, said Rav Yehudah: "One who has a courtyard open to Beit HaRaziki is obligated in two mezuzot." What is Beit HaRaziki? Rav Papa the Elder said in the name of Rav: "A house with an open entrance to a courtyard, and houses open to the entrance."

hebrew_text: ת"ר בית שער הפתוח לגינה ולקיטונית רבי יוסי אומר נידון כקיטונית וחכ"א נידון כבית שער רב ושמואל דאמרי תרוייהו מגינה לבית כולי עלמא לא פליגי דחייב מאי טעמא ביאה דבית היא
human_translation: The Sages taught a gatehouse that opens to a garden, and to a small room [ ulekitonit ], Rabbi Yosei says: Its status is like a small room, and the Rabbis say: is like a gatehouse, Rav and Shmuel both say: from the garden to the house, everyone agrees obligated What is the reason? It is entering house,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "A doorway that is open to a garden and to a courtyard." Rabbi Yossi says: "It is judged like a courtyard." And the sages say: "It is judged like a doorway." Rav and Shmuel both say: "Regarding a garden that is open to a house, everyone agrees that one is liable. What is the reason? Because it is considered an entrance of the house."

hebrew_text: כי פליגי מבית לגינה מר סבר קיטונית עיקר ומר סבר גינה עיקר
human_translation: When they disagree from house to the garden, Sage, holds small room main And Sage, hold garden main
llm_translation: When they disputed from the house to the garden, Master A holds that the small garden is primary, and Master B holds that the large garden is primary.

hebrew_text: רבה ורב יוסף דאמרי תרוייהו מבית לגינה דכולי עלמא לא פליגי דפטור מאי טעמא פיתחא דגינה הוא כי פליגי מגינה לבית מר סבר ביאה דבית הוא ומר סבר כולה
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: from house to the garden, everyone agrees exempt What is the reason? It is entrance to the garden, When they disagree from garden to the house, Sage, holds it is entering the house, and Sage, holds the entire
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: From the house to the garden, everyone agrees that one is exempt. What is the reason? The opening of the garden is considered part of the house. When they disagree, from the garden to the master's house, one opinion holds that it is considered part of the house, and the other opinion holds that it is considered part of the garden.

hebrew_text: אדעתא דגינה הוא דעבידא
human_translation: is made for the purpose of garden,
llm_translation: The knowledge of the garden is the one that causes it.

hebrew_text: אביי ורבא עבדי כרבה ורב יוסף ורב אשי עביד כרב ושמואל לחומרא והילכתא כרב ושמואל לחומרא
human_translation: Abaye and Rava would act in accordance with Rabba and Rav Yosef, And Rav Ashi would act in accordance with Rav and Shmuel, stringently, And the halakha in accordance with Rav and Shmuel, stringently.
llm_translation: Abbaye and Rava, disciples of Rabah and Rav Yosef, and Rav Ashi, act in accordance with the stringency of Rav and Shmuel, and the halacha follows the stringency of Rav and Shmuel.

hebrew_text: איתמר לול פתוח מן הבית לעלייה אמר רב הונא אם יש לו פתח אחד חייב במזוזה אחת אם יש לו ב' פתחין חייב בשתי מזוזות אמר רב פפא שמע מינה מדרב הונא האי אינדרונא דאית ליה ארבעה באבי חייב בארבע מזוזות פשיטא לא צריכא אף על גב דרגיל בחד
human_translation: It was stated: an aperture that opens from a house to a loft Rav Huna says: If has one entrance, obligated to one mezuza ; if it has two entrances, obligated to two mezuzot . Rav Pappa says: learn from that of Rav Huna this room that has four gates, obligated to four mezuzot . obvious? No, necessary even though one is accustomed to one
llm_translation: It was stated: If a balcony is open towards the house for ascending, Rav Huna said: If it has one opening, he is obligated in one mezuzah; if it has two openings, he is obligated in two mezuzot. Rav Papa said: Learn from this ruling of Rav Huna - this balcony that has four sides, he is obligated in four mezuzot. It is obvious and not needed, even though it is common to have one.

hebrew_text: אמר אמימר האי פיתחא דאקרנא חייב במזוזה אמר ליה רב אשי לאמימר והא לית ליה פצימין א"ל עדי פצימי
human_translation: Ameimar said: this entrance which at the corner obligated to a mezuza . Rav Ashi said to Ameimar: But it does not have doorposts. said to him: These [ adei ] are its doorposts,
llm_translation: Said Amemar: This opening of the roof is obligated in a mezuzah. Rav Ashi said to Amemar: But it does not have doorposts. He said to him: Witness are the doorposts.

hebrew_text: רב פפא איקלע לבי מר שמואל חזא ההוא פיתחא דלא הוה ליה אלא פצים אחד משמאלא ועבידא ליה מזוזה א"ל כמאן כר"מ אימר דאמר ר"מ מימין משמאל מי אמר
human_translation: Rav Pappa happened to the house of Mar Shmuel, he saw a certain entrance that had only one doorpost to the left and had affixed a mezuza to said to him: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Meir, say that Rabbi Meir says to right Does he say to left?
llm_translation: Rav Papa entered the house of Master Shmuel, he saw a certain opening that had only one side to the left, and he made for it a mezuzah. He said to him, "Who is like Rabbi Meir? As Rabbi Meir said, 'From right to left, who said?'"

hebrew_text: מאי היא דתניא ביתך ביאתך מן הימין אתה אומר מן הימין או אינו אלא משמאל ת"ל ביתך מאי תלמודא אמר רבה דרך ביאתך מן הימין דכי עקר איניש כרעיה דימינא עקר
human_translation: What this As it is taught your house [ beitekha ]” biatekha , from the right. Do you say from the right, or only from the left? the verse states: Your house [ beitekha ]. What is the derivation Rabba says: the way that you enter from the right, as when a person lifts his foot he lifts his right
llm_translation: "What is it that is taught in a Baraita: 'Your house, your coming in from the right'? You say, 'from the right,' or perhaps it is only from the left? The Torah teaches, 'your house.' What is the reasoning? Rabbah said: The way of your coming in is from the right, for when a person uproots, he uproots with his right foot."

hebrew_text: רב שמואל בר אחא קמיה דרב פפא משמיה דרבא בר עולא אמר מהכא (מלכים ב יב, י) ויקח יהוידע הכהן ארון אחד ויקב חור בדלתו ויתן אותו אצל המזבח מימין בבוא איש בית ה' ונתנו שמה הכהנים שומרי הסף את כל הכסף המובא בית ה'
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Aḥa said before Rav Pappa in the name of Rava bar Ulla from here: “And Jehoiada the priest took a chest, and bored a hole in the lid of it, and set it beside the altar, on the right side as one comes into the House of the Lord; and the priests that kept the threshold put in there all the money that was brought into the House of the Lord”
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Acha stood before Rav Papa in the name of Rava bar Ula and said from here (2 Kings 12:10), "And Yehoyada the priest took a chest and bored a hole in its door and placed it beside the altar on the right side as one enters the House of the Lord; and the priests who guarded the threshold put into it all the money brought into the House of the Lord."

hebrew_text: מאי ר"מ דתניא בית שאין לו אלא פצים אחד ר"מ מחייב במזוזה וחכמים פוטרין מאי טעמא דרבנן (דברים ו, ט) מזוזות כתיב
human_translation: What Rabbi Meir, As it is taught a house that has only one doorpost, Rabbi Meir deems obligated to a mezuza , and the Rabbis deem exempt What is the reasoning of the Rabbis? It is written: doorposts
llm_translation: What is the opinion of Rabbi Meir as it was taught: A house that only has one entrance, Rabbi Meir obligates a mezuzah, and the Sages exempt it. What is the reason of the Rabbis? (Deuteronomy 6:9) "Mezuzot" is written.

hebrew_text: מ"ט דר' מאיר דתניא מזוזות שומע אני מיעוט מזוזות שתים כשהוא אומר (דברים יא, כ) מזוזות בפרשה שניה שאין תלמוד לומר הוי ריבוי אחר ריבוי ואין ריבוי אחר ריבוי אלא למעט מעטו הכתוב למזוזה אחת דברי ר' ישמעאל
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Meir, As it is taught “doorposts” I derive the minimum of doorposts, two. When it says “doorposts” in the second passage as no the verse to state is amplification following amplification, and an amplification following an amplification is only to restrict the verse restricted to one doorpost. the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Reasoning of Rabbi Meir, as it was taught: "Mezuzot" - I hear the term to exclude the requirement of affixing two mezuzot when it says (Deuteronomy 11:20) "mezuzot" in the second portion, this is without a need for the verse to say "be multiplied" after "multiply," and likewise "multiply" after "be multiplied," rather it is to exclude its smallness. The Scripture thus speaks concerning one mezuzah. These are the words of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: ר"ע אומר אינו צריך כשהוא אומר (שמות יב, כג) על המשקוף ועל שתי המזוזות שאין ת"ל שתי מה ת"ל שתי זה בנה אב כל מקום שנאמר מזוזות אינו אלא אחת עד שיפרט לך הכתוב שתים
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: is not necessary. when states: the lintel and the two doorposts” as no the verse to state “two,” What the verse states “two”? This established a paradigm anywhere where it is stated “doorposts,” only one unless the verse specifies two
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, as when he says (Exodus 12:23) "on the lintel and on the two doorposts," is it not superfluous to say "two"? What does the Torah teach by saying "two"? This teaches you that in every place where it says "doorposts," it is only one, until the verse specifies for you two.

hebrew_text: ת"ר וכתבתם יכול יכתבנה על האבנים נאמר כאן כתיבה ונאמר להלן כתיבה מה להלן על הספר אף כאן על הספר
human_translation: The Sages taught “And you shall write them might one writes on the stones writing is stated here, and writing is stated there. Just as there on a book, so too, on a book.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And you shall write" - one might have thought that it should be written on stones. It is stated here as writing, and it is stated elsewhere as writing. Just as there, it is written on a scroll, so too here, it is written on a scroll.

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו נאמר כאן כתיבה ונאמר להלן כתיבה מה להלן על האבנים אף כאן על האבנים
human_translation: Or go [ kalekh ] this way, writing is stated here, and writing is stated there, Just as there, on the stones so too here, on the stones.
llm_translation: Or "all of it" for this way it is stated here it is written and it is stated there it is written what there on the stones also here on the stones.

hebrew_text: נראה למי דומה דנין כתיבה הנוהגת לדורות מכתיבה הנוהגת לדורות ואין דנין כתיבה הנוהגת לדורות מכתיבה שאינה נוהגת לדורות וכמו שנאמר להלן (ירמיהו לו, יח) ויאמר להם ברוך מפיו יקרא אלי את הדברים האלה ואני כותב על הספר בדיו
human_translation: Let us see to which it is similar, We derive writing that is performed in generations, from writing that is performed in generations, but we do not derive writing that is performed in generations from writing that is not performed in generations. And as it is stated below: “And Baruch said to them: He dictated all these words to me, and I wrote them with ink in the scroll”
llm_translation: It appears to whom similar judgment writing that is practiced for generations from writing that is practiced for generations and not judgment writing that is practiced for generations from writing that is not practiced for generations. And as it is said below (Jeremiah 36:18), "And Baruch said to them, 'He pronounced all these words to me with his mouth, and I wrote them with ink on the scroll.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי רחמנא אמר על מזוזות ואת אמרת נילף כתיבה כתיבה אמר קרא (דברים ו, ט) וכתבתם כתיבה תמה והדר על המזוזות
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: The Merciful One states: “Upon the doorposts,” and you say: Let us derive “writing” “writing,” The verse states: “And you shall write them [ ukhtavtam ],” complete writing [ ketiva tamma ], and then “upon the doorposts”
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: "The Merciful One said regarding mezuzot, and you said we derive the law from the writing itself. The verse says: 'And you shall write,' which implies writing in the singular. It is astonishing, and then the law is derived regarding mezuzot."

hebrew_text: ומאחר דכתיב [וכתבתם] האי גזירה שוה למה לי אי לאו גזירה שוה הוה אמינא ליכתבא אאבנא וליקבעה אסיפא קמ"ל:
human_translation: And since it is written: why do I this verbal analogy were it not verbal analogy, I would say should write on a stone, and affix to the doorpost. teaches us
llm_translation: And since it is written and you shall write, this gezeirah shavah, why do I need it? If it were not a gezeirah shavah, I would say to write it with a stone and fix it in the gathering. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: ארבע פרשיות שבתפילין מעכבות זו את זו ואפילו כתב אחד מעכבן: פשיטא
human_translation: the four passages that are in the phylacteries, each prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with the others, and even one letter prevents fulfillment of the mitzva with them. obvious
llm_translation: Four portions of the tefillin impede one another, and even if one wrote them, they impede them: It is obvious.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב לא נצרכא אלא לקוצו של יו"ד והא נמי פשיטא לא נצרכא אלא לאידך דרב יהודה דאמר רב יהודה אמר רב כל אות שאין גויל מוקף לה מארבע רוחותיה פסולה:
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: necessary only that the thorn, of yod But this also obvious, Rather, it is necessary only according to another that Rav Yehuda As Rav Yehuda says Rav says: Any letter that is not encircled with parchment on four of its sides, unfit.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: It was only necessary for the "kotzo" of the letter Yud. But this is also obvious! It was only necessary for the other opinion of Rav Yehudah, for Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: Any letter that is not surrounded by its four sides is invalid.

hebrew_text: ת"ר לטטפת לטטפת לטוטפת הרי כאן ד' דברי רבי ישמעאל
human_translation: The Sages taught for totafot for totafot for totafot There are four here, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "To titetet, to titetet, to tutetet, here are four words of Rabbi Yishmael."

hebrew_text: ר"ע אומר אינו צריך טט בכתפי שתים פת באפריקי שתים
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: There is no need tot in Katfei two, pat in Afriki two,
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: It is not necessary, "tet-tet," on both shoulders; two loaves, "pat," in Africa; two.

hebrew_text: ת"ר יכול יכתבם על ד' עורות ויניחם בד' בתים בד' עורות ת"ל (שמות יג, ט) ולזכרון בין עיניך זכרון אחד אמרתי לך ולא ב' וג' זכרונות הא כיצד כותבן על ד' עורות ומניחן בד' בתים בעור אחד
human_translation: The Sages taught might should write on four hides, and place them in four compartments of four hides, the verse states: “And for a memorial between your eyes” I said to you one memorial, but not two or three memorials, How so? writes on four hides and places them in four compartments of one hide.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: It might have been thought that one should write them on four hides and place them in four houses; on four hides it is stated (Exodus 13:9), "And it shall be for a sign unto thee upon thine hand, and for a memorial between thine eyes, that the Lord's law may be in thy mouth." One memorial have I spoken unto thee, not two or three memorials. How then should one write them on four hides and place them in four houses? On one hide.

hebrew_text: ואם כתבן בעור אחד והניחן בד' בתים יצא וצריך שיהא ריוח ביניהן דברי רבי וחכ"א אינו צריך ושוין שנותן חוט או משיחה בין כל אחת ואחת ואם אין חריצן ניכר פסולות
human_translation: And if wrote them on one hide and placed them in four compartments fulfilled And necessary for there to be a space between the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: It is not necessary And agree that one places a string or band between each and every one And if their furrows, are not noticeable are unfit.
llm_translation: "And if he wrote them on one piece of hide and placed them in two houses, he has fulfilled his obligation, and it is necessary that there be space between them - the words of Rabbi, while the sages say it is not necessary. And they are equal in that one must place a thread or a strap between each one. And if the stitching is not recognizable, they are invalid."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן כיצד כותבן תפלה של יד כותבה על עור אחד ואם כתבה בארבע עורות והניחה בבית אחד יצא וצריך לדבק שנאמר (שמות יג, ט) והיה לך לאות על ידך כשם שאות אחת מבחוץ כך אות אחת מבפנים דברי ר' יהודה ר' יוסי אומר אינו צריך
human_translation: The Sages taught How does write them? the phylacteries of the arm, he writes it on one hide. But if he wrote it on four hides and placed it in one compartment, fulfilled And it is necessary to attach as it is stated: “And it shall be for a sign for you upon your arm” just as one sign on the outside, so too, one sign on the inside, the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Yosei says: It is not necessary
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: How does one write the hand Tefillah? He writes it on one piece of hide. And if he wrote it on four hides and placed it in one house, he has fulfilled his obligation, but he must glue them together, as it is stated (Exodus 13:9), "And it shall be a sign for you upon your hand" - just as one sign is on the outside, so too, one sign is on the inside. These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah; Rabbi Yossi says: It is not necessary.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוסי ומודה לי ר' יהודה ברבי שאם אין לו תפילין של יד ויש לו שתי תפילין של ראש שטולה עור על אחת מהן ומניחה מודה היינו פלוגתייהו אמר רבא מדבריו של ר' יוסי חזר בו ר' יהודה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: And Rabbi Yehuda the Distinguished [ Beribbi ] concedes to me that if one does not have phylacteries of the arm but has two phylacteries of the head, that he covers one of them with patches of hide, and places it concedes This is their dispute Rava said: From Rabbi Yosei’s statement Rabbi Yehuda retracted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said, and Rabbi Yehuda son of Rabbi concedes to me, that if one does not have a hand Tefillin but has two head Tefillin, he should remove the strap from one of them and wear it. This is their dispute. Rava said: Rabbi Yehuda retracted from the words of Rabbi Yosei.

hebrew_text: איני והא שלח רב חנניה משמיה דר' יוחנן תפלה של יד עושין אותה של ראש ושל ראש אין עושין אותה של יד לפי שאין מורידין מקדושה חמור' לקדושה קלה
human_translation: Is that so? But Rav Ḥananya sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: phylacteries of the arm, can convert it to of the head, but of the head, cannot convert it to of the arm, because one does not reduce from greater sanctity to lesser sanctity
llm_translation: I am not. But didn't Rav Chananya send in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "The hand Tefillah is made like that of the head, but the head Tefillah is not made like that of the hand, because we do not descend from a strict sanctity to a lighter sanctity."

hebrew_text: ל"ק הא בעתיקתא הא בחדתתא ולמ"ד הזמנה מילתא היא דאתני עלייהו מעיקרא
human_translation: not difficult, this with regard to old that with regard to new And according to the one who says designation is significant, where he stipulated with regard to them from the outset
llm_translation: "Regarding this, in the ancient and in the recent, and according to the one who maintains that it is a matter of time, for it was taught about them from the beginning."

hebrew_text: ת"ר כיצד סדרן קדש לי והי' כי יביאך מימין שמע והי' אם שמוע משמאל
human_translation: The Sages taught How does one arrange “Sanctify unto Me” “And it shall be when He shall bring you” on the right; “Listen, “And it shall come to pass, if you shall hearken diligently” on the left.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: How is the order of the sections? "Sanctify to Me" and it shall be, "If you will heed" from the right, and it shall be, "If you will not heed" from the left.

hebrew_text: והתניא איפכא אמר אביי ל"ק כאן מימינו של קורא כאן מימינו של מניח והקורא קורא כסדרן:
human_translation: But isn’t it taught opposite Abaye said not difficult: Here to the right of reader, there to the right of one who is donning And the reader reads in their order,
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: Abaye said the opposite, "Here is the right side of the reader, here is the right side of the one laying, and the reader reads in their proper order."

hebrew_text: אמר רב חננאל אמר רב החליף פרשיותיה פסולות אמר אביי לא אמרן
human_translation: Rav Ḥananel says Rav says: one exchanged its passages, are unfit. Abaye said: We did not say
llm_translation: Rav Hananel said in the name of Rav: He interchanged the portions, they are invalid. Abaye said: We did not say this.

hebrew_text: אלא גוייתא לברייתא וברייתא לגוייתא אבל גוייתא לגוייתא וברייתא לברייתא לית לן בה
human_translation: unless an inner for an outer or an outer for an inner one, But an inner for inner or an outer for outer we have no with it.
llm_translation: Rather, the body to the creation, and the creation to the body, but the body to the body and the creation to the creation, we do not have in it.

hebrew_text: א"ל רבא מאי שנא גוייתא לברייתא וברייתא לגוייתא דלא דהך דבעי למיחזי אוירא לא קא חזייא והא דלא קא בעי למיחזי אוירא קא חזייא ברייתא לברייתא וגוייתא לגוייתא נמי הך דבעיא למיחזי אוירא דימין קא חזיא אוירא דשמאל ודשמאל קא חזיא אוירא דימין אלא ל"ש
human_translation: Rava said to What is different an inner for an outer and an outer for an inner that not that this which needs to see the air, does not see and that which does not need to see the air, does see it. an outer for outer or an inner for inner as well, this which needs to see the air of right sees the air of left and of left sees the air of right Rather, is no difference
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the difference between a body to a creature and a creature to a body? That which, when it needs to be seen, it is not seen, and that which does not need to be seen, is seen. A creature to a creature and a body to a body, also that which needs to be seen, the light is seen on the right side, and the light of the left side is seen on the left side. Rather, say:

hebrew_text: ואמר רב חננאל אמר רב תיתורא דתפילין הלכה למשה מסיני אמר אביי מעברתא דתפילין הלכה למשה מסיני ואמר אביי שי"ן של תפילין הלכה למשה מסיני
human_translation: And Rav Ḥananel says Rav says: the titora of phylacteries, a halakha to Moses from Sinai. Abaye said: the ma’ebarta of phylacteries, a halakha to Moses from Sinai. And Abaye says: shin on phylacteries a halakha to Moses from Sinai.
llm_translation: And Rav Hananel said in the name of Rav Tithra: The halakha regarding tefillin is from Sinai. Abaye said: The strap of tefillin is from Sinai. And Abaye said: The shin of tefillin is from Sinai.

hebrew_text: וצריך שיגיע חריץ למקום התפר רב דימי מנהרדעא אמר כיון דמנכר לא צריך
human_translation: And there is a requirement that furrow reach the place of the stitches, Rav Dimi of Neharde’a says: Once it is noticeable it is not necessary
llm_translation: And necessary that reach awl to place the sewing Rav Dimi from Nehardea said since recognizable not necessary

hebrew_text: ואמר אביי האי קילפא דתפילין צריך למיבדקיה דדילמא אית בה ריעותא ובעינא כתיבה תמה וליכא רב דימי מנהרדעא אמר לא צריך קולמוסא בדיק לה
human_translation: And Abaye says: this parchment of phylacteries, must examine it as perhaps it has a flaw, and complete writing is required, and not Rav Dimi of Neharde’a says: No required; the quill examines it
llm_translation: And Abaye said: This pouch of the tefillin needs to be checked, for perhaps it contains a hole, and I require a complete writing. And there is no Rav Dimi from Nehardea who said: It does not need to be checked with a reed.

hebrew_text: א"ר יצחק רצועות שחורות הלכה למשה מסיני מיתיבי תפילין אין קושרין אותן אלא במינן בין ירוקות בין שחורות בין לבנות אדומות לא יעשה מפני גנאי ודבר אחר
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: straps black a halakha to Moses from Sinai. raises an objection One may tie phylacteries only of their type, whether green, or black, or white. one should not make red because deprecatory and something else,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: "Black straps - the halacha is according to the tradition from Sinai." It was taught: regarding phylacteries, one may only tie them with their own kind, whether they are green, black, white, or red. One should not do this out of disgrace, and for another reason.

hebrew_text: א"ר יהודה מעשה בתלמידו של ר"ע שהיה קושר תפיליו בלשונות של תכלת ולא אמר לו דבר איפשר אותו צדיק ראה תלמידו ולא מיחה בו אמר לו הן לא ראה אותו ואם ראה אותו לא היה מניחו
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: an incident involving Rabbi Akiva’s student, who would tie his phylacteries with strips of sky blue wool and did not say anything to him. possible that righteous man saw his student and he did not object to his said to Yes, did not see him, and if he had seen him, he would not have allowed him
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said: There was an incident with the student of Rabbi Akiva who was tying his tzitzit with threads of tekhelet, and his teacher did not say anything to him. That righteous man saw his student and did not rebuke him. He said to him, "Did you not see him? And if you did see him, you should not have let him go."

hebrew_text: מעשה בהורקנוס בנו של ר' אליעזר בן הורקנוס שהיה קושר תפיליו בלשונות של ארגמן ולא אמר לו דבר איפשר אותו צדיק ראה בנו ולא מיחה בו אמרו לו הן לא ראה אותו ואם ראה אותו לא היה מניחו
human_translation: an incident involving Hyrcanus, the son of Rabbi Eliezer ben Hyrcanus, who would tie his phylacteries with strips of purple wool, and did not say anything to him. possible that righteous man saw his son and he did not object to his said to him: Yes, did not see him, and if he had seen him, he would not have allowed him
llm_translation: The incident with Horkanos, the son of Rabbi Eliezer ben Horkanos, who used to tie his phylacteries with threads of crimson wool, and no one said anything to him. A certain righteous man saw his son and did not rebuke him. They said to him, "Did you not see him? And if you saw him, why did you not rebuke him?"

hebrew_text: קתני מיהא בין ירוקות בין שחורות ובין לבנות לא קשיא כאן מבפנים כאן מבחוץ
human_translation: In any event, teaches whether green, or black, or white, not difficult. Here, the inside there, the outside
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Whether they are green, black, or white, it is not difficult. Here, from the inside, here, from the outside.

hebrew_text: אי מבפנים מאי גנאי ודבר אחר איכא זימנין דמתהפכין ליה
human_translation: If the inside what deprecatory or something else is there Sometimes his become reversed,
llm_translation: If from the inside, what is the disgrace? And another explanation: there are times when they turn it over to him.

hebrew_text: תנא תפילין מרובעות הלכה למשה מסיני אמר רב פפא בתפרן ובאלכסונן
human_translation: taught phylacteries square a halakha to Moses from Sinai. Rav Pappa says along their seams and their diagonals,
llm_translation: It was taught: Tefillin square, a halakha from Moses at Sinai. Rav Pappa said: With their straps and their knots.

hebrew_text: לימא מסייע ליה העושה תפילתו עגולה סכנה ואין בה מצוה אמר רב פפא מתני' דעבידא כי אמגוזא
human_translation: Let us say supports One who fashions his phylacteries a round danger, and it not mitzva Rav Pappa said: the mishna that are fashioned like a nut,
llm_translation: Let us say: If one who makes his prayer circular, it is a danger and there is no mitzvah in it. Rav Papa said: It is taught in a Mishnah: One who acts like an almond.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא תפילין כל זמן שפני טבלא קיימת כשירות רב חסדא אמר נפסקו שתים כשירות שלש פסולות
human_translation: Rav Huna says: phylacteries as long as the surface of outer hide is intact, they are fit, Rav Ḥisda says: two tore, are fit, three they are unfit.
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Tefillin, as long as the parchment is intact, are valid. Rav Chisda said: If two are cut, they are valid; if three, they are invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הא דאמרת שתים כשירות לא אמרן אלא זה שלא כנגד זה אבל זה כנגד זה פסולות וזה כנגד זה נמי לא אמרן אלא בחדתתא אבל בעתיקתא לית לן בה
human_translation: Rava said: that which you said, two they are fit, we said only not aligned with each other, But aligned with each other, are unfit. And even aligned with each other, we said only with regard to new But with regard to old we have no with it,
llm_translation: Rava said: This that you said, two women are valid, we only said this when they are not opposite each other, but if they are opposite each other, they are invalid. And this case opposite this case as well, we only said this in the case of a new woven cloth, but in the case of an old woven cloth, we do not have a ruling on it.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לרב יוסף היכי דמיין חדתתא והיכי דמיין עתיקתא אמר ליה כל היכא כי מיתלי ביה בשלחא והדר חלים עתיקתא ואידך חדתתא
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: What are the circumstances new and what are the circumstances old said to him: any where if one holds the hide and pulls it, it returns to its place [ ḥaleim ], old; and the other new.
llm_translation: Abaye said to Rav Yosef: How should one establish the new grain offering and how should one establish the old grain offering? He said to him: Wherever it is mentioned in the context of sending forth, establish the new one, and then establish the old one.

hebrew_text: וא"נ כל היכי דכי מיתלי ביה במתנא אתייה אבתריה חדתתא ואידך עתיקתא
human_translation: Alternatively, any where if hanging by the strap follows new; and the other old.
llm_translation: And if not, in any way that when it is taught in the Mishnah, a later one comes after it, and the other is earlier.

hebrew_text: אביי הוה יתיב קמיה דרב יוסף איפסיק ליה רצועה דתפילי א"ל מהו למיקטריה א"ל וקשרתם כתיב שתהא קשירה תמה
human_translation: Abaye was sitting before Rav Yosef strap of his phylacteries tore. said to What is to tie said to him: It is written “And you shall bind them [ ukshartam ] that binding must be complete [ keshira tamma ],
llm_translation: Abbaye was sitting in front of Rav Yosef, a strap of his tefillin snapped. He said to him, "What is the law regarding tying it?" He said to him, "And you shall bind" is written, indicating that it should be tied permanently.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב אחא בריה דרב יוסף לרב אשי מהו למיתפריה ועייליה לתפירה לגאו אמר פוק חזי מה עמא דבר
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rav Yosef, said to Rav Ashi: What is to sew and insert stitching inside, said Go out and see what the people are doing.
llm_translation: He said to him, Rav Acha, son of Rav Yosef, to Rav Ashi: What is the law regarding cutting it and bringing it for sewing into a pride? He said: Go out and see what the people are saying.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא גרדומי רצועות כשירות ולאו מילתא היא מדאמרי בני רבי חייא גרדומי תכלת וגרדומי אזוב כשירין התם הוא דתשמישי מצוה נינהו אבל הכא דתשמישי קדושה נינהו לא
human_translation: Rav Pappa says: The remnants of straps, are fit. And it is not so, from that the sons of Rabbi Ḥiyya say: The remnants of sky blue wool and the remnants of hyssop, are fit. it is there as they are articles of a mitzva; but here, are articles of sanctity, not
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: Girdles of linen are valid, and it is not a matter, as the sons of Rabbi Chiya said: Girdles of blue wool and girdles of hyssop are valid. There, they are fit for the use of a mitzvah, but here, where they are fit for the use of holiness, they are not valid.

hebrew_text: מכלל דאית להו שיעורא וכמה שיעורייהו אמר רמי בר חמא אמר ר"ל עד אצבע צרדה רב כהנא מחוי כפוף רב אשי מחוי פשוט
human_translation: by inference that have measure. And how much is their measure? Rami bar Ḥama says Reish Lakish says: until the index finger. Rav Kahana demonstrate a bowed Rav Ashi demonstrate a straight
llm_translation: From the fact that it has a measurement, and how many measurements does it have? Rami bar Hama said in the name of Rabbi Yehuda the Prince: up to the width of a finger. Rav Kahana from the village of Mahozi bent over, Rav Ashi from the village of Peshot.

hebrew_text: רבה קטר להו ופשיט ושדי להו רב אחא בר יעקב קטר להו ומתלית להו מר בריה דרבנא עביד כדידן
human_translation: Rabba tie and release and let them fall Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov tie them and plait them Mar, son of Rabbana, act like we
llm_translation: Rava offered incense for them and they were appeased, and Rav Aha bar Yaakov offered incense for them and suspended the plague, the son of Ravna's son did as we do.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה בריה דרב שמואל בר שילת משמיה דרב קשר של תפילין הלכה למשה מסיני אמר ר"נ ונוייהן לבר רב אשי הוה יתיב קמיה דמר זוטרא איתהפכא ליה רצועה דתפילין א"ל לא סבר לה מר ונוייהן לבר א"ל לאו אדעתאי
human_translation: Rav Yehuda, son of Rav Shmuel bar Sheilat, says in the name of Rav: knot of phylacteries, a halakha to Moses from Sinai. Rav Naḥman says: And their decorative outward. Rav Ashi was sitting before Mar Zutra strap of phylacteries became reversed. said to him: Doesn’t the Master hold their decorative outward? said to him: not my mind,
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah, son of Rav Shmuel, son of Shilat, said in the name of Rav: The knot of the Tefillin is a Halacha from Moses at Sinai. Rav Nahman said: And their adornment is for the son of Rav Ashi. He was sitting before Mar Zutra when the strap of the Tefillin flipped over for him. Mar Zutra said to him: The Master does not hold this way. He said to him: It is not my intention.

hebrew_text: (דברים כח, י) וראו כל עמי הארץ כי שם ה' נקרא עליך ויראו ממך תניא ר"א הגדול אומר אלו תפילין שבראש (שמות לג, כג) והסרותי את כפי וראית את אחורי אמר רב חנא בר ביזנא אמר ר"ש חסידא מלמד שהראה לו הקב"ה למשה קשר של תפילין
human_translation: “And all the nations of the land shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you, and they shall be afraid of you” is taught Rabbi Eliezer the Great says: This the phylacteries of the head, “And I will remove My hand, and you will see My back” Rav Ḥana bar Bizna says Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida says: teaches that the Holy One, Blessed be He, showed Moses the knot of phylacteries
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Deuteronomy 28:10) "And all the peoples of the earth shall see that the name of the Lord is called upon you, and they shall be afraid of you." It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer the Great says, "These are the Tefillin of the head." (Exodus 33:23) "And I will take away My hand, and you shall see My back." Rav Ḥana bar Bizna said that Rabbi Shimon Ḥasida said: This teaches that the Holy One, blessed be He, showed Moses the knot of the Tefillin.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה קשר של תפילין צריך שיהא למעלה כדי שיהו ישראל למעלה ולא למטה וצריך שיהא כלפי פנים כדי שיהו ישראל לפנים ולא לאחור
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: The knot of phylacteries must be above, in order that the Jewish people should be above and not below. And it must be placed toward the front [ panim ], in order that the Jewish people should be in front [ lefanim ] and not behind.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: The knot of the tefillin must be above, so that Israel will be above and not below, and it must be facing inward, so that Israel will be facing inward and not backward.

hebrew_text: אמר רב שמואל בר בידרי אמר רב ואמרי לה אמר ר' אחא אריכא אמר רב הונא ואמרי לה אמר רב מנשיא אמר שמואל תפילין מאימתי מברך עליהן משעת הנחתן איני והא אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל כל המצות כולן מברך עליהן עובר לעשייתן אביי ורבא דאמרי תרוייהו משעת הנחה ועד שעת קשירה
human_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Bideri says Rav says, and some say Rabbi Aḥa Arikha, says Rav Huna says, and some say Rav Menashya says Shmuel says: phylacteries, from when does one recite a blessing over them? From the time when one dons them Is that so? But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say Shmuel says: all the mitzvot, one recites a blessing over them prior to their performance? Abaye and Rava both say: from the time of donning until the time of binding
llm_translation: Rav Shmuel bar Bideri said in the name of Rav, and some say in the name of Rabbi Ahah Erika, Rav Huna said, and some say Rabbi Yannai said, Shmuel said: From when does one recite a blessing over the tefillin? From the time of their placement. Is it not so? But Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: For all the mitzvot, one recites a blessing over them before performing them. Abaye and Rava both said: From the time of placement until the time of binding.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא סח בין תפילה לתפילה חוזר ומברך
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: spoke between phylacteries and phylacteries recite the blessing again
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: "Sach, between one prayer and another, one should repeat the blessing."

hebrew_text: סח אין לא סח לא והא שלח רב חייא בריה דרב הונא משמיה דר' יוחנן על תפילה של יד אומר ברוך אשר קדשנו במצותיו וצונו להניח תפילין על תפילין של ראש אומר ברוך אשר קדשנו במצותיו וצונו על מצות תפילין
human_translation: spoke, yes, did not speak, not But Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Huna, sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: On the phylacteries of the arm says Blessed Who has sanctified us through His mitzvot and commanded us to don phylacteries. On the phylacteries of the head says Blessed Who has sanctified us through His mitzvot and commanded us concerning the mitzva of phylacteries.
llm_translation: Tractate: Berakhot Text: "One does not recite a blessing over a blessing. But behold, Rav Chiya, son of Rav Huna, sent in the name of Rabbi Yochanan regarding the hand Tefillin, one says: 'Blessed is He who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us to lay Tefillin.' Regarding the head Tefillin, one says: 'Blessed is He who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning the commandment of Tefillin.'"

hebrew_text: אביי ורבא דאמרי תרוייהו לא סח מברך אחת סח מברך שתים
human_translation: Abaye and Rava both say, did not speak, recites one spoke, recites two
llm_translation: Abaye and Rava both said: One who did not speak the blessing before eating does not recite one blessing; one who did speak the blessing before eating recites two blessings.

hebrew_text: תנא סח בין תפילה לתפילה עבירה היא בידו וחוזר עליה מערכי המלחמה
human_translation: taught spoke between phylacteries and phylacteries he has a sin, and due to he returns from the ranks of war.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Between one prayer and another, it is a transgression in his hand, and he repeats it like the ranks of the war.

hebrew_text: תנא כשהוא מניח מניח של יד ואחר כך מניח של ראש וכשהוא חולץ חולץ של ראש ואחר כך חולץ של יד בשלמא כשהוא מניח מניח של יד ואח"כ מניח של ראש דכתיב (דברים ו, ח) וקשרתם לאות על ידך והדר והיו לטוטפת בין עיניך
human_translation: taught When one dons dons of the arm and afterward dons of the head. And when he removes removes of the head and afterward removes of the arm. Granted, when one dons dons of the arm and afterward dons of the head as it is written: “And you shall bind them for a sign upon your arm,” and then “And they shall be for frontlets between your eyes”
llm_translation: Mishna: When one puts on Tefillin, he first puts on the hand Tefillin, and afterwards puts on the head Tefillin. And when he removes them, he first removes the head Tefillin, and afterwards removes the hand Tefillin. It is well according to the opinion that when he puts on, he first puts on the hand Tefillin, and afterwards puts on the head Tefillin, as it is written (Deuteronomy 6:8), "And you shall bind them as a sign upon your hand, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes."

hebrew_text: אלא כשהוא חולץ חולץ של ראש ואח"כ חולץ של יד מנלן אמר רבה רב הונא אסברא לי אמר קרא והיו לטוטפת בין עיניך כל זמן שבין עיניך יהו שתים
human_translation: But from where do we when he removes removes of the head and afterward he removes of the arm? Rabba said Rav Huna explained to me The verse states: and they shall be for frontlets between your eyes,” As long as between your eyes, shall be two.
llm_translation: Rather, when he removes, he removes the headband first, and then he removes the handband. From where do we derive this? Rabah said, Rav Huna expounded to me: The verse states, "And they shall be as frontlets between your eyes" - as long as they are between your eyes, they should be two.

hebrew_text: ת"ר תפילין מאימתי מברך עליהן משעת הנחתן כיצד היה משכים לצאת לדרך ומתיירא שמא יאבדו מניחן וכשיגיע זמנן ממשמש בהן ומברך עליהן
human_translation: The Sages taught phylacteries, from when does one recite a blessing over them? From the time don them. How so? If one is rising early to leave to the road and is afraid lest become lost dons them And when time their arrives, he touches them and recites a blessing over them.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: From when do we recite a blessing over the tefillin? From the moment of their placement. In what manner? If one was preparing to set out on a journey and was afraid they might get lost, he should put them on. And when their time arrives, he touches them and recites a blessing over them.

hebrew_text: ועד מתי מניחן עד שתשקע החמה רבי יעקב אומר עד שתכלה רגל מן השוק וחכמים אומרים עד זמן שינה ומודים חכמים לר' יעקב שאם חלצן לצאת לבית הכסא או ליכנס לבית המרחץ ושקעה חמה שוב אינו חוזר ומניחן
human_translation: And until when does one wear them? Until the sun sets. Rabbi Ya’akov says: Until traffic in the marketplace ceases. And the Rabbis say: Until the time of sleep. And the Rabbis concede to Rabbi Ya’akov that if one removed them to go out to the bathroom or to enter the bathhouse and the sun set, one does not don them again.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Until when do we leave them? Until the sun sets. Rabbi Yaakov says until the foot is removed from the marketplace, and the sages say until the time of sleep. And the sages agree with Rabbi Yaakov that if one removed them to go to the bathroom or to enter the bathhouse, and the sun set again, one does not need to return them.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן הלכה כרבי יעקב רב חסדא ורבה בר רב הונא מצלו בהו באורתא איכא דאמרי אין הלכה כר' יעקב
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says: halakha in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov. Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna would pray in the evening, with Some say halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Ya’akov
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: The halacha is like Rabbi Yaakov. Rav Chisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna were sitting in the light. Some say: The halacha is not like Rabbi Yaakov.

hebrew_text: והא רב חסדא ורבה בר רב הונא מצלו בהו באורתא ההוא פליגא
human_translation: But Rav Ḥisda and Rabba bar Rav Huna would pray in the evening with That disagrees
llm_translation: And behold, Rav Ḥisda and Rabbah bar Rav Huna were sitting in that place in the evening.

hebrew_text: ומי אמר רבה בר רב הונא הכי והא אמר רבה בר רב הונא ספק חשיכה ספק לא חשיכה לא חולץ ולא מניח הא ודאי חשיכה חולץ התם בערב שבת איתמר
human_translation: And did Rabba bar Rav Huna say this, But doesn’t Rabba bar Rav Huna say: uncertain nightfall not nightfall, neither removes nor dons This definitely nightfall, removes there was stated with regard to Shabbat eve,
llm_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna said thus, but did not Rabba bar Rav Huna say: "In a case of doubt regarding darkness, whether it is dark or not, one neither removes nor places"? Indeed, in a case of doubt regarding darkness, one removes. There it was stated in the context of Friday evening.

hebrew_text: מאי קסבר אי קסבר לילה זמן תפילין שבת נמי זמן תפילין אי קסבר שבת לאו זמן תפילין לילה נמי לאו זמן תפילין דמהיכא דממעטא שבת מהתם ממעטי לילות
human_translation: What does hold? If he holds night a time phylacteries, Shabbat also a time phylacteries. If he holds Shabbat not a time phylacteries, night also not a time phylacteries. that from where Shabbat is excluded nights are excluded from there
llm_translation: What does he hold? If he holds that night is the time for Tefillin, then Shabbat is also a time for Tefillin. If he holds that Shabbat is not a time for Tefillin, then night is also not a time for Tefillin. Just as from there (Shabbat) he limits (the time for Tefillin), so too he limits nights.

hebrew_text: דתניא (שמות יג, י) ושמרת את החוקה הזאת למועדה מימים ימימה ימים ולא לילות מימים ולא כל ימים פרט לשבתות וימים טובים דברי רבי יוסי הגלילי ר"ע אומר לא נאמר חוקה זו אלא לפסח בלבד
human_translation: As it is taught “And you shall observe this ordinance in its season from year [ miyamim ] to year” days [ yamim ] but not nights. “From year [ miyamim ],” but not all days. excludes Shabbatot and Festivals, the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: This an ordinance, is stated only with regard to the Paschal
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita (Exodus 13:10): "And you shall observe this statute at its appointed time, from days to days." Not at nights, from days to days, and not every day, except for Sabbaths and festivals. These are the words of Rabbi Yossi the Galilean. Rabbi Akiva says: This statute was only stated for Passover.

hebrew_text: נפקא ליה מהיכא דנפקא ליה לר' עקיבא דתניא ר' עקיבא אומר יכול יניח אדם תפילין בשבתות ובימים טובים ת"ל (שמות יג, טז) והיה לאות על ידך ולטוטפת בין עיניך מי שצריכין אות יצאו שבתות וימים טובים שהן גופן אות
human_translation: derives from where Rabbi Akiva derives it from, as it is taught Rabbi Akiva says: might a person should don phylacteries on Shabbatot and Festivals. the verse states: “And it shall be for a sign for you on your arm, and for a remembrance between your eyes, require a sign exclude Shabbatot and Festivals, as they themselves are signs
llm_translation: He went out from where he went out to Rabbi Akiva, as it was taught: Rabbi Akiva says, "One might have thought that a person may place tefillin on Sabbaths and festivals, as it is stated (Exodus 13:16), 'And it shall be for a sign upon your hand and for frontlets between your eyes.' Those who require a sign, Sabbaths and festivals, which are themselves a sign, have gone out."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אלעזר כל המניח תפילין אחר שקיעת החמה עובר בעשה ור' יוחנן אמר עובר בלאו לימא בר' אבין אמר ר' אילעא קא מיפלגי דאמר ר' אבין אמר ר' אילעא כל מקום שנאמר השמר פן ואל אינו אלא לא תעשה
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: Anyone who dons phylacteries after sunset violates a positive mitzva. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He violates a prohibition. Let us say disagree with regard to Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Ile’a says. As Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Ile’a says: Any place where it is stated Observe, Lest, or: Do not, nothing other than a prohibition,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Elazar: Anyone who puts on tefillin after sunset transgresses a positive commandment. And Rabbi Yochanan said: He transgresses a negative commandment. Let us say in the name of Rav Avin: Rabbi Ilai disputes this, for Rabbi Avin said in the name of Rabbi Ilai: Any place where it says "be careful lest" and "do not" is only a prohibition.

hebrew_text: דמר אית ליה דר' אבין ומר לית ליה דר' אבין
human_translation: As Sage, is of of Rabbi Avin, And Sage, is of not of Rabbi Avin,
llm_translation: There is one who says it is Rabbi Avin, and there is one who says it is not Rabbi Avin.

hebrew_text: לא דכולי עלמא אית להו דרבי אבין אמר ר' אילעא והכא בהא קא מיפלגי מר סבר השמר דלאו לאו והשמר דעשה עשה ומר סבר השמר דעשה נמי לאו
human_translation: No, everyone is of that Rabbi Avin Rabbi Ile’a says, and here they disagree with regard to this: Sage, holds “observe” with regard to a prohibition a prohibition, “observe” with regard to a positive a positive And Sage, holds “observe” with regard to a positive also a prohibition.
llm_translation: Not everyone agrees with Rabbi Avin. Rabbi Ila'a said, and here they argue about this: one master holds that "guarding" of a negative commandment is not like a negative commandment, and "guarding" of a positive commandment is like a positive commandment, and the other master holds that "guarding" of a positive commandment is also not like a negative commandment.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבי אלעזר ואם לשמרן מותר ואמר רבינא הוה יתיבנא קמיה דרב אשי וחשך והניח תפילין ואמרי ליה לשמרן קא בעי להו מר ואמר לי אין וחזיתיה לדעתיה דלאו לשמרן הוא בעי קסבר הלכה ואין מורין כן
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar says: And if to safeguard them permitted.And Ravina said: I was sitting before Rav Ashi and grew dark, and he donned phylacteries. And I said to him: Does the Master need to safeguard them? And he said to me: Yes. But I saw that his intention not needed to safeguard them; holds: halakha , but ruling is not issued to that effect.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said, "And if for their sake, it is permitted." And Ravina said, "He was sitting before Rav Ashi and it was dark, and he put on tefillin. And they said to him, 'For their sake, does the Master require them?' And he said to me, 'No.' And I saw according to his opinion that he does not require them for their sake. He holds that it is a halacha, and we do not teach this way."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר רב הונא חייב אדם למשמש בתפילין בכל שעה קל וחומר מציץ ומה ציץ שאין בו אלא אזכרה אחת אמרה תורה והיה על מצחו תמיד שלא תסיח דעתו ממנו תפילין שיש בהן אזכרות הרבה על אחת כמה וכמה
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Huna says: A person is obligated to touch phylacteries the entire time an a fortiori from frontplate And if frontplate, which has only one mention the Torah states: “And it should be always upon his forehead” that he should not be distracted from it, phylacteries, which have numerous mentions all the more so
llm_translation: Rabbah son of Rav Huna said: A person is obligated to engage with Tefillin at every hour. A fortiori from the forehead-plate. And just as the forehead-plate, which contains only one mention, the Torah said, "And it shall be on his forehead always," to prevent his mind from straying from it, Tefillin, which contain many mentions, how much more so.

hebrew_text: ת"ר ידך זו שמאל אתה אומר שמאל או אינו אלא ימין תלמוד לומר (ישעיהו מח, יג) אף ידי יסדה ארץ וימיני טפחה שמים ואומר (שופטים ה, כו) ידה ליתד תשלחנה וימינה להלמות עמלים ואומר (תהלים עד, יא) למה תשיב ידך וימינך מקרב חיקך כלה
human_translation: The Sages taught your arm [ yadkha ]” this left Do you say left or is it only right The verse states: “Even My hand [ yadi ] has laid the foundation of the earth, and My right hand [ vimini ] has spread out the heavens” And states: “Her hand [ yadah ] she put to the tent pin, and her right hand [ viminah ] to the workmen’s hammer” and states: “Why do You withdraw Your hand [ yadkha ], even Your right hand [ viminekha ]? Draw it out of Your bosom and consume them”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Your hand" - this refers to the left hand. You might say it refers to the left, or perhaps it is actually the right. The Talmud teaches to say (Isaiah 48:13): "Indeed My hand founded the earth, and My right hand spread out the heavens." And it says (Judges 5:26): "Her hand she put to the tent peg, and her right hand to the workmen's hammer." And it says (Psalms 74:11): "Why do You withdraw Your hand, even Your right hand? From within Your bosom, consume them."

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי החורם אומר מצינו ימין שנקרא יד שנאמר (בראשית מח, יז) וירא יוסף כי ישית אביו יד ימינו ואידך יד ימינו איקרי יד סתמא לא איקרי
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaḤorem says: we have found that right called yad , as it is stated: “And when Joseph saw that his father was laying his right hand [ yad yemino ]” And the other is called “his right hand [ yad yemino ],” is not called a yad without specification.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei HaChorem says: We find that the right hand is called a hand, as it is stated (Genesis 48:17), "And Joseph saw that his father was placing his right hand." And the other hand, his right hand is called a hand, but not called a hand in general.

hebrew_text: ר' נתן אומר אינו צריך הרי הוא אומר (דברים ו, ח) וקשרתם וכתבתם מה כתיבה בימין אף קשירה בימין וכיון דקשירה בימין הנחה בשמאל היא ור' יוסי החורם הנחה דבשמאל מנא ליה נפקא ליה מהיכא דנפקא ליה לר' נתן
human_translation: Rabbi Natan says: not necessary, it says: “And you shall bind them “And you shall write them just as writing is with right so too, binding with right And since binding is with right donning is on left And from where does Rabbi Yosei HaḤorem, derive that donning on left He derives it from where Rabbi Natan derives it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Nathan says: It is not necessary. Behold, it says (Deuteronomy 6:8), "And you shall bind them and inscribe them." Just as the inscription is on the right, so too the binding is on the right. And since the binding is on the right, the placing is on the left. And Rabbi Yosei the son of Chorin, from where does he derive that the placing is on the left? He derives it from where he derives it for Rabbi Nathan.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר מידכה כתיב בה"י כהה א"ל ר' אבא לרב אשי ואימא ידך שבכח א"ל מי כתיב בחי"ת
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: from your arm [ yadkha ]” is written with heh weak [ keha ] Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi: But say Your arm that is of strength [ shebeko’aḥ ], said to Is written with a ḥet ?
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said, "From your hand it is written in the Torah, 'dim.'" Rabbi Abba said to Rav Ashi, "And say, 'your hand with strength.'" He said to him, "Who is it written in the Prophets?"

hebrew_text: כתנאי ידכה בה"י זו שמאל אחרים אומרים ידך לרבות את הגידם תניא אידך אין לו זרוע פטור מן התפילין אחרים אומר ידכה לרבות את הגידם
human_translation: subject to tanna’im , Yadkha with a heh , this left Others say: “Your arm,” to include one without arm, is taught another does not have arm, exempt from the phylacteries. Others say: Yadkha to include one without arm
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "The Tannaim: 'Yadkha' in the name of the Lord, this is the left hand. Others say: 'Yadekha' to include the sinews. It was taught in another Baraita: If one does not have an arm, he is exempt from Tefillin. Others say: 'Yadkha' to include the sinews."

hebrew_text: ת"ר אטר מניח תפילין בימינו שהוא שמאלו והתניא מניח בשמאלו שהוא שמאלו של כל אדם אמר אביי כי תניא ההיא בשולט בשתי ידיו
human_translation: The Sages taught A left-handed person dons phylacteries on his right which is his left But isn’t it taught dons on his left which is the left of every person? Abaye said: When that is taught, to one who has control with both his hands,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One places tefillin on his right hand, which is his left. And it was taught: One places it on his left, which is his left. Abaye said: When it was taught, it was referring to one who is ambidextrous.

hebrew_text: תנא דבי מנשה על ידך זו קיבורת בין עיניך זו קדקד היכא אמרי דבי רבי ינאי מקום שמוחו של תינוק רופס
human_translation: The school of Menashe taught “On your arm”; this bicep. “Between your eyes”; this crown Where The school of Rabbi Yannai say: place where the baby’s brain is soft
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Menashe: "On your hand" - this refers to the grave. "Between your eyes" - this refers to the skull. Where is the place that the soft spot of an infant is pressed?

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה פלימו מרבי מי שיש לו שני ראשים באיזה מהן מניח תפילין א"ל או קום גלי או קבל עלך שמתא אדהכי אתא ההוא גברא א"ל איתיליד לי ינוקא דאית ליה תרי רישי כמה בעינן למיתב לכהן אתא ההוא סבא תנא ליה חייב ליתן לו י' סלעים
human_translation: Peleimu raised a dilemma before Rabbi one who has two heads, on which of them does he don phylacteries? said to him: Either get up exile or accept upon yourself excommunication In the meantime, a certain man arrived said to child has been born to me who has two heads. How much must I give to the priest A certain elder came taught him: You are obligated to give him ten sela ,
llm_translation: He asked Rabbi Pli'mo: "One who has two heads, in which of them should he place tefillin?" He said to him: "Either get up and reveal yourself, or accept upon yourself excommunication." That certain man came and said to him: "A child was born to me who has two heads, how much do we need to give to the priest?" That elder came and taught him: "He is obligated to give him ten shekels."

hebrew_text: איני והתני רמי בר חמא מתוך שנאמר (במדבר יח, טו) פדה תפדה את בכור האדם שומע אני אפילו נטרף בתוך ל' ת"ל
human_translation: Is that so? But Rami bar Ḥama teaches: Since it is stated “The firstborn of man you shall redeem” I derive even he was ravaged, within thirty the verse states:
llm_translation: I am not, and it was taught: Rami bar Hama said, because it is stated (Numbers 18:15), "You shall surely redeem the firstborn of man," do I hear that even if he was torn within thirty days, it teaches us.

llm_translation: "In Numbers 18:15, however, it is different here, as it is written: 'Only the firstborn of man you shall redeem.' The Merciful One has suspended it on the skull."

hebrew_text: אמר מר ידך זו קיבורת מנלן דת"ר (שמות יג, ט) על ידך זו גובה שביד אתה אומר זו גובה שביד או אינו אלא על ידך ממש אמרה תורה הנח תפילין ביד והנח תפילין בראש מה להלן בגובה שבראש אף כאן בגובה שביד
human_translation: The Master says: “On your arm”; this bicep. From where do we As the Sages taught: “On your arm [ yadkha ]”; this upper of the arm. Do you say this upper of the arm, or only literally on your hand, The Torah says: Don phylacteries on the yad and don phylacteries on the head; just as there, on upper of the head, so too here, on upper of the arm.
llm_translation: Master said: "Your hand, this is a grave." From where do we derive this? As it was taught in a Baraita (Exodus 13:9), "By your hand," this refers to the height of the hand. When you say "this is the height of the hand," is it truly the height of the hand, or rather, is it specifically by your hand itself? The Torah said, "Place the Tefillin on your hand and place the Tefillin on your head." Just as there, it is referring to the height of the head, so too here, it is referring to the height of the hand.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר אומר אינו צריך הרי הוא אומר (שמות יג, ט) והיה לך לאות לך לאות ולא לאחרים לאות ר' יצחק אומר אינו צריך הרי הוא אומר (דברים יא, יח) ושמתם את דברי אלה על לבבכם וקשרתם שתהא שימה כנגד הלב
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: not necessary, as states: “And it shall be for a sign for you a sign for you, but not a sign for others, Rabbi Yitzḥak says: not necessary, as states: “Therefore you shall place these words in your heart and you shall bind them” that placing shall be opposite the heart,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: It is not necessary. For behold, it says (Exodus 13:9), "And it shall be a sign for you upon your hand, and for a memorial between your eyes." Rabbi Yitzchak says: It is not necessary. For behold, it says (Deuteronomy 11:18), "Therefore shall you lay up these my words in your heart and in your soul, and bind them for a sign upon your hand."

hebrew_text: ר' חייא ורב אחא בריה דרב אויא מכוין ומנח ליה להדי ליביה רב אשי הוה יתיב קמיה דאמימר הוה ציריא בידיה וקא מתחזיין תפילין אמר ליה לא סבר לה מר לך לאות ולא לאחרים לאות אמר ליה במקום לך לאות איתמר

llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya and Rav Acha, son of Rav Avya, were intent and placing on his heart. Rav Ashi was sitting in front of Amemar, holding a needle in his hand, and they were seen wearing tefillin. He said to him, "Does the Master not hold that one should go for a sign for yourself and not for others?" He said to him, "In a place where there is a sign for yourself, it was stated."

hebrew_text: גובה שבראש מנלן דת"ר בין עיניך זו גובה שבראש אתה אומר זו גובה שבראש או אינו אלא בין עיניך ממש נאמר כאן בין עיניך ונאמר להלן (דברים יד, א) לא תשימו קרחה בין עיניכם למת מה להלן בגובה שבראש מקום שעושה קרחה אף כאן בגובה של ראש מקום שעושה קרחה
human_translation: upper of the head, From where do we As the Sages taught: “Between your eyes” this upper of the head. Do you say this upper of the head, or is it only literally between your eyes? It is stated here: “Between your eyes,” and it is stated there: nor make any baldness between your eyes for the dead” Just as there, on upper of the head, a place where render bald so too, on upper of the head, a place where render bald.
llm_translation: Height in the head from where do we derive? As it was taught by the Rabbis: "Between your eyes" - this is the height in the head. You may say, this is the height in the head, or is it rather literally "between your eyes"? It is stated here "between your eyes," and it is stated elsewhere (Deuteronomy 14:1) "You shall not make a bald spot between your eyes" - just as there, it refers to the height in the head, the place where one makes a bald spot, so too here, in the height of the head, the place where one makes a bald spot.

human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: not necessary, the Torah says: Don phylacteries on the arm don phylacteries on the head. Just as there, to a place which is fit to become ritually impure with one mark, so too here, to a place which is fit to become ritually impure with one mark,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: It is not necessary for the Torah to have said, "Place the Tefillin on the hand, place the Tefillin on the head." Just as there, in a place where it is fitting to become impure through one affliction, so too here, in a place where it is fitting to become impure through one affliction.

human_translation: Rava bar Ahina said: between is a cloak with five

hebrew_text: אמר רב שישא בריה דרב אידי האי מאן דבצריה לגלימיה לא עביד ולא כלום שוייה טלית בעלת חמש

llm_translation: Rav Shisha, son of Rav Idi, said: "One who guards his cloak does nothing, it is of no use; he should place a tallit worth five upon it."

human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya says: One who ties his garment has not done anything What is the reason? It is considered as though untied, And we learned likewise All bound jugs, are ritually pure, except for jugs of Arabs,
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshia said: "One who designs his cloak does nothing at all. What is the reason? Because it is considered like one who weaves it. And we also learned: All bundles of bundles are pure, except for bundles of Arabs."

hebrew_text: אמר רב דימי מנהרדעא האי מאן דחייטיה לגלימיה לא עבד ולא כלום אם איתא דלא מיבעי ליה ליפסוק ולישדייה:
human_translation: Rav Dimi of Neharde’a says: One who sews his garment, has not done anything if it is so that he does not need let him cut and throw it
llm_translation: Rav Dimi from Nehardea said: "One who sews his cloak does not do anything. If it is necessary for him, let him tear it and mend it."

llm_translation: Ravina was walking behind Mar bar Rav Ashi on Shabbat eve. The strap of his sandal snapped, but he did not say anything to him. When they arrived at his house, he said to him, "From there the strap snapped."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר רב אדא אמר רב אדא אמר רב אם נפסק החוט מעיקרו פסולה יתיב רב נחמן וקא אמר להא שמעתא איתיביה רבא לרב נחמן במה דברים אמורים בתחילתו אבל סופו שיריו וגרדומיו כל שהוא
human_translation: Rabba bar Rav Adda says Rav Adda says Rav says: If a string was severed at its base, unfit. Rav Naḥman sat and stated this halakha . Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman In what is this statement said, initially But end, its remainder and its severed any

hebrew_text: יתיב רבה וקאמר משמיה דרב חוט של כרך עולה מן המנין אמר ליה רב יוסף שמואל אמרה ולא רב איתמר נמי אמר רבה בר בר חנה סח לי רבי יאשיה דמן אושא חוט של כרך עולה לה מן המנין

llm_translation: Rabah was sitting and saying in the name of Rav: "The thread of a beam is included in the count." Rav Yosef said to him: "Shmuel also said so, not only Rav." Itmar also said: Rabah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yashiyah from Usha: "The thread of a beam is included in the count."

hebrew_text: יתיב רבא וקא אמר משמיה דשמואל תכלת שכרך רובה כשרה אמר ליה רב יוסף רב אמרה ולא שמואל איתמר נמי אמר רב הונא בר יהודה אמר רב ששת אמר רב ירמיה בר אבא אמר רב תכלת שכרך רובה כשרה
human_translation: Rava sat and said in the name of Shmuel: wound the majority of sky-blue fit. Rav Yosef said to Rav said it, and not Shmuel. was also stated: Rav Huna bar Yehuda says Rav Sheshet says Rav Yirmeya bar Abba says Rav says: wound the majority of sky-blue fit.
llm_translation: Rava was sitting and saying in the name of Shmuel: "The majority of the blue dye is valid." Rav Yosef said to him: "Rav said it, not Shmuel." It was also stated: Rav Huna son of Yehuda said that Rav Sheshet said that Rav Yirmiyah son of Abba said that the majority of the blue dye is valid."

hebrew_text: רב חייא בריה דרב נתן מתני הכי אמר רב הונא אמר רב ששת אמר רב ירמיה בר אבא אמר רב תכלת שכרך רובה כשרה ואפילו לא כרך בה אלא חוליא אחת כשרה ונויי תכלת שליש גדיל ושני שלישי ענף
human_translation: Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Natan, teaches like this: Rav Huna says Rav Sheshet says Rav Yirmeya bar Abba says Rav says: wound the majority of sky-blue fit. And even he wound only one set of fit. But finest sky-blue one-third windings and two-thirds loose
llm_translation: Rav Chiya son of Rav Natan teaches thus: Rav Huna said in the name of Rav Sheshet who said in the name of Rav Yirmiya bar Abba who said in the name of Rav: If most of your garment is dyed with tekhelet, it is valid, even if it is not fully dyed with it, but only one thread is dyed with tekhelet, and the beauty of tekhelet is one-third of a large garment and two-thirds of a small garment.

hebrew_text: וכמה שיעור חוליא תניא רבי אומר כדי שיכרוך וישנה וישלש תאנא הפוחת לא יפחות משבע והמוסיף לא יוסיף על שלש עשרה
human_translation: And what measure a set is taught Rabbi says: such that one winds and a second and third taught: One who minimizes may not fewer than seven and one who adds may not more than thirteen
llm_translation: And how much is the measure of a ḥoliya? It was taught in a baraita: Rabbi says, enough for one to wrap, sleep, and relieve oneself. A fig tree that diminishes should not diminish less than seven branches, and one who adds should not add more than thirteen.

hebrew_text: הפוחת לא יפחות משבע כנגד שבעה רקיעים והמוסיף לא יוסיף על שלש עשרה כנגד שבעה רקיעין וששה אוירין שביניהם
human_translation: One who minimizes may not fewer than seven corresponding to seven firmaments. And one who adds may not more than thirteen corresponding to seven firmaments and six air between them.
llm_translation: The one who diminishes shall not diminish less than seven, corresponding to seven firmaments, and the one who adds shall not add more than thirteen, corresponding to seven firmaments and six spaces between them.

hebrew_text: תנא כשהוא מתחיל מתחיל בלבן הכנף מין כנף וכשהוא מסיים מסיים בלבן מעלין בקודש ולא מורידין
human_translation: taught: When one begins begins with a white the corner” type corner And when he concludes he concludes with a white One elevates in sanctity and does not downgrade.
llm_translation: Mishna: When one begins, he begins with the white of the wing, from the wing. And when he finishes, he finishes with the white. We ascend in holiness and do not descend.

hebrew_text: רב ורבה בר בר חנה הוו יתבי הוה קא חליף ואזיל ההוא גברא דמיכסי גלימא דכולה תכלתא ורמי ליה תכלתא
human_translation: Rav and Rabba bar bar Ḥana were sitting A certain man was passing by wearing a cloak that entirely of sky-blue on which he had affixed sky-blue
llm_translation: Rav and Rabbah bar bar Ḥana were sitting. A certain man passed by wearing a cloak entirely dyed blue, and he showed him the blue.

hebrew_text: וגדילא מיגדיל אמר רב יאי גלימא ולא יאי תכלתא רבה בר בר חנה אמר יאי גלימא ויאי תכלתא
human_translation: and entirely windings, Rav said: The cloak is beautiful, but the sky-blue not beautiful. Rabba bar bar Ḥana said: The cloak is beautiful, and the sky-blue beautiful.
llm_translation: "And a cloak, does it enlarge?" Rav Yai said: "With a cloak, not with blue wool." Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said: "With a cloak and with blue wool."

hebrew_text: במאי קא מיפלגי רבה בר בר חנה סבר כתיב (דברים כב, יב) גדיל וכתיב (במדבר טו, לח) פתיל או גדיל או פתיל
human_translation: With regard to what do they disagree? Rabba bar bar Ḥana holds it is written twisted cords” and it is written: thread” either twisted cords, or strings.
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Rabbah bar bar Ḥana holds: It is written (Deuteronomy 22:12), "twisted cords," and it is written (Numbers 15:38), "a cord of blue threads," or "twisted cords" or "a cord of blue threads."

hebrew_text: ורב סבר לעולם פתיל בעינן וההיא גדילים למניינא הוא דאתא גדיל שנים גדילים ארבעה עשה גדיל ופותליהו מתוכו
