human_translation: And Rav holds actually, we require strings and that “twisted cords” it comes for number twisted cord, two “twisted cords,” four Form twisted cords and let hang loose from them.
llm_translation: And Rav holds: Always we require a thread, and that case of "cords" is for the count, for it came, a cord of two strands, cords of four strands, he made a cord and twisted them from within.

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל משמיה דלוי חוטי צמר פוטרין בשל פשתן
human_translation: Shmuel says in the name of Levi: Wool strings exempt of linen,
llm_translation: Said Shmuel in the name of Levi: Threads of wool exempt in the case of linen.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו של פשתן מהו שיפטרו בשל צמר צמר בשל פשתים הוא דפטר דכיון דתכלת פטרה לבן נמי פטר אבל פשתים בצמר לא
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before What is of linen exempt of wool? it is wool that exempt of linen, as since the sky-blue exempts white also exempt But linen to a wool not
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: What is the ruling regarding flax garments, may they be exempted with wool? Wool with flax garments is what exempts, for since blue exempts white, likewise flax exempts wool, but wool with flax does not.

hebrew_text: או דלמא כיון דכתיב (דברים כב, יא) לא תלבש שעטנז צמר ופשתים יחדו גדילים תעשה לך לא שנא צמר בפשתים ולא שנא פשתים בצמר
human_translation: Or perhaps, since it is written: “You shall not wear diverse kinds, wool and linen together. You shall prepare yourself twisted cords is no difference wool to linen, and is no difference linen to wool.
llm_translation: Or perhaps since it is written (Deuteronomy 22:11), "You shall not wear a garment of wool and linen together," this means you shall make fringes of wool and linen for yourself, indicating that wool is not different from linen, and linen is not different from wool.

hebrew_text: ת"ש דאמר רחבה אמר רב יהודה חוטי צמר פוטרין בשל פשתן ושל פשתן פוטרין בשל צמר חוטי צמר ופשתים פוטרין בכל מקום ואפילו בשיראין
human_translation: Come hear as Raḥava says Rav Yehuda says: Wool strings exempt of linen, of linen exempt of wool, strings of wool and linen exempt in any case, and even from silks [ beshira’in ].
llm_translation: Come and hear: Rabbi Yehudah said in the name of Rabba, "Threads of wool exempt linen garments, and linen garments exempt wool garments. Threads of wool and linen exempt each other everywhere, even in a belt."

hebrew_text: ופליגא דרב נחמן דאמר רב נחמן השיראין פטורין מן הציצית איתיביה רבא לרב נחמן השיראין והכלך והסריקין כולן חייבין בציצית מדרבנן
human_translation: And disagrees of Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman says: Shira’in are exempt from ritual fringes. Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman shira’in , kalakh , and serikin all require ritual fringes. by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: And it is in dispute of Rav Nachman, for Rav Nachman said: The blind are exempt from tzitzit. Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: The blind, the lame, and the sick - all of them are obligated in tzitzit from the Rabbinic law.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אימא סיפא וכולן צמר ופשתים פוטרין בהן אי אמרת בשלמא דאורייתא היינו דמישתרו בהו כלאים אלא אי אמרת דרבנן היכי מישתרי בהו כלאים אימא או צמר או פשתים
human_translation: If that is so, say the latter clause And all of these wool and linen exempt them. Granted, if you say by Torah law, that is diverse kinds are permitted for them. But if you say by rabbinic law, how could diverse kinds be permitted for them? Say Either wool or linen
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: "And all of them, wool and linen, exempt with them." If you say this is according to the Torah, that is why they are permitted together with them, but if you say it is according to the Rabbis, how can they permit them together with them? Say either wool or linen.

hebrew_text: הכי נמי מסתברא דקתני סיפא הן במינן פוטרין שלא במינן אין פוטרין אי אמרת בשלמא דרבנן היינו דמיפטרו במינן אלא אי אמרת דאורייתא צמר ופשתים הוא דפטר
human_translation: So too, it is reasonable as teaches the latter clause: these exempt of their type do not exempt that is not of their type. Granted, if you say by rabbinic law, that is they are exempted of their type. But if you say by Torah law, it wool or linen that exempt
llm_translation: So too it is logical, for it teaches in the latter clause: "Yes, of their kind they are exempt; not of a different kind are they exempt." If you say, according to the Rabbis, that is why they are exempt of their kind. But if you say, according to the Torah, it is wool and linen that exempts.

hebrew_text: אי משום הא לא איריא כדרבא דרבא רמי כתיב הכנף מין כנף וכתיב צמר ופשתים
human_translation: If due to that there is no argument, in accordance with of Rava. As Rava raises a contradiction: It is written “the corner” type corner. And it is written: “Wool and linen”
llm_translation: If because of this it is not fitting, like Rava, Rava raises a contradiction: It is written "the wing of a wing" and it is written "wool and linen."

hebrew_text: הא כיצד צמר ופשתים פוטרין בין במינן בין שלא במינן שאר מינין במינן פוטרין שלא במינן אין פוטרין
human_translation: How so? wool or linen exempt whether of their type whether not of their type other types exempt of their type they do not exempt that is not their type,
llm_translation: This is how it is: Wool and linen exempt, whether of their kind or not of their kind, other species of their kind exempt, not of their kind not exempt.

hebrew_text: ורב נחמן כדתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman, in accordance with a tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: And Rav Nahman in accordance with the teaching of the school of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: דתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל הואיל ונאמרו בגדים בתורה סתם ופרט לך הכתוב באחד מהן צמר ופשתים אף כל צמר ופשתים
human_translation: As of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: Since garments is stated in the Torah without specification and the verse specified in one of wool or linen, so too, all wool or linen.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: Since garments were mentioned in the Torah in general terms, and the Scripture specified for you wool and linen, this teaches that just as wool and linen are included, so too all wool and linen.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי והאי תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל מפקא מאידך תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל דתנא דבי ר' ישמעאל בגד אין לי אלא בגד צמר מנין לרבות צמר גמלים וצמר ארנבים ונוצה של עזים והכלך והסריקין והשיראין מנין ת"ל או בגד:
human_translation: Abaye said: This a tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael diverges from another a tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, As of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: garment” I have only a garment of wool From where camels’ hair, rabbits’ wool, goats’ hair, or kalakh , serikin , and shirayin , included The verse states: “Or garment.”
llm_translation: Abbaye said, "And this Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael derives it from another Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, for the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: 'I only have the garment of wool. How do I know to include camel wool, rabbit wool, goat's fleece, linen, and haircloth?' How do we know? The verse states, 'or a garment.'"

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן סדין בציצית ב"ש פוטרין וב"ה מחייבין והלכה כדברי ב"ה
human_translation: The Sages taught ritual fringes cloak, Beit Shammai deem exempt And Beit Hillel deem obligated And halakha in accordance with the statement of Beit Hillel.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "One who wraps himself in a linen garment with tzitzit, Beit Shammai exempts him, and Beit Hillel obligates him, and the halacha follows the opinion of Beit Hillel."

hebrew_text: א"ר אליעזר ב"ר צדוק והלא כל המטיל תכלת בירושלים אינו אלא מן המתמיהין
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Rabbi Tzadok says: But is it not anyone who affixes sky-blue in Jerusalem is nothing other than one of those who causes to be astonished
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer son of Tzadok said: But isn't it so that anyone who casts techelet in Jerusalem is only from those who are perplexed.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי א"כ למה אסרוה לפי שאין בקיאין
human_translation: Rabbi says: If so, why did prohibit because are not well versed
llm_translation: Said Rabbi: "If so, why did they prohibit it? Because they are not experts."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא בר רב חנא לרבא ולרמו בי עשרה ונפקו לשוקא ומפרסמא למילתא כל שכן דמתמהו עילון
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥana said to Rava: let ten take and go out to the marketplace and publicize the matter, All the more so would be astonished at us
llm_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥana said to Rava and Rammu: "With regard to the house of ten cubits, they went out to the marketplace and publicized the matter. Certainly the upper part is perplexing."

hebrew_text: ולידרשא בפירקא גזירה משום קלא אילן
human_translation: Let teach during lecture decree due to indigo [ kala ilan ],
llm_translation: And to expound in the chapter a decree because of a voice of a tree.

hebrew_text: ולא יהא אלא לבן כיון דאפשר במינן לא
human_translation: let be merely white Since it is possible the same type not
llm_translation: And not should be except for a son since it is possible with us.

hebrew_text: כדריש לקיש דאמר ריש לקיש כל מקום שאתה מוצא עשה ולא תעשה אם אתה יכול לקיים את שניהם מוטב ואם לאו יבוא עשה וידחה את לא תעשה
human_translation: in accordance with of Reish Lakish. As Reish Lakish says: Any place where you find a positive mitzva and a prohibition if you are able to fulfill both of them, preferable; and if not the positive mitzva shall come and override the prohibition.
llm_translation: As Reish Lakish said, "Every place that you find 'do' and 'do not do,' if you can fulfill both, it is better. But if not, let 'do' come and push aside 'do not do.'"

hebrew_text: וליבדקוה אלא גזירה משום טעימה
human_translation: And let them test Rather, decree due to testing
llm_translation: And it should be examined, rather it is a decree because of tasting.

hebrew_text: וליכתבה אדיסקי אדיסקי ליקום וליסמוך אמר רבא השתא
human_translation: Let write letters Shall we go and rely on letters, Rava said: Now,
llm_translation: And to write it, Adisqi Adisqi, to establish and to support. Rava said: Now.

hebrew_text: חמץ בפסח ויוה"כ דכרת סמכינן אדיסקי הכא דעשה בעלמא לא כל שכן
human_translation: leavened bread on Passover and Yom Kippur, which karet , we rely on letters here, which merely a positive mitzva, not all the more so
llm_translation: Leaven on Passover and Yom Kippur, we establish the law of excision. Here in the case of Yom Kippur where it is merely a positive commandment, how much more so is it the case that one is liable for transgressing it.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא הא מילתא אמרי ואיתמר במערבא משום דרבי זירא כוותי שמא יקרע סדינו בתוך ג' ויתפרנו
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is a statement I said, and it was stated in the West, in the name of Rabbi Zeira in accordance with my lest cloak rip within three and he sew it
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This matter they said, and it was stated in the West in the name of Rabbi Zeira: like our teacher, lest one tear his garment in three and repair it.

hebrew_text: והתורה אמרה תעשה ולא מן העשוי
human_translation: And the Torah states: Prepare and not from what has already been prepared.
llm_translation: And the Torah said, "Do" and not from the done.

hebrew_text: שרא רבי זירא לסדיניה רב זירא אמר גזירה נמי משום כסות לילה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira untied his cloak. Rav Zeira said: decree also due to a nighttime garment.
llm_translation: Sira Rabbi Zeira l'Sidineiha, Rav Zeira amar: Gezeirah nami m'shum k'sut laila.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא הא מילתא אמרי ואיתמר במערבא משמיה דר' זירא כוותי היא של בגד וכנפיה של עור חייבת היא של עור וכנפיה של בגד פטורה מאי טעמא עיקר בגד בעינן
human_translation: And Rava said: This is a statement I said, and it was stated in the West, in the name of Rabbi Zeira in accordance with my from cloth and its corners from leather, required from leather and its corners from cloth, exempt What is the reason We require the main garment
llm_translation: And Rava said: This matter they said, and it was stated in the West in the name of Rabbi Zeira: The like of it is the garment's body and its wings are of leather, it is liable. If its body is of leather and its wings are of a garment, it is exempt. What is the reason? The main part must be of a garment.

hebrew_text: רב אחאי אזיל בתר כנף
human_translation: Rav Aḥai follow the corner
llm_translation: Rav Ahai went after the wing.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אמר רב סחורה אמר רב הונא הטיל לבעלת שלש והשלימה לארבע פסולה [משום] תעשה ולא מן העשוי
human_translation: Rava says Rav Seḥora says Rav Huna says: affixed to possessing three and completed fourth unfit. Prepare and not from what has already been prepared.
llm_translation: Rava said, Rav Sachorah said, Rav Huna said: If one added three and completed it to four, it is invalid due to "ta'aseh" and not from what is already done.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי חסידים הראשונים כיון שארגו בה ג' היו מטילין לה תכלת אימא כיון שפצעו בה ג' היו מטילין לה תכלת
human_translation: raises an objection the early pious once they weaved three they would affix sky-blue to Say Once they completed [ shepatzu ] three they would affix sky-blue to
llm_translation: The early pious ones raised an objection: Once they weave three threads in it, they shall immerse it in blue dye. Say: Once they spin three threads in it, they shall immerse it in blue dye.

hebrew_text: ומי אמרינן תעשה ולא מן העשוי (איני) והאמר ר' זירא הטיל למוטלת כשרה
human_translation: And do we say: Prepare and not from what has already been prepared? Is that so But doesn’t Rabbi Zeira say: affixed to affixed fit,
llm_translation: And who said "do" and not "from the one who is done" (I am not)? And Rabbi Zeira said: "He who throws to the one who is obligated is valid."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא השתא בבל תוסיף קאי מעשה לא הוי
human_translation: Rava said: now is for prohibition of adding is not an action?
llm_translation: Rava said: "Now in Babylonia, you will add to the deed, it shall not be."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב פפא ממאי דגברא לאוסופי קא מיכוין דלמא לבטולי קא מיכוין ובל תוסיף ליכא מעשה איכא
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this: From where that person intended to add Perhaps he intended to nullify and there is no prohibition of adding there is an action.
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects: From what does the man intend? Perhaps he intends for nullification, and there is no action.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' זירא אמר רב מתנא אמר שמואל תכלת אין בה משום כלאים ואפי' בטלית פטורה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says Rav Mattana says Shmuel says: sky-blue are not subject to diverse kinds, and even to a cloak exempt
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira, said Rav Mattana, said Shmuel: Techelet does not have the status of kilayim, and even in a garment it is exempt.

hebrew_text: מאי טלית פטורה אילימא דלית בה שיעורא והתניא טלית שהקטן מתכסה בו ראשו ורובו
human_translation: What A cloak exempt If we say that is not of the size But isn’t it taught a cloak that a minor cover his head and most of his with
llm_translation: What is a "Talit Patuah"? If you say it is one that does not have a measure, but it was taught: A Talit in which a child can cover his head and most of his body.

hebrew_text: והגדול יוצא בה דרך עראי חייבת בציצית אין הקטן מתכסה בו ראשו ורובו אע"פ שהגדול יוצא בה עראי פטורה וכן לענין כלאים
human_translation: and an adult goes out on occasion it, required ritual fringes. not a minor cover his head and most of his with even if an adult goes out on occasion it, exempt And so too with regard to diverse kinds,
llm_translation: The elder who goes out on it on Shabbat in an unusual manner is obligated in tzitzit; the minor who does not cover his head and most of his body with it, even though the elder goes out on it in an unusual manner, is exempt. And similarly regarding kilayim.

hebrew_text: והוינן בה מאי וכן לענין כלאים אילימא וכן לענין איסורא דכלאים והא אנן תנן אין עראי בכלאים
human_translation: And we discussed it: What And so too with regard to diverse kinds? If we say And so too with regard to the prohibition of diverse kinds, But didn’t we learn There is no with regard to diverse kinds occasionally
llm_translation: And we understand from it what? And similarly regarding Kilayim. Perhaps and similarly regarding the prohibition of Kilayim. But haven't we learned: "There is no 'Erva' in Kilayim."

hebrew_text: ואמר רב נחמן בר יצחק וכן לענין סדין בציצית
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says And so too with regard to cloak to ritual fringes.
llm_translation: And Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, "And similarly regarding the matter of a linen garment in tzitzit."

hebrew_text: אלא מאי פטורה הטיל למוטלת
human_translation: Rather, what exempt affixed to affixed
llm_translation: Rather what exempted it? He cast it to the one responsible.

hebrew_text: והא אמרה רבי זירא חדא זימנא חדא מכלל דחבירתה איתמר
human_translation: But didn’t Rabbi Zeira say this one time One was stated from the other by inference,
llm_translation: And behold, Rabbi Zeira said one time, one from all her friends was said.

hebrew_text: ת"ר טלית כפולה חייבת בציצית ורבי שמעון פוטר ושוין שאם כפלה ותפרה שחייבת
human_translation: The Sages taught cloak that is folded required ritual fringes And Rabbi Shimon deems exempt And agree that if he folded it and sewed it, required
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A folded garment is obligated in tzitzit, and Rabbi Shimon exempts it, and they are equal in that if one folded it and sewed it, it is obligated.

hebrew_text: תפרה פשיטא לא צריכא דנקטה בסיכי
human_translation: sewed it, obvious No, necessary where he fastened it with pins
llm_translation: The stitching is obvious, not necessary that it was sewn with stitches.

hebrew_text: רבה בר הונא איקלע לבי רבא בר רב נחמן חזייה דהוה מיכסי טלית כפולה ורמי ליה חוטי עילוי כפילא איפשיטא ואתא חוטא וקם להדי רישיה
human_translation: Rabba bar Huna arrived at the house of Rava bar Rav Naḥman, he saw that was wearing a cloak that was folded and affixed strings to it on the fold. unfolded, and the string came and settled near his head,
llm_translation: Rabbah bar Huna came to the house of Rava bar Rav Nahman, he saw that he was wearing a folded garment, and he threw him the upper threads folded, he untied them and came a sin and stood before him.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה לאו היינו כנף דכתב רחמנא באורייתא אתא שדייה איכסי גלימא אחריתי
human_translation: said to This is not corner that the Merciful One writes in the Torah. went threw it off, he covered himself a different cloak.
llm_translation: He said to him: Is this not the wing that the Merciful One wrote in the Torah? He came, removed the other garment.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מי סברת חובת גברא הוא חובת טלית הוא זיל רמי לה
human_translation: said to Do you hold an obligation the man? it is an obligation cloak go affix to it
llm_translation: He said to him, "Do you think it is the obligation of a man? It is the obligation of a prayer shawl. Go and throw it up."

hebrew_text: לימא מסייע ליה חסידים הראשונים כיון שארגו בה שלש היו מטילין בה תכלת שאני חסידים דמחמרי אנפשייהו
human_translation: Let us say supports the early pious once they weaved three of they would affix sky-blue to pious different, as they would act stringently with themselves.
llm_translation: Let us say, the early pious ones are supported, since when they wove it, they would insert in it blue. How are the early pious ones different? They are stringent with themselves.

hebrew_text: ופליגא דמלאכא דמלאכא אשכחי' לרב קטינא דמיכסי סדינא אמר ליה קטינא קטינא סדינא בקייטא וסרבלא בסיתוא ציצית של תכלת מה תהא עליה
human_translation: disagrees with an angel As an angel found Rav Ketina when he was wearing cloak, said to him: Ketina, Ketina, cloak in the summer and a coat [ sarbela ], in the winter, what will become of ritual fringes of sky-blue wool?
llm_translation: And there is a dispute of angels that the angel found for Rav Ketina d'Miksei Sdina. He said to him, "Ketina, Ketina, Sdina is in the basket, and the sash is in the bundle. What should be done with the blue tzitzit upon it?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ענשיתו אעשה אמר ליה בזמן דאיכא ריתחא ענשינן
human_translation: said to him: Do you punish for a positive mitzva? said to him: At a time when there is anger we punish
llm_translation: He said to him: "I will punish him." He said to him: "When there is anger, we punish."

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא חובת גברא הוא היינו דמחייב דלא קא רמי אלא אי אמרת חובת טלית הוא הא לא מיחייבא
human_translation: Granted, if you say is an obligation man, that is deemed liable as he did not affix But if you say is an obligation cloak he was not obligated
llm_translation: If you say, "Granted, it is the obligation of a man," that is why he is liable, for he is not raising an objection. But if you say, "It is the obligation of a garment," then it is not obligatory.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי חובת גברא הוא נהי דחייביה רחמנא כי מיכסי טלית דבת חיובא כי מיכסי טלית דלאו בת חיובא היא מי חייביה רחמנא
human_translation: Rather, what it is an obligation man? granted that the Merciful One rendered him obligated when he is wearing a cloak that subject to the obligation when he is wearing a cloak that is not subject to the obligation did the Merciful One deem him obligated?
llm_translation: Rather, what is the obligation of a person? Indeed, since the Merciful One obligated him when he covers himself with a garment of obligation, when he covers himself with a garment that is not of obligation, is he obligated by the Merciful One?

hebrew_text: אלא הכי קאמר ליה טצדקי למיפטר נפשך מציצית
human_translation: Rather, this is saying to ploys [ tatzdeki ] to exempt yourself from ritual fringes?
llm_translation: Rather, this is what he said to him: "Tzidki, free yourself from the tzitzit."

hebrew_text: אמר רב טובי בר קיסנא אמר שמואל כלי קופסא חייבין בציצית ומודה שמואל בזקן שעשאה לכבודו שפטורה מ"ט (דברים כב, יב) אשר תכסה בה אמר רחמנא האי לאו לאיכסויי עבידא
human_translation: Rav Tovi bar Kisna says Shmuel says: Garments a box are required ritual fringes, But Shmuel concedes in an old man, where was made in his honor, that exempt. What is the reason The Merciful One states “with which you cover yourself” This is not made for covering
llm_translation: Rav Tovi bar Kisna said in the name of Shmuel: A vessel of a box is obligated in tzitzit, and Shmuel concedes regarding a zaken garment made for its honor that it is exempt, for the Merciful One said: "With which you cover yourself" - this is not made for covering.

hebrew_text: בההיא שעתא ודאי רמינן ליה משום (משלי יז, ה) לועג לרש חרף עושהו
human_translation: At that time, we certainly affix to because “Whoever mocks the poor blasphemes his Maker”
llm_translation: In that hour, certainly we raise a contradiction to him in the name of (Proverbs 17:5) "He who mocks the poor insults his Maker."

hebrew_text: אמר רחבה אמר ר' יהודה טלית שנקרעה חוץ לשלש יתפור תוך שלש לא יתפור
human_translation: Raḥava says Rabbi Yehuda says: a cloak that became torn beyond three may sew within three may not sew
llm_translation: Said Rachbah, said Rabbi Yehuda: A garment that tore outside of three handbreadths should be sewn; within three handbreadths should not be sewn.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי טלית שנקרעה חוץ לשלש יתפור תוך שלש רבי מאיר אומר לא יתפור וחכ"א יתפור
human_translation: This is also taught a cloak that became torn beyond three may sew within three Rabbi Meir says: may not sew And the Rabbis say: may sew
llm_translation: It was taught: Also thus, a garment that tore outside of three handbreadths should be sewn within three handbreadths. Rabbi Meir says: It should not be sewn, and the sages say: It should be sewn.

hebrew_text: ושוין שלא יביא אפילו אמה על אמה ממקום אחר ובה תכלת ותולה בה ושוין שמביא תכלת ממקום אחר ותולה בה
human_translation: And agree that one may not bring even a square cubit from elsewhere, containing sky-blue and attach to And agree that one may bring sky-blue from elsewhere and attach to
llm_translation: And equal that not he shall bring even cubit upon cubit from place other and in it blue and hangs in it and equal that brings blue from place other and hangs in it

hebrew_text: ובלבד שלא תהא מופסקת שמעת מינה מתירין מבגד לבגד דילמא דאי בלאי
human_translation: provided that are not broken. conclude from untie from garment to garment? Perhaps if worn out
llm_translation: And as long as it is not interrupted, we permit transferring from one garment to another, lest it be without.

hebrew_text: ת"ר טלית שכולה תכלת כל מיני צבעונין פוטרין בה חוץ מקלא אילן
human_translation: The Sages taught a cloak that entirely sky-blue wool, every type of color exempt it, except for indigo,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A garment that is entirely made of tekhelet, all types of dyes exempt it except for the dye of the tree.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי טלית אין פוטר בה אלא מינה טלית שכולה תכלת מביא תכלת וד"א ותולה בה וקלא אילן לא יביא ואם הביא כשר
human_translation: raises an objection A cloak exempted only by its own type. a cloak that entirely sky-blue wool, brings sky-blue [ tekhelet ] and something else, and attaches to And he may not bring indigo But if he brought fit.
llm_translation: The question was raised: A garment that is not exempt with it, except its kind. A garment that is entirely blue, he brings blue. And some say: And he hangs it and reads. Woolen threads, he should not bring, and if he brought, it is valid.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק לא קשיא כאן בטלית בת ארבעה חוטין כאן בטלית בת שמונה חוטין
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: not difficult, here, to a cloak that has four strings, There, to a cloak that has eight strings,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It is not difficult. Here (in the case of) a tallit of four threads (it is obligated in tzitzit), here (in the case of) a tallit of eight threads (it is obligated in tzitzit).

hebrew_text: שמעת מינה מתירין מבגד לבגד דלמא דאי עבד
human_translation: you conclude from one may untie from garment to garment? Perhaps that if did
llm_translation: Heard from it, we permit from garment to garment, perhaps for if he did.

hebrew_text: איתמר רב אמר אין מתירין מבגד לבגד ושמואל אמר מתירין מבגד לבגד
human_translation: It was stated Rav says: One may not untie from garment to garment. And Shmuel says: One may untie from garment to garment.
llm_translation: It was stated: Rav said, "We do not permit transferring items from garment to garment," and Shmuel said, "We permit transferring items from garment to garment."

hebrew_text: רב אמר אין מדליקין מנר לנר ושמואל אמר מדליקין מנר לנר
human_translation: Rav says: One may not light from lamp to lamp. And Shmuel says: One may light from lamp to lamp.
llm_translation: Rav said: We do not light from one lamp to another, and Shmuel said: We do light from one lamp to another.

hebrew_text: רב אמר אין הלכה כרבי שמעון בגרירה ושמואל אמר הלכה כר' שמעון בגרירה
human_translation: Rav says: halakha not in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to dragging And Shmuel says halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to dragging
llm_translation: Rav said: The halakha does not follow Rabbi Shimon regarding dragging, and Shmuel said: The halakha follows Rabbi Shimon regarding dragging.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי כל מילי דמר עביד כרב לבר מהני תלת דעביד כשמואל מתירין מבגד לבגד ומדליקין מנר לנר והלכה כרבי שמעון בגרירה
human_translation: Abaye said: all matters of the Master, he conducted himself in accordance with Rav, except these three where he conducted himself in accordance with Shmuel. one may untie from garment to garment, and one may light from lamp to lamp, and halakha in accordance with Rabbi Shimon with regard to dragging
llm_translation: Abbaye said: All matters that Mar does, Rav does like him, except for three things that Shmuel does differently: he permits transferring from one garment to another, he permits lighting from one lamp to another, and the halakha follows Rabbi Shimon in the case of dragging.

hebrew_text: דתניא רבי שמעון אומר גורר אדם מטה כסא וספסל ובלבד שלא יתכוין לעשות חריץ
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: A person may drag a bed, chair, or bench provided that he does not intend to make a furrow
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, a person may drag a bed, chair, or stool, as long as he does not intend to make a furrow.

hebrew_text: רב יהודה מסר ליה לקצרא רב חנינא עביד לה סיסא רבינא חייט להו מיחט
human_translation: Rav Yehuda give to a laundryman Rav Ḥanina form a bundle Ravina them sew
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah handed it over to Ketzarah, Rav Chanina made a sisa for her, Ravina cut it for them.

hebrew_text: ת"ר כמה חוטין הוא נותן ב"ש אומרים ד' וב"ה אומרים ג'
human_translation: The Sages taught How many strings does one place Beit Shammai say: Four and Beit Hillel say: Three
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: How many threads does one give? Beit Shammai say four, and Beit Hillel say three.

hebrew_text: וכמה תהא משולשת ב"ש אומרים ד' וב"ה אומרים ג' וג' שבית הלל אומרים אחת מארבע בטפח של כל אדם אמר רב פפא טפח דאורייתא ד' בגודל שית בקטנה חמש בתילתא
human_translation: And how much should be hanging [ meshulleshet ] Beit Shammai say: Four and Beit Hillel say: Three And three that Beit Hillel say one-fourth of a handbreadth [ tefaḥ ] of any person. Rav Pappa said: handbreadth of the Torah four by thumb; six by smallest five by third,
llm_translation: "And how much should the triangle be? Beit Shammai says four, and Beit Hillel says three, and the three of Beit Hillel say one of four fingerbreadths for every person. Rav Pappa said: A fingerbreadth is biblical, four in the large and six in the small."

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא ד' בתוך ד' ומשולשת ד' ורב יהודה אמר ג' בתוך ג' משולשת ג'
human_translation: Rav Huna says four within four and hang four And Rav Yehuda says: three within three hang three
llm_translation: Rav Huna said: Four within four, and a triangle within four. And Rav Yehudah said: Three within three, a triangle within three.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא הלכתא ד' בתוך שלש משולשת ארבע
human_translation: Rav Pappa says the halakha four within three hang four
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: The halakha is within three of a quadrilateral.

hebrew_text: למימרא דאית להו שיעורא ורמינהו ציצית אין ציצית אלא יוצא ואין ציצית אלא משהו וכבר עלו זקני ב"ש וזקני ב"ה לעליית יוחנן בן בתירא ואמרו ציצית אין לה שיעור כיוצא בו לולב אין בו שיעור
human_translation: Is this to say that have measure? And raises a contradiction strings” Strings nothing other than emerges and strings only any length. And already the elders of Beit Shammai and the elders of Beit Hillel ascended to the attic of Yoḥanan ben Beteira, and said: Ritual fringes have no measure. Similarly, a lulav has no measure.
llm_translation: To say that it has a measure, and they raised a contradiction: "Tzitzit - there is no tzitzit except something that goes out, and there is no tzitzit except something that is hanging." And the elders of Beit Shammai and the elders of Beit Hillel already ascended for the ascent of Yochanan ben Batera, and they said: "Tzitzit has no measure, similar to the lulav, which has no measure."

hebrew_text: מאי לאו אין לה שיעור כלל לא
human_translation: What, not have no measure at all? No,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "לאו אין לה שיעור כלל לא"?

hebrew_text: אין לה שיעור למעלה אבל יש לה שיעור למטה דאי לא תימא הכי כיוצא בו לולב אין לו שיעור הכי נמי דאין לו שיעור כלל
human_translation: do not have a maximum measure, however, they do have a minimum measure, As, if you do not say so, similar to it, a lulav has no measure, that it also has no measure whatsoever?
llm_translation: There is no measure above, but there is a measure below. For if you do not say so, it is like a lulav, which has no measure at all.

hebrew_text: והתנן לולב שיש בו ג' טפחים כדי לנענע בו כשר אלא אין לו שיעור למעלה אבל יש לו שיעור למטה ה"נ אין לו שיעור למעלה אבל יש לו שיעור למטה
human_translation: But didn’t we learn A lulav that has three handbreadths sufficient to wave with it, fit Rather, has no maximum measure, but it does have a minimum measure. So too, have no maximum measure, but they have a minimum measure.
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: A palm branch (lulav) that has three handbreadths in order to wave with it is valid. However, it does not have a measure above, but it does have a measure below. So too here: It does not have a measure above, but it does have a measure below.

hebrew_text: ת"ר ציצית אין ציצית אלא ענף וכן הוא אומר (יחזקאל ח, ג) ויקחני בציצית ראשי ואמר אביי וצריך לפרודה כי צוציתא דארמאי
human_translation: The Sages taught strings” strings [ tzitzit ] nothing other than strings that hang down [ anaf ], and so it states “I was taken by a lock [ betzitzit ] of my head” And Abaye says: And required to separate like a gentile’s lock
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "Tzitzit" - Tzitzit is nothing but a branch. And so it says (Ezekiel 8:3), "And he took me by a lock of hair." And Abaye said: And it needs to be separated, for it is the Aramaic word for "branch."

hebrew_text: ת"ר הטיל על הקרן או על הגדיל כשירה רבי אליעזר בן יעקב (אומר) פוסל בשתיהן
human_translation: The Sages taught affixed to the corner or to the border [ gadil ], fit. Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov disqualifies in both
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: If one placed it on the horn or on the band, Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov deems it valid; he disqualifies it in both cases.

hebrew_text: כמאן אזלא הא דאמר רב גידל אמר רב ציצית צריכה שתהא נוטפת על הקרן שנאמר (במדבר טו, לח) על כנפי בגדיהם כמאן כרבי אליעזר בן יעקב
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rav Giddel says Rav says: Ritual fringes must hang down onto the corner as it is stated: “On the corners of their garments” In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov.
llm_translation: As to whom does this go according to? This is like what Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav: Tzitzit requires that it should be dripping on the corner, as it is stated (Numbers 15:38), "On the corners of their garments." Whose opinion is this? Like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יעקב אמר רבי יוחנן וצריך שירחיק מלא קשר גודל
human_translation: Rabbi Ya’akov says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: And must distance a full thumb joint
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yaakov, said Rabbi Yochanan, "And one must distance from a full knot of Gudal."

hebrew_text: ואיצטריך דרב פפא ואיצטריך דר' יעקב דאי מדרב פפא הוה אמינא תוך ג' דלא לירחיק טפי וכמה דמקרב מעלי איצטריך דר' יעקב
human_translation: And it was necessary of Rav Pappa and it was necessary of Rabbi Ya’akov. because if from of Rav Pappa, I would say within three that one may not distance more but the closer the better. it was necessary of Rabbi Ya’akov.
llm_translation: And it was necessary for Rav Papa, and it was necessary for Rabbi Yaakov, for if it were from Rav Papa, I would say within three cubits so as not to distance it too much, and however much it is closer to me, it was necessary for Rabbi Yaakov.

hebrew_text: ואי מדרבי יעקב הוה אמינא מלא קשר גודל דלא ליקרב טפי וכמה דרחיק מעלי צריכא
human_translation: And if from of Rabbi Ya’akov, I would say a full thumb joint that one may not closer but the further the better. necessary.
llm_translation: And if according to Rabbi Yaakov, I would say, "A full knot of a large size that does not come close too much, and as much as it is distant from me, it is necessary."

hebrew_text: רבינא ורב סמא הוו יתבי קמיה דרב אשי חזייה רב סמא לקרניה דגלימיה דרבינא דסתר ובצר ממלא קשר גודל אמר ליה לא סבר לה מר להא דר' יעקב אמר ליה בשעת עשייה איתמר
human_translation: Ravina and Rav Samma were sitting before Rav Ashi. Rav Samma saw that the corner of Ravina’s cloak was torn and less than full a thumb joint said to Doesn’t the Master hold in accordance with that of Rabbi Ya’akov said to was stated at the time made.
llm_translation: Ravina and Rav Sama were sitting before Rav Ashi. Rav Sama saw the horn of Ravina's robe hidden and torn. He said to him, "Does the Master not hold in accordance with that of Rabbi Yaakov?" He replied to him, "It was stated at the time of the action."

hebrew_text: איכסיף אמר ליה רב אשי לא תתקיף לך חד מינייהו כתרי מינן
human_translation: became embarrassed Rav Ashi said to Do not be upset one of them, is like two of us,
llm_translation: איכסיף - Iksif אמר - said ליה - to him רב אשי - Rav Ashi לא - not תתקיף - be angry לך - to you חד - one מינייהו - of them כתרי - crowns מינן - from us

hebrew_text: רב אחא בר יעקב רמי ארבע ועייף להו מיעף ומעייל להו בגלימא ואביק להו מיבק קסבר בעינן תמניא בגלימא כי היכי דליהוי גדיל גדילים במקום פתיל
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov would affix four and he would fold them and insert them into the garment, and loop them he held we require eight in the garment, in order that there be twisted cord “twisted cords” at the place, loose hanging string.
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov would throw four and tire them out, and then bring them in with a cloak, and would take them out with a stick. He holds that we require eight with a cloak so that it will become a large cloak in place of a thread.

hebrew_text: רב ירמיה מדפתי רמי תמניא דאינהו שיתסר ולא אביק להו מר בריה דרבינא עביד כדידן
human_translation: Rav Yirmeya of Difti would affix eight that are sixteen and he would not loop them Mar, son of Ravina, would prepare like ours,
llm_translation: Rav Yirmiya of Difti would throw eight coins at them, and the son of Ravina would do as we do.

hebrew_text: רב נחמן אשכחיה לרב אדא בר אהבה רמי חוטי וקא מברך לעשות ציצית א"ל מאי ציצי שמענא הכי אמר רב ציצית אין צריכה ברכה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman found Rav Adda bar Ahava affixing strings and reciting the blessing To prepare ritual fringes [ tzitzit ]. said to What tzitzi I hear? This is what Rav says: Ritual fringes do not require a blessing
llm_translation: Rav Nachman found Rav Adda bar Ahava weaving threads and reciting the blessing for making tzitzit. He said to him, "What are you doing?" He replied, "I heard thus: Rav said, 'Tzitzit does not require a blessing.'"

hebrew_text: כי נח נפשיה דרב הונא על רב חסדא למירמא דרב אדרב ומי אמר רב ציצית אין צריך ברכה והא אמר רב יהודה אמר רב מנין לציצית בעובד כוכבים שהיא פסולה שנאמר (במדבר טו, ב) דבר אל בני ישראל ועשו להם ציצית בני ישראל יעשו ולא העובדי כוכבים יעשו
human_translation: when Rav Huna died, Rav Ḥisda went into to raise a contradiction of Rav to of Rav, Did Rav say ritual fringes do not require a blessing But doesn’t Rav Yehuda say Rav says: From where ritual fringes by a gentile unfit? as it is stated: “Speak unto the children of Israel that they prepare for themselves strings” the children of Israel shall prepare but the gentiles shall not prepare
llm_translation: When Nah, the soul of Rav Huna, was resting upon Rav Ḥisda, to suggest to Rav in the name of Rav, did Rav indeed say that tzitzit does not require a blessing? But did not Rav Yehudah say in the name of Rav: From where do we derive that tzitzit worn by a non-Jew is invalid? As it is stated (Numbers 15:38), "Speak to the children of Israel and say to them that they shall make for themselves tzitzit." The children of Israel shall make, but not the idolaters.

hebrew_text: והא מאי רומיא אמר רב יוסף קסבר רב חסדא כל מצוה שכשירה בעובד כוכבים בישראל אין צריך לברך כל מצוה שפסולה בעובד כוכבים בישראל צריך לברך
human_translation: But what contradiction Rav Yosef said: Rav Ḥisda held any mitzva which fit by a gentile, by a Jew, he does not need to recite a blessing. any mitzva which unfit by a gentile, by a Jew, he needs to recite a blessing
llm_translation: And this, what is the case of Rome? Rav Yosef said Rav Chisda: Any commandment that is valid for a Gentile is not necessary to recite a blessing over for an Israelite. Any commandment that is invalid for a Gentile, one must recite a blessing over for an Israelite.

hebrew_text: וכללא הוא והרי מילה דכשירה בעובד כוכבים דתניא עיר שאין בה רופא ישראל ויש בה רופא ארמאי ורופא כותי ימול ארמאי ואל ימול כותי דברי רבי מאיר רבי יהודה אומר כותי ולא ארמאי
human_translation: And is principle? But circumcision, which is valid by a gentile, as it is taught a city in which there is no Jewish physician, and in which there is an Aramean, physician and a Samaritan physician, Aramean circumcise and Samaritan not circumcise the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: Samaritan and Aramean not
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And it is a general principle, and behold circumcision is valid when performed by a non-Jew, as it was taught: In a city where there is no Jewish doctor but there is an Aramean doctor and a Samaritan doctor, the Aramean should circumcise and not the Samaritan. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says, the Samaritan and not the Aramean."

hebrew_text: ובישראל צריך לברך דאמר מר המל אומר ברוך אשר קדשנו במצותיו וצונו על המילה
human_translation: And by a Jew, he must recite a blessing, as the Master said: The one who circumcises says: Blessed Who has sanctified us through His mitzvot and has commanded us concerning circumcision.
llm_translation: And in Israel, one must bless, as the Master said: "Blessed is He who sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning circumcision."

hebrew_text: מידי הוא טעמא אלא לרב רב מיפסיל פסיל דאיתמר מנין למילה בעובד כוכבים שפסולה דרו בר פפא משמיה דרב אמר (בראשית יז, ט) ואתה את בריתי תשמור
human_translation: Is there reason according to but Rav? Rav invalidates as it was stated: From where that circumcision by a gentile not valid? Daru bar Pappa says in the name of Rav: And as for you, you shall keep My covenant,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Midi hu ta'ama ela l'Rav Rav mifsil pisil d'itmar minyan l'milah b'oved kochavim she'pisulah d'ru bar Papa mishmei d'Rav amar (Bereshit 17:9) v'atah et briti tishmor." English translation: "This is the reason, but for Rav, Rav disqualifies a disqualification, as it was stated: From where do we derive the invalidation of circumcision performed by a non-Jew? Ru bar Papa in the name of Rav said, 'And you shall keep My covenant' (Genesis 17:9)."

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן אמר (בראשית יז, יג) המול ימול המל ימול
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says “Must be circumcised [ himmol yimmol ]” one who is circumcised [ hammal ] may circumcise [ yamul ]
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said (Genesis 17:13) "The one who is uncircumcised shall be cut off."

hebrew_text: סוכה מסייע ליה תפילין הוי תיובתיה
human_translation: a sukka supports phylacteries is a conclusive refutation of his
llm_translation: Sukkah assists Tefillin, it is his refutation.

hebrew_text: הרי סוכה דכשירה בעובד כוכבים דתניא סוכת עובדי כוכבים סוכת נשים סוכת בהמה סוכת כותיים סוכה מכל מקום כשירה ובלבד שתהא מסוככת כהילכתה
human_translation: A sukka is fit by a gentile, as it is taught a booth gentiles, a booth women, a booth for domesticated animals, a booth Samaritans, a booth of any sort, fit provided that it is roofed in accordance with the halakha .
llm_translation: Behold, a sukkah is valid with a non-Jew, as it was taught: the sukkah of idolaters, the sukkah of women, the sukkah of animals, the sukkah of Samaritans - a sukkah is valid from any place, as long as it is covered as it should be.

hebrew_text: ובישראל אין צריך לברך דתניא העושה סוכה לעצמו אומר ברוך אתה ה' אלהינו מלך העולם שהחיינו וקימנו והגיענו לזמן הזה בא לישב בה אומר ברוך אתה ה' אלהינו מלך העולם אשר קדשנו במצותיו וצונו לישב בסוכה ואילו לעשות סוכה לא מברך
human_translation: And by a Jew, he is not required to recite a blessing as it is taught One who constructs a sukka for himself recites: Blessed are You, Lord our God, King of the universe, Who has given us life, sustained us, and brought us to this time. he comes to sit in he recites: Blessed are You, Lord our God, King of the universe, Who has sanctified us through His mitzvot and commanded us to reside in the sukka . whereas he does not recite a blessing To construct a sukka ,
llm_translation: And in Israel, not necessary to bless, as it was taught: One who makes a sukkah for himself says, "Blessed are You, Hashem our God, King of the universe, who has kept us alive, sustained us, and brought us to this time." When he comes to sit in it, he says, "Blessed are You, Hashem our God, King of the universe, who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us to sit in the sukkah." But if one is making a sukkah, he does not recite a blessing.

hebrew_text: תפילין תיובתיה והרי תפילין דפסולות בעובד כוכבים דתני רב חיננא בריה דרבא
human_translation: phylacteries a conclusive refutation of Phylacteries are unfit by a gentile, as it is taught Rav Ḥinnana, son of Rava,
llm_translation: Tefillin, its joining, and behold, tefillin that are invalid in the case of a non-Jew, as taught by Rav Chinana, son of Rava.

hebrew_text: מפשרניא ספר תורה תפילין ומזוזות שכתבן צדוקי כותי עובד כוכבים עבד אשה וקטן מומר פסולין שנאמר וקשרתם וכתבתם כל שישנו בקשירה ישנו בכתיבה כל שאינו בקשירה אינו בכתיבה
human_translation: of Pashronya: A Torah scroll, phylacteries, or mezuzot that were written by a heretic, a Samaritan, a gentile, slave, a woman, a minor, or a Jewish apostate [ meshummad ] are unfit, as it is stated: “And you shall bind them and you shall write them Anyone who is in binding is in write anyone who is not in binding is not in write
llm_translation: "Mafsharniya, Sefer Torah, Tefillin, and Mezuzot that a Sadducee, Kutite, idolater, slave, woman, or apostate minor wrote are invalid, as it is stated: 'And you shall bind them and inscribe them.' Whatever requires binding requires inscribing; whatever does not require binding does not require inscribing."

hebrew_text: ובישראל א"צ לברך דשלח רב חייא בריה דרב הונא משמיה דר' יוחנן על תפילין של יד אומר ברוך אשר קדשנו במצותיו וצונו להניח תפילין על תפילין של ראש אומר ברוך אשר קדשנו במצותיו וצונו על מצות תפילין ואילו לעשות תפילין לא מברך
human_translation: And a Jew does not have to recite a blessing. As Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Huna, sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: On phylacteries of the arm says Blessed ho has sanctified us through His mitzvot and commanded us to don phylacteries. On phylacteries of the head says Blessed Who has sanctified us through His mitzvot and commanded us concerning the mitzva of phylacteries. whereas does not recite a blessing: To prepare phylacteries.
llm_translation: In Israel, one does not need to recite a blessing when sending a gift. Rav Chiya, son of Rav Huna, in the name of Rabbi Yochanan, said: Regarding the hand Tefillin, one says, "Blessed is He who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us to lay Tefillin." Regarding the head Tefillin, one says, "Blessed is He who has sanctified us with His commandments and commanded us concerning the commandment of Tefillin." However, when making Tefillin, one does not recite a blessing.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו היינו טעמא כל מצוה דעשייתה גמר מצוה כגון מילה אע"ג דכשירה בעובד כוכבים בישראל צריך לברך וכל מצוה דעשייתה לאו גמר מצוה כגון תפילין אע"ג דפסולות בעובד כוכבים בישראל אינו צריך לברך
human_translation: Rather, isn’t this the reason any mitzva whose performance is the completion of mitzva, such as circumcision, even though it is valid by a gentile, by a Jew he must recite a blessing. But any mitzva where the performance of is not the completion of mitzva, such as phylacteries, even though it is not valid by a gentile, by a Jew he does not need to recite a blessing.
llm_translation: Rather, is this not the reason: every positive commandment that its performance completes the commandment, such as circumcision, even though it is valid when performed by a non-Jew, in Israel one must recite a blessing. And every positive commandment that its performance does not complete the commandment, such as tefillin, even though they are invalid when performed by a non-Jew, in Israel one does not need to recite a blessing.

hebrew_text: ובציצית בהא קמיפלגי מר סבר חובת טלית הוא ומר סבר חובת גברא הוא
human_translation: And with regard to ritual fringes disagree about this: Sage, holds it is an obligation cloak. And Sage, holds it is an obligation the man.
llm_translation: And in tzitzit, here they dispute: Master holds it is the obligation of the garment, and Master holds it is the obligation of the person.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב מרדכי לרב אשי אתון הכי מתניתו לה
human_translation: Rav Mordekhai said to Rav Ashi: You teach this in this manner,
llm_translation: Rav Mordechai said to Rav Ashi: "You, thus, teach it."

hebrew_text: אנן הכי מתנינן לה א"ר יהודה אמר רב מנין לציצית בעובד כוכבים שכשירה שנאמר (במדבר טו, ב) דבר אל בני ישראל ועשו להם ציצית יעשו להם אחרים
human_translation: We teach it in this way, Rav Yehuda says Rav says: From where ritual fringes by a gentile valid? that is stated: “Speak unto the children of Israel that they prepare for themselves [ lahem ] strings” others, shall prepare for them.
llm_translation: We thus teach her: Rabbi Yehudah said in the name of Rav, how do we know that the tzitzit of a non-Jew are valid? As it is stated (Numbers 15:38), "Speak to the children of Israel and say to them that they shall make for themselves tzitzit." They shall make for themselves - others.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה אמר רב עשאן מן הקוצים ומן הנימין ומן הגרדין פסולה מן הסיסין כשירה
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says Rav says: one prepared from thorns [ kotzim ], or from threads [ nimin ] or from the strings [ geradin ] unfit, from swatches fit.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said in the name of Rav: A sukka made from thorns, reeds, or branches is invalid; but if made from flax, it is valid.

hebrew_text: כי אמריתה קמיה דשמואל אמר אף מן הסיסין פסולה בעינן טוייה לשמה
human_translation: When I stated this before Shmuel, said Even from swatches unfit, we require the spinning for the sake of
llm_translation: When she said before Shmuel, he said: "Even from the sycamore tree, we require it to be bent for the sake of its name."

hebrew_text: כתנאי ציפן זהב או שטלה עליהן עור בהמה טמאה פסולות עור בהמה טהורה כשירות ואע"פ שלא עיבדן לשמן רבן שמעון בן גמליאל אומר אף עור בהמה טהורה פסולות עד שיעבדן לשמן
human_translation: is like tanna’im , coated them gold or patched them skin of a non-kosher animal, they are unfit. skin of a kosher animal, they are fit, and even though he did not prepare for their sake, Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even skin of a kosher animal they are unfit, until he prepares them for their sake.
llm_translation: The disputants: If one lined them with gold or removed the hide of an impure animal on them, they are invalid. The hides of a pure animal are valid. Even though he did not process them for their intended purpose. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says: Even the hides of a pure animal are invalid until he processes them for their intended purpose.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לרב שמואל בר רב יהודה הא תכילתא היכי צבעיתו לה אמר ליה מייתינן דם חלזון וסמנין ורמינן להו ביורה [ומרתחינן ליה] ושקלינא פורתא בביעתא וטעמינן להו באודרא ושדינן ליה לההוא ביעתא וקלינן ליה לאודרא
human_translation: Abaye said to Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yehuda: How do you dye this sky-blue wool said to We bring blood of a ḥilazon and herbs and put them in a pot And we take a bit in an egg and test it by a wad And we throw that egg and burn the wad
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rav Shmuel bar Rav Yehuda: How did they color the techelet? He said to him: We bring the blood of the chilazon and various dyes, and we mix them in a pot, and we take a piece of wool in a basin, and we dip it in the dye, and we hang it in that basin, and we remove it to the basin.

hebrew_text: שמע מינה תלת שמע מינה טעימה פסולה ושמע מינה דבעינן צביעה לשמה ושמע מינה טעימה פסלה
human_translation: Learn from three Learn from it testing unfit And learn from it that we require dyeing for the sake of And learn from it testing renders unfit.
llm_translation: Hear from it, three; hear from it, taste; disqualified. And hear from it, that we require intent for the sake of dyeing, and hear from it, taste; invalid.

hebrew_text: היינו טעימה פסולה היינו צביעה לשמה אמר רב אשי מה טעם קאמר מה טעם טעימה פסולה משום דבעינן צביעה לשמה
human_translation: testing unfit is dyeing for the sake of Rav Ashi said: employs What is the reason, What is the reason testing unfit? because we require dyeing for the sake of
llm_translation: This is a taste that is invalid, this is dyeing for its sake. Rav Ashi said: What is the reason he said? What is the reason a taste that is invalid? Because we require dyeing for its sake.

hebrew_text: כתנאי טעימה פסולה משום שנאמר (שמות כח, לא) כליל תכלת דברי ר' חנינא בן גמליאל
human_translation: subject to tanna’im , testing unfit, as it is stated entirely of blue [ kelil tekhelet ]” the statement of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel.
llm_translation: Disputants: Taste is invalid because it is stated (Exodus 28:31) "completely blue." The words of Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel.

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן בן דהבאי אומר אפילו מראה שני שבה כשר משום שנאמר (ויקרא יד, ד) ושני תולעת
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Dahavai says: Even a second appearance is fit, As it is stated “And scarlet wool [ ushni tola’at ]”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan ben Dhabai says: Even if it appears two of them are valid, it is considered valid, as it is stated (Leviticus 14:4), "And two live birds."

hebrew_text: ת"ר תכלת אין לה בדיקה ואין נקחית אלא מן המומחה תפילין יש להם בדיקה ואין ניקחין אלא מן המומחה ספרים ומזוזות יש להן בדיקה וניקחין מכל אדם
human_translation: The Sages taught There is no testing sky-blue wool, and it may be purchased only from an expert. There is testing phylacteries but they may be purchased only from an expert. There is testing Torah scrolls and mezuzot , and they may be purchased from anyone.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Techelet does not require inspection, and it is only taken from an expert. Tefillin require inspection, and are only taken from an expert. Sifrei Torah and mezuzot require inspection, and can be taken from anyone.

hebrew_text: ותכלת אין לה בדיקה והא רב יצחק בריה דרב יהודה בדיק ליה (סי' בגשם) מייתי מגביא גילא ומיא דשבלילתא ומימי רגלים
human_translation: And is there no testing sky-blue wool? But didn’t Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, test it a mnemonic with gimmel , shin , mem . bring alum clay [ megavya gila ], and water of fenugreek [ shavlilta ], and urine [ meimei raglayim ]
llm_translation: The blue dye has no examination, but didn't Rav Yitzchak, the son of Rav Yehuda, examine it? (Tractate Bava Metzia) He brings a clod of earth, a clod of mud, and water from the feet.

hebrew_text: בן ארבעים יום ותרי לה בגווייהו מאורתא ועד לצפרא איפרד חזותיה פסולה לא איפרד חזותיה כשרה
human_translation: forty days old. soak in from night until morning. its color would fade [ ipparad ḥazutei ], unfit, its color would not fade, fit.
llm_translation: A man of forty days and two in his bowels, from Oreta to Tzafra, his vision is invalid; from Tzafra to Oreta, his vision is valid.

hebrew_text: ורב אדא קמיה דרבא משמיה דרב עוירא אמר מייתי חמירא ארכסא דשערי ואפיא לה בגוויה אישתנאי למעליותא כשרה לגריעותא פסולה וסימניך שינוי שקר שינוי אמת
human_translation: And Rav Adda said before Rava in the name of Rav Avira: One brings hard [ arkesa ] leavened barley and bakes in it. changes for the better, fit. worse, unfit. And your mnemonic Change falsehood change truth.
llm_translation: And Rav Adda stood before Rava in the name of Rav Avira and said: "Bring a donkey's saddle of hair and place it on her body. If it is suitable for the upper parts, it is valid; if for the lower parts, it is invalid. And your signs are: a change is falsehood, a change is truth."

hebrew_text: מאי אין לה בדיקה נמי דקאמר אטעימה
human_translation: What when it says: There is no testing for testing
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "she does not require examination"? Also, it is stated: "to taste."

hebrew_text: מר ממשכי אייתי תכלתא בשני רב אחאי בדקוה בדרב יצחק בריה דרב יהודה ואיפרד חזותיה בדרב אדא ואישתנאי למעליותא
human_translation: Mar, from Mashkhei, brought sky-blue in the years Rav Aḥai They tested it in Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, and its color faded. in Rav Adda and changed for the better.
llm_translation: Master Memashki brought a blue thread on Monday. Rav Ahai examined it with Rav Yitzhak, the son of Rav Yehuda, and his gaze separated from them. He went up to the upper chambers with Rav Ada, and they deliberated.

hebrew_text: סבר למיפסלה אמר להו רב אחאי אלא הא לא תכילתא היא ולא קלא אילן היא אלא שמע מינה שמועתא אהדדי איתמר
human_translation: thought deemed unfit Rav Aḥai said to them: But this is not tekhelet , and is not indigo, Rather, conclude from it halakhot were stated together.
llm_translation: He thought to disqualify it, Rav Achai said to them, rather, it is not a basket and not a voice of a tree, but rather, it is a rumor that they said to each other.

hebrew_text: היכא דבדקנא בדרב יצחק בריה דרב יהודה לא איפרד חזותיה כשרה איפרד חזותיה בדקינן לה בדרב אדא בחמירא ארכסא אישתני למעליותא כשרה לגריעותא פסולה שלחו מתם שמועתא אהדדי איתמר
human_translation: where we tested in by Rav Yitzḥak, son of Rav Yehuda, its color did not fade, fit its color faded, we test it in by Rav Adda, with hard leavened changed for the better fit; for the worse unfit. They sent from there, halakhot were stated together,
llm_translation: Where we examined with Rav Yitzchak, son of Rav Yehuda, if his vision was clear, his vision was deemed valid. If his vision was not clear, we examined it with Rav Ada in a dark place. It was found valid for higher matters but invalid for lower matters. They sent from there a report that contradicted each other. It was stated.

hebrew_text: רבי מני דייק וזבין כחומרי מתניתא א"ל ההוא סבא הכי עבוד קמאי דקמך ואצלח עיסקייהו
human_translation: Rabbi Mani was exacting and purchased in accordance with the stringencies of the baraita A certain elder said to him: This is what your early predecessors did, and their businesses were successful.
llm_translation: Rabbi Mani was precise and would buy according to the standards of the Mishnah. That elder said to him, "Do as the first ones did, and you will succeed in their dealings."

hebrew_text: ת"ר הלוקח טלית מצוייצת מן השוק מישראל הרי היא בחזקתה מן העובד כוכבים מן התגר כשרה מן ההדיוט פסולה
human_translation: The Sages taught one who purchases a cloak with ritual fringes from the marketplace, from a Jew it retains its presumptive status from a gentile, from a merchant fit, from an ordinary unfit,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: One who acquires a garment found in the marketplace from a Jew, it is assumed to be in the possession of a non-Jew; if from a merchant, it is valid; if from an ordinary person, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: ואע"פ שאמרו אין אדם רשאי למכור טלית מצוייצת לעובד כוכבים עד שיתיר ציציותיה
human_translation: And even though said: A person is not permitted to sell a cloak with ritual fringes to a gentile until he unties its ritual fringes,
llm_translation: And even though they said, "A person is not permitted to sell a woolen garment with fringes to a non-Jew until he unties its fringes."

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא הכא תרגימו משום זונה רב יהודה אמר שמא יתלוה עמו בדרך ויהרגנו
human_translation: What is the reason Here they interpreted because a prostitute Rav Yehuda said: lest accompany him on a journey and kill him.
llm_translation: What is the reason here that it is translated as "zonah"? Rav Yehudah said: Lest he accompany him on the road and kill him.

hebrew_text: רב יהודה רמי תכילתא לפרזומא דאינשי ביתיה ומברך כל צפרא להתעטף בציצית
human_translation: Rav Yehuda would affix sky-blue to the garment [ pirzuma ] of his wife. And every morning recite the blessing: To wrap ourselves in ritual fringes.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah raises a question before the prominent people of his town and blesses every bird to wrap itself in tzitzit.

hebrew_text: מדרמי קסבר מצות עשה שלא הזמן גרמא הוא אמאי מברך כל צפרא וצפרא
human_translation: From that affix he holds a positive mitzva that is not time-bound, why he recite the blessing each and every morning?
llm_translation: From the school of Kaspur, he holds: A positive commandment that is not time-bound, what is the reason that one recites a blessing for each and every bird?

hebrew_text: כרבי דתניא תפילין כל זמן שמניחן מברך עליהן דברי רבי
human_translation: in accordance with Rabbi as it is taught phylacteries, every time one dons them he recites the blessing over them, the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: Like Rabbi as it was taught: Tefillin, as long as one puts them on, he recites a blessing over them. This is the statement of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: אי הכי כל שעתא נמי רב יהודה איניש צניעא הוה ולא שרי ליה לגלימיה כוליה יומא ומאי שנא מצפרא כי משני מכסות לילה לכסות יום
human_translation: If so, also every time Rav Yehuda was a modest man and he did not remove his cloak the entire day. what different from the morning, when he changed from a nighttime garment to a daytime garment.
llm_translation: If so, at all times also Rav Yehudah was a modest person and did not allow his cloak to be fully removed all day. What is the difference? At night, one covers to cover, and during the day.

hebrew_text: ת"ר הכל חייבין בציצית כהנים לוים וישראלים גרים נשים ועבדים ר"ש פוטר בנשים מפני שמצות עשה שהזמן גרמא הוא וכל מצות עשה שהזמן גרמא נשים פטורות
human_translation: The Sages taught Everyone is obligated in ritual fringes, priests, Levites, Israelites, converts, women, and slaves. Rabbi Shimon deems women exempt, because is a positive, time-bound mitzva, and women are exempt every positive, time-bound mitzva.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: All are obligated in tzitzit - priests, Levites, and Israelites, converts, women, and slaves. Rabbi Shimon exempts women because the mitzvah of tzitzit is time-bound, and all time-bound positive commandments, women are exempt.

hebrew_text: אמר מר הכל חייבין בציצית כהנים לוים וישראלים פשיטא דאי כהנים לוים וישראלים פטירי מאן ליחייב
human_translation: The Master said Everyone is obligated in ritual fringes, priests, Levites, and Israelites. obvious? As, if priests, Levites, and Israelites were exempt who is to be obligated?
llm_translation: Said Mar: All are obligated in tzitzit - Kohanim, Leviim, and Yisraelim. It is obvious that if Kohanim, Leviim, and Yisraelim are exempt, who would be obligated?

hebrew_text: כהנים איצטריכא ליה ס"ד אמינא הואיל וכתיב (דברים כב, יא) לא תלבש שעטנז צמר ופשתים יחדיו גדילים תעשה לך מאן דלא אישתרי כלאים לגביה בלבישה הוא דמיחייב בציצית הני כהנים הואיל ואישתרי כלאים לגבייהו לא ליחייבו
human_translation: It was necessary for priests it may enter your mind to say Since it is written: “You shall not wear diverse kinds, wool and linen together. You shall prepare yourself twisted cords one who is not permitted to wear diverse kinds is obligated in ritual fringes. these priests, since diverse kinds are permitted for them they should not be obligated
llm_translation: Priests need it, in my opinion. I say, since it is written (Deuteronomy 22:11), "You shall not wear a garment of wool and linen mixed together," one who does not permit kilayim in his clothing is the one who is obligated in tzitzit. These priests, since kilayim is permitted in their garments, are not obligated.

hebrew_text: קמ"ל נהי דאישתרי בעידן עבודה בלא עידן עבודה לא אישתרי
human_translation: teaches us although permitted at the time service, when not the time of service not permitted,
llm_translation: It teaches us: Yes, that which is permitted during the time of Temple service is not permitted outside the time of Temple service.

hebrew_text: ר"ש פוטר בנשים מאי טעמא דר"ש דתניא (במדבר טו, לט) וראיתם אותו פרט לכסות לילה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon deems women exempt. What is the reasoning of Rabbi Shimon? As it is taught that you may look upon it excludes a nighttime garment,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon exempts women. What is the reason of Rabbi Shimon? As it was taught (Numbers 15:39), "And you shall see it," excluding covering at night.

hebrew_text: אתה אומר פרט לכסות לילה או אינו אלא פרט לכסות סומא כשהוא אומר (דברים כב, יב) אשר תכסה בה הרי כסות סומא אמור הא מה אני מקיים וראיתם אותו פרט לכסות לילה
human_translation: Do you say exclude a nighttime garment? Or is it exclude only the garment of a blind person, When states: with which you cover yourself” garment of a blind person is mentioned how do I realize “That you may look upon it”? exclude a nighttime garment.
llm_translation: You say: "Part to cover night or is it only a part to cover a blind person when it says (Deuteronomy 22:12) 'that you shall cover with it,' behold, covering a blind person is mentioned. What then am I fulfilling? And you shall see that it is a part to cover night."

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות כסות סומא ולהוציא כסות לילה מרבה אני כסות סומא שישנה בראיה אצל אחרים ומוציא אני כסות לילה שאינה בראיה אצל אחרים
human_translation: What did you see to include the garment of a blind person and to exclude a nighttime garment I include the garment of a blind person, which is visible to others, and I exclude a nighttime garment, which is not visible to others.
llm_translation: And what did you see to include a blind person's garment and to exclude a night garment? I include a blind person's garment that is used for sight by others, and I exclude a night garment that is not used for sight by others.

hebrew_text: ורבנן
human_translation: And the Rabbis
llm_translation: And the sages.

hebrew_text: האי אשר תכסה בה מאי עבדי ליה מיבעי להו לכדתניא (דברים כב, יב) על ארבע כנפות כסותך ארבע ולא שלש
human_translation: what do they do with, this “With which you cover yourself” require for that which is taught “on the four corners of your garment” four but not three
llm_translation: This that you shall cover with it, what does one do with it? It is necessary for them, as it was taught in a baraita (Deuteronomy 22:12), "On the four corners of your garment you shall make tassels." Four and not three.

hebrew_text: אתה אומר ארבע ולא שלש או אינו אלא ארבע ולא חמש כשהוא אומר אשר תכסה בה הרי בעלת חמש אמור ומה אני מקיים על ארבע ארבע ולא שלש
human_translation: Do you say four but not three Or is it only four but not five When states: “With which you cover yourself,” with five is thereby mentioned how do I realize “On the four four but not three
llm_translation: You say four and not three, or is it only four and not five, when it says "which you shall cover with it," behold, it speaks of five. And how do I fulfill on four? Four and not three.

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות בעלת חמש ולהוציא בעלת שלש מרבה אני בעלת חמש שיש בכלל חמש ארבע ומוציא אני בעלת שלש שאין בכלל שלש ארבע
human_translation: But what did you see to include with five and to exclude with three I include with five as five includes four, and I exclude with three as three does not include four.
llm_translation: And what did you see to include a woman with five and to exclude a woman with three? I include a woman with five that includes in the category of five four, and I exclude a woman with three that does not include in the category of three four.

hebrew_text: ור"ש מאשר נפקא ורבנן אשר לא משמע להו
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon derives from which [ asher ] And the Rabbis They do not learn “which [ asher ].”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon who went out, and the Rabbis who did not agree with him.

hebrew_text: ורבנן האי (במדבר טו, לט) וראיתם אותו מאי עבדי ליה מיבעי להו לכדתניא וראיתם אותו וזכרתם ראה מצוה זו וזכור מצוה אחרת התלויה בו ואיזו זו זו קרית שמע דתנן מאימתי קורין את שמע בשחרית משיכיר בין תכלת ללבן
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they do with this “That you may look upon it” They require it for that which is taught “That you may look upon it and remember” see this mitzva and remember another mitzva that is contingent on it. And which is that? It is the recitation of Shema . As we learned From when may one recite Shema in the morning? From when distinguish between sky-blue and white
llm_translation: The sages said: "And you shall see it" (Numbers 15:39) - what should they do with it? According to what was taught in a Baraita: "And you shall see it" - see this commandment and remember another commandment dependent on it. And which is that? It is the Shema, as we learned: From when may one recite the Shema in the morning? From the time one can distinguish between blue and white.

hebrew_text: ותניא אידך וראיתם אותו וזכרתם ראה מצוה זו וזכור מצוה אחרת הסמוכה לה ואיזו זו זו מצות כלאים דכתיב (דברים כב, יא) לא תלבש שעטנז צמר ופשתים יחדו גדילים תעשה לך
human_translation: And is taught another “that you may look upon it and remember” see this mitzva and remember another mitzva that is adjacent to it And which is that? It is the mitzva of diverse kinds as it is written: “You shall not wear diverse kinds, wool and linen together. You shall prepare yourself twisted cords”
llm_translation: And it was taught in another source: "And you shall see it and remember." See this commandment and remember another commandment that is adjacent to it. And which is that? It is the commandment of Sha'atnez, as it is written (Deuteronomy 22:11): "You shall not wear Sha'atnez, wool and linen together. You shall make twisted cords for yourself."

hebrew_text: תניא אידך וראיתם אותו וזכרתם את כל מצות ה' כיון שנתחייב אדם במצוה זו נתחייב בכל מצות כולן ור"ש היא דאמר מצות עשה שהזמן גרמא היא
human_translation: is taught another “That you may look upon it and remember all the commandments of the Lord” once a person is obligated in this mitzva he is obligated in all of the mitzvot. And this is Rabbi Shimon, who says a positive, time-bound mitzva,
llm_translation: It was taught: Another interpretation "And you shall see it and remember all the commandments of the Lord." Once a person becomes obligated in this commandment, he becomes obligated in all the commandments. And Rabbi Shimon said: It is a positive commandment that is time-bound.

hebrew_text: תניא אידך וראיתם אותו וזכרתם את כל מצות ה' שקולה מצוה זו כנגד כל המצות כולן
human_translation: is taught another “That you may look upon it and remember all the commandments of the Lord”; this mitzva is equivalent to all the mitzvot
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: "And you shall see it and remember all the commandments of the Lord" - this commandment is equivalent to all the commandments combined.

hebrew_text: ותניא אידך וראיתם אותו וזכרתם ועשיתם ראיה מביאה לידי זכירה זכירה מביאה לידי עשיה ורשב"י אומר כל הזריז במצוה זו זוכה ומקבל פני שכינה כתיב הכא וראיתם אותו וכתיב התם (דברים ו, יג) את ה' אלהיך תירא ואותו תעבוד
human_translation: And is taught another “That you may look upon it and remember and do looking leads to remembering remembering leads to doing And Rabbi Shimon bar Yoḥai says: Anyone who is diligent in this mitzva merits receiving the Divine Presence. written here: “That you may look upon it [ oto ]” and it is written there: “You shall fear the Lord your God; and Him [ oto ] shall you serve”
llm_translation: And it was taught in another source: "And you shall see it and remember and do." Seeing leads to remembering, remembering leads to doing. And Rabbi Shimon bar Yochai says: Anyone who is diligent in this commandment merits and receives the presence of the Divine Presence. It is written here, "And you shall see it," and it is written there (Deuteronomy 6:13), "You shall fear the Lord your God and Him shall you serve."

hebrew_text: ת"ר חביבין ישראל שסיבבן הקב"ה במצות תפילין בראשיהן ותפילין בזרועותיהן וציצית בבגדיהן ומזוזה לפתחיהן ועליהן אמר דוד (תהלים קיט, קסד) שבע ביום הללתיך על משפטי צדקך
human_translation: The Sages taught The Jewish people are beloved, as the Holy One, Blessed be He, surrounded them with mitzvot: phylacteries on their heads, and phylacteries on their arms, and ritual fringes on their garments, and a mezuza for their doorways. Concerning them David said: “Seven times a day I praise You, because of Your righteous ordinances”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Beloved are the children of Israel, for the Holy One, blessed be He, encompassed them with the commandments - with phylacteries on their heads, and phylacteries on their arms, and fringes on their garments, and a mezuzah on their doorposts. And concerning them, David said (Psalms 119:164), "Seven times a day I praise You for Your righteous ordinances."

hebrew_text: ובשעה שנכנס דוד לבית המרחץ וראה עצמו עומד ערום אמר אוי לי שאעמוד ערום בלא מצוה וכיון שנזכר במילה שבבשרו נתיישבה דעתו לאחר שיצא אמר עליה שירה שנאמר (תהלים יב, א) למנצח על השמינית מזמור לדוד על מילה שניתנה בשמיני
human_translation: And when David entered the bathhouse and saw himself standing naked, he said: Woe to me that that I stand naked without mitzva. But once he remembered the circumcision that was in his flesh his mind was put at ease, After he left he recited a song about as it is stated “For the leader, on the Sheminith : A Psalm of David” about circumcision, which was given on the eighth [ bashemini ]
llm_translation: And at the time when David entered the bathhouse and saw himself standing naked, he said, "Woe is me that I should stand naked without a commandment." And once he remembered the circumcision in his flesh, his mind was at ease. After he left, he said a song about it, as it is said (Psalms 12:1), "For the Leader; upon the eighth. A Psalm of David. For the circumcision that was given on the eighth."

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר בן יעקב אומר כל שיש לו תפילין בראשו ותפילין בזרועו וציצית בבגדו ומזוזה בפתחו הכל בחיזוק שלא יחטא שנאמר (קהלת ד, יב) והחוט המשולש לא במהרה ינתק ואומר (תהלים לד, ח) חונה מלאך ה' סביב ליראיו ויחלצם
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: Anyone who has phylacteries on his head, phylacteries on his arm, ritual fringes on his garment, and a mezuza on his doorway is strengthened all so that he will not sin, as it is stated “And a threefold cord is not quickly broken” And states: “The angel of the Lord encamps round about them that fear Him, and delivers them”
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Anyone who has phylacteries on his head, and phylacteries on his arm, and fringes on his garment, and a mezuzah on his doorpost, all for reinforcement so that he will not sin, as it is said (Ecclesiastes 4:12), "And a threefold cord is not quickly broken," and it is said (Psalms 34:8), "The angel of the Lord encamps around those who fear Him and delivers them."

hebrew_text: תניא היה ר' מאיר אומר מה נשתנה תכלת מכל מיני צבעונין מפני שהתכלת דומה לים וים דומה לרקיע ורקיע לכסא הכבוד שנאמר (שמות כד, י) ותחת רגליו כמעשה לבנת הספיר וכעצם השמים לטהר וכתיב (יחזקאל א, כו) כמראה אבן ספיר דמות כסא
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: What is different about tekhelet from all types of colors because tekhelet is similar to sea, and sea is similar to sky, and sky is similar to the Throne of Glory, as it is stated: and there was under His feet the like of a paved work of sapphire stone, and the like of the very heaven for clearness” And it is written: “The likeness of a throne, as the appearance of a sapphire stone”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir would say, "How is teal different from all other colors? Because teal resembles the sea, and the sea resembles the sky, and the sky resembles the Throne of Glory, as it is stated (Exodus 24:10), 'And under His feet was like a work of sapphire brick, and like the essence of the heavens for purity,' and it is written (Ezekiel 1:26), 'Like the appearance of sapphire stone, the likeness of a throne.'"

hebrew_text: תניא היה רבי מאיר אומר גדול עונשו של לבן יותר מעונשו של תכלת משל למה הדבר דומה למלך בשר ודם שאמר לשני עבדיו לאחד אמר הבא לי חותם של טיט ולאחד אמר הבא לי חותם של זהב ופשעו שניהם ולא הביאו איזה מהן עונשו מרובה הוי אומר זה שאמר לו הבא לי חותם של טיט ולא הביא
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: punishment for white greater than the punishment for sky-blue a parable: To what is this matter comparable? to a king of flesh and blood who said to his two subjects said to one Bring me a seal of clay, and he said to one: Bring me a seal of gold. And both of them were negligent and did not bring Which of them a greater punishment? You must say this to whom he said: Bring me a seal of clay, and did not bring
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir used to say, "Great is the punishment of the white (i.e., the heart) more than the punishment of the blue (i.e., the sky). What is this matter comparable to? To a human king who said to two of his servants, to one he said, 'Bring me a seal of clay,' and to the other he said, 'Bring me a seal of gold.' And they both transgressed, yet neither of them brought what was asked of them. Whose punishment is greater? You would say it is the one who was told to bring a seal of clay and did not bring it."

hebrew_text: תניא היה רבי מאיר אומר חייב אדם לברך מאה ברכות בכל יום שנאמר (דברים י, יב) ועתה ישראל מה ה' אלהיך שואל מעמך
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: A person is obligated to recite one hundred blessings every day, as it is stated “And now, Israel, what [ ma ] does the Lord your God require of you”
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir used to say, "A person is obligated to recite one hundred blessings every day, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 10:12), 'And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God ask of you.'"

hebrew_text: רב חייא בריה דרב אויא בשבתא וביומי טבי טרח וממלי להו באיספרמקי ומגדי
human_translation: on Shabbat and Festivals, Rav Ḥiyya, son of Rav Avya, made an effort to fill with spices [ be’isparmakei ] and sweet fruit,
llm_translation: Rav Chiya, son of Rav Avya, on Shabbat and on the days of Tov, would exert himself and fill for them with isparmakei and magdei.

hebrew_text: תניא היה ר"מ אומר חייב אדם לברך שלש ברכות בכל יום אלו הן שעשאני ישראל שלא עשאני אשה שלא עשאני בור
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Meir would say: A man is obligated to recite three blessings every day these are: Who did not make me a gentile; Who did not make me a woman; Who did not make me an ignoramus.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Meir used to say, "A person is obligated to recite three blessings every day. These are: 'Who has made me an Israelite,' 'Who has not made me a woman,' 'Who has not made me a boor.'"

hebrew_text: רב אחא בר יעקב שמעיה לבריה דהוה קא מברך שלא עשאני בור אמר ליה כולי האי נמי אמר ליה ואלא מאי מברך שלא עשאני עבד היינו אשה עבד
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov heard his son reciting the blessing: Who did not make me an ignoramus. said to him: in fact this far said to him: Rather, what blessing recite? Who did not make me a slave, that is a woman; a slave
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov heard that his son was blessing saying the blessing: "Who has not made me a slave." He said to him, "All this too you should say." He said to him, "But rather, why do you bless saying 'Who has not made me a slave'? This is also a woman who is a slave."

hebrew_text: זיל טפי
human_translation: more lowly
llm_translation: Go and add more.

hebrew_text: ת"ר חלזון זהו גופו דומה לים וברייתו דומה לדג ועולה אחד לשבעים שנה ובדמו צובעין תכלת לפיכך דמיו יקרים
human_translation: The Sages taught: This ḥilazon , is Its body resembles the sea, its form resembles a fish, it emerges once in seventy years, and with its blood one dyes sky-blue therefore it is expensive.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Chalzon, its body resembles the sea, and its creation resembles a fish. It ascends once in seventy years, and with its blood they dye blue. Therefore, its blood is precious."

hebrew_text: תניא א"ר נתן אין לך כל מצוה קלה שכתובה בתורה שאין מתן שכרה בעה"ז ולעה"ב איני יודע כמה צא ולמד ממצות ציצית
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Natan says: There is no mitzva, minor, that is written in the Torah, for which there is no reward given in this world; and in the World-to-Come I do not know how much Go and learn from the mitzva of ritual fringes.
