llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Nathan said, "There is no easy commandment written in the Torah for which reward is not given in this world, and the principal reward remains for the World to Come. I do not know how much reward is given. Go out and learn from the commandment of tzitzit."

hebrew_text: מעשה באדם אחד שהיה זהיר במצות ציצית שמע שיש זונה בכרכי הים שנוטלת ד' מאות זהובים בשכרה שיגר לה ארבע מאות זהובים וקבע לה זמן כשהגיע זמנו בא וישב על הפתח
human_translation: an incident involving a certain man who was diligent about the mitzva of ritual fringes. heard that there was a prostitute in the cities overseas who took four hundred gold coins as her payment. He sent her four hundred gold coins and fixed a time to her. When his time came, he came and sat at the entrance
llm_translation: A story about a man who was meticulous in the commandment of tzitzit. He heard that there was a prostitute in the outskirts of the sea who would take four hundred gold coins as her fee. He sent her four hundred gold coins as payment and set a time with her. When the appointed time arrived, he went and sat at the entrance.

hebrew_text: נכנסה שפחתה ואמרה לה אותו אדם ששיגר ליך ד' מאות זהובים בא וישב על הפתח אמרה היא יכנס נכנס הציעה לו ז' מטות שש של כסף ואחת של זהב ובין כל אחת ואחת סולם של כסף ועליונה של זהב
human_translation: The maidservant of entered and said to her: That man who sent you four hundred gold coins came and sat at the entrance. She said: Let him enter. He entered. She arranged seven beds for him, six of silver and one of gold. Between each and every one a ladder of silver, and the top of gold.
llm_translation: Her maidservant entered and said to her, "That man who sent you four hundred gold coins, let him come and sit at the doorway." She said, "He may enter." She offered him seven rods, six of silver and one of gold, and between each rod a ladder of silver, with the top one of gold.

hebrew_text: עלתה וישבה על גבי עליונה כשהיא ערומה ואף הוא עלה לישב ערום כנגדה באו ד' ציציותיו וטפחו לו על פניו נשמט וישב לו ע"ג קרקע ואף היא נשמטה וישבה ע"ג קרקע אמרה לו גפה של רומי שאיני מניחתך עד שתאמר לי מה מום ראית בי
human_translation: She went up and sat naked on the top and he too went up to sit naked facing her. his four ritual fringes came and slapped him on his face. He dropped down and sat himself on the ground, and she also dropped down and sat on the ground. She said to him: gappa of Rome that I will not allow you until you tell me what defect you saw in me.
llm_translation: She ascended and sat on top of her upper garment when she was naked, and he also ascended to sit naked opposite her. His four fringes came and slapped him on his face, he fell and sat on the ground. She also fell and sat on the ground. She said to him, "The pride of Rome, I will not leave you until you tell me what blemish you saw in me."

hebrew_text: אמר לה העבודה שלא ראיתי אשה יפה כמותך אלא מצוה אחת ציונו ה' אלהינו וציצית שמה וכתיב בה (במדבר טו, מא) אני ה' אלהיכם שתי פעמים אני הוא שעתיד ליפרע ואני הוא שעתיד לשלם שכר עכשיו נדמו עלי כד' עדים
human_translation: He said to her: the Temple that I never saw a woman as beautiful as you. But one mitzva the Lord, our God, commanded us, and its name is ritual fringes, and in it it is written twice: “I am the Lord your God” I am the one who will punish and I am the one who will reward Now, appeared to me as four witnesses
llm_translation: He said to her, "I have not seen a woman as beautiful as you except for one mitzvah that our God commanded, the tzitzit that is placed on it, and it is written in it (Numbers 15:41), 'I am the Lord your God' - twice I am, the One who is destined to exact punishment, and I am the One who is destined to reward. Now, four witnesses have appeared to me as if."

hebrew_text: אמרה לו איני מניחך עד שתאמר לי מה שמך ומה שם עירך ומה שם רבך ומה שם מדרשך שאתה למד בו תורה כתב ונתן בידה
human_translation: She said to him: I will not allow you until you tell me: What is your name, and what is the name of your city, and what is the name of your teacher, and what is the name of the study hall in which you studied Torah? He wrote and placed in her hand.
llm_translation: She said to him, "I will not leave you until you tell me what is your name, and what is the name of your city, and what is the name of your teacher, and what is the name of the study hall in which you learned Torah." He wrote and gave it to her.

hebrew_text: עמדה וחילקה כל נכסיה שליש למלכות ושליש לעניים ושליש נטלה בידה חוץ מאותן מצעות
human_translation: She arose and divided all of her property, one-third to the government, one-third to the poor, and she took one-third in her possession, in addition to those beds
llm_translation: She stood and divided all her property: one-third to the kingdom, one-third to the poor, and one-third she took in her hand, except for those sheets.

hebrew_text: ובאת לבית מדרשו של ר' חייא אמרה לו רבי צוה עלי ויעשוני גיורת אמר לה בתי שמא עיניך נתת באחד מן התלמידים הוציאה כתב מידה ונתנה לו אמר לה לכי זכי במקחך
human_translation: She came to the study hall of Rabbi Ḥiyya said to him: My teacher, instruct concerning me and make me a convert. said to her: My daughter, perhaps you set your sights on one of the students She took note from her hand and gave it to He said to her: Go take possession of your purchase.
llm_translation: She came to the study hall of Rabbi Chiya and said to him, "Rabbi, command me and make me a convert." He said to her, "My daughter, perhaps you have set your eyes on one of the students." She took a document from her bosom and gave it to him. He said to her, "Go, acquire with your purchase."

hebrew_text: אותן מצעות שהציעה לו באיסור הציעה לו בהיתר זה מתן שכרו בעה"ז ולעה"ב איני יודע כמה
human_translation: Those beds that she had arranged for him in a prohibited she arranged for him in a permitted This is the reward given to him in this world, and to the World-to-Come, I do not know how much
llm_translation: Those beds that she offered to him with prohibition, she offered to him with permission, this is the reward in this world and in the World to Come, I do not know how much.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה טלית שאולה כל שלשים יום פטורה מן הציצית מיכן ואילך חייבת
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: a borrowed cloak, for thirty days it is exempt from ritual fringes; from then on obligated.
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said: A borrowed garment for thirty days is exempt from tzitzit. From here onward, it is obligated.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי הדר בפונדקי בא"י והשוכר בית בח"ל כל שלשים יום פטור מן המזוזה מיכן ואילך חייב אבל השוכר בית בא"י עושה מזוזה לאלתר משום יישוב דא"י:
human_translation: That is also taught one who resides in a guesthouse [ pundaki ] in Eretz Yisrael, or one who rents a house outside of Eretz Yisrael, for thirty days exempt from the mezuza ; from then on obligated. But one who rents a house in Eretz Yisrael affix a mezuza immediately, due to settlement of Eretz Yisrael.
llm_translation: It was also taught in a Baraita: One who resides in an inn in the Land of Israel and rents a house in the Diaspora, for thirty days is exempt from affixing a mezuzah. From here onward, however, he is obligated. But one who rents a house in the Land of Israel must immediately affix a mezuzah due to the settlement of the Land of Israel.

hebrew_text: תפלה של יד אינה מעכבת: אמר רב חסדא לא שנו אלא שיש לו אבל אין לו מעכבת
human_translation: phylacteries of arm does not prevent Rav Ḥisda said: They taught only where one has But he does not have does prevent
llm_translation: Prayer of hand not impediment. Said Rav Chisda: They taught not except he has but not impediment.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו אמרת אמר להו לא אלא מאן דלית ליה תרי מצות חד מצוה נמי לא ליעביד ומעיקרא מאי סבר גזירה שמא יפשע
human_translation: said to him: you say said to them: No, rather one who does not have two mitzvot, should he also not perform one mitzva And what did he hold initially decree, lest he be negligent
llm_translation: They said to him, "You said a saying." He said to them, "No, rather, one who does not have two commandments, should not even do one commandment. And from the beginning, what does he hold regarding the decree lest he transgress."

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת כל שאינו מניח תפילין עובר בשמונה עשה
human_translation: Rav Sheshet says: Anyone who does not don phylacteries violates eight positive mitzvot.
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: Anyone who does not put on tefillin transgresses eight positive commandments.

hebrew_text: וכל שאין לו ציצית בבגדו עובר בחמשה עשה
human_translation: And anyone who does not have ritual fringes on his garments violates five positive mitzvot.
llm_translation: And all that does not have tzitzit on his garment transgresses five positive commandments.

hebrew_text: וכל כהן שאינו עולה לדוכן עובר בג' עשה
human_translation: And any priest who does not ascend the platform violates three positive mitzvot
llm_translation: And every kohen who does not ascend to the platform transgresses three positive commandments.

hebrew_text: כל שאין לו מזוזה בפתחו עובר בשני עשה וכתבתם וכתבתם
human_translation: Anyone who does not have a mezuza in his doorway violates two positive mitzvot, “And you shall write them “And you shall write them
llm_translation: All one who does not have a mezuzah on his doorpost transgresses two positive commandments, "and you shall write them" and "and you shall write them."

hebrew_text: ואמר ר"ל כל המניח תפילין מאריך ימים שנאמר
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: Anyone who dons phylacteries lives long life, as it is stated:
llm_translation: And Rabbi Levi said: "Anyone who puts on tefillin will prolong his days, as it is said..."

hebrew_text: (ישעיהו לח, טז) ה' עליהם יחיו ולכל בהן חיי רוחי ותחלימני והחייני:
human_translation: “The Lord is upon them, they will live, and altogether therein is the life of my spirit; and have me recover, and make me to live”
llm_translation: Isaiah 38:16 "The Lord will give them life, and to all in them, my spirit will live, and You will heal me and give me life."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הסולת והשמן אין מעכבין את היין ולא היין מעכבן המתנות שעל המזבח החיצון אין מעכבות זו את זו:
human_translation: the fine flour and the oil does not prevent the wine, and the wine does not prevent the placements on the external altar does not prevent the other
llm_translation: Mishnah: The fine flour and the oil do not nullify the wine, and the wine does not nullify the gifts on the outer altar; these do not nullify each other.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר (במדבר כט, יח) ומנחתם ונסכיהם הבא מנחה ואחר כך הבא נסכים רבי אומר זבח ונסכים הבא זבח ואחר כך הבא נסכים
human_translation: The Sages taught “And their meal offering and their libations bring meal offering and then bring libations. Rabbi says an animal offering, and libations, bring animal offering and then bring libations,
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught (Numbers 29:18), "And their meal offering and their drink offerings." If one brings a meal offering first and then brings drink offerings, Rabbi says: "Sacrifice and drink offerings." If one brings a sacrifice first and then brings drink offerings.

hebrew_text: ורבי נמי הכתיב ומנחתם ונסכיהם ההוא מיבעי למנחתם ונסכיהם בלילה ומנחתם ונסכיהם אפילו למחר
human_translation: But Rabbi also, isn’t it written: “And their meal offering and their libations,” That is necessary to their meal offering and their libations at night, and their meal offering and their libations the next day.
llm_translation: And Rabbi also, it is written, "and their meal offerings and their drink offerings." That is necessary for their meal offerings and drink offerings at night, and their meal offerings and drink offerings even for the next day.

hebrew_text: ורבנן נמי הכתיב זבח ונסכים ההוא מיבעי ליה לכדזעירי דאמר זעירי אין נסכים מתקדשין אלא בשחיטת הזבח
human_translation: But the Rabbis also, isn’t it written: “An animal offering, and libations,” That is necessary to in accordance with of Ze’eiri, as Ze’eiri says: libations are consecrated only through the slaughter of the animal offering.
llm_translation: And the Rabbis also, is it written "sacrifice" and libations? That one is necessary for him according to Zeiri, for Zeiri said: Libations are not sanctified except through the slaughter of the sacrifice.

hebrew_text: ורבי נמי מיבעי ליה לכדזעירי ורבנן נמי מיבעי להו למנחתם ונסכיהם בלילה ומנחתם ונסכיהם אפי' למחר
human_translation: But Rabbi also require to in accordance with of Ze’eiri. And the Rabbis also require to their meal offering and their libations at night, and their meal offering and their libations the next day.
llm_translation: And Rabbi also requires it for the residents of Zairi, and the Rabbis also require it for their meal offerings and libations at night, and their meal offerings and libations even for the next day.

hebrew_text: ופרים ואילים ממאי דאישתנו דלמא הכי קאמר רחמנא אי בעי פר ושני אילים ליקרב אי בעי שני פרים ואיל אחד ליקרב מדאישתני סדרן ש"מ אחריני נינהו:
human_translation: But from where that bulls and rams are different Perhaps this the Merciful One is saying: If want, sacrifice a bull and two rams, if want, sacrifice two bulls and one ram, From that the order of is different conclude from it they are different

llm_translation: Son of Nanas also, they are divided. What is the case there? Bread. So too here, bread of judgment they shall be, they shall be, and if not, they shall not be.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא בקרא גופיה קא מיפלגי (ויקרא כג, כ) קדש יהיו לה' לכהן ר"ע סבר אי זהו דבר שכולו לכהן הוי אומר זה לחם
human_translation: And if you wish, say disagree about the verse itself: “They shall be [ yihyu ] holy to the Lord for the priest” Rabbi Akiva holds: Which item is entirely to the priest? You must say it is bread.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: in the verse itself they dispute (Leviticus 23:20) "They shall be holy to the Lord for the priest." Rabbi Akiva holds: If it is an item entirely for the priest, you would say this refers to bread.

hebrew_text: ובן ננס מי כתיב קודש יהיו לכהן קודש יהיו לה' לכהן כתיב איזהו דבר שמקצתו לה' ומקצתו לכהן הוי אומר אלו כבשים
human_translation: And ben Nannas Is it written: They shall be [ yihyu ] holy for the priest, It is written “They shall be [ yihyu ] holy to the Lord for the priest.” Which item is partially to the Lord and partially to the priest? You must say it is sheep,
llm_translation: "And Ben Nanos, where is it written? 'They shall be holy to the priest, they shall be holy to the Lord.' Priest is written, what is the matter that part of it is for the Lord and part of it is for the priest? You would say, these are the lambs."

hebrew_text: ור"ע מי כתיב קדש יהיו לה' ולכהן לה' לכהן כתיב כדרב הונא דאמר רב הונא קנאו השם ונתנו לכהן:
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva Is it written: They shall be [ yihyu ] holy for the Lord and for the priest? It is written to the Lord for the priest.” in accordance with Rav Huna, as Rav Huna says: The Lord acquired it and gave it to the priest.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva said: Where is it written, "They shall be holy to the Lord and for the kohen to the Lord"? Concerning the kohen it is written, as Rav Huna said, for Rav Huna said: "The name of the Lord is zealous, and He will give to the kohen."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יוחנן הכל מודים
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Everyone concedes
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "All concede..."

llm_translation: If they are dependent on each other, they impede each other, and what is their connection? Ritual slaughter.

llm_translation: Ula said: They asked in the West: Does waving (of the offering) cause damage or not cause damage?

hebrew_text: דר' יוחנן גופא קא מיבעיא ליה מיפשט פשיטא ליה לרבי יוחנן דשחיטה עושה זיקה ותנופה אינו עושה זיקה או דלמא שחיטה פשיטא ליה ותנופה מספקא ליה תיקו
human_translation: of Rabbi Yoḥanan itself raises the dilemma: obvious to Rabbi Yoḥanan that slaughter establishes a bond but waving does not establish a bond Or perhaps it is obvious to him slaughter but he is uncertain waving shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan's own question is being asked: Is it obvious to him? It is obvious to Rabbi Yochanan that slaughter causes damage, but waving does not cause damage, or perhaps slaughter is obvious to him, and waving is uncertain. This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: א"ל ר' יהודה בר חנינא לרב הונא בריה דרב יהושע והא כי כתיב (ויקרא כג, כ) קודש יהיו לה' לכהן בתר תנופה כתיב ופליגי בן ננס ור' עקיבא
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Ḥanina said to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua: But when it is written: “They shall be holy to the Lord for the priest” written after waving, and ben Nannas and Rabbi Akiva disagree,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah bar Chanina said to Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, "But is it not written (Leviticus 23:20), 'They shall be holy to the Lord for the priest after the waving'? It is written, and Ben Nanos and Rabbi Akiva disagree."

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך בתר תנופה ולא בתר שחיטה
human_translation: And according to your reasoning after waving but not after slaughter
llm_translation: And to taste after waving, and not after slaughtering.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי אית לך למימרא מעיקרא קאי ומאי קדש יהיו לה' לכהן דבר שסופו לכהן הכא נמי דבר שסופו לכהן
human_translation: Rather, what do you have to say referring before and what “They shall be holy to the Lord for the priest”? an item that is ultimately to the priest. Here too, an item that is ultimately to the priest.

llm_translation: And slaughtering makes a wound, and we raise a contradiction: until he did not slaughter it, its bread was divided, he should bring another bread and slaughter.

llm_translation: When he slaughters it, if its bread is torn, its blood shall be sprinkled, and its flesh shall be eaten, and his hands have not fulfilled his vow, and the bread is disqualified.

From it slaughtered, impure its bread, the blood shall be sprinkled and the flesh shall be eaten, and the hands of his vow shall go out, that he gazed, pleased, upon the impure, and the bread is disqualified.

llm_translation: The thanksgiving-offering is different, for the Merciful One calls it "peace-offering," just as peace-offerings are brought without bread, so too thanksgiving is brought without bread.

llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah said: If you find to say, "Waving causes damage," the bread is lost.

hebrew_text: ואם תמצא לומר תנופה אינה עושה זיקה הביא לחם וכבשים והונפו ואבד הלחם והביא לחם אחר אותו הלחם טעון תנופה או אינו טעון תנופה

human_translation: And according to of ben Nannas, do not raise the dilemma, as he says sheep are primary. When should you raise the dilemma? according to of Rabbi Akiva, as he says loaves are primary. what
llm_translation: And according to the opinion of Ben Nanus, you should not ask, for he said "lambs are primary." When you should ask is according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, who said "bread is primary." What is the explanation?

hebrew_text: כיון דלחם עיקר בעי תנופה או דלמא כיון דמתירין דידיה כבשים נינהו לא צריך תנופה תיקו
human_translation: since the loaves are primary it requires waving. Or perhaps since its permitting factors are sheep, does not require waving. shall stand
llm_translation: Since the main aspect of bread requires waving, or perhaps since they are permitted for themselves, they are considered sheep and do not require waving. The matter stands.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לרבא מאי שנא שני כבשים דמקדשי לחם ומעכבי ומאי שנא שבעה כבשים ופר ואילים דלא מקדשי לחם ולא מעכבי
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: What is different two sheep that their sanctifies the loaves and prevents and what is different seven sheep, the bull, and rams that their does not sanctify loaves, and does not prevent
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rava: What is the difference between two lambs that are sanctified for the showbread and are a hindrance, and what is the difference between seven lambs, a bull, and rams that are neither sanctified for the showbread nor a hindrance?

hebrew_text: אמר לי' הואיל והוזקקו זה לזה בתנופה והרי תודה דלא הוזקקו זה לזה בתנופה ומקדשא ומעכבא
human_translation: said to because are bound to each other through the waving. But a thanks offering they are not bound to each other through waving, and sanctifies and prevents
llm_translation: He said to me: Since they were connected to each other through waving, yet the thanksgiving offering, which was not connected to each other through waving, sanctifies and invalidates.

hebrew_text: אלא כתודה מה תודה שלמים אף הכא נמי שלמים
human_translation: Rather, comparable to a thanks offering. Just as a thanks offering is a peace offering, so too also a peace offering.
llm_translation: Rather, "thanksgiving" - what is the thanksgiving offering? Here too, it is also a thanksgiving offering.

hebrew_text: מי דמי התם ליכא זבחים אחריני בהדיה הכא דאיכא זבחים אחריני בהדיה ליקדשו הני והני
human_translation: Are comparable? There, there are no other animal offerings with it. here, where there are other animal offerings with it, let these and those sanctify
llm_translation: There is no comparison there, for there are no other sacrifices alongside it, whereas here, there are other sacrifices alongside it, these and those shall be sanctified.

hebrew_text: אלא כאיל נזיר מה איל נזיר אע"ג דאיכא זבחים אחריני שלמים הוא דמקדשי מידי אחרינא לא הכא נמי לא שנא
human_translation: Rather, comparable to a nazirite’s ram, Just as nazirite’s ram, even though there are other offerings it is peace offering that sanctifies not anything else, here too, is no different,
llm_translation: Rather, like a Nazirite ram. Just as a Nazirite ram, even though there are other peace offerings, it is the one that sanctifies immediately for other matters. Here too, it is no different.

hebrew_text: והתם מנלן דתניא (במדבר ו, יז) ואת האיל יעשה זבח שלמים לה' על סל המצות מלמד שהסל בא חובה לאיל ושחיטת איל מקדשן לפיכך שחטו שלא לשמו לא קדשו הלחם
human_translation: And there, from where do we as it is taught “And he shall offer the ram for a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord, with the basket of unleavened bread” teaches that the basket comes an obligation for the ram, and the slaughter of the ram sanctifies Therefore, he slaughtered not for the sake of the loaves were not sanctified.
llm_translation: And there, how do we know that it was taught (in Numbers 6:17), "And the ram shall be a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord, upon the basket of unleavened bread"? This teaches that the basket is obligatory for the ram, and the slaughtering of the ram sanctifies them. Therefore, they slaughtered it not for its sake, its bread was not sanctified.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן שתי הלחם הבאות בפני עצמן יונפו ותעובר צורתן ויצאו לבית השריפה
human_translation: the Sages taught the two loaves brought by themselves, they should be waved. their form decays, and they are brought out to the place of burning,
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Two loaves that come before themselves shall be waved, and their form shall be altered, and they shall be taken out to the place of burning.

hebrew_text: מה נפשך אי לאכילה אתיין ליכלינהו אי לשריפה אתיין לשרפינהו לאלתר למה להו עיבור צורה
human_translation: Whichever way you If brought to be eaten, let eat them If brought to be burned, let burn them immediately. Why are they a decay of form,
llm_translation: "What is your desire? If for eating, let us feed them; if for burning, let us burn them immediately. Why do they need to pass through a form?"

hebrew_text: אמר רבה לעולם לאכילה אתיין גזירה שמא יזדמנו להן כבשים לשנה הבאה ויאמרו אשתקד לא אכלנו לחם בלא כבשים עכשיו נמי ניכול
human_translation: Rabba said: Actually, brought to be eaten. decree lest sheep become available to the following year, and they say: Didn’t we eat the loaves without sheep last year [ eshtakad ]? Now too, we will eat
llm_translation: Rabbah said: Always let us eat the Passover lamb roasted, lest perhaps they will have the opportunity to bring us lambs next year, and they will say, "Last year we did not eat the Passover lamb without lambs; now let us also eat."

hebrew_text: ואינהו לא ידעי דאשתקד לא הוו כבשים אינהו שריין נפשייהו השתא דאיכא כבשים כבשים הוא דשרו להו
human_translation: And they will not know that last year there were no sheep, permitted themselves now that there are sheep, it is the sheep that permits
llm_translation: And they did not know that last year there were no lambs; they were selling themselves. Now that there are lambs, it is the lambs that they sell to them.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה מנא אמינא לה דתנן א"ר יהודה העיד בן בוכרי ביבנה כל כהן ששוקל אינו חוטא
human_translation: Rabba said: From where do I say as we learned Rabbi Yehuda said ben Bukhri testified in Yavne: Any priest who contributes his shekel is not a sinner,
llm_translation: Rabbah said: From where do I say this? As we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehudah testified concerning Ben Bukhri in Yavneh, "Every priest who weighs the incense does not sin."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבן יוחנן בן זכאי לא כי אלא כל כהן שאינו שוקל חוטא אלא שהכהנים דורשין מקרא זה לעצמן
human_translation: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai said to That is not rather, any priest who does not contribute his shekel a sinner, But the priests interpret this verse to their own
llm_translation: Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai said to him: Not so, but rather, any priest who does not weigh the thread of the sin-offering, but the priests themselves interpret this verse for themselves.

hebrew_text: (ויקרא ו, טז) וכל מנחת כהן כליל תהיה לא תאכל הואיל ועומר ושתי הלחם ולחם הפנים שלנו הן היאך נאכלין
human_translation: “And every meal offering of the priest shall be wholly made to smoke; it shall not be eaten” Since the omer and the two loaves, and the shewbread are ours, How, can they be eaten?
llm_translation: "And every meal offering of a priest shall be wholly burnt; it shall not be eaten. Since the Omer, the Two Loaves, and the Showbread are ours, how can they be eaten?" (Leviticus 6:16)

hebrew_text: הני שתי הלחם היכי דמי אילימא בבאות עם הזבח אטו תודה ולחמה מי לא מנדבי כהנים ואכלי להו
human_translation: What are the circumstances these two loaves? If we say to where brought with the animal offering, Is that to say priests cannot volunteer a thanks offering and its loaves and eat them?
llm_translation: These two loaves, what are they? If you say they come with the sacrifice, then what about the thanksgiving offering and its bread, are they not voluntary offerings of the priests, and they eat them?

hebrew_text: אלא לאו בבאות בפני עצמן וקתני היאך הן נאכלין אלמא לאכילה אתיין
human_translation: Rather, not where brought by themselves, teaches How they be eaten? Apparently, come to be eaten,
llm_translation: Rather, not with regard to their coming in by themselves, and it teaches: How are they eaten? Clearly, for eating they come.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לעולם בבאות עם הזבח ודקא קשיא לך מתודה ולחמה לחמי תודה לא איקרו מנחה שתי הלחם איקרו מנחה שנא' (במדבר כח, כו) בהקריבכם מנחה חדשה לה'
human_translation: Abaye said to Actually, to brought with the animal offering, And as for that which difficult for you on a thanks offering and its loaves, loaves of a thanks offering are not called a meal offering, the two loaves are called a meal offering, as it is stated when you bring a new meal offering to the Lord”
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: Always when coming with the sacrifice, and it is difficult for you, "Thanksgiving" and "bread" - the bread of Thanksgiving is not called a meal offering. The two loaves are called a meal offering, as it is stated (Numbers 28:26): "When you bring a new meal offering to the Lord."

hebrew_text: רב יוסף אמר לעולם לשריפה אתיין והיינו טעמא דלא שרפינן לפי שאין שורפין קדשים ביו"ט
human_translation: Rav Yosef said Actually, they come to be burned, And this is the reason that we do not burn them because one may not burn consecrated on a Festival.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: Always we come to burning, and this is the reason that we do not burn on Yom Tov, because we do not burn holy items on Yom Tov.

hebrew_text: א"ל אביי מי דמי התם לאו מצותן בכך הכא דמצותן בכך לישרפינהו מידי דהוה אפר ושעיר של יום הכיפורים
human_translation: Abaye said to Is comparable There, this is not their mitzva, here, where this is their mitzva, let burn them just as is of the bull and the goat of Yom Kippur,
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: What is the comparison there? Is it not their commandments in this manner, whereas here their commandments are in this manner, to burn them immediately, as it is the ashes and the scapegoat of Yom Kippur.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב יוסף גזירה שמא יזדמנו להם כבשים לאחר מכאן א"ל אביי תינח כל זמן הקרבתם לבתר הכי לשרפינהו מאי תעובר צורתן נמי דקתני צורת הקרבתם
human_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: decree lest sheep become available to afterward, Abaye said to works out well entire time they sacrificed, after that, let them burn What that teaches their form decays? the form of their sacrifice
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Yosef said: a decree lest they come across sheep for them after this. Abaye said to him: let it be, as long as they bring them close, we will burn them. What is the issue with their form? Also, it is taught: the form of bringing them close.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר לאכילה אתיין וגזירה משום דרבה ולאו מטעמיה אלא מקרא
human_translation: Rava said they come to be eaten, but decree due to which Rabba But not from reasoning, rather, from a verse.
llm_translation: Rava said, "Regarding eating, I am stringent, and the decree is due to Rabah, not for its own sake, but from Scripture."

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא מנא אמינא לה דכתיב (ויקרא כג, יז) ממושבותיכם תביאו לחם תנופה [וגו'] בכורים לה' מה בכורים בפני עצמן אף שתי הלחם בפני עצמן ומינה מה בכורים לאכילה אף שתי הלחם נמי לאכילה
human_translation: And Rava said From where do I state that it is written “You shall bring out of your dwellings loaves of waving for first fruits to the Lord” Just as first fruits by themselves, so too the two loaves by themselves And from this just as first fruits to be eaten, so too the two loaves also to be eaten,
llm_translation: And Rava said, from where do I say this? As it is written (Leviticus 23:17), "From your dwellings you shall bring a wave offering of bread etc., the first fruits to the Lord." Just as the first fruits are separate by themselves, so too the two loaves are separate by themselves. And we learn: Just as the first fruits are for consumption, so too the two loaves are also for consumption.

hebrew_text: ת"ר כבשי עצרת אין מקדשין את הלחם אלא בשחיטה
human_translation: The Sages taught The sheep Shavuot consecrate the loaves only by slaughter.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "The lambs of Shavuot are not sanctified except through slaughter."

hebrew_text: כיצד שחטן לשמן וזרק דמן לשמן קדש הלחם שחטן שלא לשמן וזרק דמן שלא לשמן לא קדש הלחם שחטן לשמן וזרק דמן שלא לשמן הלחם קדוש ואינו קדוש דברי רבי רבי אלעזר בר' שמעון אומר לעולם אינו קדוש עד שישחוט לשמן ויזרוק דמן לשמן
human_translation: How so? one slaughtered for their sake, and sprinkled their blood for their sake, the loaves are consecrated. one slaughtered them not for their sake, and sprinkled their blood not for their sake, the loaves are not consecrated. one slaughtered them for their sake and he sprinkled their blood not for their sake, the loaves are consecrated, but they are not consecrated. the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: never consecrated until one slaughters for their sake and sprinkles their blood for their sake.
llm_translation: How does one slaughter for the sake of the anointing oil, and sprinkle the blood for the sake of the anointing oil? The consecrated bread is holy. If one slaughters not for the sake of the anointing oil, and sprinkles the blood not for the sake of the anointing oil, the bread is not holy. If one slaughters for the sake of the anointing oil, and sprinkles the blood not for the sake of the anointing oil, the bread is holy but not holy. These are the words of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: It is never holy until one slaughters for the sake of the anointing oil and sprinkles the blood for the sake of the anointing oil.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דרבי
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi
llm_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi...

hebrew_text: דכתיב (במדבר ו, יז) ואת האיל יעשה זבח שלמים לה' על סל המצות למימרא דשחיטה מקדשא
human_translation: that it is written “And he shall offer the ram for a sacrifice [ zevaḥ ] of peace offerings to the Lord, with the basket of unleavened bread” that is to say that slaughter consecrates
llm_translation: As it is written (Numbers 6:17), "And the ram shall be offered as a sacrifice of peace offerings to the Lord, upon the basket of unleavened bread," to say that slaughtering sanctifies.

hebrew_text: ור' אלעזר ברבי שמעון יעשה עד שיעשה כל עשיותיו
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, “He shall offer,” until performs all of the actions
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, would do until he did all his doings.

hebrew_text: ורבי נמי הכתיב יעשה אי כתיב זבח יעשה כדקאמרת השתא דכתיב יעשה זבח במה יעשה בזביחה
human_translation: And Rabbi also, isn’t it written: “He shall offer,” If written: A sacrifice [ zevaḥ ] he shall offer, as you are saying Now that it is written: “He shall offer a sacrifice [ zevaḥ ],” By what should he offer By slaughtering [ zeviḥa ].
llm_translation: And Rabbi also, is it written "he shall do"? If it is written "sacrifice," he shall do, as you said: now that it is written "he shall do sacrifice," what shall he do with regard to the sacrifice?

hebrew_text: ורבי אלעזר בר' שמעון הכתיב זבח ההוא מיבעי ליה לכדרבי יוחנן דאמר ר' יוחנן הכל מודים שצריך שיהא לחם בשעת שחיטה
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, isn’t it written: “A sacrifice [ zevaḥ ],” He requires that for which Rabbi Yoḥanan as Rabbi Yoḥanan says everyone, concedes that the loaves must be at the time of the slaughter.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar son of Shimon: It is written, "sacrifice that one requires" - according to Rabbi Yochanan, for Rabbi Yochanan said: Everyone agrees that it is necessary for there to be bread at the time of slaughter.

hebrew_text: מאי קדוש ואינו קדוש אביי אמר קדוש ואינו גמור רבא אמר קדוש ואינו ניתר
human_translation: What consecrated, but they are not consecrated? Abaye says: consecrated but not complete. Rava says: consecrated but not permitted
llm_translation: What is "holy" and not "holy"? Abaye said: "holy" but not complete. Rava said: "holy" but not separated.

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו איכא בינייהו למיתפס פדיונו לאביי לא תפיס פדיונו לרבא תפיס פדיונו
human_translation: What is between them? between them to transfer their redemption According to Abaye, do not transfer their redemption According to Rava, transfer their redemption
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? There is a difference between them regarding the redemption. According to Abaye, his redemption is not acquired, but according to Rava, his redemption is acquired.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לרבא היינו דאיכא בין רבי לר' אלעזר בר"ש אלא לאביי מאי איכא בין רבי לר' אלעזר בר' שמעון
human_translation: Granted, according to Rava, that is between Rabbi Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. according to Abaye, what is there between Rabbi Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon?
llm_translation: Regarding Rava, this is where there is a distinction between Rabbi and Rabbi Elazar ben Shimon. But according to Abaye, what is the distinction between Rabbi and Rabbi Elazar ben Shimon?

hebrew_text: איכא [בינייהו] לאיפסולי ביוצא
human_translation: between them with regard to rendered unfit by leaving
llm_translation: There is a difference between them to disqualify in the case of a yotzei.

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה ר' שמואל בר רב יצחק מר' חייא בר אבא כבשי עצרת ששחטן לשמן וזרק דמן שלא לשמן אותו הלחם מהו באכילה
human_translation: Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak raised a dilemma before Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba: sheep Shavuot that one slaughtered for their sake but sprinkled their blood not for their sake, those loaves, what is with regard to eating
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Shmuel son of Rav Yitzchak from Rabbi Chiya son of Abba: If one slaughtered the festival offering with intent for its fat and sprinkled its blood not for its fat, what is the ruling regarding its consumption?

hebrew_text: אליבא דמאן אי אליבא דר' אלעזר בר' שמעון האמר זריקה היא דמקדשא אי אליבא דרבי בין לאביי בין לרבא קדוש ואינו ניתר הוא
human_translation: In accordance with whose If in accordance with of Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, doesn’t he say it is sprinkling that consecrates the loaves? if in accordance with of Rabbi both according to of Abaye and according to Rava, are consecrated but are not permitted
llm_translation: In the matter of whom? If in the matter of Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon who said, "Zerikah is what sanctifies," whether in the matter of Rabbi, whether in the matter of Abaye, whether in the matter of Rava, it is sanctified and cannot be annulled.

hebrew_text: אלא אליבא דהאי תנא דתני אבוה דר' ירמיה בר אבא שתי הלחם שיצאו בין שחיטה לזריקה וזרק דמן של כבשים חוץ לזמנן ר' אליעזר אומר אין בלחם משום פיגול רבי עקיבא אומר יש בלחם משום פיגול
human_translation: Rather, in accordance with of this tanna . As the father of Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba teaches the two loaves left between slaughtering and sprinkling and sprinkled the blood of sheep beyond their time, Rabbi Eliezer says: The loaves do not due to piggul . Rabbi Akiva says: The loaves do due to piggul .
llm_translation: Rather, according to this Tanna who teaches in the name of the father of Rabbi Yirmiyah bar Abba, the two loaves that were removed between the slaughtering and the sprinkling, and the blood of the lambs was sprinkled outside of its designated time. Rabbi Eliezer says: There is no issue of Pigul with the bread. Rabbi Akiva says: There is an issue of Pigul with the bread.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת הני תנאי כרבי סבירא להו דאמ' שחיטה מקדשא
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: These tanna’im , hold in accordance with Rabbi who said: slaughtering consecrates
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: These Tannaim are like Rabbi Sebira, for he says, "Shechitah is a sanctification."

hebrew_text: מיהו ר' אליעזר לטעמיה דאמר אין זריקה מועלת ליוצא ור"ע לטעמי' דאמ' זריקה מועלת ליוצא
human_translation: But Rabbi Eliezer to his reasoning, as says sprinkling is not effective with regard to left And Rabbi Akiva to his reasoning, as Rabbi Akiva says sprinkling is effective with regard to left
llm_translation: Who is Rabbi Eliezer according to his reasoning, as he said "Zerikah is not effective for the one who is leaving," and Rabbi Akiva according to his reasoning, as he said "Zerikah is effective for the one who is leaving."

hebrew_text: דתנן אימורי קדשים קלים שיצאו לפני זריקת דמים ר' אליעזר אומר אין מועלין בהן ואין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול ונותר וטמא
human_translation: As we learned sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity that left before the sprinkling of the blood, Rabbi Eliezer says: not misusing them. And one them, he is not liable due to piggul , notar , or ritually impure.
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: Light holy items that were taken out before the sprinkling of the blood, Rabbi Eliezer says: One does not commit a trespass with them, and one is not liable for them due to the issues of "pigul," "leftover," and "impurity."

hebrew_text: ר"ע אומר מועלין בהן וחייבין עליהן משום פיגול ונותר וטמא
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: misusing them. And one them he is liable due to piggul , notar , or ritually impure.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says, "They are disqualified, and one is liable for them due to the offenses of Pigul, Notar, and Tamei."

hebrew_text: מאי
human_translation: what
llm_translation: Talmudic text: מאי English translation: What is it?

hebrew_text: מדזריקת פיגול קבעה ללחם בפיגול ביוצא כבשר זריקה שלא לשמה נמי שריא ליה ללחם או דלמא לחומרא אמרינן לקולא לא אמרי'
human_translation: from that sprinkling piggul renders piggul , like the meat by leaving sprinkling not for its own sake also permits the loaves Or perhaps to stringent we say we do not say to lenient,
llm_translation: From the act of sprinkling, she established the intention for the bread to become Pigul. In the case of Pigul, when it comes out of the Temple, it is like non-consecrated meat. The sprinkling that is not for its sake is also effective for the bread. Or perhaps we should say for a stringency reason, we do not say that it is effective for the voice of the offering.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב פפא וממאי דכי איתנהו אבראי פליגי
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this From where they disagree where are outside
llm_translation: Rav Papa objects to this, and from where do they derive it? The limbs themselves disagree.

hebrew_text: דילמא בדאיתנהו אבראי דכ"ע לא פליגי דאין זריקה מועלת ליוצא ובהדר עיילינהו פליגי דרבי אליעזר סבר לה כרבי דאמר שחיטה מקדשא ואיפסלו להו ביוצא
human_translation: Perhaps in where are outside everyone agrees that sprinkling is not effective with regard to left and they disagree in where one then brought them As Rabbi Eliezer holds in accordance with Rabbi who said: slaughter consecrates and became disqualified by leaving
llm_translation: Perhaps when they were given the limbs of the burnt-offering, they do not disagree, for throwing is not effective for the one who is leaving, and then they bring them back, they disagree, for Rabbi Eliezer holds like Rabbi who said that slaughtering sanctifies, and they invalidated it for the one who is leaving.

hebrew_text: ור"ע כר' אלעזר בר' שמעון דאמר שחיטה לא מקדשא ולא מיפסלי ביוצא
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who said: slaughter does not consecrate they do not become disqualified by leaving
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon who said slaughtering does not sanctify and does not disqualify in the case of an animal that is born through Caesarean section.

hebrew_text: האי מאי אי אמרת בשלמא ר"ע כרבי ס"ל דאמר שחיטה מקדשא להו היינו דקאמר ר' עקיבא דקדשי להו בשחיטה ואתיא זריקה קבעה להו בפיגול
human_translation: What is this Granted, if you say Rabbi Akiva holds in accordance with Rabbi who said: slaughter consecrates that is what Rabbi Akiva says that are consecrated by slaughter and sprinkling comes and renders piggul .
llm_translation: This what? What if you say? If you say, according to Rabbi Akiva like Rabbi Yehuda says, that he said slaughtering sanctifies them, this is what Rabbi Akiva said, that he sanctifies them through slaughtering, and then sprinkling establishes them as disqualified due to improper intent.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת כר' אלעזר בר' שמעון ס"ל דאמר זביחה לא מקדשא זריקת פיגול מי מקדשא
human_translation: But if you say in accordance with Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, who said: slaughter does not consecrate does sprinkling piggul consecrate
llm_translation: Rather, if you say like Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, who holds that the slaughtering does not sanctify, does the throwing of the forbidden thought sanctify?

hebrew_text: והאמר רב גידל אמר רב זריקת פיגול אינה מביאה לידי מעיל' ואינה מוציאה מידי מעיל'
human_translation: But doesn’t Rav Giddel say Rav says: Sprinkling piggul does not cause to misuse and it does not remove from misuse
llm_translation: And Rav Giddel said in the name of Rav, "The sprinkling of Pigul does not bring about liability for misuse, and it does not exempt from liability for misuse."

hebrew_text: אינה מביאה לידי מעילה באימורי קדשים קלים
human_translation: does not cause to misuse with regard to sacrificial portions of offerings of lesser sanctity.
llm_translation: It does not lead to inadvertent transgression in the utterances of light holy things.

hebrew_text: ואינה מוציאה מידי מעילה בבשר קדשי קדשים
human_translation: And it does not remove from misuse with regard to meat of offerings of the most sacred order,
llm_translation: And it does not exempt from the obligation of covering with the priestly robe in the case of the flesh of the most holy offerings.

hebrew_text: לאו איתותב דרב גידל אמר רב
human_translation: Wasn’t that which Rav Giddel Rav says conclusively refuted?
llm_translation: Not sitting together of Rav Giddel said Rav.

hebrew_text: בעא מיני' ר' ירמי' מר' זירא כבשי עצרת ששחטן לשמן ואבד הלחם מהו שיזרוק דמן שלא לשמן להתיר בשר באכילה
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raised a dilemma before Rabbi Zeira: sheep of Shavuot that one slaughtered for their own sake, and the loaves were lost, what is sprinkle their blood not for their own sake to permit meat to be eaten?
llm_translation: Requested by Rabbi Yirmiya from Mar Zira: If one slaughtered the festival offering for its own sake, and the bread became lost, what is the ruling regarding sprinkling the blood not for its own sake in order to permit the meat for consumption?

hebrew_text: א"ל יש לך דבר שאינו כשר לשמו וכשר שלא לשמו ולא והרי פסח קודם חצות דאינו כשר לשמו וכשר שלא לשמו
human_translation: said to Do you have anything that is not fit for its own sake, and fit not for its own sake? And no But there is Paschal offering before midday which is not fit for its own sake, and fit not for its own sake
llm_translation: He said to him: Do you have a thing that is not valid for its name, and valid not for its name, and not? And behold, the Passover sacrifice is before midnight, which is not valid for its name, and valid not for its name.

hebrew_text: הכי קא אמינא יש לך דבר שנראה לשמו ונדחה מלשמו ואינו כשר לשמו וכשר שלא לשמו
human_translation: This is what I saying: Do you have anything that was fit for its own sake, and was rejected from for its own sake, and is not fit for its own sake, and fit not for its own sake?
llm_translation: So I say: Do you have a thing that appears for its name and is rejected from its name, and it is not valid for its name, but it is valid not for its name.

hebrew_text: ולא והרי פסח אחר זמנו בשאר ימות השנה (קודם חצות)
human_translation: And no But there is Paschal offering, after its time, during rest of the days of the year before midday,
llm_translation: And not, and behold, Pesach after its time in the rest of the days of the year (before midnight).

hebrew_text: הכי קאמינא יש לך דבר שנראה לשמו ונשחט לשמו ונדחה מלשמו ואינו כשר לשמו וכשר שלא לשמו
human_translation: This is what I saying: Do you have anything that was fit for its own sake, and it was slaughtered for its own sake, and was rejected from for its own sake, and it is not fit for its own sake, and fit not for its own sake?
llm_translation: So I say: Do you have a thing that appears for its name, slaughtered for its name, rejected from its name, and is not valid for its name, and valid not for its name.

hebrew_text: ולא והרי תודה
human_translation: And no But there is thanks offering,
llm_translation: And not, behold a thanksgiving offering.

hebrew_text: שאני תודה דרחמנא קרייה שלמים
human_translation: thanks offering is different, as the Merciful One called it a peace offering
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "שאני תודה דרחמנא קרייה שלמים" English translation: "A thanksgiving offering is called 'Shelamim' by the Merciful One."

hebrew_text: ת"ר שחט שני כבשים על ארבע חלות מושך שתים מהן ומניפן
human_translation: The Sages taught slaughtered two sheep by four loaves he draws two of and waves them
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One slaughters two lambs for four loaves, he draws out two of them and waves them.

hebrew_text: והשאר נאכלות בפדיון אמרוה רבנן קמיה דרב חסדא הא דלא כרבי
human_translation: and the rest are eaten through redemption. The Sages said before Rav Ḥisda: This is not in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: And the rest are eaten through redemption. The Rabbis said before Rav Ḥisda: This is not like Rabbi.

hebrew_text: דאי רבי כיון דאמר שחיטה מקדשא דפריק להו היכא
human_translation: As, if is Rabbi since he says slaughter consecrates that he redeems where
llm_translation: If Rabbi, since he said "slaughter" is considered a sanctification, where does he separate them?

hebrew_text: אי דפריק להו מאבראי כיון דכתיב לפני ה' איפסיל להו ביוצא אי גוואי הא מעייל חולין לעזרה
human_translation: If he redeems them outside since it is written: before the Lord, he disqualifies by leave if inside bringing non-sacred into the courtyard.
llm_translation: If he separates from them limbs, since it is written "before the Lord," it is nullified for them in the courtyard. If it is a weekday, he brings it to the Temple.

hebrew_text: אמר להו רב חסדא לעולם כרבי ופריק להו גוואי וחולין ממילא קא הוויין
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to Actually in accordance with Rabbi and redeems inside non-sacred came by themselves,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said to them: Always be like Rabbi and separate yourselves from them, and mundane matters will automatically be distinguished.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי והתניא כשהוא פודן אין פודן אלא בחוץ
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: But isn’t it taught When he redeems he redeem them only outside
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi, "And it was taught: 'When he redeems, he redeems only outside.'"

hebrew_text: הא ודאי רבי אלעזר בר' שמעון היא דאי רבי הא איפסלו להו ביוצא
human_translation: This is certainly Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, because if Rabbi he thereby disqualifies them by leave
llm_translation: This is indeed Rabbi Elazar son of Shimon's opinion, for if it were Rabbi, they would disqualify the offering.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי לימא תיהוי תיובתיה דר' יוחנן מיהא דאיתמר תודה ששחטה על שמונים חלות חזקיה אמר קדשו ארבעים מתוך שמונים ור' יוחנן אמר לא קדשו ארבעים מתוך שמונים
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Let us say is a conclusive refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan that was stated a thanks offering that one slaughtered by eighty loaves Ḥizkiyya says: Forty of the eighty are consecrated, and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Not forty of eighty are consecrated.
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: Let the refutation of Rabbi Yoḥanan be as it was stated, that a thanksgiving offering slaughtered for eighty loaves. Ḥizkiyah said: Its sanctity is conferred upon forty out of the eighty, and Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Its sanctity is not conferred upon forty out of the eighty.

hebrew_text: ולאו מי איתמר עלה אמר רבי זירא הכל מודים היכא דאמר ליקדשו ארבעים מתוך שמונים דקדשה הכא נמי דאמר ליקדשו תרתי מתוך ארבע
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated with regard to this Rabbi Zeira says: Everyone, concedes where said: Let forty of eighty be consecrated, that are consecrated? Here too, where one said: Let two of the four be consecrated.
llm_translation: "And is it not so that it was stated? Came up Rabbi Zeira, everyone agrees, where he said to sanctify forty out of eighty, as she sanctified here also where he said to sanctify two out of four."

hebrew_text: תני ר' חנינא טירתא קמיה דר' יוחנן שחט ארבעה כבשים על ב' חלות מושך שנים מהן וזורק דמן שלא לשמן
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina Tirata taught before Rabbi Yoḥanan: one slaughtered four sheep by two loaves, draws two of and sprinkles their blood not for the sake
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Chanina of Tirata taught before Rabbi Yochanan: One slaughters four lambs for two loaves, drawing out the blood from two of them and sprinkling it not for its intended purpose.

hebrew_text: שאם אי אתה אומר כך הפסדת את האחרונים
human_translation: As, if you do not say this, you have caused the loss the latter
llm_translation: "If you do not say so, you have lost the latter ones."

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר' יוחנן וכי אומר לו לאדם עמוד וחטא בשביל שתזכה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said to And does say to a person: Arise and sin in order that you may gain?
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Yochanan, "And does one say to a person, 'Sin so that you may merit'?"

hebrew_text: והתנן אברי חטאת שנתערבו באברי עולה ר' אליעזר אומר יתנו למעלה ורואה אני את בשר חטאת למעלה כאילו היא עצים וחכמים אומרים תעובר צורתן ויצאו לבית השריפה
human_translation: But didn’t we learn the limbs of a sin offering, that were intermingled with the limbs of a burnt offering, Rabbi Eliezer says: shall place above, and I view the flesh of the sin offering above as though they are wood And the Rabbis say: the form of decays and they will go out to the place of burning
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: The limbs of a sin offering that became mixed with the limbs of a burnt offering. Rabbi Eliezer says: They should be placed above, and I see the flesh of the sin offering above as if it were wood, and the sages say: Their form should be nullified, and they should be taken out to the place of burning.

hebrew_text: אמאי לימא עמוד וחטא בשביל שתזכה
human_translation: why Let say Arise and sin in order that you may gain
llm_translation: Why say "stand and sin" in order to merit?

hebrew_text: עמוד וחטא בחטאת בשביל שתזכה בחטאת אמרינן עמוד וחטא בחטאת בשביל שתזכה בעולה לא אמרינן
human_translation: We do say: Arise and sin with a sin offering in order that you may gain with regard to a sin offering, We do not say: Arise and sin with a sin offering in order that you may gain with regard to a burnt offering.
llm_translation: Column and sin with a sin offering in order that you may merit with a sin offering, we say column and sin with a sin offering in order that you may merit with a burnt offering, we do not say.

hebrew_text: ובחדא מילתא מי אמר והא תניא כבשי עצרת ששחטן שלא לשמן או ששחטן בין לפני זמנן בין לאחר זמנן הדם יזרק והבשר יאכל
human_translation: And does say: with regard to one matter? But isn’t it taught sheep of Shavuot where one slaughtered them not for their sake, or where he slaughtered them either before their time, or after their time, the blood shall be sprinkled, and the meat shall be eaten.
llm_translation: And in one matter, who said? But it was taught: The Paschal lambs of the Festival, if they were slaughtered not for their sake, or if they were slaughtered whether before their time or after their time, the blood shall be sprinkled, and the flesh shall be eaten.

hebrew_text: ואם היתה שבת לא יזרוק ואם זרק הורצה להקטיר אימורין לערב
human_translation: And if was Shabbat, one may not sprinkle But if sprinkled is accepted to burn portions in the evening,
llm_translation: And if it was Shabbat, he shall not cast the incense, and if he cast it, it is acceptable to offer the sacrificial portions in the evening.

hebrew_text: ואמאי לימא עמוד חטא בשביל שתזכה
human_translation: But why Let say: Arise sin in order that you may gain
llm_translation: And why should one say "Amud Chatat" in order to merit.

hebrew_text: עמוד חטא בשבת כדי שתזכה בשבת אמרינן עמוד חטא בשבת כדי שתזכה בחול לא אמרינן
human_translation: We do say: Arise and sin on Shabbat in order that you may gain on Shabbat. We do not say: Arise and sin on Shabbat in order that you may gain on a weekday.
llm_translation: Column of sin on Shabbat in order to merit on Shabbat we say column of sin on Shabbat in order to merit on weekdays we do not say

hebrew_text: ובתרתי מילי לא אמר והתנן חבית של תרומה שנשברה בגת העליונה ובתחתונה חולין טמאין מודה רבי אליעזר ור' יהושע שאם יכול להציל ממנה רביעית בטהרה יציל
human_translation: And with regard to two matters not say But didn’t we learn a barrel of teruma that broke in the upper winepress, and in the lower non-sacred, impure Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua concede that if one is able to rescue a quarter- of ritual purity, he rescue
llm_translation: And in two matters he did not say, "And we learned in a Mishnah: A barrel of Terumah that broke, its upper part and its lower part are ritually impure." Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Joshua agree that if one can save a quarter of it in purity, he should save it.

hebrew_text: ואם לאו ר' אליעזר אומר
human_translation: But if not, Rabbi Eliezer says:
llm_translation: And if not, Rabbi Eliezer says:

hebrew_text: תרד ותטמא ואל יטמאנה ביד ור' יהושע אומר אף יטמאנה ביד
human_translation: descend and become impure but one not render it impure through action And Rabbi Yehoshua says: one even render it impure through action
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Tard v'titma v'al yitmanah b'yad, v'Rabbi Yehoshua omer af yitmanah b'yad." English translation: "Let him descend and become impure, but he shall not make it impure with his hand, and Rabbi Yehoshua says, even make it impure with his hand."

hebrew_text: שאני התם דלטומאה קא אזלא
human_translation: is different there, because is going to impure
llm_translation: There it is different, for impurity goes.

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב יצחק תני כבשי עצרת ששחטן שלא כמצותן פסולין ותעובר צורתן ויצאו לבית השריפה
human_translation: When Rav Yitzḥak came he taught sheep Shavuot where one slaughtered them not in accordance with their mitzva, disqualified; and their form decays and they are brought out to the place for burning.
llm_translation: When Rav Yitzchak came, he taught: The festival lambs that were slaughtered not according to their requirements are invalid, their form is deformed, and they are taken out to be burned.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן מר דמקיש להו לחטאת תני פסולין תנא דבי לוי דגמר שלמי חובה משלמי נדבה תני כשרים
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Master, who compares to a sin offering teaches: disqualified, tanna of the school of Levi, who derives an obligatory peace offering, from a voluntary peace offering, teaches valid
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: Master who compares them to a sin-offering, teaches them. It was taught: invalid. It was taught in the school of Levi: from obligatory peace-offerings, from voluntary peace-offerings, it was taught: valid.

hebrew_text: דתני לוי ושאר שלמי נזיר ששחטן שלא כמצותן (כשרין ולא עלו לבעלים לשם חובה ו) נאכלין ליום ולילה ואין טעונין לא לחם ולא זרוע
human_translation: As Levi teaches: And other peace offerings of a nazirite that one slaughtered not in accordance with their mitzva, valid but they do not satisfy the obligation of the owner And are eaten for one day and one night, require neither bread nor foreleg,
llm_translation: It was taught: Levi and the rest of the Shelamim of a Nazirite, if one slaughtered them not according to their requirements (they are valid, and did not fulfill the obligation for the owners), they may be eaten for a day and a night, and do not require either bread or the foreleg.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי אשם בן שנה והביא בן שתים בן שתים והביא בן שנה פסולין ותעובר צורתן ויצאו לבית השרפה
human_translation: raises an objection a guilt offering in its year, and brought in its second in its second and he brought in its year; disqualified. their form decays, and are brought out to the place burning.
llm_translation: The question was raised: If one brought a guilt-offering of a one-year-old animal, and then brought a two-year-old animal, or if one brought a two-year-old animal and then brought a one-year-old animal, they are disqualified, their form is distorted, and they are taken out to the place of burning.

hebrew_text: אבל עולת נזיר ועולת יולדת ועולת מצורע שהיו בני שתי שנים ושחטן כשרין
human_translation: But the burnt offering of a nazirite, or the burnt offering of a woman after childbirth, or the burnt offering of a leper, were in their second year and one slaughtered them, valid.
llm_translation: But the burnt offering of a Nazirite, and the burnt offering of a woman after childbirth, and the burnt offering of a leper, if they were two years old, and they were slaughtered, they are valid.

hebrew_text: כללו של דבר כל הכשר בעולת נדבה כשר בעולת חובה וכל הפסול בחטאת פסול באשם חוץ משלא לשמו
human_translation: The principle of the matter Any that is valid as a voluntary burnt offering is valid as an obligatory burnt offering, and any that is disqualified as a sin offering is disqualified as a guilt offering, except for not for its own sake,
llm_translation: The principle of a matter: everything valid in a voluntary burnt offering is valid in an obligatory burnt offering, and everything invalid in a sin offering is invalid in a guilt offering, except for an offering brought not for its sake.

hebrew_text: האי תנא תנא דבי לוי הוא
human_translation: This tanna , is tanna of the school of Levi
llm_translation: This Tanna, Tanna of the house of Levi, he is.

hebrew_text: תא שמע דתני לוי אשם נזיר ואשם מצורע ששחטן שלא לשמן כשרים ולא עלו לבעלים לשום חובה
human_translation: Come hear as Levi teaches: The guilt offering of a nazirite, and the guilt offering of a leper, that one slaughtered not for their sake are valid, but they did not satisfy the obligation of the owner.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as Levi taught: The guilt-offering of a Nazirite and the guilt-offering of a leper, if they were slaughtered not for their sake, are valid, and they do not fulfill the obligation of the owners.

hebrew_text: שחטן מחוסר זמן בבעלים או שהיו בני שתי שנים ושחטן פסולין
human_translation: one slaughtered them time had not yet for owners or they were in their second year and one slaughtered them, disqualified.
llm_translation: They slaughter it lacking time in the owners or if they were two years old and they slaughter it, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא ליגמר משלמים שלמים משלמים גמר אשם משלמים לא גמר
human_translation: But if it is so let him derive from peace offering, derives peace offering from peace offering, he does not derive a guilt offering from a peace offering.
llm_translation: And if it is said to complete with complete offerings, complete offerings complete the guilt offering, complete offerings do not complete.

hebrew_text: ואי גמר שלמים משלמים ליגמר נמי אשם מאשם אשם נזיר ואשם מצורע מאשם גזילות ואשם מעילות או אשם גזילות ואשם מעילות מאשם נזיר ואשם מצורע
human_translation: But if derives peace offering from peace offering, let him derive guilt offering from guilt offering. the guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper from a guilt offering for robbery and a guilt offering for misuse Or, a guilt offering for robbery or a guilt offering for misuse from guilt offering of a nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper,
llm_translation: And if one completes a guilt offering, let him also complete a guilt offering. Guilt offering of a Nazirite and guilt offering of a leper, guilt offering of thefts, and guilt offering of trespasses, or guilt offering of thefts and guilt offering of trespasses from guilt offering of a Nazirite and guilt offering of a leper.

hebrew_text: אמר רב שימי בר אשי דנין דבר שלא בהכשירו מדבר שלא בהכשירו ואין דנין דבר שלא בהכשירו מדבר שבהכשירו
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: One can derive an item that is not in its valid manner, from item that is not in its valid manner, But one cannot derive an item that is not in its valid manner, from an item that is in its valid manner,
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ashi said: We judge something that is not in its proper state based on something that is not in its proper state, and we do not judge something that is not in its proper state based on something that is in its proper state.

hebrew_text: ולא והא תניא מנין ליוצא שאם עלה לא ירד שהרי יוצא כשר בבמה
human_translation: And not But isn’t it taught From where with regard to left that if ascended it shall not descend? that left is valid on altar.
llm_translation: And not, and is it not taught: From where do we derive the law of one who ascended and did not descend, for indeed one who ascended is valid for the altar.

hebrew_text: תנא אזאת תורת העולה ריבה סמיך ליה
human_translation: tanna relies on “This is the law of the burnt offering [ ha’ola ]: include
llm_translation: It was taught: "This is the Torah of the burnt offering" - he expounded it adjacent to it.

hebrew_text: תני רבה בר בר חנה קמיה דרב כבשי עצרת ששחטן לשום אילים כשרין ולא עלו לבעלים לשום חובה אמר ליה רב עלו ועלו
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana taught before Rav: the sheep of Shavuot where one slaughtered them for the sake of rams they are valid but they do not satisfy the obligation of the owner, Rav said to certainly satisfy
llm_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana taught before Rav Ḳabshi: "The festival offerings that were slaughtered for the sake of rams are valid, and they did not ascend to the owners as a gift." Rav said to him: "They ascended, and they ascended."

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא מסתברא מילתיה דרב בכסבור אילים ושחטן לשום כבשים שהרי כבשים לשום כבשים נשחטו
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: The statement of Rav is reasonable in one thought rams and slaughtered them for the sake of lambs. since lambs were slaughtered for the sake of lambs.
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: It is logical according to the opinion of Rav, that if one intends to slaughter for the sake of sheep, and he slaughters for the sake of sheep, for indeed sheep were slaughtered for the sake of sheep.

hebrew_text: אבל כסבור אילים ושחטן לשום אילים לא עקירה בטעות הויא עקירה ורבה אמר עקירה בטעות לא הויא עקירה
human_translation: But he thought rams and slaughtered them for the sake of rams, not erroneous uprooting constitutes uprooting, But Rabba said: erroneous uprooting does not constitute uprooting.
llm_translation: But if he thought of rams and slaughtered for the sake of rams, it is not considered an accidental uprooting. Rava said: An accidental uprooting is not considered an uprooting.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ומותבינן אשמעתין הכהנים שפיגלו במקדש מזידין חייבין הא שוגגין פטורין ותני עלה פיגולן פיגול
human_translation: Rava said: We raise an objection to our halakha priests who disqualified through improper intention in the Temple, intentionally, they are liable therefore, unintentionally they are exempt. And is taught concerning this their improper intention piggul ,
llm_translation: Rava said: And we establish the testimony of the priests who rendered the offering disqualified in the Temple as intentional transgressors are liable, but as unwitting transgressors are exempt. And it was taught: regarding their disqualification, it is disqualified.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אילימא דידע דחטאת היא וקא מחשב בה לשום שלמים האי שוגגין מזידין הוו
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say knew that was a sin offering, and he intended for the sake of a peace offering, this an unintentional they were intentionally.
llm_translation: How so? If you say that he knows that it is a sin-offering, and he intends it for a peace-offering, this is a case of unintentional transgressions being treated as intentional transgressions.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו דכסבור שלמים הוא וקא מחשב בה לשום שלמים וקתני פיגולן פיגול אלמא עקירה בטעות הויא עקירה
human_translation: Rather, is it not thought that it was a peace offering and he intended for the sake of a peace offering, And taught: Their improper intention piggul . Apparently, erroneous uprooting constitutes uprooting,
llm_translation: Rather, it is not that he thinks it is whole peace-offerings, and he is calculating with it for the sake of peace-offerings, and it teaches "pigul" - "pigul." This implies that if it was uprooted unintentionally, it is considered uprooted.

hebrew_text: אמר לי' אביי לעולם דידע דחטאת היא וקא מחשב בה לשום שלמים ובאומר מותר
human_translation: Abaye said to actually where knew that it a sin offering and he intended for the sake of a peace offering, where says, permitted
llm_translation: Said to me Abaye: Always know that it is a sin, and he is considering it as a peace offering, and he says it is permissible.

hebrew_text: מתיב ר' זירא ר' שמעון אומר כל מנחות שנקמצו שלא לשמן כשרות ועלו לבעלים לשום חובה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises an objection Rabbi Shimon says: All meal offerings the handful was removed not for their sake are valid, and have satisfied the obligation of the owner,
llm_translation: Challenged Rabbi Zeira: Rabbi Shimon says, "All meal offerings that became leavened not for their sake are valid, and they ascend to the owners as a gift."

hebrew_text: שאין המנחות דומות לזבחים שהקומץ מחבת לשום מרחשת מעשיה מוכיחין עליה שהיא מחבת חרבה לשום בלולה מעשיה מוכיחין עליה שהיא חרבה
human_translation: because meal offerings are not similar to animal offerings. As, one who removes a handful pan for the sake of a deep pan, its mode of preparation proves it pan a dry for the sake of mixed its mode of preparation proves it a dry
llm_translation: The meal offerings are not similar to sacrifices, for the handful is taken from a pan, as its preparation proves it to be a pan; for a kneaded offering, as its preparation proves it to be kneaded.

hebrew_text: אבל בזבחים אינו כן שחיטה אחת לכולן קבלה אחת לכולן זריקה אחת לכולן
human_translation: But with regard to animal offerings is not so. one slaughter for all of one collection for all of them, one sprinkling for all of them.
llm_translation: But in sacrifices, it is not so; one slaughtering for all, one receiving for all, one sprinkling for all.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אילימא דידע דמחבת היא וקא קמיץ לה לשום מרחשת כי מעשיה מוכיחין מאי הוי הא מיעקר קא עקיר לה
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say where knew that was pan, and he removed a handful for the sake of a deep pan, its mode of preparation proves what of it? he is uprooting
llm_translation: How is it similar? Perhaps it is known that it is a sin-offering, and he is gathering it for the sake of a guilt-offering, for its actions testify. What is it? This is uprooting, he is uprooting it.

hebrew_text: אלא לאו דכסבור מרחשת היא וקא קמיץ לה לשום מרחשת וטעה דהכא הוא דמעשיה מוכיחין עליה הא בעלמא עקירה בטעות הויא עקירה
human_translation: Rather, is it not where thought it was a deep pan and removed a handful for the sake of a deep pan, but he was mistaken, It is here, since its mode of preparation proves it that in general, erroneous uprooting constitutes uprooting,
llm_translation: Rather, it is not that he thought it was a "marḥeshet" and was gathering it for the purpose of "marḥeshet," and he made a mistake. For here, his actions testify against him. Indeed, in general, uprooting done in error is considered uprooting.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לעולם דידע דמחבת היא וקא קמיץ לה לשום מרחשת
human_translation: Abaye said to actually where knew that was pan, and he removed a handful for the sake of a deep pan.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "Indeed, I know that she is a witch, and he is gathering information against her to accuse her of sorcery."

hebrew_text: ודקא אמרת כי מעשיה מוכיחין עליה מאי הוי רבא לטעמיה דאמר רבא מחשבה דלא מינכרא פסל רחמנא מחשבה דמינכרא לא פסל רחמנא:
human_translation: And that which you said its mode of preparation proves it what of it, Rava to his reasoning, as Rava says: The Merciful One disqualifies intent that is not recognizably The Merciful One does not disqualify intent that is recognizably
llm_translation: And you said, "For her actions testify on her behalf." What is the case? Rava according to his reasoning said: A thought that is not recognizable, the Merciful One disqualifies; a thought that is recognizable, the Merciful One does not disqualify.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ התמידין אין מעכבין את המוספין ולא המוספין מעכבין את התמידין ולא המוספין מעכבין זה את זה לא הקריבו כבש בבוקר יקריבו בין הערבים
human_translation: the daily offerings does not prevent the additional offerings, and the additional offerings does not prevent the daily offerings. And the additional offerings does not prevent other did not sacrifice a lamb in the morning they should sacrifice in the afternoon
llm_translation: Mishnah: The continual offerings do not impede the additional offerings, and the additional offerings do not impede the continual offerings. And the additional offerings do not impede one another. If they did not bring a lamb in the morning, they may bring it in the evening.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' שמעון אימתי בזמן שהיו אנוסין או שוגגין אבל אם היו מזידין ולא הקריבו כבש בבוקר לא יקריבו בין הערבים
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: When at a time when they were circumstances beyond their control or unwittingly. But if intentionally and did not sacrifice a lamb in the morning they should not sacrifice in the afternoon
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: When is it that they were coerced or mistaken, but if they were intentional and did not bring a lamb in the morning, they shall not bring it in the evening.

hebrew_text: לא הקטירו קטורת בבוקר יקטירו בין הערבים
human_translation: they did not burn incense in the morning, they should burn in the afternoon.
llm_translation: They did not burn the incense in the morning, they shall burn it between the evenings.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי שמעון וכולה היתה קריבה בין הערבים שאין מחנכין את מזבח הזהב אלא בקטורת הסמים ולא מזבח העולה אלא בתמיד של שחר ולא את השולחן אלא בלחם הפנים בשבת ולא את המנורה אלא בשבעה נרותיה בין הערבים:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: And the entire was sacrificed in the afternoon. that golden altar is initiated only with the incense of the spices And the altar of the burnt offering, only with the daily morning offering. And Table only with the shewbread on Shabbat, and Candelabrum only with of its seven lamps in the afternoon.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: "And all of it was close among the evenings, that they do not anoint the golden altar except with the incense of spices, and not the burnt offering altar except with the morning daily offering, and not the table except with the showbread on Shabbat, and not the menorah except with its seven lamps among the evenings."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ בעא מיניה ר' חייא בר אבין מרב חסדא ציבור שאין להן תמידין ומוספין אי זה מהן קודם
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Avin raised a dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: a community that did not have the daily offerings and the additional offerings, which of them takes precedence
llm_translation: The Talmud: The Gemara: R' Chiya bar Avin asked Mar Rav Chisda: A community that does not have daily offerings and additional offerings, which one of them takes precedence?

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אילימא תמידין דיומיה ומוספין דיומיה פשיטא תמידין עדיפי דהוו להו תדיר ומקודש
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say the daily offerings of that day and the additional offerings of that day, obvious the daily offerings are given preference, as is frequent and sanctified.
llm_translation: How so? If we were to say the daily offerings of its day and the additional offerings of its day, it is obvious that the daily offerings are preferable, for they are more frequent and sanctified.

hebrew_text: אלא תמידין דלמחר ומוספין דהאידנא תמידין עדיפי שכן תדיר או דלמא מוספין עדיפי דהוו להו מקודש
human_translation: Rather, the daily offerings for tomorrow or the additional offerings for today. the daily offerings given preference since frequent? Or perhaps the additional offerings are given preference because they are sanctified
llm_translation: Rather, the daily offerings, for perhaps tomorrow, and the additional offerings, for today, the daily offerings are preferable, for they are more frequent, or perhaps the additional offerings are preferable, for they have sanctity.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה תניתוה התמידין אין מעכבין את המוספין ולא המוספין מעכבין את התמידין ולא (את) המוספין מעכבין זה את זה
human_translation: said to you learned the daily offerings does not prevent the additional offerings, and the additional offerings does not prevent the daily offerings. And the additional offerings does not prevent other
llm_translation: He said to him: "You have taught that the continual offerings do not impede the additional offerings, and the additional offerings do not impede the continual offerings, and the continual offerings do not impede each other."

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אילימא דאית ליה ולקדם והתניא מנין שלא יהא דבר קודם לתמיד של שחר ת"ל (ויקרא ו, ה) וערך עליה העולה

human_translation: And Rava says “the burnt offering,” the first burnt offering
llm_translation: And Rava said: "The one who ascends, ascends first."

llm_translation: Rather, perhaps tomorrow, and it teaches "they do not prevent one another," implying that they are considered as if they are together.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לעולם דאית להו ולקדם ודקא קשיא לך שלא יהא דבר קודם מצוה בעלמא הוא
human_translation: Abaye said to actually, where they have and before And that which a difficulty for you no should precede is merely the mitzva
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "Indeed, they have it, and it is primary. And the difficulty that you find is that a matter should not precede a mitzvah in general."

hebrew_text: ת"ש אין פוחתין מששה טלאים המבוקרין בלשכת הטלאים כדי לשבת ולשני ימים טובים של ראש השנה
human_translation: Come hear no fewer than six lambs that inspected in the Chamber of the Lambs, sufficient for Shabbat and for the two festival days of Rosh HaShana
llm_translation: Come and hear: They do not decrease from the six cubits that are examined in the Chamber of the Weavers in order to sit and to repeat the two days of Rosh Hashanah.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אילימ' דאית ליה תמידין ומוספין טובא הוו
human_translation: What are the circumstances If we say that has there are many daily offerings and additional offerings
