human_translation: No, actually, where has and this is what is saying no fewer than six lambs that inspected in the Chamber of the Lambs four days prior to slaughter. And whose It is ben Bag Bag.
llm_translation: Not forever that he has and thus he said: "We do not remove less than six lambs that are inspected in the Chamber of Lambs four days before the slaughter, and it is from the lineage of Ben Bag Bag."

hebrew_text: דתניא בן בג בג אומר מנין לתמיד שטעון ביקור ד' ימים קודם שחיטה תלמוד לומר (במדבר כח, ב) תשמרו להקריב לי במועדו ולהלן הוא אומר (שמות יב, ו) והיה לכם למשמרת עד ארבעה עשר יום
human_translation: As it is taught ben Bag Bag says: From where the daily offering requires inspection four days prior to slaughter? The verse states “You shall observe [ tishmeru ] to sacrifice to Me in its due season” and elsewhere, states: and you shall keep it [ mishmeret ] until the fourteenth day
llm_translation: As it was taught: Ben Bag Bag says, "From where do we derive that the continual offering requires inspection for four days prior to slaughter?" The verse states (Numbers 28:2), "You shall be careful to offer to Me at its appointed time." And elsewhere it says (Exodus 12:6), "And it shall be for you to keep until the fourteenth day."

hebrew_text: מה להלן טעון ביקור ארבעה ימים קודם שחיטה אף כאן טעון ביקור ארבעה ימים קודם שחיטה
human_translation: just as there, requires inspection four days prior to slaughter, so too here, requires inspection four days prior to slaughter.
llm_translation: What is required there with regard to inspection four days before slaughter, so too here is required inspection four days before slaughter.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי הני ששה שבעה הוו דהא איכא דצפרא דתלתא בשבתא
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: these six be seven, as there is of the morning of the third of the week,
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: These six and seven were, for there is a bird of three on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: ולטעמיך תמניא הוו דהאיכא דפניא דמעלי שבתא
human_translation: According to your reasoning it is eight; as there is of the afternoon of Shabbat eve
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, there are eight, for there is a face of those who ascend the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: הא לא קשיא דלבתר דאקריב קאמר
human_translation: That not difficult, is saying that after he sacrificed
llm_translation: This is not difficult, for after the fact of offering, he said.

hebrew_text: מ"מ שבעה הוו אלא תנא בעלמא קאי ומאי כדי לשבת וב' ימים טובים של ר"ה סימנא בעלמא
human_translation: In any case, is seven? Rather, the tanna is generally, And what Sufficient for Shabbat and for the two festival days of Rosh HaShana? merely a mnemonic,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "מ"מ שבעה הוו אלא תנא בעלמא קאי ומאי כדי לשבת וב' ימים טובים של ר"ה סימנא בעלמא" English translation: "From where do we know seven days? Rather, it is a general teaching. And what is the reason? In order to sit. And the two festive days of Rosh Hashanah are a general sign."

hebrew_text: דיקא נמי דקתני כדי לשבת ולא קתני לשבת ולב' ימים טובים של ר"ה ש"מ:
human_translation: is also precise, as teaches: Sufficient for Shabbat and it does not teach for Shabbat and for the two festival days of Rosh HaShana, learn from
llm_translation: Precisely also that it teaches "enough for Shabbat" and it does not teach "for Shabbat and for the two days of Rosh Hashanah," infer from this:

hebrew_text: לא הקריבו כבש בבוקר וכו' אמר ר"ש וכולה היתה קריבה בין הערבים שאין מחנכין את מזבח הזהב אלא בקטרת הסמים: חינוך מאן דכר שמיה
human_translation: did not sacrifice a lamb in the morning Rabbi Shimon said: And the entire was sacrificed in the afternoon, as golden altar is initiated only with the incense of the spices Who mentioned anything about initiation
llm_translation: They did not bring a lamb in the morning, etc. Rabbi Shimon said: And the entire offering was brought between the evenings, for they do not inaugurate the golden altar except with the incense of spices. Who is the one who mentioned his name?

hebrew_text: חסורי מיחסרא והכי קתני לא הקריבו כבש בבקר לא יקריבו בין הערבים במה דברים אמורים שלא נתחנך המזבח אבל נתחנך המזבח יקריבו בין הערבים
human_translation: is incomplete, and this is it is teaching: they did not sacrifice a lamb in the morning, they should not sacrifice the afternoon. In what is this statement said? where altar had not been initiated, But the altar had been initiated, they should sacrifice the afternoon
llm_translation: Deficiencies of lineage, and thus it teaches: "They did not offer a lamb in the morning, they shall not offer in the evenings." What are we speaking about? That the altar was not cleansed. But if the altar was cleansed, they shall offer in the evenings.

hebrew_text: אר"ש אימתי בזמן שהיו אנוסין או שוגגין אבל אם היו מזידין לא הקריבו כבש בבקר לא יקריבו בין הערבים לא הקטירו קטרת בבקר יקטירו בין הערבים
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: When at a time when they were circumstances beyond their control or unwittingly. But if intentionally and did not sacrifice a lamb in the morning they should not sacrifice in the afternoon they did not burn incense in the morning, they should burn in the afternoon
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: When were they the priests compelled or mistaken, but if they were intentional, they did not offer a lamb in the morning; they shall not offer incense between the evenings, they shall offer incense in the morning.

hebrew_text: מנא הני מילי דת"ר (שמות כט, לט) ואת הכבש השני תעשה בין הערבים שני בין הערבים ולא ראשון בין הערבים
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught and the second lamb you shall offer in the afternoon” the second in the afternoon, but the first not in the afternoon.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "From where are these matters derived by the Sages? (Exodus 29:39) 'And the second lamb you shall offer in the afternoon; you shall offer it with the same meal offering as the morning offering, and its libation, you shall offer it as an offering made by fire, a satisfying aroma to the Lord.'"

hebrew_text: במד"א שלא נתחנך המזבח אבל נתחנך המזבח אפילו ראשון בין הערבים
human_translation: In what is this statement said? where altar had not been initiated, But the altar had been initiated, even the first in the afternoon.
llm_translation: In tractate Middot, if the altar was not consecrated, but if the altar was consecrated, even the first sacrifice may be offered between the evenings.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ש אימתי בזמן שהיו אנוסין או שוגגין אבל אם היו מזידין לא הקריבו כבש בבקר לא יקריבו בין הערבים לא הקטירו קטרת בבוקר יקטירו בין הערבים
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: When at a time when they were circumstances beyond their control or unwittingly. But if intentionally and did not sacrifice a lamb in the morning they should not sacrifice in the afternoon they did not burn incense in the morning, they should burn in the afternoon
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: When were they the people coerced or mistaken, but if they were intentional, they did not bring a lamb in the morning, they shall not offer it between the evenings, they did not burn incense in the morning, they shall burn it between the evenings.

hebrew_text: וכי כהנים חטאו מזבח בטל אמר רבא ה"ק לא יקריבו הן אבל אחרים יקריבו
human_translation: because the priests sinned the altar idle? Rava said this is saying: They, should not sacrifice but other should sacrifice
llm_translation: And when the priests sinned, the altar was nullified. Rava said: What is the meaning of this? They themselves should not offer sacrifices, but others should offer sacrifices.

hebrew_text: לא הקטירו קטרת בבקר יקטירו בין הערבים דכיון דלא שכיחא ומעתרא חביבא להו ולא פשעי:
human_translation: did not burn incense in the morning, may burn afternoon. that since is uncommon and causes wealthy, dear to the and they will not be negligent
llm_translation: They did not burn the incense in the morning; they shall burn it between the evenings, for it is not common, and the surplus is precious to them, and they did not transgress.

hebrew_text: אמר ר"ש וכולה היתה קריבה בין הערבים שאין מחנכין את מזבח הזהב אלא בקטרת הסמים של בין הערבים וכו': והתניא בקטרת הסמים של שחר תנאי היא
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said: And the entire was sacrificed in the afternoon. that golden altar is initiated only with the incense of the spices of the afternoon, But isn’t it taught with the incense of the spices of the morning? is tanna’im .
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon, "And all of it was close among the Arabs that they do not anoint the golden altar except with the incense of the Arabs, etc." And it was taught: "The incense of the morning is a dispute."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מסתברא כמ"ד בקטרת הסמים של בין הערבים דכתיב (שמות ל, ז) בבקר בבקר בהיטיבו את הנרות יקטירנה
human_translation: Abaye said: stands to reason in accordance with the one who says with the incense of the spices of the afternoon, as it is written every morning, when he dresses the lamps, he shall burn it.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: It is logical as the opinion of Rabbi Meir regarding the incense of the spices of the evening, as it is written (Exodus 30:7), "When he tends the lamps, he shall burn it."

hebrew_text: אי לאו דעבד הדלקה מאורתא הטבה בצפרא מהיכא
human_translation: if not performed the lighting evening, from where removed in the morning?
llm_translation: If not, that he did kindling, a lamp, he immersed, in a bird, from where?

hebrew_text: ולמ"ד בקטרת הסמים של שחר גמר ממזבח העולה מה להלן בתמיד של שחר אף כאן בקטרת הסמים של שחר:
human_translation: And according to the one who says with the incense of the spices of the morning, derives from the altar of the burnt offering. Just as there, by daily offering of the morning so too here, by the incense of the spices of the morning.
llm_translation: And according to the one who learns the opinion in the incense of spices of dawn, it is completed from the altar of the burnt offering. Just as there in the case of the daily offering of dawn, so too here in the case of the incense of spices of dawn.

hebrew_text: ולא את השלחן אלא בלחם הפנים בשבת: אלא בחול איחנוכי הוא דלא מחנך הא קדושי מיקדיש
human_translation: And Table only with the shewbread on Shabbat. But on a weekday it is is not initiated, but is sanctified?
llm_translation: And not the table, rather with the showbread on Shabbat; rather on a weekday is it dedicated, for one does not dedicate holy items.

hebrew_text: היא גופה קמ"ל דחינוך וקידוש דשלחן בשבת הוא כדקתני סיפא ולא את המנורה אלא בשבעה נרותיה בין הערבים:
human_translation: teaches us this itself, that the initiation and the sanctification of the Table on Shabbat. as teaches the latter clause And Candelabrum only with of its seven lamps in the afternoon.
llm_translation: It is its body - it teaches that education and sanctification of the table on Shabbat is as the latter clause teaches, "and not the menorah, but with its seven lamps, between the evenings."

hebrew_text: ת"ר זהו קטרת שעלתה ליחיד על מזבח החיצון והוראת שעה היתה היכא אמר רב פפא בנשיאים
human_translation: The Sages taught This is incense that was offered for an individual on the external altar, and this was a provisional edict, what Rav Pappa said: by the princes
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: This is the incense that the individual offered on the outer altar, and it was a temporary ruling. Where was it said? Rav Papa said: In the Book of Numbers.

hebrew_text: אלא יחיד על מזבח החיצון הוא דלא הא על מזבח הפנימי מקריב ותו על מזבח החיצון יחיד הוא דלא הא ציבור מקרבו
human_translation: But an individual, is it on the external altar that not but may sacrifice on the inner altar, And furthermore, on the external altar, is it individual who may not but the community may sacrifice
llm_translation: Rather, an individual offering on the outer altar he is, for not on the inner altar does he bring. And furthermore, on the outer altar he is an individual, for not the public brings it.

hebrew_text: והתניא יכול יהא יחיד מתנדב ומביא כיוצא בה נדבה וקורא אני בה (דברים כג, כד) מוצא שפתיך תשמר ועשית ת"ל (שמות ל, ט) לא תעלו עליו קטרת זרה
human_translation: But isn’t it taught might an individual may voluntarily donate and bring similar to a gift and I read with regard to “That which has gone out of your lips you shall observe and do” the verse states “You shall bring no strange incense thereon”
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: One might have thought that an individual may volunteer and bring an offering similar to a voluntary offering, and the verse states regarding it (Deuteronomy 23:24), "You shall keep and perform," to teach us (Exodus 30:9), "You shall not offer strange incense upon it."

hebrew_text: יכול לא יהא יחיד מביא שאין מביא חובתו כיוצא בה
human_translation: might an individual may not bring as does not bring his obligatory similar to this
llm_translation: It is possible that an individual should not bring, he does not bring his obligation as it is.

hebrew_text: אבל צבור יהא מביא שמביא חובה כיוצא בה ת"ל (שמות ל, ט) לא תעלו
human_translation: but a community may bring as does bring its obligatory similar to this, the verse states: You shall not bring [ lo ta’alu ]
llm_translation: But the congregation should bring what is brought as an obligation, as it is stated (Exodus 30:9), "You shall not offer."

hebrew_text: יכול לא יעלו על מזבח הפנימי אבל יעלו על מזבח החיצון ת"ל (שמות לא, יא) את שמן המשחה ואת קטרת הסמים לקודש ככל אשר צויתיך יעשו אין לך אלא מה שאמור בענין
human_translation: might may not bring on the inner altar, but may bring on the external altar. the verse states: “And the anointing oil, and the incense of sweet spices for the sacred place; according to all that I have commanded you shall they do” has only that which is stated with regard to the matter,
llm_translation: One might have thought they may not ascend upon the inner altar, but they may ascend upon the outer altar. It is stated (Exodus 31:11), "The anointing oil and the incense of sweet spices for the holy place; according to all that I have commanded you they shall do." You have nothing else except what is stated in this matter.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא לא מיבעיא קאמר לא מיבעיא ציבור על מזבח החיצון דלא אשכחן ולא מיבעיא יחיד על מזבח הפנימי דלא אשכחן אלא אפילו יחיד על מזבח החיצון דאשכחן בנשיאים הוראת שעה היתה:
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: is speaking It is not necessary, It is not necessary the community on the external altar, as we have not found And it is not necessary an individual on the inner altar, as we have not found But even an individual on the external altar, that we have found in the princes; was a provisional edict
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: It is not necessary - he means, it is not necessary for the congregation on the outer altar, for we do not find it, and it is not necessary for an individual on the inner altar, for we do not find it. Rather, even an individual on the outer altar, for we find it in the princes - it was a temporary ruling.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חביתי כ"ג לא היו באין חצאין אלא מביא עשרון שלם וחוצהו מקריב מחצה בבקר ומחצה בין הערבים
human_translation: griddle-cake of the High Priest did not come in halves. Rather, brings a complete tenth and divides it sacrifices half in the morning and half in the afternoon.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A barrel of wine, if it contained twenty-three, they would not bring the half-shekel, but rather bring a whole shekel and take out half of it, offering half in the morning and half between the evenings.

hebrew_text: כהן שמביא מחצה שחרית ומת ומינו כהן אחר תחתיו לא יביא חצי עשרון מביתו וחצי עשרונו של ראשון אלא מביא עשרון שלם (מחצה) וחוצהו מקריב מחצה ומחצה אבד נמצאו שני חצאין קריבין ושני חצאין אובדין:
human_translation: Priest who brings half in the morning and dies, and they appointed another Priest in his stead, should neither bring half of a tenth from his house nor half of tenth of an ephah of predecessor. Rather, he brings an entire tenth and divides it sacrifices half, and half is lost. Consequently, two halves are sacrificed, and two halves are lost.
llm_translation: A priest who brings half a handful of the morning offering and dies, and his replacement priest may not bring half a tenth from his own house and half a tenth from the first priest, but must bring a whole tenth (half) and separate it, offering half and half. If one half is lost, two halves are found, one is offered and one is lost.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר אילו נאמר מנחה מחצית הייתי אומר מביא חצי עשרון מביתו שחרית ומקריב חצי עשרון מביתו ערבית ומקריב
human_translation: the Sages taught If stated: A meal offering half I would have said brings half of a tenth in the morning and sacrifices half of a tenth in the afternoon and sacrifices
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: If it had only said "minchah," I would have said that one brings half a tenth from his house in the morning and offers half a tenth from his house in the evening.

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא ו, יג) מחציתה בבקר ומחציתה בערב מחצה משלם הוא מקריב הא כיצד מביא עשרון שלם וחוצהו ומקריב מחצה בבקר ומחצה בין הערבים
human_translation: the verse states: “Half of it in the morning, and half of it in the evening” he sacrifices half of a complete How so? brings a complete tenth and divides it and sacrifices half in the morning and half in the afternoon.
llm_translation: The text states: "It teaches (Leviticus 6:13), 'Half of it in the morning and half of it in the evening.' It is half complete; he brings it. How so? He brings a whole tenth and divides it, and he offers half in the morning and half between the evenings."

hebrew_text: נטמא מחצה של בין הערבים או שאבד יכול יביא חצי עשרון מביתו ערבית ויקריב ת"ל מחציתה בבקר ומחציתה בערב מחצה משלם הוא מביא
human_translation: half of the afternoon became impure or was lost might he should bring half of a tenth from his house and sacrifice the verse states: “Half of it in the morning, and half of it in the evening,” he brings half of a complete
llm_translation: He became impure half of between the evenings or he got lost, can he bring half a tenth from his house, an evening one, and offer? It is stated: "Half of it in the morning and half of it in the evening" - he brings half.

hebrew_text: הא כיצד מביא עשרון שלם [מביתו] וחוצהו ומקריב מחצה ומחצה אבד נמצאו שני חצאין קריבין ושני חצאין אובדין
human_translation: How so? brings a complete tenth from his house and divides it and he sacrifices half, and half is lost. Consequently, two halves are sacrificed, and two halves are lost.
llm_translation: This is how one brings a whole tithe from his house and takes it outside, and offers half of it, and half of it is lost: two halves are brought and two halves are lost.

hebrew_text: כ"ג שהקריב מחצה שחרית ומת ומינו אחר תחתיו יכול יביא חצי עשרון מביתו או חצי עשרונו של ראשון ת"ל ומחציתה בערב מחצה משלם הוא מביא ומקריב
human_translation: Priest who sacrificed half in the morning and died, and they appointed another Priest in his stead, might should bring half of a tenth from his house or half of a tenth of the first the verse states: “And half of it in the evening,” brings and sacrifices half of a complete
llm_translation: 23. When one brought a half-shekel in the morning and died, and his substitute came after him, one might have thought that he should bring a half-dinar from his own house or a half-dinar of the first one. It teaches: "And its half in the evening" - he brings and offers half of it.

hebrew_text: הא כיצד מביא עשרון שלם וחוצהו ומקריב ומחצה אבד נמצאו שני חצאין אובדין ושני חצאין קריבין:
human_translation: How so? brings a complete tenth from his house and divides it and he sacrifices and half is lost. Consequently, two halves are lost, and two halves are sacrificed.
llm_translation: This is how: one brings a whole tithe and divides it, and offers half. If it is lost, two halves are lost; and two halves are offered.

hebrew_text: תני תנא קמיה דר"נ מחצה ראשון ומחצה שני תעובר צורתן ויצאו לבית השריפה
human_translation: a tanna , taught before Rav Naḥman: the half first and the half second their form should decay, and brought out to the place for burning.
llm_translation: A Tanna taught before Rabbi Nehemiah: "Half of the first and half of the second day of Yom Tov, their form is nullified, and they are taken out to the place of burning."

hebrew_text: א"ל ר"נ בשלמא ראשון איחזי להקרבה אלא שני למה ליה עיבור צורה מעיקרא לאיבוד קא אתי
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said to Granted, first fit for sacrifice But second why it form decays? brought to be lost from the outset,
llm_translation: He said to him, "Rabbi Nechemiah, granted that the first offering is fit for bringing near, but the second one, why does it come to be lost from the outset?"

hebrew_text: דאמר לך מני תנא דבי רבה בר אבוה הוא דאמר אפילו פיגול טעון עיבור צורה
human_translation: Who is who said to you? It was the tanna of the school of Rabba bar Avuh, who says: even piggul , require decay of form
llm_translation: He said to you, from the teaching of the school of Rabba bar Avuha, he said, even Pigul requires the formation of the fetus.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר אפילו תימא רבנן כיון דבעידנא דפלגי בהו אי בעי האי מקריב ואי בעי האי מקריב מיחזא חזו:
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: even you say the Rabbis since at the time when divides the if he wants sacrifice this and if he wants sacrifice that fit
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Even if you say they are only scholars, since I am involved in their dispute, if this one wants to bring an offering and that one wants to bring an offering, let them both see.

hebrew_text: איתמר חביתי כהן גדול כיצד עושין אותן רבי חייא בר אבא א"ר יוחנן אופה ואח"כ מטגנה רבי אסי א"ר חנינא מטגנה ואח"כ אופה
human_translation: was stated How are the griddle-cake the High Priest prepared? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba Rabbi Yoḥanan says bakes it and afterward he fries it Rabbi Asi Rabbi Ḥanina says fries it and afterward he bakes
llm_translation: It was stated: The High Priest's barrel, how do they make it? Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They bake it first, and then they fry it. Rabbi Assi said in the name of Chanina: They fry it first, and then they bake it.

hebrew_text: א"ר חייא בר אבא כוותיה דידי מסתברא תופיני תאפינה נאה רבי אסי אמר כוותיה דידי מסתברא תופיני תאפינה נא
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said: It stands to reason in accordance with my baked pieces [ tufinei ] they shall be baked beautiful [ te’afena na’a ], Rabbi Asi said: It stands to reason in accordance with my they shall be baked partially cooked [ te’afena na ],
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba, according to his reasoning, "Tofini Ta'afina" is beautiful. Rabbi Asi said, according to his reasoning, "Tofini Ta'afina" is beautiful.

hebrew_text: כתנאי (ויקרא ו, יד) תופיני תאפינה נא רבי אומר תאפינה נאה רבי יוסי אומר תאפינה רבה אית ליה נא ואית ליה נאה
human_translation: parallel to tanna’im they shall be baked partially cooked [ te’afena na ]. Rabbi says: they shall be baked beautiful [ te’afena na’a ]. Rabbi Yosei says: should be baked extensively, accepts partially cooked, and he accepts beautiful.
llm_translation: Disputes: (Leviticus 6:14) "He shall bake it well." Rabbi says: "Well baked." Rabbi Yosei says: "Baked well." He finds it fitting and he finds it beautiful.

hebrew_text: תנן התם חביתי כ"ג לישתן ועריכתן ואפייתן בפנים ודוחות את השבת
human_translation: We learned elsewhere the High Priest’s griddle-cake their kneading, and forming of their and their baking are inside and override Shabbat.
llm_translation: We have learned there: My barrel, twenty-three, to drink, and their arrangement, and baking, inside, and they push aside the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: מנא ה"מ אמר רב הונא תופיני תאפינה נאה ואי אפי לה מאתמול אינשפה לה מתקיף לה רב יוסף אימא דכביש ליה בירקא
human_translation: From where is this matter, Rav Huna said: tufinei , baked it must be beautiful [ te’afena na’a ]. And if bake it yesterday, it swollen [ inshefa ] Rav Yosef objects to this: say that covered with greens
llm_translation: From where do we derive this? Rav Huna said: "A beautiful oven bakes well, and if one bakes in it from yesterday, it is beneficial for it." Rav Yosef objected to him: "Say, perhaps he paved it with vegetables."

hebrew_text: דבי ר' ישמעאל תנא תעשה ואפילו בשבת תעשה ואפילו בטומאה
human_translation: the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: shall be made even on Shabbat. “shall be made” even in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: "You shall do" - even on Shabbat, "You shall do" - even in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: אביי אמר אמר קרא (ויקרא ו, יג) סלת מנחה תמיד
human_translation: Abaye said verse states: “Fine flour for a meal offering perpetually”
llm_translation: Abbaye said: The verse says, "Fine flour for a regular meal offering" (Leviticus 6:13).

hebrew_text: הרי היא כמנחת תמידין
human_translation: is like the meal offering of the daily offerings.
llm_translation: Behold, she is like the Minchat Tamidin.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר (ויקרא ו, יד) על מחבת מלמד שטעונה כלי ואי אפי לה מאתמול איפסיל ליה בלינה תניא כוותיה דרבא על מחבת מלמד שטעונה כלי
human_translation: Rava said “On a griddle” teaches that requires a vessel. if he had baked it the previous day disqualified by left overnight, is taught in accordance with of Rava: “On a griddle” teaches that requires a vessel.
llm_translation: Rava said (Leviticus 6:14), "On a pan, teaches that it requires a vessel, and if one bakes on it from yesterday, it invalidates it through overnight cooling." It was taught in accordance with Rava's opinion: "On a pan, teaches that it requires a vessel."

hebrew_text: בשמן להוסיף לה שמן ואיני יודע כמה
human_translation: with the oil.” to add oil to it, I do not know how much
llm_translation: In oil to add to her oil, and I do not know how much.

hebrew_text: הריני דן נאמר כאן שמן ונאמר להלן במנחת נסכים שמן מה להלן שלשת לוגין לעשרון אף כאן שלשת לוגין לעשרון
human_translation: I deduce It is stated here, “Oil,” and it is stated there, with regard to the meal offering libations oil” Just as there, three log per tenth so too here, three log per tenth
llm_translation: Behold, I judge: it is stated here "oil," and it is stated there in the meal offering of libations "oil." Just as there (it is) three log for a tenth (of an ephah), so too here (it is) three log for a tenth (of an ephah).

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו נאמר כאן שמן ונאמר במנחת נדבה שמן מה להלן לוג אחד אף כאן לוג אחד
human_translation: Or go this way: It is stated here, “Oil,” and it is stated with regard to voluntary meal offering: oil Just as there, one log so too here, one log
llm_translation: Or "all your meal-offering" (Leviticus 2:14) is stated here regarding oil, and it is stated in the meal-offering of a voluntary offering, "oil." Just as there, a log, so too here, a log.

hebrew_text: נראה למי דומה דנין תבש"ט מתבש"ט תדיר (באה חובה) דוחה שבת דוחה טומאה
human_translation: Let us see to which it is similar, we derive tav , beit , shin , tet , from tav , beit , shin , tet . frequent [ tadir ], brought [ ba’ah ] as an obligation; override Shabbat; override impurity [ tuma ].
llm_translation: It appears to whom is it similar? That a case of a "tevash" to a "tevash" is frequent (a common occurrence), it overrides the Sabbath, it overrides impurity.

hebrew_text: ואין דנין תבש"ט משאינו תבש"ט
human_translation: And we should not derive tav , beit , shin , tet , from does not tav , beit , shin , tet .
llm_translation: And we do not judge a tavash"t from when it is not a tavash"t.

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו דנין יגי"ל מיגי"ל יחיד בגלל עצמה (יין) לבונה
human_translation: Or go this way: We derive yod , gimmel , yod , lamed , from yod , gimmel , yod , lamed , an individual [ yaḥid ]; brought for [ biglal ] its own sake, wine [ yayin ] frankincense [ levona ].
llm_translation: Or, all of it for this way, we judge Yagil from Yagil, an individual on its own (wine) for its own sake.

hebrew_text: ואין דנין יגי"ל משאינו יגי"ל
human_translation: And we should not derive yod , gimmel , yod , lamed , from which does not yod , gimmel , yod , lamed .
llm_translation: And we do not judge Yagiel from when he is not Yagiel.

hebrew_text: רבי ישמעאל בנו של רבי יוחנן בן ברוקה אומר (ויקרא ו, יג) סלת מנחה תמיד הרי היא לך כמנחת תמידין מה מנחת תמידין ג' לוגין לעשרון אף זו ג' לוגין לעשרון
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, says: fine flour for a meal offering perpetually [ tamid ], it is in the meal offering of the daily offerings [ temidin ]. Just as the meal offering of the daily offerings three log for tenth so too this three log for tenth
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka, says (Leviticus 6:13), "The fine flour offering shall be perpetual; it shall be like the meal offering of the continual offering." Just as the continual offerings are three log for the tenth part, so too this is three log for the tenth part.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר ריבה כאן שמן וריבה במנחת כבשים שמן מה להלן שלשת לוגין לעשרון אף כאן שלשת לוגין לעשרון
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: adds oil here, and adds oil there, meal offering sheep. Just as there, three log for tenth so too here, three log for tenth
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "Here it is multiplied by oil, and multiplied in the Minchat of lambs by oil. Just as there, three log for a tenth, so too here, three log for a tenth."

hebrew_text: או כלך לדרך זו ריבה כאן שמן וריבה במנחת פרים ואילים שמן מה להלן שני לוגין לעשרון אף כאן שני לוגין לעשרון
human_translation: Or go this way: adds oil here, adds oil the meal offering bulls and rams. Just as there, two log for tenth so too here, two log for tenth
llm_translation: Or, if he went on this road, he increased here oil, and he increased in the meal offering of bulls and rams oil. Just as there, two log for a tenth, so too here, two log for a tenth.

hebrew_text: נראה למי דומה דנין מנחה הבאה עשרון ממנחה הבאה בעשרון ואין דנין מנחה הבאה עשרון ממנחה הבאה ב' וג' עשרונים
human_translation: let us see to which it is similar, we derive a meal offering that comes a tenth from a meal offering that comes a tenth And we should not derive a meal offering that comes a tenth from a meal offering that comes two or three tenths
llm_translation: It appears to whom is it similar that we evaluate a meal-offering that comes with a tenth from a meal-offering that comes with a tenth, and we do not evaluate a meal-offering that comes with a tenth from a meal-offering that comes with two and three tenths.

hebrew_text: הא גופא קשיא אמרת בשמן להוסיף לה שמן והדר תני נאמר כאן שמן ונאמר במנחת נדבה שמן
human_translation: This itself difficult, you said “with the oil” to add oil, And then it teaches: It is stated here, “Oil,” and it is stated with regard to voluntary meal offering “oil.”
llm_translation: This itself is difficult: You said "with oil" to add oil to it, and then you taught: It is stated here "oil," and it is stated in the Minchat Nedavah "oil."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי מאן תנא בשמן להוסיף ר"ש היא (ואילו לא נאמר קאמר) ובדינא מאן קא מהדר רבי ישמעאל
human_translation: Abaye said: Who taught “with the oil” to add It is Rabbi Shimon, And is speaking If it were not stated. And who responds derivation Rabbi Yishmael.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Who is the Tanna that maintains the ruling regarding adding oil to the meal offering is according to Rabbi Shimon? It is Rabbi Shimon. And in the matter of law, who is the one who retracts? Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: רב הונא בריה דרב יהושע אמר כולה ר' ישמעאל בנו של ר' יוחנן בן ברוקה היא
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, said entire is Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka,
llm_translation: Rav Huna son of Rav Yehoshua said: The entire statement is attributed to Rabbi Yishmael, the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka.

hebrew_text: והכי קאמר בשמן להוסיף לה שמן דאי לקבוע שמן לא צריך כיון דכתיב בה (ויקרא ו, יד) על מחבת כמנחת מחבת דמיא
human_translation: And this he is saying: “with the oil” to add oil to it As, if to establish oil, not needed Since it is written with “On a griddle [ maḥavat ]” comparable to a pan [ maḥavat ] meal offering,
llm_translation: And so it says regarding oil, to add to it oil, for if it were to establish oil, it would not be necessary, since it is written in it (Leviticus 6:14), "Upon the pan it is made like a meal offering of a pan."

hebrew_text: או אינו אלא לקבוע לה שמן דאי לא כתב רחמנא בשמן ה"א תיהוי כמנחת חוטא
human_translation: Or to establish only oil, because if the Merciful One had not stated: “With the oil,” I would say: Let it be like meal offering of a sinner,
llm_translation: Or, rather, it is only to establish for it oil, for if not, the Merciful One did not write "with oil," it should be like a sin offering.

hebrew_text: הדר אמר תיהוי נמי לקבוע לה שמן תיתי מדינא ודן דינא ולא אתיא ליה ואצרכא קרא סולת מנחה תמיד כדמסיים רבי ישמעאל מילתיה
human_translation: then said: Let it even be to establish only it oil, arrive derivation But employ derivation he is unsuccessful, needed verse: “Fine flour for a meal offering perpetually [ tamid ]” as Rabbi Yishmael, concluded his statement
llm_translation: Returned, he said, "Let it also be established for her, I will give her oil as is appropriate, and judge the case, but she did not come, and the verse is necessary: 'Fine flour for a continual meal offering,' as Rabbi Yishmael concludes his statement."

hebrew_text: רבה אמר כולה ר"ש [ואילו לא נאמר קאמר]
human_translation: Rabba said entire is Rabbi Shimon, and is speaking If it were not stated.
llm_translation: Rabah said: The entire statement is Rabbi Shimon and if it were not said, he would be saying.

hebrew_text: וה"ק בשמן להוסיף לה שמן דאי לקבוע לה שמן לא צריך כיון דכתיב בה על מחבת כמחבת דמיא ועד שלא יאמר בשמן יש לי בדין
human_translation: And this is saying: “with the oil” to add oil to it. As, if to establish oil, not needed Since it is written with “On a griddle [ maḥavat ]” comparable to a pan [ maḥavat ] And if had not stated: “With the oil,” I have derivation
llm_translation: And the Gemara asks: with oil to add to it oil, for if it is necessary to establish it with oil, it is not necessary, since it is written about it, "on a griddle, it is like a griddle," until one does not say, "with oil I have it in judgment."

hebrew_text: ודן דינא לא אתיא ליה ואצרכא בשמן הדר אמר תיהוי כמנחת פרים ואילים
human_translation: But employ derivation he is unsuccessful, and “with the oil” is needed then said: Let be like the meal offering bulls and rams,
llm_translation: "And the judgment does not come to him, and the need is for oil. Haddar said, 'Let it be like the offering of bulls and rams.'"

hebrew_text: הדר אמר דנין
human_translation: then said: We derive
llm_translation: "Hadar amar dinin."

hebrew_text: מנחה הבאה עשרון וכו':
human_translation: a meal offering that comes a tenth
llm_translation: Mincha haba'ah asaron vekhu.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ לא מינו כהן אחר תחתיו משל מי היתה קריבה ר"ש אומר משל ציבור ר' יהודה אומר משל יורשין ושלימה היתה קריבה:
human_translation: they did not appoint another Priest in his stead, from whose was sacrificed? Rabbi Shimon says: from of the community. Rabbi Yehuda says: from of the heirs And was sacrificed a complete
llm_translation: Mishnah: A kohen who was not his original kind, who was his offering like? Rabbi Shimon says: Like a private individual. Rabbi Yehuda says: Like heirs, and it was valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ת"ר כ"ג שמת ולא מינו כהן אחר תחתיו מנין שתהא מנחתו קריבה משל יורשין ת"ל (ויקרא ו, טו) והכהן המשיח תחתיו מבניו יעשה אותה
human_translation: The Sages taught High Priest died and they did not appoint another Priest in his stead, from where that his meal offering should be sacrificed from of the heirs The verse states “And the anointed priest that shall be in his stead from among his sons shall offer it”
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: "If a Kohen Gadol dies, and not his designated successor, how do we know that his offering should be brought by his heirs? The verse states (Leviticus 6:15): 'And the anointed Kohen who is in his place from among his sons shall perform it.'"

hebrew_text: יכול יקריבנה חצאין ת"ל אותה כולה ולא חציה דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: might sacrifice it in halves the verse states “it,” all of and not half of it; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: Could he bring it as a half-offering? The verse teaches "it" in its entirety and not half of it. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: ר"ש אומר (ויקרא ו, יא) חק עולם משל עולם (ויקרא ו, טו) כליל תקטר שתהא כולה בהקטרה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: “It is a statute forever [ olam ] from of the world [ olam ], “It shall be wholly made to smoke that the entire should be sacrificed
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says (Leviticus 6:11) "a perpetual statute for all generations" (Leviticus 6:15) "the entire offering shall be offered up in smoke."

hebrew_text: והאי הכהן המשיח להכי הוא דאתא
human_translation: And did that “And the anointed priest come to this
llm_translation: And this is the anointed priest, therefore he came.

hebrew_text: האי מיבעי ליה לכדתניא (ויקרא ו, יג) זה קרבן אהרן ובניו אשר יקריבו לה' ביום המשח אותו יכול יהו אהרן ובניו מקריבין קרבן אחד ת"ל אשר יקריבו לה' אהרן בפני עצמו ובניו בפני עצמן בניו אלו כהנים הדיוטות
human_translation: That is needed for that which is taught “This is the offering of Aaron and of his sons, which they shall offer to the Lord in the day when he is anointed” might Aaron and his sons should sacrifice one offering. the verse states: “Which they shall offer to the Lord,” Aaron by himself and his sons by themselves “his sons,” these are the ordinary priests.
llm_translation: This requires for him as it was taught (Leviticus 6:13) "This is the offering of Aaron and his sons, which they shall offer to the Lord on the day he is anointed." Could it be that Aaron and his sons offer one offering? The verse states "which they shall offer to the Lord" - Aaron separately and his sons separately. His sons - these are the common priests.

hebrew_text: אתה אומר כהנים הדיוטות או אינו אלא כהנים גדולים כשהוא אומר והכהן המשיח תחתיו מבניו הרי כ"ג אמור הא מה אני מקיים בניו אלו כהנים הדיוטות
human_translation: Do you say ordinary priests, or is it only High Priests? When states “And the anointed priest that shall be in his stead from among his sons High Priest is thereby mentioned. How do I realize “his sons” These are the ordinary priests,
llm_translation: You say, "common priests," or is it rather "high priests"? When it says, "and the anointed priest in his place from among his sons," behold, so much is said. What then do I fulfill with his sons? These are the common priests.

hebrew_text: א"כ לכתוב קרא הכהן המשיח תחתיו בניו יעשה מאי מבניו שמעת מינה תרתי
human_translation: If so let the verse write: The anointed priest that shall be in his stead, his sons shall offer. What “From among Learn from two
llm_translation: "So to write, a verse: 'The anointed priest, his sons shall serve in his place.' What is meant by 'his sons'? Learn from it two things."

hebrew_text: ור"ש האי אותה מאי עביד ליה מיבעי ליה לכ"ג שמת ומינו אחר תחתיו שלא יביא חצי עשרון מביתו ולא חצי עשרון של ראשון
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Shimon, do that “it,” He requires to a High Priest who died and they appointed another in his stead, should neither bring half of a tenth from his house nor half of the tenth of an ephah of the first
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon Ha'ei, what does he do with that? He needs it for the case of "Shamet" and "Mino" after him, so that he does not bring half a shekel from his house, nor the half shekel of the first.

hebrew_text: ותיפוק ליה מן ומחציתה וי"ו לא דריש
human_translation: Let him derive from “And half of it” he does not expound vav
llm_translation: And it shall be derived from it and half of it, and the letter "vav" is not expounded.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה האי חק עולם מאי עביד ליה חוקה לעולם תהא
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Yehuda, do that “It is a statute forever statute is to forever.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda: "This statute of the world, what does it do for him? Let it be an eternal statute."

hebrew_text: כליל תקטר למה לי מיבעי ליה לכדתניא אין לי אלא עליונה מנחת כ"ג בכליל תקטר ותחתונה מנחת כהן הדיוט בלא תאכל
human_translation: why do I “It shall be wholly made to smoke”? He requires it for that which is taught I have only meal offering of the High Priest above is in “It shall be wholly made to smoke” and meal offering ordinary priest below is in “It shall not be eaten”
llm_translation: "Kilayim tekater, why do I need it? It is necessary for him, as it was taught: 'I have only the upper one, a meal-offering of twenty-three, in kilayim tekater, and the lower one, a meal-offering of a common priest, without eating.'"

hebrew_text: מנין ליתן את האמור של זה בזה ואת האמור של זה בזה ת"ל כליל כליל לגזירה שוה נאמר כאן כליל ונאמר להלן כליל
human_translation: From where to apply what is said about that to this and about this to that The verse states “Wholly,” “wholly” to a verbal analogy: It is stated here, “Wholly” and it is stated there, “Wholly”
llm_translation: From where do we derive to attribute the statement of this one to that one, and the statement of that one to this one? It is taught: "completely complete" is stated for the purpose of equating the two statements through a verbal analogy. It is stated here "complete," and it is stated there "complete."

hebrew_text: מה כאן בכליל תקטר אף להלן בכליל תקטר ומה להלן ליתן לא תעשה על אכילתו אף כאן ליתן לא תעשה על אכילתה
human_translation: Just as here, in “It shall be wholly made to smoke,” so too there, in It shall be wholly made to smoke. And just as there, to place a prohibition on its consumption, so too here, to place a prohibition on its consumption.
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: "What here in a censer shall burn, so too there in a censer shall burn. And what there it says 'do not offer upon its eating,' so too here it says 'do not offer upon its eating.'"

hebrew_text: וסבר ר"ש משל ציבור דאורייתא
human_translation: And does Rabbi Shimon hold from of the community is by Torah law,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon holds the opinion of the public is like the Torah.

hebrew_text: והתנן אר"ש שבעה דברים התקינו ב"ד וזה אחד מהן עובד כוכבים ששלח עולתו ממדינת הים שלח עמה נסכים קריבה משלו ואם לאו קריבין משל ציבור
human_translation: But didn’t we learn Rabbi Shimon said: The court instituted seven ordinances and this is one of them. a gentile who sent his burnt offering from a country overseas, he sent with it libations are sacrificed at his And if not sacrificed at the public’s
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon says, the court instituted seven things, and this is one of them - a non-Jew who sent his burnt offering from overseas, he should send with it libations close by his own, and if not, the community's offerings are brought close.

hebrew_text: וכן גר שמת והניח זבחים יש לו נסכים קריבין משלו ואם לאו קריבין משל ציבור
human_translation: And similarly, a convert who died and left offerings, if he has the libations, are sacrificed from his And if not are sacrificed from public
llm_translation: And so too, a convert who died and left sacrifices, he has libations brought from his own, and if not, libations brought from the community.

hebrew_text: ותנאי ב"ד הוא כ"ג שמת ולא מינו כהן אחר תחתיו שתהא מנחתו קריבה משל ציבור
human_translation: And It is a stipulation of the court a High Priest who died, and they did not appoint another Priest in his stead, that his meal offering sacrificed from public
llm_translation: "And it is a Tannaic dispute in the Beit Din, that he (the High Priest) died and not his substitute priest beneath him, that his offering should be brought near as that of the public."

hebrew_text: א"ר אבהו שני תקנות הוו
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said were two ordinances
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu said: There were two enactments.

hebrew_text: דאורייתא מדציבור כיון דחזו דקא מידחקא לישכה תקינו דלגבי מיורשים כיון דחזו דקא פשעי בה אוקמוה אדאורייתא
human_translation: by Torah law, from public Once they saw that the chamber depleted, instituted that should be collected from the heirs. Once they saw that were negligent in they established it in accordance with by Torah law,
llm_translation: The Torah from the public, once they saw that it was being pushed to the side, they established that regarding inheritors, once they saw that it was being violated, they established it as Torah.

hebrew_text: ועל פרה שלא יהא מועלין באפרה דאורייתא היא דתניא (במדבר יט, ט) חטא' היא מלמ' שמועלין בה היא בה מועלין
human_translation: And with regard to the heifer that one is not for misusing from its ashes. it is by Torah law? As it is taught “It is a sin offering” teaches one misusing it. “It it, misusing
llm_translation: And regarding a cow that one should not be treacherous in its ashes, for it is a biblical prohibition as it was taught (Numbers 19:9), "It is a sin to be treacherous in it," it is in it that one is treacherous.

hebrew_text: באפרה אין מועלין
human_translation: from its ashes, one is not misusing
llm_translation: In the cow, one does not perform a ritual circumcision.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי שתי תקנות הואי דאורייתא בה מועלין באפרה אין מועלין כיון דחזו דקא מזלזלי בה וקא עבדי מיניה למכתן גזרו ביה מעילה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said there were two ordinances By Torah law, it, misusing from its ashes misusing Once saw that were treating disrespectfully, and making for their wounds from it, they decreed misuse
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: There are two enactments that are of biblical origin. With regard to one, we may be negligent, but with regard to the other, we may not be negligent. Once they saw that people were treating it lightly and were making a mockery of it, they decreed upon it the penalty of lashes.

hebrew_text: כיון דחזו דקא פרשי מספק הזאות אוקמוה אדאורייתא:
human_translation: Once they saw that were refraining from uncertainty sprinkling, they established it in accordance with by Torah law,
llm_translation: Since they saw that he was spreading false reports, they established him as a witness.

hebrew_text: ת"ר פר העלם דבר של ציבור ושעירי עבודת כוכבים בתחילה מגבין להן דברי ר' יהודה ר"ש אומר מתרומת הלשכה הן באין
human_translation: The Sages taught bull for an unwitting communal sin, or the goats idol worship a new collection for them. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: come from the collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: A bull that is hidden away, an item of communal property, and the he-goats of idol worship, initially one collects for them according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda; Rabbi Shimon says: They come from the contribution of the Chamber.

hebrew_text: והתניא איפכא הי מינייהו אחריתא
human_translation: But isn’t it taught the opposite, Which of the later
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: "He reversed their types in the end."

hebrew_text: אמרוה רבנן קמיה דרב אשי לימא קמייתא אחריתא דשמעינן ליה לר"ש דחייש לפשיעה
human_translation: The Sages said before Rav Ashi: Let say the first is the later as we have heard that Rabbi Shimon is concerned about negligence.
llm_translation: The sages said before Rav Ashi: Let us say the first and last thing we heard from Rabbi Shimon, who is concerned about transgression.

hebrew_text: אמר להו רב אשי אפי' תימא בתרייתא אחריתא כי קא חייש ר"ש לפשיעה במילתא דלית בהו כפרה בגווה במילתא דאית להו כפרה בגווה לא חייש ר"ש לפשיעה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to You even say the latter is the later When Rabbi Shimon is concerned about negligence, a matter that does not provide them with atonement, Rabbi Shimon is not concerned about negligence with regard to a matter that does provide them with atonement,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to them: Even if you say in the last Tosefta, when Rabbi Shimon is concerned about a transgression in a matter that does not have atonement in the body, in a matter that has atonement in the body, Rabbi Shimon is not concerned about a transgression.

hebrew_text: מאי הוי עלה
human_translation: What was about it;
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "הוי עלה"?

hebrew_text: א"ל רבה זוטי לרב אשי ת"ש דתניא (במדבר כח, ב) את קרבני לחמי לאשי ריח ניחוחי תשמרו להקריב לי במועדו לרבות פר העלם דבר של ציבור ושעירי עבודת כוכבים שבאין מתרומת הלשכה דברי ר"ש:
human_translation: Rabba Zuti said to Rav Ashi: Come hear as it is taught My food that is presented to Me for offerings made by fire, of a pleasing aroma to Me, you shall observe to sacrifice to Me in its due season” to include bull for an unwitting communal sin and the goats of idol worship. that come from the collection of the chamber; the statement of Rabbi Shimon.
llm_translation: Rabba Zuti said to Rav Ashi: "Come and hear, as it was taught (Numbers 28:2): 'Command the children of Israel, and say to them: My offering, My bread for My offerings made by fire as a sweet aroma to Me, you shall be careful to offer to Me at its appointed time,' to include the bull of communal sin-offering and the goats of idol worship that come from the contribution of the chamber." These are the words of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: ושלימה היתה קריבה וכו': א"ר חייא בר אבא בעי רבי יוחנן שלימה שחרית ושלימה בין הערבים או דילמא שלימה שחרית ובטילה בין הערבים
human_translation: And was sacrificed a complete Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a dilemma: a complete morning and complete in the afternoon, Or perhaps a complete morning and canceled in the afternoon?
llm_translation: And Shelamah was close, etc. Said R. Chiya bar Abba, Rabbi Yochanan inquired: Is Shelamah in the morning complete, and Shelamah in the evening incomplete, or perhaps Shelamah in the morning complete and nullified in the evening.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ת"ש שמיני בחביתים ואם איתא דבטילה בין הערבים הא זמנין דלא משכח ליה שמיני בחביתים ה"ד דמת כ"ג ולא מינו אחר תחתיו
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear eighth the griddle-cake And if it were so that canceled in the afternoon, sometimes not find the eighth the griddle-cake What are the circumstances where the High Priest died and they did not appoint another in his stead.
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear! The eighth day in barrels. And if it is said that it is nullified among the mixed species, these are the times when he does not find the eighth day in barrels. This is only when he died at the age of twenty-three and did not have a son after him.

hebrew_text: אמרוה רבנן קמיה דרבי ירמיה אמר בבלאי טפשאי משום דיתבו באתרא דחשוכא אמרי שמעתתא דמחשכן
human_translation: The Sages stated before Rabbi Yirmeya. said: foolish Babylonians, because they dwell in dark land, they state halakhot that are dark,
llm_translation: The sages said before Rabbi Yirmeya: The Babylonians are foolish because they sit in a place of darkness. They said: The darkness darkens their minds.

hebrew_text: אלא דקתני שביעי בסלת תשיעי ביין ה"נ דלא בטלי
human_translation: Rather, that teaches: seventh the fine flour the ninth the wine also that they are never canceled?
llm_translation: Rather, for it was taught: the seventh year with regard to wheat, the ninth year with regard to wine, so too is it that they are not nullified.

hebrew_text: (במדבר כט, יח) מנחתם ונסכיהם בלילה מנחתם ונסכיהם אפילו למחר
human_translation: “Their meal offering and their libations” at night, “their meal offering and their libations” the next day
llm_translation: "Their meal offering and their drink offerings for the night, their meal offering and their drink offerings even for tomorrow." (Numbers 29:18)

hebrew_text: אלא דאי לא קתני ה"נ דאי לא קתני
human_translation: Rather, does not teach what if, So too does not teach what if
llm_translation: Rather, if it did not teach this, it would also teach this.

hebrew_text: אהדרוה קמיה דרבא אמר מבישותין אמרי קמייהו מטיבותין לא אמרי קמייהו
human_translation: brought before Rava. said You state our inferior before you do not state our superior before them?
llm_translation: He returned and stood before Rava. They said in front of him, "From the disgraceful ones they said in front of him, not from the good ones they said in front of him."

hebrew_text: והדר אמר רבא הני נמי טיבותין היא אמר קרא (ויקרא ו, יג) סלת מנחה תמיד הרי היא לך כמנחת תמידין
human_translation: And Rava then said This also our superior the verse states “Fine flour for a meal offering perpetually [ tamid ], is like the meal offering daily offerings [ temidin ]
llm_translation: And further said Rava: These also are good, as it is said (Leviticus 6:13), "The meal offering shall be offered continually, like the meal offering of the continual offering."

hebrew_text: מאי הוי עלה אמר ר"נ בר יצחק ת"ש דתניא שלימה שחרית ושלימה בין הערבים
human_translation: What was about Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Come hear as it is taught a complete morning and complete in the afternoon.
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "הוי עלה"? R. Nahman bar Yitzhak said: Come and hear, as it was taught: "Complete in the morning and complete in the evening."

hebrew_text: א"ר יוחנן פליגי בה אבא יוסי בן דוסתאי ורבנן
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Abba Yosei ben Dostai and the Rabbis disagree
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan disputes it: Abba Yossi ben Dostai and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אבא יוסי בן דוסתאי אומר מפריש לה שני קמצים של לבונה קומץ שחרית וקומץ בין הערבים ורבנן אמרי מפריש לה קומץ אחד חצי קומץ שחרית וחצי קומץ בין הערבים
human_translation: Abba Yosei ben Dostai says: separates two handfuls of frankincense for handful morning and handful afternoon And the Rabbis say: separates one handful for half a handful morning and half a handful afternoon
llm_translation: Abba Yossi ben Dustai says: He separates for it two handfuls of frankincense, one handful in the morning and one handful between the evenings. And the Rabbis say: He separates for it one handful, half a handful in the morning and half a handful between the evenings.

hebrew_text: במאי קמיפלגי אבא יוסי בן דוסתאי סבר לא אשכחן חצי קומץ דקריב ורבנן סברי לא אשכחן עשרון דבעי שני קמצים
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Abba Yosei ben Dostai holds one does not find half a handful is sacrificed, And the Rabbis hold that one does not find a tenth requires two handfuls
llm_translation: With what do Abba Yossi ben Dostai disagree? He holds that we do not find a half-kometz brought, while the Rabbis hold that we do not find a tenth of an ephah that requires two kometzim.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי יוחנן כהן גדול שמת ולא מינו אחר תחתיו
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a dilemma: a High Priest who died and they did not appoint another in his stead,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan the High Priest inquired: "If one who was appointed as High Priest dies and his replacement has not been designated beneath him..."

hebrew_text: לרבנן הוכפלה לבונתו או לא מי אמרינן מתוך שהוכפלה סלתו הוכפלה לבונתו או דילמא מאי דגלי גלי מאי דלא גלי לא גלי
human_translation: according to the Rabbis, is the frankincense doubled or not? Do we say since its fine flour is doubled, its frankincense doubled? Or perhaps that which reveals, it reveals, that which does not reveal, does not reveal;
llm_translation: To the Rabbis: If his dough was doubled or not, do we say since his dough was doubled, his building was doubled as well? Or perhaps what is revealed is revealed, and what is not revealed is not revealed.

hebrew_text: ושמן בין לאבא יוסי בן דוסתאי ובין לרבנן מהו
human_translation: And what is oil both to Abba Yosei ben Dostai and to the Rabbis?
llm_translation: And oil, between Abba Yossi ben Dostai and between the Rabbis, what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ת"ש ה' קמצין הן ואם איתא זימנין דמשכחת לה ז'
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear There are five a handful. And if it is so sometimes you find seven
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear: They are five "kamatzin," and if it is necessary, at times you find six.

hebrew_text: דאי לא קתני יתיב רב פפא וקאמר לה להא שמעתא אמר ליה רב יוסף בר שמעיה לרב פפא והא מעלה קומץ בחוץ דאי הוה וקתני
human_translation: does not teach what if Rav Pappa was sitting and teaching this halakha . Rav Yosef bar Shemaya said to Rav Pappa: But one who offers up handful outside is what if, and is taught
llm_translation: If it did not teach, Rav Papa would sit and say to her this teaching. Rav Yosef bar Shemaya said to Rav Papa, "But one may bring the handful outside, for if it were not so, it would have taught."

hebrew_text: מאי הוי עלה אמר ר"נ בר יצחק ת"ש דתניא כ"ג שמת ולא מינו אחר תחתיו שלימה שחרית ושלימה בין הערבים ומפריש לה ב' קמצין קומץ שחרית וקומץ בין הערבים ומפריש לה שלשת לוגין לוג ומחצה שחרית לוג ומחצה בין הערבים

llm_translation: Behold, when his mind was troubled, he opened and said (Psalms 16:2), "You are my Lord; I have no good apart from You." Thus spoke the congregation of Israel before the Holy One, blessed be He: "Master of the world, grant me goodness, for I have acknowledged You in the world."

hebrew_text: אמר לה טובתי בל עליך איני מחזיק טובה אלא לאברהם יצחק ויעקב שהודיעוני תחלה בעולם שנאמר (תהלים טז, ג) לקדושים אשר בארץ המה ואדירי כל חפצי בם

llm_translation: He said to her, "My goodness is not upon you, I hold goodness only for Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, for they informed me first in the world, as it is stated (Psalms 16:3), 'To the holy ones who are in the earth, they are the mighty ones in whom is all my delight.'"

hebrew_text: א"ר יצחק בשעה שחרב בית המקדש מצאו הקב"ה לאברהם שהיה עומד בבית המקדש אמר לו מה לידידי בביתי
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: At the time when the Temple was destroyed, the Holy One, Blessed be He, found Abraham standing in the Temple. He said to “What has My beloved to do in My house?”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzchak said: When the Temple was destroyed, the Holy One, blessed be He, found Abraham standing in the Temple. He said to him, "What is my beloved doing in my house?"

hebrew_text: אמר לו על עיסקי בני באתי אמר לו בניך חטאו וגלו אמר לו שמא בשוגג חטאו אמר לו (ירמיהו יא, טו) עשותה המזימתה אמר לו שמא מיעוטן חטאו אמר לו הרבים
human_translation: said to I have come over matters my children, said to your children sinned, and exiled said to Perhaps they sinned unwittingly, said to “Seeing that she has performed lewdness [ hamzimmata ],” said to Perhaps a minority sinned, said to “With many,”
llm_translation: He said to him, "Regarding the dealings of my sons, I have come." He said to him, "Your sons have sinned and been revealed." He said to him, "Perhaps they sinned unintentionally?" He said to him, "She who schemes has done it." He said to him, "Perhaps they sinned due to their small number?" He said to him, "The public."

hebrew_text: היה לך לזכור ברית מילה אמר לו (ירמיהו יא, טו) ובשר קודש יעברו מעליך אמר לו שמא אם המתנת להם היו חוזרין בתשובה אמר לו (ירמיהו יא, טו) כי רעתיכי אז תעלוזי
human_translation: You should have remembered covenant of circumcision, said to “And the hallowed flesh is passed from you,” said to Perhaps if You would have waited for them, they would have returned in repentance. said to “When you do evil then you rejoice.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: If you remember the covenant of circumcision, he said to him (Jeremiah 11:15) "And holy flesh shall pass from you." He said to him, perhaps if you were to give them a chance, they would repent. He said to him (Jeremiah 11:15) "For then you will be pleased."

hebrew_text: מיד הניח ידיו על ראשו והיה צועק ובוכה ואמר לו שמא חס ושלום אין להם תקנה יצתה בת קול ואמרה לו (ירמיהו יא, טז) זית רענן יפה פרי תואר קרא ה' שמך מה זית זו אחריתו בסופו אף ישראל אחריתן בסופן
human_translation: immediately placed his hands on his head and was screaming and crying. And said to conceivable, Heaven forbid, have no remedy? A Divine Voice emerged and said to him “The Lord called your name a leafy olive tree, fair with goodly fruit.” Just as this olive tree, its final at its end, so too, the Jewish people, their final at their end,
llm_translation: Immediately he placed his hands on his head and he was crying and weeping, and he said to him, "Heaven forbid, they have no remedy." A heavenly voice emerged and said to him (Jeremiah 11:16), "A fresh olive tree, beautiful in fruit and form, the Lord called your name. What is the end of this olive? Its end is at its peak. So too, Israel, their end is at their peak."

hebrew_text: (ירמיהו יא, טז) לקול המולה גדולה הצית אש עליה ורעו דליותיו אמר רבי חיננא בר פפא לקול מיליהן של מרגלים ניתרועעו דליותיהן של ישראל דאמר רבי חיננא בר פפא דבר גדול דברו מרגלים באותה שעה (במדבר יג, לא) כי חזק הוא ממנו אל תיקרי ממנו אלא ממנו כביכול שאפילו בעל הבית אינו יכול להוציא כליו משם
human_translation: “With the sound of a great tumult [ hamulla ] He has kindled fire upon it, and its branches [ daliyyotav ] are broken” Rabbi Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: From the sound of the words [ milleihen ] of the spies the branches of the Jewish people were broken. As Rabbi Ḥinnana bar Pappa says: The spies said a serious statement at that moment: “They are stronger than us” Do not read than us [ mimmenu ],” rather than Him [ mimmennu ], that even the Homeowner, is unable to remove His belongings from there, as it were.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Jeremiah 11:16) "The Lord called your name, A leafy olive tree, fair with goodly fruit; with the noise of a great tumult He has kindled fire upon it, and the branches of it are broken." Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa said: "Due to the voice of the spies, their (the Israelites') kidneys trembled." Rabbi Ḥanina bar Pappa said: "Great is the matter that the spies spoke at that time." (Numbers 13:31) "For he is stronger than we." Do not read it as "stronger than we," but rather "stronger than it seems," for even the owner of the house cannot remove his vessels from there.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה ר' חייא בר' חיננא האי לקול המולה גדולה לקול מלה מיבעיא ליה אלא אמר לו הקב"ה לאברהם קולך שמעתי וחמלתי עליהם אני אמרתי ישתעבדו בארבע מלכיות כל אחת ואחת כשיעור ארבע מלכיות
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya, son of Rabbi Ḥinnana, objects to this This “With the sound of a great tumult [ hamulla ],” it should have With the sound of a word [ mila ]. Rather, The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Abraham: I heard your voice, and I took pity [ ḥamalti ] on I said will be subjugated by four kingdoms: each and every one for the measure four kingdoms
llm_translation: Challenged him Rabbi Chiya son of Rabbi Chinana: "This for the voice of a great circumcision, for the voice of a word, is it necessary?" Rather, the Holy One, blessed be He, said to Abraham: "Your voice I have heard, and I have had compassion on them. I said they shall be subjugated to four kingdoms, each one for a specific period of four kingdoms."

hebrew_text: השתא כל חדא וחדא מאי דפסיק לה ואיכא דאמרי אני אמרתי בזה אחר זה עכשיו בבת אחת
human_translation: now each one stipulated for And there are who say I said one after the other, Now simultaneously
llm_translation: At this moment, each and every one, what is the reason for which it interrupts him? And there are those who say, "I said this after that, now simultaneously."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יהושע בן לוי למה נמשלו ישראל לזית לומר לך מה זית אין עליו נושרין לא בימות החמה ולא בימות הגשמים אף ישראל אין להם בטילה עולמית לא בעוה"ז ולא בעולם הבא ואמר רבי יוחנן למה נמשלו ישראל לזית לומר לך מה זית אינו מוציא שמנו אלא ע"י כתיתה אף ישראל אין חוזרין למוטב אלא ע"י יסורין
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: Why were the Jewish people likened to an olive tree? to tell you just as the leaves of an olive tree never fall off, neither in the summer nor in the rainy season, so too, the Jewish people will never be nullified, neither in this world nor in the World-to-Come. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Why were the Jewish people likened to an olive tree? to tell you just as an olive tree brings forth its oil only by crushing so too, the Jewish people, return to good only by means of suffering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: Why are the people of Israel likened to an olive tree? To tell you, just as an olive tree does not shed its leaves neither in the days of the sun nor in the days of rain, so too, the people of Israel do not have eternal nullification, neither in this world nor in the world to come. And Rabbi Yochanan said: Why are the people of Israel likened to an olive tree? To tell you, just as an olive tree does not yield its oil except through crushing, so too, the people of Israel do not return to goodness except through suffering.

hebrew_text: ר"מ אומר השאור בודה להן מתוכן ומחמיצן [וכו'] מאי חסירה או יתירה
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: the leaven one separates for from within and leavens What Lacking or greater?
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: "The leaven nullifies them from within and sours them etc.. What is the deficiency or excess?"

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא עיסת השאור עבה נמצאת יתירה מדת העשרון רכה נמצאת חסירה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: leavening dough stiff, is found greater a tenth the measuring soft, is found lacking.
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: The dough of leaven is found to be thicker than the measure of the tithe, and softer is found to be lacking.

hebrew_text: סוף סוף כי קא כייל לעשרון קא כייל
human_translation: Ultimately, when measures he measures of a tenth
llm_translation: Ultimately, when he is gathering for the tithe, he is gathering.

hebrew_text: רבה ורב יוסף דאמרי תרוייהו לכמות שהן היתה משערינן
human_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both say: one measures in accordance with was
llm_translation: Rabba and Rav Yosef both said: "For as long as they were deliberating."

hebrew_text: ולישקול פורתא מיניה וליחמציה מאבראי וליתיה ונילושיה בהדיה גזירה דלמא אתי לאיתויי מעלמא
human_translation: But let him take a little from and leaven it outside and bring it and knead it together with decree. perhaps they will come to bring from elsewhere,
llm_translation: And to weigh a bean from it and to roast it from the limbs and to place it and to knead it together with it, a decree lest one come to bring from the world.

hebrew_text: ת"ר אין מחמיצין
human_translation: The Sages taught One may not leaven
llm_translation: The Sages taught: We do not leaven.

hebrew_text: בתפוחים משום רבי חנינא בן גמליאל אמרו מחמיצין רב כהנא מתני לה ברבי חנינא בן תרדיון
human_translation: with apples, said in the name of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel one may leaven Rav Kahana would teach this of Rabbi Ḥanina ben Teradyon,
llm_translation: In apples, because of Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel, they said: Rav Kahana teaches in the name of Rabbi Chanina ben Teradyon.

hebrew_text: כמאן אזלא הא דתנן תפוח שריסקו ונתנו בתוך העיסה וחימצה הרי זו אסורה
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which we learned an apple that one mashed and placed in dough, and leavened this is prohibited
llm_translation: As whose opinion does this go? This one, as we learned: "If one crushed a pomegranate and placed it in the dough, and it fermented, it is prohibited."

hebrew_text: כמאן לימא רבי חנינא בן גמליאל היא ולא רבנן אפי' תימא רבנן נהי דחמץ גמור לא הוי נוקשה מיהא הוי
human_translation: In accordance with whose Shall we say is Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel, and not the Rabbis, You even say the Rabbis. Granted, that not become full-fledged leavened bread, in any event it becomes hardened [ nukshe ]
llm_translation: As whom to say, Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel it is, and not the Rabbis. Even if you say the Rabbis, since it is completely leavened, it is not considered problematic.

hebrew_text: א"ר אילא אין לך הקשה לקמיצה יותר ממנחת חוטא רב יצחק בר אבדימי אמר מנחת חוטא מגבלה במים וכשרה
human_translation: Rabbi Ila says: you do not have whose removal of handful is more difficult than the meal offering of a sinner. Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi says: the meal offering of a sinner, may knead it in water, and fit
llm_translation: Rabbi Ila said: There is no difficulty for the handful more than the sin offering. Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi said: The sin offering is mixed with water and is valid.

hebrew_text: לימא בהא קא מיפלגי דמר סבר כמות שהן משערינן ומר סבר לכמות שהיו משערינן
human_translation: Let us say disagree about this: As Sage, holds that one measures as they are, And Sage, holds that one measures as they were
llm_translation: Let us say in this case they are in disagreement, as Master holds according to their current status, and Master holds according to their previous status.

hebrew_text: לא דכולי עלמא כמות שהן משערינן ובהא קא מיפלגי דמר סבר מאי חריבה חריבה משמן ומר סבר חריבה מכל דבר
human_translation: No, everyone one measures as they are. And with regard to this they disagree: As Sage, holds: What “dry” dry of oil, And Sage, holds dry of all substances,
llm_translation: Not everyone is like their appearance, as we assess, and in this they disagree. The Master holds: "What is destroyed, is destroyed from oil," and the other Master holds: "Destruction is from anything."

hebrew_text: תנן התם בשר העגל שנתפח ובשר זקנה שנתמעך משתערין לכמות שהן
human_translation: We learned there Meat of a calf that swelled or meat of an old that shrank measured as they are
llm_translation: We learned there (in a Mishnah): The flesh of a calf that swelled and the flesh of an old animal that disintegrated are measured according to their original size.

hebrew_text: רב ורבי חייא ורבי יוחנן אמרי משתערין כמות שהן שמואל ורבי שמעון בר רבי וריש לקיש אמרי משתערין לכמות שהן
human_translation: Rav, Rabbi Ḥiyya, and Rabbi Yoḥanan say measured as they are Shmuel, Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi and Reish Lakish say measured according to as they are,
llm_translation: Rav and Rabbi Chiya and Rabbi Yochanan said: They estimate according to their value. Shmuel and Rabbi Shimon bar Rabbi and Reish Lakish said: They estimate according to their value.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי בשר העגל שלא היה בו כשיעור ותפח ועמד על כשיעור טהור לשעבר וטמא מיכן ולהבא
human_translation: raises an objection meat of a calf that was not of to measure and swelled it stood at measure pure with regard to the past, but impure from here on.
llm_translation: Challenged: The flesh of a calf that did not have the size of an olive and it swelled and reached the size of an olive - pure retroactively and impure from here on.

hebrew_text: מדרבנן
human_translation: by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: From the Rabbis

hebrew_text: אי הכי אימא סיפא וכן בפיגול וכן בנותר אי אמרת בשלמא דאורייתא היינו דאיכא פיגול ונותר אלא אי אמרת דרבנן פיגול ונותר בדרבנן מי איכא
human_translation: If so, say the latter clause And similarly, to an offering that was sacrificed with the intent to consume it after its designated time [ piggul ], and similarly with regard to left over from an offering after the time allotted for its consumption [ notar ]. Granted, if you say by Torah law, this is piggul and notar are But if you say by rabbinic law, are there piggul and notar by rabbinic law?
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: And so too with Pigul, and so too with Notar. If you say this is the case with regard to a Biblical prohibition, that is where there is Pigul and Notar. But if you say it is a Rabbinic prohibition, is there Pigul and Notar in Rabbinic law?

hebrew_text: אימא וכן בטומאת פיגול וכן בטומאת נותר
human_translation: Say And similarly, with regard to ritual impurity piggul , and similarly with regard to ritual impurity notar .
llm_translation: Say: And so too with the impurity of Pigul, and so too with the impurity of Notar.

hebrew_text: סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל וטומאת פיגול וטומאת נותר דרבנן היא כולי האי בדרבנן לא עבוד רבנן קא משמע לן
human_translation: enter your mind to say: Since impurity piggul and impurity notar by rabbinic law, the Sages did not institute such an extent, by rabbinic law. teaches us
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "I might say, since the impurity of Pigul and the impurity of Notar are Rabbinic, all of this is in Rabbinic law; the Rabbis did not perform Rabbinic work for us."

hebrew_text: ת"ש בשר זקנה שהיה בו כשיעור וצמק פחות מכשיעור טמא לשעבר וטהור מיכן ולהבא
human_translation: Come hear meat an old that was to measure and shrank less than measure impure with regard to the past, and pure from here on.
llm_translation: Come and hear: "The flesh of an old animal that had the size of an olive and was choked less than the size of an olive is ritually impure retroactively and pure from now on."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה כל היכא דמעיקרא הוה ביה והשתא לית ביה הא לית ביה וכל היכא דמעיקרא לא הוה ביה והשתא הוה ביה מדרבנן
human_translation: Rabba said, Anywhere, that was initially of but now it is not of it is not of anywhere, that initially was not of but now it is of by rabbinic law.
llm_translation: Rabah said: Wherever initially it was in it, and now it is not in it, this is not in it. And wherever initially it was not in it, and now it is in it, this is from the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: כי פליגי כגון שהיה בו כשיעור וצמק וחזר ותפח דמר סבר יש דיחוי באיסורא ומר סבר אין דיחוי באיסורא
human_translation: When they disagree where had measure and it shrank and again swelled that Sage, holds: There is disqualification with regard to a ritual matter, And Sage, holds: There is no disqualification with regard to a ritual matter.
llm_translation: When they disputed, such as a case where there was the size of an olive and it became spoiled, and then it expanded, Mar thought there is a postponement in prohibition, and Mar thought there is no postponement in prohibition.

hebrew_text: ומי איכא למ"ד דיש דיחוי באיסורין והתנן כביצה אוכלין שהניחה בחמה ונתמעטו וכן כזית מן המת כזית מן הנבלה וכעדשה מן השרץ וכזית פיגול וכזית נותר וכזית חלב טהורין ואין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול ונותר וחלב
human_translation: And is there one who says there is disqualification with regard to ritual matters? But didn’t we learn of an egg-bulk food that one placed in the sun and shrank and similarly an olive-bulk of a corpse, an olive-bulk of an animal carcass, or a lentil-bulk of a creeping animal, or an olive-bulk piggul , or an olive-bulk notar , or an olive-bulk fat, are pure, and one is not liable for them due to piggul , notar , or fat.
llm_translation: And is there one who says there is a prohibition in thoughts, and we learned in a Mishnah: "Regarding an egg that was left in the sun and shrunk, and similarly an olive's worth from a corpse, an olive's worth from a carcass, and a lentil's worth from a creeping animal, and an olive's worth of disqualified intent, and an olive's worth of what remains, and an olive's worth of pure fat, one is not liable for them due to disqualified intent, what remains, and fat."

hebrew_text: הניחן בגשמים ותפחו טמאין וחייבין עליהם משום פיגול ונותר וחלב תיובתא למ"ד יש דיחוי באיסורין תיובתא
human_translation: placed them in the rain, they swelled they are impure, and one is liable for them due to piggul , notar , or fat. the refutation of the one who says there is disqualification with regard to ritual matters a conclusive refutation.
llm_translation: They left them in the rain and they became spoiled, and one is liable for them due to Pigul, Nosar, and Chelev. It is a dispute: according to one opinion, there is a nullification in prohibitions.

hebrew_text: תא שמע תורמין תאנים על הגרוגרות במנין
human_translation: Come hear One may separate teruma figs for dried figs, by number,
llm_translation: Come and hear: We tithe figs on dried fig cakes according to the count.

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא לכמות שהן משערינן שפיר אלא אי אמרת כמות שהן הוה ליה מרבה במעשרות
human_translation: Granted, if you say one measures as they were well; But if you say as they are, this increases tithes.
llm_translation: If you say, "In accordance with the opinion that they are estimated, it is well," but if you say, "In accordance with the opinion that they are actual, he would have to increase in tithes."

hebrew_text: (ותנן) המרבה במעשרות פירותיו מתוקנים ומעשרותיו מקולקלין
human_translation: And we learned one who increases tithes, his produce is rendered fit But his tithes are ruined,
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: One who increases the tithes, his produce is well-preserved, and his tithes are spoiled.

hebrew_text: אלא מאי לכמות שהן אימא סיפא גרוגרות על התאנים במדה
human_translation: Rather, what as they were say the latter clause dried figs for figs by measure
llm_translation: Rather, what is the reason for their the Sages' opinion? Say, the latter clause: "Gargerot on the figs in a measure."

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא כמות שהן שפיר אלא אי אמרת לכמות שהן מרבה במעשרות הוא
human_translation: Granted, if you say as they are well. But if you say as they were is one who increases tithes.
llm_translation: If you say, "Granted, according to their number, it is fine," but if you say, "According to their number, it increases in tithes," it is.

hebrew_text: אלא הכא בתרומה גדולה עסקינן ורישא בעין יפה וסיפא בעין יפה היא
human_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with standard teruma . And the first clause generously, and the latter clause, it generously.
llm_translation: Rather here in the context of a large donation we are dealing with, the beginning is with a beautiful eye, and the end is with a beautiful eye.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אימא סיפא א"ר אלעזר בר' יוסי אבא היה נוטל עשר גרוגרות שבמקצוע על תשעים שבכלכלה ואי בתרומה גדולה עשר מאי עבידתיה
human_translation: If so, say the last clause: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Yosei, said: Father, would set aside ten dried figs that in a vessel for ninety that in a basket. And if standard teruma , ten what is its purpose?
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Yosei Abba would take ten grogorot of produce in the field for ninety in commerce, and if with a large contribution, what would he do with ten?

hebrew_text: אלא הכא בתרומת מעשר עסקינן ואבא אלעזר בן גומל הוא דתניא אבא אלעזר בן גומל אומר (במדבר יח, כז) ונחשב לכם תרומתכם בשתי תרומות הכתוב מדבר אחת תרומה גדולה ואחת תרומת מעשר
human_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with teruma of the tithe, And is Abba Elazar ben Gomel. As it is taught Abba Elazar ben Gomel says “And your teruma [ terumatkhem ] shall be reckoned to you the verse speaks about two terumot . One is standard teruma , and one is teruma of the tithe.
llm_translation: Rather, here we are dealing with the matter of Terumat Ma'aser, and Abba Elazar ben Gomel is the one who taught: Abba Elazar ben Gomel says (Numbers 18:27), "And it shall be credited to you as your Terumah with two Terumot." The verse speaks of one being a large Terumah and one being Terumat Ma'aser.

hebrew_text: כשם שתרומה גדולה ניטלת באומד ובמחשבה כך תרומת מעשר ניטלת באומד
human_translation: Just as standard teruma is taken by estimate, and by thought, so too, teruma of the tithe may be taken by estimate
llm_translation: Just as a large donation is taken with estimation and thought, so too the donation of the tithe is taken with estimation.

llm_translation: And in thought, what is the great terumah in the eye beautiful, also the terumah of the tithe in the eye beautiful.

hebrew_text: ומינה א"ר אלעזר בר רבי יוסי אבא היה נוטל עשר גרוגרות שבמקצוע על תשעים שבכלכלה אי אמרת בשלמא לכמות שהן אמרינן שפיר אלא אי אמרת כמות שהן בציר להו

hebrew_text: כי אתא רב דימי א"ר אלעזר שאני גרוגרות הואיל ויכול לשולקן ולהחזירן לכמות שהן
human_translation: When Rav Dimi came Rabbi Elazar says Dried figs are different, since one can boil and return them to as they were
llm_translation: When Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Elazar said: "Gergerot are different, since one can boil them and return them to their original state."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן תורמין תאנים על הגרוגרות במקום שרגילין לעשות תאנים גרוגרות ולא גרוגרות על תאנים ואפילו במקום שרגילין לעשות תאנים גרוגרות

llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: They tithe figs on dried fig cakes in a place where it is customary to make fig cakes, and not fig cakes on figs, even in a place where it is customary to make fig cakes.

hebrew_text: אמר מר תורמין תאנים על הגרוגרות במקום שרגילין לעשות תאנים גרוגרות במקום שרגילין אין במקום שאין רגילין לא
