hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא שמע מינה דחקינן ומוקמינן מתניתין בתרי טעמי ולא מוקמינן בתרי תנאי

llm_translation: Rav Papa said: Learn from this that we establish and position Mishnaic teachings based on two reasons, but we do not establish them based on two Tannaitic opinions.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל המנחות נילושות בפושרין ומשמרן שלא יחמיצו ואם החמיצו שיריה עובר בלא תעשה שנאמר (ויקרא ב, יא) כל המנחה אשר תקריבו לה' לא תעשה חמץ וחייב על לישתה ועל עריכתה ועל אפייתה
human_translation: All the meal-offerings are kneaded with lukewarm And one must watch over them that they do not leaven and if its remainder becomes leaven, one violates a prohibition, as it is stated: “No meal offering that you shall bring to the Lord shall be made with leaven; And one is liable for kneading and for shaping and for baking
llm_translation: Mishnah: All meal-offerings are kneaded with lukewarm water, and their watch is to prevent them from becoming leavened. And if they became leavened, their owner transgresses a negative commandment, as it is stated (Leviticus 2:11), "Every meal-offering that you offer to the Lord, you shall not make it leavened." And one is liable for its kneading, shaping, and baking.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנא הני מילי אמר ריש לקיש דאמר קרא (ויקרא ו, י) לא תאפה חמץ חלקם אפילו חלקם לא תאפה חמץ

llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive these matters? Reish Lakish said, as the verse states (Leviticus 6:10), "You shall not bake leavened bread as their portion; I have given it to them of My offerings." Even if their portion has not been given, you shall not bake leavened bread.

llm_translation: Said Rabbi Eftoriki: Because it is a general principle, and a specific detail that are distant from each other, and any general principle and specific detail that are distant from each other, we do not judge them as a general principle and specific detail.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב אדא בר אהבה ואמרי לה כדי וכלל ופרט המרוחקין זה מזה אין דנין אותן בכלל ופרט והתניא (ויקרא ד, כד) ושחט אותו במקום אשר ישחט העולה לפני ה' חטאת הוא היכן עולה נשחטת בצפון אף זה בצפון

But isn’t it taught and slaughter it in the place where they slaughter the burnt offering before the Lord; it is a sin offering” Where is the burnt offering slaughtered? On the northern This also in the north
llm_translation: Challenger Rav Adda bar Ahava, and some say it was R. Kadi, and the general rule is: "And a detail that is far removed from another detail, they are not judged together in the general rule and detail." And it was taught: "And he shall slaughter it in the place where he slaughters the burnt offering before the Lord, it is a sin offering." Where is the burnt offering slaughtered? In the north. So too, this one is in the north.

hebrew_text: וכי אנו מכאן למידין והלא כבר נאמר (ויקרא ו, יח) במקום אשר תשחט העולה תשחט החטאת הא למה זה יצא לקובעו שאם לא שחט אותו בצפון פסלו
human_translation: And do you learn from here? But isn’t it already stated: In the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered shall the sin offering be slaughtered to what was this singled out? to fix for it, that if he did not slaughter it in the north he has disqualified it
llm_translation: And when we learn from here? But haven't we already said (Leviticus 6:18), "In the place where you slaughter the burnt offering, you shall slaughter the sin offering"? Why did this come out to establish that if one does not slaughter it in the north, it invalidates it.

hebrew_text: אתה אומר לכך יצאת או אינו אלא שזה טעון צפון ואין אחר טעון צפון ת"ל (ויקרא ד, כט) ושחט את החטאת במקום (אשר ישחט את) העולה זה בנה אב לכל חטאות שטעונות צפון
human_translation: Do you say singled out for this Or it is only that this requires north, but no other requires north. The verse states and slaughter the sin offering in the place of burnt offering” this established a paradigm for all sin offerings, that they require north.
llm_translation: You say to him, "You have fulfilled your obligation," or is it only that this one requires the north, and no other requires the north? It is written (Leviticus 4:29), "And he shall slaughter the sin offering in the place (where he slaughters) the burnt offering." This teaches that this one is a father to all sin offerings that require the north.

llm_translation: Not because it is a general principle, and a specific detail, and even though they are far apart from each other, we include them in the general principle and the specific detail.

human_translation: Rather, it, in the north, but Paschal offering not in the north. Paschal offering derived as Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.
llm_translation: Rather, that case is specifically referring to in the north, and when it comes to Pesach in the north, Pesach according to the opinion of Rabbi Yehudah HaNasi, the son of Yaakov, is derived.

hebrew_text: דתניא רבי אליעזר בן יעקב אומר יכול יהא הפסח טעון צפון ודין הוא ומה עולה שלא קבע לה זמן בשחיטתה קבע לה צפון פסח שקבע לו זמן לשחיטתו אינו דין שקבע לו צפון
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: might a Paschal offering requires north. And this a logical inference: Just as a burnt offering, which did not fix a time for its slaughter fixed it north, a Paschal offering, which fixed a time for its slaughter, is it not logical that would fix it north?
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, "One might have thought that the Paschal lamb requires being roasted whole and it is sufficient. But what is the law? If it was not designated a time for its slaughter, it requires roasting whole. The Paschal lamb, if a time was designated for its slaughter, it is not sufficient if a time was designated for its roasting."

hebrew_text: מה לעולה שכן כליל
human_translation: what about a burnt offering? in that it is entirely
llm_translation: What is the case of an Olah that it is entirely burnt?

hebrew_text: מחטאת מה לחטאת שכן מכפרת על חייבי כריתות
human_translation: from a sin offering, what about a sin offering? in that it atone for liable for excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ],
llm_translation: Sin offering, what for sin offering? For it atones for those liable for excisions.

hebrew_text: מאשם מה לאשם שכן קדשי קדשים מכולהו נמי שכן קדשי קדשים
human_translation: from a guilt offering, what about a guilt offering? in that an offering of the most sacred order, all of from either, since an offering of the most sacred order.
llm_translation: Guilt offering, what for guilt offering? So too, most holy things, what for most holy things.

hebrew_text: אלא לעולם כדקאמרינן מעיקרא אותו בצפון ואין השוחט בצפון ודקא קשיא לך מדר' אחייה נפקא דר' אחייה לאו למעוטי שוחט בצפון הוא דאתא אלא הכי קאמר אין השוחט בצפון אבל מקבל בצפון
human_translation: Rather, as we said initially: It, in the north, but one who slaughters not in the north. And that difficult for you, we derive from of Rabbi Aḥiyya, of Rabbi Aḥiyya does not come to exclude slaughters in the north, Rather, this is what is saying: one who slaughters not in the north, but collects in the north.
llm_translation: Rather, indeed, as we say, from the outset, that one in the north, and one does not slaughter in the north. And it is difficult for you from Rabbi Aḥiyya's statement, that Rabbi Aḥiyya came out, is it not to exclude one who slaughters in the north? He came to say thus: one does not slaughter in the north, but one may receive in the north.

hebrew_text: מקבל מלקח ולקח נפקא לקח ולקח לא משמע ליה:
human_translation: collects from shall take, “And shall take” does not learn shall take, “And shall take.”
llm_translation: Receives purchase and purchase goes out, purchase and purchase, does not imply to him.

hebrew_text: וחייב על לישתה ועל עריכתה ועל אפייתה: אמר רב פפא אפאה לוקה שתים אחת על עריכתה ואחת על אפייתה והא אמרת מה אפייה מיוחדת שהיא מעשה יחידי וחייבין עליה בפני עצמה
human_translation: And one is liable for kneading and for shaping it, and for baking it, Rav Pappa said: baked is flogged two one for shaping and one for baking it. But you said Just as notable that it is a single action and one is liable for it by itself;
llm_translation: "And liable for kneading it, and for shaping it, and for baking it. Rav Papa said: One is lashed twice, once for shaping it, and once for baking it. But didn't you say that baking is distinct, as it is a unique act, and one is liable for it separately."

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא דעריך הוא ואפה הוא הא דעריך חבריה ויהיב ליה ואפה
human_translation: not difficult, this where he shaped and he, baked That where another shaped and gave to him, and he baked
llm_translation: It is not difficult: this one is a guest and that one is a baker; this one is a guest, his friend, and he gave him bread.

hebrew_text: ת"ר בכור שאחזו דם מקיזין אותו את הדם במקום שאין עושין בו מום ואין מקיזין את הדם במקום שעושין בו מום דברי ר"מ
human_translation: The Sages taught firstborn animal blood constricted, one may let blood in a place where does not cause blemish. But one may not let blood in a place where causes blemish, the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Regarding a firstborn animal that its blood was taken, they sprinkle the blood in a place where a blemish is not made, and they do not sprinkle the blood in a place where a blemish is made. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: וחכ"א יקיז אף במקום שעושין בו מום ובלבד שלא ישחוט [על אותו מום] ר"ש אומר
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: One may even let in a place where causes blemish, provided that he does not slaughter on of that blemish, Rabbi Shimon says:
llm_translation: And the sages said: One may sprinkle the blood even in a place where they cause a blemish, as long as he does not slaughter the offering with that blemish. Rabbi Shimon says:

hebrew_text: אף נשחט על אותו מום רבי יהודה אומר אפילו מת אין מקיזין לו את הדם
human_translation: may even be slaughtered on of that blemish. Rabbi Yehuda says: Even die one may not let its blood
llm_translation: Even slaughtered on that blemish. Rabbi Yehuda says, "Even if dead, do not sprinkle the blood for him."

hebrew_text: א"ר חייא בר אבא אמר רבי יוחנן הכל מודים במחמץ אחר מחמץ שהוא חייב דכתיב (ויקרא ב, יא) לא תעשה חמץ (ויקרא ו, י) ולא תאפה חמץ
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: All concede that one who leavens after leavened liable as it is written: shall be made with leaven” and “It shall not be baked with leaven”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said, Rabbi Yochanan said: Everyone agrees regarding leaven after leaven that one is liable, as it is written (Leviticus 2:11) "You shall not make leavened bread" and (Leviticus 6:10) "You shall not bake leavened bread."

hebrew_text: במסרס אחר מסרס שהוא חייב דכתיב (ויקרא כב, כד) ומעוך וכתות ונתוק וכרות אם על כורת הוא חייב על נותק לא כל שכן אלא להביא נותק אחר כורת שהוא חייב
human_translation: that one who castrates after one who castrates is liable, as it is written: “Those whose testicles are bruised, or crushed, or detached, or cut, If one is liable are cut, are detached not all the more so Rather, include detaches after cuts that he is liable.
llm_translation: In one who castrates another, one who is liable, as it is written (Leviticus 22:24), "bruised, crushed, torn, or cut." If one is liable for cutting, all the more so for tearing. Rather, to bring tearing after cutting, one is liable.

hebrew_text: לא נחלקו אלא במטיל מום בבעל מום ר' מאיר סבר כל מום לא יהיה בו ורבנן סברי (ויקרא כב, כא) תמים יהיה לרצון
human_translation: disagree only with regard to one who inflicts a blemish on blemished Rabbi Meir maintains there shall be no blemish in it” And the Rabbis maintain “it shall be perfect to be accepted”
llm_translation: They only disagreed regarding one who casts a blemish on a blemished animal. Rabbi Meir holds: "There shall be no blemish in it at all." And the Rabbis hold: "It shall be without blemish for acceptance." (Leviticus 22:21)

hebrew_text: ור' מאיר נמי הכתיב תמים יהיה לרצון ההוא למעוטי בעל מום מעיקרא
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, isn’t it written also: “It shall be perfect to be accepted”? That to exclude blemished from the outset,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir also, it is written "tamim yihyeh l'ratzon," to exclude one with a blemish from the outset.

hebrew_text: בעל מום מעיקרא דיקלא בעלמא הוא
human_translation: blemished from the outset, it is merely like a palm tree,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Ba'al mum me'ikara dikla be'alma hu."

hebrew_text: אלא למעוטי פסולי המוקדשים לאחר פדיונם סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ואסירי בגיזה ועבודה במומם נמי ליתסרי קמ"ל
human_translation: Rather, to exclude disqualified consecrated animals, after their redemption, enter your mind to say since prohibited shear or labor let also be prohibited a blemish upon them. teaches us
llm_translation: Rather, to exclude the disqualified consecrated items after their redemption. Do you really think I would say that since they are prohibited in shearing and labor due to their blemish, they are also not prohibited? The Mishnah teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: ורבנן נמי הכתיב (ויקרא כב, כא) כל מום לא יהיה בו ההוא מיבעי ליה לכדתניא וכל מום לא יהיה בו אין לי אלא שלא יהא בו מום מנין שלא יגרום לו ע"י אחרים שלא יניח בצק או דבילה על גבי האוזן כדי שיבא הכלב ויטלנו ת"ל כל מום אמר מום ואמר כל מום
human_translation: And the Rabbis as well, isn’t it written: “There shall not be any blemish in it,” That is necessary for that which is taught “There shall not be any blemish in it” I have only that it may not have a blemish From where that one may not cause upon it by means of other that one may not place dough or figs on its ear so that a dog will come and take it, The verse states: “Any blemish.” It says: “Blemish,” and it says “Any blemish”;
llm_translation: And the Rabbis also derive it from the verse (Leviticus 22:21), "There shall be no blemish in it." What does he need it for? As it was taught in a Baraita: "There shall be no blemish in it" - I might only think that there should be no blemish in it itself. From where do we derive that one should not cause a blemish in it through others, by placing dough or mud on the ear so that a dog will come and remove it? The verse states, "Every blemish," it says "blemish" and it says "every blemish."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אמי הניח שאור ע"ג עיסה והלך וישב לו ונתחמצה מאליה חייב עליה כמעשה שבת ומעשה שבת כי האי גוונא מי מיחייב והאמר רבה בר בר חנה
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says: placed leaven, on top of dough and he went and sat himself and leavened of its own liable for it. similar to action on Shabbat. And is one liable action on Shabbat a case like this? But doesn’t Rabba bar bar Ḥana say
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ami: "If one left leaven on dough and it fermented by itself, he is liable for it as if it were a Shabbat violation, and a Shabbat violation - is he liable for it?" And Rabba bar bar Ḥana said:

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן הניח בשר על גבי גחלים היפך בו חייב לא היפך בו פטור
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: placed meat on top of coals turned over liable did not turn over exempt,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "One who places meat on top of coals, if it cooked, he is liable; if it did not cook, he is exempt."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא מאי חייב נמי דקאמר כמעשה צלי של שבת
human_translation: Rava said: What as well, when he says: liable to action of roasting on Shabbat,
llm_translation: Rava said: What is the liability also? For he said, "Like the act of cooking on Shabbat."

hebrew_text: גופא אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן הניח בשר על גבי גחלים היפך בו חייב לא היפך בו פטור היכי דמי אילימא דאי לא היפך ביה לא בשיל פשיטא אלא דאי לא מהפיך ליה נמי הוה בשיל אמאי לא מיחייב
human_translation: the itself. Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: placed meat on top of coals turned over liable did not turn over exempt. What are the circumstances If we say where if not turn over not cook, obvious Rather, where if does not turn over cook. why isn’t he liable
llm_translation: The body, Rabbah son of Bar Hanah said, Rabbi Yohanan said: If one placed meat on top of coals, if it turned over, he is liable; if it did not turn over, he is exempt. What is the reason? If you say that if it did not turn over, it is obvious, rather, if it did not turn over, it should also be obvious. Why is he not liable?

hebrew_text: לא צריכא דאי לא היפך ביה הוה בשיל מצד אחד כמאכל בן דרוסאי וכי מהפיך ביה בשיל משני צדדין כמאכל בן דרוסאי וקמ"ל דכל מצד אחד כמאכל בן דרוסאי לא כלום הוא
human_translation: No, necessary where if not turn over cook on one side like the food of ben Derosai. And that he turns it over, cooks on both sides like the food of ben Derosai. And teaches us that any on one side like the food of ben Derosai is nothing,
llm_translation: Not necessary, for if it were not turned over, it would be like the food of Ben Drosai from one side, and if it were turned over from both sides, it would be like the food of Ben Drosai. And it teaches us that from any one side, like the food of Ben Drosai, it is nothing.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ואם נצלה בו כגרוגרת מצד אחד במקום אחד חייב א"ל רבינא לרב אשי במקום אחד אין בשנים או ג' מקומות לא והתנן הקודח כל שהוא חייב
human_translation: Rava says: And if to a fig-bulk was roasted on one side in one spot liable Ravina said to Rav Ashi: in one spot, yes, was over two or three spots not But didn’t we learn One who drills any is liable
llm_translation: Rava said, "And if it was removed in it like a dried fig from one side in one place, he is liable." Rabbina said to Rav Ashi, "In one place, yes; but in two or three places, no." And we learned in a Mishnah: "One who digs out any amount is liable."

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אילימא במקום אחד כל שהוא למאי חזי אלא לאו בשנים או שלשה מקומות דחזו לצירוף לא לעולם במקום אחד דחזו לבבא דאקלידא
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say in one spot For what of any size, fit Rather, is it not in two or three spots, that are fit to joined? No; actually in one spot, that is fit as an entrance [ levava ] for a key [ aklida ],
llm_translation: How so? If you say in one place, anything, what is seen? Rather, is it not in two or three places that they saw for combining? No, not in one place did they see, but in the heart of the palm tree.

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי אמר רבא אפילו בשנים וג' מקומות אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי אף אנן נמי תנינא הקודח כל שהוא חייב היכי דמי אילימא במקום אחד כל שהוא למאי חזי אלא לאו בשנים ושלשה מקומות דחזי לצירוף לא לעולם במקום אחד דחזו לבבא דאקלידא
human_translation: And there are who say Rava says: Even over two or three spots, Ravina said to Rav Ashi: We learn as well: One who drills any liable. What are the circumstances? If we say in one spot For what of any size fit Rather, is it not in two or three spots, that are fit to joined? No; actually in one spot, that it is fit as an entrance for a key.
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rava said, even in two or three places. Ravina said to Rav Ashi, we also learned: One who digs up any amount is liable. What is the case? If you say in one place, what does it look like? Rather, not in two or three places, where it looks like combining, but rather in one place, where the heart of the matter is seen.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן אילו נאמר (ויקרא ב, יא) אשר תקריבו לה' לא תעשה חמץ הייתי אומר אין לי (אלא) בלא תעשה חמץ אלא קומץ בלבד
human_translation: The Sages taught If had stated Nothing that you shall bring to the Lord shall be made with leaven, I would say: I have only handful alone in “Shall not be made with leaven,”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: If it had only said (Leviticus 2:11), "You shall not offer leaven," I would have said that I have (only) (this prohibition) without (any other) (prohibition) except for a handful alone.

hebrew_text: מנחה מנין ת"ל מנחה שאר מנחות מנין ת"ל (ויקרא ב, יא) כל המנחה
human_translation: From where a meal offering The verse states: “Meal offering,” from where other meal offerings, the verse states “No meal offering,”
llm_translation: Mincha, where is it derived from? Mincha, where is it derived from? (Leviticus 2:11) "Every mincha."

hebrew_text: אשר תקריבו לה' כשרה ולא פסולה מכאן אמרו המחמיץ את הכשירה חייב ואת הפסולה פטור
human_translation: “That you shall bring to the Lord,” a fit but not disqualified From here stated one who leavens a fit liable but a disqualified meal offering exempt.
llm_translation: That which you bring near to the Lord must be valid and not invalid. From here they said: One who leavens the valid offering is liable, and the invalid offering is exempt.

hebrew_text: בעי רב פפא חימצה ויצאת וחזר וחימצה מהו כיון דיצאת איפסילה לה ביוצא וכי הדר מחמיץ לה לא מיחייב עלה משום מחמיץ אחר מחמיץ
human_translation: Rav Pappa raises a dilemma: leavened and emerged and he again leavened it, what is since emerged it is disqualified in emerges and when he again leavens it he is not liable for it due to leavening after leavened
llm_translation: Rav Papa asked: If it became leavened, then went out, and then became leavened again, what is the ruling? Since it went out, its original status is nullified, and when it returns and becomes leavened again, is one liable for it due to the leavening of another leavening?

hebrew_text: או דילמא כיון דחימצה פסול יוצא לא מהני ביה וכי הדר מחמיץ לה מיחייב עלה משום מחמיץ אחר מחמיץ תיקו
human_translation: Or perhaps, since leavened disqualification emerges is ineffective with regard to And when he again leavens it he is liable for it due to leavening after one who leavened shall stand
llm_translation: Or perhaps since it became leavened, it is disqualified, he fulfills his obligation with it, and if he then leavens it for her, he is liable for leavening on account of leavening. Leavening after leavening - unresolved.

hebrew_text: בעי רב מרי חימצה בראשו של מזבח מהו אשר תקריבו אמר רחמנא והא אקרבה
human_translation: Rav Mari raises dilemma leavened at the top of the altar, what is The Merciful One states that you shall bring And this has brought
llm_translation: Rav Mari inquired: "If leaven is found on the top of the altar, what should you offer?" The Merciful One said, "But should I offer it?"

hebrew_text: או דלמא מחוסר הקטרה כמחוסר מעשה דמי תיקו:
human_translation: Or perhaps burning has not yet is considered like action has not yet shall stand
llm_translation: Or perhaps due to the lack of incense is like the lack of action, it is unresolved.

hebrew_text: והשתא דנפקא ליה מכל המנחה אשר תקריבו (לה') למה לי מיבעי ליה לכדתניא אשר תקריבו לרבות מנחת נסכים לחימוץ דברי רבי יוסי הגלילי רבי עקיבא אומר לרבות לחם הפנים לחימוץ
human_translation: And now that derives from “No meal offering,” why do I “That you shall bring,” It is necessary for that which is taught “That you shall bring,” to include the meal offering libations in leavening. leavening. the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: to include the shewbread in leavening.
llm_translation: And now that he has derived from "from all the meal offering that you offer" - why does he need it? He needs it, as it was taught in a baraita: "that you offer" - to include libation offerings for leavening. These are the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean; Rabbi Akiva says: to include the showbread for leavening.

hebrew_text: מנחת נסכים מי פירות הם
human_translation: the meal offering libations? is fruit juice,
llm_translation: Offering of libations, what fruits are they?

hebrew_text: ומי פירות אין מחמיצין אמר ריש לקיש אומר היה רבי יוסי הגלילי מנחת נסכים מגבלה במים וכשרה
human_translation: and fruit juices do not leaven Reish Lakish says Rabbi Yosei HaGelili would say: the meal offering libations knead with water, and fit.
llm_translation: And who said that fruits do not ferment? Reish Lakish said: Rabbi Yosei the Galilean said, "A meal-offering of libations is limited by water, and it is valid."

hebrew_text: לחם הפנים מדת יבש היא ושמענא ליה לר' עקיבא דאמר מדת יבש לא נתקדשה
human_translation: shewbread is is a measuring dry and we have heard that Rabbi Akiva said: measuring dry not consecrated
llm_translation: The bread of the presence is a dry measure, and we heard it to Rabbi Akiva who said: a dry measure was not sanctified.

hebrew_text: שלח (רבי ראובן) משמיה דרבי יוחנן כך היא הצעה של משנה ואיפוך אשר תקריבו לרבות לחם הפנים לחימוץ דברי רבי יוסי הגלילי ר' עקיבא אומר לרבות מנחת נסכים לחימוץ
human_translation: Rabbi Reuven sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: This is the version [ hetze’ah ] of baraita , and reverse “that you shall bring” to include the shewbread in leavening; the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: to include the meal offering libations in leavening.
llm_translation: Sent (Rabbi Reuven) in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: This is the proposal of the Mishnah and its reversal, that you shall bring to include the showbread for leavening. The words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. Rabbi Akiva says to include meal offerings for leavening.

hebrew_text: ואזדא ר' יוחנן לטעמיה דאמר ר' יוחנן רבי יוסי הגלילי ואחד מתלמידי ר' ישמעאל אמרו דבר אחד ומנו רבי יאשיה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan, follows [ ve’azda ] his reasoning As Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Yosei HaGelili and one of the students of Rabbi Yishmael said the same thing. And who is Rabbi Yoshiya.
llm_translation: And R. Yochanan went according to his reasoning, as R. Yochanan said: R. Yossi the Galilean and one of the disciples of R. Yishmael said one thing, and R. Yoshiyah counted it.

hebrew_text: דתניא (במדבר ז, א) וימשחם ויקדש אותם רבי יאשיה אומר מדת הלח נמשח בין מבפנים בין מבחוץ מדת יבש נמשחו מבפנים ואין נמשחו מבחוץ
human_translation: As it is taught and had anointed them and sanctified them” Rabbi Yoshiya says: measuring liquid anointed both on inside and on outside. measuring dry were anointed on inside, but were not anointed on outside.
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita (Numbers 7:1), "And he anointed them and sanctified them." Rabbi Yoshiyah says: The anointing oil was applied both inside and outside for the anointing of the Holy of Holies, but the anointing oil was applied inside and not outside for the anointing of the Holy Place.

hebrew_text: רבי יונתן אומר מדת הלח נמשחו מבפנים ואין נמשחו מבחוץ מדות יבש לא נמשחו כל עיקר תדע לך שהרי אין מקדשות דכתיב (ויקרא כג, יז) ממושבותיכם תביאו לחם תנופה שתים שני עשרונים סלת תהיינה חמץ תאפינה בכורים לה' אימתי הן לה' לאחר שנאפו
human_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: measuring liquid were anointed on inside and were not anointed on outside, measuring dry were not anointed at all. You can know because do not consecrate As it is written: “You shall bring out of your dwellings two wave-loaves of two tenth-parts of a ephah. They shall be of fine flour; they shall be baked with leaven, for first produce to the Lord” When they to the Lord? after they are baked
llm_translation: Rabbi Yonatan says: The measure of oil is anointed from within and is not anointed from without. Dry measures are not anointed at all. Know that they are not sanctified, as it is written (Leviticus 23:17): "From your dwellings you shall bring a bread offering, two loaves, two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour they shall be baked with leaven, first fruits to the Lord." When are they for the Lord? After they are baked.

hebrew_text: במאי קא מיפלגי באותם רבי יאשיה סבר אותם למעוטי מדת יבש בחוץ ור' יונתן סבר מדת יבש חול הוא ולא אצטריך קרא למעוטי כי איצטריך קרא למעוטי מדת לח מבחוץ
human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? with regard to them” Rabbi Yoshiya maintains “them” to exclude measuring dry outside, And Rabbi Yonatan maintains measuring dry are non-sacred, and it is not necessary verse to exclude Where it was necessary verse to exclude measuring liquid on outside.
llm_translation: With what do they argue? Rabbi Yashiyah holds that they are to exclude the measure of dryness outside, and Rabbi Yonatan holds that the measure of dryness is secular, and does not require a verse to exclude it, for if a verse were needed to exclude it, it would be necessary to exclude the measure of wetness from outside.

hebrew_text: לימא נמי ר' עקיבא ואחד מתלמידי ר' ישמעאל אמרו דבר אחד ומנו רבי יונתן משום דלא שוו במדת לח להדדי
human_translation: let say also, Rabbi Akiva and one of the students of Rabbi Yishmael said the same thing, and who is Rabbi Yonatan. due to are not the same with regard to measuring liquid
llm_translation: Let us also say, Rabbi Akiva and one of the disciples of Rabbi Yishmael said one thing, and Rabbi Yonatan counted them, because they did not agree in the measure of moistness towards each other.

hebrew_text: א"ל רב פפא לאביי והא איכא ביסא דלח הוא א"ל כגון שלש על גבי קטבליא
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to Abaye: But there is receptacle [ bisa ] is liquid said to where he kneaded on top of leather spread [ katavliyya ],
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to Abaye: But there is a house with a roof? He said to him: Like three on top of a palm-branch.

hebrew_text: אי הכי דקאמר ליה רבי יונתן תדע לך שהרי אינה מקדשת לימא ליה כגון דכיילא בעשרון דחול
human_translation: If so, that which Rabbi Yonatan said to you can know as do not consecrate let say to him where he measured in a tenth that non-sacred,
llm_translation: If so, as Rabbi Yonatan said to him, "Know that it is not sanctified," should he not have said to him, "like one who is not sanctified with the tithe of the profane"?

hebrew_text: הכי השתא בשלמא ביסא לא כתב רחמנא דלעביד ביסא למילש ביה כי לש לה על גבי קטבליא לית לן בה אלא עשרון כיון דאמר רחמנא עביד עשרון וכייל ביה שביק עשרון דקודש וכייל בעשרון דחול
human_translation: How can be compared? Granted, a receptacle, the Merciful One does not write that one should use a receptacle to knead when one kneads on top of a leather spread, we have no with it. But a tenth since the Merciful One states use a tenth and measure with it, leave aside consecrated a tenth and measure with a non-sacred a tenth
llm_translation: So now, indeed, regarding a bathhouse, it is understandable. The Merciful One did not write in the Torah to make a bathhouse for bathing in it, for bathing in it is not a proper use. Rather, the purpose of a bathhouse is for a tenth of the water to be heated. Since the Merciful One said to make a tenth of the water heated, and one bathes in it, he leaves the tenth of the holy water and bathes in the tenth of the mundane water.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן מנין למעלה מבשר חטאת ומבשר אשם ומבשר קדשי הקדשים ומקדשים קלים וממותר העומר וממותר שתי הלחם ומלחם הפנים ומשירי מנחות שהוא בלא תעשה
human_translation: The Sages taught From where that one who offers up of the meat of a sin offering, or of the meat of a guilt offering, or of the meat of offerings of the most sacred order, or of the meat of offerings of lesser sanctity, or of the surplus of the omer offering, or of the leftover of the two loaves, or the shewbread, or the remainder of meal offerings, that he a prohibition,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: From where do we derive that above the flesh of the sin-offering, and above the flesh of the guilt-offering, and above the flesh of the most holy offerings, and above the lighter holy offerings, and above the remainder of the Omer offering, and above the remainder of the Two Loaves offering, and above the Bread of the Presence, and above the remnants of meal-offerings, that it is prohibited to derive benefit from them?

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא ב, יא) כי כל שאור וכל דבש לא תקטירו ממנו אשה לה' כל שהוא ממנו לאישים הרי הוא בבל תקטירו
human_translation: The verse states: “For any leaven, and any honey, you shall not burn any of it as an offering made by fire to the Lord” any that of it in fire is in Do not burn,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It is taught (Vayikra 2:11), "For all leaven and all honey you shall not offer up as a fire offering to the Lord." Anything that is from them to men, behold, it is in vain that you offer it up.

hebrew_text: ושתי הלחם ולחם הפנים יש מהן לאישים והתניא יצאו שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים שאין מהם לאישים
human_translation: And the two loaves and the shewbread, is there of them in fire? But isn’t it taught except for the two loaves and the shewbread, as no of them in fire?
llm_translation: And two the bread and bread the faces there is from them to men and it was taught they go out two the bread and bread the faces that there is not from them to men.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת אין מגופו לאישים
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: no of themselves in fire,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: "There is no liability for bodily harm caused by men."

hebrew_text: איתמר המעלה מכולם על גבי הכבש רבי יוחנן אמר חייב ר' אלעזר אמר פטור
human_translation: It was stated: one who brings up of any of onto the ramp Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable Rabbi Elazar says exempt.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who ascends above all of them upon the rampart. Rabbi Yochanan said: liable. Rabbi Elazar said: exempt.

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן אמר חייב דתניא המזבח אין לי אלא מזבח כבש מנין תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ב, יב) ואל המזבח לא יעלו לרצון
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says liable, as it is taught the altar I have only altar. From where ramp The verse states: “But they shall not come up to the altar
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: "Obligated," as it was taught: "The altar." I have only the altar of a lamb. From where do we derive this? To say (Leviticus 2:12), "And upon the altar they shall not ascend for acceptance."

hebrew_text: ור' אלעזר אמר פטור מ"ט דאמר קרא (ויקרא ב, יא). שאור ודבש קרבן ראשית תקריבו אותם אותם
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi Elazar says exempt? As the verse states: leaven, and honey, As an offering of first produce you may bring them
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar said exempt from "it is necessary" as the verse says (Leviticus 2:11), "leaven and honey you shall not offer up as a burnt offering to the Lord."

hebrew_text: הוא דרבי לך כבש כמזבח אבל מידי אחרינא לא
human_translation: “them” this that amplifies for you ramp like altar But other items, not
llm_translation: He who Rabbi Lekh as a lamb as an altar but from anything else not

hebrew_text: ור' יוחנן האי אותם מאי עביד ליה
human_translation: And what does Rabbi Yoḥanan, do with this “Them,”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan, this one, what does he do with them?

hebrew_text: מיבעי ליה לכדתניא יכול יהא יחיד מתנדב ומביא כיוצא בה נדבה וקורא אני בה (דברים כג, כד) מוצא שפתיך תשמור ועשית
human_translation: He requires it for that which is taught might an individual may donate and bring a gift similar to those and I read with regard to “That which has gone out of your lips you shall observe and do;
llm_translation: He needs according to the teaching, perhaps he should be an individual who volunteers and brings a similar voluntary offering, and he reads in it (Deuteronomy 23:24) "You shall keep and do what has passed your lips."

hebrew_text: ת"ל (ויקרא ב, יב) קרבן ראשית תקריבו ציבור אמרתי לך ולא יחיד
human_translation: the verse states: “As an offering of first produce you may bring.” I said to you a community but an individual not
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Talmud teaches (Leviticus 2:12) 'The offering of first fruits you shall bring as a communal offering.' I have said to you, not an individual."

hebrew_text: יכול לא יהא יחיד מביא שאינו מביא חובתו כיוצא בה אבל יהא ציבור מביא שמביא חובתו כיוצא בה ת"ל אותם ומה יש לך להביא שתי הלחם מן השאור ובכורים מן הדבש
human_translation: might an individual may not bring as does not bring his obligatory similar to those But community shall bring as does bring its obligatory similar to those the verse states: them,” And what is there for you to bring The two loaves from leaven, and first fruits from honey,
llm_translation: One might have thought that an individual may not bring an offering if he does not bring his obligation just like it, but the community may bring an offering even if it does not bring its obligation just like it. The verse teaches: "Those," indicating that just as you must bring two loaves from leaven and first fruits from honey.

hebrew_text: ושתי הלחם לא יקרבו נדבה והתניא אם נאמר (ויקרא ב, יא) כל שאור למה נאמר כל דבש ואם נאמר כל דבש למה נאמר כל שאור מפני שיש בשאור מה שאין בדבש ויש בדבש מה שאין בשאור
human_translation: And may the two loaves not be sacrificed gift But isn’t it taught If it is stated: “Any leaven,” why is it stated: “Any honey”? And if it is stated: “Any honey,” why is it stated: “Any leaven”? because there is to leaven that is not to honey, and there is to honey that is not to leaven.
llm_translation: "And the two loaves shall not be brought as a voluntary offering." And it was taught in a Baraita: If it is stated (Leviticus 2:11), 'All leaven,' why is 'all honey' stated? And if 'all honey' is stated, why is 'all leaven' stated? Because there is something in leaven that is not in honey, and there is something in honey that is not in leaven."

hebrew_text: שאור הותר מכללו במקדש דבש לא הותר מכללו במקדש
human_translation: leaven, its general was permitted in the Temple, honey, no its general was permitted in the Temple.
llm_translation: Leaven was permitted from its general category in the Temple, honey was not permitted from its general category in the Temple.

hebrew_text: דבש הותר בשירי מנחות שאור לא הותר בשירי מנחות הא מפני שיש בשאור מה שאין בדבש ויש בדבש מה שאין בשאור הוצרך לומר כל שאור והוצרך לומר כל דבש
human_translation: honey is permitted of the remainder of meal offerings, leaven is not permitted of the remainder of meal offerings, Due to that there is to leaven that is not to honey, and there is to honey that is not to leaven, it was necessary to state: “Any leaven,” and it was necessary to state: “Any honey.”
llm_translation: Honey is permitted in the meal-offerings, but leaven is not permitted in the meal-offerings. This is because there is in leaven that which is not in honey, and there is in honey that which is not in leaven. It was necessary to say "all leaven" and it was necessary to say "all honey."

hebrew_text: שאור דהותר מכללו במקדש מאי ניהו לאו שתי הלחם דקרבה נדבה אמר רב עמרם לא ליקרב עמהם
human_translation: leaven that its general was permitted in the Temple, what is this? Isn’t that two loaves may be sacrificed a gift Rav Amram said: No, are brought with
llm_translation: Leaven of that permitted from its entirety in the Temple, what are they? Are they not the two loaves of the offering of the voluntary gift? Rav Amram said: Not to offer with them.

hebrew_text: א"ה בכורים נמי דתנן הגוזלות שעל גבי הסלין היו עולות והסלים שבידם ניתנין לכהנים הנהו לעטר בכורים הוא דאתו
human_translation: If so, first fruits also, As we learned the fledglings that on top of the baskets they would burnt offerings, and the baskets that were in the possession be given to the priests. These came to decorate first fruits,
llm_translation: א"ה בכורים נמי דתנן הגוזלות שעל גבי הסלין היו עולות והסלים שבידם ניתנין לכהנים הנהו לעטר בכורים הוא דאתו Firstborns also, as we learned: the fledglings that were on top of the baskets would ascend, and the baskets in their hands were given to the priests. Those are the crowns of firstborns that came.

hebrew_text: בעי רמי בר חמא מרב חסדא המעלה מבשר חטאת העוף ע"ג המזבח מהו
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama asked Rav Ḥisda: one who offers up on the altar of the meat of a bird a sin offering, what is
llm_translation: Inquired Rami bar Hama from Rav Ḥisda: One who brings up the flesh of a bird sin-offering upon the altar, what is the halakha?

hebrew_text: כל שממנו לאישים אמר רחמנא והאי אין ממנו לאישים או דלמא כל ששמו קרבן והאי נמי שמו קרבן אמר ליה כל ששמו קרבן והאי נמי שמו קרבן
human_translation: The Merciful One states any that of it in fire And no of this in fire Or perhaps, any that is called an offering and this also called an offering, said to Any that is called an offering and this also called an offering.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: "Anyone who designates an offering for men, the Merciful One said, 'But this one is not designated for men.' Or perhaps, 'Anyone whose name is Korban,' and this one also, his name is Korban."

hebrew_text: כתנאי ר' אליעזר אומר כל שממנו לאישים רבי עקיבא אומר כל ששמו קרבן
human_translation: subject to tanna’im , Rabbi Eliezer says: any that of it in fire Rabbi Akiva says: Any that is called an offering
llm_translation: The opinions of the Tannaim: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Any animal designated for men." Rabbi Akiva says, "Any animal whose name is 'sacrifice.'"

hebrew_text: מאי בינייהו אמר רב חסדא בשר חטאת העוף איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What is between Rav Ḥisda said: between them the meat of a bird sin offering
llm_translation: What is the difference between them? Rav Ḥisda said: In the flesh of the sin-offering bird there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: רב אמר לוג שמן של מצורע איכא בינייהו דתני לוי (במדבר יח, ט) כל קרבנם לרבות לוג שמן של מצורע
human_translation: Rav said: between them log of oil of leper, as Levi teaches: “Every offering of theirs to include the log of oil of a leper.
llm_translation: Rav said: There is a distinction between them, as Levi taught (Numbers 18:9): "All their offerings, to include the log of oil of the leper."

hebrew_text: ת"ר שאור בל תקטירו אין לי אלא כולו מקצתו מנין תלמוד לומר כל עירובו מנין ת"ל כי כל
human_translation: The Sages taught leaven: Do not burn I have only all of it From where part of it The verse states: “Any [ kol ] from where its mixed state, The verse states “As [ ki ] any
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Do not burn leaven." I only have this, but how much of it? From where do we derive it? The Torah states: "For all its leaven."

hebrew_text: מאי קאמר אמר אביי הכי קאמר שאור בל תקטירו אין לי אלא כזית חצי זית מנין ת"ל כל עירובו מנין ת"ל כי כל
human_translation: What is it saying? Abaye said: This is saying: leaven: Do not burn I have only an olive-bulk From where half an olive-bulk? The verse states: “Any from where its mixed state? The verse states: “As any
llm_translation: What is Abaye saying? Abaye said: This is what he is saying - "Do not burn leaven." I only have a measure of an olive's bulk. How do I know? The Torah states, "All of his offering." How do I know? For all.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר הכי קאמר שאור בל תקטירו אין לי אלא קומץ חצי קומץ מנין תלמוד לומר כל עירובו מנין תלמוד לומר כי כל
human_translation: Rava said This is saying: leaven: Do not burn I have only handful From where half handful? The verse states: “Any from where its mixed state? The verse states: “As any
llm_translation: Rava said thus: "Leaven shall not be burnt." I have only a handful, half a handful. From where do we derive this? To say, "For all his offerings." From where do we derive this? To say, "For all."

hebrew_text: במאי קא מיפלגי אביי סבר יש קומץ פחות משני זיתים
human_translation: what do disagree? Abaye holds: There is a handful less than two olives.
llm_translation: With what do they disagree? Abaye holds: there is a kometz less than two olives.

hebrew_text: ויש הקטרה פחותה מכזית
human_translation: And there is burning less than an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: And there is incense less than an olive's bulk.

hebrew_text: ורבא אמר אין קומץ פחות משני זיתים ואין הקטרה פחותה מכזית
human_translation: And Rava says: There is no a handful less than two olives, And there is no burning less than an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: And Rava said: A kometz is not less than two olives, and the ketoret is not less than a k'zayit.

hebrew_text: איתמר המעלה משאור ומדבש על גבי המזבח אמר רבא לוקה משום שאור ולוקה משום דבש לוקה משום עירובי שאור ומשום עירובי דבש
human_translation: It was stated: one who offers up of leaven and of honey on the altar, Rava says: is flogged due to leaven, and he is flogged due to honey, he is flogged due to mixtures of leaven, and due to mixtures of honey.
llm_translation: It was stated: One who offers up leavened bread and honey upon the altar - Rava said: He is liable on account of the leaven, and he is liable on account of the honey; he is liable on account of the mingling of leaven, and he is liable on account of the mingling of honey.

hebrew_text: אביי אמר אין לוקין על לאו שבכללות
human_translation: Abaye says: One is not flogged for a general prohibition,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: One does not receive lashes for a negative commandment that is general.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי חדא מיהא לקי
human_translation: There are who say in any event flogged one
llm_translation: There are those who say: "One may strike him."

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי חדא נמי לא לקי דהא לא מיחד לאויה כלאו דחסימה:
human_translation: And there are who say is not even flogged one as the prohibition is not specific like the prohibition against muzzling.
llm_translation: And there are those who say: One also does not receive lashes because he did not fully intend for the prohibition.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ יש טעונות שמן ולבונה שמן ולא לבונה לבונה ולא שמן לא לבונה ולא שמן
human_translation: There are that require oil and frankincense, oil but not frankincense, frankincense but not oil, neither frankincense nor oil.
llm_translation: Mishnah: There are those that require oil and frankincense, oil but not frankincense, frankincense but not oil, neither frankincense nor oil.

hebrew_text: ואלו טעונות שמן ולבונה מנחת הסולת והמחבת והמרחשת והחלות והרקיקין
human_translation: And these require oil and frankincense: The fine-flour meal offering, the a pan the a deep pan and the loaves or wafers
llm_translation: And these are the requirements: oil, frankincense, meal-offering, pan, shovel, censer, loaves, and wafers.

hebrew_text: מנחת כהנים מנחת כהן משיח מנחת עובד כוכבים מנחת נשים מנחת העומר
human_translation: the meal offering of priests; the meal offering of the anointed priest, the meal offering of a gentile; a meal offering by women; the omer meal offering
llm_translation: Offering of Priests, Offering of the Anointed Priest, Offering of a Non-Jew, Offering of Women, Offering of the Omer.

hebrew_text: מנחת נסכים טעונה שמן ואין טעונה לבונה לחם הפנים טעון לבונה ואין טעון שמן
human_translation: The meal offering libations requires oil but does not require frankincense. The shewbread requires frankincense but does not require oil.
llm_translation: Minchat Nesachim requires oil and does not require frankincense. Lechem Hapanim requires frankincense and does not require oil.

llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Perhaps it is indeed so, and is it not the same law? And what about a meal offering of libations, which does not require frankincense, it requires oil; the showbread, which requires frankincense, does not require oil. It is not the same law that requires oil. The verse states 'upon it, upon it oil,' and not upon the showbread oil."

human_translation: As might this not inference? Just as the showbread, which does not require oil, requires frankincense, the meal offering of libations, which requires oil, is it not the same law that it requires frankincense? The Talmud teaches to say regarding it, regarding it - frankincense, and not regarding the meal offering of libations - frankincense."

human_translation: What was about Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: is taught a meal offering of a sinner or a meal offering of jealousy upon which one placed frankincense, gather up the frankincense and valid. And if, before he gathered its frankincense, had intent its either beyond its time or outside its area, disqualified, but there is no karet ,
llm_translation: "What is considered 'bringing it up'? Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: It was taught in a Baraita: If one designated frankincense for a sin-offering or for a jealousy-offering, and then he placed it on coals, and someone gathered the frankincense, and it became fit for use, and if before he gathered it, he had intent regarding it, whether outside its designated time or outside its designated place, it is invalid, and it does not incur the penalty of karet."

hebrew_text: ואם משליקט לבונתה מחשב עליה חוץ למקומו פסול ואין בו כרת חוץ לזמנו פיגול וחייבין עליו כרת

llm_translation: Mishnah: There are offerings that require presentation, but do not require waving; presentation and waving; waving but not presentation; neither waving nor presentation.

hebrew_text: ואלו טעונות הגשה ואין טעונות תנופה מנחת הסולת והמחבת ומרחשת והחלות והרקיקין מנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח מנחת נכרים מנחת נשים ומנחת חוטא
human_translation: And these require bringing near but do not require waving: The fine-flour meal offering; the a pan; the a deep pan; the loaves or wafers; the meal offering of priests; the meal offering of the anointed priest; the meal offering of gentiles; a meal offering by women; and the meal offering of a sinner.
llm_translation: And these require offering, and do not require waving: Meal-offering of fine flour, the pan, the shovel, the censer, the loaves, and the wafers; Meal-offering of priests, Meal-offering of an anointed priest, Meal-offering of non-Jews, Meal-offering of women, and Meal-offering of a sinner.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר מנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח אין בהן הגשה לפי שאין בהן קמיצה וכל שאין בהן קמיצה אין בהן הגשה:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The meal offering of priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest do not require bringing near due to that there is no removal of a handful in their and any where there is no removal of a handful in their there is no bringing near.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The meal offering of the priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest do not have presentation, because they do not have a handful, and anything that does not have a handful does not have presentation.

llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "And you shall bring to include the Omer offering for presentation." And so it says (Leviticus 23:10), "And you shall bring the Omer, the beginning of your harvest, to the kohen." And he shall offer it to include the meal offering of the Sotah for presentation. And so it says (Numbers 5:25), "And he shall bring it to the altar."

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר והבאת לרבות מנחת סוטה להגשה וכן הוא אומר (במדבר ה, טו) והביא את קרבנה עליה

llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "And you shall bring to include the meal offering of the suspected adulteress for presentation." And so it says (Numbers 5:15): "And he shall bring her offering upon her."

llm_translation: But the meal offering of the Omer does not require a verse. What is the reason? Because it is a matter of law. And just as the meal offering of a sin offering, which does not require waving, requires offering, the meal offering of the Omer, which requires waving, is not the same as requiring offering.

hebrew_text: ומאי פרכת רבי שמעון פריך הכי מה להצד השוה שבהן שכן מצויין

hebrew_text: ודין הוא ציבור מביא מנחה מן החיטין חובה ומביא מנחה מן השעורים חובה אף יחיד שמביא מנחה מן החיטין נדבה (יכול) יביא מנחה מן השעורין נדבה תלמוד לומר אלה אין לי אלא אלה
human_translation: And is logical inference community brings an obligatory meal offering from wheat, and brings an obligatory meal offering from barley, So too an individual, who brings a meal offering from wheat gift can bring a meal offering from barley gift the verse states: these nothing other than these
llm_translation: "And the law is: the community brings a meal-offering from wheat - obligatory, and brings a meal-offering from barley - obligatory. Even an individual who brings a meal-offering from wheat - voluntary. (One might think) he should bring a meal-offering from barley - voluntary. The Torah teaches to say 'these' - I have only these."

hebrew_text: או אינו אומר אלה אלא לאומר הרי עלי מנחה שמביא חמישתן תלמוד לומר מאלה רצה אחת מביא רצה חמישתן מביא
human_translation: Or states “these” not but rather to with regard to says: It upon me a meal offering, that he must bring five of them. The verse states: “Of these,” wants, he brings one wants, he brings five of them.
llm_translation: Or he does not say these except to say "Behold, upon me is a meal offering that he brings its fifth." Scripture states to say "from these he desires one, he brings its fifth he brings."

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר את המנחה לרבות שאר מנחות כגון מנחת נכרים מנחת נשים להגשה יכול שאני מרבה אף שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים תלמוד לומר מאלה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: “The meal offering” to include other meal offerings, for example the meal offering of gentiles a meal offering by women, with regard to bringing near. might that I include even the two loaves and the shewbread. the verse states: “Of these,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "The Mincha offering includes other Mincha offerings, such as the Mincha of a non-Jew and the Mincha of a woman for presentation. One might have thought to include even the two loaves and the showbread. The Torah teaches us by saying 'from these.'"

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות שאר מנחות ולהוציא שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים מרבה אני שאר מנחות שיש מהן לאישים ומוציא אני שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים שאין מהן לאישים
human_translation: And what did you see to include other meal offerings and to exclude the two loaves and the shewbread I include other meal offerings, as there is of them in fire and I exclude the two loaves and the shewbread as there is no of them in fire
llm_translation: And what did you see to include other meal offerings and to exclude the two loaves and the showbread? I say, the other meal offerings, of which some are for individuals, and I exclude the two loaves and the showbread, of which none are for individuals.

hebrew_text: והלא מנחת נסכים כולה לאישים יכול יהא טעונה הגשה תלמוד לומר והקריבה
human_translation: But meal offering libations, entirely in fire, might it require bringing near. The verse states: and it shall be drawn near
llm_translation: And behold, the meal offering of libations, all for men. Could it be that it requires presentation? The Talmud teaches to say, "And he shall offer it."

hebrew_text: והא אפיקתיה והקריב והקריבה ומה ראית לרבות שאר מנחות ולהוציא מנחת נסכים
human_translation: But didn’t you derive And shall be drawn near, “And it shall be drawn near,” And what did you see to include other meal offerings and to exclude the meal offering libations
llm_translation: And ha apikateiha v'hakriv v'hakrivah u'mah ra'ita l'rabot she'ar minchot ul'hotzi minchat nesachim.

hebrew_text: מרבה אני שאר מנחות שבאות בגלל עצמן ומוציא אני מנחת נסכים שאינה באה בגלל עצמה והלא מנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח באות בגלל עצמן יכול יהו טעונות הגשה
human_translation: I include other meal offerings, as they come due to themselves, and I exclude meal offering libations, as it does not come due to itself But the meal offering of priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest come due to themselves, might they require bringing near.
llm_translation: I am abundant other meal-offerings that come because of themselves and I bring out meal-offering of libations that does not come because of itself and behold meal-offering of priests and meal-offering of anointed priest come because of themselves perhaps they require presentation.

hebrew_text: תלמוד לומר והגישה האי מיבעי ליה לגופה שטעונה הגשה מן והגיש והגישה
human_translation: the verse states: “And he shall bring it near But that is required for its own sake, that requires bringing near from “And he shall bring,” “And he shall bring it.”
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: It is necessary to say "and he shall bring it near," to include the bringing near of its own accord, which requires bringing near from where it is, as it says "and he shall bring it near."

hebrew_text: ומה ראית לרבות שאר מנחות ולהוציא מנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח מרבה אני שאר מנחות שיש מהן לאישים ובאות בגלל עצמן ויש מהן לכהנים ומוציא אני שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים שאין מהן לאישים ומנחת נסכים שאינה באה בגלל עצמה ומנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח שאין מהן לכהנים
human_translation: And what did you see to include other meal offerings and to exclude the meal offering of priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest? I include other meal offerings, as there is of them in fire and they come due to themselves, and there is of them to the priests And I exclude the two loaves and the shewbread, as there is no of them in fire. And the meal offering libations, as it does not come due to itself, and the meal offering of priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest, as there is no of them to the priests.
llm_translation: And what did you see to include other meal offerings and to exclude the meal offering of priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest? I include other meal offerings, some of which are for individuals and come on their own account, and some of which are for priests. And I exclude the two loaves and the showbread, which are not for individuals, and the meal offering of libations, which does not come on its own account, and the meal offering of priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest, which are not for priests.

hebrew_text: והרים יכול בכלי תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ו, ח) והרים ממנו בקומצו מה הרמה האמור להלן בקומצו אף הרמה האמור כאן בקומצו:
human_translation: “And shall take off,” might with a vessel. the verse states: And he shall take off from it his handful” Just as the taking off that is stated below with the handful so too, the taking off that is stated here with the handful,
llm_translation: And the heave offering, one might have thought can be done with any vessel; the verse says (Leviticus 6:8) "and he shall lift from it with its handful." Just as the lifting mentioned there is with its handful, so too the lifting mentioned here is with its handful.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אלו טעונות תנופה ואין טעונות הגשה לוג שמן של מצורע ואשמו והבכורים כדברי רבי אליעזר בן יעקב ואימורי שלמי יחיד וחזה ושוק שלהן
human_translation: These require waving and do not require bringing near The log of oil of leper and his guilt offering and the first fruits, in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov; and the sacrificial portions of the peace offerings of an individual and their breast and thigh,
llm_translation: Mishnah: These require waving, but do not require bringing near: a log of oil for a leper, his guilt-offering, and the firstborn animals, according to the words of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov, and the portions of individual peace-offerings, the breast and the thigh of them.

hebrew_text: אחד אנשים ואחד נשים בישראל ולא באחרים שתי הלחם ושני כבשי עצרת
human_translation: both men and women, by Jews and not by others. the two loaves and two lambs Shavuot
llm_translation: One men and one women in Israel and not in others two the bread and two the lambs of the assembly.

hebrew_text: כיצד הוא עושה נותן שתי הלחם על גבי שני כבשים ומניח שתי ידיו למטה מוליך ומביא מעלה ומוריד שנאמר (שמות כט, כז) אשר הונף ואשר הורם תנופה היתה במזרח והגשה במערב תנופות קודמות להגשות
human_translation: How does one perform He places the two loaves on top two lambs and places his two hands below extends and brings back, raises and lowers as it is stated “Which is waved, and which is heaved up” Waving was to the east but bringing near to the west, the wavings precede the bringing near.
llm_translation: How does one do it? He places the two loaves upon the two lambs and places his two hands below, guiding and bringing them up and down, as it is stated (Exodus 29:27), "that which is waved and that which is raised up as a wave offering was in the east and presented in the west, wave offerings preceding presentations."

hebrew_text: מנחת העומר ומנחת קנאות טעונות הגשה ותנופה לחם הפנים ומנחת נסכים אין טעונות לא הגשה ולא תנופה
human_translation: The omer meal offering and the meal offering of jealousy require bringing near and waving. The shewbread and the meal offering libations require neither bringing near nor waving.
llm_translation: The offering of the Omer and the offering of jealousy require presentation and waving; the showbread and the drink offerings do not require either presentation or waving.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר ג' מינין טעונין ג' מצות שתים בכל אחת ואחת ושלישית אין בהן ואלו הן זבחי שלמי יחיד וזבחי שלמי ציבור ואשם מצורע
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: three types require three mitzvot. Two on each and every one but the third is not in their And these are the Peace offerings individual, communal peace offerings, and the guilt offering of a leper
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Three species require three commandments, two in each one, and the third does not have them. And these are they: Peace-offerings of an individual, peace-offerings of the community, and guilt-offering of a leper.

hebrew_text: זבחי שלמי יחיד טעונין סמיכה חיים ותנופה שחוטין ואין בהן תנופה חיים זבחי שלמי ציבור טעונים תנופה חיים ושחוטין [ואין בהם סמיכה] ואשם מצורע טעון סמיכה ותנופה חי ואין בו תנופה שחוט:
human_translation: Peace offerings individuals require placing hands alive, and waving slaughtered, but there is no waving them alive. Communal peace offerings require waving alive and slaughtered, but there is no placing hands And the guilt offering of a leper requires placing hands and waving alive, but there is no waving slaughtered.
llm_translation: Sacrifices of individual peace offerings require leaning, living, and waving; they are slaughtered, and do not have waving while alive. Sacrifices of communal peace offerings require waving, living, and slaughtered and do not have leaning. And a guilt offering of a leper requires leaning and waving, living, and does not have waving while slaughtered.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן (ויקרא יד, יב) והקריב אותו לאשם ואת לוג השמן והניף אותם תנופה מלמד שטעונין תנופה כאחד
human_translation: The Sages taught and sacrifice it for a guilt offering, and the log of oil, and wave them for a wave offering teaches that require waving, together.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 14:12), "And he shall bring it for a guilt offering, along with a log of oil, and shall elevate them as a wave offering." This teaches that they require a wave offering together.

hebrew_text: ומנין שאם הניף זה בעצמו וזה בעצמו יצא תלמוד לומר והקריב אותו לאשם והניף יכול יניף ויחזיר ויניף תלמוד לומר תנופה ולא תנופות
human_translation: And from where that if waved this one by itself and that one by itself fulfilled The verse states, “And sacrifice it for a guilt offering…and wave.” might wave and then wave the verse states: “A wave offering,” but not wavings.
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that if he waved this by itself and that by itself, he fulfills his obligation? The Talmud teaches to say, "And he shall bring it for a guilt offering." And if one might think he should wave and then return and wave, the Talmud teaches to say, "A waving" and not "wavings."

hebrew_text: (ויקרא יד, יב) לפני ה' במזרח והא אמר לפני ה' יכול במערב
human_translation: before the Lord,” to the east But doesn’t say, “Before the Lord” might to the west
llm_translation: Before the Lord in the east, and behold, it says "before the Lord," could I say in the west.

hebrew_text: אמרי הני מילי מנחה דאיקרי חטאת וחטאת טעונה יסוד וקרן דרומית מזרחית לא היה לו יסוד אבל הכא לפני ה' קרינא ביה
human_translation: say This statement, meal offering, which is called “a sin offering,” and sin offering requires base and southeast corner did not have a base, But here, we call “before the Lord.”
llm_translation: The sages said these words: A meal-offering that is called a sin-offering, and a sin-offering requires a foundation and a southeastern horn, if it did not have a foundation, but here before the Lord, we call it so.

hebrew_text: והבכורים כדברי רבי אליעזר בן יעקב מאי רבי אליעזר בן יעקב דתניא (דברים כו, ד) ולקח הכהן לימד על הבכורים שטעונין תנופה דברי רבי אליעזר בן יעקב
human_translation: The first fruits in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov. What is Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, as it is taught “And the priest shall take taught concerning the first fruits, that they require waving; the statement of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov.
llm_translation: The firstborns, according to the words of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov. What is the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov? As it was taught (Deuteronomy 26:4), "And the priest shall take the basket from your hand and set it down before the altar of the Lord your God." This teaches regarding the firstborns that they require waving. These are the words of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דרבי אליעזר בן יעקב גמר יד יד משלמים כתיב הכא ולקח הכהן הטנא מידך וכתיב התם (ויקרא ז, ל) ידיו תביאנה
human_translation: What is the reason of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, is derived “hand,” from “hand,” a peace offering. It is written here, “And the priest shall take the basket from your hand” and it is written there: his hands shall bring it,
llm_translation: What is the reason for Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov's opinion that one must pay hand by hand? It is written here "and the priest shall take the basket from your hand," and it is written there (Leviticus 7:30) "his hands shall bring the offerings."

hebrew_text: מה כאן כהן אף להלן כהן ומה להלן בעלים אף כאן בעלים הא כיצד כהן מניח ידו תחת ידי בעלים ומניף
human_translation: Just as here, priest so too there, a priest Just as there, owner so too here, owner How so; priest places his hands beneath the hands of the owner and waves
llm_translation: Here is the translation of the Talmudic text: "What is here, a priest, so too there, a priest. And just as there, owners, so too here, owners. How so? The priest places his hand beneath the hand of the owner and waves."

hebrew_text: ולימא נמי כדברי ר' יהודה דתניא רבי יהודה אומר (דברים כו, י) והנחתו זו תנופה אתה אומר זו תנופה או אינו אלא הנחה
human_translation: And let also say in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught Rabbi Yehuda says “And you shall place it this waving Do you say this waving, or it is only actual placement
llm_translation: And let us also say according to the words of Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught: Rabbi Yehuda says (Deuteronomy 26:10), "And you shall set it down," you say this refers to waving offering, is it indeed waving or rather setting down.

hebrew_text: כשהוא אומר והניחו הרי הנחה אמור הא מה אני מקיים והנחתו זו תנופה
human_translation: When it states and place it placement is stated; how do I realize “And you shall place it”? This waving.
llm_translation: When he says "and he shall place it," behold, placement is spoken. What am I fulfilling? "And his offering" - this is waving.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הואיל ופתח בו הכתוב תחלה רב נחמן בר יצחק אמר הואיל ורב גבריה
human_translation: Rava says: since the verse opened first with Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: since his strength is great,
llm_translation: Rava said: Since the verse began with it initially, Rav Nahman bar Yitzchak said: Since the master is a great man.

hebrew_text: ואימורי שלמי יחיד וחזה ושוק שלהן אחד האנשים ואחד הנשים בישראל אבל לא באחרים מאי קאמר
human_translation: And the sacrificial portions of the peace offerings of an individual, and their breast and thigh, both men and women, by Jews and not by others. What is saying?
llm_translation: And the offerings of an individual, and the breast and the thigh belong to one of the men and one of the women in Israel, but not to others. What is it saying?

hebrew_text: אמר רב יהודה הכי קאמר אחד אנשים ואחד נשים קרבנן טעון תנופה ותנופה עצמה בישראל אבל לא בידי נשים
human_translation: Rav Yehuda said this is saying: Both men and women, their offerings require waving, but waving itself by Jews, But by women, not
llm_translation: Rav Yehudah said thus: One, men, and one, women, their offering requires waving, and the waving itself by Israel, but not by the hands of women.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן בני ישראל מניפין ואין העובדי כוכבים מניפין בני ישראל מניפין ואין הנשים מניפות
human_translation: The Sages taught the Jewish people wave but gentiles sons of Israel, wave but women do not wave
llm_translation: The Sages taught: The Israelites wave the lulav and the idolaters do not wave. The Israelites wave, and the women do not wave.

hebrew_text: א"ר יוסי מצינו שחלק הכתוב בין קרבן ישראל לקרבן עובדי כוכבים לקרבן נשים בסמיכה יכול נחלוק בתנופה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: We have found that the Torah differentiates between the offering of a Jew and the offering of gentiles and the offering of women, with regard to placing hands. might Can we differentiate with regard to waving,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei said: We find that the verse distinguishes between the offering of an Israelite and the offering of a non-Jew, and the offering of women in terms of proximity. One might think that it should also be distinguished in terms of waving.

hebrew_text: לא מה לי חלק בסמיכה שהסמיכה בבעלים
human_translation: No; what differentiates with regard to placing hands? that placing hands by the owner
llm_translation: Not what to me portion in semikha that semikha in owners.

hebrew_text: נחלוק בתנופה שהתנופה בכהנים אם כן מה תלמוד לומר בני ישראל בני ישראל מניפין ואין העובדי כוכבים מניפין בני ישראל מניפין ואין הנשים מניפות
human_translation: we differentiate with regard to waving Since waving by priests, If so, what the verse states: “The children of [ benei ] Israel”? the Jewish people wave but gentiles sons of [ benei ] Israel, wave but women do not wave
llm_translation: We divide regarding the waving offering that is waved by the priests. If so, what does the Talmud say? "The children of Israel, the children of Israel wave, and the idolaters do not wave. The children of Israel wave, and the women do not wave."

hebrew_text: תניא אידך בני ישראל אין לי אלא בני ישראל גרים ועבדים משוחררין מנין תלמוד לומר המקריב
human_translation: It is taught another “The children of Israel,” I have only the children of Israel, From where converts and emancipated slaves? The verse states, “He who offers [ hammakriv ]
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: "The sons of Israel" - I have only the sons of Israel, both converts and freed slaves. From where do we derive this? To say, "He who offers."

hebrew_text: או אינו אלא זה כהן המקריב כשהוא אומר (ויקרא ז, ל) ידיו תביאנה הרי בעלים אמור הא כיצד כהן מניח ידיו תחת ידי הבעלים ומניף
human_translation: Or not rather this who sacrifices [ hammakriv ] when it states: “His own hands shall bring owner is stated. How so? priest places his hands beneath the hands of the owner and waves
llm_translation: Or, rather, is this like a priest who sacrifices when he says (Leviticus 7:30) "his hands shall bring it"? Behold, the owners are saying. How so? The priest places his hands beneath the hands of the owners and waves.

hebrew_text: כיצד עושה מניח אימורין על פיסת היד וחזה ושוק עליהן ובכל מקום שיש לחם הלחם מלמעלה
human_translation: How does perform places the sacrificial portions on the palm of the hand, and breast and thigh on them. And in any place, where there are loaves the loaves on the top.
llm_translation: How does one do? Placing the portions on the palm of the hand and the chest and the thigh upon them, and in every place where there is bread, the bread is placed above.

hebrew_text: היכא אמר רב פפא במלואים
human_translation: Where Rav Pappa says: with regard to inauguration
llm_translation: Where did Rav Pappa say "in full"?

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא אילימא משום דכתיב (ויקרא י, טו) שוק התרומה וחזה התנופה על אשי החלבים יביאו להניף תנופה והכתיב (ויקרא ז, ל) את החלב על החזה יביאנו
human_translation: What is the reason, If we say because it is written: “The thigh of heaving and the breast of waving they shall bring upon the offerings of the fat made by fire, to wave it for a wave offering But isn’t it written “The fat upon the breast he shall bring,
llm_translation: What is the reason? If you say it is because it is written (Leviticus 10:15), "The thigh of the offering and the breast of the wave offering they shall bring with the offerings of fat to wave as a wave offering," and it is written (Leviticus 7:30), "And the fat upon the breast he shall bring,"

hebrew_text: אמר אביי ההוא דמייתי ליה כהן מבית המטבחיים ורמי ליה
human_translation: Abaye said: That when priest brings from the slaughtering area and overturns
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "That one who resembles a priest from the kitchens, and he raised him up."

hebrew_text: והכתיב (ויקרא ט, כ) וישימו את החלבים על החזות ההוא דיהיב ליה לכהן אחרינא ואזיל ומקטר ליה
human_translation: But isn’t it written: “And they put the fat upon the breasts” That when gives them to another priest, And goes and burns
llm_translation: And it is written (Leviticus 9:20), "And they placed the fat parts upon the breast." That which was given to another priest, he goes and offers it up.

hebrew_text: והא קא משמע לן דבעינן שלשה כהנים משום דכתיב (משלי יד, כח) ברוב עם הדרת מלך:
human_translation: And this teaches us that we require three priests because it is written: “In the multitude of people is the King’s glory”
llm_translation: And this implies to us that we require three priests because it is written (Proverbs 14:28) "In a multitude of people is the king's glory."

hebrew_text: ושתי הלחם ושני כבשי עצרת [וכו']: תנו רבנן (ויקרא כג, כ) והניף הכהן אותם על לחם הביכורים
human_translation: And the two loaves and two lambs Shavuot the Sages taught “And the priest shall wave them upon the bread of the first fruits
llm_translation: "And the two loaves and the two lambs of Shavuot etc.: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 23:20) 'And the Kohen shall wave them with the bread of the first fruits.'"

hebrew_text: יכול יניח כבשים על גבי הלחם תלמוד לומר על שני כבשים אי על שני כבשים יכול לחם על גבי כבשים תלמוד לומר על לחם הביכורים
human_translation: might place lambs on top of the bread the verse states: upon the two lambs,” If “Upon the two lambs,” might bread on top of the lambs. the verse states: “Upon the bread of the first fruits,”
llm_translation: It is possible that he may place lambs on top of the bread. The Talmud teaches to say, "On two lambs." If on two lambs, it could be that the bread is on top of the lambs. The Talmud teaches to say, "On the bread of the firstfruits."

hebrew_text: נישתקל הכתוב ואיני יודע אם לחם על גבי כבשים ואם כבשים על גבי לחם מה מצינו בכל מקום לחם למעלה אף כאן לחם למעלה היכא אמר רב פפא במילואים
human_translation: the verse is balanced, and I do not know whether bread on top of the lambs, or whether lambs on top of bread. Just as we find everywhere bread above so too, bread above Where Rav Pappa says: with regard to inauguration
llm_translation: The verse is perplexing, and I do not know if it refers to bread placed on top of lambs, or lambs placed on top of bread. What do we find in every instance? Bread is above. So too here, bread is above. Where did Rav Papa say this? In the context of the offerings.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי בן המשולם אומר כבשים למעלה ומה אני מקיים על שני כבשים להוציא שבעה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei ben HaMeshullam says: lambs above, And how do I realize “Upon the two lambs,” to exclude seven
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosi ben Hamshulam says: "Sheep above." And how do I fulfill the requirement for two sheep to bring out seven.

hebrew_text: חנינא בן חכינאי אומר מניח שתי הלחם בין ירכותיהן של כבשים ומניף ונמצא מקיים שני מקראות הללו לחם על גבי כבשים וכבשים על גבי הלחם אמר רבי לפני מלך בשר ודם אין עושין כן לפני מלך מלכי המלכים הקב"ה עושין כן אלא מניח זה בצד זה ומניף
human_translation: Ḥanina ben Ḥakhinai says places the two loaves between the thighs of lambs and waves And it is found realizes these two verses, bread is on top of the lambs and lambs on top of the bread. Rabbi says, One would not do so, before a flesh and blood king; one do so before the King of kings, the Holy One, Blessed be He? Rather, he places alongside each other, and waves
llm_translation: Hanina ben Hakinai says, "He places two loaves between the hind legs of the lambs and waves, thus fulfilling these two verses: 'bread upon the lambs' and 'lambs upon the bread.'" Rabbi said, "Before an earthly king, one does not do so; but before the King of kings, the Holy One, Blessed be He, one does so. Rather, he places this beside that and waves."

hebrew_text: והא בעינן על א"ל רב חסדא לרב המנונא ואמרי לה רב המנונא לרב חסדא רבי לטעמיה דאמר על בסמוך
human_translation: But we require “upon [ al ]” Rav Ḥisda says to Rav Hamnuna, and some say Rav Hamnuna to Rav Ḥisda: Rabbi to his reasoning, as he says al next to.
llm_translation: And this, we require regarding what Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Hamnuna, and some say Rav Hamnuna to Rav Ḥisda: "Rabbi, according to his reasoning, said about the adjacent matter."

hebrew_text: דתניא (ויקרא כד, ז) ונתת על המערכת לבונה זכה רבי אומר על בסמוך אתה אומר על בסמוך או אינו אלא על ממש כשהוא אומר (שמות מ, ג) וסכות על הארון את הפרוכת הוי אומר על בסמוך:
human_translation: as it is taught “And you shall put pure frankincense upon [ al ] each row” Rabbi says: Al Next to. Do you say al Next to? Or it only actually upon? When it says: and you shall place a cover over [al] the Ark with the Curtain” you must say al next to.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita (Leviticus 24:7): "And you shall put pure frankincense on each row." Rabbi Yehuda says: "When it says 'on each row,' do you say it is on the row itself or rather adjacent to it?" As when it says (Exodus 40:3): "And you shall screen the Ark with the curtain," you would say it is adjacent.

hebrew_text: מוליך ומביא מעלה ומוריד [וכו']: אמר רבי חייא בר אבא אמר רבי יוחנן מוליך ומביא למי שהרוחות שלו מעלה ומוריד למי שהשמים והארץ שלו
human_translation: extends and brings back, raises and lowers Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: He extends and brings back to to Whom the directions belong. He raises and lowers to to Whom the heavens and the earth belong.
llm_translation: Leading and bringing up, and bringing down, etc.: Rabbi Chiya bar Abba said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: Leading and bringing up for one whose winds are above, and bringing down for one whose heavens and earth are his.

hebrew_text: במערבא מתנו הכי אמר רב חמא בר עוקבא אמר רבי יוסי בר רבי חנינא מוליך ומביא כדי לעצור רוחות רעות מעלה ומוריד כדי לעצור טללים רעים
human_translation: In the West, they taught like this: Rabbi Ḥama bar Ukva says Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Ḥanina says: He extends and brings back in order to a halt harmful winds he raises and lowers in order to halt harmful dews
llm_translation: In the West, they taught: Rav Hama son of Ukva said, Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Chanina said: One brings and takes in order to stop evil winds, one raises and lowers in order to stop harmful dews.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוסי בר רב אבין זאת אומרת שירי מצוה מעכבים את הפורענות דהא תנופה שירי מצוה היא ועוצרת רוחות רעות וטללים רעים אמר רבה וכן לולב
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Rav Avin says: That is to say, a non-essential mitzva prevent calamity, as waving is a non-essential mitzva; and halts harmful winds and dews. Rava says: And similarly with a lulav
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yosei bar Rav Avin: This means that the songs of mitzvot delay punishment, for it is taught: "A waving of songs of mitzvot it is, and it stops evil winds and harmful dews." Rabba said: And so too the lulav.

hebrew_text: רב אחא בר יעקב ממטי ליה ומייתי ליה ומחוי הכי ואמר גירא בעינא דשטנא ולאו מילתא היא משום דאתי לאתגרויי ביה
human_translation: Rav Aḥa bar Ya’akov extend and bring back this and say: an arrow in the eye of Satan, is not correct because come to incite
llm_translation: Rav Acha bar Yaakov would bring him and bring him and say thus and say, "I want a sharp knife, and it is not a matter because it comes to challenge him."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן זבחי שלמי צבור טעונין תנופה לאחר שחיטה ותנופתן כמות שהן דברי רבי חכמים אומרים בחזה ושוק
human_translation: The Sages taught The communal peace offerings, require waving after slaughter, and their waving as they are, the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: with breast and thigh.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: communal peace offerings require waving after slaughter, and their waving is according to their amount. The words of the Sages say: in the breast and the thigh.

hebrew_text: במאי קא מיפלגי אמר ליה רב חסדא לרב המנונא ואמרי לה רב המנונא לרב חסדא בדון מינה ומינה בדון מינה ואוקי באתרה קא מיפלגי
