human_translation: With regard to what do disagree? Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Hamnuna, and some say Rav Hamnuna to Rav Ḥisda: disagree with regard to Infer from it and from it, Infer from it but interpret to its place,
llm_translation: With what are they arguing? Rav Ḥisda said to Rav Hamnuna, and some say Rav Hamnuna said to Rav Ḥisda: "In the case of 'judge one aspect against another aspect, and judge each aspect,' they are arguing."

hebrew_text: רבנן סברי דון מינה ומינה מה זבחי שלמי יחיד טעונין תנופה לאחר שחיטה אף זבחי שלמי צבור טעונין תנופה לאחר שחיטה ומינה מה התם בחזה ושוק אף הכא נמי בחזה ושוק
human_translation: The Rabbis maintain: Infer from it and from it, Just as individual peace offerings require waving after slaughter, so too, communal peace offerings require waving after slaughter. And from it: Just as there, with breast and thigh so too here, as well, with breast and thigh
llm_translation: The sages hold the opinion: "Regarding each type, just as individual peace offerings require waving after slaughter, so too communal peace offerings require waving after slaughter." And what is the comparison there? In the breast and the thigh. So too here, in the breast and the thigh.

hebrew_text: ורבי סבר דון מינה ואוקי באתרה מה זבחי שלמי יחיד טעונין תנופה לאחר שחיטה אף זבחי שלמי צבור טעונין תנופה לאחר שחיטה ואוקי באתרה התם הוא דחזה ושוק אבל הכא כמות שהן כמות שהן בחיים
human_translation: And Rabbi maintains: Infer from it but interpret to its place, Just as individual peace offerings require waving after slaughter, so too, communal peace offerings require waving after slaughter. But interpret to its place: It is there, with breast and thigh But here, as they are, as they were when alive.
llm_translation: Rabbi holds that judging the offering and waving it in its place, just as individual peace offerings require waving after slaughter, so too communal peace offerings require waving after slaughter, and he holds in its place. There, it is seen and waved, but here, as they are, as they are, while alive.

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר דכולי עלמא דון מינה ומינה הוא והיינו טעמא דרבי כי התם מה התם דבר שמתנה לכהן אף הכא דבר שמתנה לכהן
human_translation: Rav Pappa said Everyone, is: Infer from it and from it. And this is reason for Rabbi like there, Just as there, item that is a gift to the priest, so too here, item that is a gift to the priest.
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "Everyone judges according to his own perspective, and that is the reason for Rabbi's opinion, as there, just as there, something designated for a priest, so too here, something designated for a priest."

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר דכולי עלמא דון מינה ואוקי באתרה והיינו טעמא דרבנן שלמיהם ריבויא הוא:
human_translation: Ravina said Everyone, Infer from it but interpret to its place. And this is reason of the Rabbis “Their peace offerings,” is an amplification,
llm_translation: Ravina said: "Everyone judges according to his own perspective, and that is the reason why the Sages' reasoning is considered valid."

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר שלשה מינין טעונין שלש מצות שתים בכל אחד ושלישית אין בהן ואלו הן זבחי שלמי יחיד וזבחי שלמי צבור ואשם מצורע
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: three types require three mitzvot. Two on each and every one but the third is not in their And these are the Peace offerings an individual, communal peace offerings, and the guilt offering of a leper.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Three types require three commandments, two in each, and the third does not have them. And these are: Peace offerings of an individual, Peace offerings of the community, and Guilt offerings of a leper.

hebrew_text: זבחי שלמי יחיד טעונין סמיכה חיים ותנופה שחוטין ואין בהן תנופה חיים זבחי שלמי צבור טעונין תנופה חיים ושחוטין ואין בהן סמיכה אשם מצורע טעון סמיכה ותנופה חי ואין בו תנופה שחוט:
human_translation: Peace offerings individuals require placing hands alive, and waving slaughtered, but there is no waving them alive. Communal peace offerings require waving alive and slaughtered, but there is no placing hands And the guilt offering of a leper requires placing hands and waving alive, but there is no waving slaughtered.
llm_translation: Sacrifices of individual peace offerings require leaning, living, and waving; they are slaughtered and do not have waving while alive. Sacrifices of communal peace offerings require waving, living, and slaughtering; they do not have leaning. Guilt offerings of a leper require leaning and waving, living, and do not have waving while alive; they are slaughtered.

hebrew_text: ויהיו זבחי שלמי יחיד טעונין תנופה חיים מקל וחומר ומה זבחי שלמי צבור שאין טעונין סמיכה חיים טעונין תנופה חיים זבחי שלמי יחיד שטעונין סמיכה חיים אינו דין שטעונין תנופה חיים
human_translation: And let peace offerings an individual require waving alive, via an a fortiori And if communal peace offerings, that they do not require placing hands alive, require waving alive, peace offerings an individual, which require placing hands alive, is it not logical that they require waving alive?
llm_translation: And were the sacrifices of individual peace offerings requiring waving, living, a fortiori, and what about the sacrifices of communal peace offerings that do not require leaning, living, require waving, living, the sacrifices of individual peace offerings that require leaning, living, it is not the same that they require waving, living.

hebrew_text: מיעט רחמנא גבי זבחי שלמי צבור אותם אותם למעוטי זבחי שלמי יחיד
human_translation: the Merciful One excluded with regard to communal peace offerings: them “them” to exclude peace offerings an individual
llm_translation: The Merciful One limited regarding communal peace offerings those, those to exclude individual peace offerings.

hebrew_text: ויהיו זבחי שלמי צבור טעונין סמיכה מקל וחומר ומה זבחי שלמי יחיד שאין טעונין תנופה חיים טעונין סמיכה זבחי שלמי צבור שטעונין תנופה חיים אינו דין שטעונין סמיכה אמר רבינא גמירי שתי סמיכות בצבור
human_translation: And let communal peace offerings require placing hands, via an a fortiori And if peace offerings individual, that they do not require waving alive, require placing hands, communal peace offerings, which require waving alive, is it not logical that they require placing hands? Ravina said: is learned two placing hands in communal
llm_translation: And the sacrifices of communal peace offerings require leaning, a fortiori. And just as individual peace offerings that do not require waving require leaning, living creatures require leaning. Communal peace offerings that require waving, living creatures do not require leaning. It is not the same law that they require leaning. Ravina said: We have learned two leanings in the communal offering.

hebrew_text: ויהא אשם מצורע טעון תנופה שחוט מקל וחומר מה זבחי שלמי יחיד שאין טעונין תנופה חיים טעונין תנופה שחוטין אשם מצורע שטעון תנופה חי אינו דין שטעון תנופה שחוט
human_translation: And let the guilt offering of a leper require waving slaughtered, via an a fortiori And if peace offerings individual, that they do not require waving alive, require waving slaughtered, the guilt offering of a leper, requires waving alive, is it not logical that it requires waving slaughtered?
llm_translation: And an Asham of a Metzora requires waving, slaughtered from a reed, and its blood is stricter than the peace offerings of an individual which do not require waving. Living animals require waving, they are slaughtered. An Asham of a Metzora that requires waving, if it is alive, it is not the law that it requires waving if it is slaughtered.

hebrew_text: מיעט רחמנא גבי זבחי שלמי יחיד אותו אותו למעוטי אשם מצורע
human_translation: The Merciful One excluded with regard to peace offerings an individual: it “it” to exclude the guilt offering of a leper
llm_translation: The Merciful One limited regarding individual peace offerings, that same one to exclude the guilt offering of a leper.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן חמשה שהביאו קרבן אחד אחד מניף על ידי כולם והאשה כהן מניף על ידה וכן השולח קרבנותיו ממדינת הים כהן מניף על ידו:
human_translation: The Sages taught: five who brought one offering one waves on behalf of all of them. And a woman priest waves on her behalf. And similarly, one who sends his offerings from overseas, priest waves on his behalf.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Five people who bring one offering each, each one waves it by their hand, and the woman, a priest, waves it by her hand, and similarly one who sends his offerings from overseas, a priest waves it by his hand.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ האומר הרי עלי במחבת לא יביא במרחשת במרחשת לא יביא במחבת מה בין מחבת למרחשת מרחשת יש לה כיסוי מחבת אין לה כיסוי דברי ר' יוסי הגלילי ר' חנינא בן גמליאל אומר מרחשת עמוקה ומעשיה רוחשין (רכין) מחבת צפה ומעשיה קשין:
human_translation: One who says: It is upon me in a maḥavat , may not bring in a marḥeshet . in a marḥeshet , he may not bring in a maḥavat . What is between a maḥavat and a marḥeshet ? A marḥeshet has a cover, a maḥavat does not have a cover; the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel says: A marḥeshet is deep, and its product moves about [ roḥashin ] A maḥavat level and its product is hard.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who says, "I am obligated to bring a pot," should not bring a frying pan; and one who says, "I am obligated to bring a frying pan," should not bring a pot. What is the difference between a pot and a frying pan? A frying pan has a cover, while a pot does not have a cover. These are the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean. Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel says: A frying pan is deep, and its actions are soft; a pot is shallow, and its actions are hard.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי טעמא דרבי יוסי אילימא מרחשת דאתיא ארחושי הלב כדכתיב (תהלים מה, ב) רחש לבי דבר טוב ומחבת דאתיא אמחבואי הפה כדאמרי אינשי מנבח נבוחי
human_translation: what is the reason for Rabbi Yosei If we say marḥeshet that comes for musings [ raḥashei ] of the heart, as it is written: “My heart muses [ raḥash ] on a goodly matter” And maḥavat that comes for corners of [ ammaḥavo’ei ] the mouth, as people say is barking [ minbaḥ nevuḥei ],
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason for Rabbi Yosei? If you say it is because of the whisper that comes to the heart, as it is written (Psalms 45:2), "My heart murmurs a good matter," and the hammer that comes to the mouth, as people say, "He hammers out well-hammered words."

hebrew_text: אימא איפכא מחבת דאתיא אמחבואי הלב דכתיב (בראשית לא, כז) למה נחבאת לברוח מרחשת דאתיא ארחושי כדאמרי אינשי הוה מרחשן שיפתותיה אלא גמרא גמירי לה:
human_translation: say the opposite, maḥavat as it comes for the secret of the heart, as it is written “Why did you flee secretly [ naḥbeita ]” marḥeshet , as it comes for whispers [ reḥushei ] as people say: His lips were whispering [ meraḥashan ]. rather, is learned as a tradition.
llm_translation: Say the opposite of the frying pan that comes from the heart, as it is written (Genesis 31:27), "Why did you hide your heart, to run away secretly?" that comes from the whispers, as people say, "He was whispering his charms." Rather, the Gemara concludes to teach.

hebrew_text: רבי חנינא בן גמליאל אומר כו': מרחשת עמוקה דכתיב (ויקרא ז, ט) וכל נעשה במרחשת מחבת צפה דכתיב (ויקרא ז, ט) על מחבת
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina ben Gamliel says A marḥeshet deep, as it is written “And all that is made in the marḥeshet ” a maḥavat level as it is written “And on the maḥavat ”
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina ben Gamliel says, etc.: "A deep pan," as it is written (Leviticus 7:9), "And all that is made in a deep pan," "a pan," as it is written (Leviticus 7:9), "on a pan."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן בית שמאי אומרים האומר הרי עלי מרחשת יהא מונח עד שיבא אליהו
human_translation: the Sages taught Beit Shammai say: one who says: It is upon me a marḥeshet , should be placed until Elijah comes
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Beit Shammai say, "One who says, 'Behold, upon me is a cherem,' should be under a ban until Elijah comes."

hebrew_text: מספקא להו  אי על שום כלי נקראו או על שום מעשיהן
human_translation: are uncertain whether are called due to vessel or due to their preparation.
llm_translation: It is doubtful for them, whether it is due to the vessel they are called, or due to their actions.

hebrew_text: ובית הלל אומרים כלי היה במקדש ומרחשת שמה ודומה כמין כלבוס עמוק וכשבצק מונח בתוכו דומה כמין תפוחי הברתים וכמין בלוטי היוונים
human_translation: And Beit Hillel say there was vessel in the Temple, and its name marḥeshet . And resembled a type of deep kelabus , and when dough is placed inside it, resembles a type of apple of berotim or a type of acorn [ balutei ] the Greek
llm_translation: "And Beit Hillel say: The vessel in the Temple and the Marḥeshet was there, and it resembles a type of deep goblet, and when dough is placed inside it, it resembles a type of pomegranate flowers and a type of Greek nuts."

hebrew_text: ואומר וכל נעשה במרחשת ועל מחבת אלמא על שום הכלים נקראו ולא על שום מעשיהם:
human_translation: And states “And all that is made in the marḥeshet and on the maḥavat ” evidently they are called due to vessel not due to their preparation.
llm_translation: And he says, "And all that is done in secret, and on a griddle." Therefore, it is on account of the vessels that they are called, and not on account of their actions.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הרי עלי בתנור לא יביא מאפה כופח ולא מאפה רעפים ומאפה יורות הערביים ר' יהודה אומר רצה מביא מאפה כופח
human_translation: It upon me in an oven, he may not bring baked a small oven [ kupaḥ ], nor a baked tiles, nor baked pits the Arabs. Rabbi Yehuda says: wishes, bring baked a kupaḥ .
llm_translation: Mishnah: One may not bring into an oven a loaf of bread made from fine flour, nor a loaf of bread made from coarse flour, nor a loaf of bread made by the Arabians. Rabbi Yehuda says: If one desires, he may bring in a loaf of bread made from fine flour.

hebrew_text: הרי עלי מנחת מאפה לא יביא מחצה חלות ומחצה רקיקין רבי שמעון מתיר מפני שהוא קרבן אחד:
human_translation: It upon me a baked meal offering, he may not bring half loaves and half wafers; Rabbi Shimon deems permitted, due to that it is one offering
llm_translation: Behold, regarding the offering of baked meal-offering, one should not bring half loaves and half wafers. Rabbi Shimon permits it because it is considered one offering.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן מאפה תנור ולא מאפה כופח ולא מאפה רעפים ולא מאפה יורות הערביים
human_translation: The Sages taught baked in an oven” and not baked a kupaḥ , nor baked tiles, nor baked pits the Arabs,
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: One may bake in an oven, but one may not bake in a furnace, nor in a dung-heap, nor in Arab torches.

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר תנור תנור שני פעמים להכשיר מאפה כופח רבי שמעון אומר תנור תנור שני פעמים אחד שתהא אפייתן בתנור ואחד שיהא הקדישן בתנור
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: “oven,” “oven” two times, to render fit baked a kupaḥ , Rabbi Shimon says: “oven” “oven,” two times, One that their baking should be in an oven, and one that their consecration is in an oven,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "An oven, an oven, must be heated twice to render the bread baked in it susceptible to ritual impurity." Rabbi Shimon says: "An oven, an oven, must be heated twice, one for the baking of the bread in it, and one for the consecration of the oven."

hebrew_text: ומי אית ליה לר' שמעון האי סברא והתנן ר' שמעון אומר לעולם הוי רגיל לומר שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים כשרות בעזרה וכשרות בבית פאגי
human_translation: And does Rabbi Shimon hold this reasoning? But didn’t we learn Rabbi Shimon says: always be accustomed to say the two loaves and the shewbread are valid in courtyard, and are valid in Beit Pagei,
llm_translation: And is there to him to Rabbi Shimon this reasoning? And we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon says, "Always be accustomed to say 'the two loaves' and 'the showbread' are valid in the Temple courtyard and valid in the Chamber of the Parhedrin."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא אימא שיהא הקדישן לשום תנור:
human_translation: Rava said say that their consecration must be for the sake an oven.
llm_translation: Rava said: Say that the Kaddish should be for the sake of the oven.

hebrew_text: הרי עלי מנחת מאפה לא יביא מחצה [וכו']: תנו רבנן (ויקרא ב, א) וכי תקריב כשתקריב לעשות דבר רשות
human_translation: It upon me a baked meal offering, he may not bring half The Sages taught “And when you bring,” when you bring, to perform a voluntary matter.
llm_translation: Behold, regarding the meal offering of fine flour, one should not bring half etc.. The Rabbis taught: "And when you bring" - when you bring to do something optional.

hebrew_text: קרבן מנחה אמר רבי יהודה מנין לאומר הרי עלי מנחת מאפה שלא יביא מחצה חלות ומחצה רקיקין תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ב, א) קרבן מנחה קרבן אחד אמרתי לך ולא שנים ושלשה קרבנות
human_translation: “A meal offering,” Rabbi Yehuda says: From where to one who says: It upon me a baked meal offering, that he must not bring half loaves and half wafers? The verse states: “A meal offering,” I told you one offering, and not two or three offerings
llm_translation: Offering of a meal-offering. Rabbi Yehudah said: From where do we derive that one may say, "Behold, upon me is the meal-offering of baked goods," so that he does not bring half loaves and half wafers? The verse states (Leviticus 2:1), "An offering of a meal-offering." I have told you one offering, not two or three offerings.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי שמעון
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said to
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Shimon

hebrew_text: וכי נאמר קרבן קרבן שני פעמים והלא לא נאמר אלא קרבן אחד ונאמר בו חלות ורקיקין
human_translation: And is it stated “Offering,” Offering, two times, doesn’t it say “offering” only one And it is stated with regard to this loaves and wafers,
llm_translation: And when it is said "offering offering" twice, but was it not said only one offering, and it was said regarding it loaves and wafers.

hebrew_text: מעתה רצה להביא חלות מביא רקיקין מביא מחצה חלות ומחצה רקיקין מביא ובוללן וקומץ משניהם ואם קמץ ועלה בידו מאחד על שניהם יצא
human_translation: From now wants to bring loaves he may bring wafers, he may bring half loaves and half wafers, he may bring And mingles them and removes a handful from both of them. And he removed a handful and of one came up in his hand for both of them, fulfilled
llm_translation: From now on, if one desires to bring loaves, he brings only wafers; he brings half loaves and half wafers, he brings and mixes them, and he takes a handful from both. And if he took a handful and it ascended in his hand from one of them, he has fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי ב"ר יהודה אומר מנין לאומר הרי עלי מנחת מאפה שלא יביא מחצה חלות ומחצה רקיקין תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ז, ט) וכל מנחה אשר תאפה בתנור וכל נעשה במרחשת ועל מחבת לכהן המקריב אותה לו תהיה וכל מנחה בלולה בשמן וחרבה לכל בני אהרן תהיה
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda says: From where to one who says: It upon me a baked meal offering, that he may not bring half loaves and half wafers? The verse states: “And every meal offering that is baked in an oven, and every one that is made in the deep pan, and on the shallow pan, shall belong to the priest who sacrifices it. And every meal offering, mixed with oil, or dry, shall belong to all the sons of Aaron,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Judah says: From where do we derive that one who says, "Behold, upon me is a meal offering," should not bring half loaves and half wafers? The verse teaches (Leviticus 7:9): "And every meal offering that is baked in the oven and all that is prepared in a pan and on a griddle shall belong to the priest who offers it. And every meal offering, mixed with oil or dry, shall belong to all the sons of Aaron equally."

hebrew_text: מה וכל האמור למטה שני מינין חלוקין אף וכל האמור למעלה שני מינין חלוקין
human_translation: just as “And every” stated below two different types so too, “And every” stated above, two different types
llm_translation: What and all that is said below, two types are distinct; likewise, what is said above, two types are distinct.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה שפיר קאמר ר' שמעון אמר לך כיון דכתיב בשמן בשמן כמאן דכתיב קרבן קרבן דמי
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, Rabbi Shimon is saying well said to you: Since it is written: “With oil,” “With oil,” as though it is written “offering” “offering,”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda well said, Rabbi Shimon said to you: since it is written "in oil, in oil," it is like the one written "sacrifice, sacrifice."

hebrew_text: ורבי שמעון אי לא כתיב בשמן בשמן הוה אמינא דווקא מחצה חלות ומחצה רקיקין אבל חלות לחודייהו ורקיקין לחודייהו אימא לא קא משמע לן
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon If it were not written “with oil,” “with oil,” I would say specifically half loaves and half wafers, and loaves alone or wafers alone, say not teaches us
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, if it did not say "in oil," I would say specifically half loaves and half flatbreads, but loaves separately and flatbreads separately, I would say it does not teach us.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי בר' יהודה היינו אבוה איכא בינייהו דאי עבד:
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, is his father, between as, if performed
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosi son of Rabbi Yehuda, that is his father, there is a distinction between them, for if he did:

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך כל המנחות
llm_translation: We will return to you regarding all the meal offerings.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ רבי ישמעאל אומר עומר היה בא בשבת משלש סאין ובחול מחמש וחכמים אומרים אחד שבת ואחד חול משלש היה בא
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: omer would on Shabbat, brought from three se’a And during the week, from five And the Rabbis say: Both on Shabbat and week, would come from three
llm_translation: Mishnah: Rabbi Yishmael says: The Omer offering was brought on Shabbat from three se'ah, and on a weekday from five se'ah. And the Sages say: It was brought from three se'ah both on Shabbat and on a weekday.

hebrew_text: רבי חנינא סגן הכהנים אומר בשבת היה נקצר ביחיד ובמגל אחד ובקופה אחת ובחול בשלשה בשלש קופות ושלש מגלות וחכמים אומרים אחד שבת ואחד חול בשלשה בשלש קופות ובשלש מגלות:
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, says: On Shabbat was reaped by an individual and with one sickle and with one basket and during the week, by three with three baskets and three sickles. And the Rabbis say: Both on Shabbat and week, by three with three baskets and with three sickles.
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina, deputy of the priests, says: On Shabbat, one may harvest individually, with one sickle, and with one basket. On a weekday, one may harvest with three baskets, three sickles. The sages say: Whether on Shabbat or on a weekday, one may harvest with three baskets and with three sickles.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ בשלמא רבנן קא סברי עשרון מובחר בשלשה סאין אתי ולא שנא בחול ולא שנא בשבת
human_translation: Granted the Rabbis a select tenth comes from three se’a and there is no difference during the week or on Shabbat,
llm_translation: The Gemara: Granted, the Rabbis hold that the finest quality tithe is effective with three se'ahs, whether on a weekday or on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: אלא רבי ישמעאל מאי קסבר אי קסבר עשרון מובחר לא אתי אלא מחמש אפילו בשבת נמי אי משלש אתי אפילו בחול נמי
human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yishmael, What hold? If he holds a select tenth can come only from five even on Shabbat also if can come from three even on a weekday
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yishmael, what does he hold? If he holds that the best tithe does not come except from five grains, even on Shabbat it should come; if he holds that it comes from three grains, even on a weekday it should come.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא קסבר ר' ישמעאל עשרון מובחר בלא טירחא אתי מחמש בטירחא אתי משלש בחול מייתינן מחמש דהכי שביחא מילתא בשבת מוטב שירבה במלאכה אחת בהרקדה ואל ירבה במלאכות הרבה
human_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yishmael holds a select tenth without exertion from five with exertion from three. on a weekday we bring from five as this a better product, On Shabbat, preferable that one increase in one prohibited labor, of sifting and one not increase many prohibited labors,
llm_translation: Rava said: Rabbi Yishmael holds that a measure of fine flour without exertion comes from five se'ah, with exertion it comes from three. On a weekday, we bring from five, for this matter is praiseworthy on Shabbat: it is better to increase in one labor through kneading, and not to increase in many labors.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה ר' ישמעאל ור' ישמעאל בנו של ר' יוחנן בן ברוקה אמרו דבר אחד דתניא ארבעה עשר שחל להיות בשבת מפשיט את הפסח עד החזה דברי רבי ישמעאל בנו של ר' יוחנן בן ברוקה וחכמים אומרים עד שיפשיט את כולו
human_translation: Rabba said: Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, said the same thing. As it is taught the fourteenth occurs on Shabbat, one flays the Paschal offering up to the breast, the statement of Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka. And the Rabbis say: unless he flays it in its entirety.
llm_translation: Rabba said, Rabbi Yishmael, and Rabbi Yishmael the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka said one thing, as it was taught: Fourteen days that fall on Shabbat, one should skin the Paschal lamb up to the chest - the words of Rabbi Yishmael the son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Beroka. And the Sages say, up to skinning it entirely.

hebrew_text: מי לא אמר ר' ישמעאל בנו של ר' יוחנן בן ברוקה התם כל היכא דאפשר לא טרחינן הכא נמי כיון דאפשר לא טרחינן
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, say there anywhere that it is possible we do not exert Here, too, since it is possible we do not exert
llm_translation: Who did not say Rabbi Yishmael son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka there wherever possible not we exert effort here also since possible not we exert effort

hebrew_text: ממאי דלמא עד כאן לא קאמר ר' ישמעאל הכא אלא דליכא בזיון קדשים אבל התם דאיכא בזיון קדשים
human_translation: From where Perhaps Rabbi Yishmael states only here, where there is no degradation of consecrated But there, where there is degradation of consecrated
llm_translation: From what source does Rabbi Yishmael perhaps derive this law? Here he only said that there is no disgrace of holy items, but there, where there is a disgrace of holy items

hebrew_text: אימא לך כרבנן סבירא ליה
human_translation: I say to you he holds of the Rabbis
llm_translation: Say to you, like the Rabbis, he holds.

hebrew_text: אי נמי עד כאן לא קאמר ר' ישמעאל בנו של ר' יוחנן בן ברוקא התם אלא דאיתעביד ליה צורך גבוה ולא צריך אחולי שבת אבל הכא דלא איתעביד ליה צורך גבוה וצריך לאחולי שבת אימא כרבנן סבירא ליה
human_translation: Alternatively, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yoḥanan ben Beroka, states only there, where the requirements for the Most High, have been fulfilled, and no need to desecrate the Shabbat. But here, where the requirements for the Most High have not been fulfilled, and it is necessary to desecrate the Shabbat, say he holds in accordance with the Rabbis,
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Alternatively, until here, Rabbi Yishmael, son of Rabbi Yochanan ben Baroka, did not say, except that it was done for a high need and did not require desecration of the Sabbath. But here, where it was not done for a high need and requires desecration of the Sabbath, say it is according to the Rabbis' opinion.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבה ר' ישמעאל ורבי חנינא סגן הכהנים אמרו דבר אחד דתנן רבי חנינא סגן הכהנים אומר בשבת נקצר ביחיד במגל אחד ובקופה אחת ובחול בשלשה בשלש קופות ובשלש מגלות וחכמים אומרים אחד שבת ואחד חול בשלש קופות ובשלש מגלות
human_translation: Rather, Rabba said: Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, said the same thing. As we learned Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, says: On Shabbat was reaped by an individual with one sickle and with one basket and during the week, by three with three baskets and with three sickles. And the Rabbis say: Both on Shabbat and week, with three baskets and with three sickles.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbah said, Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Chanina the deputy high priests said one thing, as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Chanina the deputy high priest says, on Shabbat one may harvest individually with one sickle and one basket, and on a weekday with three, with three baskets and three sickles. But the Sages say, whether on Shabbat or on a weekday, with three baskets and three sickles.

hebrew_text: מי לא קאמר ר' חנינא סגן הכהנים התם כיון דאפשר לא טרחינן הכא נמי כיון דאפשר לא טרחינן
human_translation: Doesn’t Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, say there, since it is possible we do not exert Here, too, since it is possible we do not exert
llm_translation: Who did not say Rabbi Chanina deputy of the priests there since possible not we are concerned here also since possible not we are concerned

hebrew_text: ממאי דלמא עד כאן לא קאמר ר' ישמעאל הכא אלא דליכא פרסומי מילתא אבל התם דאיכא פרסומי מילתא אימא כרבנן סבירא ליה
human_translation: From where Perhaps Rabbi Yishmael states only here, there is no publicity event But there, there is publicity event say that he holds in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: From what source does Rabbi Yishmael perhaps not say until here? Here it is only that there is no publicity of the matter. But there, where there is publicity of the matter, say like the Rabbis, he agrees.

hebrew_text: אי נמי עד כאן לא קאמר ר' חנינא סגן הכהנים התם דאי בחד אי בשלשה צורך גבוה מיתעביד כהלכתו אבל הכא דלא איתעביד כהלכתו צורך גבוה אימא כרבנן סבירא ליה
human_translation: Alternatively, Rabbi Ḥanina, the deputy High Priest, states only there, as whether one or three is performed in its proper manner the requirement of the Most High. But here, when is not performed in its proper manner the requirement of the Most High, say that he holds in accordance with the Rabbis
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: Or alternatively, until here, Rabbi Chanina, the deputy of the priests, did not say that, there, if with one priest or with three priests, it is necessary, it is done according to his the High Priest's halakha. But here, where it is not done according to his halakha, if there is a need for three priests, say like the Rabbis, he agrees.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב אשי רבי ישמעאל ורבי יוסי אמרו דבר אחד דתנן בין שנראה בעליל ובין שלא נראה בעליל מחללין עליו את השבת רבי יוסי אומר אם נראה בעליל אין מחללין עליו את השבת
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Yosei said the same thing. As we learned Whether was seen clearly [ ba’alil ] or whether it was not seen clearly, one may desecrate the Shabbat Rabbi Yosei says: If was clearly seen, may not desecrate the Shabbat for it,
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said: Rabbi Yishmael and Rabbi Yosi said one thing, as we learned in a Mishnah: Whether one was seen intentionally or not intentionally, we desecrate the Sabbath for him. Rabbi Yosi says: If he was seen intentionally, we do not desecrate the Sabbath for him.

hebrew_text: מי לא אמר ר' יוסי התם כיון דאפשר לא טרחינן הכא נמי כיון דאפשר לא טרחינן
human_translation: Didn’t Rabbi Yosei say there: Since it is possible we do not exert Here, too, since it is possible we do not exert
llm_translation: Who did not say Rabbi Yosei there since it is possible we do not bother here also since it is possible we do not bother

hebrew_text: ממאי דלמא עד כאן לא קאמר רבי ישמעאל הכא אלא דליכא נמצאת אתה מכשילן לעתיד לבא אבל התם דנמצאת אתה מכשילן לעתיד לבא אימא כרבנן סבירא ליה
human_translation: From where Perhaps Rabbi Yishmael states only here that as there is no you will cause to stumble in the future But there, you will cause them to stumble in the future. say holds in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: From what source does Rabbi Yishmael say this? Here he only means that if you do not find them stumbling in the future, but there if you find them stumbling in the future, say like the Rabbis do.

hebrew_text: אי נמי עד כאן לא קאמר רבי יוסי התם אלא דליכא צורך גבוה ולא ניתנה שבת לדחות אבל הכא דאיכא צורך גבוה וניתנה שבת לדחות אימא כרבנן סבירא ליה
human_translation: Alternatively, Rabbi Yosei states only there, as this is not a requirement for the Most High, and Shabbat may not be desecrated. But here, is a requirement for the Most High, and Shabbat may be desecrated say in accordance with the Rabbis
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei did not mean only until here, rather, that there is no pressing need and Shabbat was not given to be pushed off. But here, where there is a pressing need and Shabbat was given to be pushed off, say like the Rabbis, he agrees.

hebrew_text: איתמר שחט שתי חטאות של ציבור ואינו צריך אלא אחת אמר רבה ואיתימא רבי אמי חייב על השניה ופטור על הראשונה ואפילו נתכפר לו בשניה ואפילו נמצאת ראשונה כחושה
human_translation: It was stated slaughtered two communal sin offerings, and only one was required, Rabba said, and some say Rabbi Ami liable for the second, but exempt for the first. And even if he achieved atonement with the second even if the first was found gaunt
llm_translation: It was stated: One who slaughters two communal sin-offerings and only one is necessary. Rabbah said, and some say it was Rabbi Ami, he is liable for the second and exempt for the first, even if atonement was achieved for him with the second, and even if the first is found to be weak.

hebrew_text: ומי אמר רבה הכי והא אמר רבה היו לפניו שתי חטאות אחת שמינה ואחת כחושה שחט שמינה ואח"כ שחט כחושה חייב כחושה ואח"כ שמינה פטור ולא עוד אלא שאומרים לו הבא שמינה לכתחלה ושחוט
human_translation: And did Rabba say this? But doesn’t Rabba say had before him two sin offerings one choice and one gaunt, slaughtered the choice and then slaughtered gaunt liable gaunt and subsequently choice exempt And moreover, say to him Bring choice and slaughter ab initio .
llm_translation: Rabah said so? But didn't Rabah say: "If two sins were before him, one fat and one lean, if he slaughtered the fat one first and then the lean one, he is liable for the lean one. And then he slaughtered the lean one, he is exempt for the fat one. Moreover, they say to him, 'Bring the fat one first and slaughter.'"

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא סמי כחושה מקמייתא ואיבעית אימא ההיא רבי אמי אמרה
human_translation: If you wish, say: Remove [ semei ] gaunt from the first And if you wish, say that was stated Rabbi Ami,
llm_translation: If you will say, "Sami is weak in front of her," and if you will say, "That one, Rabbi Ami said."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי נמצאת הראשונה כחושה בבני מעיין מהו בתר מחשבתו אזלינן וגברא לאיסורא קא מיכוין או דלמא בתר מעשיו אזלינן
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: first found be gaunt, in its intestines what is we follow his intention and this man, intended prohibition Or perhaps we follow his actions
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: If the first action is like a thought in the sons of Ma'ayan, what is the law after his intention? Are we going after the man's intent to prohibit, or perhaps after his actions?

hebrew_text: א"ל לאו היינו דרבה ורבא דאיתמר שמע שטבע תינוק בים ופרש מצודה להעלות דגים והעלה דגים חייב להעלות דגים והעלה דגים ותינוק רבא אמר חייב ורבה אמר פטור
human_translation: said to Isn’t this Rabba and Rava, As it was stated: one heard that a child was drowning at sea, and he spread a net to raise fish and he raised fish, liable to raise fish, raised fish and child, Rava says: liable, and Rabba says: exempt,
llm_translation: He said to him: Is this not like the case of Rabbah and Rava where it was stated: If one heard that a child fell into the sea and spread a net to bring up fish, and he brought up fish, he is liable to bring up fish. And he brought up fish, and the child. Rava said: He is liable, and Rabbah said: He is exempt.

hebrew_text: ועד כאן רבה לא קא פטר אלא כיון דשמע אמרינן נמי דעתיה אתינוק אבל לא שמע לא
human_translation: And Rabba deemed exempt only there, since heard we say that his intention was also to the child. But not heard not
llm_translation: Until here, Rabbah did not exempt him, rather, once he heard, we also say that the mind of a child comes, but he did not hear.

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי אמר ליה היינו פלוגתייהו דרבה ורבא  דאיתמר שמע שטבע תינוק בים ופרש מצודה להעלות דגים והעלה דגים חייב להעלות דגים והעלה תינוק ודגים רבה אמר פטור ורבא אמר חייב רבה אמר פטור זיל בתר מעשיו ורבא אמר חייב זיל בתר מחשבתו
human_translation: And there are who say said to This is between Rabba and Rava. As it was stated: one heard that a child was drowning at sea, and he spread a net to raise fish and he raised fish, liable to raise fish, raised fish and child, Rava says: liable, and Rabba says: exempt. Rabba says exempt follows his actions, Rava says liable follows his intention.
llm_translation: And there are those who say, he said to him, this is their dispute, Rabah and Rava, as it was stated: If one heard that a child fell into the sea and spread a net to catch fish, and he caught fish, he is obligated to bring up the fish. And if he brought up the child and the fish, Rabah said he is exempt, and Rava said he is obligated. Rabah said, go after his actions, and Rava said, go after his intent.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה חולה שאמדוהו לגרוגרת אחת ורצו עשרה בני אדם והביאו עשרה גרוגרות בבת אחת פטורין אפילו בזה אחר זה אפילו קדם והבריא בראשונה
human_translation: Rabba says: ill person whom evaluated to one fig and ten men ran and brought ten figs simultaneously, they are exempt even one after the other, even had already recovered his health by the first
llm_translation: Rabbah said: If a sick person was prescribed one fig cake, and ten people desired to bring him fig cakes, and they brought ten fig cakes in one vessel, they are exempt, even if one after the other, even if the healthy person was first.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא חולה שאמדוהו לשתי גרוגרות ויש שתי גרוגרות בשתי עוקצין ושלש בעוקץ אחת הי מינייהו מייתינן שתים מייתינן דחזו ליה או דלמא שלש מייתינן דקא ממעטא קצירה
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: ill person whom evaluated to two figs and there are two figs by two stems [ okatzin ] and three figs by one stem, which of them we bring? we bring two as is fit for him, Or perhaps we bring three as limit reaping,
llm_translation: Rava asked: A sick person for whom they designated two dried figs, and there are two dried figs in two bundles, and three in one bundle - do we bring two, for they are visible to him, or perhaps we bring three, for it minimizes the gathering.

hebrew_text: פשיטא שלש מייתינן
human_translation: obvious we bring three
llm_translation: Obvious, we bring three.

hebrew_text: דעד כאן לא קאמר ר' ישמעאל התם אלא דכי ממעט באכילה קא ממעט קצירה אבל הכא דכי קא ממעט באכילה קא מפשא קצירה ודאי שלש מייתינן:
human_translation: as Rabbi Yishmael states only there, as when limits for eating, limits reaping. But here, when limits of eating increases reaping. certain we bring three
llm_translation: Until here, Rabbi Yishmael did not say there, except that when one minimizes eating, one minimizes harvesting. But here, when one minimizes eating, he transgresses harvesting, and certainly we bring three witnesses.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ מצות העומר להביא מן הקרוב לא ביכר הקרוב לירושלים מביאין אותו מכל מקום מעשה שבא העומר מגגות צריפין ושתי הלחם מבקעת עין סוכר:
human_translation: The mitzva of the omer is to bring from proximate did not ripen the proximate to Jerusalem, one brings it from any place an incident where the omer came from Gaggot Tzerifin and the two loaves from the valley of Ein Sokher.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The commandment of the Omer is to bring from the close fields. Not from the close to Jerusalem do they bring it, rather from any place. It happened that the Omer came from the roofs of Tzrifin and the two loaves from the valley of Ein Sochar.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי טעמא איבעית אימא משום כרמל
human_translation: What is the reason If you wish, say because fresh ear [ karmel ]”
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? If you wish, say it is because of Karmel.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא משום דאין מעבירין על המצות:
human_translation: And if you wish, say due to one does not postpone the mitzvot.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say it is because we do not pass over the commandments.

hebrew_text: מעשה שבא [העומר] מגגות צריפין: תנו רבנן כשצרו מלכי בית חשמונאי זה על זה והיה הורקנוס מבחוץ ואריסטובלוס מבפנים בכל יום ויום היו משלשלין להן דינרין בקופה ומעלין להן תמידין
human_translation: an incident where the omer came from Gaggot Tzerifin The Sages taught When the kings of the Hasmonean monarchy besieged each other Hyrcanus was outside of and Aristoblus was inside. On each and every day they would lower dinars in a box and would send up daily offerings
llm_translation: The incident of the Omer that came from the roofs of Zarifin: The Rabbis taught: When the kings of the Hasmonean house quarreled with each other, and Hyrcanus was on the outside and Aristobulus was on the inside, every day they would shake for them a dinar in a box and provide for them incense.

hebrew_text: היה שם זקן אחד שהיה מכיר בחכמת יוונית לעז להם בחכמת יוונית אמר להן כל זמן שעסוקין בעבודה אין נמסרין בידכם למחר שלשלו להן דינרין בקופה והעלו להן חזיר כיון שהגיע לחצי חומה נעץ צפרניו בחומה ונזדעזעה ארץ ישראל ארבע מאות פרסה על ארבע מאות פרסה
human_translation: A certain elderly man was there, who was familiar with Greek wisdom. He communicated to by Greek wisdom. The elderly man said to them: As long as they are engaged with the service, they will not be delivered into your hands. on the following day, they lowered dinars in a box, they sent up a pig to them. Once reached halfway wall, it inserted its hooves Eretz Yisrael shuddered four hundred parasangs by four hundred parasangs.
llm_translation: There was a certain elder there who was knowledgeable in Greek wisdom. He would speak to them in Greek wisdom, saying to them, "As long as you are engaged in labor, you are not entrusted with the work. Tomorrow, they handed them a dinar in a basket, and they brought up a pig for them. Once it reached halfway up the wall, it stuck its hooves into the wall, and the Land of Israel shook four hundred parasangs by four hundred parasangs."

hebrew_text: באותה שעה אמרו ארור שיגדל חזיר וארור שילמד בנו חכמת יוונית ועל אותה שעה שנינו מעשה שבא עומר מגגות צריפין ושתי הלחם מבקעת עין סוכר
human_translation: they said that time: Cursed is he who raises pigs, and cursed is he who teaches his son Greek wisdom. And with regard to that time we learned: An incident in which the omer , came from Gaggot Tzerifim, and the two loaves from the valley of Ein Sokher.
llm_translation: At that time they said: "Cursed is one who raises a swine, and cursed is one who teaches his son Greek wisdom." And at that time we learned the incident of the sheaf that came from the roofs of Tyre and the two loaves from the valley of Sukkot.

hebrew_text: כי מטא עומר לא הוו ידעי מהיכא אייתי עומר אכרזו אתא ההוא חרשא אותיב חדא ידא אאיגרא וחדא ידיה אצריפא אמר להו מרדכי מי איכא דוכתא דשמה גגות צריפין או צריפין גגות בדקו ואשכחוה
human_translation: When it came omer they did not know from where bring omer proclaimed A certain deaf-mute [ ḥersha ] came stretched out one hand toward a roof, and one hand toward a hut [ atzerifa ]. Mordekhai said to Is there a place that is called Gaggot Tzerifin or Tzerifin Gaggot? They checked and found
llm_translation: When the Omer offering arrived, they did not know from where to bring the Omer. They proclaimed, "Bring the Omer!" There came a certain deaf-mute who held a bundle of barley in one hand and a bundle of flax in the other. Mordechai said to them, "Is there a place where roofs are made of flax and flax of roofs?" They investigated and found it so.

hebrew_text: כי בעי לאתוי שתי הלחם לא הוו ידעי מהיכא לאתויי אכרזו אתא ההוא גברא חרשא אותיב ידיה אעיניה וחדא ידא אסיכרא אמר להו מרדכי ומי איכא דוכתא דשמה עין סוכר או סוכר עין בדקו ואשכחו
human_translation: when they needed to bring the two loaves, they did not know from where to bring proclaimed a certain deaf-mute came stretched out hand toward his eye [ a’eineih ] and one hand toward a door latch [ assikhera ]. Mordekhai said to And is there a place that is called: Ein Sokher, or Sokher Ayin? They checked and found
llm_translation: When they wanted to bring the two loaves of the offering, they did not know from where to bring them. They proclaimed, a certain deaf man came, he placed his hands on his eyes, and with one hand on his forehead, he said to them, "Is there a place called 'Ein Sukar' or 'Sukar Ein'?" They searched and found.

hebrew_text: הנהו שלש נשים דאייתו שלש קינין חדא אמרה לזיבתי וחדא אמרה לימתי וחדא אמרה לעונתי
human_translation: a certain three women brought three nests One said: for my ziva ; and one said: for my yamma ; and one said: for my ona .
llm_translation: These three women brought three complaints: one said to my menstruation, one said to my death, and one said to my guilt.

hebrew_text: סבור מינה זיבתי זבה ממש לימתי לימתי ממש לעונתי לעונתה דכולהו חדא חטאת וחדא עולה
human_translation: understood from For my ziva , an actual zava . For my yamma , My actual yamma , For my ona , for her time [ ona ] that all one sin offering and one burnt offering.
llm_translation: Opinion from where? My menstrual impurity is actual, her menstrual impurity is actual, my appointed time is actual, her appointed time is actual, for all of them one sin offering and one burnt offering.

hebrew_text: אמר להו מרדכי שמא בזוב סיכנה שמא בים סיכנה שמא בעינה סיכנה דכולהו עולות נינהו בדוק ואשכח
human_translation: Mordekhai said to Perhaps was endangered of flow [ zov ]. perhaps was endangered at sea [ yam ]. perhaps was endangered through her eye [ ayin ], as they are all burnt offerings. was checked and found
llm_translation: Mordechai said to them: Perhaps there is a danger of zov, perhaps there is a danger of the sea, perhaps there is a danger of the eye, for all these are possible risks. Investigate and find out.

hebrew_text: והיינו דתנן פתחיה על הקינין זה מרדכי למה נקרא שמו פתחיה  פותח דברים ודורשן ויודע בשבעים לשון
human_translation: And this is as we learned Petaḥya for the nests This is Mordekhai; why was he called Petaḥya, that he would open, topics and interpret them and he knew seventy languages
llm_translation: And this is what we learned in the Mishnah: The opening of the Book of Esther is concerning the Kinnim. Why was his name called Pethahiah? Because he opens matters and expounds them, and he knows in seventy languages.

hebrew_text: כולהו סנהדרין נמי ידעי שבעים לשון דאמר רבי יוחנן אין מושיבים בסנהדרין אלא בעלי חכמה בעלי מראה בעלי קומה בעלי זקנה בעלי כשפים ויודעים שבעים לשון שלא תהא סנהדרין שומעת מפי התורגמן
human_translation: All Sanhedrin also know seventy languages. As Rabbi Yoḥanan says: place on the Sanhedrin only of wisdom, and of appearance, and of stature, and of age And masters of sorcery, and know seventy languages that the Sanhedrin will not hear from the mouth of a translator
llm_translation: All the Sanhedrin also know seventy languages, as Rabbi Yochanan said: Only those who are wise, of good appearance, tall, elderly, skilled in magic, and know seventy languages may sit in the Sanhedrin, so that the Sanhedrin does not have to rely on an interpreter.

hebrew_text: אלא דהוה בייל לישני ודריש והיינו דכתיב במרדכי (נחמיה ז, ז) בלשן:
human_translation: Rather, as combine languages and interpret This is which is written with regard to Mordekhai: “Bilshan”
llm_translation: Rather, one should come and learn and expound, and this is what is written in Mordecai (Nehemiah 7:7) in the language:

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כיצד הן עושין שלוחי בית דין יוצאין מערב יום טוב ועושין אותן כריכות במחובר לקרקע כדי שיהא נוח לקצור כל העיירות הסמוכות לשם מתכנסות לשם כדי שיהא נקצר בעסק גדול
human_translation: How would they perform Emissaries of the court emerge on the eve of the festival and fashion sheaves while attached to the ground, so that it would be convenient to reap all the towns adjacent to would assemble there, so that it would be harvested with great fanfare.
llm_translation: Mishnah: How do they make the messengers of the court go out on Erev Yom Tov? They make for them bundles attached to the ground so that it will be easy to harvest. All the neighboring towns gather there so that it will be harvested with a large workforce.

hebrew_text: כיון שהחשיכה אומר להן בא השמש אומר הין בא השמש אומר הין מגל זו אומר הין מגל זו אומר הין קופה זו אומר הין קופה זו אומר הין
human_translation: Once it grew dark, says to Did the sun set? says Yes. Did the sun set? say: Yes. this sickle? says Yes. this sickle? says: Yes. this basket? says Yes. this basket? says: Yes.
llm_translation: Once it became dark, he says to them, "The sun has come." He says, "Yes, the sun has come." He says, "This scroll is a yes." He says, "This scroll is a yes." He says, "This bowl is a yes." He says, "This bowl is a yes."

hebrew_text: בשבת אומר להן שבת זו אמר הין שבת זו אמר הין אקצור והם אומרים לו קצור אקצור והם אומרים לו קצור
human_translation: on Shabbat, says to this Shabbat? says Yes. this Shabbat? says: Yes. Shall I cut And they say to him Cut. Shall I cut And they say Cut.
llm_translation: On Shabbat, he says to them, "This Shabbat," he says, "Yes." "This Shabbat," he says, "Yes." "I will harvest," and they say to him, "Harvest." "I will harvest," and they say to him, "Harvest."

hebrew_text: שלש פעמים על כל דבר ודבר והן אומרים לו הין הין הין כל כך למה (לי) מפני הבייתוסים שהיו אומרים אין קצירת העומר במוצאי יו"ט:
human_translation: three times with regard to each and every matter, and says to him: Yes, yes, yes. Why do I to that extent? due to the Boethusians, as they would say: There is no harvest of the omer at the conclusion of the Festival
llm_translation: Three times for every matter, and they say to him, "Yes, yes, yes, why so much? Because of the Boethusians who used to say, 'The cutting of the Omer is not on the conclusion of the festival.'"

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן אלין יומיא דלא להתענאה בהון ומקצתהון דלא למספד בהון מריש ירחא דניסן עד תמניא ביה איתוקם תמידא דלא למספד ומתמניא ביה ועד סוף מועדא איתותב חגא דשבועיא דלא למספד
human_translation: The Sages taught These are the days on which fasting is prohibited, and on some of them eulogizing is prohibited From the New Moon of Nisan until the eighth of the daily offering was established, not to eulogize And from the eighth of until the end of the festival festival of Shavuot was restored, not to eulogize
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: These are the days on which one should not fast and some of them on which one should not eulogize: from the beginning of the month of Nissan until the eighth day, the daily offering is established and one should not eulogize; and from then until the end of the festival, the festival of weeks, one should not eulogize.

hebrew_text: מריש ירחא דניסן ועד תמניא ביה איתוקם תמידא דלא למספד שהיו צדוקים אומרים יחיד מתנדב ומביא תמיד מאי דרוש (במדבר כח, ד) את הכבש האחד תעשה בבקר ואת הכבש השני תעשה בין הערבים
human_translation: From the New Moon of Nisan until the eighth of the daily offering was established, not to eulogize that the Sadducees would say: An individual may donate and bring daily offering, What expound? “The one lamb shall you offer [ ta’aseh ] in the morning, and the other lamb shall you offer in the afternoon”
llm_translation: At the beginning of the month of Nisan until the eighth day, the continual offering was established, so that it should not be lacking. For the Sadducees used to say, "An individual may volunteer and bring the continual offering." What is the verse that is expounded? "The one lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer between the evenings." (Numbers 28:4)

hebrew_text: מאי אהדרו (במדבר כח, ב) את קרבני לחמי לאשי תשמרו שיהיו כולן באין מתרומת הלשכה
human_translation: What reply My food that is presented to Me for offerings made by fire, you shall observe [ tishmeru ] all of the should come from collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of 'you shall present my food offerings, the food of my offerings by fire' (Numbers 28:2)? That they should all come from the contribution of the Chamber."

hebrew_text: מתמניא ביה ועד סוף מועדא איתותב חגא דשבועיא דלא למספד שהיו בייתוסין אומרים עצרת אחר השבת
human_translation: From the eighth of until the end of the festival festival of Shavuot was restored, not to eulogize As the Boethusians would say Shavuot after Shabbat,
llm_translation: They appointed for it until the end of the festival of Sukkot, that it should not be a day of mourning, for the Boethusians used to say, "Shemini Atzeret is after the Sabbath."

hebrew_text: ניטפל להם רבן יוחנן בן זכאי ואמר להם שוטים מנין לכם ולא היה אדם אחד שהיה משיבו חוץ מזקן אחד שהיה מפטפט כנגדו ואמר משה רבינו אוהב ישראל היה ויודע שעצרת יום אחד הוא עמד ותקנה אחר שבת כדי שיהו ישראל מתענגין שני ימים קרא עליו מקרא זה (דברים א, ב) אחד עשר יום מחורב דרך הר שעיר
human_translation: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai joined and said to them: Fools! From where you And there was no man who answered him, except for one elderly man who was prattling [ mefatpet ] at him, and he said: Moses, our teacher, was a lover of the Jewish people and he knew that Shavuot is one day. he arose and established it after Shabbat, in order that the Jewish people would enjoy themselves for two days. recited this verse to “It is eleven days’ journey from Horeb to Kadesh Barnea by the way of Mount Seir”
llm_translation: Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai interceded for them and said to them, "Fools, how many sacrifices do you require?" And there was no one who would respond to him except for one elder who would whisper to him. And he said, "Our teacher Moses was a lover of Israel, and he knew that the congregation would be detained for one day, so he stood up and instituted another ordinance after Shabbat so that Israel may delight for two days." This verse was called upon him: "Eleven days from Horeb by way of Mount Seir" (Deuteronomy 1:2).

hebrew_text: ואם משה רבינו אוהב ישראל היה למה איחרן במדבר ארבעים שנה אמר לו רבי בכך אתה פוטרני אמר לו שוטה ולא תהא תורה שלמה שלנו כשיחה בטילה שלכם
human_translation: And if Moses, our teacher, was a lover of the Jewish people, why did he delay them in the wilderness forty years? said to him: My teacher, you dismiss me with this said to him: Fool! And will our perfect Torah not be as your frivolous speech?
llm_translation: "And if Moses our teacher loved Israel, why did he delay them in the wilderness for forty years? Rabbi said to him: 'By this you absolve me.' He said to him: 'Fool! Let not our perfect Torah be like your idle chatter.'"

hebrew_text: כתוב אחד אומר (ויקרא כג, טז) תספרו חמשים יום וכתוב אחד אומר (ויקרא כג, טו) שבע שבתות תמימות תהיינה
human_translation: One verse states: you shall number fifty days; and one verse, states: seven weeks shall there be complete.”
llm_translation: One written verse says (Leviticus 23:16) "You shall count fifty days," and one written verse says (Leviticus 23:15) "Seven complete weeks there shall be."

hebrew_text: הא כיצד כאן ביום טוב שחל להיות בשבת כאן ביו"ט שחל להיות באמצע שבת
human_translation: How so, Here, when the festival occurs on Shabbat. There, when the festival occurs in the middle of the week.
llm_translation: Here is how it is: Here, on a festival that falls on Shabbat; here, on a festival that falls in the middle of the week.

hebrew_text: (של ר' אליעזר סופר רבי יהושע מונה רבי ישמעאל מעמר רבי יהודה למטה סימן)
human_translation: a mnemonic of Rabbi Eliezer: Number; Rabbi Yehoshua: Count; Rabbi Yishmael: From the omer ; Rabbi Yehuda: Below.
llm_translation: Regarding Rabbi Eliezer the scribe, Rabbi Yehoshua appoints Rabbi Yishmael from Amor, Rabbi Yehuda below as a sign.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר אומר אינו צריך הרי הוא אומר (דברים טז, ט) תספר לך ספירה תלויה בבית דין שהם יודעים לחדש ממחרת השבת מחרת י"ט יצאת שבת בראשית שספירתה בכל אדם
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: is not necessary, as states: you shall number for you; counting is dependent upon court, as they know calculate the new “The morrow after the day of rest [ hashabbat ]” The morrow after the Festival, exclude Shabbat of Creation, whose counting by every person,
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: It is not necessary, as it says (Deuteronomy 16:9), "You shall count for yourself a counting," dependent on the court, who know to declare the new month after the Sabbath, the day after the festival. You have left the Sabbath at the beginning, for its counting is incumbent upon every individual.

hebrew_text: רבי יהושע אומר אמרה תורה מנה ימים וקדש חדש מנה ימים וקדש עצרת מה חדש סמוך לביאתו ניכר אף עצרת סמוך לביאתו ניכרת
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: Torah said count days, and sanctify month count days and sanctify the festival of Shavuot just as month is known before it comes, so too the festival of Shavuot is known before it comes,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua says: The Torah said "count days" and sanctify the new moon, count days, and sanctify the festival of Shavuot. Just as the new moon close to its arrival is recognizable, so too the festival of Shavuot close to its arrival is recognizable.

hebrew_text: ואם תאמר עצרת לעולם אחר השבת היאך תהא ניכרת משלפניה
human_translation: And if you say Shavuot always day after Shabbat, how known what came before it?
llm_translation: And if you will say, "Shavuot is always after Shabbat, how will it be distinguished from its preceding day?

hebrew_text: רבי ישמעאל אומר אמרה תורה הבא עומר בפסח ושתי הלחם בעצרת מה להלן רגל ותחלת רגל אף כאן רגל ותחלת רגל
human_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says The Torah said: Bring omer on Passover and the two loaves on Shavuot . Just as there, festival the beginning of the Festival, so too here, festival the beginning of the Festival.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yishmael says: The Torah said, "The Omer offering on Passover and the two loaves on Shavuot." Just as there in the case of Shavuot it is a pilgrimage festival and the beginning of the pilgrimage festival, so too here in the case of Passover it is a pilgrimage festival and the beginning of the pilgrimage festival.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה בן בתירא אומר נאמר שבת למעלה ונאמר שבת למטה מה להלן רגל ותחלת רגל סמוך לה אף כאן רגל ותחלת רגל סמוך לה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says stated “ shabbat ” above and stated “ shabbat ” below Just as festival and beginning of the Festival follows so too here, Festival, follows the beginning of the Festival,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: It is stated "Shabbat" above, and it is stated "Shabbat" below. Just as there, "foot" and the beginning of the foot are close to it, so too here, "foot" and the beginning of the foot are close to it.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן (ויקרא כג, טו) וספרתם לכם שתהא ספירה לכל אחד ואחד
human_translation: The Sages taught “And you shall count for you,” that there should be a counting by each and every
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And you shall count for yourselves" (Leviticus 23:15) - that there should be a counting for each and every one.

hebrew_text: (ויקרא כג, יא) ממחרת השבת ממחרת יו"ט או אינו אלא למחרת שבת בראשית רבי יוסי בר יהודה אומר הרי הוא אומר (ויקרא כג, טז) תספרו חמשים יום כל ספירות שאתה סופר לא יהו אלא חמשים יום
human_translation: From the morrow after the day of rest [ hashabbat ], from the morrow after the festival Or not rather after the Shabbat of Creation, Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says: as states: you shall number fifty days” all the countings that you count shall be only fifty days.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Leviticus 23:11) "On the day after the Sabbath, the day after the festival," or is it only the day after the Sabbath? In the beginning, Rabbi Yosei bar Yehuda says, "Behold, it says (Leviticus 23:16) 'You shall count fifty days,' all the counts that you count shall be only fifty days."

hebrew_text: ואם תאמר ממחרת שבת בראשית פעמים שאתה מוצא חמשים ואחד ופעמים שאתה מוצא חמשים ושנים חמשים ושלשה חמשים וארבעה חמשים וחמשה חמשים וששה
human_translation: And if you say “From the morrow after Shabbat of Creation, sometimes you will find fifty-one and sometimes you will find fifty-two, fifty-three, fifty-four, fifty-five, fifty-six.
llm_translation: And if you will say, "From the day after the Sabbath, in the beginning," count times that you find fifty-one, and times that you find fifty-two, fifty-three, fifty-four, fifty-five, and fifty-six.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה בן בתירא אומר אינו צריך
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Beteira says: is not necessary,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda ben Betera says: It is not necessary.

hebrew_text: הרי הוא אומר תספור לך ספירה תלויה בבית דין יצתה שבת בראשית שספירתה בכל אדם
human_translation: as states: you shall number for you; counting is dependent upon court, exclude Shabbat of Creation, whose counting by every person,
llm_translation: Behold, he says, "You shall count a counting dependent on the court. Shabbat emerged in the beginning, for its counting is in every person."

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי אומר ממחרת השבת ממחרת יום טוב אתה אומר ממחרת יו"ט או אינו אלא ממחרת שבת בראשית אמרת וכי נאמר ממחרת השבת שבתוך הפסח והלא לא נאמר אלא ממחרת השבת דכל השנה כולה מלאה שבתות צא ובדוק איזו שבת
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says from the morrow after the day of rest [ hashabbat ]” from the morrow after the festival Do you say from the morrow after the festival or is it only from the morrow after Shabbat of Creation, You say Is it stated: From the morrow after the day of rest [ hashabbat ] that is during Passover? No, it is stated only: “From the morrow after the day of rest [ hashabbat ].” that the entire year is full of Shabbatot , go and examine which Shabbat
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei says, "The day after Shabbat, the day after Yom Tov, you say 'the day after Yom Tov,' or is it rather 'the day after Shabbat'? In the beginning, you said, 'And when it is said, 'the day after Shabbat,' is it within Pesach?' But was it not only said 'the day after Shabbat,' for the entire year is full of Shabbatot. Go out and examine which Shabbat."

hebrew_text: ועוד נאמרה שבת למטה ונאמרה שבת למעלה מה להלן רגל ותחילת רגל אף כאן רגל ותחילת רגל
human_translation: And furthermore, stated “ shabbat ” below, and stated “ shabbat ” above Just as below, festival and beginning of the Festival; so too here, Festival, near the beginning of the Festival,
llm_translation: And furthermore it was said Shabbat below and it was said Shabbat above, what is the comparison? Just as there below is the end of the foot and the beginning of the foot, so too here above is the end of the foot and the beginning of the foot.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון בן אלעזר אומר כתוב אחד אומר (דברים טז, ח) ששת ימים תאכל מצות וכתוב אחד אומר (שמות יב, טו) שבעת ימים מצות תאכלו הא כיצד מצה שאי אתה יכול לאוכלה שבעה מן החדש אתה יכול לאוכלה ששה מן החדש
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says One verse states: “Six days you shall eat unleavened bread” and one verse states: “Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread” How these matza that you are unable to eat for seven from the new you are able to eat for six from the new
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar says: It is written in one place (Deuteronomy 16:8), "Six days you shall eat unleavened bread," and it is written in another place (Exodus 12:15), "Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread." How is this possible? Unleavened bread that you cannot eat for seven days from the new month, you can eat for six days from the new month.

hebrew_text: (ויקרא כג, טו) מיום הביאכם תספרו יכול יקצור ויביא ואימתי שירצה יספור

llm_translation: (Leviticus 23:15) "From the day after the day of your bringing the sheaf of the wave offering, you shall count for yourselves, seven complete weeks."

human_translation: the verse states: from the time the sickle is first put to the standing grain you shall begin to number If “From the time the sickle is first put to the standing grain you shall begin to number,” might harvest and count and bring whenever he wishes. the verse states: “From the day that you brought
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches (Deuteronomy 16:9): "From when the sickle begins to cut the standing grain, you shall begin to count." If from when the sickle begins to cut, one may think that he may harvest and count, when is it that he should bring it? The Talmud teaches: "From the day you bring it."

hebrew_text: אי מיום הביאכם יכול יקצור ויספור ויביא ביום תלמוד לומר (ויקרא כג, טו) שבע שבתות תמימות תהיינה אימתי אתה מוצא שבע שבתות תמימות בזמן שאתה מתחיל לימנות מבערב
human_translation: If “From the day that you brought might harvest and count and bring during the day, the verse states: seven weeks there shall be complete.” When do you find seven complete weeks? at the time when you begin to count from the evening.
llm_translation: From the day of your bringing, can harvest and count and bring on the day Talmud to say (Leviticus 23:15) "Seven complete Sabbaths there shall be." When do you find seven complete Sabbaths? When you begin to count from the evening.

llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei also saw a contradiction, and that is what he said, "and furthermore."

hebrew_text: גופא אמר אביי מצוה למימני יומי ומצוה למימני שבועי רבנן דבי רב אשי מנו יומי ומנו שבועי אמימר מני יומי ולא מני שבועי אמר זכר למקדש הוא:
human_translation: the itself Abaye said: a mitzva to count days, and a mitzva to count weeks. the Sages of the study hall of Rav Ashi counted days and they counted weeks. Ameimar counted days but not weeks. said: is commemoration of the Temple.
llm_translation: The body, Abaye said, it is a mitzvah to count daily, and it is a mitzvah to count weekly. The sages of the house of Rav Ashi counted daily and counted weekly. Amemar counted daily but not weekly. He said, "It is a remembrance for the Temple."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ קצרוהו ונתנוהו בקופות הביאוהו לעזרה והיו מהבהבין אותו באור כדי לקיים בו מצות קלי דברי רבי מאיר וחכמים אומרים בקנים ובקולחות חובטין אותו כדי שלא יתמעך
human_translation: they harvested and placed it in baskets, they brought it to the courtyard. And they would singe in fire in order to fulfill the mitzva of parched the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: beating with reeds and with cabbage stalks, so that would not be crushed.
llm_translation: Mishnah: They would harvest it and place it in baskets, bring it to the Temple courtyard, and sift it in the light in order to fulfill the mitzvah of parching. Rabbi Meir says, "with baskets and winnowing forks they would sift it," and the Sages say, "they would beat it with reeds so that it would not become moldy."

hebrew_text: נתנוהו לאבוב ואבוב היה מנוקב כדי שיהא האור שולט בכולו שטחוהו בעזרה והרוח מנשבת בו נתנוהו לריחים של גרוסות והוציאו ממנו עשרון שהוא מנופה בשלש עשרה נפה והשאר נפדה ונאכל לכל אדם וחייב בחלה ופטור מן המעשר ר' עקיבא מחייב בחלה ובמעשרות:
human_translation: They placed into a hollow vessel [ le’abuv ], and vessel was perforated so that the fire would take hold of in its entirety. they spread in the courtyard and the wind would blow upon They placed in a mill to grits, And they produced from a tenth that was sifted through thirteen sifters, and the rest is redeemed and eaten by any person. And is obligated in ḥalla , and exempt from the tithe. Rabbi Akiva deems obligated in ḥalla and tithes
llm_translation: They placed it in an oven, and the oven was perforated so that the light would illuminate its entire surface. They plastered it with clay and the wind blew through it. They placed it among bundles of herbs, and they took out from it a tithe, which is separated with thirteen perforations, and the rest is redeemed and may be eaten by anyone. One is obligated in challah and exempt from tithing. Rabbi Akiva obligates in challah and tithes.

llm_translation: Carmel soft and full, and so it says (2 Kings 4:42) "And a man came from Baal-shalishah, and he brought to the man of God bread of the firstfruits, twenty loaves of barley, and fresh ears of grain in his sack. And he said, 'Give to the people, and let them eat.' But his servant said, 'What, should I set this before a hundred men?' He replied, 'Give it to the people, and let them eat, for thus said the Lord, "They shall eat and have some left."'"

human_translation: And states: let us solace ourselves [ nitalesa ] with love” We shall converse [ nissa veniten ] and we shall go up [ vena’aleh ] and we shall rejoice [ venismaḥ ] and be pampered [ venitḥata ] with loves.
llm_translation: And he says (Proverbs 7:18), "He has gone on a journey, he has taken a bag of money with him, and he will not return home until the day of the full moon."

llm_translation: And he says (Job 39:13), "The wing of the ostriches flap joyously, though not with the pinions and plumage of a stork."

The treasurer will prove that one is obligated in challah and exempt from tithes.

llm_translation: And if it is said that the anointing oil does not exempt, what are they saying to him? "It is it."

human_translation: Rather, Rabbi Yoḥanan says: It is a settled, tradition in the mouth of Rabbi Akiva that money was given only of that they required
llm_translation: Rather, said Rabbi Yochanan, it is a well-arranged teaching in the mouth of Rabbi Akiva that money was only given for their sake.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא פשיטא לי דמירוח הקדש פוטר ואפילו ר' עקיבא לא קא מחייב התם אלא שלא ניתנו מעות אלא לצורך להן אבל מירוח הקדש בעלמא פוטר
human_translation: Rava said: obvious to me that smoothing consecrated exempts And even Rabbi Akiva, obligates tithes only there, where money was given only that they required But smoothing consecrated generally exempts
llm_translation: Rava said: It is obvious to me that with regards to consecrated property, one is exempt, and even Rabbi Akiva does not obligate one to bring a sin offering there, except that the money was not given except for their own benefit. But with regards to consecrated property in general, one is exempt.

hebrew_text: מירוח העובד כוכבים תנאי היא דתניא תורמין משל ישראל על של ישראל ומשל עובדי כוכבים על של עובדי כוכבים ומשל כותיים על של כותיים ומשל כל על של כל דברי רבי מאיר ורבי יהודה
human_translation: smoothing a gentile is tanna’im , as it is taught One separates from of a Jew to of a Jew, from from gentiles to from gentiles, and from from Samaritans to from Samaritans. from of any to of any the statement of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda,
llm_translation: From the distance of an idolater, it is a condition, as it was taught: One may tithe produce of an Israelite for an Israelite, and of idolaters for idolaters, and of Samaritans for Samaritans, and of any for any. These are the words of Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי ורבי שמעון אומרים תורמין משל ישראל על של ישראל ומשל עובדי כוכבים על של כותיים ומשל כותיים על של עובדי כוכבים אבל לא משל ישראל על של עובדי כוכבים ושל כותיים ולא משל עובדי כוכבים ושל כותיים על [של] ישראל
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon say: One separates teruma from of a Jew to of a Jew, and from gentiles to from Samaritans, and from from Samaritans to from gentiles. But not from of a Jew to from gentiles or from Samaritans, nor from from gentiles or from Samaritans to of a Jew.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosi and Rabbi Shimon say: One may tithe produce of an Israelite for an Israelite, and the produce of idolaters for idolaters, and the produce of idolaters for idolaters. However, one may not tithe the produce of an Israelite for idolaters, nor the produce of idolaters for Israelites.

hebrew_text: גלגול הקדש פוטר דתנן הקדישה עיסתה עד שלא גלגלה ופדאתה חייבת משגלגלה ופדאתה חייבת הקדישה עד שלא גלגלה וגלגלה הגזבר ואחר כך פדאתה פטורה שבשעת חובתה היתה פטורה
human_translation: kneading consecrated exempts as we learned consecrated her dough before she kneaded and she redeemed it, she is obligated she after she kneaded and she redeemed it, she is obligated she consecrated before she kneaded and treasurer it and she subsequently redeemed it, she is exempt. at the time its obligation it was exempt,
llm_translation: The rolling of the consecrated item exempts, as we learned in a Mishnah: its consecration is binding until it is rolled, and its redemption is obligatory once it is rolled. Consecration is binding until it is rolled, and once it is rolled, the treasurer rolls it and then its redemption is exempt, for at the time of its obligation, it is exempt.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא גלגול עובד כוכבים מאי מיתנא תנן גר שנתגייר והיתה לו עיסה נעשה עד שלא נתגייר פטור משנתגייר חייב ספק חייב
human_translation: Rava raises a dilemma: kneaded a gentile, what is taught as we learned a convert who converted and had dough his prepared before he converted, exempt after he converted, obligated. uncertain, obligated.
llm_translation: Rava asked: "Regarding the reincarnation of a non-Jew, what is the law?" What is the meaning of what we learned in the Mishnah: "A convert who had dough, it becomes permitted before he converted, he is exempt; after he converted, he is liable. In a case of doubt, he is liable."

hebrew_text: או דלמא רבי יוסי ורבי שמעון קתני לה דקא פטרי אבל רבי מאיר ורבי יהודה גמרי ראשית ראשית מהתם
human_translation: Or perhaps Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon taught as they exempt But Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda derive the first from there, “The first
llm_translation: Or perhaps Rabbi Yosei and Rabbi Shimon taught it, for they exempted one from liability in a case of but Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda concluded that one is liable for "reshit reshit" from there.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא יהא רעוא דאחזיה בחילמא הדר אמר רבא מאן דאמר מירוח העובד כוכבים פוטר גלגול העובד כוכבים פוטר מאן דאמר מירוח העובד כוכבים אינו פוטר גלגול העובד כוכבים אינו פוטר
human_translation: Rava said: May it be will that I see in a dream. Rava then said: The one who says smoothing of gentile exempts kneading of gentile exempts the one who says smoothing of gentile does not exempt kneading gentile does not exempt
llm_translation: Rava said: Let the evil inclination of those who hold by the stars be satisfied. Thereupon Rava said: One who says that the influence of the planets exempts from punishment, the transmigration of souls exempts from punishment. One who says that the influence of the planets does not exempt from punishment, the transmigration of souls does not exempt from punishment.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רב פפא לרבא עובד כוכבים שהפריש פטר חמור וחלה מודיעים אותו שהוא פטור וחלתו נאכלת לזרים ופטר חמור גוזז ועובד בו
human_translation: Rav Pappa raised an objection to Rava a gentile who separated a firstborn donkey, or ḥalla one informs him that he is exempt and his ḥalla eaten by non-priests and firstborn donkey sheared and worked.
llm_translation: Rav Papa raised an objection to Rava: A non-Jew who separated out a firstborn donkey and it became sick, they inform him that he is exempt, and its carcass may be eaten by non-priests, and the firstborn donkey is sheared and used for labor.

hebrew_text: הא תרומתו אסורה והא האי תנא דאמר מירוח העובד כוכבים אינו פוטר וגלגול עובד כוכבים פוטר
human_translation: But his teruma prohibited And this a tanna who says: smoothing by a gentile does not exempt it and kneading a gentile exempts
llm_translation: This terumah is forbidden, and this Tanna who said, "The steam of a non-Jew does not exempt," and the wheel of a non-Jew exempts.

hebrew_text: ועוד איתיביה רבינא לרבא חלת עובד כוכבים בארץ ותרומתו בחוצה לארץ מודיעין אותו שהוא פטור חלתו נאכלת לזרים ותרומתו אינה מדמעת הא תרומתו בארץ אסורה ומדמעת
human_translation: And Ravina further raised an objection to Rava ḥalla of a gentile in Eretz or his teruma outside Eretz one informs him that he is exempt his ḥalla eaten by non-priests and his teruma does not render a mixture But his teruma in Eretz prohibited and renders a mixture
llm_translation: And furthermore, Rabbina raised an objection to Rava: If a Gentile baked bread in the land and his terumah is outside the land, they inform him that he is exempt. His bread may be eaten by strangers, but his terumah does not render impure. But if his terumah is in the land, it is forbidden, and it renders impure.

hebrew_text: והא האי תנא דאמר מירוח העובד כוכבים אינו פוטר גלגול העובד כוכבים פוטר
human_translation: And this a tanna who says: smoothing by a gentile does not exempt it kneading by a gentile exempts
llm_translation: And this, this Tanna who said, "From the wind of a non-Jew one is not exempt from the wheel of a non-Jew is exempt."

hebrew_text: מדרבנן גזירה משום בעלי כיסים
human_translation: by rabbinic law. a decree due to people of means.
llm_translation: From the Rabbis, a decree because of those who have money bags.

hebrew_text: אי הכי אפילו חלה נמי אפשר דאפי לה פחות מחמשת רבעים קמח ועוד
human_translation: If so, ḥalla as well, possible to bake less than five-fourths flour and more,
llm_translation: If so, even if she is sick, it is also possible that she baked less than five quarters of flour and more.

hebrew_text: תרומה נמי אפשר דעביד לה כדר' אושעיא דאמר רבי אושעיא מערים אדם על תבואתו ומכניסה במוץ שלה כדי שתהא בהמתו אוכלת ופטורה מן המעשר אי נמי דעייל לה דרך גגות ודרך קרפיפות
human_translation: teruma also by acting that which Rabbi Oshaya as Rabbi Oshaya says: A person can employ artifice with his grain, and bringing it into in its chaff so that his animal may eat And exempt from tithes. Alternatively, to bring in way roofs or way enclosures [ karpeifot ].
llm_translation: Trumah, too, it is possible that one may do it like Rabbi Oshaya, for Rabbi Oshaya said: A person piles up his produce and brings it into its chaff so that his livestock may eat it, and he is exempt from tithing. Alternatively, he may bring it in through rooftops and through balconies.

hebrew_text: התם בפרהסיא זילא ביה מילתא הכא בצינעא לא זילא ביה מילתא:
human_translation: There, in public [ befarhesya ], it is degrading for one Here, in private, it is not degrading for him,
llm_translation: There, in the marketplace, go with it a matter; here, in private, do not go with it a matter.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ בא לו לעשרון נתן עליו שמנו ולבונתו יצק ובלל הניף והגיש קמץ והקטיר והשאר נאכל לכהנים
human_translation: came to the tenth placed in its oil, and its frankincense poured and mixed waved and brought removed the handful and burned And the rest is eaten by the priests.
llm_translation: Mishnah: If one comes to the tenth of an ephah, he places its oil and frankincense, pours and mixes, waves and brings a handful, burns, and the rest is eaten by the priests.

hebrew_text: משקרב העומר יוצאין ומוצאין שוק ירושלים שהוא מלא קמח קלי שלא ברצון חכמים דברי רבי מאיר ר' יהודה אומר ברצון חכמים היו עושין:
human_translation: Once the omer was sacrificed emerge and find the marketplace of Jerusalem full of the flour parched grain not with the approval of the Sages; the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says: They would do with the approval of the Sages.
llm_translation: When the Omer offering is brought close, they go out and find the market of Jerusalem filled with roasted grain, not according to the will of the Sages. These are the words of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Yehuda says, "According to the will of the Sages they used to do."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ולא גזר רבי יהודה דלמא אתי למיכל מיניה
human_translation: And doesn’t Rabbi Yehuda issued a decree perhaps someone come to eat from it?
llm_translation: Gemara: And Rabbi Yehuda did not decree, lest one come to eat from it.

hebrew_text: ורמינהו ר' יהודה אומר בודקין אור ארבעה עשר ובארבעה עשר שחרית ובשעת הביעור וחכמים אומרים לא בדק כו'
human_translation: And raises a contradiction Rabbi Yehuda says one searches on the evening of the fourteenth and on the fourteenth the morning, and at the time of eradication And the Rabbis say: one did not search
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: Rabbi Yehuda says, "One examines the light on the fourteenth of Nisan and on the fourteenth of Nisan in the morning, and at the time of Bi'ur." And the Sages say, "He did not examine, etc."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה שאני חדש
human_translation: Rabba says new is different,
llm_translation: Rabah said: "Shani Chadash."

hebrew_text: מתוך שלא היתרתה לו אלא על ידי קיטוף זכור הוא
