human_translation: Since you permitted one only by picking he will remember
llm_translation: From the fact that she was only permitted to him through gathering, he is remembered.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי תינח קצירה טחינה והרקדה מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: Abaye said to him: works out well picking grinding and sifting, what can be said?
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him: "Regarding the offering of the Feast of Weeks, what can be said about grinding, kneading, and baking?"

hebrew_text: הא לא קשיא טחינה בריחיא דידא הרקדה על גבי נפה
human_translation: This not difficult, grinding with a hand mill, sifting on top of sifter.
llm_translation: This is not difficult: "Tehina" in our region is the same as "Rakda" on a napkin.

hebrew_text: בית השלחין דשריא קצירה דתנן קוצרין בית השלחין שבעמקים אבל לא גודשין מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: a field that requires irrigation, where harvesting is permitted, as we learned One may harvest an irrigated field and in the valleys, but one not pile what can be said?
llm_translation: The house of the messengers is permitted for harvesting, as we learned in a Mishnah: One may harvest in the house of the messengers in the valleys, but one may not thresh. What can be said?

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אביי חדש בדיל מיניה חמץ לא בדיל מיניה
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said: distances himself from new does not distance himself from leavened bread,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: "New flour is distinct from it leaven, but not old flour from it."

hebrew_text: אמר רבא דר' יהודה אדר' יהודה קשיא דרבנן אדרבנן לא קשיא
human_translation: Rava said: of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda a difficulty, of the Rabbis of the Rabbis not a difficult?
llm_translation: Rava said: According to Rabbi Yehuda, according to Rabbi Yehuda, it is difficult for the Rabbis; according to the Rabbis, it is not difficult.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא דר' יהודה אדר' יהודה לא קשיא כדשנינן דרבנן אדרבנן לא קשיא הוא עצמו מחזר עליו לשורפו מיכל אכיל מיניה
human_translation: Rather, Rava said of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda not difficult, as we resolved of the Rabbis of the Rabbis also not difficult: himself is seeking out to burn it, he eat from it?
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: According to Rabbi Yehuda in the name of Rabbi Yehuda, it is not difficult. As we have learned in the teachings of the Rabbis, according to the Rabbis, it is not difficult. He himself repeated it to burn it; Michal ate from it.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר דרבי יהודה אדרבי יהודה לא קשיא קמח קלי תנן
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: of Rabbi Yehuda of Rabbi Yehuda not difficult, As we learned flour of parched grain.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: Rabbi Yehuda said, "Rabbi Yehuda did not have a difficulty - we learned: 'fine flour'."

hebrew_text: והא דרב אשי ברותא היא תינח מקלי ואילך עד קלי מאי איכא למימר
human_translation: And this of Rav Ashi is an error [ baruta ], works out well from flour of parched grain and forward, until parched grain, what can be said?
llm_translation: And this that Rav Ashi said, "Baruta is Tinech from my staff until Kelai, what can be said about this?

hebrew_text: וכי תימא הכא נמי ע"י קיטוף וכדרבה בית השלחין דשריא קצירה מאי איכא למימר אלא הא דרב אשי ברותא היא:
human_translation: And if you would say here too through picking in accordance with of Rabba, an irrigated field, which is permitted harvested what can be said? Rather, this of Rav Ashi is an error.
llm_translation: And if you will say here also by uprooting, and like Rabba in the House of Senders where reaping is permitted, what can be said? Rather, this is like what Rav Ashi said in the marketplace.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ משקרב העומר הותר חדש מיד הרחוקים מותרין מחצות היום ולהלן משחרב בהמ"ק התקין ר' יוחנן בן זכאי שיהא יום הנף כולו אסור
human_translation: From that the omer was sacrificed, new was permitted immediately. distant is permitted from midday and beyond. From that the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that the day of waving is entirely prohibited,
llm_translation: Mishnah: When the Omer offering is brought close, the new grain is permitted immediately. Those far away are permitted from midday. And from then on, when the Temple was destroyed, Rabbi Yochanan ben Zakkai instituted that the entire day of the waving should be forbidden.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יהודה והלא מן התורה הוא אסור שנאמר (ויקרא כג, יד) עד עצם היום הזה מפני מה הרחוקים מותרין מחצות היום ולהלן מפני שהן יודעין שאין ב"ד מתעצלין בו:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: But isn’t it forbidden by Torah law, as it is stated: until this selfsame day, And for what permitted distant from midday and beyond, due to that they know that the court are not indolent in its
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehudah: But is it not prohibited from the Torah, as it is stated (Leviticus 23:14), "Until the very same day"? Why then are those far away permitted from midday onwards, while here they are not? Because they know that the court does not neglect it.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ רב ושמואל דאמרי תרוייהו בזמן שבית המקדש קיים עומר מתיר בזמן שאין בית המקדש קיים האיר מזרח מתיר
human_translation: Rav and Shmuel both say: When the Temple is standing, omer permits When the Temple is not standing, the illumination of the eastern permits
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav and Shmuel both say: When the Temple is standing, the Omer offering permits new grain consumption; when the Temple is not standing, the appearance of dawn permits new grain consumption.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא תרי קראי כתיבי כתיב (ויקרא כג, יד) עד (יום) הביאכם וכתיב עד עצם היום הזה הא כיצד
human_translation: What is the reason? Two verses are written It is written “until you have brought and it is written “until the selfsame day.” How so?
llm_translation: What is the reason that two verses are written? It is written (Leviticus 23:14) "until the day of your bringing" and it is written "until the very day" - how so?

hebrew_text: כאן בזמן שבית המקדש קיים כאן בזמן שאין בית המקדש קיים
human_translation: Here, when the Temple is standing. There, when the Temple is not standing.
llm_translation: Here, when the Temple is standing, here, when the Temple is not standing.

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן וריש לקיש דאמרי תרוייהו אפילו בזמן שבית המקדש קיים האיר מזרח מתיר והכתיב עד הביאכם למצוה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Reish Lakish both say: Even when the Temple is standing, the illumination of the eastern permits But isn’t it written: “Until you have brought to the mitzva
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Reish Lakish both said: Even when the Temple is standing, the east wind permits, as it is written, "until He brings you to the land."

hebrew_text: משקרב העומר הותר חדש מיד למצוה
human_translation: From that the omer was sacrificed, new was permitted immediately. to the mitzva
llm_translation: When the Omer offering is brought close, the new grain is immediately permitted for the mitzvah.

hebrew_text: העומר היה מתיר במדינה ושתי הלחם במקדש למצוה
human_translation: the omer would permit in the country [ bamedina ] and the two loaves in the Temple. to the mitzva
llm_translation: The Omer was permitting in the province and two loaves in the Temple for the commandment.

hebrew_text: משחרב בית המקדש התקין רבן יוחנן בן זכאי שיהא יום הנף כולו אסור מאי טעמא מהרה יבנה בית המקדש ויאמרו אשתקד מי לא אכלנו בהאיר מזרח השתא נמי ניכול
human_translation: From that the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that the day of waving is completely prohibited What is the reason soon the Temple will be rebuilt, and will say: Last year [ eshtakad ], didn’t we eat as soon as the eastern was illuminated, Now, too, let us eat
llm_translation: Talmudic text: After the destruction of the Temple, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai instituted that the entire day of Yom Kippur should be forbidden. What is the reason? "Hasten to rebuild the Temple," so that they will say, "We have not eaten this year, but next year in the rebuilt Jerusalem."

hebrew_text: ולא ידעי דאשתקד לא הוה עומר האיר מזרח מתיר והשתא דאיכא עומר עומר מתיר ואי סלקא דעתך למצוה משום מצוה ליקום וליגזור
human_translation: And they not know that last year, when there was no Temple, the illuminating of the eastern permitted but now that there is an omer the omer permits And if it enters your mind to the mitzva we arise and decree due to a mitzva
llm_translation: And not know that previously was Omer from the east permitted, and now that there is Omer, Omer is permitted. And if it enters your mind to fulfill a commandment for the sake of the commandment, let it be established and decreed.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק רבן יוחנן בן זכאי בשיטת רבי יהודה אמרה דאמר מן התורה אסור שנאמר (ויקרא כג, יד) עד עצם היום הזה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai stated in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, who says it is prohibited by Torah law as it is stated: until this selfsame [ etzem ] day,
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said, Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai in the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda said, she said, from the Torah it is forbidden, as it is stated (Leviticus 23:14), "until this very day."

hebrew_text: עד עיצומו של יום וקסבר עד ועד בכלל
human_translation: until the essence [ itzumo ] of the day. And holds “until,” until and including,
llm_translation: Until the end of the day, and he holds that "until" includes everything.

hebrew_text: ומי סבר לה כוותיה והא מיפלג פליג עליה דתנן משחרב בית המקדש התקין רבן יוחנן בן זכאי שיהא יום הנף כולו אסור אמר ר' יהודה הלא מן התורה הוא אסור דכתיב עד עצם היום הזה
human_translation: And does hold in accordance with But he disagrees with him, as we learned From that the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai instituted that the day of waving is entirely prohibited. Rabbi Yehuda says: But isn’t it forbidden by Torah law, as it is written: “Until this selfsame day”?
llm_translation: And who thinks like her? But they disagree about her, as we learned: When the Temple was destroyed, Rabban Yohanan ben Zakkai instituted that the entire day of the waving of the Omer offering should be forbidden. Rabbi Yehudah said: Is it not already forbidden by the Torah, as it is written, "until this very day"?

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה הוא דקא טעי הוא סבר רבן יוחנן בן זכאי מדרבנן קאמר ולא היא מדאורייתא קאמר והא התקין קתני מאי התקין דרש והתקין
human_translation: It is Rabbi Yehuda who is mistaken. He thought Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai is saying by rabbinic law. And is not so; is saying by Torah law. But it is taught instituted, What Instituted, he interpreted and instituted
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah, he is the one who erred, he holds that Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai is speaking from a Rabbinic standpoint and not from a Biblical standpoint. But is it not from the Torah that he is speaking? He taught: What did he rectify? He interpreted and rectified.

hebrew_text: רב פפא ורב הונא בריה דרב יהושע אכלי חדש באורתא דשיתסר נגהי שבסר קסברי חדש בחוצה לארץ דרבנן ולספיקא לא חיישינן
human_translation: Rav Pappa and Rav Huna, son of Rav Yehoshua, ate the new on evening of the sixteenth leading into the seventeenth They held new outside Eretz by rabbinic law. And we are not concerned for uncertainty
llm_translation: Rav Papa and Rav Huna the son of Rav Yehoshua ate new produce in the city of Sheitsar Nighei on the fourteenth of Nisan. They hold that new produce outside the Land of Israel is Rabbinically prohibited, but in a doubtful case we are not concerned.

hebrew_text: ורבנן דבי רב אשי אכלו בצפרא דשבסר קסברי חדש בחוצה לארץ דאורייתא
human_translation: And the Sages of the study hall of Rav Ashi ate the new on the morning of the seventeenth. They held new outside Eretz by Torah law.
llm_translation: And the Rabbis of the house of Rav Ashi ate in the town of Shevser. They hold that the new month is sanctified outside of the Land of Israel by biblical law.

hebrew_text: ורבן יוחנן בן זכאי מדרבנן קאמר וכי תקין ליום הנף לספיקא לא תקין
human_translation: And Rabban Yoḥanan ben Zakkai is saying by rabbinic law. And instituted for day of waving not instituted for uncertain.
llm_translation: And Rabban Yochanan ben Zakkai from the Rabbis said: "If it is established for the Day of the Omer for a doubt, it is not established."

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא אמרה לי אם אבוך לא הוה אכיל חדש אלא באורתא דשבסר נגהי תמניסר דסבר לה כר' יהודה וחייש לספיקא:
human_translation: Ravina said: My mother told me: Your father would eat from new only on the evening of the seventeenth leading into the eighteenth. he held in accordance with Rabbi Yehuda and concerned for uncertainty
llm_translation: Ravina said: My mother told me, "If your father would only eat fresh produce in the light of the setting sun, he would live like Rabbi Yehuda and be concerned about doubt."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ העומר היה מתיר במדינה ושתי הלחם במקדש אין מביאין מנחות וביכורים ומנחת בהמה קודם לעומר אם הביא פסול קודם לשתי הלחם לא יביא אם הביא כשר:
human_translation: the omer would permit in the country and the two loaves in the Temple. One may not bring meal offerings, or first fruits, or the meal offering animal prior to the omer , and if he brought unfit. prior to the two loaves one may not bring if he brought fit.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The Omer permits the new grain in the province, and the Two Loaves are offered in the Temple. One does not bring meal offerings, first fruits, and animal meal offerings before the Omer. If one brought them before the Omer, they are invalid. Before the Two Loaves, one should not bring them. If one brought them, they are valid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ יתיב רבי טרפון וקא קשיא ליה מה בין קודם לעומר לקודם שתי הלחם
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon sat and posed difficulty: What is between before the omer before the two loaves?
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Tarfon was sitting and he was troubled by the question: What is the difference between "before the Omer" and "before the two loaves"?

hebrew_text: אמר לפניו יהודה בר נחמיה לא אם אמרת קודם לעומר שכן לא הותר מכללו אצל הדיוט תאמר קודם לשתי הלחם שהותר מכללו אצל הדיוט
human_translation: Yehuda bar Neḥemya said before No, If you said before omer no general prohibition was permitted, with regard to an ordinary shall you say before the two loaves, when general prohibition was permitted with regard to an ordinary
llm_translation: Said before Him Judah son of Nehemiah: No, if you say before the Omer, so it was not permitted from its entirety by a layman, will you say before the two loaves, which were permitted from its entirety by a layman.

hebrew_text: שתק רבי טרפון צהבו פניו של רבי יהודה בן נחמיה אמר לו רבי עקיבא יהודה צהבו פניך שהשבת את זקן תמהני אם תאריך ימים אמר רבי יהודה ברבי אלעאי אותו הפרק פרס הפסח היה כשעליתי לעצרת שאלתי אחריו יהודה בן נחמיה היכן הוא ואמרו לי נפטר והלך לו
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon was silent, Rabbi Yehuda ben Neḥemya’s face brightened. Rabbi Akiva said to him: Yehuda, has your face brightened because you answered the elder? I will be astonished if the days of your life will be lengthy. Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Ilai, said: That period was half before Passover. When I ascended for Shavuot , I asked about him: Where is Yehuda ben Neḥemya? And they said to me: He passed away and left
llm_translation: Rabbi Tarfon was silent. The face of Rabbi Yehudah ben Nchemiah turned pale. Rabbi Akiva said to him, "Yehudah, your face has turned pale because you have silenced an elder. If you prolong your days..." Rabbi Yehudah son of Rabbi Elai said, "That chapter was about the Paschal lamb. When I ascended for the festival, I asked about him, Yehudah ben Nchemiah, and they told me, 'He passed away and has gone.'

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק לדברי יהודה בן נחמיה נסכים ביכורים שהקריבם קודם לעומר כשירין פשיטא
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: According to the statement of Yehuda ben Neḥemya, libations first fruits that one brought before the omer valid. obvious
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: According to the words of Judah ben Nehemiah, libations and first fruits that were brought before the Omer offering are valid. This is obvious.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא התם הוא דהותר מכללו אצל הדיוט אבל הכא דלא הותר מכללו לא קמ"ל כל שכן הכא דלא איתסר כלל
human_translation: lest you say: It is there, as general prohibition was permitted with regard to an ordinary But here, no its general prohibition was permitted, not teaches us All the more so here where was not prohibited at all.
llm_translation: What is the reason? There, it is because it is permitted from its general category for a layman, but here, since it is not permitted from its general category, it teaches us all the more so here, where it was not prohibited at all.

hebrew_text: (סד"ר הנצ"א גל"י פי"ל סימן) בעי רמי בר חמא שתי הלחם מהו שיתירו שלא כסדרן
human_translation: a mnemonic Order, sprouting, dung of, elephant. Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: the two loaves what is as they permit out of their order?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (סד"ר הנצ"א גל"י פי"ל סימן) בעי רמי בר חמא שתי הלחם מהו שיתירו שלא כסדרן English translation: Rami bar Hama asked: What is the ruling regarding two loaves of bread that were not in their proper order?

hebrew_text: היכי דמי כגון דזרעינהו בין העומר לשתי הלחם וחליף עלייהו שתי הלחם ועומר מאי כסדרן שריין שלא כסדרן לא שריין או דלמא שלא כסדרן נמי שריין
human_translation: What are the circumstances where they planted in between the omer and the the two loaves And two loaves passed by and omer What permit their order, out of their order does not Or perhaps permit even out of their order.
llm_translation: How so? For example, if one sowed them between the Omer and the Two Loaves, and then the Two Loaves were exchanged for them, what is the law? If they are in their proper order, they are permitted; if they are not in their proper order, they are not permitted. Or perhaps even if they are not in their proper order, they are permitted.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה תא שמע (ויקרא ב, יד) ואם תקריב מנחת ביכורים במנחת העומר הכתוב מדבר מהיכן באה מן השעורין אתה אומר מן השעורין או אינו אלא מן החיטין
human_translation: Rabba said: Come hear “And if you bring a meal offering of first fruits The verse is speaking of the omer meal offering. From where, is it brought? from barley. Do you say from barley, or it is only from wheat?
llm_translation: Rabbah said: Come and hear (Leviticus 2:14), "And if you bring near a meal offering of first fruits to the meal offering of the Omer, the Scripture is speaking. From where does it come? Do you say it comes from barley, or is it rather from wheat?"

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר אומר נאמר אביב במצרים ונאמר אביב לדורות מה אביב האמור במצרים שעורין אף אביב האמור לדורות שעורין
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says is stated “in the ear” with regard to Egypt: and it is stated “in the ear” for generations. Just as “in the ear” that is stated with regard to Egypt barley, so too “in the ear” that is stated for generations barley.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: It is stated "aviv" in Egypt, and it is stated "aviv" for generations. Just as the "aviv" mentioned in Egypt is barley, so too the "aviv" mentioned for generations is barley.

hebrew_text: ורבי עקיבא אומר מצינו יחיד שמביא חובתו מן החיטין וחובתו מן השעורין
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva says: We found an individual who brings his obligation from wheat, and his obligation from barley,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva says: We find an individual who brings his obligation from wheat and his obligation from barley.

hebrew_text: וציבור שמביאין חובתן מן החיטין מביאין חובתן מן השעורין ואם אתה אומר בא מן החיטין לא מצינו ציבור שמביא חובתו מן השעורין
human_translation: And community that they bring their obligation from wheat, brings their obligation from barley. And if you say comes from wheat, we not found a community that brings its obligation from barley.
llm_translation: And a community that brings their obligation from wheat, they bring their obligation from barley. And if you say it comes from wheat, we do not find a community that brings their obligation from barley.

hebrew_text: דבר אחר אם אתה אומר עומר בא מן החיטין אין שתי הלחם ביכורים
human_translation: Alternatively, if you say omer comes from wheat, the two loaves not first fruits.
llm_translation: Another explanation: if you say "Omer" comes from wheat, the two loaves are not firstfruits.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא דשתי הלחם שלא כסדרן שריין משכחת לה דמקריב עומר מהנך דאשרוש קודם לשתי הלחם ובתר העומר דאשתקד
human_translation: And if it is so, that the two loaves not in their order permit you find where sacrifices omer from these that took root prior the two loaves but after the omer of last year.
llm_translation: And if it is so that two loaves not in their proper order are permitted, you find that the offering of the omer is from those that Ahasuerus offered before the two loaves, and after the omer of the previous year.

hebrew_text: ושתי הלחם מהנך דאשרוש קודם לעומר דהשתא ובתר שתי הלחם דאשתקד
human_translation: And the two loaves from these that took root prior to the current omer and after the two loaves of last year.
llm_translation: And the two loaves, from where are they? From Esther before the Omer of now, and after the two loaves of last year.

hebrew_text: מי סברת
human_translation: Do you hold
llm_translation: Who do you think...

hebrew_text: בכורים לפירא קא אמרינן למזבח קא אמרינן והא אכיל לה מזבח מפירי דהא שתא
human_translation: we say first fruits, fruit we say upon the altar the altar consumed from the fruit, of this year.
llm_translation: First-fruits for fruit we say, for the altar we say, but she may eat from the fruit of the year.

hebrew_text: בעי רמי בר חמא שתי הלחם הנצה שריא או חנטה שרייה מאי הנצה ומאי חנטה אילימא הנצה דפירא וחנטה דפירא השתא השרשה שריא הנצה וחנטה מיבעיא
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a dilemma: two loaves budding permitted, or formation permitted? What budding and what formation? If we say budding of the fruit and the formation of the fruit, Now taking root permitted is necessary budding or formation
llm_translation: Rami bar Hama asked: "Is two breads of fine flour permitted, or two breads of barley permitted?" What is "fine flour" and what is "barley"? If you say "fine flour" is wheat flour and "barley" is barley flour, now, the root is permitted, but is fine flour and barley required?

hebrew_text: אלא הנצה דעלה וחנטה דעלה מי הוי כי השרשה או לא תיקו
human_translation: Rather, budding of leaf and the formation of leaf. whether is like the taking root or not shall stand
llm_translation: Rather, the branch of above and the stalk of above, is it considered as part of the root or not? This remains undecided.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא בר רב חנן חטין שזרען בקרקע עומר מתירן או אין עומר מתירן היכי דמי אי דאשרוש תנינא אי דלא אשרוש תנינא
human_translation: Rava bar Rav Ḥanan raises a dilemma: wheat that one sowed in the ground, omer permit them or omer not permit them What are the circumstances? If where has taken root we learn If it where has not taken root, we learn
llm_translation: Rava son of Rav Hanan asked: Wheat that one sows in the ground, does an Omer permit them or does an Omer not permit them? What is the case? If we are dealing with a case where there is a doubt, we have learned; if we are not dealing with a case where there is a doubt, we have learned.

hebrew_text: דתנן אם השרישו קודם לעומר עומר מתירן ואם לאו אסורין עד שיבא עומר הבא
human_translation: As we learned If took root before the omer omer permits them And if not, they are prohibited until next omer
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: If they uprooted it before the Omer, they are permitted. But if not, they are forbidden until the next Omer comes.

hebrew_text: לא צריכא דחצדינהו וזרעינהו קודם לעומר ואתא עומר וחליף עלייהו וקא מיבעיא ליה מהו לנקוטי ומיכל מינייהו כמאן דשדייא בכדא דמיא ושרינהו עומר או דלמא בטיל להו לגבי ארעא
human_translation: No, is necessary where one reaped and sowed it prior to the omer , and omer arrived and passed And the dilemma he raises: What is to take and eat from them? considered like cast into a jug, and omer renders their permitted? Or perhaps he subordinated them to the ground,
llm_translation: Not necessary to harvest and plant them before the Omer, and the Omer comes and takes their place, and the question arises: What is the law regarding those who have already harvested and eaten from them, as if one were to throw them into a jug of water and the Omer nullifies them, or perhaps it is ineffective in the case of produce on the ground.

hebrew_text: יש להן אונאה או אין להן אונאה
human_translation: Does exploitation to them or does exploitation not to them?
llm_translation: They have ona'ah or do they not have ona'ah.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אילימא דאמר ליה שדאי בה שיתא ואתו סהדי ואמרי דלא שדא בה אלא חמשה והאמר רבא כל דבר שבמדה ושבמשקל ושבמנין אפילו פחות מכדי אונאה חוזר
human_translation: What are the circumstances? If we say that one said: I sowed six in and witnesses came and said that he sowed only five in it, But doesn’t Rava say: any item that by measure, or by weight, or by number, even less than the measure of exploitation reversed.
llm_translation: How is it possible? If one says to him: "I sold you a field," and witnesses come and say that he did not sell it to him, but only five acres, and Rava said: "Any matter that involves measurement, weight, or count, even if it is less than the value of a sixth, the transaction is reversed."

hebrew_text: אלא דאמר ליה שדאי בה כדבעי לה ואתו סהדי ואמרי דלא שדא בה כדבעי לה יש להן אונאה דכמאן דשדייא בכדא דמיא ויש להן אונאה או דלמא בטיל להו לגבי ארעא
human_translation: Rather, where said: I cast as required, and witnesses came and said that he did not cast as required. they to exploitation, like cast into a jug, and they to exploitation? Or, perhaps subordinated them to the ground,
llm_translation: Instead, he said to him: "It is a field according to his desire." And witnesses came and said that he did not act according to his desire. They have ona'ah, as if one deceived in a measure of a kab, and they have ona'ah. Or perhaps it is nullified concerning land.

hebrew_text: נשבעין עליהן או אין נשבעין עליהן כדשדייא בכדא דמיא וכמטלטלי דמו ונשבעין עליהן או דלמא בטיל להו אגב ארעא וכמקרקעי דמו ואין נשבעין עליהן תיקו
human_translation: he take an oath with regard to or he not take an oath with regard to like cast into a jug, and they are like movable property and one takes an oath with regard to them? Or, perhaps he subordinated them to the ground, they are like land and one does not take an oath with regard to them. shall stand
llm_translation: We swear by them or do not swear by them, like a jug of water and like movable objects, and we swear by them, or perhaps they are nullified due to the ground, like things attached to the ground, and we do not swear by them. Teiku.

hebrew_text: בעי רמי בר חמא חטין שבגללי בקר ושעורין שבגללי בהמה מהו למאי אילימא לטמויי טומאת אוכלין תנינא חטין שברעי בקר ושעורין שבגללי בהמה חישב עליהן לאכילה אין מטמא טומאת אוכלין לקטן לאכילה מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises dilemma: wheat that in the dung of cattle, or barley found in the dung of an animal, what is With regard to what If we say to become susceptible to the ritual impurity of food, we learn wheat in the dung of cattle or barley in the dung of animals, do not become susceptible to ritual impurity of food. collected them for eating, do become susceptible to ritual impurity of food.
llm_translation: Rami bar Hama asked: Wheat that is for the sake of cattle, and barley that is for the sake of animals, what is the law regarding them? If you say they are designated for consumption, we have learned: Wheat that is for the sake of cattle, and barley that is for the sake of animals, if one intended them for consumption, they do not convey ritual impurity of food. But if they are designated for animal feed, they convey ritual impurity of food when eaten by a minor.

hebrew_text: אלא למנחות פשיטא דלא (מלאכי א, ח) הקריבהו נא לפחתך הירצך או הישא פניך
human_translation: Rather, for meal offerings. obvious that not “Present it now unto your governor; will he be pleased with you or show you favor?
llm_translation: Rather, regarding meal offerings, it is obvious that they are not brought by angels, as it says in Malachi 1:8, "Present it, please, to your governor; will he be pleased with you, or show you favor?"

hebrew_text: לא צריכא דנקטינהו וזרעינהו וקא בעי לאיתויי מנחות מינייהו מאי משום דמאיסותא הוא וכיון דזרעינהו אזדא למאיסותייהו או דלמא משום כחישותא הוא והשתא נמי כחושה תיקו
human_translation: No; necessary where one collected and sowed and wants to bring meal offerings from them. What Is because disgusting, and since he sowed them their disgusting left? Or perhaps because they are weakened And now also weakened, shall stand
llm_translation: Not necessary that we pick them and plant them, and he wants to bring meal offerings from them. What is the reason? Because it is a despised act. And since he planted them, they have become despised, or perhaps it is due to their weakness. And now, too, it is weak. Let it stand.

hebrew_text: בעי רמי בר חמא פיל שבלע כפיפה מצרית והקיאה דרך בית הרעי מהו למאי
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises dilemma: an elephant that swallowed an Egyptian wicker basket and excreted it with its waste, what is With regard to what
llm_translation: Inquired Rami bar Hama: An elephant that swallowed a Egyptian reed and vomited it out in the manner of the entrance of a brothel - what is the ruling?

hebrew_text: אילימא למבטל טומאתה תנינא כל הכלים יורדין לידי טומאתן במחשבה ואין עולין מטומאתן אלא בשינוי מעשה
human_translation: If we say with regard to its ritual impurity is nullified we learn All vessels descend into their ritual impurity by means of thought. But they ascend from their ritual impurity only by means of a change an action.
llm_translation: If you say that it nullifies its impurity, we learned: All vessels descend into their impurity through thought, and they do not ascend from their impurity except through a change of action.

hebrew_text: לא צריכא דבלע הוצין ועבדינהו כפיפה מצרית מי הוה עיכול הוה ליה
human_translation: No, necessary where swallowed palm leaves [ hutzin ] and one made them an Egyptian wicker basket. Is digestion, is
llm_translation: Not necessary to swallow almonds and make them into a pastry of Egyptian flaxseed, would it be digestible for him.

hebrew_text: ככלי גללים ככלי אדמה ואין מקבלין טומאה דאמר מר כלי אבנים וכלי גללים וכלי אדמה אין מקבלין טומאה לא מדברי תורה ולא מדברי סופרים או דלמא לא הוי עיכול
human_translation: like dung vessels like earth vessels, and are not susceptible to ritual impurity, as the Master said: Stone vessels and dung vessels and earth vessels are not susceptible to ritual impurity, neither by Torah law nor by rabbinic law? Or perhaps not digestion,
llm_translation: Like vessels of dung, like vessels of earth, and they do not receive impurity. For the Master said: vessels of stones, vessels of dung, and vessels of earth do not receive impurity, neither from the words of the Torah nor from the words of the Sages. Or perhaps it is not a valid analogy.

hebrew_text: תפשוט ליה מהא דאמר עולא משום ר"ש בר יהוצדק מעשה ובלעו זאבים שני תינוקות בעבר הירדן ובא מעשה לפני חכמים וטהרו את הבשר
human_translation: Resolve from that which Ulla says in the name of Rabbi Shimon bar Yehotzadak: An incident wolves swallowed two children on bank of the Jordan, and incident came before the Sages and they deemed the flesh ritually pure,
llm_translation: He should remove from it that which Ulla said in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yehotzadak: There was an incident where wolves swallowed two infants on the other side of the Jordan River, and the incident came before the sages, and they declared the flesh to be pure.

hebrew_text: שאני בשר דרכיך ולפשוט מסיפא וטמאו את העצמות שאני עצמות דאקושי טפי
human_translation: flesh is different, as is soft But let us resolve from the last clause but deemed bones ritually impure. bones is different, as they are harder.
llm_translation: Different is the flesh of your ways, and to explain from the end, "and they defiled the bones." Different are bones, for they are more difficult.

hebrew_text: בעי ר' זירא חיטין שירדו בעבים מהו למאי אי למנחות אמאי לא אלא לשתי הלחם מאי
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises a dilemma: wheat that fell from the clouds, what is With regard to what If for meal offerings, why not? Rather, for the two loaves What
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira inquired: "Wheat that descended in clouds, what is the law regarding it? For what purpose? If for meal-offerings, why not? Rather, for the two loaves, what is the law?"

hebrew_text: ממושבותיכם אמר רחמנא לאפוקי דחוצה לארץ דלא אבל דעבים שפיר דמי או דלמא ממושבותיכם דווקא ואפילו דעבים נמי לא
human_translation: the Merciful One states: “Out of your dwellings,” to exclude that from outside Eretz that not but from clouds permitted? Or perhaps specifically: “Out of your dwellings,” and even from clouds also not
llm_translation: From your dwellings, the Merciful One said, to exclude the outside of the land, for it is not considered a proper mourning. Or perhaps, specifically from your dwellings, even the outside is also not considered.

hebrew_text: ומי איכא כי האי גוונא אין כדעדי טייעא נחיתא ליה רום כיזבא חיטי בתלתא פרסי
human_translation: But is there a case like this? Yes, as in Adi the Arab [ taya’a ], down on him wheat a height of one handbreadth over three parasangs.
llm_translation: And who is there that this color is not like the color of the hyena, it does not descend to him the height of a barleycorn in three Persian parasangs.

hebrew_text: בעי ר"ש בן פזי שיבולת שהביאה שליש קודם לעומר ועקרה ושתלה לאחר העומר והוסיפה מהו בתר עיקר אזלינן ושרייה עומר או דלמא בתר תוספת אזלינן ועד שיבא עומר הבא
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi raises a dilemma: an ear that reached one-third prior to the the omer and uprooted it and planted after the omer , and it added what is Do we follow the original permitted the omer Or perhaps we follow the additional And until the next omer is brought.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi asked: If one brought a sheaf before the Omer, uprooted it, and replanted it after the Omer, and it grew, what is the law regarding the subsequent primary offering? Do we go and permit the Omer, or perhaps we go after the additional offering until the next Omer comes?

hebrew_text: תפשוט ליה מהא דאמר ר' אבהו אמר רבי יוחנן ילדה שסבכה בזקנה ובה פירות אפילו הוסיף במאתים אסור
human_translation: Resolve from which Rabbi Abbahu says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a young that one grafted onto an old, and there were fruits on even added two hundred prohibited.
llm_translation: He should take from that which Rabbi Abbahu said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: A woman who gave birth while still young and has fruits in her womb, even if he added two hundred coins, it is forbidden.

hebrew_text: ואמר ר' שמואל בר נחמני אמר ר' יונתן בצל ששתלו בכרם ונעקר הכרם אפילו הוסיף במאתים אסור
human_translation: And Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: an onion that one planted in a vineyard, and the vineyard was uprooted, even added two hundred prohibited.
llm_translation: And said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: "Regarding an onion that was planted in a vineyard, and the vineyard was uprooted, even if one added two hundred onions, it is prohibited."

hebrew_text: היא גופה קא מיבעיא ליה מפשט פשיטא להו לרבנן דבתר עיקר אזלינן לא שנא לקולא ולא שנא לחומרא או דלמא ספוקי מספקא להו ולחומרא אמרינן לקולא לא אמרינן תיקו
human_translation: that itself is raises a dilemma: obvious to the Sages that we follow the main no difference whether to a leniency or whether to a stringency? Or perhaps they are uncertain and to a stringency, we say to a leniency, we do not say shall stand
llm_translation: The question is regarding its essence. It is obvious to the Rabbis that after the main point, we do not differentiate between leniency and stringency. Or perhaps they are in doubt, and for stringency we say "no," for leniency we say "let it stand."

hebrew_text: בעי רבה לענין מעשר מאי היכי דמי כגון
human_translation: Rabba raises a dilemma: With regard to tithe, what What are the circumstances? where
llm_translation: Rabah inquired regarding the matter of tithing: What is the case of "like"?

hebrew_text: דאמדינהו ועשרינהו ושתלינהו והוסיפה להו
human_translation: estimated and separated those tithes, and planted and added to its
llm_translation: They measured them and found them to be twenty and thirty and added to them.

hebrew_text: אם תמצא לומר לא אזלינן בתר עיקר ותוספת בעי עשורי עיקר מאי אמר ליה אביי מאי שנא מכל חיטי ושערי דעלמא
human_translation: If you say we do not follow the main and additional requires tithes, what main, Abaye said to what is different from any general wheat or barley?
llm_translation: If you find to say no we do not go after the main and the addition requires a tenth of the main what did Abaye say to him what is different from all the wheat and barley of the world

hebrew_text: אמר ליה דבר שזרעו כלה לא מיבעיא לי אלא כי קמיבעיא לי דבר שאין זרעו כלה מאי
human_translation: said to I do not raise the dilemma a substance whose seed disintegrates Rather, when I raise the dilemma a substance whose seed does not disintegrate. What
llm_translation: He said to him: A matter whose seed is complete, I do not need, rather when I need a matter whose seed is not complete, what is it?

hebrew_text: תפשוט ליה מהא דאמר רבי יצחק אמר ר' יוחנן ליטרא בצל שתיקנו וזרעו מתעשר לפי כולו
human_translation: Let him resolve from that which Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: a litra of onions that one tithed, and sowed it is tithed according to the entire
llm_translation: He should take from this that Rabbi Yitzchak said, Rabbi Yochanan said: "A lettuce in which its stalk was fixed and its seed grew becomes tithed in its entirety."

hebrew_text: התם היינו זריעתו הכא לאו היינו זריעתו
human_translation: There, that is is sowed. Here, is not is sowed.
llm_translation: There, that is its sowing; here, it is not its sowing.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ר' חנינא בר מניומי לאביי עציץ שאינו נקוב מהו אי לא נקוב הא לא נקוב
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina bar Minyumi said to Abaye: a flowerpot [ atzitz ] that is not perforated, what is If it is not perforated, this non-perforated
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Chanina bar Minyumi to Abaye: A flowerpot that is not perforated, what is it? If it is not perforated, behold it is not perforated.

hebrew_text: דלמא חזר ונקבו קא אמרת
human_translation: Perhaps you say went and perforated it.
llm_translation: Perhaps he returned and pierced it, you said.

hebrew_text: הכא חדא זריעה היא איחבורי הוא דקא מיחברא ועולה התם שתי זריעות נינהו
human_translation: Here, is one sowing. is attached and it rises There, there are two sowings.
llm_translation: Here, one planting it is, Ikhburi it is that is being planted, and it ascends there, two plantings they are.

hebrew_text: בעי ר' אבהו שבולת שמרחה בכרי ושתלה וקרא עליה שם במחובר מהו כיון דמרחה טבלא לה כי קרא עליה שם קדשה לה או דלמא כיון דשתלה פקע ליה טבלא מינה
human_translation: Rabbi Abbahu raises a dilemma: an ear that one smoothed into a pile and sowed it and designated it while attached what is since he smoothed it, he has given it untithed produce, and when he designated it he sanctified it? Or perhaps, since he sowed it its untithed produce lapsed from it.
llm_translation: Rabbi Abbahu asked: If one smears a kernel with oil, plants it, and then names it while it is still attached, what is the ruling? Since he smeared it, the oil is absorbed into it; but when he names it, is it sanctified for him, or perhaps since he planted it, the oil is separated from it.

hebrew_text: אמרי ליה רבנן לאביי אם כן מצינו תרומה במחובר לקרקע ותנן לא מצינו תרומה במחובר לקרקע
human_translation: The Sages said to Abaye: If so, we found teruma attached to the ground. But we learn We do not find teruma attached to the ground.
llm_translation: The sages said to Abaye, "If so, we find terumah in something attached to the ground, yet we learned that we do not find terumah in something attached to the ground."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה כי תניא ההיא לענין איחיובי מיתה וחומש דאי תליש ואכיל תלוש הוא ואי גחין ואכיל בטלה דעתו אצל כל אדם
human_translation: said to When that is taught, liable to death or a fifth. that if one detaches and eats it is detached. And if he stooped down and ate his intention is irrelevant by all people.
llm_translation: He said to him: "For it has been taught in a Baraita regarding the obligation of death and the fifth of the value, for if one is loose and eats, he is loose, and if he is arrogant and eats, his mind is nullified in the eyes of all people."

hebrew_text: ומאי שנא מדכתב אפינקסא דאילפא ביצי נבלת העוף הטהור מקצתן בחוץ ומקצתן בפנים מבפנים מטמאין בגדים אבית הבליעה מבחוץ אין מטמאין בגדים אבית הבליעה
human_translation: what is different from that is written on the tablet [ appinkesa ] of Ilfa: eggs carcass of a kosher bird, some of them outside and some of them inside from inside they render garments ritually impure in the throat. from outside they do not render garments ritually impure in the throat.
llm_translation: And what is the difference, since it is written: "the crop of the fowl that is on the back of the fowl" - some of them outside and some of them inside, from the inside they render garments unclean, from the outside they do not render garments unclean.

hebrew_text: תלוש עבידי אינשי דאכלי הכי במחובר לא עבידי אינשי דאכלי
human_translation: detached, common for people to eat this with regard to attached not common for people to eat
llm_translation: The actions of people who eat are done in this way when detached, the actions of people who eat are not done when attached.

hebrew_text: אמר רב טביומי בר קיסנא אמר שמואל הזורע כלאים בעציץ שאינו נקוב אסור אמר אביי בשלמא אי אשמעינן לוקה מכת מרדות מדרבנן שפיר אלא אסור מאי קמ"ל
human_translation: Rav Tavyumei bar Kisna says Shmuel says: one who plants diverse kinds in a non-perforated flowerpot, prohibited. Abaye said: Granted if taught us is flogged lashes for rebelliousness by rabbinic law, well But prohibited, what is teaching us?
llm_translation: Rav Taviyomi son of Kisna said in the name of Shmuel: One who plants kilayim in a pot that is not perforated is prohibited. Abaye said: If we were to hear that one is liable for lashes for a rabbinic prohibition, that would be well and good. But to say it is prohibited, what does this teach us?

hebrew_text: דמדרבנן הויא זריעה תנינא תרם משאינו נקוב על הנקוב תרומה ויחזור ויתרום:
human_translation: that is sowing by rabbinic law? We learn separated teruma from a non-perforated for a perforated teruma and he must again separate teruma
llm_translation: From the Rabbis it was taught: If one separated terumah from produce that was not perforated, on perforated produce it is terumah, and he should separate terumah again.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ החיטין והשעורין והכוסמין והשיבולת שועל והשיפון הרי אלו חייבין בחלה ומצטרפין זה עם זה ואסורים בחדש מלפני הפסח ומלקצור מלפני העומר אם השרישו קודם לעומר העומר מתירן ואם לאו אסורין עד שיבא העומר הבא:
human_translation: Wheat, barley, spelt, oats, and rye; these are obligated in ḥalla , and one joins together with the others And they are prohibited of new prior to the Passover and to reap prior to the omer If took root prior the omer the omer permits their and if not, they are prohibited until the next omer is brought
llm_translation: Mishnah: The wheat, barley, spelt, oats, and rye - these are obligated in challah, and they can be combined with each other, and are forbidden as new produce before Passover, and for harvesting before the Omer offering. If they took root before the Omer offering, the Omer offering permits them, but if not, they are forbidden until the next Omer offering arrives.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנא כוסמין מין חיטים שיבולת שועל ושיפון מין שעורין כוסמין
human_translation: taught Spelt a type of wheat, oats and rye a type of barley. Spelt
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: "Kusmin" refers to a species of wheat, "Shibbolet Shu'al" refers to oats, and "Shipon" refers to a species of barley. Kusmin.

hebrew_text: גולבא שיפון דישרא שיבולת שועל שבולי תעלא הני אין אורז ודוחן לא
human_translation: gulva , rye dishra , oats shibbolei ta’ala . these yes, rice and millet, no,
llm_translation: Gulba shipon diYisra shiboleit shual shibolei ta'ala hani ein orz ve'dochan lo.

hebrew_text: מנא הני מילי אמר ריש לקיש אתיא לחם לחם ממצה כתיב הכא (במדבר טו, יט) והיה באכלכם מלחם הארץ וכתיב התם (דברים טז, ג) לחם עוני
human_translation: From where is this matter, Reish Lakish said: derived “bread” “bread” from matza . It is written here, “And it shall be that when you eat of the bread of the land, and it is written there, “Bread of affliction”
llm_translation: The Talmudic text translates as follows: Rabbi Yochanan said: "How do we know this matter?" Reish Lakish said: "It is derived from the verse 'bread of affliction' written here (Numbers 15:19) and written there (Deuteronomy 16:3) 'bread of affliction.'"

hebrew_text: והתם גופה מנלן אמר ריש לקיש וכן תנא דבי ר' ישמעאל וכן תנא דבי ר' אליעזר בן יעקב אמר קרא (דברים טז, ג) לא תאכל עליו חמץ שבעת ימים תאכל עליו מצות לחם עוני דברים הבאים לידי חימוץ אדם יוצא בהן ידי חובתו בפסח יצאו אלו שאין באין לידי חימוץ אלא לידי סירחון:
human_translation: And there, from where do we Reish Lakish said, and likewise of the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught, and likewise of the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov taught, the verse states: “You shall eat no leavened bread with it; seven days you shall eat with it matza , the bread of affliction” substances that will come to leavening a person fulfill his obligation by them on Passover, exclude these which, do not come to leavening but to decay [ sirḥon ].
llm_translation: There, how do we know? Reish Lakish said, and so too it was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael, and so too it was taught in the school of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov: The verse says (Deuteronomy 16:3), "You shall not eat upon it leaven; seven days you shall eat upon it unleavened bread, the bread of affliction." These are matters that lead to fermentation; a person fulfills his obligation with them. On Passover, these are the ones that do not lead to fermentation, but rather to purging.

hebrew_text: ומצטרפין זה עם זה: תנא התבואה והקמחים והבציקות מצטרפין זה עם זה למאי הלכתא
human_translation: joins together with the others taught produce and flours and pieces of dough, joins together with the others. With regard to what halakha
llm_translation: "And they combine with each other: It was taught: The produce, the flour, and the dough combine with each other. What is the halakha?"

hebrew_text: אמר רב כהנא לענין חדש רב יוסף אמר לענין חמץ בפסח רב פפא אמר לענין מעשר שני דאי אכיל ליה חוץ לחומה לקי
human_translation: Rav Kahana says: with regard to the new Rav Yosef says: with regard to leavened bread on Passover. Rav Pappa says: with regard to second tithe As, if ate outside the wall is flogged.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said regarding the matter of new grain, Rav Yosef said regarding the matter of leaven on Passover, Rav Papa said regarding the matter of second tithe: If one eats it outside the wall, he is liable.

hebrew_text: רבא אמר לענין טומאת אוכלין והא קמ"ל דתבואה וקמחין דומיא דבצקות מה התם אוכלא בעיניה אף הכא נמי אוכלא בעיניה
human_translation: Rava says: to the matter of ritual impurity of food; and this it teaches us: That produce and flours similar to pieces of dough. Just as there, food as is, so too here also, food as is,
llm_translation: Rava said regarding the matter of the impurity of foods, and this is what it comes to teach us, that produce and flour are similar to dough. Just as there it is considered food in its own right, so too here it is also considered food in its own right.

hebrew_text: והתניא חטה בין קלופה בין שאינה קלופה מצטרפת שעורה קלופה מצטרפת שאינה קלופה אין מצטרפת
human_translation: it is taught Wheat, whether shelled or unshelled, combines barley, combines shelled. When not shelled, does not combine
llm_translation: And it was taught in a Baraita: wheat, whether it is peeled or not peeled, its measurement combines. If it is peeled, it combines; if it is not peeled, it does not combine.

hebrew_text: איני והא תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל (ויקרא יא, לז) על כל זרע זרוע אשר יזרע כדרך שבני אדם מוציאין לזריעה חטה בקליפתה ושעורה בקליפתה ועדשים בקליפתן
human_translation: Is that so, But didn’t the school of Rabbi Yishmael teach upon any sowing seed that is sown, typical for people to take it out for sowing. wheat in its shell, barley in its shell, and lentils in their shells.
llm_translation: I am not, but isn't it taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael (Leviticus 11:37), "On all seed sown, which is sown as people sow, wheat in its husk, barley in its husk, and lentils in their husks."

hebrew_text: לא קשיא הא בלחות הא ביבשות:
human_translation: not difficult. this with regard to moist that with regard to dry
llm_translation: Not difficult. This is the case with wet items, this is the case with dry items.

hebrew_text: ואסורין בחדש מלפני הפסח: מנא הני מילי אמר ריש לקיש אתיא לחם לחם ממצה:
human_translation: And they are forbidden of new prior to the Passover From where is this matter Reish Lakish said: derived “bread” “bread” with regard to matza
llm_translation: And forbidden in the month before Passover: From where are these matters? Reish Lakish said: It is derived from "bread of affliction" (Deuteronomy 16:3).

hebrew_text: ולקצור לפני העומר: מנא הני מילי אמר רבי יוחנן אתיא ראשית ראשית מחלה
human_translation: And to reap prior to the omer From where are these matters Rabbi Yoḥanan said: derived “the first” and “the first” with regard to ḥalla :
llm_translation: And to harvest before the Omer: From where are these matters? Rabbi Yochanan said: The beginning of the beginning is a sickness.

hebrew_text: מאי קודם לעומר ר' יונה אמר קודם קצירת העומר רבי יוסי בר זבדא אמר קודם הבאת העומר
human_translation: What Prior to the omer ? Rabbi Yona says: prior to the reaping of the omer Rabbi Yosei bar Zavda says: Prior to the bringing of the omer
llm_translation: What comes before the Omer? Rabbi Yonah said: Before the harvesting of the Omer. Rabbi Yosei bar Zavda said: Before the bringing of the Omer.

hebrew_text: תנן אסורין בחדש לפני פסח ולקצור לפני העומר בשלמא למאן דאמר קודם הבאת העומר היינו דלא קא עריב להו ותני להו
human_translation: we learned And they are forbidden of new prior to the Passover and to reap prior to the omer Granted, according to the one who said prior to the bringing of the omer this is that did not combine and teach them
llm_translation: We have learned: It is forbidden to engage in new grain before Passover, and to harvest before the Omer offering. It is understandable according to the opinion that holds that before the bringing of the Omer offering is the determining factor, as this is what does not combine for them, and teaches them.

hebrew_text: אלא למ"ד קודם קצירת העומר ליערבינהו וליתנינהו אסורין בחדש ולקצור לפני הפסח
human_translation: But according to the one who said prior to the reaping of the omer let combine them and teach them And they are forbidden of new and to reap prior to the Passover
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who holds that before the cutting of the Omer, one may mix and place them together, they are prohibited in the month, and to harvest before Passover.

hebrew_text: אלא אי איתמר אסיפא איתמר אם השרישו קודם לעומר העומר מתירן מאי קודם לעומר רבי יונה אמר קודם הבאת העומר רבי יוסי בר זבדא אומר קודם קצירת העומר
human_translation: Rather, if was stated it was stated with regard to the latter clause If took root prior to the omer the omer permits their What Prior to the omer ? Rabbi Yona says: Prior to the bringing of the omer Rabbi Yosei bar Zavda says: Prior to the harvesting of the omer
llm_translation: Rather, if it is stated, the conclusion is stated: If they uprooted before the Omer, the Omer permits them. What is meant by "before the Omer"? Rabbi Yonah said: Before the bringing of the Omer. Rabbi Yosei bar Zavda said: Before the harvesting of the Omer.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי אלעזר
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar said to
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Elazar

hebrew_text: לרבי יאשיה דדריה לא תיתב אכרעיך עד דמפרשת ליה להא מתניתין מנין לעומר שמתיר בהשרשה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoshiya of his generation, Do not sit on your knees until you have explained to me for that the mishna: From where that the omer permits upon taking root
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yashiyah of Darya, do not sit down until you explain to him the Mishnah: From where do we derive the permissibility of the Omer offering with its root?

hebrew_text: מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא ב, יד) אביב לאו מכלל דאיכא דלאו אביב
human_translation: From where do we that it is written: grain in the ear not by inference there is that is not “grain in the ear,”
llm_translation: From where do we derive that which is written (Leviticus 2:14), "aviv" is not inclusive of everything that is not "aviv"?

hebrew_text: דלאו אביב ולעולם דעייל שליש
human_translation: that is not “grain in the ear” but actually grew one-third
llm_translation: Not spring, and always bring a third.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר שמואל (דברים טז, ט) מהחל חרמש לאו מכלל דאיכא דלאו בר חרמש דלאו בר חרמש ולעולם שחת
human_translation: Rather, Shmuel said from the time the sickle is first put not by inference that cannot a sickle, that cannot a sickle but actually fodder,
llm_translation: Rather, Shmuel said (Deuteronomy 16:9), "From the beginning of the threshing floor." Is it not from the inference that there is one who is not a son of a threshing floor? Not a son of a threshing floor, and forever he has sinned.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק קמה לאו מכלל דלאו בר קמה דלאו בר קמה ולעולם אגם
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: “The standing grain” not by inference that and unable to stand, that is unable to stand actually a marsh;
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak: "Kama Lavo is not from the category of 'not Kama Lavo,' and not from the category of 'not Bar Kama Lavo,' but rather always Agam."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא (שמות כג, טז) אשר תזרע משעת זריעה אמר ליה רב פפא לרבא אי הכי אע"ג דלא השריש נמי אמר ליה סודני (שמות כג, טז) בשדה כתיב:
human_translation: Rather, Rava said which you sow from the time of sowing, Rav Pappa said to Rava: If so, even though had not taken root said to Wise one [ sudni ] It is written: “In the field,”
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said (Exodus 23:16), "From the time of sowing." Rav Pappa said to Rava, "If so, even though it did not take root?" He said to him, "It is written (Exodus 23:16), 'In the field.'"

hebrew_text: מתני׳ קוצרין בית השלחין שבעמקים אבל לא גודשין אנשי יריחו קוצרין ברצון חכמים וגודשין שלא ברצון חכמים ולא מיחו בידם קוצר לשחת מאכיל לבהמה א"ר יהודה אימתי בזמן שמתחיל עד שלא הביא שליש רבי שמעון אומר יקצור ויאכיל אף משהביא שליש
human_translation: one may reap an irrigated field in the valleys, but one may not arrange a pile. The residents of Jericho, reaped with the approval of the Sages and arranged in a pile without the approval of the Sages, but did not reprimand them. One may for fodder feed it to an animal. Rabbi Yehuda said: When At a time when he begins before one-third Rabbi Shimon says: One may reap and feed even after they reached one-third
llm_translation: Mishnah: One may harvest the produce of the fields in the valleys, but one may not gather it into sheaves. The people of Jericho may harvest willingly, but they may not gather into sheaves against the will of the Sages. And they may not destroy it. One may harvest for the purpose of feeding animals. Rabbi Yehudah said: When is this permitted? From the time one begins until he brings a third of the harvest. Rabbi Shimon says: He may harvest and feed even after he brings a third.

hebrew_text: וקוצרין מפני נטיעות מפני בית האבל מפני ביטול בית המדרש לא יעשה אותן כריכות אבל מניחין צבתים
human_translation: And one may reap due to saplings due to the place of mourning, due to dereliction of the study hall. one may not fashion them sheaves, but he leaves them unbound.
llm_translation: And they cut short because of plantings, because of a house of mourning, because of the nullification of the study hall, one should not make those bundles, but they leave the stubble.

hebrew_text: מצות העומר לבא מן הקמה לא מצא יביא מן העמרים מצותו לבא מן הלח לא מצא יביא יבש מצותו לקצור בלילה נקצר ביום כשר ודוחה את השבת:
human_translation: The mitzva of the omer to come from standing grain. one did not find he brings from sheaves. Its mitzva is to come from moist one did not find he brings from dry Its mitzva is to reap at night, it was reaped during the day, fit. And overrides Shabbat.
llm_translation: The commandment of the Omer - if one did not find grain to bring from the standing crop, he should bring from the piles. His commandment is to bring from the moist grain. If he did not find moist grain, he should bring dry grain. His commandment is to harvest at night. It is harvested during the day, valid, and overrides the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תניא ר' בנימין אומר כתוב אחד אומר (ויקרא כג, י) וקצרתם את קצירה והבאתם את עומר וכתיב (ויקרא כג, י) ראשית קצירכם אל הכהן
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Binyamin says one verse states: and shall reap its harvest, then you shall bring the omer ” But it is written “Of the first fruits of your harvest to the priest,”
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Benjamin says, it is written, "And you shall reap the harvest thereof, and you shall bring the sheaf" (Leviticus 23:10), and it is written, "The first of your harvest to the kohen" (Leviticus 23:10).

hebrew_text: הא כיצד ממקום שאתה מביא אי אתה קוצר ממקום שאי אתה מביא אתה קוצר
human_translation: How these With regard to a place from you bring you may not reap with regard to a place from you may not bring you may reap
llm_translation: This is how: from a place where you bring, if you do not bring, you are cutting short from a place where you do not bring, you are cutting short.

hebrew_text: אימא ממין שאתה מביא אי אתה קוצר ממין שאי אתה מביא אתה קוצר ההוא לא מצית אמרת מדרבי יוחנן:
human_translation: say With regard to the type from you bring you may not reap with regard to the type from you may not bring you may reap You cannot say that that Rabbi Yoḥanan
llm_translation: Say, from the species that you bring, if you do not cut from the species that you do not bring, you are cutting. That one does not ignite, you said, from Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: אנשי יריחו קוצרין ברצון חכמים וגודשין שלא ברצון חכמים [וכו']: מאן שמעת ליה דאמר מיחו ולא מיחו רבי יהודה
human_translation: The residents of Jericho, reaped with the approval of the Sages and arranged in a pile without the approval of the Sages, Whom did you hear who said: reprimanded They did not reprimand Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The people of Jericho harvest willingly according to the sages and thresh unwillingly not according to the sages etc.. Who heard him say "michu" and not "michu"? Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: וסבר ר' יהודה קצירה דאנשי יריחו ברצון חכמים הואי והא תניא ששה דברים עשו אנשי יריחו שלשה ברצון חכמים ושלשה שלא ברצון חכמים
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda hold reaping of the residents of Jericho was with the approval of the Sages? But isn’t it taught The people of Jericho performed six actions, three with the approval of the Sages and three without the approval of the Sages.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda holds: The harvesting of the people of Jericho is done with the consent of the Sages. But isn't it taught: The people of Jericho did six things, three with the consent of the Sages and three without the consent of the Sages.

hebrew_text: ואלו שברצון חכמים מרכיבין דקלים כל היום וכורכין את שמע וקוצרין לפני העומר ברצון חכמים ואלו שלא ברצון חכמים גודשין לפני העומר ומתירין גמזיות של הקדש של חרוב ושל שקמה ופורצין פרצות בגנותיהן ובפרדסותיהן להאכיל נשר לעניים בשני בצורת בשבתות ובימים טובים דברי ר' מאיר
human_translation: And these with the approval of the Sages: They graft palm trees the entire day and they bundle Shema , and they reap before the omer with the approval of the Sages. And these without the approval of the Sages: They pile before the omer , and they permit consecrated branches [ gamziyyot ] of carob and of sycamore and they make breaches in their gardens and in their orchards to feed fallen to the poor during drought years, on Shabbatot and Festivals. the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: And these are the ones that the sages permit to gather palm branches all day and tie the Shema and harvest before the Omer with the consent of the sages. And these are the ones that the sages do not permit to gather before the Omer and they permit the cutting of shoots of the holy carob and the sycamore and they break through their fences and orchards to feed the eagle to the poor on Mondays and Thursdays and on holidays. These are the words of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהודה אם ברצון חכמים הן עושין יהו כל אדם עושין כן אלא אלו ואלו שלא ברצון חכמים ועל שלשה מיחו בידם ועל שלשה לא מיחו בידם
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to if they acted with the approval of the Sages, every person would do so, Rather, these and those were performed without the approval of the Sages. With regard to three reprimanded them, and with regard to three did not reprimand them.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda, if with the consent of the sages they act, then everyone acts thus, but these and these who act without the consent of the sages, and concerning three they are liable, and concerning three they are not liable.

hebrew_text: ואלו שלא מיחו בידם מרכיבין דקלים כל היום וכורכין את שמע וקוצרין וגודשין לפני העומר ואלו שמיחו בידם
human_translation: And these which did not reprimand them: They graft palm trees the entire day, and they bundle Shema , and they reap and pile before the omer And these are which reprimanded them:
llm_translation: And these are the ones who do not have the capability in their hands, they ride palm trees all day and wrap themselves with the Shema, and they harvest and thresh before the Omer, and these are the ones who have the capability in their hands.

hebrew_text: מתירין גמזיות של הקדש של חרוב ושל שקמה ופורצין פרצות בגנותיהן ובפרדסותיהן כדי להאכיל נשר לעניים בשני בצורת בשבתות ובימים טובים ונותנין פאה לירק ומיחו בידם
human_translation: They permit consecrated branches of carob and of sycamore they make breaches in their gardens and orchards, in order to feed fallen fruit to the poor during drought years on Shabbatot and Festivals; and they designate the corner [ pe’a ] of vegetables. And reprimanded them
llm_translation: Permitting branches of consecrated carob and sycamore trees, and breaking through fences in their gardens and orchards in order to feed carrion to the poor on Mondays and Thursdays, and giving the corner of the field to vegetables, and they measure it with their hands.

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך ששה שבעה הוו אלא סמי מכאן קצירה:
human_translation: And according to your reasoning, six there were seven Rather, omit from here reaping
llm_translation: And to taste you, six seven were, rather, from here, reaping.

hebrew_text: קוצר לשחת ומאכיל לבהמה: תנן התם ואלו מפסיקין לפאה הנחל והשלולית ודרך היחיד ודרך הרבים ושביל הרבים ושביל היחיד הקבוע בימות החמה ובימות הגשמים והבור והניר וזרע אחר
human_translation: One may for fodder feed it to an animal we learned there And these divide for pe’a , A stream and a canal [ vehashelulit ], and a private road and a public road and a permanent public trail or a private trail whether in the summer or in the rainy season, and an uncultivated field, and a plowed field, and a seed a different
llm_translation: Reaping for destruction and feeding to animals: We learned there, and these are the things that interrupt for the corner, the stream, the thornbush, the private path, the public path, the public thoroughfare, and the private thoroughfare, the one that is fixed during the days of the sun and during the days of rain, and the pit, the lamp, and another seed.

hebrew_text: וקוצר לשחת מפסיק דברי רבי מאיר וחכמים אומרים אין מפסיק אלא אם כן חרש
human_translation: And reaps for fodder, divides the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say: does not divide unless one plowed
llm_translation: And one who cuts grape clusters for the winepress, Rabbi Meir says: he interrupts the Shabbat prohibition, and the Sages say: he does not interrupt unless he is silent.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר ר' יוחנן ר' מאיר בשיטת ר' שמעון אמרה דאמר יקצור ויאכיל אף משהביאה שליש אלמא קסבר כל לשחת לאו קצירה היא
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Meir said in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, who says One may reap and feed even after they reached one-third Apparently, holds any for fodder is not reaping.
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Rabbi Meir, according to the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, said: "When it says 'he shall cut it and eat it,' even if he brings a third of the produce." This indicates that he holds that not all cutting is considered harvesting.

hebrew_text: יתיב רבה וקאמר לה להא שמעתא איתיביה רב אחא בר הונא לרבא אכלה חגב קרסמוה נמלים שברתהו הרוח הכל מודים חרש מפסיק לא חרש אינו מפסיק הכל מודים מאן רבי מאיר
human_translation: Rabba sat and stated this halakha . Rav Aḥa bar Huna raised an objection to Rava was consumed by grasshoppers, ants nibbled at [ kirsemuha ], the wind broke it all concede plowed, it divides not plowed, it does not divide All concede, whom Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: Rava was sitting and saying to her, to that teaching. Rav Acha bar Huna raised an objection to Rava: "If a locust consumed it, and ants broke it, the wind scattered it, everyone agrees - if a deaf person interrupts, he does not interrupt, everyone agrees. Who is the opinion of? Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: אי אמרת בשלמא מתני' בשלא הביאה שליש ברייתא דחרש אין לא חרש לא בשהביא שליש
human_translation: Granted, if you say the mishna, where not reached one-third baraita , where plowed, yes, not plowed, no, reached one-third
llm_translation: If you say, "Granted, the Mishnah is referring to when he did not bring a third," the Baraita of Harash does not apply, neither when he brought a third.

hebrew_text: אלא אי אמרת מתניתין נמי בשהביא שליש השתא ומה התם דקצירה (דהתם) אמר רבי מאיר לא שמה קצירה הכא לא כל שכן
human_translation: But if you say the mishna also where reached one-third Now, if reaping there, Rabbi Meir said: not called reaping; here not all the more so
llm_translation: Rather, if you say that the Mishnah also refers to when one brought a third of the produce now, and what is the comparison there to the case of harvesting? Rabbi Meir said there in a different context: It is not considered harvesting. Here, all the more so it should not be considered harvesting.

hebrew_text: אלא רבי מאיר בשיטת רבי יהודה אמרה דאמר אימתי בזמן שהתחיל עד שלא הביא שליש אבל אם התחיל עד שהביא שליש אסור
human_translation: Rather, stated in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda, who says, When [ eimatai ] At a time when he began before one-third But if he began after reached one-third, prohibited.
llm_translation: Rather, Rabbi Meir in the opinion of Rabbi Yehuda said, "When did he begin? Until he did not bring a third. But if he began until he brought a third, it is forbidden."

hebrew_text: אימר דשמעת ליה לרבי יהודה לבהמה לאדם מי שמעת ליה דאם כן הוו להו תלתא תנאי
human_translation: say that you heard Rabbi Yehuda did you hear him for human That if so, there would be three tanna’im :
llm_translation: Said that he heard from Rabbi Yehuda regarding an animal to a person, did you hear from him that if so, they would have three teachings.

hebrew_text: אלא כי אתא רב דימי אמר רבי מאיר בשיטת רבי עקיבא רבו אמר אף לאדם נמי לא הויא קצירה דתנן המנמר שדה ושייר בו קלחים לחים רבי עקיבא אומר פאה לכל אחד ואחד
human_translation: Rather, when Rav Dimi came he said: Rabbi Meir stated with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, his teacher. even for human is not reaping as we learned one who alternate field, and he leaves in it moist stems Rabbi Akiva says: pe’a in each and every
llm_translation: Instead, when Rav Dimi came, Rabbi Meir said in the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, his teacher said, "Even for a person, it is not considered gleaning." As we learned in a Mishnah: "One who prunes a field and leaves moist stalks in it." Rabbi Akiva says, "Pe'ah for each and every one."

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים מאחד על הכל ואמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל לא חייב רבי עקיבא אלא במנמר לקליות אבל במנמר לאוצר לא
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: from one for the whole And Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: Rabbi Akiva obligated only when alternate for roasted grains. But when alternate for storehouse, no
llm_translation: The Sages say: "From one source for everything." And Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Rabbi Akiva only obligates one for a minmar to keliyot, but for a minmar to otzar, not.

hebrew_text: איני והא כי אתא רבין אמר רבי יוחנן מחייב היה רבי עקיבא אף במנמר לאוצר
human_translation: Is that so? But when Ravin came Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Rabbi Akiva deems obligated even where alternative for a storehouse.
llm_translation: I am not convinced, but when Ravin came, Rabbi Yochanan said: Rabbi Akiva would even obligate one to pay in a case of a concealed treasure.

hebrew_text: סבר לה כוותיה בחדא ופליג עליה בחדא:
human_translation: holds in accordance with with regard to one and disagrees with him with regard to one
llm_translation: He thought to her like his friend in one matter and argued with her in one matter.

hebrew_text: קוצרין מפני הנטיעות ומפני בית האבל ומפני בית המדרש: מאי טעמא (ויקרא כג, י) קצירכם אמר רחמנא ולא קציר מצוה
human_translation: And one may reap due to saplings due to the place of mourning, due to dereliction of the study hall. What is the reason the Merciful One states: your harvest but not reaping for a mitzva.
llm_translation: We cut short because of plantings, and because of a house of mourning, and because of a house of study. What is the reason? (Leviticus 23:10) "Your harvest," the Merciful One said, and not a harvest of a mitzvah.

hebrew_text: ולא יעשה כריכות אבל מניחן צבתים: מאי טעמא דכמה דאפשר לא טרחינן:
human_translation: one may not fashion them sheaves, but he leaves them unbound. What is the reason? as much as possible we do not exert
llm_translation: "And one should not make folds, but rather place them in pairs. What is the reason? Because as much as possible, we do not trouble ourselves."

hebrew_text: מצות העומר להביא מן הקמה: תנו רבנן (ויקרא ב, יד) ואם תקריב מנחת בכורים מה תלמוד לומר לפי שמצות העומר להביא מן הקמה מנין שאם לא מצא מן הקמה יביא מן העומרין תלמוד לומר תקריב
human_translation: the mitzva of the omer to bring from the standing grain. The Sages taught What the verse states: Since the mitzva of the omer to bring from the standing grain, from where that if one does not find from the standing grain, bring from the sheaves? The verse states: “You shall bring,”
llm_translation: The commandment of the Omer is to bring from the standing grain: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 2:14) "And if you bring a meal offering of first fruits..." What does the Torah teach us? Since the commandment of the Omer is to bring from the standing grain, from where do we derive that if one did not find standing grain, he should bring from the sheaves? The Torah teaches us to say, "You shall bring."

hebrew_text: דבר אחר תקריב לפי שמצוה להביא מן הלח ומנין שאם לא מצא מן הלח יביא מן היבש תלמוד לומר תקריב דבר אחר תקריב לפי שמצותו לקצור בלילה מנין שאם נקצר ביום כשר (תלמוד לאמר תקריב)
human_translation: Alternatively, “You shall bring.” Since it is a mitzva to bring from the moist From where bring from the dry The verse states: “You shall bring,” Alternatively, “you shall bring” Since mitzva reaped at night, from where that during the daytime, it is fit? The verse states: “You shall bring.”
llm_translation: Another explanation: One should bring from the moist grain, and how do we know that if one did not find from the moist grain, he should bring from the dry grain? The verse states, "You shall bring" - bring another thing. One should bring according to the command to harvest at night, and how do we know that if one harvested during the day it is valid? The verse states, "You shall bring."

hebrew_text: ודוחה את השבת תלמוד לאמר תקריב תקריב כל שהוא תקריב מכל מקום תקריב ואפילו בשבת תקריב ואפילו בטומאה:
human_translation: overrides Shabbat? The verse states: “You shall bring.” “You shall bring,” any “you shall bring,” from anywhere “you shall bring” even on Shabbat. “you shall bring” even in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: And he pushes aside the Sabbath, the Talmud says to say, "You shall offer, you shall offer, anything you shall offer, from any place you shall offer, and even on the Sabbath you shall offer, and even in a state of impurity you shall offer."

hebrew_text: נקצר ביום כשר: והתנן כל הלילה כשר לקצירת העומר ולהקטיר חלבים ואברים זה הכלל דבר שמצותו כל היום כשר כל היום דבר שמצותו בלילה כשר כל הלילה
human_translation: it was reaped during the day, fit. But didn’t we learn the entire night is valid reaping the omer for burning the fats and the limbs This is the principle: A matter that it is a mitzva during the entire day is valid the entire day, a matter that it is a mitzva at night is valid the entire night.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Niktzar bayom kasher: v'hitanan kol halaila kasher l'katzirat ha'omer u'l'haktir chalavim v'avrim, zeh haklal, davar she'mitzvato kol hayom kasher, kol hayom, davar she'mitzvato balaila kasher, kol halaila." English translation: "Harvested during the day is valid. And we learned: All night is valid for harvesting the Omer offering and for offering up fats and limbs. This is the principle: A matter whose commandment is throughout the day is valid all day, a matter whose commandment is at night is valid all night."

hebrew_text: קתני לילה דומיא דיום מה דיום בלילה לא אף דלילה ביום נמי לא
human_translation: teaches at night similar to the day. just as by day, at night not so too at night, by day not
llm_translation: It was taught: "Night is similar to day. Just as day is prohibited, so too night is prohibited. And just as night is permitted, so too day is permitted."

hebrew_text: אמר רבה לא קשיא הא רבי והא ר' אלעזר בר' שמעון דתניא היה עומד ומקריב מנחת העומר ונטמאת אם יש אחרת אומר לו הבא אחרת תחתיה ואם לאו אומר לו הוי פקח ושתוק דברי רבי
human_translation: Rabba said: not difficult. This Rabbi and that Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon. As it is taught was standing and sacrificing the omer meal offering and it became ritually impure if there is another says to bring another in its stead. And if no says to him: Be shrewd and keep silent; the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: Rabah said: It is not difficult. Here, it is Rabbi, and here, it is Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: If one was standing and offering the Omer offering and became impure, if there is another to offer in his place, he says to him, "Come in place of him." But if not, he says to him, "Be attentive and remain silent," the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: ר' אלעזר בר' שמעון אומר בין כך ובין כך אומר לו הוי פקח ושתוק שכל העומר שנקצר שלא כמצותו פסול
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: In either case, says to him: Be shrewd and keep silent, as any omer that is harvested not in accordance with its mitzva is unfit.
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: Whether this way or that way, one should say to him, "Be attentive and silent," for any omer that is harvested not in accordance with its commandment is invalid.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן ר' אלעזר בר' שמעון בשיטת רבי עקיבא רבו של אביו אמרה דתנן כלל אמר ר' עקיבא כל מלאכה שאפשר לו לעשותה מערב שבת אינה דוחה את השבת
human_translation: Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, said in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, the teacher of his father. As we learned Rabbi Akiva stated a principle: Any prohibited labor that can be performed on Shabbat eve, does not override Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon said in the opinion of Rabbi Akiva, his father's teacher: As we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Akiva said, "Any work that one can do before Shabbat does not override Shabbat."

hebrew_text: וסבר לה כרבי ישמעאל דאמר קצירת העומר מצוה דתנן רבי ישמעאל אומר מה חריש רשות אף קציר רשות יצא קציר העומר שהיא מצוה
human_translation: And holds in accordance with Rabbi Yishmael, who said reaping of the omer is a mitzva. As we learned Rabbi Yishmael says: just as plowing voluntary so too, harvesting is voluntary. the harvesting of the omer is excluded as it is a mitzva.
llm_translation: And he thought like Rabbi Yishmael who said, "The harvesting of the Omer is a commandment," as we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yishmael says, "Just as plowing is optional, so too harvesting is optional." The harvesting of the Omer, which is a commandment, fulfills the obligation.

hebrew_text: ואי סלקא דעתך נקצר שלא כמצותו כשר אמאי דחי שבת נקצריה מערב שבת אלא מדדחי שבת שמע מינה נקצר שלא כמצותו פסול
human_translation: And If it enters your mind reaped not its mitzva fit, why override Shabbat? Let one reap it on Shabbat eve. Rather, from overrides Shabbat, learn from was reaped not its mitzva, unfit.
llm_translation: And if it enters your mind that something that is lacking, not like its commandment, is valid, why is it that if one slaughters on Shabbat, his slaughtering is valid from Erev Shabbat? Rather, since he slaughters on Shabbat, we learn that something lacking, not like its commandment, is invalid.

hebrew_text: ורבי לאו תלמידיה דרבי שמעון הוא
human_translation: Isn’t Rabbi student of Rabbi Shimon,
llm_translation: And Rabbi is not a disciple of Rabbi Shimon.

hebrew_text: והתניא אמר רבי כשהיינו למדין תורה אצל רבי שמעון בתקוע היינו מעלין לו שמן ואלונטית מחצר לגג ומגג לקרפיף ומקרפיף לקרפיף אחר עד שאנו מגיעין למעיין שאנו רוחצין בו
human_translation: But isn’t it taught Rabbi said: When we would study Torah with Rabbi Shimon in Tekoa, we would carry to him oil and a towel [ aluntit ] from the courtyard to the roof and from the roof into an enclosure and from enclosure to another enclosure, until we reached the spring in which we would bathe,
llm_translation: And it was taught: Rabbi said, when we were learning Torah by Rabbi Shimon in Tekoa, we would bring up for him oil and a lamp from the courtyard to the roof, and from the roof to the parapet, and from one parapet to another, until we reached the spring in which we would bathe.

hebrew_text: סבר לה כאידך דרבי שמעון דתניא אמר ר' שמעון בא וראה כמה חביבה מצוה בשעתה שהרי הקטר חלבים ואברים כשרים כל הלילה ולא היה ממתין להן עד שתחשך
human_translation: holds in accordance with the other of Rabbi Shimon, as it is taught Rabbi Shimon said: Come and see how dear is a mitzva in its time. As burning the fats and limbs is valid all night, but one would not wait with them until nightfall;
llm_translation: He thought like the other opinion of Rabbi Shimon, as it was taught: Rabbi Shimon said, "Come and see how beloved a mitzvah is at its time, for the burning of fats and limbs is valid all night, and he did not wait for them until it became dark."

hebrew_text: ורבי אלעזר בר' שמעון לא שמיע ליה
human_translation: And did Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, not know
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon did not hear from him.

hebrew_text: אלא שאני התם שהרי דחתה שחיטה את השבת
human_translation: Rather, there, is different, as the slaughter overrode Shabbat.
llm_translation: Rather, it is different there, for indeed she has pushed aside the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: ולרבי הכי נמי דחתה שחיטה את השבת אלא קסבר רבי קצירת העומר לא דחיא שבת
