human_translation: But according to Rabbi also the slaughter overrode Shabbat. Rather, Rabbi holds reaping of the omer does not override Shabbat,
llm_translation: And for Rabbi, so too, that slaughtering pushes aside the Sabbath, rather, Rabbi holds that the harvesting of the Omer does not push aside the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: ולא והתנן וחכמים אומרים אחד שבת ואחד חול משלש היה בא דלא כרבי
human_translation: And not But didn’t we learn And the Rabbis say: Both on Shabbat and week, would come from three That is not in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: And not, and we learned in a Mishnah, "And the sages say, one who is on Shabbat and one who is on a weekday, from three categories he comes, not like Rabbi Yehuda HaNasi."

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים אחד שבת ואחד חול בשלשה בשלש קופות ובשלש מגלות דלא כרבי
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: Both on Shabbat and week by three with three baskets and three sickles. That is not in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: The Sages say: one day is Shabbat and one day is weekday in three cases - in three boxes and in three scrolls, not like Rabbi.

hebrew_text: ובשבת יאמר להם שבת זו דלא כרבי:
human_translation: And on Shabbat, says to this Shabbat? That is not in accordance with Rabbi
llm_translation: And on Shabbat he shall say to them, "This Shabbat is not like Rabbi's."

hebrew_text: נקצר ביום כשר ודוחה את השבת: מאן שמעת ליה דאמר נקצר ביום כשר רבי וקתני ודוחה את השבת מאי לאו קצירה לא להקרבה
human_translation: was reaped during the day, fit, and overrides Shabbat. whom did you hear who said: If the omer was reaped during the day, fit? Rabbi And it is taught And it overrides Shabbat. What, is it not reaping? No, to sacrifice
llm_translation: Harvesting on a valid day and overrides the Sabbath: Who heard him say that harvesting on a valid day is valid, and he taught and overrides the Sabbath? What, is it not harvesting for the purpose of offering?

hebrew_text: אבל לקצירה לא והתניא רבי אומר (ויקרא כג, מד) וידבר משה את מועדי ה' מה תלמוד לומר לפי שלא למדנו אלא לתמיד ופסח שנאמר בהן (במדבר ט, ב) במועדו (במדבר כח, ב) במועדו ואפילו בשבת במועדו ואפילו בטומאה
human_translation: But with regard to reaping, not As, isn’t it taught Rabbi “And Moses declared the appointed times of the Lord What the verse states because we learned only that the daily offering and the Paschal offering as it is stated concerning them: “In its appointed time” in its appointed time and even on Shabbat; in its appointed time and even in ritual impurity.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: But for harvesting, no. And it was taught: Rabbi says (Leviticus 23:44) "And Moses declared the appointed times of the Lord." What is the Talmud coming to teach us? That we only learn for the regular offerings and for Passover, as it is stated regarding them (Numbers 9:2) "at its appointed time" and (Numbers 28:2) "at its appointed time," even on Shabbat, at its appointed time, and even in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: שאר קרבנות הצבור מנין תלמוד לומר (במדבר כט, לט) אלה תעשו לה' במועדיכם
human_translation: the rest of the communal offerings, from where The verse states “These you shall sacrifice to the Lord in your appointed times”
llm_translation: The other communal offerings, how do we know? To say (Numbers 29:39), "These you shall offer to the Lord at your appointed times."

hebrew_text: מנין לרבות עומר והקרב עמו שתי הלחם והקרב עמהן תלמוד לאמר וידבר משה את מועדי ה' הכתוב קבע מועד לכולן
human_translation: From where to include omer and sacrificed with it, the two loaves and sacrificed with them? The verse states: “And Moses declared the appointed times of the Lord the verse established one time for all of them.
llm_translation: From where do we derive to include the Omer offering and the sacrifice with it, the two loaves, and the sacrifice with them? Scripture states, "And Moses spoke the appointed times of the Lord," indicating that the Scripture established a fixed time for all of them.

hebrew_text: למאי אילימא להקרבה שתי הלחם בני הקרבה נינהו
human_translation: With regard to what If we say for sacrifice, are the two loaves fit for sacrifice?
llm_translation: Regarding what? If you say for offering, they are the two loaves of the offering.

hebrew_text: אלא פשיטא לטחינה והרקדה ודכותה גבי עומר לקצירה וקא דחי את השבת
human_translation: Rather, obvious to grinding and sifting. And similarly, with regard to the omer with regard to reaping And overrides Sh abbat.
llm_translation: Rather, it is obvious regarding grinding, dancing, and sifting in the context of the Omer for harvesting, and it is pushing aside the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: אלא עומר להקרבה ושתי הלחם לאפיה וקסבר רבי תנור מקדש אי אפי לה מאתמול איפסילה לה בלינה
human_translation: Rather, omer with regard to sacrifice, but two loaves, with regard to baking. And Rabbi holds oven consecrates if bake from the previous day, disqualifying it left overnight.
llm_translation: Rather, the omer for offering, and the two loaves for baking. And Rabbi holds: the oven sanctifies. If he bakes them from yesterday, it is disqualified due to overnight delay.

hebrew_text: וסבר רבי תנור מקדש והתניא כבשי עצרת אין מקדשין את הלחם אלא בשחיטה כיצד שחטן לשמן וזרק דמן לשמן קדש הלחם
human_translation: And Rabbi hold oven consecrates But isn’t it taught lambs consecrate the loaves only by slaughter. How so? one slaughtered for their sake, and sprinkled their blood for their sake, the loaves are consecrated.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Tanur holds that sanctifies. And it was taught: The lambs of the assembly festival, one does not sanctify the bread except through slaughter. How is this done? He slaughters them for their sake, and he sprinkles their blood for their sake; thus sanctifying the bread.

hebrew_text: שחטן שלא לשמן וזרק דמן שלא לשמן לא קדש הלחם שחטן לשמן וזרק דמן שלא לשמן הלחם קדוש ואינו קדוש דברי רבי
human_translation: one slaughtered them not for their sake, and sprinkled their blood not for their sake, the loaves are not consecrated, one slaughtered them for their sake and he sprinkled their blood not for their sake, the loaves are consecrated but they are not consecrated the statement of Rabbi
llm_translation: He slaughtered it not for its sake, and he threw its blood not for its sake - the bread is not sanctified. If he slaughtered it for its sake and threw its blood not for its sake, the bread is sanctified but not sanctified - the words of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: ר' אלעזר בר' שמעון אומר לעולם אינו קדוש עד שישחוט לשמן ויזרוק דמן לשמן
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: Actually, the loaves are consecrated only when one slaughters for their sake and sprinkles their blood for their sake,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Shimon says: Always not holy until slaughter for its sake and sprinkle its blood for its sake.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק הוקבעו ולא הוקבעו קא אמר
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: is saying are fixed or are not fixed
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "It was established, and it was not established," is what he said.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך פרק רבי ישמעאל
llm_translation: We will return to you, Chapter of Rabbi Yishmael.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ואלו מנחות נקמצות ושיריהן לכהנים מנחת הסלת והמחבת והמרחשת והחלות והרקיקין מנחת עובדי כוכבים ומנחת נשים ומנחת העומר ומנחת חוטא ומנחת קנאות
human_translation: And these are the meal offerings a handful is removed and remainder by the priests: The meal offering of fine flour; and the pan; and the deep pan; the loaves; and the wafers; meal offering of gentiles; and meal offering of women; and the omer meal offering, and the meal offering of a sinner; and meal offering of jealousy,
llm_translation: Mishnah: And these are the meal-offerings that are burned and their remnants belong to the priests: the meal-offering of fine flour, the pan, the shovel, the baking-pan, and the wafers. The meal-offering of idolaters, the meal-offering of women, the meal-offering of the Omer, the meal-offering of a sinner, and the meal-offering of jealousy.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר מנחת חוטא של כהנים נקמצת וקומץ קרב לעצמו ושירים קריבים לעצמן:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: meal offering of a sinner by priests, a handful is removed. And the handful is sacrificed by itself, and remainder is sacrificed by itself.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The sin offering meal offering of the priests becomes crumbled, and he shall gather it up for himself, and the fats are brought close for themselves.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב פפא כל היכא דתנן עשר תנן מאי קא משמע לן
human_translation: Rav Pappa stated Anywhere that we learned we learned ten What is teaching us,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Pappa said, "Wherever we learned 'ten,' what does it teach us?"

hebrew_text: לאפוקי מרבי שמעון דאמר מחצה חלות ומחצה רקיקין יביא קא משמע לן דלא:
human_translation: to exclude of Rabbi Shimon, who said: he may bring half loaves and half wafers. teaches us that that not
llm_translation: Not like Rabbi Shimon who said half loaves and half flat cakes one should bring - it implies to us that not.

hebrew_text: ושיריהן לכהנים: מנלן דכתיבא כתיבא ודלא כתיבא כתיב בה (ויקרא ו, ז) וזאת תורת המנחה הקרב אותה בני אהרן וגו' והנותרת ממנה יאכלו אהרן ובניו
human_translation: And their remainder by the priests. From where do we which is written is written. And which is not written it is written of it: “And this is the law of the meal offering: The sons of Aaron shall offer it And the remainder of it shall Aaron and his sons eat”
llm_translation: And their songs for the priests: From where do we derive that when it is written it is written, and when it is not written it is written? It is written in it (Leviticus 6:7), "And this is the law of the meal offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it, etc." And the remainder from it shall be eaten by Aaron and his sons.

hebrew_text: באה חיטין לא קמיבעיא לן כי קא מיבעיא לן באה שעורין באה שעורין נמי מדנקמצת שיריה לכהנים
human_translation: comes wheat, we did not ask, When we asked comes barley, comes barley also, since a handful is removed, its remainder to the priests,
llm_translation: Grain came, wheat did not come up for us, when it asks for us, grain came, barley came, barley also from the leftover of its measure for the priests.

hebrew_text: אליבא דרבנן לא קא מיבעיא לן כי קא מיבעיא לן אליבא דרבי שמעון דאמר איכא מנחה דמיקמצא ולא מיתאכלא
human_translation: According to of the Rabbis, we did not ask When we asked according to of Rabbi Shimon, who said: There is meal offering of which a handful is removed but is not eaten.
llm_translation: In the matter of the Rabbis, it is not necessary for us. When it is necessary for us, in the matter of Rabbi Shimon, who said: there is a meal offering that is found but not eaten.

hebrew_text: דתנן רבי שמעון אומר מנחת חוטא של כהנים נקמצת הקומץ קרב בעצמו והשירים קריבין בעצמן מנלן
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Shimon says: meal offering of a sinner by a priest, a handful is removed. the handful is sacrificed by itself, and the remainder is sacrificed by itself. from where do we
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Shimon says, "The meal offering of sin offering of the priests, the handful is taken with itself, and the leftover portions are brought by themselves." How do we know this?

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה דאמר קרא (ויקרא ז, י) וכל מנחה בלולה בשמן וחרבה לכל בני אהרן תהיה אם אינו ענין לבלולה של חיטין תנהו ענין לבלולה של שעורין ואם אינו ענין לחרבה של חיטין תנהו ענין לחרבה של שעורין
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya said: as the verse states: “And every meal offering, mixed with oil, or dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have” If is not the matter of a mixed of wheat, apply it matter of a mixed of barley, And if is not the matter of a dry of wheat, apply it matter of a dry of barley,
llm_translation: Said Hezekiah, as said the verse (Leviticus 7:10), "And every meal offering mixed with oil and dry shall belong to all the sons of Aaron." If it does not pertain to the mixing of wheat, attribute it to the mixing of barley. And if it does not pertain to the dry of wheat, attribute it to the dry of barley.

hebrew_text: והאי להכי הוא דאתא הא מיבעי ליה לכדתניא מנין שאין חולקין מנחות כנגד זבחים
human_translation: And this does it come to this Isn’t necessary for that which is taught From where that may not receive a share meal offerings in exchange for offerings,
llm_translation: And this is why he came, this one needs to ask according to what is taught: From where do we derive that one does not divide meal-offerings against sacrifices?

hebrew_text: תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ז, ט) וכל המנחה אשר תאפה בתנור לכל בני אהרן תהיה איש כאחיו
human_translation: The verse states: “And every meal offering that is baked in the oven…shall all the sons of Aaron have, each man like the other”
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: "To say (Leviticus 6:9), 'And every meal offering that is baked in an oven and all that is prepared in a pan or on a griddle shall belong to the sons of Aaron, each man like his brother.'"

hebrew_text: יכול לא חלקו מנחות כנגד זבחים שלא קמו תחתיהן בדלות אבל יחלקו מנחות כנגד עופות שהרי קמו תחתיהן בדלות תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ז, ט) וכל נעשה במרחשת לכל בני אהרן תהיה
human_translation: might they may not receive a share meal offerings in exchange for offerings since they do not substitute for them in poverty. But they may receive a share meal offerings in exchange for bird offering since they do substitute for them in poverty. the verse states: “And all that is prepared in the deep pan…shall all the sons of Aaron have,”
llm_translation: He can not divide Minchah offerings against sacrifices that did not have birds standing beneath them in the courtyard, but he can divide Minchah offerings against birds, for indeed birds stood beneath them in the courtyard. The verse teaches (Leviticus 7:9), "And every meal offering that is baked in the oven and all that is prepared in a pan, and on a griddle, shall be for the sons of Aaron, all alike."

hebrew_text: יכול לא יחלקו מנחות כנגד עופות שהללו מיני דמים והללו מיני קמחים יחלקו עופות כנגד זבחים שהללו והללו מיני דמים תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ז, ט) ועל מחבת לכל בני אהרן תהיה
human_translation: might they may not receive a share meal offerings in exchange for bird offering since these, are types of blood and those, are types of flour. But they may receive a share bird offering in exchange for offerings, since both types of blood the verse states: “And on a pan…shall all the sons of Aaron have,”
llm_translation: It is possible that they should not divide the meal-offerings against the birds, these are types of blood, and these are types of flours, they should divide the birds against the sacrifices, these are types of blood. It is taught: "And on the griddle, it shall be for all the sons of Aaron." (Leviticus 7:9)

hebrew_text: יכול לא יחלקו עופות כנגד זבחים שהללו עשייתן ביד והללו עשייתן בכלי אבל יחלקו מנחות כנגד מנחות שאלו ואלו עשייתן ביד תלמוד לאמר (ויקרא ז, י) וכל מנחה בלולה בשמן לכל בני אהרן תהיה
human_translation: might they may not receive a share bird offering in exchange for offerings because these, their processing, by hand, and those, their processing, with a utensil, But they may receive a share meal offerings in exchange for meal offerings, since the processing of these and those by hand. the verse states: “And every meal offering mixed with oil…shall all the sons of Aaron have”
llm_translation: Can not they divide birds against sacrifices these praise their making by hand and these praise their making by vessel but they can divide meal offerings against meal offerings these and these praise their making by hand Scripture says (Leviticus 7:10) "And every meal offering mixed with oil or dry shall all the sons of Aaron have."

hebrew_text: יכול לא יחלקו מחבת כנגד מרחשת ומרחשת כנגד מחבת שזו מעשיה קשין וזו מעשיה רכין אבל יחלקו מחבת כנגד מחבת ומרחשת כנגד מרחשת תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ז, י) וחרבה לכל בני אהרן תהיה
human_translation: might they may not receive a share a pan in exchange for offering a deep pan, or a deep pan in exchange for offering a pan, since the actions this pan a hard and the actions that a soft But they may receive a share a pan in exchange for a pan, or a deep pan in exchange for a deep pan. the verse states: “Or dry, shall all the sons of Aaron have”
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Can one not differentiate between a griddle and a pot, and a pot and a griddle, for this one's actions are severe and that one's actions are gentle, but one can differentiate between a pot and a pot, and a griddle and a griddle. The Torah teaches (Leviticus 6:10), 'And it shall be for all the sons of Aaron.'" This is the word-for-word translation of the Talmudic text provided.

hebrew_text: יכול לא יחלקו בקדשי קדשים אבל יחלקו בקדשים קלים תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ז, י) איש כאחיו ואם על תודה כשם שאין חולקין בקדשי קדשים כך אין חולקים בקדשים קלים
human_translation: might may not receive a share of offerings of the most sacred order, but they may receive a share of offerings of lesser sanctity the verse states one as well as another” and “If for a thanks offering” Just as one may not receive a share of offerings of the most sacred order, so too, one may not receive a share of offerings of lesser sanctity,
llm_translation: He can not divide in holy of holies but can divide in holy light. Scripture says (Leviticus 7:10) "each like his brother" and if for thanksgiving just as they do not divide in holy of holies so they do not divide in holy light.

hebrew_text: איש איש חולק ואפילו בעל מום ואין קטן חולק ואפילו תם
human_translation: “One [ ish a man [ ish ] receives a share even blemished, but a minor may not receive a share even unblemished.
llm_translation: A man, a man divides, and even a Ba'al Mum, and a minor does not divide, and even a Tam.

hebrew_text: ההוא מכל נפקא והא אפיקתיה לכדרבי יוסי ברבי יהודה אלא ההוא מוכל
human_translation: that is derived from “Every But derived that which Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, Rather, that from “And every [ vekhol ]
llm_translation: That one went out from all, and this one went out according to Rabbi Yossi, the son of Rabbi Yehuda. Rather, that one is comprehensive.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר אתיא מדתני לוי דתני לוי (במדבר יח, ט) לכל קרבנם ולכל מנחתם ולכל חטאתם ולכל אשמם
human_translation: Ravina said: comes from that Levi teaches, as Levi teaches: Every offering of theirs, and every meal offering of theirs, and every sin offering of theirs, and every guilt offering of theirs,
llm_translation: Ravina said: It comes from the teaching of Levi, as Levi taught (Numbers 18:9), "To all their offerings, and to all their meal offerings, and to all their sin offerings, and to all their guilt offerings."

hebrew_text: כל קרבנם לרבות לוג שמן של מצורע סלקא דעתך אמינא (במדבר יח, ט) מן האש כתב רחמנא קמ"ל
human_translation: “Every offering of theirs,” to include log of oil of leper, enter your mind to say the Merciful One writes “From the fire,” teaches us:
llm_translation: All their offerings to include a log of oil for a leper - is it your opinion? I would say (Numbers 18:9) "from the fire" - the Merciful One has written, teaching us.

hebrew_text: לכל מנחתם לרבות מנחת העומר ומנחת קנאות סלקא דעתך אמינא (שמות כט, לג) ואכלו אותם אשר כופר בהם אמר רחמנא והאי להתיר קא אתיא ואידך נמי לברר קא אתיא קמ"ל
human_translation: “And every meal offering of theirs,” to include the omer meal offering, and the meal offering of jealousy enter your mind to say the Merciful One states: “And they shall eat those wherewith atonement was made” And this comes to permit and the other as well, comes to clarify teaches us:
llm_translation: Their meal offerings, including the Omer offering and the offering of jealousy. Do you think I would say (Exodus 29:33) "and they shall eat those things with which atonement was made"? The Merciful One said, "This comes to permit." And the other one also comes to clarify. This teaches us.

hebrew_text: (במדבר יח, ט) לכל חטאתם לרבות חטאת העוף סלקא דעתך אמינא נבילה היא קמ"ל
human_translation: “And every sin offering of theirs,” to include a bird sin offering, enter your mind to say: it is an unslaughtered animal carcass, teaches us:
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Numbers 18:9) "For all their sin, including the sin of the bird." Is it possible that I might say it refers to a carcass? The Torah teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: (במדבר יח, ט) לכל אשמם לרבות אשם נזיר ואשם מצורע אשם מצורע בהדיא כתיב ביה (ויקרא יד, יג) כי כחטאת האשם הוא לכהן
human_translation: “And every guilt offering of theirs,” to include the guilt offering of the nazirite and the guilt offering of the leper, the guilt offering of the leper, it is explicitly written with regard to it: “For as the sin offering is the priest’s, so is the guilt offering”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Numbers 18:9) "For all their guilt offering; to include the guilt offering of a Nazirite and the guilt offering of a leper, the guilt offering of a leper is explicitly written about it (Leviticus 14:13) 'For it is like the guilt offering; it is for the priest.'"

hebrew_text: אלא לרבות אשם נזיר כאשם מצורע סלקא דעתך אמינא להכשיר קא אתי קמ"ל
human_translation: Rather, to include guilt offering of the nazirite, like guilt offering of the leper. enter your mind to say: it comes to prepare teaches us:
llm_translation: Rather, to include the guilt offering of a Nazirite like the guilt offering of a leper. Is it necessary to say that I would think it comes to permit? The Torah teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: (במדבר יח, ט) אשר ישיבו זה גזל הגר (במדבר יח, ט) לך היא ולבניך שלך היא ולבניך אפילו לקדש בו את האשה
human_translation: which they may restore”; this stolen a convert “for you and for your sons” it is yours and your sons’ even to betroth a woman with it,
llm_translation: (Numbers 18:9) "Which they shall give, this is the priest's due." (Numbers 18:9) "It is yours and your sons'." It is yours and your sons', even to sanctify with it the woman.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא
human_translation: Rav Huna said:
llm_translation: Rav Huna said:

hebrew_text: שלמי העובדי כוכבים עולות איבעית אימא קרא ואיבעית אימא סברא איבעית אימא סברא עובד כוכבים לבו לשמים
human_translation: Peace offerings gentiles burnt offerings, if you wish, cite a verse; and if you wish, propose a logical argument. If you wish, propose a logical argument: a gentile his heart is to Heaven,
llm_translation: Shelamai the idolater's offerings. You raised a dilemma: say it is derived from a verse, and you raised a dilemma: say it is derived from reasoning. You raised a dilemma: say it is derived from reasoning. An idolater, his heart is directed to Heaven.

hebrew_text: ואיבעית אימא קרא (ויקרא כב, יח) אשר יקריבו לה' לעולה כל דמקרבי עולה ליהוי
human_translation: And if you wish, cite a verse: which they will offer to the Lord as a burnt offering” any that sacrificed should be a burnt offering.
llm_translation: And if you wish, say: A verse states (Leviticus 22:18), "Which they shall offer unto the Lord for a burnt-offering." Whoever brings a burnt-offering should be considered.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב חמא בר גוריא עובד כוכבים שהתנדב להביא שלמים נתנן לישראל ישראל אוכלן נתנן לכהן הכהן אוכלן
human_translation: Rav Ḥama bar Gurya raises an objection a gentile who volunteered to bring a peace offering, gave it to an Israelite, Israelite eats it; gave it to a priest, the priest eats it.
llm_translation: A question was raised: Rav Hama son of Guria raised an objection: A non-Jew who volunteered to bring a peace offering, he gave it to an Israelite, the Israelite may eat it; he gave it to a Kohen, the Kohen may eat it.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא הכי קא אמר על מנת שיתכפר בהן ישראל ישראל אוכלן על מנת שיתכפר בהן כהן כהן אוכלן
human_translation: Rava said: This is saying: in order to achieve atonement an Israelite the Israelite eats in order to achieve atonement a priest the priest eats
llm_translation: Rava said: This is what he said: "For the purpose of atonement for the Israelites, the Israelites eat them; for the purpose of atonement for the priests, the priests eat them."

hebrew_text: מתיב רב שיזבי אלו מנחות נקמצות ושיריהן לכהנים מנחת עובדי כוכבים א"ר יוחנן לא קשיא הא רבי יוסי הגלילי הא רבי עקיבא
human_translation: Rav Sheizevi raises an objection These are the meal offerings a handful is removed and their remainder by the priests…the meal offering of gentiles. Rabbi Yoḥanan said: not difficult. This Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, that Rabbi Akiva.
llm_translation: A question was raised: Rav Sheizbi raised the objection: Are these the rejected meal offerings and their accompanying songs for the priests? The meal offering of idolaters. Rabbi Yochanan said: There is no difficulty, this is Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, and this is Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: דתניא (ויקרא כב, ג) איש מה תלמוד לאמר איש איש לרבות את העובדי כוכבים שנודרין נדרים ונדבות כישראל
human_translation: As it is taught A man [ ish ]. Why the verse state “ ish ish ”? to include the gentiles, that they can vow vow offerings and gift offerings like a Jew
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita (Leviticus 22:3): "A man" - what does the Talmud teach to say "a man"? "A man" to include idolaters who vow vows and offerings like Israel.

hebrew_text: (ויקרא כב, יח) אשר יקריבו לה' לעולה אין לי אלא עולה שלמים מנין תלמוד לומר נדריהם תודה מנין תלמוד לומר נדבותם
human_translation: “Which they will offer to the Lord as a burnt offering,” I have only a burnt offering. From where a peace offering? The verse states: “Their vows.” From where a thanks offering? The verse states “Their gift offerings.”
llm_translation: "And they shall offer it to the Lord, a burnt offering." I might have only learned about a burnt offering. From where do we learn this? To say, "their vows for a thanksgiving offering." From where do we learn this? To say, "their freewill offerings."

hebrew_text: מנין לרבות העופות והיין והלבונה והעצים תלמוד לאמר נדריהם לכל נדריהם נדבותם לכל נדבותם
human_translation: From where to include birds and wine and the frankincense, and the wood The verse states “Their vows,” “Any of their vows”; “Their gift offerings,” “Any of their gift offerings.”
llm_translation: From where do we derive to include birds, wine, frankincense, and wood? The Talmud teaches: "Their vows for all their vows, and their freewill offerings for all their freewill offerings."

hebrew_text: אם כן מה תלמוד לאמר עולה עולה פרט לנזירות דברי ר' יוסי הגלילי רבי עקיבא אומר אשר יקריבו לה' לעולה אין לי אלא עולה בלבד
human_translation: If so, what the verse states: a burnt offering”? burnt offering, the exclusion of naziriteship. the statement of Rabbi Yosei HaGelili. Rabbi Akiva says: “Which they will offer to the Lord as a burnt offering,” nothing other than a burnt offering alone
llm_translation: If so, what does the Talmud come to say "olah olah," excluding Naziriteship? These are the words of Rabbi Yosei the Galilean; Rabbi Akiva says, "which they shall offer to the Lord for a burnt offering." I have only a burnt offering.

hebrew_text: והאי פרט לנזירות מהכא נפקא מהתם נפקא (במדבר ו, ב) דבר אל בני ישראל ואמרת אליהם איש כי יפליא לנדור נדר נזיר להזיר בני ישראל נודרין ואין העובדי כוכבים נודרים
human_translation: And this exclusion of naziriteship, derived from here, derived from there: “Speak to the children of Israel, and say to them: When a man…shall clearly utter a vow, the vow of a nazirite” the children of Israel vow but the gentiles cannot vow
llm_translation: And this detail for Nazirites is derived from here, derived from there (Numbers 6:2) "Speak to the children of Israel and say to them: When a man or woman makes a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself for the Lord." The children of Israel make vows, but idolaters do not make vows.

hebrew_text: אי מהתם הוה אמינא קרבן הוא דלא לייתי אבל נזירות חלה עלייהו קמ"ל
human_translation: If from there, I would say: is the offering that cannot bring, but naziriteship takes effect upon them teaches us
llm_translation: If from there, I would say it is a sacrifice that does not bring, but Nazirites are liable for them - this teaches us.

hebrew_text: כמאן אזלא הא דתנן אמר ר"ש שבעה דברים התקינו בית דין וזה אחד מהן עובד כוכבים ששלח עולתו ממדינת הים ושילח עמה נסכיה קריבין משלו ואם לאו קריבין משל ציבור
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which we learned Rabbi Shimon said: The court instituted seven ordinances And this is one of them. a gentile sent his burnt offering from a country overseas, he sent with it libations are offered at his And if not sacrificed at the public’s
llm_translation: As to whom does this go according to? This is like what we learned: Rabbi Shimon said, "The court established seven matters, and this is one of them: a gentile who sent his burnt offering from overseas, and he sent with it his libations, we offer his sacrifices; if not, we offer the community's sacrifices."

hebrew_text: לימא ר' יוסי הגלילי ולא רבי עקיבא אפילו תימא רבי עקיבא עולה וכל חבירתה
human_translation: Let us say Rabbi Yosei HaGelili and not Rabbi Akiva. You even say Rabbi Akiva, a burnt offering and all its accessories,
llm_translation: Let Rabbi Yossi the Galilean say, and not Rabbi Akiva. Even if you say Rabbi Akiva, it ascends, and all its companions.

One might think his burnt offering does not require libations. The Talmud teaches to say this is the opinion of neither Rabbi Yossi the Galilean nor Rabbi Akiva.

hebrew_text: אי רבי יוסי הגלילי הא אמר אפילו יין נמי אי ר' עקיבא הא אמר עולה אין מידי אחרינא לא
human_translation: If Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, doesn’t he say even wine If Rabbi Akiva, doesn’t he say a burnt offering, yes, something else no,
llm_translation: If Rabbi Yosei the Galilean said, "Even wine also," if Rabbi Akiva said, "An 'olah' does not require anything else."

hebrew_text: איבעית אימא ר' יוסי הגלילי ואיבעית אימא רבי עקיבא איבעית אימא ר' יוסי הגלילי סמי מההיא יין ואיבעית אימא רבי עקיבא עולה וכל חבירתה:
human_translation: If you wish, say Rabbi Yosei HaGelili; and if you wish, say Rabbi Akiva. If you wish, say Rabbi Yosei HaGelili, omit from that wine, And if you wish, say Rabbi Akiva, a burnt offering and all its accessories.
llm_translation: If you wish, say it was Rabbi Yosei the Galilean, and if you wish, say it was Rabbi Akiva. If you wish, say it was Rabbi Yosei the Galilean who placed it on that wine, and if you wish, say it was Rabbi Akiva who brought it up, and all its companions.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר מנחת חוטא של כהנים [וכו']: מנא הני מילי
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: meal offering of a sinner by priests, From where is this matter
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "The sin offering meal offering of the priests etc.: From where are these matters?"

hebrew_text: דתנו רבנן (ויקרא ה, יג) והיתה לכהן כמנחה שתהא עבודתה כשרה בו
human_translation: as the Sages taught “And shall be the priest’s, as the meal offering” that its rite would be valid by
llm_translation: They taught in a Baraita (Leviticus 5:13), "And it shall be for the priest, like the meal offering, so that her service shall be valid in him."

hebrew_text: אתה אומר שתהא עבודתה כשרה בו או אינו אלא להתיר מנחת חוטא של כהנים ומה אני מקיים (ויקרא ו, טז) וכל מנחת כהן כליל תהיה לא תאכל מנחת נדבתו אבל חובתו תהא נאכלת
human_translation: Do you say that the rite would be valid by him? Or is it only to permit meal offering of a sinner by priests. And how do I realize “And every meal offering of the priest shall be offered in its entirety; it shall not be eaten” his voluntary meal offering, but his obligatory may be eaten.
llm_translation: You say that its service should be valid in it or is it only to permit the sin offering of the priests. And how do I fulfill (Leviticus 6:16) "Every meal offering of a priest shall be a whole offering; it shall not be eaten." His voluntary offering shall not be eaten, but his obligatory offering shall be eaten.

hebrew_text: תלמוד לומר והיתה לכהן כמנחה מקיש חובתו לנדבתו מה נדבתו אינה נאכלת אף חובתו אינה נאכלת אמר רבי שמעון וכי נאמר והיתה לכהן כמנחתו והלא לא נאמר אלא כמנחה אלא להקיש
human_translation: the verse states: “And it shall be the priest’s as the meal offering.” compares obligatory to his voluntary Just as his voluntary is not eaten, so too, his obligatory is not eaten. Rabbi Shimon said: Is it stated: And it shall be the priest’s, as his meal offering? But it states only: “As the meal offering,” Rather, to compare
llm_translation: The Talmud teaches: It is stated "and it shall be for the kohen like a meal offering." It compares his obligation to his voluntary offering. Just as his voluntary offering is not eaten, so too his obligation is not eaten. Rabbi Shimon said: Is it really stated "and it shall be for the kohen like his meal offering"? Was it not only stated "like a meal offering"? Rather, it is to make a comparison.

hebrew_text: מנחת חוטא של כהנים כמנחת חוטא של ישראל מה מנחת חוטא של ישראל נקמצת אף מנחת חוטא של כהנים נקמצת
human_translation: the meal offering of a sinner by priests equivalent to a meal offering of a sinner by an Israelite. Just as the meal offering of a sinner by an Israelite, a handful is removed, so too, the meal offering of a sinner by priests, a handful is removed.
llm_translation: The meal offering of a sin offering of the priests is like the meal offering of a sin offering of Israel. Just as the meal offering of a sin offering of Israel becomes leavened, so too the meal offering of a sin offering of the priests becomes leavened.

hebrew_text: אי מה מנחת חוטא של ישראל נקמצת ושיריה נאכלין אף מנחת חוטא של כהנים נקמצת ושיריה נאכלין
human_translation: If Just as the meal offering of a sinner by an Israelite, a handful is removed and its remainder is eaten, so too, meal offering of a sinner by priests, a handful removed and its remainder eaten.
llm_translation: If what the sin offering of an Israelite becomes crumbled and its remnants are eaten, so too the sin offering of the priests becomes crumbled and its remnants are eaten.

hebrew_text: תלמוד לאמר (ויקרא ה, יג) לכהן כמנחה לכהן כמנחה ולא לאשים כמנחה הא כיצד קומץ קרב בעצמו ושירים קריבין בעצמן
human_translation: the verse states: the priest’s, as the meal offering,” with regard to the priest, like the meal offering but not like the meal offering by the fires How this handful is sacrificed by itself, and the remainder is sacrificed by itself,
llm_translation: Talmud to say (Leviticus 5:13) to the priest as a meal offering to the priest as a meal offering and not to place as a meal offering how so? He should take a handful by himself and the frankincense they bring by themselves.

hebrew_text: הא שתהא עבודתה כשרה בו מהכא נפקא
human_translation: this that its rite is valid by him, derived from here?
llm_translation: This is the translation of the Talmudic text: "The act of worship is valid through him, as derived from here."

hebrew_text: מהתם נפקא מנין לכהן שבא ומקריב קרבנותיו בכל עת ובכל שעה שירצה תלמוד לאמר (דברים יח, ו) ובא בכל אות נפשו ושרת
human_translation: derived from there, From where with regard to a priest that come and sacrifice his offerings at any time and at any hour that he desires, The verse states: and comes with all the desire of his soul then he shall serve
llm_translation: From there, how do we derive the number for a priest who comes and offers his sacrifices at any time and at any hour he wishes? The Talmud seeks to say (Deuteronomy 18:6), "And he shall come with all the desire of his soul and serve."

hebrew_text: אי מהתם הוה אמינא הני מילי דבר שאין בא על חטא אבל דבר שבא על חטא אימא לא
human_translation: If from there, I would say: This statement, a matter that does not come for a sin, But matter that comes for a sin, I would say not
llm_translation: If from there, I would say these matters that do not come upon sin, but a matter that comes upon sin, I would say no.

hebrew_text: והא נמי מהכא נפקא מהתם נפקא (במדבר טו, כח) וכפר הכהן על הנפש השוגגת בחטאה בשגגה מלמד שהכהן מתכפר על ידי עצמו
human_translation: And this also derived from here, derived from there: “And the priest shall effect atonement for the soul that sins unwittingly, when he sins unwittingly” teaches that the priest effect atonement through himself,
llm_translation: And also, this is derived from there, it is derived (Numbers 15:28) "And the priest shall make atonement for the soul that errs unwittingly when he sins unwittingly," teaching that the priest atones for himself.

hebrew_text: אי מההוא הוה אמינא הני מילי בשוגג אבל במזיד לא קמ"ל
human_translation: If from that I would say: This statement, for unwittingly. But for intentionally, not teaches us
llm_translation: If you would ask me, I would say these matters apply to unintentional transgressions, but regarding intentional transgressions, it teaches us otherwise.

hebrew_text: במזיד היכי משכחת לה בזדון שבועה

human_translation: is taught another Rabbi Shimon says: the meal offering of a sinner by the priests, a handful is removed; and the handful is sacrificed by itself, and the remainder is sacrificed by itself. Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: The handful is sacrificed by itself, and the remainder is scattered upon the place of the ashes.
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: Rabbi Shimon says, "The meal offering of sin offering of the priests becomes crumbled, and the handful is brought by itself, and the leftover portions are brought by themselves." Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says, "The handful is brought by itself, and the leftover portions are scattered on the ash heap."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' חייא בר אבא הוי בה רבי יוחנן בית הדשן דהיכא אי דלמעלה היינו אבוה אי דלמטה יש לך דבר שקרב למטה
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Abba said Rabbi Yoḥanan discusses it To which place of the ashes If that is above, is his father, if to that is below you have item that is sacrificed below
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Chiya bar Abba: Be like Rabbi Yochanan in the house of the hearth. Where is that? Perhaps above is its father, or perhaps below you have something close to below.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי אבא דלמא לאיבוד אחיכו עליה וכי יש לך דבר שקרב לאיבוד
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said to Perhaps to be wasted. they laughed at him, But you have item that is sacrificed to be wasted?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Abba, perhaps your brother's property is lost, and do you have anything that is close to being lost?

hebrew_text: תני אבוה דרבי אבין (ויקרא ו, טז) כל מנחת כהן כליל תהיה לא תאכל לאכילה הקשתיה ולא לדבר אחר
human_translation: the father of Rabbi Avin teaches: “And every meal offering of the priest shall be offered in its entirety; it shall not be eaten” I have likened with regard to eating, but not with regard to another matter,
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of the father of Rabbi Avin (Leviticus 6:16), "Every meal offering of a priest shall be a whole offering; it shall not be eaten." This is a difficult matter, neither for eating nor for any other purpose.

hebrew_text: מאי קא אמר אמר אביי הכי קא אמר כל מנחת כהן לא תאכל חובתו כליל תהיה נדבתו א"ל רבא סכינא חריפא מפסקא קראי
human_translation: What is he saying, Abaye said this is what is saying: “Every meal offering of the priest…shall not be eaten,” his obligation, “Shall be offered in its entirety,” his gift Rava said to him: sharp knife cutting the verses
llm_translation: What is Abaye saying? Abaye said thus: "Every meal offering of a priest shall not be eaten in its entirety; it shall be entirely burnt. Rava said to him: 'A sharp knife cuts through the verses.'"

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא כל מנחת כהן כליל תהיה נדבתו לא תאכל חובתו
human_translation: Rather, Rava says: “Every meal offering of the priest shall be offered in its entirety,” his gift “shall not be eaten,” his obligatory
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: "Every meal offering of a priest shall be entirely burnt; it shall not be eaten."

hebrew_text: ואיפוך אנא מסתברא נדבתו הוה ליה לרבויי שכן תדירה לא חטי בסים ריחיה
human_translation: But I reverse stands to reason his gift offering should be included as that frequent, did not sin, its scent is fragrant,
llm_translation: And the opposite, I would argue, his donation was excessive, for it was more than necessary, as its fragrance did not lack in the spices.

hebrew_text: אדרבה חובתו הוה ליה לרבויי שכן עשרון חובה הנך נפישן
human_translation: On the contrary, should to include his obligatory as a tenth an obligation. these are numerous
llm_translation: On the contrary, his obligation was even greater, for so is the decree of the Torah: "A tenth of the obligation is theirs."

hebrew_text: ורבנן האי כל מנחת כהן כליל תהיה לא תאכל מאי עבדי ליה
human_translation: And the Rabbis this “And every meal offering of the priest shall be offered in its entirety; it shall not be eaten,” what do they do with it?
llm_translation: And the Rabbis: "This entire meal offering of a priest shall be entirely burnt; you shall not eat it." What do they do with it?

hebrew_text: מיבעי להו לכדתניא אין לי אלא עליונה בכליל תקטר ותחתונה בלא תאכל
human_translation: They require it for that which is taught I have only above, to: “It shall be entirely smoked,” and below, to: “It shall not be eaten.”
llm_translation: They need it, as it was taught: "I only have the upper one, you shall offer it up in smoke, and the lower one you shall not eat."

hebrew_text: מנין ליתן את האמור של זה בזה ואת האמור של זה בזה תלמוד לאמר כליל כליל לגזירה שוה נאמר כאן כליל ונאמר להלן כליל
human_translation: From where to apply that was said about this to that and that was said about that to this The verse states: “Entirely,” “Entirely,” as a verbal analogy: It is stated here, “Entirely,” and it is stated there, “Entirely.”
llm_translation: From where do we derive to juxtapose the statement of this one with that one, and the statement of that one with this one? The Talmud teaches to say "fully" for the purpose of a verbal analogy. It is stated here "fully" and it is stated there "fully."

hebrew_text: מה להלן בכליל תקטר אף כאן בכליל תקטר ומה כאן ליתן לא תעשה על אכילתו אף להלן ליתן לא תעשה על אכילתו
human_translation: Just as there, to “It shall be entirely smoked,” so too here, to “It shall be entirely smoked.” And just as here, to impose a prohibition upon eating it, so too there, to impose a prohibition upon eating it.
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: Talmudic text: Just as there, with a complete offering, one may burn it, so too here, with a complete offering, one may burn it. And just as here, one may not give it for consumption, so too there, one may not give it for consumption.

hebrew_text: בעי רבינא כהן שאכל מן האימורין מה הוא לאו דזרות
human_translation: Ravina asks: a priest who ate from the sacrificial portions, what is the prohibition of a non-priest
llm_translation: Ravina inquired: A kohen who ate from the emurim, what is the status of the prohibition?

hebrew_text: לא קא מיבעיא לי כי קא מבעיא לי לאו דכליל תהיה מאי
human_translation: I do not raise the dilemma. When I raise the dilemma, prohibition of: “Shall be offered in its entirety; What
llm_translation: Not inquiring to me, for inquiring to me, is it not "shall be complete"? What is it?

hebrew_text: אמר רב אהרן לרבינא תא שמע דתניא ר' אליעזר אומר כל שהוא (ויקרא ו, טז) בכליל תהיה ליתן לא תעשה על אכילתו:
human_translation: Rav Aharon said to Ravina: Come hear which is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: every which is in “shall be offered in its entirety” to impose a prohibition against eating it.
llm_translation: Rav Aharon said to Ravina: Come and hear, as it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says, "Anything that is (Leviticus 6:16) 'in the censer shall it be' - you shall not do it for its consumption."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ מנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח ומנחת נסכים למזבח ואין בהן לכהנים ובזה יפה כח מזבח מכח הכהנים שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים נאכלין לכהנים ואין בהם למזבח ובזה יפה כח הכהנים מכח המזבח:
human_translation: The meal offering of priests, the meal offering of the anointed priest, and the meal offering libations on the altar, and there is no of them for the priests. And in the power of the altar is greater than the power of the priests. The two loaves, and the shewbread, are eaten by the priests, and there is no part of them on the altar. And in the power of the priests is greater than the power of the altar.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The meal-offering of priests, and the meal-offering of the anointed priest, and the drink-offerings are for the altar, and they do not belong to the priests. And in this, the strength of the altar is distinguished from the strength of the priests. The two loaves and the showbread are eaten by the priests, and do not belong to the altar. And in this, the strength of the priests is distinguished from the strength of the altar.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ותו ליכא והא איכא עולה איכא עורה לכהנים והא איכא עולת העוף איכא מוראה ונוצה והא איכא נסכים לשיתין אזלי
human_translation: And are there no additional But isn’t there the burnt offering, There is hide, to the priests. But isn’t there the bird a burnt offering, There is crop and its feathers, But aren’t there libations, go to the drainpipes,
llm_translation: Gemara: There is no "and furthermore." But there is an Olah sacrifice, there is a Minchah offering for the priests, there is a bird Olah sacrifice, there is frankincense and levonah, and there are libations for libations to be poured.

hebrew_text: ומאי בזו לאפוקי מדשמואל דאמר שמואל המתנדב יין מביאו ומזלפו על גבי אישים קמ"ל דלשיתין אזלי
human_translation: And what And in to exclude of Shmuel, as Shmuel said: One who donates wine brings it and pours it over the fires teaches us that goes to the drainpipes,
llm_translation: And what is the difference to exclude from Samuel, for Samuel said: One who donates wine should bring it and pour it on the hands of the priests. This teaches that for libations they go to the sixth group.

hebrew_text: מסייע ליה לשמואל דאמר שמואל המתנדב שמן קומצו ושיריו נאכלין:
human_translation: supports of Shmuel. As Shmuel said: One who donates oil removes a handful and its remainder is eaten
llm_translation: Assisting him to Shmuel, for Shmuel said: "One who volunteers, his oil and his leftovers are eaten."

hebrew_text: שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים: ותו ליכא והא איכא חטאת העוף איכא דמה
human_translation: the two loaves and the shewbread, And are there no more But isn’t there the bird sin offering, There is its blood,
llm_translation: Two the bread and bread the face: and furthermore not and this there is sin-offering of bird there is what

hebrew_text: והאיכא לוג שמן של מצורע איכא מתנותיו
human_translation: But isn’t there log of oil of a leper there are its placements,
llm_translation: And there is a log of oil for the metzora, there are his gifts.

hebrew_text: ומאי בזו לאפוקי ממאן דאמר שתי הלחם הבאות בפני עצמן לשריפה אתיין קמשמע לן דבזו יפה כח כהנים לעולם:
human_translation: And what And in to exclude of the one who says: The two loaves that are brought by themselves, they go to be burned. teaches us that in this the power of the priests is always greater,
llm_translation: And what is the meaning of "B'Zu"? To exclude the opinion of the one who said that two loaves that come on their own for burning come to teach us that in this case the strength of the priests is forever.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל המנחות הנעשות בכלי טעונות שלשה מתנות שמן יציקה ובלילה ומתן שמן בכלי קודם לעשייתן
human_translation: All the meal offerings that are prepared in a vessel, require three placements of oil, Pouring and mixing and placement of oil into the vessel prior to preparation
llm_translation: Mishnah: All meal-offerings that are made in vessels require three gifts: oil pouring, mixing, and giving oil in a vessel before their preparation.

hebrew_text: חלות בוללן דברי רבי וחכמים אומרים סולת החלות טעונות בלילה ורקיקין משיחה כיצד מושחן כמין כי והשאר נאכלין לכהנים:
human_translation: loaves mixes them the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: fine flour the loaves require mixing wafers smearing How does one smear them? similar chi, and the rest eaten by priests.
llm_translation: Chalot bolan, the words of Rabbi, and the sages say: The fine flour of the chalot requires kneading at night, and the wafers are anointed. How are they anointed? Like the Mincha offering, and the rest is eaten by the priests.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ למעוטי מאי אמר רב פפא למעוטי מנחת מאפה
human_translation: To exclude what Rav Pappa said: to exclude baked meal offering,
llm_translation: Gemara: To exclude what? What did Rav Papa say? To exclude the Minchat Mafah.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן (ויקרא ב, ז) ואם מנחת מרחשת קרבנך סלת בשמן תעשה מלמד שטעונה מתן שמן בכלי קרבנך קרבנך לגזירה שווה
human_translation: the Sages taught “And if your offering is a deep-pan meal offering, it shall be made of fine flour in oil” teaches that it requires placement of oil in vessel, “your offering” “your offering” to a verbal analogy:
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And if your offering is a meal offering baked in a pan, it shall be made of fine flour with oil" (Leviticus 2:7) - this teaches that it requires the addition of oil in the vessel of your offering, your offering is equivalent to a decree.

hebrew_text: מה כאן מתן שמן בכלי אף להלן מתן שמן בכלי ומה להלן יציקה ובלילה אף כאן יציקה ובלילה:
human_translation: Just as here, placement of oil in utensil so too there, placement of oil in utensil And just as there, pouring and mixing so too here, pouring and mixing
llm_translation: Here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: "What here giving oil in vessel also there giving oil in vessel and what there pouring also here pouring and at night."

hebrew_text: חלות בוללן דברי רבי וחכמים אומרים סולת:
human_translation: loaves mixes them the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: fine flour,
llm_translation: Loaves - Rabbi says they are made with fine flour, and the sages say with coarse flour.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן (ויקרא ב, ה) סלת בלולה מלמד שנבללת סולת רבי אומר חלות בוללן שנאמר (ויקרא ז, יב) חלות בלולות אמרו לו והלא לחמי תודה נאמר בהן חלות ואי אפשר לבוללן כשהן חלות אלא סולת
human_translation: The Sages taught fine flour mixed teaches that it is mixed flour. Rabbi says: loaves mixes them, as it is stated: loaves mixed said to him: But is it not with regard to loaves of a thanks offering it is stated: loaves and it is not possible to mix them when they are loaves, only fine flour?
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: (Leviticus 2:5) "fine flour mixed." This teaches that the flour is mixed. Rabbi says: loaves are mixed, as it is said (Leviticus 7:12) "loaves mixed." They said to him: But is it not stated regarding the loaves of thanksgiving offering, "loaves"? And it is impossible to mix them when they are loaves, rather, it is fine flour.

hebrew_text: כיצד עושה נותן שמן בכלי קודם לעשייתן ונותנה ונותן שמן עליה ובוללה ולשה ואופה ופותתה ונותן עליה שמן וקומץ
human_translation: How does perform places oil in a utensil before is done, and places And he places oil upon it and mixes it, and kneads it and bakes it And he breaks it and he places oil upon and removes a handful
llm_translation: How does one do it? He puts oil in a vessel before their making, and he puts it, and he puts oil on it, and he kneads it, and lets it rest, and bakes it, and breaks it, and puts oil on it, and gathers it up.

hebrew_text: רבי אומר חלות בוללן שנאמר חלות בלולות בשמן כיצד עושה נותן שמן בכלי קודם לעשייתה ונותנה ולשה ואופה ופותתה ונותן עליה שמן ובוללה וחוזר ונותן עליה שמן וקומץ
human_translation: Rabbi says: loaves, mixes them as it is stated: “Loaves mixed with oil.” How does perform places oil in a utensil before is done, and places And he kneads it and bakes it and breaks and places oil upon the and mixes and again places oil upon and removes a handful
llm_translation: Rabbi says: "Chalot are kneaded." As it is stated: "Chalot kneaded with oil." How does one do it? He puts oil in a vessel before making the dough, then makes it, lets it rest, bakes it, breaks it, puts oil on it, kneads it, puts oil on it again, and folds it.

hebrew_text: אי אפשר דקאמרי ליה רבנן לרבי מאי היא אמר רבי שמואל בר רב יצחק רביעית שמן היא היאך מתחלקת לכמה חלות:
human_translation: it is not possible which the Rabbis said to Rabbi what it Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzḥak says: a quarter- of oil is how could it be divided among a number of loaves?
llm_translation: It is impossible that the sages said to Rabbi, "What is it?" Rabbi Shmuel bar Rav Yitzchak said, "It is a quarter log of oil. How is it divided into how many loaves?"

hebrew_text: החלות טעונות בלילה ורקיקין משיחה: תנו רבנן חלות בלולות ולא רקיקין בלולין שיכול והלא דין הוא ומה חלות שאינן טעונות משיחה טעונות בלילה רקיקין שטעונין משיחה אינו דין שטעונין בלילה תלמוד לומר חלות בלולות ולא רקיקין בלולין
human_translation: The loaves require mixing and wafers smearing. The Sages taught loaves mixed but the wafers are not mixed. might not logical inference? And if loaves, which do not require smearing, require mixing, is it not logical wafers, which require smearing, require mixing? the verse states: “Loaves mixed,” but wafers are not mixed.
llm_translation: The loaves require kneading at night, and the wafers require anointing. The Rabbis taught: Loaves that are kneaded and not wafers that are kneaded, perhaps it is the same? Just as loaves that do not require anointing require kneading at night, wafers that require anointing do not require kneading at night. It is not the same. Wafers that require anointing do not require kneading at night. The verse teaches: Loaves that are kneaded and not wafers that are kneaded.

hebrew_text: רקיקין משוחין ולא חלות משוחות שיכול והלא דין הוא ומה רקיקין שאינן טעונין בלילה טעונין משיחה חלות שטעונות בלילה אינו דין שטעונות משיחה תלמוד לומר רקיקין משוחים ולא חלות משוחות
human_translation: wafers are smeared but loaves are not smeared. as might not logical inference, And if wafers, which do not require mixing, require smearing, is it not logical loaves, which require mixing, require smearing? the verse states wafers are smeared but loaves are not smeared.
llm_translation: Thin pancakes anointed and not loaves anointed that it is possible and is it not the same? And what thin pancakes that do not require kneading at night require anointing, loaves that require kneading at night do not require anointing? It is not so, that they require anointing. The Talmud teaches to say: Thin pancakes anointed and not loaves anointed.

hebrew_text: מאי תלמודא אמר רבא לא לישתמיט ולכתוב חלות משוחות ורקיקין בלולין:
human_translation: What is the derivation? Rava said: should not omit and let it write Smeared loaves and mixed wafers.
llm_translation: What is the Talmud? Rava said: Not to leave out and write about anointed loaves and rolled wafers.

hebrew_text: כיצד מושחן כמין כי והשאר נאכל וכו': מאי כמין כי אמר רב כהנא כמין כי יווני
human_translation: How does one smear them? similar chi, and the rest is eaten What Similar chi? Rav Kahana said: similar Greek chi,
llm_translation: How is musk prepared like a type of kohl, and the rest is eaten, etc.? What is "like a type of kohl"? Rav Kahana said: Like Greek kohl.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן מנחה הבאה מחצה חלות ומחצה רקיקין מביא לוג שמן וחוצהו חציו לחלות וחציו לרקיקין
human_translation: the Sages taught meal offering that comes as half loaves and half wafers, brings a log of oil, and divides it into two Half of for loaves, and half of for wafers.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: A Mincha offering that consists of half loaves and half wafers, one brings a log of oil and divides it, half for the loaves and half for the wafers.

hebrew_text: וחלות בוללן ורקיקין מושחן ומושח את הרקיק על פני כולו ושאר השמן מחזירו לחלות רבי שמעון בן יהודה משום רבי שמעון אומר מושחן כמין כי ושאר השמן נאכל לכהנים
human_translation: the loaves, mixes them and the wafers, smears And smears the wafer over the entire surface, and he returns the rest of the oil to the loaves. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: smears them similar chi, and the rest is eaten by the priests.
llm_translation: "And loaves kneaded and wafers anointed, and one anoints the wafer over its entirety, and the rest of the oil returns to the loaves. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: one anoints like the manner of 'ki,' and the rest of the oil is eaten by the priests."

hebrew_text: תניא אידך רקיקין הבאים בפני עצמן מביא לוג שמן ומושחן וחוזר ומושחן עד שיכלה כל שמן שבלוג רבי שמעון בן יהודה אומר משום רבי שמעון מושחן כמין כי ושאר השמן נאכל לכהנים:
human_translation: It is taught another wafers that come by themselves brings a log of oil and smears them, and he again smears them until all the oil in the log is finished. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: smears them similar chi, and the rest of the oil is eaten by the priests.
llm_translation: It was taught in another Baraita: Thin cakes that come by themselves, one brings a log of oil and anoints them, and then anoints them again until all the oil in the log is finished. Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: One anoints them like the manner of a "Ki," and the rest of the oil is eaten by the priests.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל המנחות הנעשות בכלי טעונות פתיתה:
human_translation: All the meal offerings that are prepared in a vessel require breaking
llm_translation: Mishnah: All meal-offerings that are made in utensils require kneading.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ למעוטי מאי אמר רב פפא למעוטי שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים
human_translation: To exclude what Rav Pappa said: to exclude the two loaves, and the shewbread,
llm_translation: Gemara: To exclude what? What did Rav Papa say? To exclude the two loaves and the showbread.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן (ויקרא ב, ו) פתות אותה פתים מנחה לרבות כל המנחות לפתיתה יכול שאני מרבה אף שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים תלמוד לאמר אותה
human_translation: The Sages taught “You shall break it in pieces, a meal offering” to include all the meal offerings of breaking might that I include even the two loaves and the shewbread. the verse states: it
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "He shall break it into pieces, and pour oil on it; it is a meal offering." (Leviticus 2:6) "Pitot" (pieces) includes all meal offerings. One might have thought that I should also include the two loaves and the showbread. The Torah teaches to say "it."

hebrew_text: (ויקרא ב, ו) ויצקת שמן מנחה לרבות כל המנחות ליציקה יכול שאני מרבה אף מנחת מאפה תלמוד לומר עליה שמן
human_translation: “And you shall pour oil a meal offering.” to include all the meal offerings of pouring. might that I include even the baked meal offering. the verse states: oil upon it,”
llm_translation: "And he shall pour oil on it, a meal offering." (Leviticus 2:6) "And you shall pour oil" - to include all meal offerings for pouring. One might have thought that I should also include a baked meal offering. The Torah teaches us by saying regarding it, 'oil.'

hebrew_text: אוציא את החלות ולא אוציא את הרקיקין תלמוד לומר היא מאי תלמודא אימא להוציא מנחת כהנים
human_translation: I should exclude the loaves but I should not exclude the wafers. the verse states: “It What is the derivation, I will say: to exclude the meal offering of priests
llm_translation: I will take out the loaves and I will not take out the wafers. The Torah says, "it is" - what is the teaching? Say it is to take out the meal offering of the priests.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה איזהו דבר שצריך שני מיעוטין הוי אומר זו מנחת מאפה:
human_translation: Rabba says: What is the matter that requires two exclusions? You must say: It is the baked meal offering,
llm_translation: Rabbah said: What is a matter that requires two limitations? One would say, this is a "Minchat Ma'afeh."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ מנחת ישראל קופל אחד לשנים ושנים לארבעה ומבדיל מנחת כהנים קופל אחד לשנים ושנים לארבעה ואינו מבדיל מנחת כהן משיח לא היה מקפלה רבי שמעון אומר מנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח אין בהן פתיתה מפני שאין בהן קמיצה וכל שאין בהן קמיצה אין בהן פתיתה וכולן פותתן כזיתים:
human_translation: the meal offering of an Israelite folds [ kofel ] one and two into four and separates the meal offering of priests, folds one into two and two into four and does not separate meal offering of the anointed priest, he would not fold it. Rabbi Shimon says: the meal offering of priests nor the meal offering of the anointed priest is there breaking because in there is no removal of a handful. And any in which there is no removal of a handful there is no breaking And all breaks them olive-bulk-
llm_translation: Mishnah: The meal offering of an Israelite is kneaded for two priests, and for four priests, and one separates the portions. The meal offering of a priest is kneaded for two priests, and for four priests, and one does not separate the portions. If the meal offering of the anointed priest was not kneaded, Rabbi Shimon says: The meal offering of a regular priest and the meal offering of the anointed priest do not contain a handful, because they do not contain a handful, and anything that does not contain a handful does not contain a handful, and all of them require a portion the size of an olive.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן פתות יכול לשנים תלמוד לומר פתים אי פתים יכול יעשנה פירורין תלמוד לומר אותה אותה לפתיתים ולא פתיתה לפתיתים
human_translation: the Sages taught “You shall break might into two the verse states: pieces,” If pieces, might he should renders it crumbs. the verse states: it,” it in pieces, and not its pieces into pieces.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: "Simple" - one might think it refers to two loaves of bread. The Torah says "loaves" - if it said "loaves," one might think it means make them into crumbs. The Torah says "it" - "it" refers to loaves, and not to crumbs.

hebrew_text: הא כיצד מנחת ישראל קופל אחד לשנים ושנים לארבעה ומבדיל מנחת [כהנים] וכהן משיח היה מקפלה וכו' והא אנן תנן לא היה מקפלה אמר רבה אינו מקפלה לארבעה אבל מקפלה לשנים
human_translation: How so? the meal offering of an Israelite, folds one into two and two into four and separates the meal offering of priests and anointed priest, folds it didn’t we learn He would not fold it? Rabba says: does not fold it into four, but fold it into two.
llm_translation: This is how the Minchat Yisrael is folded: one fold for two, and two folds for four. And one separates the Minchat Kohanim. And if the Kohen Mashiah was folding it, etc. But we have learned: he did not fold it. Rabbah said: he does not fold it for four, but he folds it for two.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר מנחת כהנים ומנחת כהן משיח אין בהן פתיתה אמר רב יוסף האי חביצא דאית בה פירורין כזית מברכינן עליה המוציא לחם מן הארץ אי לית בה פירורין כזית מברכינן עליה בורא מיני מזונות
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: the meal offering of priests nor the meal offering of the anointed priest is there breaking Rav Yosef said: this cooked dish, which contains pieces an olive-bulk, one recites upon it Who brings forth bread from the earth. if it does not contain pieces an olive-bulk, one recites upon it Who creates the various kinds of nourishment.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: The meal offering of the priests and the meal offering of the anointed priest do not require kneading. Rav Yosef said: If this loaf contains pieces the size of an olive, we recite over it "Who brings forth bread from the earth." If it does not contain pieces the size of an olive, we recite over it "Who creates various kinds of sustenance."

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף מנא אמינא לה דתניא היה עומד ומקריב מנחות בירושלים אומר ברוך שהחיינו וקימנו נטלן לאכלן אומר המוציא לחם מן הארץ ותנן וכולן פתיתים בכזית
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I say this As it is taught would stand and sacrifice meal offerings in Jerusalem recite: Blessed Who has given us life and sustained us would take to eat them, he would recite Who brings forth bread from the earth. And we learned And all pieces of an olive-bulk.
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: From where do I know this? As it is taught: If one was standing and offering meal offerings in Jerusalem, he says, "Blessed is He who has kept us alive and sustained us," he takes the offering to eat it. He says, "Who brings forth bread from the earth." And we learned: All of them the meal offerings are of the size of an olive.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי ולתנא דבי רבי ישמעאל דאמר מפרכן עד שמחזירן לסלתן הכי נמי דלא מברך המוציא
human_translation: Abaye said to But according to the tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael, who said He crushes them until he restores them to they flour, that so too, does not recite Who brings forth
llm_translation: Abbaye said to him, and according to the Tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael who said, "From the point of their separation until they are returned to their flour," so too, one does not recite the blessing of "Hamotzi."

hebrew_text: וכי תימא הכי נמי והתניא ליקט מכולן כזית ואכלו אם חמץ הוא ענוש כרת אם מצה הוא אדם יוצא בהן ידי חובתו בפסח
human_translation: And if you would say indeed, But isn’t it taught one who gathered an olive-bulk from all of and ate it, if it was leavened bread punishable by karet . If was of unleavened bread, a person fulfills his obligation on Passover through
llm_translation: And if you will say so too, and it was taught in a Baraita: If one gathered from all of them (the five types of grain) an olive's worth and ate it, if it is leavened, he is liable to karet; if it is unleavened, he fulfills his obligation with them on Passover.

hebrew_text: הכא במאי עסקינן בשעירסן
human_translation: what are we dealing with here? where pressed them [ beshe’eirsan ]
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with their goats.

hebrew_text: אי הכי היינו דקתני עלה והוא שאכלן בכדי אכילת פרס ואי בשעירסן שאכלו מיבעי ליה אלא הכא במאי עסקינן בבא מלחם גדול
human_translation: If so, that which is taught about And this is when he ate in to eat a half-loaf [ peras ] if where he pressed them should have When he ate it, Rather, what are we dealing with here? where came from a large bread.
llm_translation: If so, this is what was taught: "Regarding leaves, one must eat them in an amount equivalent to the size of a Persian meal. And if it is regarding goat's teeth, where they ate them, what does he need? Rather, here we are dealing with what? We are dealing with the case of the Great Salt Sea."

hebrew_text: מאי הוי עלה רב ששת אמר אפילו פירורין שאין בהן כזית אמר רבא והוא דאיכא תוריתא דנהמא עלייהו:
human_translation: what was about it? Rav Sheshet says: Even pieces that do not have an olive-bulk, Rava said: And is where have the appearance [ torita ] of bread,
llm_translation: What is the case of "a leaf"? Rav Sheshet said, even crumbs that do not contain an olive's bulk. Rava said, and this is when there is a Torah verse upon them.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל המנחות טעונות שלש מאות שיפה וחמש מאות בעיטה שיפה ובעיטה בחיטין ור' יוסי אומר בבצק כל המנחות באות עשר עשר חוץ מלחם הפנים וחביתי כהן גדול שהם באות שתים עשרה דברי רבי יהודה רבי מאיר אומר כולם באות שתים עשרה חוץ מחלות תודה ונזירות שהן באות עשר עשר:
human_translation: All the meal offerings require rubbing three hundred and striking five hundred Rubbing and striking on the wheat And Rabbi Yosei says: on the dough All of the meal offerings come ten ten except for the shewbread and the griddle-cake of the High Priest, which come twelve the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says: They all come twelve except for loaves the thanks offering and naziriteship, which come ten each.
llm_translation: Mishnah: All meal-offerings require three hundred shekels of fine flour and five hundred of coarse flour. R. Yosei says: with dough. All meal-offerings come with ten loaves, except for the showbread and the loaves of the High Priest, which come with twelve. The words of Rabbi Yehudah; Rabbi Meir says: all come with twelve, except for the loaves of thanksgiving and the Nazirites, which come with ten.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנא שף אחת בועט שתים שף שתים בועט שלש בעי רבי ירמיה אמטויי ואתויי חד או דלמא אמטויי ואתויי תרי מאי תיקו:
human_translation: taught rubs once strikes twice. rubs twice strikes three Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma back and forth one or perhaps back and forth two What shall stand
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught: One who kicks with one foot, two feet kick back; two feet kick back, three feet are required. Rabbi Yirmeya asked: If one foot is raised and brought down, is it considered one kick, or perhaps if one foot is raised and brought down, it is considered two kicks? What is the resolution?

hebrew_text: שיפה ובעיטה בחיטין רבי יוסי אומר בבצק: איבעיא להו בבצק ולא בחיטין או דלמא אף בבצק תא שמע דתניא שיפה ובעיטה בחיטין רבי יוסי אומר שיפה ובעיטה בבצק:
human_translation: Rubbing and striking on the wheat Rabbi Yosei says: on the dough. A dilemma was raised before on the dough and not on the wheat Or perhaps also on the dough. Come hear as it is taught Rubbing and striking on the wheat Rabbi Yosei says: Rubbing and striking on the dough.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Shifah u'Beitah b'Chitin, Rabbi Yossi omer b'Vatzek: Iba'ya lehu b'Vatzek u'lo b'Chitin, o d'lama af b'Vatzek ta shma d'tanya Shifah u'Beitah b'Chitin, Rabbi Yossi omer Shifah u'Beitah b'Vatzek." English translation: "Plaiting and baking with wheat, Rabbi Yossi says with dough: It was asked of them with dough and not with wheat, or perhaps even with dough come and hear that it was taught: Plaiting and baking with wheat, Rabbi Yossi says plaiting and baking with dough."

hebrew_text: כל המנחות באות כו' שתים עשרה: לחם הפנים בהדיא כתיב ביה
human_translation: all of the meal offerings come twelve the shewbread, it is written explicitly of it:
llm_translation: All the Minchah offerings come to twelve: the Showbread is explicitly written about in it.

hebrew_text: חביתי כהן גדול אתיא חוקה חוקה מלחם הפנים
human_translation: griddle-cake of the High Priest derived from shewbread. obligation obligation”
