hebrew_text: כל המנחות דבאות עשר עשר מנלן גמר מלחמי תודה מה להלן עשר אף כאן עשר ולילף מלחם הפנים מה להלן שתים עשרה אף כאן שתים עשרה
human_translation: all the meal offerings that they come ten ten from where do we derives from the loaves of the thanks offering. Just as there, ten so too here, ten But let him derive it from the shewbread: Just as there, twelve so too here, twelve.
llm_translation: All the meal offerings that come with ten, from where do we derive? We learn from the thanksgiving offering. Just as there, ten; so too here, ten. And to exclude the showbread, from where do we derive? Just as there, twelve; so too here, twelve.

hebrew_text: מסתברא מלחמי תודה הוה ליה למילף שכן יחיד המתנדב שמן נפסל שלא בשבת ושלא בטומאה
human_translation: stands to reason should derive from the loaves of the thanks offering, as an individual one who donates oil disqualified not on the Sabbath, and not in ritual impurity,
llm_translation: It is logical that the thanksgiving offering should be excluded, for similarly, an individual who volunteers oil is disqualified, not on Shabbat and not due to impurity.

hebrew_text: אדרבה מלחם הפנים הוה ליה למילף שכן הקדש ולבונה מצה ועצם
human_translation: On the contrary, should derive from the shewbread, as consecrated and frankincense, unleavened bread, and itself,
llm_translation: On the contrary, it should have been necessary for him to separate, as such is the law regarding the Holy things: frankincense, meal-offering, unleavened bread, and bone.

hebrew_text: הנך נפישן
human_translation: These are numerous
llm_translation: These are the words: הנך נפישן

hebrew_text: ואי סבירא לן דבר הלמד בגזירה שוה חוזר ומלמד בבנין אב נילף מחביתי כהן גדול מה להלן שתים עשרה אף כאן שתים עשרה
human_translation: And if we hold a matter learned through a verbal analogy may subsequently teach as a paradigm, let us derive from the griddle-cake of the High Priest: Just as there, offering twelve so too here, twelve
llm_translation: And if it is reasonable to us that a matter learned through a gezeirah shavah can then teach through a binyan av, it is derived from my teacher, the High Priest. Just as there, twelve; so too here, twelve.

hebrew_text: מסתברא מלחמי תודה הוה ליה למילף שכן הדיוט שהתנדב חצאין
human_translation: stands to reason should derive from the loaves of the thanks offering, as an ordinary one who donates halves,
llm_translation: It is logical that the thanksgiving offering should be required to be divided, as the layman who volunteered half.

hebrew_text: לפיגול שלא בשבת ושלא בטומאה
human_translation: as piggul , not on the Sabbath, and not in ritual impurity,
llm_translation: Regarding Pigul that is not on Shabbat and not in a state of impurity.

hebrew_text: אדרבה מחביתי כוהן גדול הוי ליה למילף שכן עשרון כלי הקדש ולבונה
human_translation: On the contrary, should have derived from the High Priest’s griddle-cake as a tenth vessel, consecrated and frankincense,
llm_translation: On the contrary, the High Priest's belt should be to the contrary, for thus is the arrangement of the vessels of the Sanctuary and the frankincense.

hebrew_text: מצה ועצם הגשה ואישים והני נפישן
human_translation: unleavened bread, and itself, bringing near and the fires of the altar, And these are numerous
llm_translation: Unleavened bread and bone, sinew, and joints, and these are the thick ones.

hebrew_text: הדיוט מהדיוט עדיף ליה
human_translation: prefers an ordinary from an ordinary
llm_translation: The layman from the layman is preferable to him.

hebrew_text: רבי מאיר אומר כולן באות שתים עשרה מאי קסבר אי סבירא ליה דדבר הלמד בגזירה שוה חוזר ומלמד בבנין אב יליף מחביתי דכהן גדול דהני נפישן
human_translation: Rabbi Meir says: They all come twelve What does hold? If he holds that a matter learned through a verbal analogy subsequently teach as a paradigm, derives from the High Priest’s griddle-cake as these are numerous.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir says: All of them come in twelve. What does he hold? If it is reasonable to him that a matter learned through a gezeirah shavah then teaches through a building, he will derive from my friend, the High Priest, that these are the prominent ones.

hebrew_text: אי סבירא ליה דדבר הלמד בגזירה שוה אינו חוזר ומלמד בבנין אב יליף מלחם הפנים הקדש מהקדש עדיף ליה:
human_translation: if he holds that a matter learned through a verbal analogy is not subsequently teach as a paradigm, derives from the shewbread. prefers consecrated from consecrated
llm_translation: If he holds that a matter learned through a gezeirah shavah does not return to teach a matter of building, he will derive the law of the showbread from the holy of holies: the holy is superior to it.

hebrew_text: חוץ מלחמי תודה ונזירות שהן באות עשר עשר: לחמי תודה בהדיא כתיב בהו
human_translation: except for loaves thanks offering and naziriteship, which come ten each. the loaves of the thanks offering, it is written explicitly of them
llm_translation: Outside of the thanksgiving offerings and nazirites which are explicitly written with the letter "ayin" ten times: the thanksgiving offerings, it is explicitly written in them.

hebrew_text: נזירות דאמר מר שלמיו לרבות שלמי נזיר
human_translation: naziriteship as the Master says: “his peace offerings” to include peace offering of the nazirite.
llm_translation: Nazirites, as Mar said, "Shelamyo" includes the Shelamim of a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: אמר רב טובי בר קיסנא אמר שמואל לחמי תודה שאפאן ארבע חלות יצא והא בעינן ארבעים למצוה
human_translation: Rav Tovi bar Kisna says Shmuel says: loaves of thanks offering that one baked as four loaves, fulfilled But we require forty to mitzva
llm_translation: Rav Tovi bar Kisna said: Shmuel said, "My thanksgiving bread, if it had four loaves, one fulfills the obligation, yet we require forty for the mitzvah."

hebrew_text: והא בעי אפרושי תרומה מינייהו וכי תימא דמפריש מכל חדא וחדא אחד אמר רחמנא שלא יטול פרוס דאפרשינהו בלישה
human_translation: But is required to separate teruma from them And if you would say that he separate from each and every the Merciful One state: one that he may not take sliced where he separated it while kneading,
llm_translation: And this requires clarification regarding separating terumah from them. And if you will say that one separates from each and every one individually, it is said by the Merciful One that one should not take a portion that I have separated through rubbing.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי כל המנחות שריבה במדת חלתן או שמיעט במדת חלתן כשרות חוץ מלחם הפנים וחביתי כוהן גדול ולחמי תודה ונזירות הוא
human_translation: raises an objection All the meal offerings where increased the measure of their loaves or where decreased the measure of their loaves fit, except for the shewbread, and the High Priest’s griddle-cake and loaves thanks offering and naziriteship. He
llm_translation: The question was raised: All meal-offerings that he increased in their measure or decreased in their measure are valid, except for the showbread, the loaves of the High Priest, the loaves of thanksgiving, and the Nazirite offerings.

hebrew_text: דאמר כי האי תנא דתניא כל המנחות שריבה במדת חלתן או שמיעט במדת חלתן כשרות חוץ מלחם הפנים וחביתי כהן גדול ויש אומרים אף לחמי תודה ונזירות
human_translation: states in accordance with that tanna , as it is taught All the meal offerings where increased the measure of their loaves or where decreased the measure of their loaves fit, except for the shewbread and the High Priest’s griddle-cake And some say: Even the loaves of the thanks offering and naziriteship
llm_translation: He said: For this Tanna who taught: All meal-offerings that he increased in their measure or decreased in their measure are valid, except for the showbread, the High Priest's loaves, and some say, also the loaves of thanksgiving-offering and the Nazirites.

hebrew_text: אמר רב הונא מנחת מאפה שאפה חלה אחת יצא מאי טעמא (מצות) מצת כתיב
human_translation: Rav Huna says: baked meal offering that baked one loaf, fulfilled What is the reason? “unleavened loaves [ matzot ]” is written unleavened loaf [ matzat ],
llm_translation: Said Rav Huna: "With regard to a meal-offering that one bakes, if he baked one loaf, he has fulfilled the obligation. What is the reason? 'Matzah' is written."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב פפא טעמא דכתיב מצת הא כתיב מצות לא והא גבי לחמי תודה דכתיב מצות ואמר רב טובי בר קיסנא אמר שמואל לחמי תודה שאפאן ארבע חלות יצא ההיא פליגא:
human_translation: Rav Pappa objects to this The reason that it is written matzat . But written: Matzot , not But concerning the loaves of the thanks offering, where it is written “ matzot ” and Rav Tovi bar Kisna said Shmuel said: loaves of the thanks offering that were baked as four loaves, fulfilled That disagrees
llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Papa: The reason it is written "matzah" is it not also written "matzot"? And regarding the loaves of thanksgiving offering, it is written "matzot." And Rav Tovi bar Kisna said in the name of Shmuel: The loaves of thanksgiving offering, even if they are four loaves, fulfill that dispute.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ העומר היה בא עשרון משלש סאין שתי הלחם שתי עשרונים משלש סאין לחם הפנים עשרים וארבע עשרונים מעשרים וארבע סאין:
human_translation: The omer offering, would come a tenth from three se’a The two loaves two-tenths from three se’a The shewbread twenty-four tenths from twenty-four se’a
llm_translation: Mishnah: The Omer offering was brought with ten measures of fine flour. Two loaves were brought with two tenths of an ephah. The showbread was brought with twenty-four tenths of an ephah.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי טעמא כיון דמחדש אתי ומשעורין אתי עשרון מובחר לא אתי אלא משלש סאין
human_translation: What is the reason Since comes from new and comes from barley, a choice tenth comes only from three se’a
llm_translation: Gemara: What is the reason? Since he brings new produce and measures it, the finest tithe does not come except from three se'ah.

hebrew_text: שתי הלחם שתי עשרונות משלש סאין כיון דמחיטין אתיין אף על גב דמחדש אתיין שתי עשרונות אתו משלש סאין
human_translation: the two loaves two-tenths from three se’a Since come from wheat, although come from new two-tenths come from three se’a
llm_translation: Two loaves twelve cents from three se'ahs since wheat come also though renew come two twelve cents come from three se'ahs

hebrew_text: לחם הפנים עשרים וארבעה עשרונות מעשרים וארבעה סאין מאי טעמא כיון דמחיטין אתו ומישן אתו עשרון מובחר אתי מסאה
human_translation: the shewbread twenty-four tenths from twenty-four se’a What is the reason? Since come from wheat, and come from old a choice tenth comes from one se’a

human_translation: But can a matter that was derived by comparison come back and teach by comparison it is from itself, and another matter, and any from itself and another matter is not a comparison.
llm_translation: And when a matter is learned through a comparison, it returns and teaches through a comparison similar to it, and it is another matter entirely. And anything similar to it and another matter, it is not considered a comparison.

llm_translation: Gemara: From where are these matters derived? hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אויא אימא אנתא דמשחא אלא כדדרש רב נחמן בר רב חסדא משמיה דרבי טבלא (ויקרא ו, יג) זה קרבן אהרן ובניו אשר יקריבו לה' ביום המשח אותו

llm_translation: Challenges her Rav Avya: Say, the anointing oil? Rather, as expounded by Rav Nachman bar Rav Chisda in the name of Rabbi Tavla: "This is the offering of Aharon and his sons, which they shall offer to the Lord on the day he is anointed." (Leviticus 6:13)

hebrew_text: וכי מה למדנו לבניו ביום המשחו אלא מקיש חינוכו להמשחו מה המשחו רבוכה אף חינוכו רבוכה
human_translation: And what have we learned with regard to sons, on the day that he is anointed? Rather, juxtaposes his inauguration with he is anointed. just as he is anointed is poached in water, so too his inauguration is poached in water.
llm_translation: And when did we learn to his sons on the day of his anointing? Rather, it is derived: His anointing is compared to his consecration. Just as his consecration is with sprinkling, so too his anointing is with sprinkling.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא כהן גדול המתקרב לעבודה צריך שתי עשרונות האיפה אחת להמשחו ואחת לחינוכו מר בר רב אשי אמר שלש
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda says: A High Priest who approaches the service required two tenths of an ephah, one for he is anointed and one for his inauguration. Mar bar Rav Ashi says: three
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: A High Priest who is about to perform the service requires twelve log of oil, one for his anointing and one for his consecration. Mar bar Rav Ashi said: three.

hebrew_text: ולא פליגי הא דעבד עבודה כשהוא כהן הדיוט הא דלא עבד עבודה כשהוא כהן הדיוט:
human_translation: And they do not disagree. This who performed service as an ordinary priest. that who has not performed service as an ordinary priest.
llm_translation: And they do not argue this one who performed the service when he is a commoner, this one who did not perform the service when he is a commoner.

hebrew_text: מאי תלמודא אמר רב פפא דבר שנאמר בו מצות לאפוקי רבוכה דלא נאמר בו מצות דבי רבי ישמעאל תנא מצות כלל חלות ורקיקין פרט כלל ופרט אין בכלל אלא מה שבפרט חלות ורקיקין אין מידי אחרינא לא:
human_translation: What is the derivation Rav Pappa says: an item of which it was stated: “ Matzot .” to exclude poached in water, of which it is not stated: Matzot . the school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: “Unleavened bread” a generalization; “loaves and wafers is a detail. a generalization and a detail, the generalization includes only what is in the detail. loaves and wafers are other items are not.
llm_translation: What is Talmud? Rav Pappa said: A matter that has a commandment stated regarding it, to exclude something that does not have a commandment stated regarding it. The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: A general commandment includes loaves and flat cakes. "General" is a specification, and "specification" is nothing other than what is specified. Loaves and flat cakes are not anything else.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ השוחט את התודה לפנים ולחמה חוץ לחומה לא קדש הלחם שחטה עד שלא קרמו פניה בתנור ואפילו קרמו כולן חוץ מאחד מהן לא קדש הלחם:
human_translation: one who slaughters the thanks offering inside and its loaves were outside the wall, the loaves were not consecrated. if he slaughtered before the surface formed a crust in the oven, and even formed a crust except for one of them, the loaves were not consecrated.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who slaughters the thanksgiving offering inside and its bread outside the wall, the bread is not sanctified. If he slaughtered it before its face was crusted in the oven, and even if all of them were crusted except for one of them, the bread is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מאי חוץ לחומה רבי יוחנן אמר חוץ לחומת בית פאגי וריש לקיש אמר חוץ לחומת העזרה
human_translation: What outside the wall? Rabbi Yoḥanan says outside the wall of Beit Pagei And Reish Lakish says outside the wall of the courtyard.
llm_translation: Gemara: What is considered "outside the wall"? Rabbi Yochanan said, "Outside the wall of Beit Pagi," and Reish Lakish said, "Outside the wall of the Azarah."

hebrew_text: ריש לקיש אמר חוץ לחומת העזרה בעינן על בסמוך
human_translation: Reish Lakish says outside the wall of the courtyard, we require “with [ al ]” nearby.
llm_translation: Reish Lakish said: "Outside the wall of the Azarah we require it to be nearby."

hebrew_text: ורבי יוחנן אמר חוץ לחומת בית פאגי אבל חוץ לעזרה קדוש ולא בעינן על בסמוך
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: outside the wall of Beit Pagei, But outside the courtyard, consecrated. And we do not require “with” nearby.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yochanan said, "Outside the wall of Beit Pagi, but outside the Azarah is holy, and we do not require proximity."

hebrew_text: והא איפליגו בה חדא זימנא
human_translation: But didn’t they disagree with regard to this one time?

human_translation: as we learned One who slaughters the Paschal offering with leavened bread transgresses a prohibition, Rabbi Yehuda says: Even the daily offering And Reish Lakish says: Actually, one is not liable unless is of the one who slaughters or the one who sprinkles or one of the members of the group, with in the courtyard. And Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even if is not with in the courtyard.
llm_translation: As we have learned in a Mishnah: one who slaughters the Paschal lamb on leaven transgresses a negative commandment. Rabbi Yehuda says: also the continual offering. And Reish Lakish said: one is not liable until he is either slaughtering, sprinkling, or one of the members of the group with him in the Temple courtyard. And Rabbi Yochanan said: even if there are not with him in the Temple courtyard.

llm_translation: It is necessary, for if it was stated in that case, in that case, Rabbi Yochanan said: Wherever there is a prohibition involved, but regarding the sanctity of bread, I would say that Reish Lakish agrees, for if it is inside, it is holy; if it is outside, it is not holy.

hebrew_text: ואי איתמר בהא בהא קאמר ריש לקיש אבל בהך אימא מודה ליה לרבי יוחנן צריכא

llm_translation: And if it was stated in this case, in this case, Reish Lakish said, but in that case, say it is necessary for Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דרבי יוחנן השוחט את התודה לפנים ולחמה חוץ לחומת בית פאגי לא קדש הלחם:
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: one who slaughters the thanks offering inside and its loaves were outside the walls of Beit Pagei, the loaves were not consecrated.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who slaughters the thanksgiving offering inside, and its bread outside the wall of the Beit Pagi, the bread is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: שחטה עד שלא קרמו פניה בתנור:
human_translation: he slaughtered before the surface of the loaves formed a crust in the oven,
llm_translation: "She slaughtered it until they did not blacken its face in the oven."

hebrew_text: מנא הני מילי דתנו רבנן (ויקרא ז, יג) על חלות לחם חמץ יקריב קרבנו על זבח מלמד שאין הלחם קדוש אלא אם כן קרמו פניה בתנור יקריב קרבנו על זבח מלמד שאין הלחם קדוש אלא בשחיטת הזבח זבח תודת מלמד שאם שחט שלא לשמן לא קדש הלחם
human_translation: From where are these matters As the Sages taught: “With cakes of leavened bread he shall present his offering with the sacrifice teaches that the loaves are not consecrated unless the surface formed a crust in the oven, “he shall present his offering with the sacrifice” teaches that the loaves are consecrated only upon the slaughtering of the offering. “the sacrifice for thanks” teaches that if one slaughtered not for its sake, the loaves were not consecrated.
llm_translation: The words that the Rabbis taught: "On loaves of leavened bread he shall offer his offering" (Leviticus 7:13) - this teaches that the bread is not holy unless its face has been turned towards the oven. "He shall offer his offering with the sacrifice" - this teaches that the bread is not holy except through the slaughter of the sacrifice. "A thanksgiving offering" - this teaches that if one slaughters it not for its sake, the bread is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן יוצאין במצה נא ובמצה העשויה באילפס מאי מצה נא אמר רב יהודה אמר שמואל כל שפורסה ואין חוטין נמשכין הימנה
human_translation: the Sages taught: fulfills with half-done, matza , and with matza made in a stewpot [ ilpas ] What half-done matza ? Rav Yehuda says Shmuel says: any that one breaks it, threads are not drawn from it.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: One fulfills one’s obligation with matzah that is pleasant and with matzah made in an oven. What is matzah that is pleasant? Rav Yehudah said in the name of Shmuel: Any matzah that is perforated and the threads do not pull away from it.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא וכן לענין לחמי תודה פשיטא הכא לחם כתיב והכא לחם כתיב
human_translation: Rava said: And so with regard to the matter of the loaves of the thanks offering, obvious? Here, “bread” is written and here, “bread” is written.
llm_translation: Rava said: And similarly regarding the matter of the bread of thanksgiving-offering, it is obvious here, "bread" is written here, and "bread" is written here.

hebrew_text: מהו דתימא אחד אמר רחמנא שלא יטול פרוס והא כמאן דפריסא דמיא קמשמע לן
human_translation: Lest you say the Merciful One states one that one may not take sliced and this is considered like one that is sliced, teaches us
llm_translation: What is the reasoning? One might say, "The Merciful One said that he should not take a portion." But according to whom does it resemble one who takes a portion? This teaches us.

hebrew_text: איתמר תודה ששחטה על שמונים חלות חזקיה אמר קדשו ארבעים מתוך שמונים ורבי יוחנן אמר לא קדשו ארבעים מתוך שמונים
human_translation: was stated a thanks offering that one slaughtered by eighty loaves Ḥizkiyya says: Forty of the eighty are consecrated, and Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Not forty of eighty are consecrated.
llm_translation: It was stated: Todah (Thanksgiving offering) that was slaughtered for eighty loaves. Hezekiah said: Its sanctity is on forty out of eighty, and Rabbi Yohanan said: Its sanctity is not on forty out of eighty.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא הכל מודים היכא דאמר ליקדשו ארבעים מתוך שמונים קדשו אל יקדשו ארבעים אלא אם כן יקדשו שמונים לא קדשו כי פליגי בסתמא מר סבר לאחריות קא מיכוין ומר סבר לקרבן גדול קא מיכוין
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: Everyone, concedes where said: Let forty of eighty be consecrated, that are consecrated. Forty should not be consecrated unless eighty will be consecrated, they were not consecrated. They disagree when without specification. Sage, holds: He intends to guarantee And Sage, holds: He intends to a large offering
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Zeira: Everyone agrees, where it says to sanctify forty out of eighty, sanctify; do not sanctify forty unless you sanctify eighty. If they disputed in a general case, one holds that he intends for responsibility, and one holds that he intends for a large offering.

hebrew_text: אביי אמר דכולי עלמא (לאחריות) קא מיכוין ובכלי שרת מקדשין שלא מדעת קא מיפלגי מר סבר כלי שרת מקדשין שלא מדעת ומר סבר כלי שרת אין מקדשין שלא מדעת
human_translation: Abaye said: Everyone he intends to guarantee and they disagree with regard to service vessels consecrate without intention Sage, holds service vessels consecrate without intention. And Sage, holds service vessels do not consecrate without intention.
llm_translation: Abaye said: "Everyone is unintentional, and regarding consecrated vessels, they argue. One Master holds that consecrated vessels that are not intentional are sanctified, and the other Master holds that consecrated vessels that are not intentional are not sanctified."

hebrew_text: רב פפא אמר דכולי עלמא כלי שרת מקדשין שלא מדעת והכא בסכין קא מיפלגי מר סבר סכין מקדשת ככלי שרת [ומר סבר סכין כיון דלית ליה תוך אינה מקדשת ככלי שרת]
human_translation: Rav Pappa said: Everyone service vessels consecrate without intention, and here they disagree with regard to knife. Sage, holds the knife consecrates as a service vessel And Sage, holds since the knife has no inside, it does not consecrate as a service vessel
llm_translation: Rav Papa said: "Everyone agrees that vessels of the Temple may be sanctified unintentionally. Here, in the case of a knife, the dispute arises. One Sage holds that a knife sanctifies like a Temple vessel, and the other Sage holds that since it does not have an interior, it does not sanctify like a Temple vessel."

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי רב פפא אמר דכולי עלמא כלי שרת אין מקדשין אלא מדעת והכא בסכין קא מיפלגי מר סבר סכין אלימא מכלי. שרת דאף על גב דלית ליה תוך מיקדשה ומר סבר סכין לא אלימא ליה מכלי שרת:
human_translation: And there are who say Rav Pappa said: Everyone service vessels consecrate only with intention, and here they disagree with regard to the knife Sage, holds the knife is stronger than service vessels, as even though it has no inside it consecrates And Sage, holds the knife is not stronger than service vessels,
llm_translation: And there are those who say, Rav Papa said: "Serving vessels, one does not sanctify except with intent." And here, regarding a knife, the Master's dispute is: one opinion holds that a knife is considered a vessel. Even though it does not have an interior for sanctification. And the other opinion holds that a knife is not considered a vessel for sanctification.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שחטה חוץ לזמנה וחוץ למקומה קדש הלחם שחטה ונמצאת טריפה לא קדש הלחם
human_translation: slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area, the loaves were consecrated slaughtered and it was discovered an animal with a wound that would have caused it to die within twelve months [ tereifa ], the loaves were not consecrated,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Shechitah outside its time and outside its place, the consecrated bread shechted and found to be treifah is not consecrated bread.

hebrew_text: שחטה ונמצאת בעלת מום ר' אליעזר אומר קידש וחכמים אומרים לא קידש
human_translation: slaughtered and it was discovered a blemished Rabbi Eliezer says: consecrated And the Rabbis say: not consecrated
llm_translation: The slaughter and it is found to have a blemish, Rabbi Eliezer says it is sanctified, and the sages say it is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: שחטה שלא לשמה וכן איל המילואים וכן שני כבשי עצרת ששחטן שלא לשמן לא קדש הלחם:
human_translation: slaughtered not for its sake and likewise, the ram of inauguration and likewise, slaughtered the two sheep Shavuot not for their sake, the loaves were not consecrated.
llm_translation: The slaughter that is not for its sake, and similarly the ram of consecration, and similarly the two lambs of Shavuot that were slaughtered not for their sake, the bread is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מתניתין מני רבי מאיר
human_translation: Whose the mishna? Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Gemara, from the Mishnah of Rabbi Meir.

hebrew_text: דתניא זה הכלל כל שפיסולו קודם שחיטה לא קדש הלחם פיסולו אחר שחיטה קדש הלחם שחטה חוץ לזמנה וחוץ למקומה קדש הלחם שחטה ונמצאת טריפה לא קדש הלחם
human_translation: As it is taught This is the principle: Any which disqualification preceded slaughter, the loaves were not consecrated, its disqualification after slaughter, the loaves were consecrated. slaughtered beyond its time or outside its area, the loaves were consecrated, slaughtered and it was discovered a tereifa , the loaves were not consecrated,
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: This is the principle: any animal whose disqualification occurred before slaughter, the bread is not sanctified. If its disqualification occurred after slaughter, the bread is sanctified. If it was slaughtered outside its designated time or place, the bread is sanctified. If it was slaughtered and found to be a treifah, the bread is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: שחטה ונמצאת בעלת מום רבי אליעזר אומר קדש רבי יהושע אומר לא קדש דברי ר' מאיר
human_translation: slaughtered and it was discovered a blemished Rabbi Eliezer says: consecrated, Rabbi Yehoshua says: not consecrated. the statement of Rabbi Meir,
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Slaughtered and found to have a blemish, Rabbi Eliezer says it is holy, Rabbi Joshua says it is not holy. These are the words of Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יהודה לא נחלקו רבי אליעזר ור' יהושע על ששחטה ונמצאת טריפה שלא קדש ועל חוץ לזמנו שקדש ועל בעל מום שלא קדש ועל מה נחלקו על חוץ למקומו שר' אליעזר אומר קדש ורבי יהושע אומר לא קדש
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua did not disagree with regard to he slaughtered and it was discovered a tereifa , that it was not consecrated; and with regard to beyond its time, that it was consecrated; and with regard to a blemished that it was not consecrated. And with regard to what did they disagree? with regard to outside its area, as Rabbi Eliezer says: was consecrated, and Rabbi Yehoshua says: was not consecrated.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah said: Rabbi Eliezer and Rabbi Yehoshua did not disagree regarding an animal that was slaughtered and found to be a treifah, which was not consecrated, and regarding an animal offered outside its designated time, which was consecrated, and regarding an animal with a blemish that was not consecrated. What did they disagree about? Regarding an animal offered outside its designated place. Rabbi Eliezer says it is consecrated, and Rabbi Yehoshua says it is not consecrated.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אליעזר הואיל וחוץ לזמנו פסול וחוץ למקומו פסול מה חוץ לזמנו קדש אף חוץ למקומו קדש אמר ר' יהושע הואיל וחוץ למקומו פסול ובעל מום פסול מה בעל מום לא קדש אף חוץ למקומו לא קדש
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said: Since beyond its time is disqualified and outside its area is disqualified, just as beyond its time were consecrated, so too outside its area were consecrated. Rabbi Yehoshua said: Since outside its area is disqualified and a blemished is disqualified, just as a blemished were not consecrated, so too outside its area were not consecrated.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Eliezer: Since outside of its time is invalid, and outside of its place is invalid, just as outside of its time is holy, so too outside of its place is holy. Said Rabbi Yehoshua: Since outside of its place is invalid, and a blemished animal is invalid, just as a blemished animal is not holy, so too outside of its place is not holy.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי אליעזר אני דמיתיהו לחוץ לזמנו ואתה דמיתו לבעל מום נראה למי דומה אם דומה לחוץ לזמנו נדוננו מחוץ לזמנו אם דומה לבעל מום נדוננו מבעל מום
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer said to him: I compared to beyond its time, and you compared it to a blemished Let us consider to which it is similar. If it is similar to beyond its time, we will deduce its from beyond its time. If it is similar to a blemished we will deduce its from a blemished
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Eliezer, "I compare him to one outside his time, and you compare him to a blemished animal. To whom does he appear similar? If he appears similar to one outside his time, we shall judge him as one outside his time. If he appears similar to a blemished animal, we shall judge him as a blemished animal."

hebrew_text: התחיל רבי אליעזר לדון דנין פסול מחשבה מפסול מחשבה ואין דנין פסול מחשבה מפסול הגוף
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer began to reason: We deduce a disqualification intention from a disqualification intention, And we do not deduce a disqualification intention from a disqualification the body
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer began to adjudicate: "Invalid thought from invalid thought, and one does not adjudicate invalid thought from invalid body."

hebrew_text: התחיל רבי יהושע לדון דנין פסול שאין בו כרת מפסול שאין בו כרת ואל יוכיח חוץ לזמנו שפסול שיש בו כרת ועוד נדוננו משלא לשמו שפסול מחשבה ואין בו כרת
human_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua began to reason We deduce a disqualification that does not excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ], from a disqualification that does not karet , beyond its time should as proof, as a disqualification that karet . And furthermore, let us deduce from not for its sake, as a disqualification intention and does not karet ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehoshua began to adjudicate cases of disqualification: if it lacks karet, it is disqualified; if it lacks karet, it is disqualified. And one should not argue beyond its time, for if it is disqualified due to having karet, and furthermore, it is adjudicated from the time it was not for its sake, it is disqualified due to intent, and it lacks karet.

hebrew_text: ושתק רבי אליעזר
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer was silent,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer remained silent.

hebrew_text: ורבי מאיר מאי שנא שחטה ונמצאת טריפה דהוי פסולו קודם שחיטה ומאי שנא שחטה ונמצאת בעלת מום דלא הוי פסולו קודם שחיטה
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, what is different he slaughtered it and it was discovered to be a tereifa that it is its disqualification precedes slaughter, and what is different he slaughtered it and it was discovered to be a blemished that it is not its disqualification precedes slaughter,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir, what is the difference between if it was slaughtered and found to be a treifah, it is considered invalid before the slaughter, and what is the difference between if it was slaughtered and found to have a blemish, it is not considered invalid before the slaughter.

hebrew_text: בדוקין שבעין ואליבא דר' עקיבא דאמר אם עלו לא ירדו ורבי יהושע כי אמר רבי עקיבא אם עלו לא ירדו בפסולא דגופיה אבל לקדושי לחם לא
human_translation: to on the cornea of the eye, and in accordance with of Rabbi Akiva, who said if they ascended they shall not descend, And Rabbi Yehoshua, When Rabbi Akiva said if they ascended they shall not descend, disqualification of itself, But with regard to the consecration of the loaves not
llm_translation: Examiners of the eyes, and according to the opinion of Rabbi Akiva who said: "If they ascended, they do not descend," and Rabbi Yehoshua, for when Rabbi Akiva said: "If they ascended, they do not descend," it is in regard to its own disqualification, but for the sanctification of the bread, no.

hebrew_text: איתמר חטאת ששחטה חוץ לזמנה אם עלתה לא תרד חוץ למקומה רבא אמר תרד רבה אמר לא תרד
human_translation: was stated: a sin offering that one slaughtered beyond its time, if it ascended it shall not descend. outside its area, Rava says: It shall descend Rabba says: It shall not descend.
llm_translation: It was stated: If one slaughtered the sin-offering outside its designated time, if its blood ascended, it shall not descend. Outside its designated place, Rava said it shall descend, Rabah said it shall not descend.

hebrew_text: רבא כרבי יהושע ורבה כרבי אליעזר
human_translation: Rava in accordance with Rabbi Yehoshua, And Rabba in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer,
llm_translation: Rava is like Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbah is like Rabbi Eliezer.

hebrew_text: והדר ביה רבה לגביה דרבא מדהדר ביה רבי אליעזר לגביה דרבי יהושע
human_translation: And Rabba retracted in favor of of Rava since Rabbi Eliezer retracted in favor of of Rabbi Yehoshua,
llm_translation: And he returned to him, Rabah to Rabba, adorning him; Rabbi Eliezer to Rabbi Joshua.

hebrew_text: ואיכא דאמרי אף על גב דהדר ביה ר' אליעזר לגביה דרבי יהושע רבה לגביה דרבא לא הדר ביה התם הוא דקאמר ליה נדוננו משלא לשמו אבל הכא אי דיינת ליה משלא לשמו אם עלתה לא תרד:
human_translation: And there are who say: Even though Rabbi Eliezer retracted in favor of of Rabbi Yehoshua, Rabba did not retract in favor of of Rava, there, said to him: Let us deduce its from not for its sake. But here, if you deduce its from not for its sake, if it ascended it shall not descend.
llm_translation: And there are those who say, even though Rabbi Eliezer retracted in front of Rabbi Yehoshua, Rabba retracted in front of Rava did not retract there, that is where he said to him, "We may judge him unfavorably for his own sake, but here, if you judge him unfavorably for his own sake, if it goes up, it will not come down."

hebrew_text: שחטה שלא לשמה [וכו']: אמר רב פפא שבק תנא דידן איל נזיר דשכיח ונקיט איל המילואים ותנא דידן עיקר מילתא נקט:
human_translation: slaughtered not for its sake, Rav Pappa said the tanna of our omit nazirite’s ram, which is common and teach the ram of the inauguration And the tanna of our He taught the primary matter,
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: "Shechitah shelo lishmah etc.: Amar Rav Papa shavak tanah didan eil nazir dishchich v'nakit eil hamiluim v'tanah didan ikar milta nakat."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הנסכים שקדשו בכלי ונמצא זבח פסול אם יש זבח אחר יקריבו עמו ואם לאו יפסלו בלינה:
human_translation: the libations were sanctified in vessel and the offering was discovered unfit, if there is another offering should be sacrificed with and if not, they should be disqualified by left overnight,
llm_translation: Mishnah: The libations that were sanctified in a vessel, and a blemish was found in the sacrifice, if there is another sacrifice, they shall offer it with it; and if not, they shall render them invalid through overnight stay.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר זעירי אין הנסכים מתקדשין אלא בשחיטת הזבח מאי טעמא אמר קרא (ויקרא כג, לז) זבח ונסכים
human_translation: Ze’eiri says: Libations are sanctified only upon the slaughter of the offering. What is the reason verse states: a sacrifice, and libations,
llm_translation: Gemara: Zairi said, "The libations are not sanctified except through the slaughter of the sacrifice." What is the reason? It is said in the verse (Leviticus 23:37), "Sacrifice and libations."

hebrew_text: תנן הנסכים שקדשו בכלי ונמצא זבח פסול אם יש זבח אחר יקרבו עמו ואם לאו יפסלו בלינה
human_translation: we learned the libations were sanctified in vessel and the offering was discovered unfit, if there is another offering should be sacrificed with and if not, they should be disqualified by left overnight,
llm_translation: We have learned: The libations that were sanctified in a vessel, and a blemish was found in the sacrifice, if there is another sacrifice, they shall offer it together with it, but if not, they shall render it invalid through overnight stay.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו דאיפסיל בשחיטה לא דאיפסיל בזריקה
human_translation: What, is it not where became unfit through slaughter, No, that became unfit through the sprinkling
llm_translation: What is the negative of disqualification in slaughter? Not the negative of disqualification in sprinkling.

hebrew_text: כמאן כרבי דאמר שני דברים המתירין מעלין זה בלא זה
human_translation: In accordance with whose in accordance with Rabbi who said: two factors that permit they can each elevate without the other.
llm_translation: As according to Rabbi who said two things that permit, they ascend one without the other.

hebrew_text: אפילו תימא ר' אלעזר בר' שמעון הכא במאי עסקינן כגון שקיבל דמן בכוס ונשפך
human_translation: Even you say Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, Here, we are dealing with where collected its blood in the cup but spilled
llm_translation: Even if you say, "Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon," here, what are we dealing with? Such as when one received blood in a cup and it spilled.

hebrew_text: ור' אלעזר ברבי שמעון סבר לה כוותיה דאבוה דאמר כל העומד לזרוק כזרוק דמי
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, holds in accordance with his father as said: Any that stands to be sprinkled is considered as sprinkled.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, holds in accordance with the opinion of his father who said, "Anyone who stands to throw is considered as one who has thrown."

hebrew_text: אמר מר אם יש זבח אחר יקרבו עמו והא אמר רב חסדא שמן שהפרישו לשום מנחה זה פסול לשום מנחה אחרת אמר רבי ינאי לב בית דין מתנה עליהם אם הוצרכו הוצרכו ואם לאו יהו לזבח אחר
human_translation: The Master said If there is another offering should be sacrificed with But didn’t Rav Ḥisda say oil that separated for the sake of this meal offering unfit for the sake of another meal offering? Rabbi Yannai says: The court tacitly stipulates concerning if they were required they were required But if not, they should be another offering.
llm_translation: The Master said: If there is another sacrifice, they shall bring it with him. But didn't Rav Ḥisda say: Oil that was designated for one meal offering is invalid for another meal offering? Rabbi Yannai said: The court has authority over them. If they needed it, they needed it, and if not, let it be for another sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אי הכי שמן נמי שמן גופה דמנחה הוא
human_translation: If that is so, the oil as well? The oil is of the meal offering itself
llm_translation: If so, oil is also oil, it is the essence of the Minchah.

hebrew_text: וליתנו עליהן דניפקו לחולין גזירה שמא יאמרו מוציאין מכלי שרת לחול
human_translation: let stipulate concerning them that they shall emerge to non-sacred decree lest they will say: One may remove from service vessels to non-sacred.
llm_translation: And they did not establish regarding them the vessels of the Temple that they may be taken out to secular use, due to a decree lest they say people may say they are taken out from the holy vessels to secular use.

hebrew_text: השתא נמי גזירה שמא יאמרו נסכים שהפרישן לשום זבח זה כשרין לשום זבח אחר
human_translation: now as well, decree lest say: Libations that one separated for the sake of one offering are fit for the sake of a different offering
llm_translation: At present also, it is a decree lest they say libations that one separated for the sake of this sacrifice are valid for another sacrifice.

hebrew_text: התני מתתיה בן יהודה כגון שהיה זבח זבוח באותה שעה
human_translation: Mattitya ben Yehuda teaches where there was offering slaughtered at the same time.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: Matitya ben Yehuda, for example, who was slaughtering a sacrifice at that time.

hebrew_text: אבל אין זבח זבוח באותה שעה מאי נפסל בלינה אדתני סיפא אם לאו יפסלו בלינה ליפלוג וליתני בדידה במה דברים אמורים שהיתה זבח זבוח באותה שעה אבל אין זבח זבוח באותה שעה לא
human_translation: but there is not offering slaughtered at the same time, what disqualified by left overnight. rather than teaching the latter clause And if not they should be disqualified by left overnight; let distinguish and teach within the itself In what is this statement said? where there was offering slaughtered at the same time. But if there is not offering slaughtered at the same time, not
llm_translation: But a sacrifice is not sacrificed at that time. What is the disqualification? We learned in the latter clause: If not, they are disqualified by overnight stay. Let it be taught separately: In what case are these words said? When a sacrifice was sacrificed at that time. But a sacrifice is not sacrificed at that time, no.

hebrew_text: הכי נמי קא אמר במה דברים אמורים שהיה זבח זבוח באותה שעה אבל אין זבח זבוח באותה שעה נעשה כמי שנפסלו בלינה ופסולין
human_translation: That is also what is saying: In what is this statement said? where there was offering slaughtered at the same time. But if there is not offering slaughtered at the same time, are considered as if they were disqualified by left overnight, and disqualified.
llm_translation: So too, it is saying: In what case are these words said? That if one slaughtered a sacrifice at that moment, but if one did not slaughter a sacrifice at that moment, it becomes like those that were disqualified at night and are disqualified.

hebrew_text: ומי אית ליה לרבי שמעון (בן אלעזר) לב בית דין מתנה עליהן
human_translation: But does Rabbi Shimon ben Elazar, accept the court tacitly stipulates concerning
llm_translation: And is there for Rabbi Shimon (ben Elazar) a heart in the court to gift upon them.

hebrew_text: והא אמר רב אידי בר אבין אמר רב עמרם אמר רבי יצחק אמר רבי יוחנן תמידין שלא הוצרכו לציבור לדברי רבי שמעון אין נפדין תמימים לדברי חכמים נפדין תמימים
human_translation: But didn’t Rav Idi bar Avin say Rav Amram said Rabbi Yitzḥak said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: daily offerings that were not needed for the public, According to the statement of Rabbi Shimon, they may not be redeemed unblemished, according to the statement of the Rabbis, they may be redeemed unblemished,
llm_translation: And behold, Rav Idi bar Avin said in the name of Rav Amram who said in the name of Rabbi Yitzchak who said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: "Regular animals that were not needed for the public, according to the words of Rabbi Shimon, are not redeemed; according to the words of the Sages, they are redeemed."

hebrew_text: שאני התם דאית להו תקנתא ברעייה:
human_translation: it is different there, because they have arrangement through graze
llm_translation: There is a difference there, for it has a remedy in its vicinity.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ ולד תודה ותמורתה הפריש תודה ואבדה והפריש אחרת תחתיה אינה טעונה לחם שנאמר (ויקרא ז, יב) והקריב על זבח התודה התודה טעונה לחם ולא ולדה ולא חילופה ולא תמורתה טעונין לחם:
human_translation: the offspring a thanks offering, or its substitute; one separated a thanks offering and it was lost and he separated another in its stead, does not require loaves. as it is stated: then he shall sacrifice with the thanks offering the thanks offering requires loaves, but neither its offspring, nor its replacement, nor its substitute requires loaves.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A thanksgiving offering and its exchange, if the thanksgiving offering was separated and lost, and another was separated in its place, it does not require bread, as it is stated (Leviticus 7:12), "And he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour soaked." The thanksgiving offering requires bread, but not its offspring, nor its substitute, they do not require bread.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן מהו אומר תודה יקריב (אם על תודה יקריב) מנין למפריש תודתו ואבדה והפריש אחרת תחתיה ונמצאת הראשונה והרי שתיהן עומדות מנין שאיזה מהן שירצה יקריב ולחמה עמה תלמוד לומר התודה יקריב
human_translation: The Sages taught What is it states: He sacrifices for a thanks offering? If he sacrifices for a thanks offering. From where with regard to one separated his thanks offering and it was lost and he separated another in its stead, and the first animal was found, and they both stand from where that he may sacrifice whichever of them he wishes, and its loaves with it? The verse states he shall sacrifice the thanks offering,
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: What does one say regarding a thanksgiving offering (if one should bring a thanksgiving offering)? From where do we derive that if one designated his thanksgiving offering and it became lost, and he designated another one in its place, and then the first one is found, both of them stand? From where do we derive that he may bring whichever one he desires, and its bread with it? The verse teaches: "The thanksgiving offering he shall bring" (Leviticus 7:12).

hebrew_text: יכול שתהא שניה טעונה לחם תלמוד לומר יקריבנו אחד ולא שנים אחר שריבה הכתוב ומיעט מנין לרבות ולדות וחליפות ותמורות להקרבה תלמוד לומר (ויקרא ז, יב) אם על תודה יכול יהו טעונות לחם תלמוד לאמר והקריב על זבח התודה תודה טעונה לחם ולא ולדה ולא חילופה ולא תמורתה טעונין לחם
human_translation: might that the second requires loaves the verse states: “He sacrifices it,” one but not two. Since the verse included and excluded from where includes offspring, replacements, and substitutes for sacrifice? the verse states: “If for a thanks offering,” might they would require loaves the verse states: “Then he shall sacrifice with the thanks offering,” thanks offering requires loaves, but neither its offspring, nor its replacement, nor its substitute requires loaves.
llm_translation: I can translate the text for you: Talmudic text: "Could it be that a second offering requires bread? The Talmud teaches us to say that 'he shall offer it' referring to one offering and not two. This is because the Scripture limited the offering and excluded others. How do we know to include thanksgiving offerings, peace offerings, sin offerings, and guilt offerings for requiring bread with them? The Talmud teaches us to say, 'If offered for thanksgiving' then they require bread. This is as it says, 'And he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened cakes mingled with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil, and cakes mingled with oil, of fine flour soaked' (Leviticus 7:12). Thanksgiving requires bread, but not a vow offering, not a freewill offering, not a substitution offering, and not a redemption offering; these do not require bread."

hebrew_text: שלח רב חנינא משמיה דרבי יוחנן לא שנו אלא לאחר כפרה אבל לפני כפרה טעונין לחם
human_translation: Rav Ḥanina sent in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: taught only after atonement, but before atonement, they require loaves.
llm_translation: Sent Rav Chanina in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: They only taught this regarding after atonement, but before atonement, bread is required.

hebrew_text: הוי בה רב עמרם אהייא אילימא אחליפי תודת חובה אי לפני כפרה תנינא אי לאחר כפרה תנינא
human_translation: Rav Amram discussed this To which If we say to the replacement for an obligatory thanks offering, If before atonement we learned if after atonement we learned
llm_translation: Be with Rav Amram, Ahaiya. If you say, "exchange a thanksgiving offering," we have learned - if before atonement, we have learned; if after atonement, we have learned.

hebrew_text: אלא אחליפי תודה נדבה בין לפני כפרה בין לאחר כפרה טעונות לחם מרבה בתודות הוא
human_translation: Rather, to the replacement for a voluntary thanks offering. whether before atonement or after atonement, require loaves, is increases thanks offerings.
llm_translation: Rather, the thanksgiving offering, whether before atonement or after atonement, requires leavened bread in abundance.

hebrew_text: אלא אולד תודה נדבה בין לפני כפרה בין לאחר כפרה אין טעונין לחם מותר דתודה היא אלא אולד תודה חובה לפני כפרה טעון לחם לאחר כפרה אין טעון לחם
human_translation: Rather, to the offspring of a voluntary thanks offering. whether before atonement or after atonement, do not require loaves, this is a leftover of the thanks offering, Rather, to the offspring of an obligatory thanks offering. before atonement, it requires loaves, after atonement, it does not require loaves.
llm_translation: Rather, a thanksgiving offering, whether before atonement or after atonement, does not require bread. For it is a thanksgiving offering. Rather, a thanksgiving offering that is obligatory before atonement requires bread, but after atonement does not require bread.

hebrew_text: מאי קמ"ל דקסבר ר' יוחנן אדם מתכפר בשבח הקדש הוי בה נמי אביי כי האי גוונא
human_translation: what is teaching us that Rabbi Yoḥanan holds: A person achieves atonement with the enhancement of consecrated Abaye also discusses in this way
llm_translation: What is the teaching that Rabbi Yochanan holds that a person is atoned for through the praise of the Holy One, blessed be He? Abaye also holds this opinion in this matter.

hebrew_text: איתמר נמי אמר רב יצחק בר יוסף אמר רבי יוחנן חילופי תודה נדבה בין לפני כפרה בין לאחר כפרה טעונה לחם מרבה בתודות הוא ולד תודה נדבה בין לפני כפרה בין לאחר כפרה אין טעון לחם מותר דתודה הוא וולד תודה חובה לפני כפרה טעונין לחם לאחר כפרה אין טעונין לחם
human_translation: was also stated: Rav Yitzḥak bar Yosef says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: the replacement for a voluntary thanks offering, whether before atonement or after atonement, requires loaves, is increases thanks offerings. The offspring of a voluntary thanks offering, whether before atonement or after atonement, does not require loaves, is a leftover of the thanks offering. And the offspring of an obligatory thanks offering, before atonement, it requires loaves, after atonement, it does not require loaves.
llm_translation: It was also stated: Rav Yitzchak bar Yosef said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: An exchange of a thanksgiving offering, whether before atonement or after atonement, requires bread in abundance. And a child of a thanksgiving offering, whether before atonement or after atonement, does not require bread. If it is a voluntary thanksgiving offering, whether before atonement or after atonement, it does not require bread. But if it is an obligatory thanksgiving offering, before atonement, it requires bread; after atonement, it does not require bread.

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל כל שבחטאת מתה בתודה אין טעונה לחם כל שבחטאת רועה בתודה טעונה לחם
human_translation: Shmuel says: any in which a sin offering to die, with a thanks offering, it does not require loaves. any in which a sin offering graze with a thanks offering, it requires loaves.
llm_translation: Said Shmuel: Any animal offered as a sin-offering that dies before being sacrificed in a thanksgiving-offering does not require bread. Any animal offered as a sin-offering that grazes after being designated in a thanksgiving-offering requires bread.

hebrew_text: מתיב רב עמרם מהו אומר (ויקרא ז, יב) התודה יקריב מנין למפריש תודתו ואבדה והפריש אחרת תחתיה ונמצאת הראשונה והרי שתיהן עומדות מנין שאיזו מהן שירצה יקריב ולחמה עמה תלמוד לאמר התודה יקריב יכול תהא שניה טעונה לחם תלמוד לאמר יקריבנו אחד ולא שנים
human_translation: Rav Amram raises an objection What is it states: He sacrifices for a thanks offering? From where one who separated his thanks offering and it was lost and he separated another in its stead, and the first animal was found, and they both stand from where that he may sacrifice whichever of them he wishes, and its loaves with it? The verse states: He sacrifices for a thanks offering. might that the second requires loaves The verse states: “He sacrifices it,” one but not two.
llm_translation: Rav Amram raised an objection: What does it mean (Leviticus 7:12), "He shall offer it for thanksgiving"? From where do we derive that one who separates his thanksgiving offering and it becomes lost, and he separates another in its place, and then the first one is found, both of them stand? From where do we derive that whichever of them he wishes, he may offer, and its bread with it? The verse teaches to say, "He shall offer it for thanksgiving." I might have thought that the second one requires bread. The verse teaches to say, "He shall offer it," one and not two.

hebrew_text: ואילו גבי חטאת כי האי גונא רועה דתנן הפריש חטאתו ואבדה והפריש אחרת תחתיה ונמצאת הראשונה והרי שתיהן עומדות מתכפר באחת מהן ושניה תמות דברי רבי וחכמים אומרים אין חטאת מתה אלא שנמצאת לאחר שנתכפרו בעלים הא קודם שנתכפרו בעלים רועה
human_translation: Whereas with regard to a sin offering in a case like this, is graze, as we learned one separated his sin offering and it was lost, and he separated another in its stead, and the first was found, and both stand achieves atonement with one of them and the second shall die; the statement of Rabbi And the Rabbis say: A sin offering die only was found after its owner achieved atonement. that before the owner achieved atonement, graze.
llm_translation: And regarding the sin offering, for this case of theft, as we learned: If one designated his sin offering and it got lost, and he designated another one in its place, and then the first one is found, both of them stand. Atonement is achieved with one of them, and the other shall die. These are the words of Rabbi. The Sages say: The sin offering does not die until it is found after its owners have achieved atonement. Now, if it is found before its owners have achieved atonement, it grazes.

hebrew_text: שמואל כרבי סבירא ליה דאמר אבודה בשעת הפרשה מתה
human_translation: Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi who said: lost at the time of the separation die.
llm_translation: Shmuel agrees with Rabbi Sevira, who said: "An item lost during the time of separation is considered dead."

hebrew_text: אלא רועה לרבי היכי משכחת לה כדרבי אושעיא דאמר רבי אושעיא הפריש שתי חטאות לאחריות מתכפר באיזה מהן שירצה והשניה תרעה
human_translation: But how can you find graze according to Rabbi like that of Rabbi Oshaya, as Rabbi Oshaya says: one separated two sin offerings, as a guarantee he may achieve atonement with whichever of them he wishes, and the second shall graze.
llm_translation: Instead, how does Rabbi find support for his opinion? Like Rabbi Oshaya, for Rabbi Oshaya said: One who separates two sin-offerings for atonement, may achieve atonement through whichever one he desires, and the other one will graze.

hebrew_text: והא גבי תודה כי האי גוונא אין טעונה לחם אלא שמואל כרבי שמעון סבירא ליה דאמר חמש חטאות מתות
human_translation: But in a case like this a thanks offering, does not require loaves. Rather, Shmuel holds in accordance with Rabbi Shimon, who said: five sin offerings die;
llm_translation: And this regarding the thanksgiving offering, for this type does not require bread, rather Shmuel holds like Rabbi Shimon who holds that five sin-offerings are liable to death.

hebrew_text: והא רועה לרבי שמעון לית ליה כלל
human_translation: But Rabbi Shimon does not hold any graze.
llm_translation: And behold, the shepherd to Rabbi Shimon does not have at all.

hebrew_text: שמואל נמי חדא קאמר כל שבחטאת מתה בתודה אין טעונה לחם מאי קמ"ל לאפוקי מדרבי יוחנן דאמר אדם מתכפר בשבח הקדש קמשמע לן דלא
human_translation: Shmuel also stated one any in which a sin offering to die, with a thanks offering, it does not require loaves. What is teaching us? to exclude of Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said: A person achieves atonement with the enhancement of consecrated teaches us that not
llm_translation: Shmuel also said one thing: Any sin-offering that dies in a state of thanksgiving does not require bread. What does he come to teach us? To exclude the opinion of Rabbi Yochanan, who said: A person achieves atonement through the praise of the Holy One. This teaches us that it is not so.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אבא זו תודה וזו לחמה אבד הלחם מביא לחם אחר אבדה תודה אינו מביא תודה אחרת מאי טעמא לחם לגלל תודה ואין תודה לגלל לחם
human_translation: Rabbi Abba says: This is a thanks offering and this is its loaves, the loaves were lost, he brings other loaves. the thanks offering was lost, he does not bring another thanks offering, What is the reason The loaves are on account of the thanks offering; But the thanks offering is not on account of the loaves;
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba: This is a thanksgiving offering, and this is a bread offering. If the bread is lost, one may bring another bread offering; if the thanksgiving offering is lost, one may not bring another thanksgiving offering. What is the reason? Bread can substitute for a thanksgiving offering, but a thanksgiving offering cannot substitute for bread.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא הפריש מעות לתודתו
human_translation: And Rava says: separated money for his thanks offering
llm_translation: And Rava said: "One should separate money for his thanksgiving offering."

hebrew_text: ונתותרו מביא בהן לחם ללחמי תודה ונתותרו אין מביא בהן תודה
human_translation: and remained he brings, with loaves for the loaves of the thanks offering and remained he may not bring a thanks offering with
llm_translation: And it was permitted to bring with them bread for the thanksgiving offerings, and it was permitted, one does not bring thanksgiving offerings.

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא אילימא משום דרב כהנא דאמר רב כהנא מנין ללחמי תודה שנקראו תודה שנאמר (ויקרא ז, יב) והקריב על זבח התודה חלות מצות אי הכי איפכא נמי לחם איקרי תודה תודה לא איקרי לחם
human_translation: What is the reason? If we say due to of Rav Kahana, As Rav Kahana said: From where the loaves of a thanks offering are called a thanks offering? that is stated “Then he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanks offering loaves” If that is so, the opposite also The loaves are called a thanks offering, the thanks offering is not called loaves.
llm_translation: What is the reason? If you say it is because of Rav Kahana, for Rav Kahana said, "From where do we derive that the loaves of the thanksgiving offering are called 'thanksgiving'? As it is stated (Leviticus 7:12), 'And he shall offer with the sacrifice of thanksgiving unleavened loaves.' If so, it should also be reversed, calling bread 'thanksgiving' and not calling thanksgiving 'thanksgiving.'

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא הפריש תודתו ואבדה וחזר והפריש אחרת תחתיה ואבדה וחזר והפריש אחרת תחתיה ונמצאו הראשונות והרי שלשתן עומדות נתכפר בראשונה שניה אינה טעונה לחם שלישית טעונה לחם
human_translation: And Rava says: one separated his thanks offering and it was lost, and he again separated another in its stead, and it was lost, and he again separated another in its stead, and the first were found, and the three of them stand he achieved atonement with the first the second does not require loaves, the third requires loaves,
llm_translation: And Rava said: If one designated his thanksgiving offering and it got lost, and then he designated another one in its place and it got lost, and then he designated another one in its place, and the first ones were found, behold, all three are standing. The first one atones, the second one does not require bread, and the third one requires bread.

hebrew_text: נתכפר בשלישית שניה אינה טעונה לחם ראשונה טעונה לחם באמצעית שתיהן אין טעונות לחם אביי אמר אפילו נתכפר באחת מהן שתיהן אין טעונות לחם כולהו חליפין דהדדי נינהו
human_translation: he achieved atonement with the third, the second does not require loaves, the first requires loaves, with the middle, both of them, do not require loaves, Abaye says: Even if he achieved atonement with one of them, two do not require loaves, they are all replacements for one another.
llm_translation: Atoned for with the third, the second does not require bread, the first requires bread. In the middle, both do not require bread. Abaye said: Even if atoned for with one of them, both do not require bread. All these are interchangeable with each other.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי זירא וכן לענין חטאות הפריש חטאתו ואבדה והפריש אחרת תחתיה ואבדה והפריש אחרת תחתיה ונמצאו הראשונות והרי שלשתן עומדות נתכפר בראשונה שניה תמות שלישית תרעה
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira says: And so for the matter of sin offerings: one separated his sin offering and it was lost, and he separated another in its stead, and it was lost, and he separated another in its stead, and the first were found, and the three of them stand he achieved atonement with the first, the second is to die, the third is graze
llm_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: And similarly regarding sin offerings, he separated his sin offering and it got lost, and he separated another one in its place and it got lost, and he found the first ones, and behold all three are standing, the first one atoned for, the second one shall die, the third one shall graze.

hebrew_text: נתכפר בשלישית שניה תמות וראשונה תרעה נתכפר באמצעית שתיהן ימותו אביי אמר אפילו נתכפר באחת מהן שתיהן ימותו כולהו חליפין דהדדי נינהו
human_translation: he achieved atonement with the third, the second is to die, and the first is graze, he achieved atonement with the middle, both of them, are to die, Abaye says: Even if he achieved atonement with one of them, two are to die, they are all replacements for one another.
llm_translation: Atoned in the third, the second will die, and the first will graze. Atoned in the middle, both will die. Abaye said: Even if atoned in one of them, both will die. They are interchangeable with each other.

hebrew_text: מאי וכן מהו דתימא התם הוא דאיכא למימר מרבה בתודות הוא אבל הכא דליכא למימר מרבה בחטאות הוא אימא לא קמ"ל
human_translation: What And so lest you say there, since it can be said is one who increases thanks offerings; but here, since it cannot be said is one who increases sin offerings, I would say not teaches us
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "and similarly"? What might you say, that there it is possible to say it refers to increasing thanksgiving offerings, but here, where it is not possible to say it refers to increasing sin offerings, say no.

hebrew_text: תני רבי חייא תודה שנתערבה בתמורתה ומתה אחת מהן חבירתה אין לה תקנה היכי נעביד נקריב לחם בהדה דלמא תמורה היא לא נקריב לחם בהדה דלמא תודה היא
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya teaches: a thanks offering that was intermingled with its substitute, and one of them died, the other has no remedy. What should we do? we bring loaves with it, perhaps it is a substitute, we do not bring loaves with it, perhaps it is the thanks offering,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya taught: If a thanksgiving offering became mixed up with its exchange, and one of them died, its companion has no remedy. What shall we do? Shall we offer the bread with it together? Perhaps it is an exchange, so we should not offer the bread with it together. Perhaps it is a thanksgiving offering.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי אי דאמר עלי לא סגיא דלא מייתי ליה בהמה אחרינא ולחם ולימא אי הך דקיימא תמורה היא הא תודה והא לחמה אי הך דקיימא תודה היא הא לחמה והא תיהוי אחריות
human_translation: What are the circumstances If said: upon me not sufficient if he does not bring another animal and loaves, and says: If the one remaining is the substitute, this be the thanks offering and these its loaves; if the one remaining is the thanks offering, these its loaves, and let this be its guarantee,
llm_translation: How is it similar? If he says, "Upon me it is not incumbent to bring him another animal, and bread," and let him say, "If this is considered an exchange, then it is a thanksgiving offering, and if this is considered a thanksgiving offering, then it is bread," and there will be liability.

hebrew_text: לא צריכא דאמר הרי זו
human_translation: No, necessary which said: This is
llm_translation: Not necessary, as he said, "Behold, this."

hebrew_text: סימן למודי"ם מיד"ת על"ה שי"ש שכ"ן דדמ"ה דא"י חל"ש מות"ר תמור"ה בחו"ץ חזקי"ה הפרי"ש חטא"ת לאח"ר יות"ר
human_translation: a mnemonic Lemudim , middat , ala , shish , sheken , dedamah , de’i , Ḥalash , leftover; substitute; outside; Ḥizkiyya; separated a sin offering; for a guarantee.
llm_translation: Signs for the letters Mem, Vav, Dalet, Yud, Tav, Ayin, Lamed, Hei, Shin, Yud, Shin, Shin, Kuf, Nun, Dalet, Dalet, Mem, Hei, Aleph, Shin, Yud, Shin, Chet, Kuf, Nun, Dalet, Dalet, Aleph, Yud, Chet, Lamed, Shin, Mem, Vav, Tav, Vav, Resh, Tav, Hei, Bet, Chet, Vav, Tzadi, Chet, Yud, Hei, Hei, Chet, Zayin, Kuf, Yud, Aleph, Hei, Chet, Lamed, Shin, Mem, Vav, Tav, Vav, Resh.

hebrew_text: אמרו למדין לפני רבי וליתי לחם ולימא אי הך דקיימא תודה היא הא לחמה אי לא ליפוק לחולין אמר להו וכי מכניסין חולין לעזרה
human_translation: Lemedin , said before Rabbi But Let him bring loaves and let him say: If this that is extant is the thanks offering, these are its loaves, if not, let go out to non-sacred said to him: and do we bring non-sacred into the courtyard?
llm_translation: They said to bring before Rabbi and let him bring bread and say, "If this is considered a thanksgiving offering, then it is its bread. If not, let it be taken out to the secular area." He said to them, "Do we bring secular items into the Temple courtyard?"

hebrew_text: וליתי בהמה ולחם ולימא אי הך דקיימא תמורה היא הא תודה והא לחמה אי הך דקיימא תודה היא הא לחמה והא תיהוי שלמים אמר להו משום דקא ממעט באכילה דשלמים
human_translation: And let him bring animal with loaves and let him say: If this that is extant is the substitute, this the thanks offering and these its loaves. If this that is extant is the thanks offering, these its loaves, and this should be a peace offering, said to him: because he reduces for consuming the peace offering,
llm_translation: Let him bring an animal and bread, and let him say: If this one is considered a vow-offering, then let it be a thanksgiving-offering, and if this one is considered a thanksgiving-offering, then let it be a vow-offering. He said to them: Because he is diminishing in the eating of the thanksgiving-offering.

hebrew_text: אמר לוי לרבי וליתי בהמה ולחם ולימא אי הך דקיימא תמורה היא הא תודה והא לחמה ואי האי דקיימא תודה היא הא לחמה והא תיהוי מותר דתודה אמר ליה כמדומה אני שאין לו מוח בקדקדו
human_translation: Levi said to Rabbi And let him bring animal with loaves and let him say: If this that is extant is the substitute, this the thanks offering and these its loaves. And if that that is extant is the thanks offering, these its loaves and this will be the leftover of the thanks offering, said to him: It seems to me that he has no brain in his skull.
llm_translation: Levi said to Rabbi, "Let him bring an animal and bread, and let him say, 'If this is a fulfillment of a vow, let it be a thanksgiving offering; if this is a thanksgiving offering, let it be a fulfillment of a vow.' Rabbi said to him, 'It is as if he has no brain in his skull.'"

hebrew_text: וכי מפרישין תחלה למותרות
human_translation: And does one separate as a leftover ab initio ?
llm_translation: And when do they separate initially for permissible items?

hebrew_text: יתיב רבי יצחק בר שמואל בר מרתא קמיה דרב נחמן ויתיב וקאמר ולייתי בהמה ולחם ולימא אי הך דקיימא תמורה היא הא תודה והא לחמה ואי הך דקיימא תודה היא הא לחמה והא תהוי תמורה
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Shmuel bar Marta was sitting before Rav Naḥman, and he was sitting and saying: And let him bring animal with loaves and let him say: If this that is extant is the substitute, this the thanks offering and these its loaves. And if this that is extant is the thanks offering, these its loaves and this will be a substitute,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yitzhak son of Samuel son of Marta sat before Rav Nahman, and he sat and said, "Let him bring an animal and bread, and let him say, 'If this is a Temurah, then this is a Todah, and if this is a Todah, then this is a Temurah.'"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה עני מרי ארבעין בכתפיה וכשר
human_translation: said to him: Answer me, my Master: forty on his shoulders, and fit
llm_translation: He said to him: "A poor person has forty coins on his shoulder, and it is valid."

hebrew_text: רב עילא חלש על לגביה אביי ורבנן ויתבי וקא אמרי אם איתא לדר' יוחנן דאמר חוץ לחומת העזרה קדוש לייתי לחם ולותבה חוץ לחומת העזרה ולימא אי הך דקיימא תודה היא הא לחמה ואי לא ליפוק לחולין
human_translation: Rav Ila took ill, Abaye and the Sages went to him, and they were sitting and saying: If accepts of Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said: outside the wall of the courtyard consecrated, let bring loaves and set them outside the wall of the courtyard and let him say: If this that is extant is the thanks offering, these its loaves, and if not, let them go out as non-sacred
llm_translation: Rav Ila became weak on his back, Abaye and the Rabbis were sitting, and they were saying, "If it comes according to Rabbi Yochanan who said, 'Outside the wall of the Temple courtyard, bread is holy and it is brought in, outside the wall of the Temple courtyard,' and he should say, 'If this is a Thanksgiving offering, it is, but if not, it should go out for common use.'"

hebrew_text: משום דאיכא ארבע להניף היכי ליעביד לנפינהו אבראי (ויקרא ז, ל) לפני ה' כתיב גוואי קא מעייל חולין לעזרה הלכך לא אפשר
human_translation: because there are four wave. How would he perform Shall he wave them outside before the Lord” is written inside He brought non-sacred food into the courtyard. Therefore, not possible.
llm_translation: Because there are four to wave, how can one bring the limbs? It is written (Leviticus 7:30), "Before the Lord," indicating that one brings secular items to the Temple courtyard. Therefore, it is not possible.

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב שישא בריה דרב אידי אם איתא לדחזקיה דאמר קדשו ארבעים מתוך שמונים לייתי בהמה ולייתי שמונים בהדה ולימא אי הך דקיימא תודה היא הא נמי תיהוי תודה והא שמונים דתרוייהו אי הך דקיימא תמורה היא הא תודה והא לחמה וליקדשו להו ארבעים מתוך שמונים
human_translation: Rav Sheisha, son of Rav Idi, objects to this: If accepts of Ḥizkiyya, who said Forty of the eighty are consecrated, bring an animal and let him bring eighty loaves with it and say: If this that is extant is the thanks offering, this should also be a thanks offering and these eighty for both of them. if this that is extant is the substitute, this a thanks offering and these its loaves, and let forty of the eighty be consecrated for it.
llm_translation: Challenges him Rav Shisha son of Rav Idi: If it is for the purpose of strengthening his claim that he said, "His sanctity is forty out of eighty, bring an animal and bring eighty with it." And let him say: If this one is established as a thanksgiving offering, this one too shall be a thanksgiving offering. And the eighty, both of them, if this one is established as a vow offering, this one shall be a thanksgiving offering. And let them sanctify forty out of eighty.

hebrew_text: משום דקא ממעט באכילה דארבעים
human_translation: because it reduces consumption of the forty
llm_translation: Because he is diminishing in eating of forty.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אשי לרב כהנא אם איתא לדרבי יוחנן דאמר הפריש חטאת מעוברת וילדה רצה בה מתכפר רצה בוולדה מתכפר לייתי בהמה מעוברת וימתין לה עד שתלד ולייתי שמונים בהדה ולימא אי הך דקיימא תמורה היא הא וולדה תודה היא והא שמונים דתרווייהו ואי הך דקיימא תודה היא הא נמי תודה היא והא שמונים דתרווייהו הוא והאי ליהוי מותר דתודה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: If accepts of Rabbi Yoḥanan, who said: one separated a pregnant a sin offering and it gave birth, he wants he can achieve atonement with it, he wants he can achieve atonement with its offspring; let bring a pregnant animal and wait until it gives birth, and let him bring eighty with it and say: If this that is extant is the substitute, this are thanks offerings, and these eighty for both of them. And if this that is extant is the thanks offering, this a thanks offering, and these eighty for both of them, and let this be the leftover of the thanks offering.
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana, "If it is according to Rabbi Yochanan who said: 'If one designates a pregnant sin-offering and it gives birth, he can achieve atonement with it; if he designates it for its offspring, he can achieve atonement with the offspring,' let him bring a pregnant animal and wait for it to give birth, and bring both together. And let him say: If this one is considered a substitution, then the offspring is a thanksgiving offering; and both together are eighty. And if this one is considered a thanksgiving offering, then this one is also a thanksgiving offering, and both together are eighty. And let it be permitted to him as a thanksgiving offering."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מאן לימא לן דאמר רבי יוחנן אם שיירו משוייר דלמא אם שיירו אינו משוייר והיינו טעמא דרבי יוחנן דאמר אדם מתכפר בשבח הקדש
human_translation: said to him: Who shall say to us that Rabbi Yoḥanan said if he reserved it reserved Perhaps if he reserved it, it is not reserved, and this is the reason that Rabbi Yoḥanan as he said: A person achieves atonement with the enhancement of consecrated
llm_translation: He said to him, who should say to us that Rabbi Yochanan said, "If they left it, it is left, perhaps if they left it, it is not left." And this is the reason of Rabbi Yochanan who said, "A person atones through the praise of the Holy One."

hebrew_text: רבינא איקלע לדמהוריא אמר ליה רב דימי בריה דרב הונא מדמהוריא לרבינא ולייתי בהמה ולימא הרי עלי ולייתי בהמה אחריתי ולייתי שמונים בהדה ולימא אי הך דקיימא תמורה היא הני תרתי תודות והא שמונים דתרוייהו ואי הך דקיימא תודה היא והא דאמרי עלי נמי ליהוי תודה והא שמונים דתרוייהו ואידך תהוי לאחריות
human_translation: Ravina happened to Dimhorya. Rav Dimi, son of Rav Huna from Dimhorya, said to Ravina: And let bring an animal and say: It is upon me and let him bring another animal, and let him bring eighty with it and say: If this that is extant is the substitute, these two thanks offerings and these eighty for both of them. And if this that is extant is the thanks offering, this one which I said: upon me, should also be a thanks offering, and these eighty for both of them, and let the other be for a guarantee,
llm_translation: Ravina went to Mahoza. Rav Dimi, son of Rav Huna, said to him: From Mahoza to Ravina, he should bring an animal and say, "This is upon me." He should then bring another animal and say, "These eighty are together." If this first animal is considered an exchange, these two are both thanksgiving-offerings, and the eighty animals are both thanksgiving-offerings. If this first animal is considered a thanksgiving-offering, then he should also say, "This is upon me," and the eighty animals are both for liability.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה התורה אמרה (קהלת ה, ד) טוב אשר לא תדור משתדור ולא תשלם ואת אמרת ליקום ולינדור בתחילה:
human_translation: said to him: The Torah said: “Better is it that you should not vow, than that you should vow and not pay” and you say: Let him rise up and vow ab initio ?
llm_translation: He said to him, the Torah said (Ecclesiastes 5:4), "It is better not to vow than to vow and not fulfill." And you said to establish and vow at the outset.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ האומר הרי עלי תודה יביא היא ולחמה מן החולין
human_translation: One who says: It upon me a thanks offering, must bring it and its loaves from non-sacred
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who says, "I am obligated to bring a thanksgiving offering," should bring it and its bread from unconsecrated funds.

hebrew_text: תודה עלי מן החולין ולחמה מן המעשר יביא היא ולחמה מן החולין תודה מן המעשר ולחמה מן החולין יביא היא ולחמה מן המעשר יביא ולא יביא מחיטי מעשר שני אלא ממעות מעשר שני:
human_translation: upon me a thanks offering from non-sacred and its loaves from tithe he must bring and its loaves from non-sacred a thanks offering from tithe and its loaves from non-sacred he may bring and its loaves from tithe he may bring And he may not bring from second-tithe wheat; rather, with second-tithe money.
llm_translation: Acknowledgment from the mundane, its bread from the tithe shall bring it, and its bread from the mundane, acknowledgment from the tithe shall bring it, and its bread from the mundane shall bring it, and its bread from the tithe shall bring, and one shall not bring wheat of the second tithe, but from the money of the second tithe.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב הונא האומר הרי עלי לחמי תודה מביא תודה ולחמה מאי טעמא מידע ידע האי גברא דלחם בלא תודה לא איקריב והאי תודה ולחמה קאמר והאי דקאמר לחמי תודה סוף מילתא נקט
human_translation: Rav Huna says: One who says: It upon me loaves of a thanks offering, must bring a thanks offering and its loaves, What is the reason? This man knows that loaves are not brought without a thanks offering, and this saying: a thanks offering and its loaves. And stated this loaves of a thanks offering, he was citing the end of the matter,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Huna said: One who says, "Behold, upon me is the obligation of my thanksgiving offering," brings a thanksgiving offering, and its bread. What is the reason? He knows that this man, who brings bread without thanksgiving, does not offer it. And this is what he said: "My bread of thanksgiving." The conclusion is drawn from this.

hebrew_text: תנן תודה מן המעשר ולחמה מן החולין יביא כמה שנדר ואמאי כיון דאמר לחמה מן החולין יביא היא ולחמה מן החולין
human_translation: we learned a thanks offering from tithe and its loaves from non-sacred he may bring as he vowed. And why Since he said: Its loaves from non-sacred he should bring and its loaves from non-sacred
llm_translation: We have learned: Thanksgiving from the tithe, and its bread from the non-consecrated produce. How much should one bring if he made a vow? And why is it necessary to specify since he said, "its bread from the non-consecrated produce he should bring it, and its bread from the non-consecrated produce."

hebrew_text: שאני התם דכיון דאמר תודה מן המעשר נעשה כאומר הרי עלי לחם לפטור תודתו של פלוני
human_translation: It is different there, as since he said a thanks offering from tithe he is considered as one who says: It upon me loaves to exempt the thanks offering of so-and-so.
llm_translation: There it is different, since he said "thanksgiving from the tithe is done as if he said, 'Behold, I am obligated to bring bread to exempt the thanksgiving of so-and-so.'"

hebrew_text: אי הכי רישא דקתני תודה מן החולין ולחמה מן המעשר יביא היא ולחמה מן החולין הכא נמי נעשה כאומר הרי עלי תודה לפטור לחמו של פלוני
human_translation: If that is so, the first clause which teaches a thanks offering from non-sacred and its loaves from tithe he must bring and its loaves from non-sacred here too he is considered as one who says: It upon me a thanks offering to exempt the loaves of so-and-so,
llm_translation: If so, the beginning of the Mishnah teaches: "Thanksgiving from ordinary produce, and its bread from the tithe, she shall bring it, and its bread from ordinary produce." Here too, it is done as it says, "Behold, upon me is the thanksgiving to exempt the bread of so-and-so."

hebrew_text: הכי השתא בשלמא לחם למיפטר תודה אתי תודה למיפטר לחם מי אתיא
human_translation: How can be compared? Granted, loaves come to exempt the thanks offering. does a thanks offering come to exempt the loaves?
llm_translation: So now, indeed, regarding the case of bread, it is well understood that thanksgiving is required for its discharge. Thanksgiving is required for its discharge, but is thanksgiving required for water?

hebrew_text: תא שמע האומר הרי עלי תודה בלא לחם וזבח בלא נסכים כופין אותו ומביא תודה ולחמה זבח ונסכים
