human_translation: Come hear one who says: It upon me a thanks offering without loaves, or offering without libations, coerces him, and he brings a thanks offering with its loaves, an offering with its libations.
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who says, "I take upon myself the obligation of a thanksgiving offering without bread, and a sacrifice without libations," we compel him to bring a thanksgiving offering with its bread, a sacrifice, and libations.

hebrew_text: טעמא דאמר אבל לא אמר תודה לא
human_translation: The reason that he said But he did not say a thanks offering, not
llm_translation: Reason that he said "Aval" but did not say "Toda" no

hebrew_text: הוא הדין אף על גב דלא אמר תודה ואיידי דקא בעי למיתנא זבח בלא נסכים דלא מתני ליה נסכים בלא זבח תנא נמי תודה
human_translation: the same is true even if he did not say a thanks offering, And Since wants to teach offering without libations, which not teach libations without an offering, he also taught a thanks offering.
llm_translation: He the same even though he did not say thanksgiving and since he needs to teach a sacrifice without libations, he does not teach libations without a sacrifice. A Tanna also taught thanksgiving.

hebrew_text: אמאי נדר ופתחו עמו הוא
human_translation: Why this a vow with its opening?
llm_translation: Why "Nedar" and "Pitcho Amo Hu"

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה הא מני בית שמאי היא דאמרי תפוס לשון הראשון דתנן הריני נזיר מן הגרוגרות ומן הדבלה בית שמאי אומרים נזיר ובית הלל אומרים אינו נזיר
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya said: whose is this It is Beit Shammai, who say: attend the first statement. As we learned I am hereby a nazirite from dried figs and from figs, Beit Shammai say: nazirite, And Beit Hillel say: he is not a nazirite,
llm_translation: Hizkiyah said: This is the opinion of Beit Shammai, for they say: "The first language is binding." As we learned in a Mishnah: "Behold, I am a Nazir from the dried figs and from the pressed figs." Beit Shammai say: "He is a Nazir," and Beit Hillel say: "He is not a Nazir."

hebrew_text: רבי יוחנן אמר אפילו תימא בית הלל באומר אילו הייתי יודע שאין נודרין כך לא הייתי נודר כך אלא כך ומאי כופין דקא בעי הדר ביה
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: You even say Beit Hillel, with regard to one who says: Had I known that one does not vow this I would not have vowed this but that And what coerces where, he wants to retract his
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say Beit Hillel agrees that had I known that vows are not taken so, I would not have taken a vow thus, but rather thus. And what do they force him to do? To annul it for him.

hebrew_text: תא שמע האומר הרי עלי תודה בלא לחם וזבח בלא נסכים ואמרו לו הבא תודה ולחמה וזבח ונסכים ואומר אילו הייתי יודע שכן לא הייתי נודר כופין אותו ואומר לו (דברים יב, כח) שמור ושמעת
human_translation: Come hear: one who says: It upon me a thanks offering without loaves, or: offering without libations, and said to him: Bring a thanks offering with its loaves, or: offering with its libations, and he says: Had I known that such I would not have vowed coerces him, and says to him: “Observe and hear”
llm_translation: Come and hear: One who says, "I undertake to bring a thanksgiving offering without bread, and a sacrifice without libations," and they say to him, "Bring a thanksgiving offering with its bread, and a sacrifice with its libations," and he says, "Had I known this, I would not have made the vow," we compel him, and say to him, "Observe and listen" (Deuteronomy 12:28).

hebrew_text: בשלמא לחזקיה ניחא ליה אלא לר' יוחנן קשיא אמר לך ר' יוחנן הא ודאי בית שמאי היא
human_translation: Granted, works out well according to Ḥizkiyya, But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, a difficulty, Rabbi Yoḥanan said to you: This is certainly Beit Shammai,
llm_translation: In Shlomo's name, it is fitting for Hezekiah, but for Rabbi Yochanan it is difficult. Rabbi Yochanan said to you: "This is certainly the opinion of Beit Shammai."

hebrew_text: מאי שמור ושמעת אמר אביי שמור הבא תודה ושמעת הבא לחמה רבא אמר שמור הבא תודה ולחמה ושמעת שלא תהא רגיל לעשות כן
human_translation: What “Observe and hear,” Abaye says: “Observe” Bring a thanks offering; “and hear” Bring its loaves. Rava says: “Observe” Bring a thanks offering and its loaves; “and hear” that you should not act this regularly.
llm_translation: What is "Shemor" and "Shema'at"? Abaye said: "Shemor" that comes for thanksgiving, and "Shema'at" that comes for a sin-offering. Rava said: "Shemor" that comes for thanksgiving and a sin-offering, and "Shema'at" that one should not be accustomed to do so.

hebrew_text: (תודה) היא ולחמה מן המעשר יביא יביא לא סגי דלא מייתי רב נחמן ורב חסדא אמרי רצה מביא לא רצה לא יביא
human_translation: a thanks offering and its loaves from tithe he shall bring He shall bring, not sufficient if he does not bring Rav Naḥman and Rav Ḥisda say: wants, he brings does not want, he does not bring
llm_translation: Gratitude, and its bread, from the tithe, one shall bring, shall bring. It is not sufficient that one does not bring. Rav Nachman and Rav Chisda said: If he desires, he may bring; if he does not desire, he shall not bring.

hebrew_text: ולא יביא מחיטי מעשר שני אלא ממעות מעשר שני רב נחמן ורב חסדא דאמרי תרוייהו לא שנו אלא מחיטי מעשר שני אבל מחיטין הלקוחות ממעות מעשר שני יביא
human_translation: And he may not bring from second-tithe wheat; rather, with second-tithe money. Rav Naḥman and Rav Ḥisda both say: taught only from second-tithe wheat but he may bring from wheat purchased with second-tithe money.
llm_translation: "And one should not bring from the wheat of the second tithe, but from the money of the second tithe. Rav Nahman and Rav Hisda, both said: They only taught not to bring from the wheat of the second tithe, but if one took wheat from the money of the second tithe, he may bring it."

hebrew_text: יתיב רבי ירמיה קמיה דרבי זירא ויתיב וקאמר לא שנו אלא מחיטי מעשר שני אבל מחיטין הלקוחות במעות מעשר שני יביא אמר ליה רבי אתה אומר כן אני אומר אפילו מחיטין הלקוחות במעות מעשר שני לא יביא ואימא טעמא דידי ואימא טעמא דידך אימא טעמא דידך תודה מהיכא קא ילפת לה משלמים
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya was sitting before Rabbi Zeira, and he was sitting and saying: taught only from second-tithe wheat but he may bring from wheat purchased from second-tithe money. said to him: My teacher, you say so? I say he may not bring even from wheat purchased from second-tithe money. And I will say my reasoning and I will say your reasoning. I will say your reasoning From where do you derive a thanks offering a peace offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah was sitting before Rabbi Zeira, and he was sitting and saying, "They only taught regarding wheat of the second tithe, but regarding wheat purchased with money of the second tithe, one should bring it." Rabbi said to him, "Rabbi, do you say so?" "I say," he replied, "even wheat purchased with money of the second tithe should not be brought." And say, "My reason and say, 'Your reason.'" Say, "Your reason." From where do you derive the concept of 'thanksgiving' that you are inferring it from the payment?

hebrew_text: ושלמים שם שם ממעשר [ומינה] מה שלמים אין גופן מעשר אף תודה נמי אין גופה מעשר והני חיטי הלקוחות במעות מעשר שני נמי אין גופן מעשר
human_translation: And a peace offering “there” “there” from tithe. And from this Just as peace offerings are not themselves tithe, so too a thanks offering, they are not themselves tithe. And that wheat which is purchased with second-tithe money is also not itself tithe;
llm_translation: "And peace-offerings there, there from tithe and kind what peace-offerings not their body tithe also thanksgiving also not its body tithe and these wheat bought with money second tithe also not their body tithe."

hebrew_text: אימא טעמא דידי תודה מהיכא קא ילפינא לה משלמים ושלמים שם שם ממעשר מה שלמים אין מין מעשר אף תודה אין מין מעשר לאפוקי חיטין הלקוחות במעות מעשר שני דמין מעשר נינהו
human_translation: I will say my reasoning From where do I derive a thanks offering from a peace offering. And a peace offering “there” “there” from tithe. just as a peace offering is not species tithe, so too a thanks offering not species tithe. to exclude wheat purchased with second-tithe money, which is species tithe.
llm_translation: Say, what is the reason for my thanksgiving? From where do I derive it for her? From "Shelamim" and "Shelamim" there, from the tithe. Just as "Shelamim" is not of the tithe, so too thanksgiving is not of the tithe. This is to exclude wheat that was purchased with second tithe money, for they are considered as second tithe.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אמי המתפיס מעות מעשר שני לשלמים לא קנו שלמים מאי טעמא דלא אלימא קדושת השלמים למיחל אקדושת מעשר שני
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says: one who designates second-tithe money for a peace offering, not assume a peace offering. What is the reason? that the sanctity of the peace offering is not strong to take effect upon the sanctity of second tithe.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ami: One who designates money of the Second Tithe for Peace Offerings has not acquired Peace Offerings. What is the reason? Because the holiness of the Peace Offerings does not take effect to defer the holiness of the Second Tithe.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי הלוקח חיה לזבחי שלמים ובהמה לבשר תאוה לא יצא העור לחולין לאו למימרא דקני שלמים
human_translation: raises an objection one who purchases an undomesticated animal for a peace offering, or a domesticated animal for meat of desire, the hide does not become non-sacred. Is that not to say that assumes a peace offering,
llm_translation: The question was raised: One who purchases a live animal for peace offerings and an animal for desired meat, has he not fulfilled his obligation? The hide does not go out for common use. Is this not to say that it is fit for peace offerings?

hebrew_text: הא איתמר עלה אמר רב לא קני שלמים ומאי לא יצא העור לחולין הכי קאמר אינו בתורת לצאת העור לחולין מאי טעמא אמר רבה נעשה כלוקח שור לחרישה
human_translation: Wasn’t it stated concerning that Rav said: not assume a peace offering; and what the hide does not become non-sacred? This is saying: not in the category of hide would become non-sacred. What is the reason? Rabba says: it is considered as if he purchased an ox for plowing,
llm_translation: Here is the English translation of the Talmudic text: It was stated: If one ascended, Rav said: He does not acquire peace-offerings. And what is the reason? He did not fulfill the requirement of "to go out." The skin did not go out to be mundane. What is the reason? Rabba said: It is made like one who acquires an ox for plowing.

hebrew_text: איתמר המתפיס מעות מעשר שני לשלמים ר' יוחנן אמר קני רבי אלעזר אומר לא קני
human_translation: was stated one who designates second-tithe money for a peace offering. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: assumes Rabbi Elazar says: not assume
llm_translation: It was stated: One who takes money of Second Tithe for Shelamim. Rabbi Yochanan says: He acquires. Rabbi Elazar says: He does not acquire.

hebrew_text: ואליבא דר' יהודה דאמר מעשר ממון הדיוט הוא דכולי עלמא לא פליגי דקני כי פליגי אליבא דר' מאיר דאמר מעשר ממון גבוה הוא מאן דאמר לא קני כר' מאיר ומאן דאמר קני כיון דמעשר קרי ליה שלמים כי מיתפסת ליה נמי תפיס
human_translation: And according to of Rabbi Yehuda, who said: tithe is non-sacred property, everyone agrees that assumes When they disagree, according to of Rabbi Meir, who said: tithe is property Most High. The one who says not assume in accordance with Rabbi Meir, And the one who says assumes since tithe is called a peace offering, when he designates as well designated
llm_translation: In the school of Rabbi Yehuda who said: "Tithing money is the duty of a commoner," for everyone agrees that when they argue, it is in the school of Rabbi Meir who said: "Tithing money is a high matter." Whoever says it is not like Rabbi Meir, and whoever says it is, since tithing is called complete, when it is taken, it is also taken.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי המתפיס מעות מעשר שני לשלמים כשהוא פודן מוסיף עליהם שני חומשין אחד לקדש ואחד למעשר
human_translation: raises an objection one who designates second-tithe money for a peace offering, when he redeems he adds to it two-fifths: for the sacrificial and for tithe.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was asked: One who takes money of the Second Tithe to redeem it for regular money, when he redeems it, he adds upon them two fifths, one for the consecrated and one for the tithe.

hebrew_text: מי סברת דברי הכל היא הא מני רבי יהודה היא:
human_translation: Do you maintain is agreed by everyone? whose is this? It is Rabbi Yehuda, peace
llm_translation: Who thinks the words of everyone? It is from Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ מנין לאומר הרי עלי תודה שלא יביא אלא מן החולין תלמוד לומר (דברים טז, ב) וזבחת פסח לה' אלהיך צאן ובקר והלא פסח אין בא אלא מן הכבשים ומן העזים אם כן מה תלמוד לומר צאן ובקר להקיש כל הבא מן הצאן ומן הבקר לפסח מה פסח דבר שבחובה ואין בא אלא מן החולין אף כל דבר שבחובה אין בא אלא מן החולין
human_translation: From where one who says: It upon me a thanks offering, that he may bring only from non-sacred the verse states: “And you shall sacrifice the Paschal offering to the Lord your God, of the flock and the herd” Doesn’t the Paschal offering come only from lambs and goats? If so, why does the verse state: “The flock and the herd”? to juxtapose all that come from the flock and from the herd to Paschal offering, just as Paschal offering a matter of obligation and comes only from non-sacred so too any matter of obligation comes only from non-sacred
llm_translation: Mishnah: From where do we derive that one may say, "Behold, upon me is a thanksgiving offering," that one may only bring it from non-consecrated property? The Torah states (Deuteronomy 16:2), "And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering to the Lord your God, sheep and cattle." But isn't the Passover offering only brought from lambs and goats? If so, why does the Torah say "sheep and cattle"? To draw an analogy: Just as anyone who brings from sheep and cattle for the Passover offering, the Passover offering being an obligatory matter and only brought from non-consecrated property, so too, any obligatory matter is only brought from non-consecrated property.

hebrew_text: לפיכך האומר הרי עלי תודה הרי עלי שלמים הואיל ובאין חובה לא יביאו אלא מן החולין ונסכים בכל מקום לא יביאו אלא מן החולין:
human_translation: Therefore, one who says: It upon me a thanks offering, It upon me a peace offering, since come an obligation they may be brought only from non-sacred And libations, in any case, may be brought only from non-sacred
llm_translation: Therefore, one who says, "Behold, upon me is a thanksgiving offering," "Behold, upon me is a peace offering," since there is no obligation, they shall only bring from the non-consecrated property, and libations anywhere, they shall only bring from the non-consecrated property.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ופסח גופיה מנא לן דתניא ר' אליעזר אומר נאמר פסח במצרים ונאמר פסח לדורות מה פסח האמור במצרים לא בא אלא מן החולין אף פסח האמור לדורות לא בא אלא מן החולין
human_translation: And the Paschal offering itself, from where do we As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: “Paschal offering” is stated with regard to Egypt and “Paschal offering” is stated with regard to generations just as the Paschal offering stated with regard to Egypt was brought only from non-sacred so too the Paschal offering stated with regard to generations may be brought only from non-sacred
llm_translation: Gemara: And how do we know the law of the Passover sacrifice itself? As it was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says, it is stated "Passover" in Egypt, and it is stated "Passover" for generations. Just as the Passover sacrifice mentioned in Egypt came only from ordinary animals, so too the Passover sacrifice mentioned for generations comes only from ordinary animals.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי עקיבא וכי דנין אפשר משאי אפשר אמר לו אף על פי שאי אפשר ראייה גדולה היא ונלמד הימנה
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva said to him: But does one derive possible from impossible? said to him: Even though impossible it is a great proof, and we shall derive from it.
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Akiva, "And is it possible to judge? If possible, possible." He said to him, "Even though it is impossible, it is a great insight, and we learn from it."

hebrew_text: חזר רבי עקיבא ודנו דין אחר מה לפסח מצרים שכן אין טעון מתן דמים ואימורין לגבי מזבח
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva then presented a different logical derivation what about the Paschal offering Egypt? that did not require placement of blood sacrificial portions by the altar.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva reviewed and judged another case: What about the Paschal lamb of Egypt? Since it does not require the offering of blood and sacrificial portions on the altar.

hebrew_text: תאמר בפסח דורות שטעון מתן דמים ואימורין לגבי מזבח
human_translation: you say with the Paschal offering generations, which requires placement of blood and sacrificial portions by the altar?
llm_translation: It is stated in Pesachim: generations that require both monetary compensation and sacrificial offerings at the altar.

hebrew_text: אמר לו הרי הוא אומר (שמות יג, ה) ועבדת את העבודה הזאת בחדש הזה שיהיו כל עבודות של חודש הזה כזה
human_translation: said to him: as the states that you shall perform this service in this month” that all the services of this month shall be like this,
llm_translation: He said to him: "Behold, it says (Exodus 13:5), 'And you shall serve this service in this month,' that all services of this month should be like this."

hebrew_text: ור' עקיבא אי סבר לה דאין דנין אפשר משאי אפשר ליקו במילתיה
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, if he holds that one does not derive possible from impossible, let him stand by his statement.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, if he holds that we do not judge, it is possible that when it is possible, he can be refuted in his argument.

hebrew_text: אי הדר ביה והאי דלא גמר מפסח מצרים משום האי פירכא הוא פסח מדבר יוכיח
human_translation: if he retracted and that he did not derive from the Paschal offering Egypt is due to that refutation the Paschal offering the wilderness will prove
llm_translation: If he returns to it, and this one did not complete the Passover of Egypt because of this, the verse "A Passover offering for the Lord" will prove it.

hebrew_text: לדבריו דר' אליעזר קאמר לדידי אין דנין אפשר משאי אפשר לדידך דאמרת דנין אפשר משאי אפשר מה לפסח מצרים שכן אינו טעון מתן דמים ואימורין לגבי מזבח תאמר בפסח דורות שטעון מתן דמים ואימורין לגבי מזבח
human_translation: stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Eliezer. According to my one does not derive possible from impossible, according to your which you said one derives possible from impossible, What about the Paschal offering Egypt? that did not require placement of blood sacrificial portions by the altar. you say with regard to the Paschal offering generations, which requires placement of blood and sacrificial portions by the altar?
llm_translation: According to the words of Rabbi Eliezer, he said to me: "We do not judge 'possible' based on 'possible,' as you said that 'possible' requires a blood offering and sacrificial parts on the altar. Let it be said regarding the Passover offering of future generations, which requires a blood offering and sacrificial parts on the altar."

hebrew_text: ואמר ליה רבי אליעזר ועבדת
human_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said to him “That you shall keep
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer said to him, "And you shall serve."

hebrew_text: ורבי אליעזר לימא ליה פסח מדבר יוכיח
human_translation: But Rabbi Eliezer Let him say to The Paschal offering the wilderness will prove
llm_translation: And Rabbi Eliezer should say to him: "The Passover offering from the wilderness shall prove it."

hebrew_text: לדבריו דרבי עקיבא קאמר ליה לדידי דנין אפשר משאי אפשר ומשום האי פירכא פסח מדבר יוכיח לדידך דאמרת אין דנין אפשר משאי אפשר ועבדת
human_translation: stated in accordance with the statement of Rabbi Akiva. In my one derives possible from impossible. And as that refutation the Paschal offering the wilderness will prove According to your which you said one does not derive possible from impossible, “That you shall keep
llm_translation: According to the words of Rabbi Akiva, he said to him, according to my opinion, it is possible, it is possible. And because of this, the verse of the Passover offering will prove for you, for you said, "It is not possible, it is possible," and you did.

hebrew_text: והשתא נמי ליפרוך אמר רב ששת זאת אומרת אין משיבין על ההיקש
human_translation: But even now, let refute Rav Sheshet says: That is to say one cannot refute a juxtaposition,
llm_translation: And now also to refute it, Rav Sheshet said: This means one does not respond to the juxtaposition.

hebrew_text: ובתרביצא אמור וכי דבר הלמד בהיקש חוזר ומלמד בהיקש בכללא איתמר פסח כוליה חדא מילתא היא
human_translation: And in the study hall [ uvetarbitza ] they said: But can a matter derived via juxtaposition, again teach a matter via juxtaposition? was stated in a general the entire Paschal offering is one matter.
llm_translation: In the Tractate of Berachot it is stated: "And when it comes to a comparison, does a matter that is learned through a juxtaposition also teach through a juxtaposition? In general, it was stated: The Passover sacrifice is entirely one matter."

hebrew_text: ורבי עקיבא פסח דאינו בא אלא מן החולין מנא ליה נפקא ליה מהא דאמר שמואל משום ר' אליעזר (ויקרא ז, לז) זאת התורה לעולה ולמנחה ולחטאת ולאשם ולמילואים ולזבח השלמים
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, from where does he that the Paschal offering comes only from non-sacred derives it from that which Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer: “This is the law of the burnt offering, of the meal offering, and of the sin offering, and of the guilt offering, and of the inauguration offering, and of the sacrifice of peace offerings”
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva, the Passover offering that comes only from non-consecrated animals, how does he derive it? How does he derive it from what Shmuel said in the name of Rabbi Eliezer (Leviticus 7:37): "This is the Torah of the burnt offering, the meal offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the ordination offering, and the sacrifice of peace offerings."

hebrew_text: עולה מה עולה טעונה כלי אף כל טעון כלי מאי היא אילימא מזרק גבי זבחי שלמי ציבור נמי כתיב (שמות כד, ו) וישם באגנות
human_translation: burnt offering,” just as a burnt offering requires a utensil so too do all require a utensil. What utensil? If we say a bowl, With regard to communal peace offerings it is also written: And Moses took half of the blood and put it in basins”
llm_translation: "Olah, what is an Olah? Requires a vessel. Also, every offering that requires a vessel, what is it? If you say it is the sprinkling of blood in the communal peace offerings, it is also written (Exodus 24:6), 'And he placed in the basins.'"

hebrew_text: אלא סכין ועולה גופה מנלן דכתיב (בראשית כב, י) וישלח אברהם את ידו ויקח את המאכלת לשחוט את בנו והתם עולה הוא דכתיב (בראשית כב, יג) ויעלהו לעולה תחת בנו
human_translation: Rather, a knife, And a burnt offering itself, from where do we that which is written: “And Abraham stretched forth his hand, and took the knife to slaughter his son” and there, a burnt offering, as it is written: “And offered it up for a burnt offering instead of his son”
llm_translation: Rather, a knife and an offering, from where do we derive that its body is required? As it is written (Genesis 22:10), "And Abraham stretched out his hand and took the knife to slaughter his son." And there, it is an offering, as it is written (Genesis 22:13), "And he offered him up as an offering in place of his son."

hebrew_text: מנחה מה מנחה אינה נאכלת אלא לזכרי כהונה אף כל אין נאכלין אלא לזכרי כהונה מאי אי חטאת ואשם
human_translation: a meal offering, just as a meal offering is eaten only by males of priesthood so too are all eaten only by males of priesthood. what is it If sin offering and guilt offering,
llm_translation: Mincha, what Mincha is not eaten except for male priests, so too all are not eaten except for male priests. What if it is a sin offering and guilt offering.

hebrew_text: בהדיא כתיב
human_translation: is explicitly written
llm_translation: In truth, it is written.

hebrew_text: אי זבחי שלמי ציבור מרבויא דקראי אתי (במדבר יח, י) בקדש הקדשים תאכלנו כל זכר (בכהנים) יאכל אותו לימד על זבחי שלמי ציבור שאין נאכלים אלא לזכרי כהונה
human_translation: If communal peace offerings, is derived from amplification of the verse “In a most sacred place shall you eat of it; every male may eat it” teaches with regard to communal peace offerings that they are eaten only by males of priestly
llm_translation: If the communal peace offerings come in abundance, the verse comes to teach (Numbers 18:10), "In a most holy place you shall eat it; every male (among the priests) shall eat it." This teaches regarding communal peace offerings that they are only eaten by male priests.

hebrew_text: תנאי היא איכא דמייתי לה מהכא ואיכא דמייתי לה מהכא
human_translation: It is tanna’im . There is who cites it, from here, and there is who cites it from there,
llm_translation: It is a Tannaitic dispute. There are some who bring a proof for it from here, and there are some who bring a proof for it from here.

hebrew_text: חטאת מה חטאת מקדשה בבלוע אף כל מקדשה בבלוע
human_translation: “Sin offering” Just as a sin offering, is sanctified through absorbed, so too all is sanctified through absorbed
llm_translation: Sin-offering, what sin-offering, its sanctity is through ingestion, so too all its sanctity is through ingestion.

hebrew_text: אשם מה אשם אין שפיר ושליא קדוש בו אף כל אין שפיר ושליא קדוש בו קסבר ולדות קדשים בהוייתן הן קדושים ודנין אפשר משאי אפשר
human_translation: “Guilt offering” Just as a guilt offering, a fetal sac and a placenta are not sacred within it, so too any a fetal sac and a placenta are not sacred within it. holds offspring of sacrificial they are sanctified as they are And one derives possible from impossible,
llm_translation: Guilt-offering what guilt-offering not valid and fat-tail holy in it also all not valid and fat-tail holy in it holds and offspring of holy beings in their existence they are holy and judge possible from impossible

hebrew_text: מלואים מה מלואים מותריהן בשריפה ואין בעלי חיים מותריהן בשריפה אף כל מותריהן בשריפה ואין בעלי חיים מותריהן בשריפה
human_translation: “Inauguration offering” Just as inauguration offering, their leftovers by incineration, and no living animals among their leftovers by incineration, so too all their leftovers are by incineration, and there are no living animals among their leftovers by incineration.
llm_translation: Fulfillments, what fulfillments, their permissibility is by burning, and living beings, their permissibility is not by burning, even all their permissibility is by burning, and living beings, their permissibility is not by burning.

hebrew_text: שלמים מה שלמים מפגלין ומתפגלין אף כל מפגלין ומתפגלין
human_translation: “Peace offering” Just as peace offering, render piggul and rendered piggul , so too all render piggul and are rendered piggul .
llm_translation: Peace offerings, what is considered peace offerings, disqualified and becoming disqualified, so too all that are disqualified and becoming disqualified.

hebrew_text: במתניתא תנא משמיה דר' עקיבא (ויקרא ז, לז) זאת התורה כו' מנחה מה מנחה מקדשת בבלוע אף כל מקדשת בבלוע
human_translation: It was taught in a baraita in the name of Rabbi Akiva “This is the law “meal offering” Just as a meal offering, is sanctified through absorbed, so too all is sanctified through absorbed
llm_translation: In the teaching it was taught in the name of Rabbi Akiva (Leviticus 7:37), "This is the Torah, etc." "Mincha" - just as a "mincha" sanctifies when swallowed, so too, all that sanctifies when swallowed.

hebrew_text: ואיצטריך למכתב בחטאת ואיצטריך למכתב במנחה דאי כתב רחמנא במנחה משום דרכיכא בלעה אבל חטאת אימא לא ואי כתב רחמנא בחטאת משום דבשר אגב דשמן קדיר אבל מנחה אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And it was necessary to write with regard to a sin offering, and it was necessary to write with regard to a meal offering. As, had the Merciful One written with regard to a meal offering, that since it is soft, it is absorbed but a sin offering, I would say not And had the Merciful One written with regard to a sin offering, because, on account of its fattiness, the meat penetrates [ kadeir ] but a meal offering, I would say not necessary
llm_translation: And it was necessary for a writing in the sin offering, and it was necessary for a writing in the meal offering. For if the Merciful One wrote regarding the meal offering, it is because it is consumed by the way of swallowing, but regarding the sin offering, one might say no. And if the Merciful One wrote regarding the sin offering, it is because of the flesh on top of the oil in the pot, but regarding the meal offering, one might say no, it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: חטאת מה חטאת אינה באה אלא מן החולין וביום ובידו הימנית אף כל אינו בא אלא מן החולין וביום ובידו הימנית
human_translation: “Sin offering” Just as a sin offering is brought only from non-sacred and in the daytime, and with right hand, so too all are brought only from non-sacred and in the daytime, and with right hand.
llm_translation: Sin-offering, what sin-offering? Comes only from the mundane, and on the day, and in his right hand. So too, everything comes only from the mundane, and on the day, and in his right hand.

hebrew_text: וחטאת גופה מנלן אמר ר' חסדא דאמר קרא (ויקרא טז, ו) והקריב אהרן את פר החטאת אשר לו לו משלו ולא משל מעשר
human_translation: And a sin offering itself, from where do we Rav Ḥisda said: as the verse states: “And Aaron shall present the bull of the sin offering, which is his” from his and not from tithe
llm_translation: And sin-offering itself from where? Said Rabbi Ḥisda, as said the verse (Leviticus 16:6), "And Aaron shall offer the bull of the sin-offering which is for himself, and not for the tithe."

hebrew_text: ביום (ויקרא ז, לח) מביום צוותו נפקא כדי נסבה
human_translation: in the daytime? derived from “On the day of His commanding” cited for no reason [ kedi ],
llm_translation: On the day (Leviticus 7:38) "from the day of his anointing" he went out as a bride.

hebrew_text: בידו הימנית מדרבה בר בר חנה נפקא דאמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר ריש לקיש כל מקום שנאמר אצבע וכהונה אינו אלא ימין כדי נסבה
human_translation: with right hand? derived from of Rabba bar bar Ḥana? As Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Reish Lakish says: any place that it is stated a finger, or priesthood, only right cited for no reason,
llm_translation: With his right hand, from Rabba bar bar Ḥana emerged, for Rabba bar bar Ḥana said in the name of Reish Lakish: Any place where it is stated "finger" and "priesthood" is only referring to the right hand, in order to turn it.

hebrew_text: אשם מה אשם עצמותיו מותרין אף כל עצמותיו מותרין
human_translation: “Guilt offering” Just as a guilt offering, its bones are permitted so too any its bones are permitted.
llm_translation: Guilt what guilt his bones permissible even all his bones permissible

hebrew_text: ור' עקיבא האי (דברים טז, ב) וזבחת פסח
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, that “And you shall sacrifice the Paschal offering,”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva this (Deuteronomy 16:2) "And you shall sacrifice the Passover."

hebrew_text: מאי עביד ליה מבעי ליה לכדרב נחמן דאמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה מנין למותר הפסח שקרב שלמים שנאמר (דברים טז, ב) וזבחת פסח לה' אלהיך צאן ובקר והלא אין פסח בא אלא מן הכבשים ומן העזים אלא מותר הפסח יהא לדבר הבא מן הצאן ומן הבקר
human_translation: what does he make of it, He requires it for that by Rav Naḥman, as Rav Naḥman says Rabba bar Avuh says: From where that a leftover Paschal offering, is sacrificed as a peace offering that is stated: “And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering unto the Lord, your God, of the flock and the herd.” But isn’t a Paschal offering brought only from the sheep and from the goats? Rather, that a leftover Paschal offering should be as brought from the flock and from the herd,
llm_translation: What does he do with it? He needs it for, according to Rav Nahman who said in the name of Rabba bar Avuh, from where do we derive that a Paschal offering brought as a peace offering is permissible? As it is stated (Deuteronomy 16:2), "And you shall sacrifice the Passover offering to the Lord your God, sheep and cattle." But is not the Passover offering brought only from lambs and goats? Rather, the Paschal offering should be permissible for something that comes from sheep and cattle.

hebrew_text: והא מהכא נפקא מדאבוה דשמואל נפקא דכתיב (ויקרא ג, ו) אם מן הצאן קרבנו לזבח שלמים ואמר אבוה דשמואל דבר הבא מן הצאן יהא לזבח שלמים
human_translation: But is it derived from here It is derived from that Shmuel’s father As it is written: if his offering for a sacrifice of peace offerings is of the flock” and Shmuel’s father said: that is brought from the flock, will be a sacrifice of peace offerings.
llm_translation: And from here it is derived from the father of Shmuel it is derived as it is written (Leviticus 3:6) "If his offering is from the flock for a sacrifice of peace offerings," and the father of Shmuel said: "A thing that comes from the flock shall be for a peace offering."

hebrew_text: ואכתי מהכא נפקא מהתם נפקא והתניא כבש לרבות את הפסח לאליה
human_translation: But still Is it derived from here? It is derived from there, And isn’t it taught “lamb” to include the Paschal offering in fat tail
llm_translation: And thus it is derived from here, it is derived from there. And it was taught: "A lamb" includes the Passover offering for Elijah.

hebrew_text: כשהוא אומר אם כבש להביא פסח שעברה שנתו ושלמים הבאים מחמת פסח לכל מצות שלמים שיטענו סמיכה ונסכים ותנופת חזה ושוק
human_translation: When states: “If a lamb,” to include in all the mitzvot of peace offerings a Paschal offering whose year has passed and peace offerings brought due to a Paschal offering. that they require placing hands libations, and the waving of breast and thigh.
llm_translation: When he says, "If a lamb," to bring a Passover offering, his year has passed, and peace offerings that come due to the Passover, for all peace offerings, they should be laden with leaning, libations, waving of the breast, and the thigh.

hebrew_text: כשהוא אומר ואם עז הפסיק הענין לימד על העז שאינה טעונה אליה
human_translation: And when states: if goat,” it interrupted the matter taught that the a goat does not require fat tail
llm_translation: When it says, "And if a goat," the matter is interrupted, teaching about a goat that does not require it.

hebrew_text: תלתא קראי כתיב חד לעברה זמנו ועברה שנתו וחד לעברה זמנו ולא עברה שנתו וחד ללא עברה זמנו ולא עברה שנתו
human_translation: Rather, three verses are written One its time has passed, and its year has passed, And one its time has passed, but not its year. And one neither its time nor its year has passed,
llm_translation: Three verses are written: one for the transgression of its appointed time and its appointed year, and one for the transgression of its appointed time but not its appointed year, and one for not transgressing its appointed time and not its appointed year.

hebrew_text: וצריכי דאי אשמעינן עברה זמנו ועברה שנתו משום דאידחי ליה לגמרי אבל עברה זמנו ולא עברה שנתו דחזי לפסח שני אימא לא
human_translation: And are necessary. As had the Merciful One written where its year and its time have passed, as it was completely rejected from a Paschal offering; but its time has passed but its year not which fit to second Pesaḥ , I would say not
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to say that the transgression occurred after its time and after its year, it would completely push it aside. But if the transgression occurred after its time and not after its year, as it appears for the second Passover, say no.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן עברה זמנו ולא עברה שנתו דאידחי ליה מפסח ראשון אבל לא עברה זמנו ולא עברה שנתו דאפילו לפסח ראשון נמי חזי אימא לא צריכא:
human_translation: And if had taught us whose time has passed but whose year has not passed because was rejected from the first Pesaḥ ; but where neither its time nor its year have passed, which fit to a Paschal offering I would say not are necessary.
llm_translation: And if we were to say that the transgression occurred after its time, but did not occur after its year, it would exempt him from the first Passover. However, if it did not occur after its time and did not occur after its year, even for the first Passover, one might say it is unnecessary.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך התודה היתה באה
llm_translation: The return upon you the thanks was coming

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל קרבנות הציבור והיחיד באין מן הארץ ומחוצה לארץ מן החדש ומן הישן חוץ מן העומר ושתי הלחם שאינן באין אלא מן החדש ומן הארץ
human_translation: All communal and individual offerings come from Eretz and from outside Eretz from the new and from the old except for the omer , and the two loaves, as they come only from the new and from Eretz
llm_translation: Mishnah: All communal and individual sacrifices come from the land and from outside the land, from the new and from the old, except for the Omer offering and the two loaves, which only come from the new and from the land.

hebrew_text: וכולן אינן באין אלא מן המובחר ואיזהו מובחר שלהם מכניס וזטחא אלפא לסלת שנייה להן עפוריים בבקעה
human_translation: And all come only from the optimal- And which optimal for them? Makhnis and Zateḥa primary [ alfa ] for fine flour. Secondary to them Aforayim in the valley.
llm_translation: And all of them do not come except from the finest, and which is their finest? He brings in and sprinkles fine flour for their second meal with barley in the valley.

hebrew_text: כל הארצות היו כשרות אלא מכאן היו מביאין:
human_translation: ll the regions were valid , but from here, they would bring
llm_translation: All the lands were valid except from here they would bring:

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מתניתין דלא כי האי תנא דתניא עומר הבא מן הישן כשר שתי הלחם הבאות מן הישן כשרות אלא שחיסר מצוה
human_translation: The mishna is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught An omer that comes from the old valid. the two loaves that come from the old are valid, but lacks mitzva.
llm_translation: Gemara: A teaching that is not like this Tanna, as it was taught in a Baraita: "An Omer offering that comes from old grain is valid, and two loaves that come from old grain are valid, except that it lacks a mitzvah."

hebrew_text: עומר דכתיב (ויקרא ב, יד) תקריב את מנחת בכוריך ואפילו מן העלייה
human_translation: omer as it is written: you shall bring the meal offering of your first fruits” even from the attic.
llm_translation: Omer as it is written (Vayikra 2:14) "You shall bring near your firstfruits offering" and even from the "Aliyah."

hebrew_text: שתי הלחם דכתיב (ויקרא כג, יז) ממושבותיכם תביאו ולא מן חוצה לארץ ממושבותיכם ואפילו מן העלייה
human_translation: two loaves as it is written: From your dwellings you shall bring and not from outside of Eretz “from your dwellings” and even from the attic.
llm_translation: The two loaves as it is written (Leviticus 23:17) "from your dwellings you shall bring" and not from outside the land from your dwellings, and even from the upper floor.

hebrew_text: הא אפיקתיה אמר קרא תביאו ואפילו מן העלייה
human_translation: Didn’t you expound that the verse states: you shall bring” and even from the attic.
llm_translation: This is the translation of the Talmudic text you provided: "Here, his departure, said the verse, 'Bring him out, even from the ascent.'"

hebrew_text: והאי מיבעי ליה שכל שאתה מביא ממקום אחר הרי הוא כזה אם כן ליכתוב קרא תביא מאי תביאו שמע מינה תרתי
human_translation: But that is necessary that any that you bring in another instance, is to be like this If so, let the verse write: You shall bring [ tavi ], what “You shall bring [ tavi’u ],” learn from it two
llm_translation: And this one requires him to bring intelligence, that wherever you bring from another place, behold, it is like this. If so, let him write the verse: "You shall bring." What is meant by "bring"? Learn from it two things.

hebrew_text: והכתיב (ויקרא כג, י) ראשית למצוה
human_translation: But isn’t “first” written for mitzva.
llm_translation: And it is written (Leviticus 23:10), "The beginning of the commandment."

hebrew_text: הכתיב (ויקרא כג, טז) חדשה האי מיבעי ליה לכדתניא רבי נתן ור' עקיבא אמרו שתי הלחם הבאות מן הישן כשרות ומה אני מקיים חדשה שתהא חדשה לכל המנחות
human_translation: isn’t it written “A new it is necessary for that which is taught Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Akiva said the two loaves are brought from the old valid. How do I realize “A new are to be the first of all the meal offerings.
llm_translation: It is written (Leviticus 23:16), "new." This, what does it require for? As it was taught in a Baraita, Rabbi Natan and Rabbi Akiva said: "Two loaves that come from the old are valid." And how do I fulfill "new"? That it should be new for all meal offerings.

hebrew_text: עד כאן לא פליגי אלא בחדש
human_translation: They disagree only with regard to the new
llm_translation: Until here they only argue about the new month.

hebrew_text: אבל בארץ לא פליגי דעומר ושתי הלחם מארץ אין מחוצה לארץ לא
human_translation: But with regard to Eretz they do not disagree that the omer and the two loaves from Eretz indeed, from outside of Eretz not
llm_translation: But in the land, they do not argue, regarding the Omer and the Two Loaves, from the land, not outside the land.

hebrew_text: כמאן דלא כי האי תנא דתניא ר' יוסי בר רבי יהודה אומר עומר בא מחוצה לארץ ומה אני מקיים (ויקרא כג, י) כי תבאו אל הארץ שלא נתחייבו בעומר קודם שנכנסו לארץ
human_translation: In accordance with whose It is not in accordance with this tanna , as it is taught Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says the omer come from outside of Eretz How do I realize “When you come into the land that were not obligated in the omer before they entered Eretz
llm_translation: As one who does not follow this Tanna, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says, "The Omer offering comes from outside the land." And how do I fulfill (Leviticus 23:10) "When you come into the land" if they were not obligated in the Omer before entering the land.

hebrew_text: וקסבר חדש בחוצה לארץ דאורייתא היא דכתיב ממושבותיכם כל מקום שאתם יושבין משמע וכי תבאו זמן ביאה היא וכיון דאורייתא היא אקרובי נמי מקריבין:
human_translation: And he holds outside of Eretz new is by Torah law, as it is written: “From all your dwellings” indicates anywhere that you dwell, “When you come is the time entering And since is by Torah law, one may also offer
llm_translation: And he holds, "New in outside the land, it is from the Torah, as it is written, 'From your dwellings,' any place that you are dwelling, implies. And when the time of intercourse comes, it is. And since it is from the Torah, close ones also bring sacrifices."

hebrew_text: תנן התם שומרי ספיחין בשביעית נוטלין שכרן מתרומת הלשכה
human_translation: We learned elsewhere guards of produce that grew without being purposely planted [ sefiḥin ] during the Sabbatical collect their wages from the collection of the chamber.
llm_translation: We have learned there (in a Mishnah): Those who guard the crops in the Sabbatical year take their wages from the contribution of the Chamber.

hebrew_text: רמי ליה רמי בר חמא לרב חסדא תנן שומרי ספיחין בשביעית נוטלין שכרן מתרומת הלשכה ורמינהו (ויקרא כה, ו) לאכלה ולא לשריפה
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raises a contradiction to Rav Ḥisda: We learned the guards of sefiḥin during the Sabbatical collect their wages from the collection of the chamber. And one can raise a contradiction for eating” but not for burning.
llm_translation: Rami ley Rami bar Ḥama to Rav Ḥisda: We learned in a Mishnah: Those who guard the produce of the Sabbatical year may take their wages from the Terumah of the Chamber. And we raise a contradiction: "For eating and not for burning" (Leviticus 25:6).

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רחמנא אמר לך (ויקרא כג, יד) לדורותיכם ואת אמרת תיבטל
human_translation: said to him: The Merciful One said to you throughout your generations” and you say should be canceled
llm_translation: He said to him: The Merciful One said to you (Leviticus 23:14), "Throughout your generations, and you shall not do any work."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ומי קאמינא אנא תיבטל לייתי מדאשתקד בעינא כרמל וליכא
human_translation: said to him: But am I saying should be canceled? Let one bring from the previous year, I require that “fresh ear” and is not
llm_translation: He said to him, "And who am I saying that I should be nullified, bring me a case like that of Carmel, and there is none."

hebrew_text: ולייתי מכרמל דאשתקד אמר קרא (ויקרא ב, יד) כרמל תקריב בעינא כרמל בשעת הקרבה וליכא
human_translation: But let one bring from the young grain of previous year, The verse states: “Fresh ear, you shall bring” I need young grain at the time of offering and is not
llm_translation: And bring from Carmel, as previously stated, the verse says (Leviticus 2:14) "Carmel you shall offer." I need Carmel at the time of offering, and there is none.

hebrew_text: איתמר רבי יוחנן אמר כרמל תקריב ר' אלעזר אומר ראשית קצירך ראשית קצירך ולא סוף קצירך
human_translation: was stated Rabbi Yoḥanan says “Fresh ear, you shall bring,” Rabbi Elazar says “The first of your harvest” the first of your harvest, and not from the last of your harvest,
llm_translation: It was stated: Rabbi Yochanan said, "Bring a Carmel." Rabbi Elazar said, "The first of your harvest, the first of your harvest, and not the end of your harvest."

hebrew_text: מותיב רבה (ויקרא ב, יד) ואם תקריב מנחת בכורים במנחת העומר הכתוב מדבר מהיכן היא באה מן השעורים אתה אומר מן השעורים או אינו אלא מן החיטין
human_translation: Rabba raises an objection “And when you shall bring a meal offering of first fruits The verse is speaking of the omer meal offering. From which does it come? from barley. Do you say from barley, or it only from wheat?
llm_translation: Rabah raises an objection: "And if you bring a meal offering of firstfruits to the meal offering of the Omer, the Scripture speaks. From where does it come? Is it from barley? You say, from barley, or is it rather from wheat?"

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר אומר נאמר (שמות ט, לא) אביב במצרים ונאמר (ויקרא ב, יד) אביב לדורות מה אביב האמור במצרים שעורים אף אביב האמור לדורות אינו בא אלא מן השעורים
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says is stated “in the ear,” with regard to Egypt: and it is stated “in the ear” for generations. Just as “in the ear” that is stated with regard to Egypt barley, so too “in the ear” that is stated for generations barley.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: It is stated (Exodus 9:31) "aviv in Egypt," and it is stated (Leviticus 2:14) "aviv for generations." Just as the aviv mentioned in Egypt is barley, so too the aviv mentioned for generations is nothing other than barley.

hebrew_text: רבי עקיבא אומר מצינו יחיד שמביא חובתו מן החיטין ומביא חובתו מן השעורין ואף ציבור מביא חובתו מן החיטין ומביא חובתו מן השעורין אם אתה אומר מן החיטין לא מצינו ציבור שמביא חובתו מן השעורין
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva says: We found an individual who brings his obligation from wheat, and his obligation from barley, And community that they bring their obligation from wheat, brings their obligation from barley. And if you say comes from wheat, we not found a community that brings their obligation from barley.
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: We find an individual who brings his obligation from wheat and brings his obligation from barley, and even the community brings its obligation from wheat and brings its obligation from barley. If you say from wheat, we do not find a community that brings its obligation from barley.

hebrew_text: דבר אחר אם אתה אומר עומר בא מן החיטין אין שתי הלחם ביכורים אלמא משום ביכורים הוא תיובתא
human_translation: Alternatively, if you say omer comes from wheat, the two loaves not first fruits. Evidently, because first fruits, a conclusive refutation
llm_translation: Another explanation: If you say "omer" comes from wheat, then the two loaves are not firstfruits. This proves that it is due to the firstfruits.

hebrew_text: תנן התם אין מביאין ביכורים חוץ משבעת המינין ולא
human_translation: We learned elsewhere One may bring first fruits only from the seven species But not
llm_translation: We have learned there: One does not bring first fruits except from the seven species, and not.

hebrew_text: מתמרים שבהרים ולא מפירות שבעמקים אמר עולא אם הביא לא קידש
human_translation: from dates that in the mountains, and not from produce that in the valleys. Ulla says: if one did bring he does not consecrate
llm_translation: Palm trees of the mountains and not from the fruits of the valleys. Ulla said: If one brought wine it is not sanctified.

hebrew_text: יתיב רבה וקא אמר לה להא שמעתא איתיביה רבי אחא בר אבא לרבה (ויקרא ב, יב) קרבן ראשית שתהא ראשית לכל המנחות וכן הוא אומר (במדבר כח, כו) בהקריבכם מנחה חדשה לה' בשבועותיכם
human_translation: Rabba sat and stated this halakha . Rabbi Aḥa bar Abba raised an objection to Rabba “A first offering that it is to be the first of all the meal offerings And similarly states when you bring a new meal offering to the Lord”
llm_translation: Rabah was sitting and saying to her this teaching. Rabbi Aḥa bar Abba raised an objection to Rabah: "The offering of first fruits shall be the first of all meal offerings." And so it says (Leviticus 2:12): "The offering of first fruits shall be the first of all meal offerings." And likewise it says (Numbers 28:26): "When you bring a new meal offering to the Lord on your weeks."

hebrew_text: אין לי אלא חדשה של חטים חדשה של שעורים מנין תלמוד לומר חדשה חדשה אם אינו ענין לחדשה של חיטין תנהו ענין לחדשה של שעורים
human_translation: I have only new, of wheat From where new, of barley the verse states “new,” “new,” If is not matter of new of wheat, apply it to the matter of new of barley.
llm_translation: I have only new wheat, new barley. How do we know to say "new, new"? If it is not relevant to new wheat, teach it is relevant to new barley.

hebrew_text: ומנין שתהא קודמת לביכורים תלמוד לומר (שמות לד, כב) וחג שבעות תעשה לך בכורי קציר חטים ואין לי אלא בכורי קציר חטים קציר שעורים מנין תלמוד לאמר (שמות כג, טז) וחג הקציר בכורי מעשיך אשר תזרע בשדה
human_translation: And from where that precede first fruits The verse states: “And you shall make for yourself a festival of Shavuot , the first fruits of the wheat harvest” I have only first fruits of the wheat harvest. From where the barley harvest? The verse states “And the festival of the harvest, the first fruits of your labors, which you will sow in the field”
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that the Festival of Weeks should precede the First Fruits? The Talmud teaches (Exodus 34:22), "And the Feast of Weeks you shall make for yourself, the first fruits of the wheat harvest." And I have only the first fruits of the wheat harvest. How do I know that this includes the first fruits of the barley harvest? The Talmud teaches (Exodus 23:16), "And the Feast of the Harvest, the first fruits of your labors which you sow in the field."

hebrew_text: ואין לי אלא שתזרע עלו מאליהן מנין תלמוד לומר בשדה
human_translation: I have only that you sowed, From where that sprouted by themselves? The verse states: “In the field”
llm_translation: And I have nothing except that you should sow them from their place. How do we know this? To say "in the field."

hebrew_text: ואין לי אלא בשדה מנין לרבות שבגג ושבחורבה ושבעציץ ושבספינה תלמוד לאמר (במדבר יח, יג) בכורי כל אשר בארצם
human_translation: I have only in a field. From where to include that on a roof, or that in a ruin, or that in a flowerpot, or that on a ship? The verse states “The first fruit of all that grows in their land,
llm_translation: "And I have only the law of in a field, how do I know to include cases of on a roof, and in a ruin, and in a flowerpot, and in a ship? The Talmud teaches us to say (Numbers 18:13), 'The first ripe fruits of all that is in their land.'"

hebrew_text: מנין שתהא קודמת לנסכים ופירות האילן נאמר כאן בכורי מעשיך ונאמר להלן (שמות כג, טז) באספך את מעשיך מן השדה מה להלן נסכים ופירות אילן אף כאן נסכים ופירות אילן
human_translation: From where that is to precede the libations and fruits of the tree? It is stated here, “The first fruits of your labors” and it is stated there “When you gather in the products of your labors from the field.” Just as there, the libations and the fruit of the tree, so too, here, the libations and the fruit of the tree.
llm_translation: From where is it derived that precedence should be given to wine libations and the fruits of the tree? It is stated here, "the first of your produce," and it is stated there (Exodus 23:16), "when you gather in the produce of your land." Just as there, it refers to wine libations and the fruits of the tree, so too here it refers to wine libations and the fruits of the tree.

hebrew_text: קתני מיהא שבגג שבחורבה שבעציץ ושבספינה סיפא אתאן למנחות
human_translation: In any event, it was taught that on a roof, that in a ruin, that in a flowerpot, or that on a ship. the latter clause we come to meal offerings.
llm_translation: It was taught: "From the fact that it states 'on the roof of the ruin, in a flowerpot, and on a ship,' the latter clause comes to include meal-offerings."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב אדא בר אהבה אי הכי היינו דכתיב (במדבר יח, יא) כל טהור בביתך יאכל אותו ואי מנחות לזכרי כהונה הוא דמיתאכלן
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava objects to this: If so, that which is written “Any pure member of your household may eat of it,” but if meal offerings, as they are to be eaten by male priests.
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava objects to this: If so, then this is what is written (Numbers 18:11): "Every pure one in your house may eat it." And if it is referring to male priests, they are the ones who may eat them.

hebrew_text: אמר רב משרשיא תרי קראי כתיבי (במדבר יח, יג) לך יהיה וכתיב כל טהור בביתך יאכל אותו הא כיצד כאן בביכורים כאן במנחות
human_translation: Rav Mesharshiyya said: two verses are written, shall be yours” And it is written “Any pure member of your household may eat of it,” How these Here, concerns the first fruits, there, concerns meal offerings,
llm_translation: Rav Mesharshia said: Two verses are written (Numbers 18:13) "It shall be for you" and it is written "Every pure one in your house shall eat it." How so? Here regarding first fruits, and here regarding meal offerings.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר כוליה במנחות וסיפא דקרא אתאן ללחמי תודה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said its entirety concerns meal offerings, but the latter clause of the verse we come to loaves of a thanks offering,
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: entirely with meal-offerings, and the latter part of the verse we come for the loaves of thanksgiving.

hebrew_text: בפלוגתא ר' יוחנן אמר אם הביא לא קדש ריש לקיש אמר אם הביא קדש נעשה ככחוש בקדשים
human_translation: with regard to the dispute Rabbi Yoḥanan says: if one did bring he does not consecrate Reish Lakish says: If one did bring he has consecrated they are regarded just like a gaunt with regard to sacrificial
llm_translation: In the dispute, Rabbi Yochanan said, "If he brought an offering not sanctified." Reish Lakish said, "If he brought an offering sanctified, it is done as 'like the copper in the holy items.'"

hebrew_text: בשלמא ריש לקיש כדאמר טעמא אלא רבי יוחנן מאי טעמא אמר רבי אלעזר רבי יוחנן חזאי בחלום מילתא מעלייתא אמינא אמר קרא (דברים כו, ב) מראשית ולא כל ראשית (דברים כו, ב) מארצך ולא כל ארצך
human_translation: Granted, Reish Lakish as he stated the reason But Rabbi Yoḥanan, what is the reason Rabbi Elazar said: I see Rabbi Yoḥanan in a dream, I am saying a proper matter. The verse states from the first but not all the first from your land.” but not all your land.
llm_translation: In accordance with Rish Lakish as he said, the reason is as follows. But Rabbi Yochanan, what is the reason? Rabbi Elazar said, Rabbi Yochanan saw in a dream a matter from above, and I say, he said a verse: "From the beginning" and not all beginning, "of your land" and not all your land.

hebrew_text: וריש לקיש האי ארצך מאי עביד ליה מיבעי ליה לכדתניא רבן גמליאל בר רבי אומר נאמר כאן ארץ ונאמר להלן ארץ מה להלן שבח ארץ אף כאן שבח ארץ
human_translation: And Reish Lakish, what does he use this “your land”? is necessary for that which is taught Rabban Gamliel, son of Rabbi says: land” is stated here and “land” is stated there just as there, praise of Eretz so too, here, praise of Eretz
llm_translation: Reish Lakish: What does this verse "your land" teach him? He needs it for what was taught in a Baraita: Rabban Gamliel the son of Rabbi says, it is stated here "land" and it is stated there "land," just as there it is praise of the land, so too here it is praise of the land.

hebrew_text: ואידך ארץ מארץ
human_translation: And the other land” “from land,”
llm_translation: And the other opinion is "land from land."

hebrew_text: ואידך ארץ מארץ לא משמע ליה
human_translation: And the other one, He does not learn land” “from land.”
llm_translation: And the other opinion is that "land" refers to land, it does not listen to him.

hebrew_text: תני חדא שבגג ושבחורבה שבעציץ ושבספינה מביא וקורא ותניא אידך מביא ואינו קורא
human_translation: It is taught one that on a roof, or that in a ruin, or that in a flowerpot, or that on a ship, brings and recites it is taught another brings but does not recite
llm_translation: It was taught: One who is on the roof, in a ruin, in a ship, may bring a Torah scroll and read. And it was taught in another Baraita: One may bring a Torah scroll but not read.

hebrew_text: בשלמא ריש לקיש גג אגג לא קשיא הא בגג דמערה הא בגג דבית
human_translation: Granted Reish Lakish, a roof by a roof not difficult. this is referring to a roof of a cave, that is referring to a roof of a house.
llm_translation: In accordance with the opinion of Reish Lakish, the roof of Agag is not problematic. This is the case with the roof of a cave, but with the roof of a house.

hebrew_text: חורבה אחורבה לא קשיא כאן בחורבה עבודה כאן בחורבה שאינה עבודה
human_translation: a ruin by a ruin not difficult. here, is referring to a cultivated ruin, there, is referring to an uncultivated ruin.
llm_translation: Churbah achurbah, lo kashya. Kan b'churbah avodah, kan b'churbah she'einah avodah.

hebrew_text: עציץ אעציץ לא קשיא כאן בנקובה כאן בשאינו נקובה
human_translation: a flowerpot by a flowerpot not difficult. here, is referring to a perforated there, is referring to an unperforated
llm_translation: Potter I will potter not difficult here in a perforated vessel here in one that is not perforated.

hebrew_text: ספינה אספינה לא קשיא כאן בספינה של עץ כאן בספינה של חרס
human_translation: a ship by a ship not difficult. here, is referring to a ship of wood, there, is referring to a ship of earthenware.
llm_translation: Ship, I gathered it, not difficult. Here, with a ship of wood, here, with a ship of clay.

hebrew_text: אלא לרבי יוחנן קשיא
human_translation: But according to Rabbi Yoḥanan, difficult,
llm_translation: Rather, to Rabbi Yochanan it is difficult.

hebrew_text: תנאי היא דתניא שבגג ושבחורבה מביא וקורא שבעציץ ושבספינה אינו מביא כל עיקר:
human_translation: is tanna’im as it is taught that on a roof, or that in a ruin, brings and recites that in a flowerpot, or that on a ship, does not bring at all.
llm_translation: It is a Tannaitic teaching as it was taught: "One may bring the Four Species on a roof and in a ruin, and recite the blessing, but in a pot and in a ship, one does not bring them at all."

hebrew_text: וכולן אינן באות אלא מן המובחר כו': אמרי ליה יוחנא וממרא למשה תבן אתה מכניס לעפריים אמר להו אמרי אינשי למתא ירקא ירקא שקול:
human_translation: And all come only from the optimal Yoḥana and Mamre, said to Moses: you are bringing straw to Afarayim? said to them: people say: To a city herbs, take herbs.
llm_translation: And all of them do not come except from the choicest, etc. They said to him, Yochanan and Mar, "Moses, do you bring straw into the barns?" He said to them, "People say to the city, 'Each stalk of vegetable is weighed.'"

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אין מביאין לא מבית הזבלים ולא מבית השלחים ולא מבית האילן ואם הביא כשר
human_translation: one may not bring from a fertilized field, nor from an irrigated field, nor from a field of trees, But if did bring fit.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One does not bring the water for the ceremony of the Sotah neither from the house of the refuse, nor from the house of the baths, nor from the house of the terebinth. And if one brought from there, it is valid.

hebrew_text: כיצד הוא עושה נרה שנה ראשונה ובשנה שניה זורעה קודם לפסח שבעים יום והוא עושה סולת מרובה
human_translation: How does one produce He plows first year, and in the second year, he sows it seventy days before Passover, and it produces an abundance of fine, flour.
llm_translation: How does one make the lamp? The first year, and in the second year, he plants it seventy days before Passover, and he makes fine flour.

hebrew_text: כיצד בודק הגזבר מכניס ידו לתוכן עלה בה אבק פסולה עד שינפנה
human_translation: How does inspect The treasurer inserts his hand into powder covers it, unfit, until one sifts it
llm_translation: How does the treasurer inspect? He inserts his hand into them; if dust rises, the offering is invalid until it is cleared.

hebrew_text: ואם התליעה פסולה:
human_translation: And if became wormy, unfit
llm_translation: And if the tekiyah is invalid:

hebrew_text: גמ׳ כיצד עושה נרה שנה ראשונה איבעיא להו היכי קאמר נרה שנה ראשונה ושניה נרה וזורעה או דלמא נרה שנה ראשונה ושניה זורעה בלא נרה
human_translation: How does one produce He plows first year, A dilemma was raised before What saying? he plows first and second he plows it and sows it? Or perhaps he plows first and second he sows it without plowing it.
llm_translation: Gemara: How does one make the first year's candle? It was asked: What is it saying, "the first year's candle," and the second one, he lights and plants it? Or perhaps, "the first year's candle," and the second one, he plants without lighting it.

hebrew_text: תא שמע דתניא אמר רבי יוסי אף חיטי כרזיים וכפר אחים אלמלא סמוכות לירושלים היו מביאין מהן לפי שאין מביאין את העומר אלא מן השדות המודרמות והמנונרות לכך שבהן חמה זורחת ומהן חמה שוקעת
human_translation: Come hear as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Also grain Kerazayim and Kefar Aḥim, if only had been close to Jerusalem, they would have brought from them As that one brings the omer only from the southern fields and that were plowed for that as upon such sun rises and from those sun sets.
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei said, "Even wheat from Karzayim and Capar Ahim, were it not for their proximity to Jerusalem, they would bring from them, for they only bring the Omer from the fields that are arranged and shaded, because the sun rises over them and sets over them."

hebrew_text: כיצד עושה נרה שנה ראשונה ושניה חורש ושונה וזורעה קודם לפסח שבעים יום כדי שתהא סמוכה לחמה ועושה קנה זרת ושיבולת זרתיים
human_translation: How does one produce He plows first year, and second plows and repeats and he sows it seventy days before Passover. in order that will be close to sun and produce a stalk a handspan and ear two handspans.
llm_translation: How does one make the lamp? The first year, he plows, sows, and prunes it. He plants it before Passover seventy days so that it will be close to its heat. And he makes a stalk of wheat and two barley grains.

hebrew_text: וקוצר ומעמר ודש וזורה ובורר וטוחן ומרקד ומביא אצל גזבר וגזבר מכניס ידו לתוכה אם עלתה בה אבק אומר לו חזור ונפה אותה שניה משום רבי נתן אמרו גזבר סך ידו שמן ומכניס לתוכה עד שמעלה כל אבקה
human_translation: And reaps and gathers and threshes and winnows and sorts and grinds and sifts and brings to the treasurer. And treasurer inserts his hand into it If powder covers it, says to Go back and sift it a second say in the name of Rabbi Natan the treasurer douses his hand oil and inserts it into until all of its powder will be brought up.
llm_translation: And he harvests, and gathers, and threshes, and winnows, and selects, and grinds, and sifts, and brings to the treasurer. And the treasurer inserts his hand into it; if dust rises from it, he says to him, "Go back and blow it away a second time." In the name of Rabbi Nathan they said: The treasurer rubs his hand with oil and inserts it into it until all its dust rises.

hebrew_text: קתני מיהת חורש ושונה
human_translation: In any event, the teaches plows and repeats
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: "One who plows and repeats."

hebrew_text: ולטעמיך מתניתין לא קתני שונה
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, the mishna does not teach repeats
llm_translation: And according to your reasoning, the Mishnah does not teach "shoneh."

hebrew_text: ברייתא קתני שונה
human_translation: the baraita teaches repeats
llm_translation: A braita teaches: "Shoneh."

hebrew_text: הא לא קשיא כאן בעבודה כאן בשאינה עבודה
human_translation: This not difficult; here, is referring to a cultivated there, is referring to an uncultivated
llm_translation: This is not difficult here in Avodah, here in She'einah Avodah.

hebrew_text: מאי הוי עלה תא שמע דתניא ניר חציה וזורע חציה ניר חציה וזורע חציה
human_translation: What was about Come hear which is taught one plows half of and sows half of plows half of and sows half of
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Havi Aleh Ta Shema"? As it was taught in a Baraita: One plows half and sows half, plows half and sows half.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן אין מביאין את העומר אלא מן השדות המודרמות שבארץ ישראל שבהן חמה זורחת ומהן חמה שוקעת
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: One brings the omer only from southern fields of Eretz Yisrael, as upon those sun rises and from those sun sets.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: The Omer offering is brought only from the fields that are irrigated in the Land of Israel, from which the sun rises and into which the sun sets.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי אבא שאול אומר עומר היה בא מבקעת בית מקלה כבת ג' סאין היתה ושדה מודרמת היתה ובה חמה זורחת וממנה חמה שוקעת ניר חציה וזורע חציה ניר חציה וזורע חציה
human_translation: This is also taught Abba Shaul says the omer would come from the valley of Beit Mikle. was about three se’a , and it was a southern field, and sun would rise upon it, and sun would set from it. plowed half of and sowed half of plowed half of and sowed half of
llm_translation: It was taught: Abba Saul also says, "An omer was coming from the valley of Beit Makle, like the size of three se'ahs, and it was a field in Modramta, and the sun was rising over it, and from it the sun was setting. One plows half of it and sows half of it, plows half of it and sows half of it."

hebrew_text: רב חלקיה בר טובי הוה ליה קרנא דארעא ניר חציה וזרע חציה ניר חציה וזרע חציה ועבדה על חד תרי ומזבין להו לחיטי לסמידא:
human_translation: Rav Ḥilkiya bar Tovi had a tract of land. He plowed half of and sowed half of he plowed half of and sowed half of it. And produced twice and he sold wheat as fine flour [ lismida ]
llm_translation: Rav Chelkiah bar Tovi had a field, half of it was plowed and half of it was sown, half of it was plowed and half of it was sown, and he worked on it for one or two years, and they would sell it for wheat or barley.

hebrew_text: ואם התליעה פסולה: תנו רבנן סולת שהתליעה רובה פסולה וחיטין שהתליעו רובן פסולות בעי רבי ירמיה ברוב חטה או ברוב סאה תיקו:
human_translation: And if became wormy, unfit The Sages taught Fine flour the majority of which became wormy unfit. And wheat the majority of which became wormy unfit, Rabbi Yirmeya asks: majority of wheat or majority of a se’a unfit? shall stand
llm_translation: And if the waving is invalid: The Rabbis taught: Fine flour, if its waving is mostly invalid, it is invalid. And wheat, if most of them were waved invalidly, they are invalid. Rabbi Jeremiah asked: With the majority of wheat or with the majority of a se'ah? This remains undecided.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא הקדישן מהו שילקה עליהן משום בעל מום כיון דפסיל כבעל מום דמי או דלמא אין בעל מום אלא בבהמה תיקו:
human_translation: Rava asks: one consecrated what is he should be flogged for them due to a flawed since unfit, comparable to a blemished Or perhaps, a flawed applies only to an animal. shall stand
llm_translation: Rava asked: What is the law regarding consecrated animals that one should remove from them due to a blemish, since a disqualified animal is considered as if it had a blemish, or perhaps a blemish only applies to animals? This remains unresolved.

hebrew_text: תנן התם כל עץ שנמצא בו תולעת פסול לגבי מזבח אמר שמואל לא שנו אלא לח אבל יבש גוררו וכשר
human_translation: We learned elsewhere any log in which a worm is found unfit for on the altar. Shmuel says: They taught only a wet But a dry scrapes away, and fit
llm_translation: We learned there: Any tree in which a worm is found is invalid for the altar. Shmuel said: They only taught this regarding a moist worm, but if it is dry, one may remove it and it is valid.

hebrew_text: בעי רבא הקדישו מהו שילקה עליו משום בעל מום כיון דפסול כבעל מום דמי או דלמא אין בעל מום אלא בבהמה תיקו:
human_translation: Rava asks: one consecrated what is he should be flogged for it due to a flawed since unfit, comparable to a blemished Or perhaps, a flawed applies only to an animal. shall stand
llm_translation: Rava asked: If one consecrated an animal what is the law if it develops a blemish, is it to be redeemed on account of being blemished, since it is disqualified like a blemished animal, or perhaps a blemished animal is only subject to redemption in the case of a beast? This remains undecided.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ תקוע אלפא לשמן אבא שאול אומר שניה לה רגב בעבר הירדן כל הארצות היו כשרות אלא מיכן היו מביאין
human_translation: Tekoa primary of oil Abba Shaul says: Secondary to is Regev on the bank of the Jordan All the regions were valid but from here they would bring
llm_translation: Mishnah: Tekoa blew a thousand for the anointing oil. Abba Saul says: "Its second was for Mount Regav across the Jordan. All lands were valid except from here they would bring."

hebrew_text: אין מביאין לא מבית הזבלים ולא מבית השלחים ולא מן מה שנזרע ביניהם ואם הביא כשר אין מביאין אנפקטן ואם הביא כשר אין מביאין מן הגרגרין שנשרו במים ולא מן הכבשים ולא מן השלוקים ואם הביא פסול:
human_translation: One may not bring from a fertilized grove, nor from an irrigated grove, nor from was sown between But if one did bring valid. One may not bring unripe olives [ anpiktan ], but if one did bring valid. One may not bring from olives that were soaked in water, nor from pickled nor from boiled and one did bring not valid.
llm_translation: One does not bring from the dung heap, nor from the pigeon coop, nor from that which is sown between them. And if one brought, if it is valid, one does not bring from the anpaktan. And if one brought, if it is valid, one does not bring from the grains that were soaked in water, nor from the kernels, nor from the boiled ones. And if one brought, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ (שמואל ב יד, ב) וישלח יואב תקועה ויקח משם אשה חכמה מאי שנא תקועה אמר רבי יוחנן מתוך שרגילין בשמן זית חכמה מצויה בהן:
human_translation: “And Joab sent to Tekoa, and fetched from there a wise woman” What is different Tekoa Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Since are accustomed to olive oil, wisdom is prevalent there.
llm_translation: Gemara (Shmuel 2:14, 2): And Yoav sent to Tekoa and took from there a wise woman. What is the difference of Tekoa? Rabbi Yochanan said: Because they are accustomed to olive oil, wisdom is found among them.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן (דברים לג, כד) וטובל בשמן רגלו זה חלקו של אשר שמושך שמן כמעין אמרו פעם אחת נצרכו להן אנשי לודקיא בשמן מינו להן פולמוסטוס אחד אמרו לו לך והבא לנו שמן במאה ריבוא
human_translation: The Sages taught and immerse his foot in oil” This the portion of Asher, as the oil flows like a spring. They said once, the people of Laodicea were in need of oil. They appointed messenger [ polmostos ] said to him: Go and bring us one million of oil.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: (Deuteronomy 33:24) "And he shall dip his foot in oil." This refers to the portion of Asher, who draws oil like a spring. They said once the people of Ludikia needed oil from their own kind, so they sent one Polmostos to bring them oil worth a hundred thousand.

hebrew_text: הלך לירושלים אמרו לו לך לצור הלך לצור אמרו לו לך לגוש חלב הלך לגוש חלב אמרו לו לך אצל פלוני לשדה הלז ומצאו שהיה עוזק תחת זיתיו אמר לו יש לך שמן במאה ריבוא שאני צריך אמר לו המתן לי עד שאסיים מלאכתי המתין עד שסיים מלאכתו
human_translation: He went to Jerusalem They said to him: Go to Tyre, He went to Tyre, They said to him: Go to Gush Ḥalav, He went to Gush Ḥalav, they said to him: Go to so-and-so, to that field. and found hoeing [ ozek ] under his olive trees. said to Do you have one million of oil that I need? said to him: Wait for me until I complete my labor, waited until completed his labor.
llm_translation: He went to Jerusalem, they said to him, go to Tyre. He went to Tyre, they said to him, go to Gush Halav. He went to Gush Halav, they said to him, go to the field of so-and-so. And they found him pressing olives beneath his olive tree. He said to him, do you have oil in a hundred thousand? He said, I need. He said to him, wait for me until I finish my work. He waited until he finished his work.

hebrew_text: לאחר שסיים מלאכתו הפשיל כליו לאחוריו והיה מסקל ובא בדרך אמר לו יש לך שמן במאה ריבוא כמדומה אני ששחוק שחקו בי היהודים כיון שהגיע לעירו הוציאה לו שפחתו קומקמום של חמין ורחץ בו ידיו ורגליו הוציאה לו ספל של זהב מליאה שמן וטבל בו ידיו ורגליו לקיים מה שנאמר וטובל בשמן רגלו
human_translation: After he completed his labor, slung his tools behind him, and he was removing stones as he went along the path. He said to you have one million of oil that I need? It seems to me that the Jews are making a laughingstock of me When he reached his city, maidservant brought out to him a kettle [ kumkemos ] of hot and he washed his hands and his feet. she brought out to him a golden basin filled with oil, in which he immersed his hands and feet, in fulfillment of that is stated “And immerse his foot in oil”
llm_translation: After he finished his work, he removed his tools behind him and was walking. He was laughing. He came on the way. He said to him, "Do you have oil in a hundred thousand like me?" The Jews laughed at him. When he arrived at his city, his maidservant brought him a pitcher of hot water. He washed his hands and feet with it. She brought him a golden basin full of oil. He dipped his hands and feet in it to fulfill what is said, "And he shall dip his foot in oil."

hebrew_text: לאחר שאכלו ושתו מדד לו שמן במאה ריבוא אמר לו כלום אתה צריך ליותר אמר לו הן אלא שאין לי דמים אמר לו אם אתה רוצה ליקח קח ואני אלך עמך ואטול דמיו מדד לו שמן בשמונה עשר ריבוא אמרו לא הניח אותו האיש לא סוס ולא פרד ולא גמל ולא חמור בארץ ישראל שלא שכרו
human_translation: After they ate and drank, measured out one million of oil. said to him: you do not need any more said to him: Yes, but I do not have money said to him: If you wish to take take and I will go with you and collect the money measured out 180,000 of oil. said: he left neither a horse, nor a mule, nor a camel, nor a donkey in Eretz Yisrael that he did not rent
llm_translation: After they ate and drank, he measured for him oil in a hundred quarters. He said to him, "Do you need anything more?" He said to him, "Yes, but I do not have money." He said to him, "If you want to take it, take it, and I will go with you and take his blood." He measured for him oil in eighteen quarters. They said, "This man did not leave anything, neither horse nor mule nor camel nor donkey in the land of Israel that he did not hire."

hebrew_text: כיון שהגיע לעירו יצאו אנשי עירו לקלסו אמר להם לא לי קלסוני אלא לזה שבא עמי שמדד לי שמן במאה ריבוא והרי נושה בי בשמונה עשרה ריבוא לקיים מה שנאמר (משלי יג, ז) יש מתעשר ואין כל מתרושש והון רב:
human_translation: When reached his city, the people of his city came out to praise him [ lekaleso ] said to them: Do not praise me. Rather, this who has come with me, as he measured for me one million of oil, and he extended a debt to me for 180,000 of oil. in fulfillment of that is stated: “There is one who seems to be rich, yet has nothing; there is one who seems to be poor, yet has great wealth”
llm_translation: When he arrived at his city, the people of his city went out to curse him. He said to them, "Do not curse me, but rather curse the one who came with me, who measured out oil for me in a hundred measures, yet it turned out to be only eighteen measures, in order to fulfill what is said, 'There are those who become rich yet have nothing, and those who become poor yet have great wealth.'"

hebrew_text: אין מביאין לא מבית הזבלים: והתניא אין מביאין אנפקטן
human_translation: One may not bring from a fertilized grove. But isn’t it taught One may not bring unripe olives,
llm_translation: They do not bring from the garbage dump: And it was taught: They do not bring Anpaktan.

hebrew_text: ואם הביא פסול (והתניא ואם הביא כשר) מפני שהוא שרף
human_translation: but if one did bring it is not valid. But isn’t it taught because it is sap
llm_translation: And if he brought an offering that is invalid (and it was taught: "And if he brought an offering that is valid") because it is burnt.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יוסף לא קשיא הא ר' חייא הא ר' שמעון בר רבי דר' חייא זריק ליה ור' שמעון בר רבי מטבל [ביה] (ליה) וסימניך עשירים מקמצין:
human_translation: Rav Yosef said: not difficult This Rabbi Ḥiyya, that Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi As Rabbi Ḥiyya would toss away, and Rabbi Shimon, son of Rabbi would dip And your mnemonic wealthy are parsimonious,
llm_translation: Rav Yosef said: It is not difficult - here we are dealing with Rabbi Chiya, and here we are dealing with Rabbi Shimon the son of Rabbi. Rabbi Chiya sprinkles the water on the person afflicted with tzara'at, and Rabbi Shimon the son of Rabbi dips the hyssop in the water. And your mnemonic is: "Rich people are stingy."

hebrew_text: (אסתר ב, יב) ששה חדשים בשמן המור מאי שמן המור רב הונא בר חייא אמר סטכתא ר' ירמיה בר אבא אמר שמן זית שלא הביא שליש:
human_translation: Six months with oil of myrrh, What is “oil of myrrh”? Rav Huna bar Ḥiyya says: setakhta . Rav Yirmeya bar Abba says: an oil from olives that have not reached one-third
llm_translation: Esther 2:12 "Six months with oil of myrrh." What is "oil of myrrh"? Rav Huna bar Chiya said "stakhta." Rabbi Yirmeya bar Abba said "olive oil that did not bring a third."

hebrew_text: תניא (נמי הכי) רבי יהודה אומר אנפקנון שמן זית שלא הביא שליש למה סכין אותו שמשיר את השיער ומעדן את הבשר:
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi Yehuda says: anpikanon olive oil that have not reached one-third why do spread it because it removes the hair and pampers the skin.
llm_translation: It was taught: (Similarly) Rabbi Yehuda says, "Anafknon olive oil that did not bring a third (of its volume), why (is it called) a knife? That (is) what detangles the hair and nourishes the flesh."

hebrew_text: אין מביאין מן הגרגרין שנשרו במים תנו רבנן שמן זית כבוש שלוק שרוי ושל שמרים ושל ריח רע לא יביא ואם הביא פסול
human_translation: One may not bring from olives that were soaked in water, The Sages taught Olive oil pickled boiled soaked and from sediment, and with a foul odor may not be brought and if one did bring not valid.
llm_translation: We do not bring from the dried figs that were soaked in water. The Sages taught: Olive oil that is pressed, soaked, and from olives that are bitter, one should not bring. And if one brought, it is invalid.

hebrew_text: בעי רבה הקדישו מהו שילקה עליו משום בעל מום כיון דפסול כבעל מום דמי או דלמא אין בעל מום אלא בבהמה תיקו:
human_translation: Rava asks: consecrated what is he should be flogged for it due to a flawed since it unfit, comparable to a blemished Or perhaps a flawed applies only to an animal. shall stand
