llm_translation: Rabah inquired: If one consecrated an animal what is the law if it should develop a blemish, is it to be redeemed on account of a blemish? Since it is disqualified, is it considered as if it had a blemish, or perhaps a blemish applies only to an animal? This remains undecided.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שלשה זיתים הן ובהן שלשה שלשה שמנים
human_translation: There are three olives and in each them, three oils
llm_translation: Mishnah: Three olives they are, and in them three three se'ahs.

hebrew_text: הזית הראשון מגרגרו בראש הזית וכותש ונותן לתוך הסל ר' יהודה אומר סביבות הסל זה ראשון
human_translation: the first olive One picks at the top of the olive and crushes and places inside basket Rabbi Yehuda says: surrounding the basket. This is the first
llm_translation: The first olive, its pit at the top of the olive, one crushes it and places it inside the basket. Rabbi Yehuda says: around the basket, this is the first one.

hebrew_text: [חזר] וטוען בקורה ר' יהודה אומר באבנים זה שני
human_translation: one then presses down with beam Rabbi Yehuda says: by stones This is the second
llm_translation: He returned and claims with a beam. Rabbi Yehuda says: with stones, this is two.

hebrew_text: חזר וטחן וטען זה שלישי
human_translation: One then ground and pressed down this is the third
llm_translation: He returned and ground and loaded, this is the third.

hebrew_text: הראשון למנורה והשאר למנחות
human_translation: The first for the Candelabrum, and the rest for meal offerings.
llm_translation: The first portion for the Menorah, and the rest for the Meal Offerings.

hebrew_text: השני מגרגרו בראש הגג וכותש ונותן לתוך הסל רבי יהודה אומר סביבות הסל זה ראשון
human_translation: the second One picks on the rooftop. And one crushes and places into basket, Rabbi Yehuda says: surrounding the basket. This first
llm_translation: The second person crushes the olives on the roof and presses them, and puts the oil into the basket. Rabbi Yehuda says: Around the basket is considered the first pressing.

hebrew_text: טוען בקורה ורבי יהודה אומר באבנים זה שני
human_translation: One presses down with beam, And Rabbi Yehuda says: by stones This second
llm_translation: Claims in the beam, and Rabbi Yehuda says in stones, this is two.

hebrew_text: חזר וטחן וטען זה שלישי
human_translation: One then ground and pressed down this third
llm_translation: He returned and ground and loaded, this is the third.

hebrew_text: הראשון למנורה והשאר למנחות
human_translation: The first for the Candelabrum, and the rest for meal offerings.
llm_translation: The first portion for the menorah, and the rest for the meal offerings.

hebrew_text: שלישי עוטנו בבית הבד עד שילקה ומעלהו ומנגבו בראש הגג כותש ונותן לתוך הסל רבי יהודה אומר סביבות הסל זה ראשון
human_translation: third One packs it into a vat [ oteno ] in the olive press [ beit habbad ] until it softens, and one raises up and dries it on the rooftop one crushes and places into basket, Rabbi Yehuda says: surrounding the basket. This the first
llm_translation: Third day he wraps it in the house of linen until it dries, and he brings it up and presses its south side on the roof, squeezes and puts it into the basket. Rabbi Yehudah says: Around the basket, this is the first.

hebrew_text: טוען בקורה רבי יהודה אומר באבנים זה שני
human_translation: One presses down with beam, And Rabbi Yehuda says: by stones This second
llm_translation: Claims in the roof. Rabbi Yehuda says, "With stones, this is two."

hebrew_text: חזר וטחן וטען זה שלישי
human_translation: One would then grind and press down this third
llm_translation: He returned and ground and loaded, this is the third.

hebrew_text: הראשון למנורה והשאר למנחות:
human_translation: The first for the Candelabrum, and the rest for meal offerings.
llm_translation: The first portion for the Menorah, and the rest for the Meal Offerings.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ איבעיא להו מגרגרו תנן או מגלגלו תנן
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before we learn one picks [ megargero ], or we learn one allows to ripen [ megalgelo ],
llm_translation: Gemara: It was asked of them: Did we learn "from its pit" or "from its wheel"?

hebrew_text: תא שמע דתניא שמן זית מזיתו מכאן אמרו זית ראשון מגלגלו בראש הזית וכונסו לבית הבד וטוחנו בריחים ונותנו בסלין שמן היוצא ממנו זה היה ראשון
human_translation: Come hear which is taught oil of an olive” from their olive tree, From here said first olive one allows to ripen [ megalgelo ], and brings it into the olive press, and grinds it with a millstone and places it in baskets, and this oil that would flow from it would be first
llm_translation: Come and hear, as it was taught: Olive oil from its olives, from here they said: the first olive, its first pressing is at the top of the olive, and they gather it into the house of the press, and they crush it with beams, and they place it in baskets. The oil that comes out of it, this was the first.

hebrew_text: טען בקורה שמן היוצא ממנו זה היה שני וחזר ופרק טחן וטען זה היה שלישי הראשון למנורה והשאר למנחות וכן זית שני
human_translation: one presses down with beam. oil that flows from it, this would be second then one would remove and grind and press down this would be third The first for the Candelabrum, and the rest for meal offerings. And similarly second olive
llm_translation: He loaded the beam with oil that came out of it, this was the second, and he returned and ground. He loaded, this was the third, the first for the menorah, and the rest for the meal offerings. And similarly, the second olive.

hebrew_text: וזית שלישי עוטנו בבית הבד עד שילקה ומעלה לראש הגג ועושה אותו כמין תמרה עד שיזובו מימיו וכונסו לבית הבד וטוחנו בריחים ונותנו בסלין ושמן היוצא ממנו זה היה ראשון
human_translation: And third olive is packed into a vat in the olive press, until it softens, and one raises up to the roof and makes it a sort of heap, until the fluid flows away. And one brings it to the olive press and grinds it with a millstone and places it into baskets. oil that would flow from it, this would be first
llm_translation: And a third olive, they wrap it in the house of linen until it rots, and they bring it up to the top of the roof, and they make it like a date palm until its water oozes out, and they gather it to the house of linen, and they grind it with spices, and they put it in baskets, and the oil that comes out of it, that was the first.

hebrew_text: טען בקורה שמן היוצא ממנו זה היה שני פרק חזר וטחן וטען זה היה שלישי הראשון למנורה והשאר למנחות
human_translation: one presses down with beam. oil that would flow from it, this would be second And then one would remove and grind and press down this would be third The first for the Candelabrum, and the rest for meal offerings.
llm_translation: He loaded the beam with oil that came out of it, this was the second; he returned and ground, and loaded, this was the third. The first was for the menorah, and the rest for the meal offerings.

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה אומר לא היה טוחנו בריחים אלא כותשו במכתשת ולא היה טוען בקורה אלא באבנים ולא היה נותנו בסלין אלא לתוך סביבות הסל
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One does not grind with a millstone; rather, one crushes it in a mortar. And one does not press down with beam; rather, with stones. And one does not place into the baskets; rather, around the basket.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: He did not grind spices with a mortar, but crushed them with a pestle; and he did not carry a beam, but stones; and he did not place it in a basket, but into the vicinity of the basket.

hebrew_text: הא גופא קשיא כותש מני רבי יהודה היא תוך הסל אתאן לרבנן
human_translation: This itself difficult, whose crushed? It is Rabbi Yehuda. inside of the basket, we arrive at the Rabbis
llm_translation: This itself difficult pressing from Rabbi Yehuda she inside the basket came to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: האי תנא סבר לה כותיה בחדא ופליג עליה בחדא:
human_translation: This tanna holds in accordance with with regard to one but disagrees with him with regard to another
llm_translation: This Tanna holds that he (the husband) thinks of her (the wife) as one (i.e., as if she is already married to him) and argues with her (the wife) as one (i.e., as if she is not yet married to him).

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הראשון שבראשון אין למעלה הימנו השני שבראשון והראשון שבשני שוין השלישי שבראשון והשני שבשני והראשון שבשלישי שוין השלישי שבשני והשני שבשלישי שוין השלישי שבשלישי אין למטה הימנו
human_translation: the first that is from the first there is none superior to it. The second that is from the first and the first that is from the second equal The third that is from the first and the second that is from the second and the first that is from the third equal The third that is from the second and the second that is from the third equal the third that is from the third there is none inferior to it.
llm_translation: Mishnah: The first in the first, there is none higher than him. The second in the first, and the first in the second, are equal. The third in the first, and the second in the second, and the first in the third, are equal. The third in the second, and the second in the third, and the first in the third, are equal. The third in the third, there is none lower than him.

hebrew_text: אף כל המנחות היו בדין שיטענו שמן זית זך מה מנורה שאינה לאכילה טעונה שמן זית זך מנחות שהן לאכילה אינו דין שיטענו שמן זית זך תלמוד לאמר (שמות כז, כ) זך כתית למאור ואין זך כתית למנחות
human_translation: Also, all the meal offerings, it was logical that they should require refined olive oil, if Candelabrum, whose is not to be consumed requires refined olive oil, meal offerings, which to be consumed is it not logical that they should require refined olive oil? the verse states: “Refined pounded for illumination” but there is no refined pounded for meal offerings.
llm_translation: Even all the meal offerings were in the law that they should be mixed with pure olive oil. Just as the menorah, which is not for consumption, requires pure olive oil, meal offerings which are for consumption do not require that they be mixed with pure olive oil. It is a teaching to say (Exodus 27:20), "Pure beaten olive oil for the light," and not "pure beaten olive oil for the meal offerings."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ שוין והא אמרת ראשון למנורה והשאר למנחות אמר רב נחמן בר יצחק מאי שוין שוין למנחות:
human_translation: equal But didn’t you say first for the Candelabrum and the rest for meal offerings? Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak said: What they are equal they are equal with regard to meal offerings,
llm_translation: Gemara: They are equal. But didn't you say the first portion is for the Menorah and the rest for the Meal-offerings? Rav Nahman bar Yitzhak said: What is meant by "they are equal"? They are equal for the Meal-offerings.

hebrew_text: אף [כל] המנחות היו בדין [וכו']: תנו רבנן (שמות כז, כ) זך אין זך אלא נקי רבי יהודה אומר כתית אין כתית אלא כתוש
human_translation: Also all the meal offerings, it was logical The Sages taught “refined” nothing other than clean Rabbi Yehuda says “pounded” nothing other than crushed
llm_translation: Even all the meal offerings were in the law etc.: The Sages taught (Exodus 27:20) "pure" - "pure" means nothing but clean. Rabbi Yehuda says "crushed" - "crushed" means crushed.

hebrew_text: יכול יהא זך כתית פסול למנחות תלמוד לאמר (שמות כט, מ) ועשרון סולת בלול בשמן כתית אם כן מה תלמוד לאמר למאור אלא מפני החיסכון
human_translation: might refined, pounded is unfit for meal offerings, the verse states “And a tenth of fine flour, thoroughly mixed with pounded oil” If so, what the verse states “for illumination”? Rather, due to the sparing [ haḥisakhon ]
llm_translation: It is possible that fine wheat flour is invalid for meal-offerings. The Talmud says (Exodus 29:2), "And unleavened bread, mixed with oil, fine wheat flour." If so, why does the Talmud say "for lighting" instead? Rather, it is due to saving.

hebrew_text: מאי חיסכון אמר רבי אלעזר התורה חסה על ממונן של ישראל
human_translation: What sparing? Rabbi Elazar says: the Torah spared the money of the Jewish people
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "saving"? Rabbi Elazar said: The Torah safeguards the money of Israel.

hebrew_text: (ויקרא כד, ב) צו את בני ישראל ויקחו אליך שמן זית זך אמר רבי שמואל בר נחמני אליך ולא לי לא לאורה אני צריך:
human_translation: “Command the children of Israel, and they shall take for yourself refined pounded olive oil Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says: “for yourself,” and not for My I do not need its light.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (ויקרא כד, ב) צו את בני ישראל ויקחו אליך שמן זית זך אמר רבי שמואל בר נחמני אליך ולא לי לא לאורה אני צריך: English translation: (Leviticus 24:2) "Command the children of Israel, and they shall take to you pure olive oil." Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said: "To you, and not to me, do I need it for illumination."

hebrew_text: שלחן בצפון ומנורה בדרום אמר ר' זריקא אמר ר' אלעזר לא לאכילה אני צריך ולא לאורה אני צריך
human_translation: Table in the north and Candelabrum, in the south Rabbi Zerika says Rabbi Elazar says: I do not require for eating, nor do I require for its illumination.
llm_translation: Table in the north and lamp in the south, Rabbi Zerika said, Rabbi Elazar said, "Not for eating do I need, and not for illumination do I need."

hebrew_text: (מלכים א ו, ד) ויעש לבית חלוני שקופים אטומים תנא שקופין [מבפנים] ואטומים [מבחוץ] לא לאורה אני צריך
human_translation: “And he made for the House, windows narrow and broad” taught narrow within and broad without, I do not require its illumination.
llm_translation: Kings 1:6:4 "And he made for the house windows of narrow lights." It was taught: "Narrow lights facing inward, and narrow windows outward, not for illumination do I require."

hebrew_text: (ויקרא כד, ג) מחוץ לפרכת העדות באהל מועד עדות הוא לכל באי עולם שהשכינה שורה בישראל
human_translation: “Outside the Curtain of the testimony in the Tent of Meeting” is testimony to all of humanity that the Divine Presence rests among the Jewish people.
llm_translation: "And he shall slaughter the calf before the Lord; and Aaron's sons, the priests, shall offer the blood and dash the blood round about upon the altar that is at the door of the tent of meeting." (Leviticus 9:8)

hebrew_text: ואם תאמר לאורה אני צריך והלא כל ארבעים שנה שהלכו ישראל במדבר לא הלכו אלא לאורו אלא עדות הוא לכל באי עולם שהשכינה שורה בישראל
human_translation: And if you say: I need its light? But isn’t all forty years that Jewish people walked in the wilderness they walked exclusively by His light, Rather, is testimony to all of humanity that the Divine Presence rests among the Jewish people.
llm_translation: And if you will say, "For the light I need," but did not all forty years that the Israelites walked in the desert, they only walked by His light? Rather, it is a testimony to all the inhabitants of the world that the Divine Presence dwells among Israel.

hebrew_text: מאי עדותה אמר רבא זה נר מערבי שנותנין בה שמן כנגד חברותיה וממנה היה מדליק ובה היה מסיים:
human_translation: What its testimony? Rava says: is the westernmost lamp in which they place oil equivalent the other and from it would kindle and with it he would conclude
llm_translation: What is its testimony? Rava said: This is a western lamp that they would place oil in it opposite its companions, and from it he would light and with it he would conclude.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ מאין היו מביאין את היין קדוחים ועטולין אלפא ליין שניה להן בית רימה ובית לבן בהר וכפר סיגנא בבקעה כל ארצות היו כשרות אלא מיכן היו מביאין
human_translation: From where would they bring the wine Keduḥim and Attulin primary for wine. Secondary to them Beit Rima and Beit Lavan, in the mountain, and village of Signa, in the valley. All the regions were valid but from here, they would bring
llm_translation: Mishnah: From where would they bring the wine? Kaduchim and Atulin to the wine, a thousand for the second wine. For them, Beit Rimah and Beit Levan on the mountain, and Kfar Signa in the valley. All lands were valid except from here they would bring.

hebrew_text: אין מביאין לא מבית הזבלים ולא מבית השלחים ולא ממה שנזרע ביניהן ואם הביא כשר אין מביאין הליסטיון ואם הביא כשר אין מביאין ישן דברי רבי וחכמים מכשירין אין מביאין לא מתוק ולא מעושן ולא מבושל ואם הביא פסול ואין מביאין מן הדליות אלא מן הרגליות ומן הכרמים העבודין
human_translation: One may not bring from a fertilized vineyard, or from an irrigated vineyard, or from which was sown between But if one did bring valid. One may not bring sweet wine made from sun-dried grapes [ hilyasteyon ], but if one did bring valid. One may not bring aged the statement of Rabbi but the Rabbis deem it valid. One may not bring sweet nor smoked nor from boiled and if one did bring not valid. And one may not bring grapes suspended rather, from grapes at foot vineyards that are cultivated,
llm_translation: One does not bring from the dung heap, nor from the house of excrement, nor from that which is sown between them. And if one brought, if it is valid, one does not bring from the listiyyon, and if one brought, if it is valid, one does not bring old. The words of Rabbi and the Sages are lenient. One does not bring neither sweet nor smoked nor cooked. And if one brought, it is invalid. And one does not bring from the buckets, but from the footpaths and from the vineyards that are worked.

hebrew_text: ולא כונסין אותו בחצבין גדולים אלא בחביות קטנות ואינו ממלא את החבית עד פיה כדי שיהא ריחו נודף
human_translation: And one should not collect into large barrels, rather, in small casks. And one does not fill up until its mouth; so that its fragrance will diffuse
llm_translation: And not gather him in large jugs, rather in small barrels, and he does not fill the barrel until its mouth, so that its scent may waft.

hebrew_text: אינו מביא מפיה מפני
human_translation: One should not bring from mouth of due to
llm_translation: He does not bring forth from his mouth because

hebrew_text: הקמחין ולא משוליה מפני השמרים אלא מביא משלישה מאמצעה
human_translation: the flour- nor from bottom of due to the sediment Rather, one brings from its middle third.
llm_translation: The flour and not its residue because of the leaveners, rather one brings from its middle third.

hebrew_text: כיצד הוא בודק הגזבר יושב והקנה בידו זרק הגיר הקיש בקנה
human_translation: How does inspect The treasurer sits and the reed in his hand. draws chalk [ hagir ], he knocks with the reed
llm_translation: How does the treasurer inspect? He sits, and the reed in his hand. The convert threw, the proselyte struck with the reed.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי בר' יהודה אומר שיש בו קמחין פסול שנאמר (במדבר כח, לא) תמימים יהיו לכם ומנחתם... תמימים יהיו לכם ונסכיהם:
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: in which there is flour- unfit as it is stated “Unblemished they shall be for you…and their meal offering oil…unblemished they shall be for you, and their libations”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei son of Rabbi Yehuda says there is in it coarse flour invalid, as it is stated (Numbers 28:31) "They shall be unblemished for you and their meal-offering... unblemished for you and their libations."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אין מביאין לא מתוק ולא מבושל ולא מעושן ואם הביא פסול והא קתני רישא אין מביאין את הליסטיון ואם הביא כשר
human_translation: One may not bring sweet nor boiled nor smoked and if one did bring not valid. But doesn’t the first clause teach: One may not bring libations from sweet wine made from sun-dried grapes, but if one did bring valid?
llm_translation: Gemara: One does not bring neither raw nor cooked nor smoked offerings, and if one brought them, it is invalid. But didn't the first clause teach: One does not bring the listiyyon, and if one brought it, it is valid.

hebrew_text: אמר רבינא כרוך ותני רב אשי אמר חוליא דשימשא לא מאיס חוליא דפירא מאיס:
human_translation: Ravina said: combine and teach Rav Ashi said: the sweetness by the sun is not objectionable, sweetness of the fruit is objectionable,
llm_translation: Ravina said: "Kerukh." And Rav Ashi taught: "Chulia dishimsha lo ma'is, chulia d'pira ma'is."

hebrew_text: אין מביאין ישן דברי רבי וחכמים מכשירין: אמר חזקיה מאי טעמא דרבי אמר קרא (במדבר כח, יד) לכבש יין מה כבש בן שנתו אף יין בן שנתו
human_translation: One may not bring aged the statement of Rabbi but the Rabbis deem it valid. Rabbi Ḥizkiyya said: What is the reasoning of Rabbi The verse states for a lamb, of wine” just as a lamb in its year, so too wine in its year.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Ein mevi'in yashan, divrei Rabbi ve-chachamim mekashrin. Amar Chizkiyah, mai taima d'Rabbi amar kra (Bamidbar 28:14) 'lachvesh yayin.' Mah kevesh ben shenato, af yayin ben shenato." English translation: "One does not bring old, the words of Rabbi and the sages are valid. Chizkiyah said, what is the reason that Rabbi said? It is because the verse states (Numbers 28:14) 'to pour wine.' Just as a lamb in its first year, so too wine in its first year."

hebrew_text: אי מה כבש בן שתי שנים פסול אף יין בן שתי שנים פסול וכי תימא הכי נמי והתניא יין בן שתי שנים לא יביא ואם הביא כשר מאן שמעת ליה דאמר לא יביא רבי וקאמר אם הביא כשר
human_translation: If just as a lamb in second year, not valid, so too wine in second year not valid. And if you would say indeed But isn’t it taught wine in second year may not be brought if one did bring it valid? whom did you hear who said may not be brought? Rabbi And yet he says If one did bring valid.
llm_translation: "If a lamb of two years old is invalid, so too wine of two years old is invalid. And if you will say, 'Is that so?' But it was taught: Wine of two years old should not be brought, and if one brought it, it is valid. Who is the authority you rely upon that said not to bring it? Rabbi said not to bring it, and he also said if one brought it, it is valid."

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא היינו טעמא דרבי דכתיב (משלי כג, לא) אל תרא יין כי יתאדם:
human_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is the reasoning of Rabbi As it is written “Look not upon the wine when it is red”
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This is the reason of Rabbi, as it is written (Proverbs 23:31), "Do not look at wine when it is red."

hebrew_text: אין מביאין לא מן הדליות כו': תנא כרמים העבודים פעמים בשנה:
human_translation: One may not bring grapes suspended taught: Vineyards that are cultivated twice a year.
llm_translation: They do not bring from the diluyot, etc. It was taught: Vineyards are worked twice a year.

hebrew_text: רב יוסף הוה ליה קרנא דפרדיסא דרפיק ביה טפי ריפקא ועבד חמרא דדרי מיא על חד תרין:
human_translation: Rav Yosef had a tract that was an orchard [ depardeisa ] which he give an extra hoeing, and it produced wine a dilution using twice of water
llm_translation: Rav Yosef had a horn of a paradis that he would pour a lot of wine into and make a mixture of wine and water on one side.

hebrew_text: לא היו כונסין אותן בחצבין גדולים: תנא חביות כדיות לודיות ובינוניות
human_translation: they would not collect into large barrels, taught casks flasks Lod and are medium-sized.
llm_translation: They did not gather them in large barrels: It was taught: barrels like those of Lud and medium-sized ones.

hebrew_text: אין מניחין אותן שתים שתים אלא אחת אחת:
human_translation: they should not be placed in twos, rather singly,
llm_translation: We do not place them two by two, rather one by one.

hebrew_text: כיצד בודק גזבר יושב וקנה בידו זרק הגיר הקיש בקנה: תנא זרק הגיר של שמרים גזבר הקיש בקנה
human_translation: How does inspect treasurer sits and the reed in his hand. draws chalk he knocks with the reed taught: draws chalk from the sediment, he knocks with the reed.
llm_translation: How does one inspect a treasurer? He sits and holds a reed in his hand. The treasurer throws a nut, which hits the reed. It was taught: the treasurer throws a nut of sesame seeds, the treasurer hits the reed.

hebrew_text: ולימא ליה מימר מסייע ליה לרבי יוחנן דאמר רבי יוחנן כשם שהדיבור יפה לבשמים כך דיבור רע ליין:
human_translation: let him speak. supports of Rabbi Yoḥanan, as Rabbi Yoḥanan said: Just as speech is beneficial to the spices, so is speech detrimental to wine,
llm_translation: And let him say to him a saying that supports for Rabbi Yochanan, for Rabbi Yochanan said: Just as speech is beneficial for spices, so too, harmful speech is beneficial for wine.

hebrew_text: רבי יוסי בר רבי יהודה אומר וכו': בעי ר' יוחנן הקדישו מהו שילקה עליו משום בעל מום כיון דפסול כבעל מום דמי או דלמא אין בעל מום אלא בבהמה תיקו:
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: Rabbi Yoḥanan raises a dilemma one consecrated it what is he should be flogged for it due to a flawed since it unfit, it is comparable to a blemished Or perhaps, a flawed applies only to an animal. shall stand
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei bar Rabbi Yehuda says, etc.: Rabbi Yochanan inquired: What is the law if one consecrated an animal and it developed a blemish, is it to be redeemed on account of a blemish? Since it is disqualified like a blemished animal, is it considered as a blemished animal? Or perhaps a blemished animal is only subject to redemption in the case of a beast? This matter shall remain unresolved.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן אלים ממואב כבשים מחברון עגלים משרון גוזלות מהר המלך
human_translation: The Sages taught rams from Moab; lambs from Hebron; calves from Sharon; fledglings, from the King’s Mountain.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Rams from Moab, lambs from Hebron, calves from Sharon, and kids from the Mount of the King."

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר מביאין כבשים שגבהן כרחבן אמר רבא בר רב שילא מאי טעמא דר' יהודה דכתיב (ישעיהו ל, כג) ירעה מקנך ביום ההוא כר נרחב:
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: One should bring lambs whose height is like their width, Rava bar Rav Sheila said: What is the reason of Rabbi Yehuda? As it is written: your cattle shall graze in wide pastures [ kar nirḥav ] on that day”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: We bring sheep whose height is equal to their width. Rava, son of Rav Sheilah, said: What is the reason for Rabbi Yehudah's statement? Because it is written (Isaiah 30:23): "He will give rain for your seed with which you sow the ground, and bread, the produce of the ground, which will be rich and plentiful."

hebrew_text: כתיב (ישעיהו סב, ו) על חומותיך ירושלים הפקדתי שומרים כל היום וכל הלילה תמיד לא יחשו המזכירים את ה' אל דמי לכם מאי אמרי הכי אמר רבא בר רב שילא (תהלים קב, יד) אתה תקום תרחם ציון
human_translation: is written: “I have set watchmen upon your walls, Jerusalem; they shall never be silent day nor night; those who remind the Lord, take no rest” What say This Rava bar Rav Sheila said: “You will arise and have compassion upon Zion;
llm_translation: It is written (Isaiah 62:6), "Upon your walls, O Jerusalem, I have set watchmen all day and all night, continuously; they shall never be silent, those who remind the Lord." What is meant by "they shall never be silent"? Thus said Rava bar Rav Sheila (Psalm 102:14), "You will arise and have mercy on Zion."

hebrew_text: רב נחמן בר יצחק אמר (תהלים קמז, ב) בונה ירושלים ה' ומעיקרא מאי הוו אמרי אמר רבא בר רב שילא (תהלים קלב, יג) כי בחר ה' בציון אוה למושב לו:
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: “The Lord builds up Jerusalem, And initially, what would say? Rava bar Rav Sheila says: “For the Lord has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His habitation.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said (Psalms 147:2), "The Lord builds Jerusalem." And from the outset, what were they saying? Rava bar Rav Sheilah said (Psalms 132:13), "For the Lord has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His dwelling place."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך פרק כל קורבנות ציבור
llm_translation: We will return to you, Chapter of All Public Offerings.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שתי מדות של יבש היו במקדש עשרון וחצי עשרון רבי מאיר אומר עשרון עשרון וחצי עשרון
human_translation: Two measuring vessels for dry were in the Temple a tenth and one-half of a tenth Rabbi Meir says: a tenth a tenth and one half of a tenth
llm_translation: Mishnah: Two measures of dry goods were in the Temple: a tenth of an ephah and half a tenth of an ephah. Rabbi Meir says: It was a tenth of an ephah and half a tenth of an ephah.

hebrew_text: עשרון מה היה משמש שבו היה מודד לכל המנחות לא היה מודד לא בשלשה לפר ולא בשל שנים לאיל אלא מודדן עשרונות
human_translation: What did tenth serve? with which one would measure for all the meal offerings. One would not measure neither with three- for a bull, nor with two for a ram. Rather, one measures them tenths.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "Asaron mah hayah meshamesh shbo hayah moded lekol haminchot lo hayah moded lo beshalosh lepar velo beshal shnayim la'ayil ela modedan asaronot." English translation: "A tenth, what was it used for? With it, one would measure all the meal offerings. He would not measure with three for a bull, nor with two for a ram, but he would measure them with tenths."

hebrew_text: חצי עשרון מה היה משמש שבו היה מודד חביתי כהן גדול מחצה בבקר ומחצה בין הערבים:
human_translation: What did one half of a tenth serve? with which one would measure High Priest’s griddle-cake half in the morning and half in the afternoon.
llm_translation: Half a shekel what was used for it was measuring the chest of the High Priest half in the morning and half between the evenings.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תניא היה ר' מאיר אומר מה תלמוד לומר (במדבר כח, כט) עשרון עשרון לכבש האחד מלמד ששתי עשרונות היו במקדש אחד גדוש ואחד מחוק
human_translation: is taught Rabbi Meir would say: What the verse states: “A tenth, a tenth, for every lamb” teaches that there were two a tenth in the Temple. One heaped, and one leveled
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Meir would say, "What is the Torah teaching us when it says (Numbers 28:29), 'A tenth for each lamb'? This teaches that there were two tenths in the Temple, one piled and one measured."

hebrew_text: גדוש שבו היה מודד לכל המנחות
human_translation: heaped with which one would measure for all the meal offerings.
llm_translation: Heap that was measuring for all the meal offerings.

hebrew_text: מחוק שבו היה מודד לחביתי כהן גדול
human_translation: leveled with which one would measure for High Priest’s griddle-cake
llm_translation: The engraved staff that was in his hand, Moded to my barrel, Kohen Gadol.

hebrew_text: וחכמים אומרים לא היה שם אלא עשרון אחד שנאמר (במדבר כט, ד) ועשרון אחד לכבש האחד אם כן מה תלמוד לאמר עשרון עשרון לרבות חצי עשרון
human_translation: And the Rabbis say: There was only one a tenth there as it is stated: “And one tenth-part for every lamb” if so, what the verse states: “A tenth, a tenth, to include one-half of a tenth
llm_translation: The Sages say: There was only one tenth there, as it is stated (Numbers 29:4), "And one tenth for one lamb." If so, what is the teaching to say "tenth tenth" to include half a tenth.

hebrew_text: ור' מאיר חצי עשרון מנא ליה נפקא ליה מועשרון ורבנן וי"ו לא דרשי
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, from where he one-half of a tenth He derives it from “and one tenth-part And the Rabbis, They do not derive “and.”
llm_translation: And Rabbi Meir half a shekel counted to him, he derived from it a tenth, and the Rabbis, "and" did not expound.

hebrew_text: ורבי מאיר האי ועשרון אחד לכבש האחד מאי עביד ליה ההוא שלא ימדוד לא בשל שלשה לפר ולא בשל שנים לאיל
human_translation: And Rabbi Meir, this “And one tenth-part for every lamb,” what does he do with it? That one should not measure neither with three- for a bull, nor with two for a ram.
llm_translation: Rabbi Meir said: "And one-tenth for each of the ten lambs - what does he do with it? That he does not measure with three se'ah for a bull, nor with two se'ah for a ram."

hebrew_text: ורבנן נפקא להו מנקודו דתניא אמר ר' יוסי למה נקוד וי"ו שבאמצע (במדבר כט, ד) עשרון של עשרון ראשון של יום טוב הראשון של חג שלא ימדוד לא בשל ג' לפר ולא בשל שנים לאיל ורבי מאיר נקודו לא דריש:
human_translation: And the Rabbis, They derive from its dot. as it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Why is vav in the middle of “a tenth [ issaron ]” dotted first “a tenth” concerning first festival day of the Festival that one should not measure neither with three- for a bull, nor with for a ram. And Rabbi Meir, He does not derive its dot.
llm_translation: The sages went out from his point, as it was taught: Rabbi Yosei said, "Why is there a dot on the 'vav' in the middle (Numbers 29:4) 'A tenth for a tenth day, the first day of the first festival'? To teach that one should not measure with three for a bull or with two for a ram." And Rabbi Meir does not interpret the dot.

hebrew_text: חצי עשרון מה היה משמש שבו היה מודד לחביתי כהן גדול:
human_translation: What did one-half of a tenth serve? with which one would measure for the High Priest’s griddle-cake
llm_translation: Half a shekel what was used with it was measuring for the High Priest's chest.

hebrew_text: מודד ורמינהי חביתי כהן גדול לא היו באין חצאין אלא מביא עשרון שלם וחוצהו
human_translation: measuring. And raises a contradiction griddle-cake of the High Priest did not come in halves. Rather, brings a complete tenth and divides it
llm_translation: Measured and they raised a contradiction: "Haviti the High Priest did not enter the Holy of Holies except with a full measure, and he would take it out."

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת מאי מודד נמי דקתני מחלק
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: What is measuring, that teaches? divide
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: What is the meaning of "moded" (measuring)? Also, as it is taught: "makhlek" (dividing).

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רמי בר חמא מרב חסדא חצי עשרון לרבי מאיר גדוש היה או מחוק היה
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised a dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: one-half of a tenth according to Rabbi Meir, was heaped or was leveled?
llm_translation: Requested of him Rami bar Hama, Mar Rav Ḥisda: "Half a shekel to Rabbi Meir, was it sparse or was it engraved?"

hebrew_text: (סימן: חצ"י חבית"י שלח"ן)
human_translation: a mnemonic Half; griddle-cake Table.
llm_translation: Tractate: Bava Metzia Chapter 7, Mishnah 2 Rabbi Yehuda says: If one sends a barrel of wine to a colleague and it breaks on the way, if the sender is a merchant, he is liable. If he is not a merchant, he is exempt.

hebrew_text: ותיבעי לך לרבנן לרבנן עשרון גופיה קא מיבעיא להו גדוש היה או מחוק היה
human_translation: But The dilemma can be raised according to the Rabbis. According to the Rabbis, a tenth itself one raises the dilemma, was heaped or was leveled.
llm_translation: And it was asked of the Rabbis, of the Rabbis: "Is the tithe itself being asked about, was it piled up or was it measured?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מדר' מאיר נשמע לרבי מאיר ומדרבי מאיר נשמע לרבנן
human_translation: said to him: From of Rabbi Meir we can extrapolate Rabbi Meir and from of Rabbi Meir we can extrapolate the Rabbis
llm_translation: He said to him: "From Rabbi Meir it is heard, and from Rabbi Meir it is heard to the Rabbis."

hebrew_text: מדאמר ר' מאיר עשרון מחוק חצי עשרון נמי מחוק מדר' מאיר מחוק לרבנן נמי מחוק
human_translation: From that Rabbi Meir said a tenth leveled, one-half of a tenth, as well, leveled. from that Rabbi Meir leveled, also according to the Rabbis, leveled.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Meir said: "A 'asaron' is measured as half an 'asaron,' and likewise, 'mechok' according to Rabbi Meir is 'measured,' and 'mechok' according to the Rabbis is also 'measured.'"

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רמי בר חמא מרב חסדא חביתי כהן גדול במה מחלקן לחלות ביד או בכלי פשיטא דביד דאי בכלי טורטני יכניס
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: High Priest’s griddle-cake with what one divide it into loaves with hand or with vessel? obvious that with hand, as if with vessel, would one bring scales [ turtanei ]
llm_translation: Requested of him Rami bar Hama from Rav Ḥisda: "Haviti the High Priest, in what way do they divide them, to carry in hand or in a vessel?" It is obvious that in hand, for if in a vessel, he would enter with a tortoise vessel.

hebrew_text: ויכניס כיון דבקללה כתיב לאו אורח ארעא
human_translation: And let him bring Since in written a curse: not proper conduct
llm_translation: And he brought him in, since it is written "not the way of the land."

hebrew_text: בעא מיניה רמי בר חמא מרב חסדא שלחן מהו שיקדש קמצים בגודש שלו מדמקדש לחם קמצים נמי מקדש או דלמא דחזי ליה מקדש דלא חזי ליה לא מקדש
human_translation: Rami bar Ḥama raised dilemma before Rav Ḥisda: Table, what is as it consecrates handfuls on the upper part of from consecrates loaves also consecrates handfuls Or perhaps consecrates which is fit for it, does not consecrate which is not fit for it,
llm_translation: Rami bar Hama asked Mar Rav Ḥisda: "Regarding a table, what is the law if one sanctifies handfuls of dough on his table? Just as one sanctifies bread, so too, does he sanctify handfuls, or perhaps since he sanctifies bread, he does not sanctify handfuls?"

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אינו מקדש איני והאמר רבי יוחנן לדברי האומר טפחיים ומחצה קופל נמצא שלחן מקדש חמשה עשר טפח למעלה לדברי האומר טפחיים קופל נמצא שלחן מקדש י"ב טפח למעלה
human_translation: said to him: does not consecrate Is that so? But didn’t Rabbi Yoḥanan say: According to the statement of the one who says one folds two and a half handbreadths it emerges Table consecrates fifteen handbreadths above it, according to the statement of the one who says one folds two handbreadths it emerges Table consecrates twelve handbreadths above it.
llm_translation: He said to him, "I do not sanctify." But didn't Rabbi Yochanan say: According to the opinion that a table of the Sanctuary is found to be a span and a half folded, it is fifteen handbreadths high; according to the opinion that a table of the Sanctuary is found to be a span folded, it is twelve handbreadths high.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אינו מקדש ליקרב אבל מקדש ליפסל:
human_translation: said to him: does not consecrate to be sacrificed But consecrates to be disqualified
llm_translation: He said to him, "He does not sanctify to bring near, but he sanctifies to disqualify."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שבע מדות של לח היו במקדש הין וחצי הין ושלישית ההין ורביעית ההין
human_translation: There were seven measuring vessels for liquids in the Temple. hin , one half of a hin , and one-third of a hin , and one-quarter of a hin ,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Seven measures of fine flour were in the Temple: a hin, half a hin, a third of a hin, and a quarter of a hin.

hebrew_text: לוג וחצי לוג ורביעית לוג
human_translation: log and one half of a log and one-quarter of a log
llm_translation: Log, half a log, and a quarter of a log.

hebrew_text: ר' אליעזר בר ר' צדוק אומר שנתות היו בהין עד כאן לפר ועד כאן לאיל עד כאן לכבש
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: there were graduations [ shenatot ] on hin until here for the bull, and until here for the ram, until here for the lamb.
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer son of Rabbi Tzadok says: "Years were among them until here for a bull, and until here for a ram, until here for a lamb."

hebrew_text: ר' שמעון אומר לא היה שם הין וכי מה היה הין משמש אלא מדה יתירה של לוג ומחצה היתה שם שבה היה מודד למנחת כהן גדול לוג ומחצה בבוקר לוג ומחצה בין הערבים:
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: There was no there hin , as what could -hin serve? Rather, there was an additional measuring vessel of one and a half log there, with which one would measure for the meal offering of the High Priest; one and a half log in the morning and one and a half log in the afternoon.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: There was no wine there. And if there was wine, what was the wine used for? Only an extra measure of a log and a half was there, in which he would measure for the meal offering of the High Priest: a log and a half in the morning, and a log and a half between the evenings.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן שבע מדות של לח היו במקדש רביעית לוג וחצי לוג ולוג ורביעית ההין ושלישית ההין וחצי הין והין דברי רבי יהודה רבי מאיר אומר הין וחצי הין ושלישית ההין ורביעית ההין ולוג וחצי לוג ורביעית לוג רבי שמעון אומר לא היה שם הין וכי מה היה הין משמש
human_translation: The Sages taught There were seven measuring vessels for liquids in the Temple. One-quarter of a log ; one-half of a log ; log ; one-quarter of a hin ; one-third of a hin ; one-half of a hin ; and hin . the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Meir says hin ; one-half of a hin ; one-third of a hin ; one-quarter of a hin ; log ; one-half of a log ; and one-quarter of a log . Rabbi Shimon says: There was no there hin , as what could -hin serve?
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: There were seven measures of oil in the Temple - a quarter-log, half-log, log, a quarter of a hin, a third of a hin, half a hin, and a hin. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda; Rabbi Meir says: a hin, half a hin, a third of a hin, a quarter of a hin, a log, half a log, and a quarter-log. Rabbi Shimon says: There was no hin there. But what was the hin used for?

hebrew_text: את מי אביא תחתיו אלא מדה יתירה של לוג ומחצה היתה שם שבו היה מודד לחביתי כהן גדול לוג ומחצה בבקר לוג ומחצה בין הערבים
human_translation: which I bring in its stead Rather, there was an additional measuring vessel of one and a half log there with which one would measure for the griddle-cake of the High Priest; one and a half log in the morning one and a half log in the afternoon.
llm_translation: Whom shall I bring under him, except an extra measure of a log and a half was there, with which he would measure for the High Priest: a log and a half in the morning, a log and a half between the evenings.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו חצי לוג היתה שם ואפשר לשער בחצי לוג
human_translation: said to there was one-half of a log there, and possible to calculate by one-half of a log
llm_translation: They said to him, "There was half a log there, and it is possible to estimate with half a log."

hebrew_text: אמר להם אף לדבריכם [חצי לוג] ולוג לא יעשה רביעית היתה שם ואפשר לשער ברביעית אלא זה הכלל היה במקדש כלי שמשמש מדה זו אינו משמש מדה אחרת:
human_translation: said to them: according to your statement as well, one should not fashion one-half of a log or log , there was one-quarter there, and possible to calculate by one-quarter Rather, this was the principle in the Temple: vessel that used for this quantity was not used a different quantity.
llm_translation: He said to them, "Even according to your words, a half-log and a log will not make a quarter. There was a fourth there, and it was possible to estimate by a fourth. Rather, this was the principle in the Temple: a vessel that serves for this measure does not serve for another measure."

hebrew_text: ר' אלעזר בר' צדוק אומר שנתות היו בהין וכו':
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: There were graduations on hin ,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok says: "Years were in it, etc."

hebrew_text: מאי איכא בין רבי מאיר לרבי יהודה אמר ר' יוחנן בירוצי מדות איכא בינייהו
human_translation: What is there between Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda? Rabbi Yoḥanan said: between them overflow [ beirutzei ] of measuring vessels,
llm_translation: What is the difference between Rabbi Meir and Rabbi Yehuda? Rabbi Yochanan said: In the measurements of the Temple Courtyard there is a difference between them.

hebrew_text: למאן דאמר ממטה למעלה קסבר בירוצי המדות נתקדשו ורביעית יהיב ליה רחמנא למשה ואמר ליה שער דקא עיילי להו בירוצין
human_translation: According to the one who said in ascending he holds overflow of measuring vessels is consecrated. the Merciful One gave Moses one-quarter and said to him: calculate overflow enters
llm_translation: To whom that said from below to above, holds that in the running of the measurements they became sanctified, and a quarter He gave to Moses, and the Merciful One said to him, "The gate through which they enter the measurements."

hebrew_text: למאן דאמר ממעלה למטה קסבר בירוצי מדות לא נתקדשו והין יהיב ליה רחמנא למשה ואמר ליה שער בהא דקא נפקי בירוצין
human_translation: According to the one who said in descending he holds overflow of measuring vessels is not consecrated. the Merciful One gave Moses hin and said to him: With this calculate overflow is excluded
llm_translation: To whom that said from above to below holds, he holds that in the case of running measures were not sanctified, and the Merciful One gave it to Moses, and said to him, "Measure out in the running measures."

hebrew_text: אביי אמר דכולי עלמא בירוצי המדות איכא למימר נתקדשו ואיכא למימר לא נתקדשו והכא במלאים קא מיפלגי
human_translation: Abaye said: Everyone, overflow of measuring vessels, one could say they are consecrated and one could say they are not consecrated, But here they disagree with regard to “full”
llm_translation: Abaye said: In general, regarding the running of the measurements, it can be said that they became sanctified, and it can be said that they did not become sanctified. And here, in the case of the fullers, they are in dispute.

hebrew_text: מאן דאמר מלמעלה למטה קא סבר מלאים שלא יחסר ושלא יותיר
human_translation: The one who said in descending holds “full” that it should neither less nor more
llm_translation: The one who says "from above to below" holds that it is full so as not to lack and not to exceed.

hebrew_text: ומאן דאמר ממטה למעלה מלאים שלא יחסר אבל יותיר מלאים קרינא ביה
human_translation: And the one who said in ascending holds “full” should not less but it more, is called full.
llm_translation: And one who says "from below upwards" - that they should be filled so as not to lack, but if they are left over, they are considered full.

hebrew_text: אמר מר רבי שמעון אומר לא היה שם הין שפיר קאמר להו רבי שמעון לרבנן ורבנן הוה הין דעבד משה לשמן המשחה דכתיב (שמות ל, כד) ושמן זית הין
human_translation: the Master said Rabbi Shimon says: There was no there hin , Rabbi Shimon is saying well to the Rabbis, And the Rabbis It was hin that Moses fashioned for anointing oil as it is written: “And of olive oil a hin .
llm_translation: The Master said: Rabbi Shimon said, "There was no 'hin' there." Rabbi Shimon was saying well to the Rabbis, and the Rabbis were the 'hin' that Moses made for the anointing oil, as it is written (Exodus 30:24), "a hin of olive oil."

hebrew_text: מר סבר כיון דלדורות לא הוה צריך לפי שעה הוא דעבדיה ואיגנז ואידך כיון דהוה הוה
human_translation: Sage, holds since there was no need in generations, fashioned it for time, and it was sequestered. And the other since it was it was
llm_translation: Master holds: since for generations it was not necessary, it is he who did it temporarily, and the other holds: since it was, it was.

hebrew_text: אמר מר ואת מי אביא תחתיו לא סגיא דלא מעייל כדאמר רבינא גמירי שתי סמיכות בציבור הכא נמי גמירי דשבע מדות של לח היו במקדש
human_translation: The Master said which I bring in its stead Is it not possible to not include as Ravina said is learned two placing hands for communal Here too, is learned there were seven measuring vessels for liquids in the Temple.
llm_translation: The Master said: "And with whom shall I bring the offering beneath him? It is not difficult, for he does not bring it up." As Rabbina said: We have learned that two ordinations are not performed in public. Here too, we have learned that there were seven measures of flour in the Temple.

hebrew_text: ר' אלעזר בר' צדוק אומר שנתות היו בהין ולית ליה שבע מדות לית ליה ואי בעית אימא מאי שבע מדות שבע מדידות:
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Tzadok, says: there were graduations on hin But doesn’t have seven measuring vessels? He does not have And if you wish, say what seven measuring vessels? seven measuring
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar son of Rabbi Tzadok says: Years were in it, and it does not have seven attributes, and if you wish, say: What are the seven attributes? Seven attributes.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ רביעית מה היתה משמשת רביעית מים למצורע ורביעית שמן לנזיר
human_translation: What did quarter- serve? a quarter- of water for the leper, and a quarter- of oil for the nazirite
llm_translation: Mishnah: A quarter-log of what was it serving? A quarter-log of water for the leper, and a quarter-log of oil for the Nazirite.

hebrew_text: חצי לוג מה היה משמש חצי לוג מים לסוטה וחצי לוג שמן לתודה
human_translation: What did half serve? a half- of water for the sota and a half- of oil for the thanks offering.
llm_translation: Half a log - what was it used for? Half a log of water for the Sotah, and half a log of oil for the thanksgiving offering.

hebrew_text: ובלוג היה מודד לכל המנחות
human_translation: And with log , one would measure for all the meal offerings.
llm_translation: And in a log he would measure for all the meal offerings.

hebrew_text: אפילו מנחה של ס' עשרון נותן לה ס' לוג ר' אליעזר בן יעקב אומר אפילו מנחה של ס' עשרון אין לה אלא לוגה שנאמר (ויקרא יד, כא) למנחה ולוג שמן
human_translation: even a meal offering of sixty tenths one adds to it sixty log Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: even a meal offering of sixty tenths only its log as it is stated for a meal offering, and a log of oil”
llm_translation: Even a meal offering of ten shekels, one gives it a log. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says, even a meal offering of ten shekels has only a log, as it is stated (Leviticus 14:21), "for a meal offering and a log of oil."

hebrew_text: ששה לפר וארבעה לאיל ושלשה לכבש
human_translation: Six - for a bull; and four for a ram; and three for a lamb.
llm_translation: Six for a bull, and four for a ram, and three for a lamb.

hebrew_text: שלשה ומחצה למנורה חצי לוג לכל נר:
human_translation: three and a half for the Candelabrum, a half- log for each lamp.
llm_translation: Three and a half for the menorah, half a log for each lamp.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ יתיב רבי וקא קשיא ליה רביעית למה נמשחה אי מצורע
human_translation: Rabbi was sitting and posed a difficulty: For what was quarter- anointed If a leper,
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi was sitting and he was troubled by the following question: Why is the fourth finger anointed if one is a leper.

hebrew_text: חוץ הוא ואי נזיר לחם נזיר בשחיטת איל הוא דקדיש
human_translation: is outside And if a nazirite, loaves of a nazirite are consecrated through the slaughter of ram
llm_translation: It is outside, and if a Nazirite is eating Nazirite bread, it is considered the consecration of a ram for a sacrifice.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבי חייא שבה היה מודד לחביתי כהן גדול רביעית שמן לכל חלה וחלה קרי עליה (ישעיהו מו, יא) מארץ מרחק איש עצתי:
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya said to as with it one would measure for High Priest’s griddle-cake a quarter of oil for each and every loaf. read about “The man of my counsel from a far country”
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Chiya the Elder would measure for my father-in-law, the High Priest, a quarter of oil for each loaf, and he would call it upon her (Isaiah 46:11) "from a distant land, a man of my counsel."

hebrew_text: חצי לוג מה היה משמש: יתיב רבי וקא קשיא ליה חצי לוג למה נמשח אי סוטה וכי חולין הוא דצריכי לקדושי (במדבר ה, יז) מים קדושים כתיב אי תודה לחמי תודה בשחיטת תודה הוא דקדשי
human_translation: What did half- log serve? Rabbi was sitting and posed a difficulty: For what was half- log anointed If sota , Is non-sacred that it is necessary to consecrate it written: holy water if a thanks offering, loaves of a thanks offering are consecrated through the slaughter of thanks offering,
llm_translation: Half a log - what was it used for? Rabbi was sitting and questioning: Why is half a log needed? If it is for a Sotah, is it considered mundane that it requires sanctified water (Numbers 5:17)? If it is for a Todah offering, is it in the slaughtering of the Todah that it becomes sanctified?

hebrew_text: אמר ליה ר' שמעון ברבי שבו היה מחלק חצי לוג שמן לכל נר ונר אמר לו נר ישראל כך היה

llm_translation: Six for a bull, four for a ram, three for a lamb: Whence do we derive this? As it is written (Numbers 28:14), "And their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine for a bull."

human_translation: Three and a half for the Candelabrum, a half- log for each lamp. From where are these matters as the Sages taught from evening to morning, you shall put into its quantity so that it will continue burning from evening until morning. llm_translation: Three and a half for the menorah, half a log for each lamp: From where do we derive these matters that the Rabbis taught (Exodus 27:21) "From evening until morning, the lamp shall be kept burning"? Another explanation: "From evening until morning" - there is no other service that is valid from evening until morning except for this alone. And the Sages estimated half a log from dusk until dawn.

human_translation: one who said they calculated by increasing the Torah spared the money of the Jewish people, And one who said they calculated by decreasing in a place of wealth there is no poverty.
llm_translation: The one who says from below to above, the Torah has compassion on the money of Israel, and the one who says from above to below, the Torah does not have poverty in a place of wealth.

hebrew_text: אבל אין מערבין נסכי כבשים בנסכי פרים ואילים ואם בללן אלו בפני עצמן ואלו בפני עצמן ונתערבו כשרים אם עד שלא בלל פסול
human_translation: But one may not mix together the libations of lambs with the libations of bulls or rams, And if one intermingled these by themselves and these by themselves, and were they mixed together, fit If before were intermingled disqualified.
llm_translation: But do not mix libations of lambs with libations of bulls and rams, and if one mixed these separately and these separately, and they became mixed, they are valid, unless one did not mix them, then they are invalid.

hebrew_text: הכבש הבא עם העומר אף על פי שמנחתו כפולה לא היו נסכיו כפולים:
human_translation: the lamb that comes with the omer even though its meal offering is doubled, its libations were not doubled;
llm_translation: The lamb that comes with the Omer, even though its meal offering is doubled, its libations were not doubled.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ורמינהו
human_translation: And raises a contradiction
llm_translation: Talmudic text: גמ׳ ורמינהו English translation: The Gemara asks and raises a contradiction:

hebrew_text: (ויקרא ג, ה) והקטירו שלא יערב חלבים בחלבים
human_translation: “And they shall burn,” that one may not mix fats with the fats
llm_translation: "And they shall burn, that the fats may not be mixed with one another."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יוחנן אם נתערבו קא אמר
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: stated if were mixed
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: If they became mixed, he said.

hebrew_text: אי הכי ואין מערבין נסכי כבשים בנסכי פרים ואילים ואפילו נתערבו נמי לא והא מדקתני סיפא בללן אלו בפני עצמן ואלו בפני עצמן ונתערבו כשרין מכלל דרישא לכתחלה קא אמר
human_translation: If that is so, And one may not mix together the libations of lambs with the libations of bulls or rams, even they were mixed together, also not But from that the latter clause teaches: one intermingled these by themselves and these by themselves and were they mixed together fit it may be inferred that the first clause stated ab initio .
llm_translation: If so, and one does not mix libations of lambs with libations of bulls and rams, and even if they were mixed, no. But isn't it taught in the latter clause: "These by themselves, and these by themselves, and if they were mixed, they are valid"? From the inference of the first clause, he is saying initially.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי הכי קאמר מערבין יינן אם נתערב סלתן ושמנן
human_translation: Abaye said this is saying: their wine may be mixed together if their fine flour and their oil were mixed together,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: This is what it means when it says, "We mix the wine with them if their flour and oil are mixed."

hebrew_text: ויינן לכתחלה לא והתניא במה דברים אמורים בסלת ושמן אבל יין מערבין
human_translation: And not wine ab initio But isn’t it taught In what is this statement, said? with regard to flour and oil. But one may mix together wine
llm_translation: And wine initially not. And it was taught: In what matters are these words said? In flour and oil, but wine may be mixed.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר אביי הכי קאמר היכא דהוקטר סלתן ושמנן מערבין יין לכתחלה היכא דלא הוקטר אם נתערב סלתן ושמנן מערבין נמי יינן ואם לאו אין מערבין דלמא אתי לאיערובי סלת ושמן לכתחלה:
human_translation: Rather, Abaye said this is saying: where their fine flour and their oil have been burned one may mix together wine ab initio . where have not been burned, if their fine flour and their oil have been mixed together, one may mix together their wine But if not one may not mix together. perhaps one will come to mix together flour and oil ab initio ,
llm_translation: Rather, Abaye said: This is what he is saying - where their flour and oil were mixed, one may mix wine initially. Where their flour and oil were not mixed, if their flour and oil became mixed, one may also mix their wine. And if not, one may not mix, for perhaps one will come to mix flour and oil initially.

hebrew_text: כבש הבא עם העומר: תנו רבנן (ויקרא כג, יג) ומנחתו שני עשרונים לימד על כבש הבא עם העומר שמנחתו כפולה
human_translation: the lamb that comes with the omer The Sages taught “And its meal offering shall be two tenths” teaches about lamb that comes with the omer that its meal offering is doubled.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A lamb that comes with the Omer offering: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 23:13) "And its meal offering shall be two tenths of an ephah." This teaches regarding a lamb that comes with the Omer offering that its meal offering is doubled.

hebrew_text: יכול כשם שמנחתו כפולה כך יינו כפול תלמוד לומר (ויקרא כג, יג) ונסכו יין רביעית ההין יכול לא יהא יינו כפול שאינו נבלל עם מנחתו אבל יהא שמנו כפול שנבלל עם מנחתו תלמוד לאמר ונסכו כל נסכיו לא יהו אלא רביעית
human_translation: might just as its meal offering is doubled, so its wine doubled, the verse states, “And its libation shall be of wine, a quarter- hin ” might its wine should not be doubled, as it is not intermingled with its meal offering, but its oil should be doubled, as it is intermingled with its meal offering. the verse states: “And its libation all of its libations shall be only a quarter hin
llm_translation: I can when his offering double so his wine double Talmud to say (Leviticus 23:13) and his drink wine fourth hin can not his wine double that not mixed with his offering but his oil double that mixed with his offering Talmud to say and his drink all his drink offerings not be except fourth

hebrew_text: מאי תלמודא אמר רבי אלעזר כתיב ונסכה וקרינן ונסכו
human_translation: What is the derivation Rabbi Elazar says: It is written veniskah , And we read it venisko ,
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Talmuda"? Rabbi Elazar said: It is written "and his libation" and we read it as "and his libation."

hebrew_text: כיצד נסכה דמנחה כנסכו דיין מה יין רביעית אף שמן נמי רביעית
human_translation: How the libation of the meal offering, is like the libation of of wine: Just as wine a quarter so too, oil a quarter
llm_translation: How is the libation of the meal-offering like the libation of the judge? Just as with the wine, a quarter-log, so too with the oil, a quarter-log.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יוחנן אשם מצורע ששחטו שלא לשמו טעון נסכים שאם אי אתה אומר כן פסלתו
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: a guilt offering of a leper that one slaughtered not for its own sake, requires libations, as if you do not say this, you have disqualified it.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan: "A guilt-offering of a leper that was slaughtered not for its sake requires libations, for if you do not say so, you invalidate it."

hebrew_text: מתקיף לה רב מנשיא בר גדא אלא מעתה כבש הבא עם העומר ששחטו שלא לשמו תהא מנחתו כפולה שאם אי אתה אומר כן פסלתו
human_translation: Rav Menashya bar Gadda objects to this: If that is so, lamb that comes with the omer one slaughtered it not for its own sake, its meal offering should be doubled as if you do not say this, you have disqualified it.
llm_translation: Rav Menasheh bar Gada objects to this: But now, if a lamb that comes with the Omer offering was slaughtered not for its sake, its meal offering should be doubled, for if you do not say so, you invalidate it.

hebrew_text: ותמיד של שחר ששחטו שלא לשמו יהא טעון שני גזירין בכהן אחד שאם אי אתה אומר כן פסלתו ותמיד של בין הערבים ששחטו שלא לשמו יהא טעון שני גזירין בשני כהנים שאם אי אתה אומר כן פסלתו
human_translation: And daily morning offering, one slaughtered it not for its own sake, it should require two logs by one priest, as if you do not say this, you have disqualified it. And daily afternoon offering, one slaughtered it not for its own sake, it should require two logs by two priests, as if you do not say this, you have disqualified it.
llm_translation: "And the daily morning offering that was slaughtered not for its sake requires two decrees against one priest, for if you do not say so, you invalidate it. And the daily afternoon offering that was slaughtered not for its sake requires two decrees against two priests, for if you do not say so, you invalidate it."

hebrew_text: אין הכי נמי אלא אמר אביי חדא מינייהו נקט
human_translation: Yes, it is indeed so Rather, Abaye said: mentioned one of them
llm_translation: So too, but rather Abaye said: one of them he took.

hebrew_text: ר' אבא אמר בשלמא הנך עולות נינהו
human_translation: Rabbi Abba said Granted, these they are burnt offerings;
llm_translation: Rabbi Abba said: "Indeed, these are burnt offerings."

hebrew_text: אי לא חזו לעולת חובה קרבי לעולת נדבה אלא הכא אי לא מוקמית ליה במילתיה אשם נדבה מי איכא
human_translation: if they are no fit to obligatory burnt offerings, they can be sacrificed as voluntary burnt offerings, But here, if you do not maintain it in accordance with its status is there a voluntary guilt offering?
llm_translation: If not seen for obligatory burnt offering, bring for voluntary burnt offering. Rather here, if not established for its matter, is there a guilt offering for voluntary offering?

hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דרבי יוחנן אשם מצורע ששחטו שלא לשמו או שלא נתן מדמו על גבי בהונות הרי זו עולה לגבי מזבח וטעון נסכים וצריך אשם אחר להתירו:
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: a guilt offering of a leper that one slaughtered not for its own sake, or where one did not place of its blood upon thumb and big toe, this is brought up upon the altar and requires libations, but needs another guilt offering to permit him
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: The guilt-offering of a leper that was slaughtered not for its sake, or if its blood was not placed on the corners of the altar, it ascends upon the altar and requires libations, and another guilt-offering is needed to permit it.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל מדות שבמקדש היו נגדשות חוץ משל כהן גדול שהיה גודשה לתוכה
human_translation: All measuring vessels that were in the Temple were heaped except for of the High Priest, as its heaped was contained within its
llm_translation: Mishnah: All measurements in the Temple were pressed except for the High Priest's, which was pressed inside.

hebrew_text: מדת הלח בירוציהן קדש ומדת היבש בירוציהן חול
human_translation: measuring vessels for liquids, their overflows, are sacred, but measuring vessels for dry their overflows are non-sacred.
llm_translation: Measurement of wet in their the animals' running is holy, and measurement of dry in their the animals' running is secular.

hebrew_text: רבי עקיבא אומר מדת הלח קדש לפיכך בירוציהן קדש מדת היבש חול לפיכך בירוציהן חול רבי יוסי אומר לא משום זה אלא שהלח נעקר והיבש אינו נעקר:
human_translation: Rabbi Akiva says measuring vessels for liquids sacred, therefore their overflows are sacred, measuring vessels for dry non-sacred, therefore their overflows are non-sacred. Rabbi Yosei says: not due to that Rather, because the liquid was displaced, the a dry was not displaced
llm_translation: Rabbi Akiva says: The attribute of moist is holy, therefore in their runs they are holy. The attribute of dry is mundane, therefore in their runs they are mundane. Rabbi Yossi says: Not because of this, rather because the moist is uprooted and the dry is not uprooted.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מני אי רבי מאיר חד גדוש הוה אי רבנן חדא ומחוק הוה
human_translation: whose If Rabbi Meir, one was when heaped; if the Rabbis, there was one and leveled.
llm_translation: Gemara: Who is the authority of this statement? If it is Rabbi Meir, it is one who is stringent, and if it is the Rabbis, it is one and it is lenient.

hebrew_text: אמר רב חסדא לעולם רבי מאיר ומאי כל מדות כל מדידות:
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda said: Actually, Rabbi Meir And what All measuring vessels [ kol middot ] all measurements [ kol medidot ]
llm_translation: Rav Chisda said: Always follow the opinion of Rabbi Meir, and what is the reason? All his measures are exact.

hebrew_text: מדת הלח בירוציהן קדש: במאי קא מיפלגי
human_translation: measuring vessels for liquids, their overflows are sacred, With regard to what do disagree?
llm_translation: Measurement of the Lechi in their Eruvin: With what are they in dispute?

hebrew_text: תנא קמא סבר מדת הלח נמשחה בין מבפנים בין מבחוץ מדת יבש נמשחה מבפנים ולא נמשחה מבחוץ
human_translation: The first tanna holds measuring liquid anointed both on inside and on outside. measuring dry were anointed on inside, but were not anointed on outside.
llm_translation: First Tanna holds: the measure of oil is anointed whether from inside or from outside, the measure of dry is anointed from inside and not anointed from outside.

hebrew_text: ורבי עקיבא סבר מדת הלח נמשחה בין מבפנים בין מבחוץ מדת יבש לא נמשחה כל עיקר
human_translation: And Rabbi Akiva, holds measuring liquid were anointed on inside and were not anointed on outside, measuring dry were not anointed at all,
llm_translation: And Rabbi Akiva holds: the measure of oil, whether applied from within or from without, the measure of dryness was not applied at all.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוסי סבר אידי ואידי נמשחה מבפנים ולא נמשחה מבחוץ והכא היינו טעמא דלח נעקר ומגווה דמנא קא אתי והיבש אינו נעקר
human_translation: And Rabbi Yosei holds this and that, were anointed on the inside but were not anointed on the outside, and here, this is the reason As of liquid was displaced, and it comes from the inside of the vessel, But the a dry was not displaced,
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei holds: both this and that were anointed from within and were not anointed from without. And here, this is the reason: the moist is uprooted, and the dryness comes in, and the dryness is not uprooted.

hebrew_text: וכי נעקר מאי הוי גברא למאי דצריך קא מכוין
human_translation: But if was displaced, what of it? A person intends that which he requires,
llm_translation: And when it is uprooted, what is the status of the man for what he intended.

hebrew_text: אמר רב דימי בר שישנא משמיה דרב זאת אומרת כלי שרת מקדשין שלא מדעת רבינא אמר לעולם אימא לך כלי שרת אין מקדשין אלא מדעת וגזרה שמא יאמרו מוציאין מכלי שרת לחול
human_translation: Rav Dimi bar Shishna said in the name of Rav: That is to say service vessels consecrate without intent Ravina said: Actually, I will say to you service vessels consecrate only with intent But a decree lest say one may transfer in a service vessel to non-sacred
llm_translation: Rav Dimi bar Shishna said in the name of Rav: This means to say, vessels of the Temple service sanctify only with intent. Ravina said: Actually, I will say to you, vessels of the Temple service sanctify only with intent and decree, lest they say they are taken out from vessels of the Temple to secular use.

hebrew_text: מותיב ר' זירא סידר את הלחם ואת הבזיכין לאחר השבת והקטיר את הבזיכין בשבת פסולה כיצד יעשה יניחנו לשבת הבאה שאפילו הוא על שלחן ימים רבים אין בכך כלום
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raised an objection arranged the bread and the bowls after Shabbat, and he burned the bowls on Shabbat disqualified, How should one proceed He should leave until the following Shabbat, as even if it remained on the Table for many days, nothing with that,
llm_translation: Challenger: Rabbi Zeira arranged the bread and the spices after Shabbat, and he burned the spices on Shabbat. It is invalid. How should he do it? He should leave it for the following Shabbat, so that even if it is on the table for many days, there is nothing wrong with that.

hebrew_text: ואמאי התם נמי לימא גזירה שמא יאמרו מפקידין בכלי שרת
human_translation: But why There too, let us say a decree lest say one can store in a service vessel
llm_translation: And why there also say, let us say a decree lest they say they deposit in a vessel of service.

hebrew_text: פנים אחוץ קא רמית פנים לאו כולי עלמא ידעי חוץ כולי עלמא ידעי
human_translation: Are you raising a contradiction inside and outside inside not everyone is aware outside everyone is aware
llm_translation: "Outside you have raised faces, inside not everyone knows. Outside everyone knows, inside not everyone knows."

hebrew_text: תנן התם מותר נסכים לקיץ המזבח
human_translation: We learned there The surplus libations to supplementary of the altar [ keitz hamizbe’aḥ ].
llm_translation: We have learned there: "It is permitted to pour libations on the altar in the summer."

hebrew_text: מאי מותר נסכים
human_translation: What Surplus libations?
llm_translation: What is the allowance of libations?

hebrew_text: רבי חייא בר יוסף אמר בירוצי מדות ר' יוחנן אמר כאותה ששנינו המקבל עליו לספק סלתות מארבע ועמדו בשלש יספק מארבע
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef says: the overflows of measuring vessels. Rabbi Yoḥanan says: like that which we learned one who accepts upon himself to supply fine flour at four and stood at three supply at four
llm_translation: Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef said: In the courtyards of the Temple, Rabbi Yochanan said: Just as we learned, one who undertakes to supply four seahs of fine flour and delivers only three, should supply four.

hebrew_text: משלש ועמדו מארבע מספק מארבע שיד הקדש על העליונה
human_translation: at three and stood at four supply at four that the treasury is at an advantage.
llm_translation: From three and they stand, from four uncertain from four the hand of the Holy One, blessed be He, on the upper one.

hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דרבי חייא בר יוסף תניא כוותיה דרבי יוחנן
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef, is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yochanan.

hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דרבי חייא בר יוסף בירוצי מידות הללו מה היו עושין בהן אם יש זבח אחר יקריבו עמו ואם לנו יפסלו בלינה ואם לאו מקיצין בהן את המזבח וקיץ זה מהו עולות הבשר לשם ועורות לכהנים
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Yosef: These overflows of measuring vessels, what would be done with them? if there is another offering sacrifice with it And if were left overnight they are disqualified by being left overnight. And if not are used to supplement the altar. And these supplementary what burnt offerings; their flesh to God, and the hides to the priests.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Chiya bar Yosef: In these measurements of Hillel, what would they do with them? If there is another sacrifice, they would bring it with him, and if not, they would disqualify it through overnight stay. And if not, they would remove the altar from them. And what is the meaning of "burnt offerings of the flesh for the Name, and the skins for the priests"?

hebrew_text: תניא כוותיה דרבי יוחנן המקבל עליו לספק סלתות מארבע ועמדו משלש מספק מארבע משלש ועמדו מארבע מספק מארבע שיד הקדש על העליונה וזהו ששנינו מותר נסכים לקיץ המזבח:
human_translation: is taught in accordance with of Rabbi Yoḥanan: one who accepts upon himself to supply fine flour at four and stood at three supply at four at three and stood at four supply at four that the treasury is at an advantage. And this that we learned The surplus libations to supplementary of the altar.
llm_translation: It was taught in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: One who undertakes to supply fine flour from four measures and they stood at three, he supplies from four, they stood at three, and he supplies from four, the hand of the Holy One, blessed be He, is upon the upper one. And this is what we learned: libations are permitted for the summer of the altar.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל קרבנות הציבור והיחיד טעונין נסכים חוץ מן הבכור והמעשר והפסח והחטאת והאשם אלא שחטאתו של מצורע ואשמו טעונין נסכים:
human_translation: All offerings, communal or individual, require libations, except for the firstborn the tithe the Paschal offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering, But that sin offering of a leper and his guilt offering require libations.
llm_translation: Mishnah: All communal and individual sacrifices require libations, except for the firstborn, the tithe, the Passover offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering. However, the sin offering of a leper and his guilt offering require libations.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן
human_translation: The Sages taught
llm_translation: Talmudic text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן English translation: The Gemara: The Rabbis taught:

hebrew_text: (במדבר טו, ג) ועשיתם אשה לה' יכול כל העולה לאישים יהא טעון נסכים אפילו מנחה תלמוד לומר (במדבר טו, ג) עולה שלמים מנין תלמוד לומר זבח תודה מנין תלמוד לאמר או זבח
human_translation: “And you will make a fire offering to the Lord.” might any that is raised up as a fire offering shall require libations even a meal offering. The verse states: “A burnt offering,” from where a peace offering The verse states: “A sacrifice.” From where a thanks offering The verse states: “Or a sacrifice.”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Numbers 15:3) "And you shall make an offering by fire to the Lord." One might think that anyone who brings an offering must also bring libations, even a meal offering. Therefore, the verse states (Numbers 15:3), "a burnt offering." How do we know to include peace offerings? The verse states, "a thanksgiving sacrifice." How do we know to include a vow offering? English translation: (Numbers 15:3) "And you shall make an offering by fire to the Lord." One might think that everyone who brings an offering must also bring libations, even a meal offering. Therefore, the verse states (Numbers 15:3), "a burnt offering." How do we know to include peace offerings? The verse states, "a thanksgiving sacrifice." How do we know to include a vow offering?

hebrew_text: יכול שאני מרבה אף בכור ומעשר ופסח וחטאת ואשם תלמוד לומר (במדבר טו, ג) לפלא נדר או בנדבה בא בנדר ונדבה טעון נסכים שאינו בא בנדר ונדבה אין טעון נסכים
human_translation: might that I include even the firstborn the tithe the Paschal offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering. the verse states: “In fulfillment of a vow clearly uttered, or as a gift.” comes in a vow or a gift requires libations, which do not come in a vow or a gift not require libations.

hebrew_text: (במדבר טו, יא) ככה יעשה לשור האחד או לאיל האחד או לשה בכבשים או בעזים לשור האחד מה תלמוד לאמר לפי שמצינו שחלק הכתוב בין נסכי איל לנסכי כבש יכול נחלק בין נסכי פר לנסכי עגל תלמוד לאמר לשור האחד
human_translation: “So it shall be done for the one bull, or for the one ram, or for the kid of the lambs or of the goats” Why the verse state: “For the one bull”? Since we have found the verse differentiates between the libations of a ram and the libations of a lamb, might we differentiate between the libations of a bull, and the libations of a calf, the verse states: “For the one bull,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Numbers 15:11) "Thus shall it be done for one bull or for one ram or for one lamb or a kid of the goats." For one bull, what is the Talmud to say? Since we find that the verse distinguishes between the libations of a ram and the libations of a lamb, one might think it also distinguishes between the libations of a bull and the libations of a calf. The Talmud teaches to say, "for one bull."

hebrew_text: או לאיל מה תלמוד לאמר לפי שמצינו שחלק הכתוב בין נסכי בן שנה לנסכי בן שתים יכול נחלק בין נסכי בן שתים לנסכי בן שלש תלמוד לאמר או לאיל האחד
human_translation: Why the verse state: “For the one ram”? Since we have found the verse differentiates between the libations of in year and the libations of in second might we differentiate between the libations of in second and the libations of in third the verse states: “For the one ram,”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Or to a ram, what is the Talmud to say, for we find that the Scripture divided between the libations of a one-year-old lamb and the libations of a two-year-old lamb. One might think that it should also divide between the libations of a two-year-old lamb and the libations of a three-year-old lamb. The Talmud comes to say: Or to a ram, the one.

hebrew_text: או לשה בכבשים מה תלמוד לאמר לפי שמצינו שחלק הכתוב בין נסכי כבש לנסכי איל יכול נחלק בין נסכי כבשה לנסכי רחלה תלמוד לאמר או לשה בכבשים
human_translation: Why the verse state: “For the kid of the lambs”? It could be that it also distinguishes between libations of a female lamb and libations of a female ram. The Talmud says: Or for a ewe in sheep.

hebrew_text: או בעזים מה תלמוד לאמר לפי שמצינו שחלק הכתוב בין נסכי כבש לנסכי איל יכול נחלק בין נסכי גדי לנסכי שעיר תלמוד לומר או בעזים
human_translation: Why the verse state: “Or of the goats”? Since we have found that the verse differentiates between the libations of a male lamb and the libations of a ram, might we differentiate between the libations of a kid and the libations of goat. the verse states: “Or of the goats.”
llm_translation: Or with goats, what is the Talmud to say? For we find that the Scripture distinguishes between libations of a lamb and libations of a ram. Could it differentiate between libations of a kid and libations of a he-goat? The Talmud teaches to say, "Or with goats."

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא בדיק לן רבא

hebrew_text: מתני׳ כל קרבנות הצבור אין בהן סמיכה חוץ מן הפר הבא על כל המצות ושעיר המשתלח רבי שמעון אומר אף שעיר עבודת כוכבים
human_translation: all communal offerings there is no placing hands except for the bull that comes for any of the mitzvot and the scapegoat Rabbi Shimon says: Also goat idol worship
llm_translation: Mishnah: All communal sacrifices do not require leaning of hands except for the bull that is brought for all the commandments and the scapegoat. Rabbi Shimon says: Also the scapegoat of idol worship.

hebrew_text: כל קרבנות היחיד טעונין סמיכה חוץ מן הבכור והמעשר והפסח
human_translation: All offerings of an individual require placing hands, except for the firstborn the tithe and the Paschal offering.
llm_translation: All sacrifices the individual require leaning except for the firstborn, the tithe, and the Passover.

hebrew_text: והיורש סומך ומביא נסכים ומימר:

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן כל קרבנות הצבור אין בהן סמיכה חוץ מפר הבא על כל המצות ושעירי עבודת כוכבים דברי רבי שמעון רבי יהודה אומר שעירי עבודת כוכבים אין בהן סמיכה ואת מי אביא תחתיהם שעיר המשתלח
human_translation: The Sages taught all communal offerings there is no placing hands, except for the bull that comes for any of the mitzvot, and goats for of idol worship; the statement of Rabbi Shimon. Rabbi Yehuda says: There is no placing hands goats for idol worship. But which shall I bring in their place? The scapegoat.
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught: All communal sacrifices do not require leaning of hands except for the bull brought for any transgression and the goats of idol worship. These are the words of Rabbi Shimon; Rabbi Yehuda says: The goats of idol worship do not require leaning of hands. And who do I bring under them? The scapegoat.

hebrew_text: לא סגיא דלא מעייל אמר רבינא גמירי שתי סמיכות בצבור
