llm_translation: Not significant that not brings. Said Ravina: learned two ordinations in public.

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי שמעון והלא אין סמיכה אלא בבעלים וזה אהרן ובניו סומכין בו אמר לו אף זה אהרן ובניו מתכפרין בו
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said to Isn’t it placing hands only by owner, And this Aaron or his sons places hands on it, said to him: this as well, Aaron and his sons achieve atonement through it
llm_translation: Said to him Rabbi Shimon, "But isn't semicha only with sacrifices, and this is Aharon and his sons leaning on it?" He said to him, "Indeed, this is Aharon and his sons atoning with it."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' ירמיה ואזדו לטעמייהו
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya said: And follow reasoning.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yirmiyah: "And they went according to their reasons."

hebrew_text: דתניא (ויקרא טז, לג) וכפר את מקדש הקדש זה לפני ולפנים ואת אהל מועד זה היכל מזבח כמשמעו יכפר אלו העזרות כהנים כמשמען על כל עם הקהל אלו ישראל יכפר אלו הלוים
human_translation: as it is taught “He shall bring atonement upon the sanctum of the sacred”; this the innermost sanctum, “And upon the Tent of Meeting”; this Sanctuary. altar”; in accordance with its plain meaning. “He shall effect atonement”; this courtyards. priests”; in accordance with its plain meaning. upon all the people”; these are the Israelites. “Shall he bring atonement”; this the Levites.
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita (Leviticus 16:33), "And he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary, this is before and in front of, and for the Tent of Meeting, this is the Sanctuary, the Altar." 'He shall make atonement' - these are the Temple Courtyards; 'for the priests' - as it sounds; 'for all the congregation' - these are the Israelites; 'for the Levites' - as it sounds.

hebrew_text: הושוו כולן לכפרה אחת שמתכפרין בשעיר המשתלח דברי רבי יהודה
human_translation: All of them are equated with regard to one atonement, that they are atoned for by the scapegoat the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: They were all equal for one atonement, atoning with the scapegoat - the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון אומר כשם שדם שעיר הנעשה בפנים מכפר על ישראל על טומאת מקדש וקדשיו כך דם הפר מכפר על הכהנים על טומאת מקדש וקדשיו כשם שוידוי של שעיר המשתלח מכפר על ישראל בשאר עבירות כך וידוי של פר מכפר על הכהנים בשאר עבירות
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Just as blood of the goat whose performed inside atones for Israelites for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial so too, blood of the bull atones for the priests for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial just as confession over the scapegoat atones for Israelites for other transgressions, so too, confession over bull atones for the priests for other transgressions.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Just as the blood of the goat that is brought inside atones for the Israelites regarding the impurity of the sanctuary and its holy items, so too the blood of the cow atones for the priests regarding the impurity of the sanctuary and its holy items. Just as the confession of the goat that is sent away atones for Israel for other transgressions, so too the confession of the cow atones for the priests for other transgressions.

hebrew_text: ור' שמעון הא ודאי הושוו אין הושוו דבני כפרה נינהו מיהו כל חד וחד מכפר בדנפשיה
human_translation: And according to Rabbi Shimon, Weren’t certainly equated they are equated that they are all subject to atonement but each one achieves atonement in its own
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon said: "Certainly they are equal, they are equal, for they are like the sons of atonement. Nevertheless, each and every one atones for himself."

hebrew_text: לרבי יהודה טומאת מקדש וקדשיו ישראל מכפרי בדם שעיר הנעשה בפנים וכהנים בפר של אהרן בשאר עבירות אלו ואלו מכפרי בוידוי שעיר המשתלח ולרבי שמעון בשאר עבירות נמי כהנים בוידוי דפר מתכפרי
human_translation: According to Rabbi Yehuda, defiling of Temple or its sacrificial Israelites achieve atonemment through blood of the goat whose performed inside and priests through bull of Aaron, for other transgressions, these and those achieve atonement through confession scapegoat. But according to Rabbi Shimon, for other transgressions as well, priests achieve atonement through confession over bull
llm_translation: To Rabbi Yehudah, the impurity of the Sanctuary and its sanctified items, Israelites atone with the blood of the goat that is made inside, and the priests with the bull of Aaron. In other transgressions, both these and those atone with confession. The goat that is sent away atones, and according to Rabbi Shimon, in other transgressions, priests also atone with confession, for the bull atones.

hebrew_text: כדקתני אחד ישראל ואחד כהנים ואחד כהן משיח מה בין ישראל לכהנים ולכהן משיח אלא שדם הפר מכפר על הכהנים על טומאת מקדש וקדשיו [זו דברי ר' יהודה]
human_translation: like that is taught Israelites and priests and anointed priest, What between Israelites, priests, and anointed priest? only that the bull atones for the priests for defiling of Temple or its sacrificial this is the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: As it was taught: "One Israelite, one Kohen, and one Kohen Mashiah. What is the difference between Israelites, Kohanim, and Kohen Mashiah? Except that the blood of the bull atones for the Kohanim for the impurity of the sanctuary and its holy items." This is the statement of Rabbi Yehudah

hebrew_text: ור' שמעון אומר כשם שדם השעיר הנעשה בפנים מכפר על ישראל כך דם הפר מכפר על הכהנים כשם שוידויו של שעיר המשתלח מכפר על ישראל כך וידויו של פר מכפר על הכהנים
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon says: just as blood of the goat, whose performed inside atones for Israelites, so blood of the bull atones for the priests. just as confession over the scapegoat atones for Israelites, so confession over bull atones for the priests.
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Just as the blood of the goat that is done inside atones for the Israelites, so too the blood of the cow atones for the priests. Just as the confession of the goat that is sent away atones for the Israelites, so too the confession of the cow atones for the priests.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן (ויקרא ד, טו) וסמכו זקני העדה את ידיהם על ראש הפר פר טעון סמיכה ואין שעירי עבודת כוכבים טעונין סמיכה דברי ר' יהודה
human_translation: the Sages taught “And the elders of the congregation shall place their hands upon the head of the bull before the Lord” bull requires placing hands, but goats for idol worship do not require placing hands; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "And the elders of the congregation shall lay their hands upon the head of the bull" (Leviticus 4:15). A bull requires semikah, but the goats of idol worship do not require semikah. These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah.

hebrew_text: ר' שמעון אומר פר טעון סמיכה בזקנים ואין שעירי עבודת כוכבים טעון סמיכה בזקנים אלא באהרן
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: bull requires placing hands by Elders but goats for idol worship do not require placing hands by the Elders, rather by Aaron,
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: "A bull requires semichah with the elders, and the he-goats of idolatrous worship require semichah with the elders only with Aharon."

hebrew_text: ורמינהו החי החי טעון סמיכה ואין שעירי עבודת כוכבים טעונין סמיכה דברי ר' יהודה ר' שמעון אומר חי טעון סמיכה באהרן
human_translation: And raises a contradiction “the live the live requires placing hands, but the goats for idol worship do not require placing hands; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: live requires placing hands by Aaron,
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: "The living animal requires semichah, but the scapegoat used in the atonement ritual for idol worship does not require semichah." These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah; Rabbi Shimon says, "The living animal requires semichah, just like the scapegoat used by Aaron."

hebrew_text: ואין שעירי עבודת כוכבים טעונין סמיכה באהרן אלא בזקנים
human_translation: but the goats for idol worship do not require placing hands by Aaron. Rather, by the Elders
llm_translation: And the he-goats of idol worship do not require leaning on Aaron, only on the elders.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת ותסברא דהך קמייתא מתרצתא היא הא אמר ר' שמעון סמיכה בבעלים בעינן
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: And you understand that this first is accurate, But didn’t Rabbi Shimon say we require placing hands by owners,
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said, "And the logic of that earlier statement is satisfactory, for Rabbi Shimon said, 'We require proximity in cases of owners.'"

hebrew_text: אלא תריץ הכי הפר פר טעון סמיכה ואין שעירי עבודת כוכבים טעונין סמיכה דברי רבי יהודה רבי שמעון אומר החי חי טעון סמיכה באהרן ואין שעירי עבודת כוכבים טעונין סמיכה באהרן אלא בזקנים
human_translation: Rather, answer as follows: the bull bull requires placing hands, but goats for idol worship do not require placing hands; the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: the live live requires placing hands by Aaron, but the goats idol worship do not require placing hands by Aaron. Rather, by the Elders
llm_translation: Rather, run thus: "The bull requires semikhah." And the he-goats of idolatry do not require semikhah. These are the words of Rabbi Yehudah; Rabbi Shimon says: "The living creature requires semikhah." In the case of Aharon. And the he-goats of idolatry do not require semikhah in the case of Aharon, but in the case of the elders.

hebrew_text: והכי קא אמר ליה ר' שמעון לר' יהודה שעירי עבודת כוכבים בעו סמיכה ואי שמיע לך דלא בעו סמיכה באהרן הוא דשמיע לך ומיעוטא מהחי הוא
human_translation: And this is what Rabbi Shimon was saying to Rabbi Yehuda: Goats for idol worship require placing hands. And if you heard that they do not require placing hands, it is with regard to Aaron, that you heard and the exclusion is from “the live
llm_translation: And so he said to him, Rabbi Shimon said to Rabbi Yehuda, "The goat of idol worship requires semichah. And if you hear that semichah is not required for Aharon, it is he who is telling you, and it is a limitation from the living."

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה למה לי למעטינהו מקרא והא אמר רבינא גמירי שתי סמיכות בצבור גירסא בעלמא
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, why do I to exclude from a verse? Didn’t Ravina say is learned two placing hands for communal merely a well-known statement.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, why do I need to lessen them from the verse? But didn't Ravina say: We have learned that two ordinations in public is just a general statement.

hebrew_text: ורבי שמעון שעירי עבודת כוכבים דבעיא סמיכה מנלן
human_translation: And Rabbi Shimon, from where do we that goats idol worship require placing hands?
llm_translation: And Rabbi Shimon She'ari regarding idol worship requires leaning, from where do we derive this?

hebrew_text: נפקא לן מדתניא (ויקרא ד, כד) וסמך ידו על ראש השעיר לרבות שעיר נחשון לסמיכה דברי ר' יהודה ר' שמעון אומר לרבות שעירי עבודת כוכבים לסמיכה שהיה ר' שמעון אומר כל חטאת שנכנס דמה לפנים טעונה סמיכה
human_translation: we derive from that which is taught And he shall place his hand upon the head of the goat” to include goat Nahshon in placing hands the statement of Rabbi Yehuda. Rabbi Shimon says: to include goats idol worship in placing hands as Rabbi Shimon would say: Any sin offering whose blood enters inside requires placing hands.
llm_translation: We have learned from a Baraita (Leviticus 4:24), "And he shall lay his hand upon the head of the he-goat" to include the he-goat of Nahshon for the laying on of hands. The words of Rabbi Yehudah: Rabbi Shimon says to include the he-goats of idol worship for the laying on of hands, as Rabbi Shimon used to say, "Any sin-offering whose blood enters inside requires laying on of hands."

hebrew_text: למה לי למימרא שהיה סימנא בעלמא
human_translation: Why do I to state: As would merely a mnemonic
llm_translation: "Why do I need to say that there was a sign in the world?"

hebrew_text: ואימא שעיר הנעשה בפנים דומיא דשעיר נשיא דמכפר על עבירות מצוה ידועה
human_translation: But say goat whose performed inside similar to goat of a king, which atones for known transgressions of a mitzva.
llm_translation: And say: "The goat that is made inside is similar to the goat, the leader, that atones for well-known sins."

hebrew_text: ולרבינא דאמר גמירי שתי סמיכות בציבור קראי למה לי
human_translation: And according to Ravina, who said: is learned two placing hands for communal why do I verses,
llm_translation: And according to Ravina who said, "It is learned: Two ordinations in public, what are the verses for?"

hebrew_text: איצטריך הלכתא ואיצטריך קראי
human_translation: The halakha was necessary, and the verses was necessary
llm_translation: It is necessary a law, and it is necessary verses.

hebrew_text: דאי מקרא הוה אמינא זבחי שלמי ציבור
human_translation: As, if from the verse, I would say communal peace offerings,
llm_translation: If it were a verse, I would say "the communal peace offerings."

hebrew_text: כי קשיא אמתניתין דהך פירקא דכל המנחות באות אמר ר' שמעון שלשה מינין טעונין שלש מצות
human_translation: like difficulty against the mishna of that chapter, All the meal offerings come Rabbi Shimon says: three types require three mitzvot;
llm_translation: For difficult are the Mishnaic statements of this chapter of all meal-offerings come, said Rabbi Shimon: three types require three commandments.

hebrew_text: ליתי בקל וחומר ויהו זבחי שלמי ציבור טעונין סמיכה מקל וחומר מה שלמי יחיד שאין טעונין תנופה חיים טעונין סמיכה חיים וכו' איצטריך הלכתא
human_translation: Let us bring an a fortiori communal peace offerings should require placing hands through an a fortiori If peace offerings an individual, that they do not require waving alive, require placing hands, was necessary the halakha
llm_translation: Let it come with a fortiori reasoning: and let the peace offerings of the community require semikha. A fortiori reasoning: just as the peace offerings of an individual, which do not require waving, require semikha, so too the peace offerings of the community require semikha. And so on. This is necessary for the halakha.

hebrew_text: ואי מהלכתא (הוה אמינא) לא ידעינן הי נינהו קמשמע לן דומיא דשעיר נשיא דמכפר על עבירות מצוה ידועה:
human_translation: And if from the halakha I would say we do not know which teaches us similar to goat of a king, which atones for known transgressions of a mitzva,
llm_translation: And if on the way (I would say), we do not know who they are, we learn from this that they are like the he-goat brought as an atonement for known transgressions.

hebrew_text: כל קרבנות היחיד טעונין סמיכה חוץ מבכור ומעשר ופסח:
human_translation: All offerings of an individual require placing hands except for the firstborn the tithe and the Paschal offering.
llm_translation: All sacrifices the individual require leaning except firstborn and tithe and Passover.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן (ויקרא א, ג) קרבנו ולא הבכור שיכול והלא דין הוא ומה שלמים שאין קדושתן מרחם טעונין סמיכה בכור שקדושתו מרחם אינו דין שטעון סמיכה תלמוד לומר קרבנו ולא הבכור
human_translation: The Sages taught “His offering” but not the firstborn As might Could this not inference, If a peace offering, whose consecration does not from womb, requires placing hands, a firstborn whose consecration from the womb, is it not logical that it requires placing hands? the verse states: “His offering,” but the firstborn not.
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "His offering" (Leviticus 1:3) - and not the firstborn. Is it possible? But isn't it logical? And just as peace offerings, whose sanctity does not require leaning of hands, require leaning of hands, the firstborn, whose sanctity is from the womb, is it not logical that it requires leaning of hands? The Torah teaches to say, "His offering" - and not the firstborn.

hebrew_text: קרבנו ולא מעשר שיכול והלא דין הוא ומה שלמים שאין מקדשין לפניהם ולאחריהם טעונין סמיכה מעשר שמקדש לפניו ולאחריו אינו דין שטעון סמיכה תלמוד לומר קרבנו ולא מעשר
human_translation: “His offering” but not the tithe As might Could this not inference, If peace offerings, does not consecrate before and after them, require placing hands, tithe which can consecrate before and after it, is it not logical that it requires placing hands? the verse states: “His offering,” but the tithe not.
llm_translation: Its offering and not tithe, that it can, and is it not the same? And what about peace offerings that are not sanctified before or after them require leaning, tithe that sanctifies before and after it is not the same, as the Scripture says, "Its offering and not tithe."

hebrew_text: קרבנו ולא פסח שיכול והלא דין הוא ומה שלמים שאינו בעמוד והבא טעונין סמיכה פסח שהוא בעמוד והבא אינו דין שטעון סמיכה תלמוד לומר קרבנו ולא פסח
human_translation: “His offering” but not the Paschal offering. As might Could this not inference, If peace offerings, which are not arise and bring require placing hands, a Paschal offering, which is arise and bring is it not logical that it requires placing hands? the verse states: “His offering,” but the Paschal offering not.
llm_translation: Its offering and not Passover, that he can bring, and is it not the same law? And as for peace offerings which are not on the altar and one who comes requires semichah, Passover which is on the altar and one who comes does not require semichah, the Talmud teaches to say "its offering and not Passover."

hebrew_text: איכא למיפרך מה לשלמים שכן טעונין נסכים ותנופת חזה ושוק קראי אסמכתא בעלמא
human_translation: can be refuted. What about peace offerings? that they require libations and the waving of the breast and thigh. the verses a mere support,
llm_translation: There is to refute, what for the peace offerings, as thus they require libations and the waving of the breast and the thigh, it is merely a support.

hebrew_text: אלא
human_translation: But
llm_translation: Rather

hebrew_text: קראי למה לי קרבנו ולא קרבן חבירו קרבנו ולא קרבן עובד כוכבים קרבנו לרבות כל בעלי קרבן לסמיכה:
human_translation: why do I verses? “his offering” but not an offering of another “his offering” but not an offering of a gentile. “his offering” to include all owners of offering in placing hands,
llm_translation: The verses - why do I need "his offering" and not "the offering of his fellow," "his offering" and not "the offering of a non-Jew," "his offering" to include all those bringing an offering for the laying on of hands.

hebrew_text: היורש סומך:
human_translation: the heir places hands
llm_translation: The inheritor relies.

hebrew_text: תני רב חנניה קמיה דרבא יורש אינו סומך יורש אינו מימר והא אנן תנן היורש סומך ומביא את נסכיו ומימר
human_translation: Rav Ḥananya taught in the presence of Rava: An heir does not place hands an heir cannot substitute But didn’t we learn The heir places hands and brings libations, and he can substitute
llm_translation: It was taught: Rav Hananiah taught before Rava: An heir does not rely; an heir does not say. But did we not learn: An heir relies and brings his libations and says.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה איפכאי אמר ליה לא מתניתין מני רבי יהודה היא דתניא יורש סומך יורש מימר רבי יהודה אומר יורש אינו סומך יורש אינו מימר
human_translation: said to Should I reverse said to him: No, whose the mishna? It is Rabbi Yehuda, as it is taught An heir places hands, an heir can effect substitution. Rabbi Yehuda says: An heir does not place hands, an heir cannot effect substitution.
llm_translation: He said to him: "Iphkai." He said to him: "It is not in accordance with the teaching of Rabbi Yehuda, as it was taught in a Baraita: An heir who is a blind person may rely on another heir." Rabbi Yehuda says: "An heir may inherit but may not rely on another heir."

hebrew_text: מאי טעמא דר' יהודה קרבנו ולא קרבן אביו ויליף תחלת הקדש מסוף הקדש מה סוף הקדש יורש אינו סומך אף תחילת הקדש יורש אינו מימר
human_translation: What is the reasoning of Rabbi Yehuda? “his offering” but not one’s father’s offering And derives the initial stage of consecration, from the final stage of consecration: Just as the final stage of consecration, an heir does not place hands, so too, the initial stage of consecration, an heir cannot effect substitution.
llm_translation: What is the reason that Rabbi Yehuda considers his offering as a sacrifice, but not his father's offering? He derives the beginning of sanctity from the end of sanctity. Just as the end of sanctity does not confer inheritance, so too the beginning of sanctity does not confer inheritance.

hebrew_text: ורבנן (ויקרא כז, י) המר ימיר לרבות את היורש ויליף סוף הקדש מתחילת הקדש מה תחלת הקדש יורש מימר אף סוף הקדש יורש סומך
human_translation: And the Rabbis, he shall substitute [ hamer yamir ] to include the heir And they derive final stage of consecration, from an initial stage of consecration: Just as the initial stage of consecration, an heir can effect substitution, so too, the final stage of consecration, an heir places hands.
llm_translation: The Sages (Leviticus 27:10) who taught: "If one exchanges to include the heir, and he then deduces the end of the consecrated property from the beginning of the consecrated property, just as at the beginning of the consecrated property the heir is included, so too at the end of the consecrated property the heir is included."

hebrew_text: ורבנן האי קרבנו מאי עבדי ליה קרבנו ולא קרבן עובד כוכבים קרבנו ולא קרבן חבירו קרבנו לרבות כל בעלי קרבן לסמיכה
human_translation: And the Rabbis, what do they do with this “His offering”? “his offering” but not an offering of a gentile. “his offering” but not an offering of another “his offering” to include all owners of offering in placing hands,
llm_translation: And the Rabbis: What does this "his offering" do? His offering, but not the offering of a non-Jew. His offering, but not the offering of his fellow. His offering includes all those who bring an offering for the laying on of hands.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה לרבות כל בעלי קרבן לסמיכה לית ליה ואי נמי אית ליה עובד כוכבים וחבירו מחד קרא נפקא אייתרו ליה תרי קראי חד קרבנו ולא קרבן אביו ואידך לרבות כל בעלי קרבן לסמיכה
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda does not hold to include all owners of offering in placing hands, Alternatively, he holds derive a gentile or another from one verse, leaves him two verses. One “his offering” but not his father’s offering and the other to include all owners of offering in placing hands.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda includes all owners of a sacrifice for semichah, he does not have it. And if he has it, a non-Jew and his fellow from one side, a verse comes out extra for him, two verses, one his sacrifice and not his father's sacrifice. And the other to include all owners of a sacrifice for semichah.

hebrew_text: ורבי יהודה האי המר ימיר מאי עביד ליה מיבעי ליה לרבות את האשה דתניא לפי שכל הענין כולו אינו מדבר אלא בלשון זכר מה סופינו לרבות את האשה תלמוד לומר המר ימיר
human_translation: And Rabbi Yehuda, what does he do in this he shall substitute [ hamer yamir ]”? He requires it to include a woman As it is taught Since the entire matter is stated only in the masculine form, what we ultimately to include a woman? The verse states: he shall substitute [ hamer yamir ],”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: This "mar" (bitter substance), what does he do with it? It is necessary for him to include the woman, as it was taught: Since the entire matter speaks only in the masculine language, what is the conclusion? To include the woman. It is stated in the Torah: "The mar will change" (Numbers 5:24).

hebrew_text: ורבנן דרשי מואם ור' יהודה ואם לא דריש:
human_translation: And the Rabbis, they derive from “And if” And Rabbi Yehuda does not expound “and if”
llm_translation: And the Rabbis expounded: "Mo'am," and Rabbi Yehuda, and if not, he did not expound.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הכל סומכין חוץ מחרש שוטה וקטן וסומא ועובד כוכבים והעבד והשליח והאשה
human_translation: Everyone places hands except for a deaf-mute, an imbecile, a minor, a blind person, a gentile, slave, the agent and a woman.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Everyone is eligible except for a deaf-mute, imbecile, minor, blind person, idolater, slave, agent, and woman.

hebrew_text: וסמיכה שירי מצוה
human_translation: And placing hands is a non-essential mitzva;
llm_translation: And "Semicha" of leftover Mitzvah.

hebrew_text: על הראש בב' ידים ובמקום שסומכין שוחטין ותכף לסמיכה שחיטה:
human_translation: on the head with two hands. And in the location that one places hands, one slaughters And immediately following placing hands, slaughter
llm_translation: On the head with two hands, and in a place where they lean, they slaughter, and immediately after leaning, slaughter.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ בשלמא חרש שוטה וקטן דלאו בני דעה נינהו עובד כוכבים נמי (ויקרא א, ב) בני ישראל סומכין ואין עובדי כוכבים סומכין אלא סומא מאי טעמא לא
human_translation: Granted, a deaf-mute, an imbecile, and a minor as they are not mentally competent. a gentile the children of Israel place hands but gentiles do not place hands But a blind person, what is the reason not
llm_translation: Gemara: Granted, a deaf-mute, a fool, and a minor are not considered people of understanding; however, even idolaters (Leviticus 1:2) "the children of Israel lean," and idolaters do not lean, rather, they are blind. What is the reason? No.

hebrew_text: רב חסדא ורב יצחק בר אבדימי חד אמר אתיא סמיכה סמיכה מזקני עדה
human_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi One said derived placing hands placing hands by Elders of congregation,
llm_translation: Rav Ḥisda and Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi, one said: "The leaning of hands must be from the elders of the congregation."

hebrew_text: וחד אמר אתיא סמיכה סמיכה מעולת ראייה
human_translation: And one said derived placing hands placing hands burnt offering of appearance
llm_translation: And one said: "The proximity of one halachic ruling to another halachic ruling is superior as proof."

hebrew_text: ולמאן דאמר מעולת ראייה מאי טעמא לא יליף מן זקני עדה
human_translation: And according to the one who said from burnt offering of appearance, what is the reason he does not derive from Elders of congregation?
llm_translation: And according to the one who says the superiority of evidence, what is the reason he does not derive from the elders of the congregation?

hebrew_text: דנין יחיד מיחיד ואין דנין יחיד מציבור
human_translation: one derives an individual from an individual, and one does not derive an individual from a communal
llm_translation: We judge an individual against another individual, but we do not judge an individual against the community.

hebrew_text: ולמאן דיליף מזקני עדה מאי טעמא לא יליף מעולת ראייה דנין מידי דכתיב ביה סמיכה בגופיה ממידי דכתיב ביה סמיכה בגופיה לאפוקי עולת ראייה דהיא גופה מעולת נדבה גמרה
human_translation: And according to the one who said from Elders of congregation, what is the reason he does not derive from burnt offering of appearance? one derives a matter which placing hands is written with regard to itself, from matter which placing hands is written with regard to itself, to exclude burnt offering of appearance, as it itself is derived from a voluntary burnt offering.
llm_translation: And according to the one who derives the law from the elders of the congregation, what is the reason that he does not derive the law from the elevation offering of proof? It is because we derive laws from something that has the laying on of hands written about it in its own body, to exclude the elevation offering of proof, which is its own body, from being derived from.

hebrew_text: דתני תנא קמיה דרב יצחק בר אבא (ויקרא ט, טז) ויקרב את העולה ויעשה כמשפט כמשפט עולת נדבה לימד על עולת חובה שטעונה סמיכה:
human_translation: as a tanna taught in the presence of Rav Yitzḥak bar Abba: “And the burnt offering was presented, and he sacrificed in accordance with the ordinance” In accordance with the ordinance of a voluntary burnt offering. teaches about obligatory burnt offering, that it requires placing hands,
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita before Rav Yitzchak bar Abba (Leviticus 9:16) "And he brought the burnt offering and performed it according to the ordinance." "According to the ordinance" - this teaches about a voluntary burnt offering that requires semichah.

hebrew_text: והעבד והשליח והאשה: תנו רבנן (ויקרא א, ד) ידו ולא יד עבדו ידו ולא יד שלוחו ידו ולא יד אשתו
human_translation: slave, the agent and a woman the Sages taught “His hand” but not the hand of his slave; “his hand” but not the hand of his agent; “his hand” but not the hand of his wife.
llm_translation: And the slave, and the messenger, and the woman: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 1:4) "His hand" - and not the hand of his slave, "his hand" - and not the hand of his messenger, "his hand" - and not the hand of his wife.

hebrew_text: כל הני למה לי צריכא אי כתב רחמנא חד הוה אמינא למעוטי עבד דלאו בר מצות אבל שליח דבר מצוה הוא ושלוחו של אדם כמותו אימא לסמוך
human_translation: Why do I all these are necessary, had the Merciful One written one I would say to exclude slave, as he is not commanded in mitzvot But an agent, since he is commanded in mitzvot, and a person’s agent is like himself, say could place hands
llm_translation: All these, why do I need? If the Merciful One had written one, I would have said to exclude a slave who is not a son of a commandment, but a messenger of a commandment he is, and his messenger is like himself, say to rely on.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן הני תרתי דלאו כגופיה דמיא אבל אשתו דכגופיה דמיא אימא תיסמך צריכא:
human_translation: And had taught us these two as they are not considered like his own flesh. But his wife, who is considered like his own flesh, say she places hands necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to hear these two, that they are not similar to its essence, but his wife, who is similar to his essence, I would say that it is necessary to rely on it.

hebrew_text: סמיכה שירי מצוה: ת"ר (ויקרא א, ד) וסמך (ויקרא א, ד) ונרצה וכי סמיכה מכפרת והלא אין כפרה אלא בדם שנאמר (ויקרא יז, יא) כי הדם הוא בנפש יכפר אלא לומר לך שאם עשאה לסמיכה שירי מצוה מעלה עליו הכתוב כאילו לא כיפר וכיפר
human_translation: placing hands is a non-essential mitzva. The Sages taught “And he shall place his hand and it shall be accepted for him But does placing hands effect atonement? Isn’t atonement only through blood? As it is stated for it is the blood of the soul that effects atonement” Rather, to say to you that if one treated placing hands a non-essential mitzva the verse ascribes him as though he did not effect atonement; but atones
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Semikha shirei mitzvah: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 1:4) "And he shall lay his hand (semakh) (Leviticus 1:4) and it shall be accepted." But does semikha atone? Is it not only through blood that atonement is achieved, as it is stated (Leviticus 17:11) "For the blood, by reason of the life, atones"? Rather, to tell you that if one performs semikha with the remnants of a mitzvah, the Scripture regards it as if he has not atoned, yet he has atoned.

hebrew_text: ותניא גבי תנופה כי האי גוונא (ויקרא יד, כא) לתנופה לכפר וכי תנופה מכפרת והלא אין כפרה אלא בדם שנאמר כי הדם הוא בנפש יכפר אלא לומר לך שאם עשאה לתנופה שירי מצוה מעלה עליו הכתוב כאילו לא כיפר וכיפר:
human_translation: And it is taught with regard to waving in this way: to be waved to effect atonement Does waving effect atonement? Isn’t atonement only through the blood? As it is stated: “For it is the blood of the soul that effects atonement” Rather, to say to you that if one treated waving a non-essential mitzva the verse ascribes him as though he did not effect atonement; but effects atonement
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita regarding waving, for this type (Leviticus 14:21) "for waving, for atonement." But does waving atone? Is not atonement only through blood, as it is stated, "for the blood is the life, it atones"? Rather, to tell you that if one performs waving with leftover offerings, the Scripture regards it as if he did not atone, yet he did atone.

hebrew_text: על הראש: תנו רבנן ידו על הראש ולא ידו על הצואר ידו על הראש ולא ידו על הגביים ידו על הראש ולא ידו על החזה
human_translation: on the head The Sages taught “his hand upon the head” but not his hand on the neck “his hand upon the head” but not his hand on the back “his hand upon the head” but not his hand on the breast
llm_translation: On the head: The Sages taught: His hand on the head and not his hand on the neck, his hand on the head and not his hand on the thighs, his hand on the head and not his hand on the chest.

hebrew_text: כל הני למה לי צריכי דאי כתב רחמנא חד למעוטי צואר דלא קאי בהדי ראשו אבל גבו דקאי להדי ראשו אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: Why do I all these are necessary, had the Merciful One written one I would say to exclude neck, as it is not level with the head of But its back, which is level with its head, say not necessary
llm_translation: All these, why do I need them? For if the Merciful One had written one case to exclude the neck that is not adjacent to the head, but the back that is adjacent to the head, I would say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן הני תרי משום דלא איתרבי לתנופה אבל חזה דאיתרבי לתנופה אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And had taught us these two as not included in waving But breast, which is included in the waving not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say these two cases are different because they do not combine for waving, but if it is seen that they do combine for waving, say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו ידו על הצדדין מהו תא שמע דתניא אבא ביראה ברבי אליעזר בן יעקב אומר ידו על ראשו ולא ידו על הצדדין
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before his hand on the sides what is Come hear, as it is taught Abba Bira’a, son of Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, says his hand upon the head of on its head and not his hand on the sides
llm_translation: The question was asked to them: his hand on the sides, what is the ruling? Come and hear, as it was taught in a Baraita: Abba B'Yira in the name of Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: his hand on his head, and not his hand on the sides.

hebrew_text: בעי רבי ירמיה מטלית מהו שתחוץ תא שמע ובלבד שלא תהא דבר חוצץ בינו לבין הזבח:
human_translation: Rabbi Yirmeya raises a dilemma: a cloth, what is to an interposition Come hear provided that there is no item that interposes between him and the offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yirmiyah inquired: "Regarding a garment, what is the ruling if it is spread out? Come and hear: as long as there is nothing intervening between it and the sacrifice."

hebrew_text: ובשתי ידים: מנא הני מילי אמר ריש לקיש דאמר קרא (ויקרא טז, כא) וסמך אהרן את שתי ידו כתיב ידו וכתיב שתי זה בנה אב כל מקום שנאמר ידו הרי כאן שתים עד שיפרט לך הכתוב אחת
human_translation: with two hands. From where are these matters Reish Lakish said: As the verse states “And Aaron shall place both his hands [ yadav ] His hand. But it is written “both,” This established a paradigm any place where it is stated His hand, there are here two unless the verse specifies one.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: "And with two hands: From where are these matters derived? Reish Lakish said, as the verse states (Leviticus 16:21), 'And Aaron shall lay both his hands.' It is written 'his hand' and it is written 'both,' this teaches that in every place where it says 'his hand,' here it means two, until the verse specifies one."

hebrew_text: אזל רבי אלעזר אמרה להא שמעתא בבי מדרשא ולא אמרה משמיה דריש לקיש שמע ריש לקיש ואיקפד אמר ליה אי סלקא דעתך כל היכא דכתיב ידו תרתי נינהו למה לי למכתב ידיו ידיו
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar went and stated this halakha in the study hall, but he did not say it in the name of Reish Lakish. Reish Lakish heard and became angry. said to If it enters your mind wherever it is written: His hand, there are two why do I to write: His hands, his hands,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar went, she said to him, "I heard in the study hall, and did not say in the name of Resh Lakish, 'Listen, Resh Lakish,' and he became angry. He said to him, 'If it were your opinion, wherever it is written "his hands," why do I need "his hands" written twice? His hands.'"

hebrew_text: אקשי ליה עשרים וארבע ידיו (ויקרא ז, ל) ידיו תביאנה (דברים לג, ז) ידיו רב לו (בראשית מח, יד) שכל את ידיו אישתיק
human_translation: raised objections against him twenty-four His hands, “His own hands [ yadav ] shall bring “his hands [ yadav ] shall contend for him, “Guiding his hands [ yadav ] wittingly, was silent,
llm_translation: I will ask him, "twenty-four his hands" (Leviticus 7:30) "his hands shall bring" (Deuteronomy 33:7) "his hands are abundant for him" (Genesis 48:14) "he restrained his hands"

hebrew_text: לבתר דנח דעתיה אמר ליה מאי טעמא לא תימא לי ידיו דסמיכה קאמרי
human_translation: After calmed down, he said to What is the reason you did not say to me I was speaking His hands [ yadav ], with regard to placing hands.
llm_translation: After Noah's mind was settled, he said to him, "What is the reason that you do not say 'his hands' of leaning?"

hebrew_text: בסמיכה נמי כתיב (במדבר כז, כג) ויסמוך את ידיו עליו ויצוהו סמיכה דבהמה קאמרי:
human_translation: also with regard to placing hands it is written, “And he placed his hands [ yadav ] upon him I was speaking with regard to placing hands an animal
llm_translation: In leaning also it is written (Numbers 27:23) "And he leaned his hands upon him and commanded him." Leaning refers to an animal.

hebrew_text: ובמקום שסומכין שוחטין תכף לסמיכה שחיטה: מאי קאמר הכי קאמר במקום שסומכין שוחטין שתכף לסמיכה שחיטה:
human_translation: And in the location that one places hands, one slaughters And immediately following placing hands, slaughter What is saying? this is saying: In the location that one places hands one slaughters because immediately following placing hands, slaughter
llm_translation: In a place where they lean the animal for slaughter, they slaughter immediately after leaning. What is it saying? It is saying that in a place where they lean, they slaughter immediately after leaning.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חומר בסמיכה מבתנופה ובתנופה מבסמיכה שאחד מניף לכל החברים ואין אחד סומך לכל החברים חומר בתנופה שהתנופה נוהגת בקרבנות היחיד ובקרבנות הצבור
human_translation: stringency with regard to placing hands than with regard to waving, and with regard to waving than with regard to placing hands. that one waves on behalf of all the partners, but one cannot places hands on behalf of all the partners; The stringency with regard to waving that waving is practiced in offerings of an individual, and in communal offerings,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Strictness in waving the offering is more stringent than in placing the offering adjacent to the altar, and in placing the offering is more stringent than in waving the offering, for one waves for all the members of the group, but one does not place the offering for all the members. Strictness in waving the offering is because waving is practiced in individual offerings and communal offerings.

hebrew_text: בחיים ובשחוטין ובדבר שיש בו רוח חיים ובדבר שאין בו רוח חיים מה שאין כן בסמיכה:
human_translation: in alive, and in slaughtered, in an item in which there is a living spirit, and in an item in which there is not a living spirit,
llm_translation: In life and in slaughtered animals, and in a matter that contains vitality, and in a matter that does not contain vitality, what is not the case with regard to Semikhah:

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן (ויקרא א, ג) קרבנו לרבות כל בעלי קרבן לסמיכה
human_translation: The Sages taught “his offering” to include all owners of an offering of placing hands,
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 1:3), "His offering," to include all those who bring an offering for semichah.

hebrew_text: שיכול והלא דין הוא ומה תנופה שנתרבתה בשחוטין נתמעטה בחוברין סמיכה שלא נתרבתה בשחוטין אינו דין שתתמעט בחוברין תלמוד לאמר קרבנו לרבות כל בעלי קרבן לסמיכה
human_translation: as might Could it not inference If waving, which was amplified to apply to slaughtered was limited with regard to partners, placing hands, which was not amplified to apply to slaughtered is it not logical that it was limited with regard to partners, the verse states: “His offering,” to include each of the owners of an offering in placing hands.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "Perhaps, but isn't it the same law? And just as the waving of the offering that increased in the case of slaughtered animals decreased in the case of bound animals, so too, the leaning of hands that did not increase in the case of slaughtered animals is not a law that it should decrease in the case of bound animals. The Talmud states to say: 'His offering' Leviticus 3:1 to include all those who bring an offering for leaning."

hebrew_text: ותתרבה תנופה בחוברין מקל וחומר ומה סמיכה שלא נתרבתה בשחוטין נתרבתה בחוברין תנופה שנתרבתה בשחוטין אינו דין שנתרבתה בחוברין
human_translation: But waving should be amplified with regard to partners, through a fortiori If placing hands, which was not amplified to apply to slaughtered was amplified with regard to partners, waving, which was amplified to apply to slaughtered is it not logical that it was amplified with regard to partners,
llm_translation: "And there was an increase in waving in the dough of Hovrin, both in quantity and quality. And just as proximity was not increased in sacrifices, it was increased in dough. Waving that was increased in sacrifices is not the same as waving that was increased in dough."

hebrew_text: משום דלא אפשר היכי ליעביד לינפו כולהו בהדי הדדי קא הויא חציצה ליניף וליהדר וליניף תנופה אמר רחמנא ולא תנופות
human_translation: because It is not possible as how would it be done? Let all of wave together, would be interposition Let wave, and then will wave, the Merciful One states a waving, but not wavings,
llm_translation: Because it is not possible how to do to wave all of them together in each other it is a half wave to wave and to return and to wave. The Merciful One said "and not waves."

hebrew_text: וסמיכה בשחוטין ליתא והתנן בזמן שכהן גדול רוצה להקטיר היה עולה בכבש והסגן בימינו הגיע למחצית הכבש אחז סגן בימינו והעלהו והושיט לו הראשון הראש והרגל סומך עליהם וזורקן
human_translation: And is there no placing hands on slaughtered But didn’t we learn When the High Priest want to sacrifice he would ascend the ramp and the deputy [ segan ] to the right reached halfway the ramp deputy hold by his right hand and bring him up And the first hold out the head and the leg who would place hands upon them, and he would throw
llm_translation: And proximity in slaughtering not applicable. And we learned: When the High Priest desires to offer, he would bring a lamb. And the deputy in his time reached half of the lamb, the deputy in his time took hold of it and raised it, and the first one extended the head and the leg, leaning on them, and he would throw them.

hebrew_text: הושיט השני לראשון שתי ידים נותנו לכהן גדול סומך עליהם וזורקן נשמט השני והלך לו וכך היו מושיטין לו שאר כל האברים סומך עליהם וזורקן
human_translation: the second would hold out the two forelegs to the first give them to the High Priest, place hands upon them and throw them the second priest slip away and leave, And in this manner would hold out the rest of all the limbs place hands upon them and throw them
llm_translation: The second extends to the first two hands, the High Priest places them on him and pushes him away, the second one is removed and goes away, and thus they would extend to him all the other limbs, place them on him, and push them away.

hebrew_text: ובזמן שהוא רוצה הוא סומך ואחרים זורקין
human_translation: And when wants, he place hands and other throw
llm_translation: And in the time that he wants, he relies, and others throw.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי התם משום כבודו דכהן גדול:
human_translation: Abaye said: there, due to the eminence of the High Priest,
llm_translation: Abbaye said: There, on account of the honor of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך פרק שתי מידות
llm_translation: We will return to you, Chapter of the Two Measures.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שתי הלחם נילושות אחת אחת ונאפות אחת אחת  לחם הפנים נילושות אחת אחת ונאפות שתים שתים ובדפוס היה עושה אותן כשהוא רודן נותנן לדפוס כדי שלא יתקלקלו:
human_translation: The two loaves are kneaded one one and they are baked one one, The shewbread are kneaded one one and baked two two, And would prepare in a mold [ defus ] When he removes he places in a mold so that their will not be ruined.
llm_translation: Mishnah: Two of the showbreads are kneaded one by one and baked one by one. The showbread of the faces are kneaded one by one and baked two by two. And in the printing, he would make them when he is kneading, and he would give them to the printing so that they would not spoil.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ מנא הני מילי דתנו רבנן (ויקרא כד, ה) שני עשרונים יהיה החלה האחת מלמד שנילושות אחת אחת
human_translation: From where are these matters as the Sages taught “Two-tenths of an ephah shall be in one cake” teaches that are kneaded one one.
llm_translation: Gemara: From where do we derive these matters that the Rabbis taught? (Leviticus 24:5) "One-tenth of an ephah shall be the measure for one cake," teaching that they are kneaded one by one.

hebrew_text: מנין שאף שתי הלחם כך תלמוד לומר יהיה ומנין שאפייתן שתים שתים תלמוד לומר (ויקרא כד, ו) ושמת אותם יכול אף שתי הלחם כן תלמוד לומר אותם
human_translation: From where that this also the two loaves, The verse states: “Shall be,” And from where that the baking two two? The verse states: “And you shall set them [ vesamta otam ],” might the two loaves also this The verse states: “Them [otam],”
llm_translation: Talmudic text: From where do we derive that even the two loaves of the showbread should be baked in this manner? The Torah states, "shall be," indicating two loaves. And from where do we derive that they should be baked two by two? The Torah states, "And you shall place them" (Leviticus 24:6). One might have thought that this applies even to the two loaves, therefore the Torah states, "them."

hebrew_text: האי אותם הא אפיקתיה אם כן לימא קרא ושמתם מאי ושמת אותם שמעת מיניה תרתי:
human_translation: Didn’t you derive this “Them,” If so, let the verse say: And you shall set them [ vesamtam ], What “ vesamta otam ”? You learn from two
llm_translation: This is the sign, if so, let him say a verse "and you shall place." What is "and you shall place"? You have heard from him two.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן ושמת אותם בדפוס שלשה דפוסין הם נותנה לדפוס ועדיין היא בצק וכמין דפוס היה לה בתנור וכשהוא רודה נותנה בדפוס כדי שלא תתקלקל ולהדרה לדפוס קמא כיון דאפי לה נפחה:
human_translation: the Sages taught “And you shall set them” in a mold. There are three molds places in a mold it is still dough. And there was a type of mold for in the oven, And when he removes [ rodah ] he places it in mold so that its will not be ruined. But Let him return to the first mold, Once is baked, it rises,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "And place them in the mold." There are three molds: one places it in the mold while it is still dough, and it is like a mold that was in the oven. And when it expands, one places it in the mold so that it does not spoil, and to return it to the original mold, once it has been baked, it expands.

hebrew_text: איתמר לחם הפנים כיצד עושין אותו
human_translation: It was stated: How is the shewbread prepared,
llm_translation: It was stated: The showbread, how is it made?

hebrew_text: רבי חנינא אמר כמין תיבה פרוצה ר' יוחנן אמר כמין ספינה רוקדת
human_translation: Rabbi Ḥanina says: like a box that is open Rabbi Yoḥanan says like a rocking boat,
llm_translation: Rabbi Chanina said: like a broken box. Rabbi Yochanan said: like a dancing ship.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למאן דאמר כמין תיבה פרוצה היינו דהוו יתבי בזיכין אלא למאן דאמר כמין ספינה רוקדת היכי הוו יתבי בזיכין מקום עביד להו
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said like a box that is open this is that bowls of frankincense could rest But according to the one who said like a rocking boat, how would bowls rest prepared place for
llm_translation: In accordance with the one who said it is like a broken box, that is why they would sit in rows. But according to the one who said it is like a rocking boat, how would they sit in rows? A place was made for them.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למאן דאמר כמין תיבה פרוצה היינו דהוו יתבי קנים אלא למאן דאמר כמין ספינה רוקדת קנים היכי הוו יתבי מורשא עביד להו
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said like a box that is open this is that rods could rest But according to the one who said like a rocking boat, how were rods resting would make a protrusion in
llm_translation: In accordance with the one who said it is like a broken box, that is why they were sitting with reeds. But according to the one who said it is like a dancing ship with reeds, how did they sit in Morasha?

hebrew_text: בשלמא למאן דאמר כמין תיבה פרוצה היינו דסמכי ליה סניפין ללחם אלא למאן דאמר כמין ספינה רוקדת היכי סמכי ליה סניפין ללחם דעגיל להו מיעגל
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said like a box that is open this is that panels would support the loaves. But according to the one who said like a rocking boat, how would panels support the loaves? that would be made to curve
llm_translation: In accordance with the one who says it is like a broken box, that is why they lean branches against the bread. But according to the one who says it is like a rocking boat, how do they lean branches against the bread? They roll it and encircle it.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למאן דאמר כמין ספינה רוקדת היינו דבעינן סניפין אלא למאן דאמר כמין תיבה פרוצה סניפין למה לי אגב יוקרא דלחם תלח
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said like a rocking boat, this is that we require panels. But according to the one who said like a box that is open why do I panels? due to the weight of loaves would break [ telaḥ ].
llm_translation: In accordance with the one who said it is like a dancing ship, that is why we need supports. But according to the one who said it is like a broken ark, why do we need supports in relation to the honor of the bread of Talaḥ?

hebrew_text: בשלמא למאן דאמר כמין ספינה רוקדת סניפין על גבי שלחן מונחין אלא למאן דאמר כמין תיבה פרוצה סניפין היכא מנח להו אארעא מנח להו אין דאמר רבי אבא בר ממל לדברי האומר כמין ספינה רוקדת סניפין על גבי שלחן מונחין לדברי האומר כמין תיבה פרוצה סניפין על גבי קרקע מונחין
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said like a rocking boat, panels are placed on Table, But according to the one who said like a box that is open where would place panels? Would place them on the ground? Yes, as Rabbi Abba bar Memel said: According to the statement of the one who says like a rocking boat, panels are placed on the Table, according to the statement of the one who says like a box that is open panels are placed on ground.
llm_translation: In accordance with the one who says like a ship dancing, branches on a table are placed. But according to the one who says like a broken box, where are the branches placed? On the ground they are placed. Indeed, Rabbi Abba bar Memel said: According to the one who says like a ship dancing, branches on a table are placed; according to the one who says like a broken box, branches on the ground are placed.

hebrew_text: כמאן אזלא הא דאמר ר' יהודה הלחם מעמיד את הסניפין והסניפין מעמידין את הלחם כמאן דאמר כמין ספינה רוקדת
human_translation: In accordance with whose is that which Rabbi Yehuda said: The loaves support the panels and the panels support the loaves, in accordance with the one who said like a rocking boat,
llm_translation: As to whom does this go according to? This is like what Rabbi Yehuda said: the bread supports the branches, and the branches support the bread. As to whom said, like a dancing ship.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי כמין כוורת היה לה בתנור ודומה כמין טבלא מרובעת אימא ופיה דומה כמין טבלא מרובעת
human_translation: raises an objection There was in the oven for similar to a barrel and it resembled a type of rectangular tablet [ tavla ]. Say the opening, resembled a type of rectangular tablet,
llm_translation: The question was raised: If she had a type of oven resembling a "kivarta," and its opening is like a square "tabla," say, and its mouth is like a square "tabla."

hebrew_text: תניא כמאן דאמר כמין ספינה רוקדת דתניא ארבעה סניפין של זהב היו שם מפוצלין מראשיהן כמין דקרנין היו שסומכין בהן את הלחם שהוא דומה כמין ספינה רוקדת
human_translation: It is taught in accordance with the one who said like a rocking boat, as it is taught There were four gold panels there, split up at their upper ends they were like forked because the bread, which resembled a type of rocking boat, was supported by them.
llm_translation: It is taught: According to the opinion that says like a dancing ship, as it is taught: there were four golden branches there, split from their tops like horns, upon which they would lean the bread, which resembled a dancing ship.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו לחם הפנים נפסל במסעות או אינו נפסל במסעות רבי יוחנן ורבי יהושע בן לוי חד אמר נפסל וחד אמר אינו נפסל
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before the shewbread disqualified during the journeys or was it not disqualified during the journeys? Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi. One says disqualified, and one says not disqualified.
llm_translation: The question was asked: Is the showbread disqualified by journeys or is it not disqualified by journeys? Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi, one said it is disqualified, and one said it is not disqualified.

hebrew_text: מאן דאמר נפסל דכתיב (במדבר ב, יז) כאשר יחנו כן יסעו מה בחנייתו נפסל ביוצא אף בנסיעתו נפסל ביוצא
human_translation: The one who says disqualified as it is written as they encamp, so shall they journey, just as when encamped disqualified when leaves so too, when journeys disqualified when leaves
llm_translation: The one who said disqualified, as it is written (Numbers 2:17) "as they camp, so shall they journey." Just as in his encampment he is disqualified, so too in his journey he is disqualified.

hebrew_text: מאן דאמר אינו נפסל דכתיב (במדבר ד, ז) ולחם התמיד עליו יהיה
human_translation: The one who says not disqualified as it is written and the continual bread shall remain upon it”
llm_translation: Who said he is not disqualified, as it is written (Numbers 4:7), "And the continual bread shall be upon it."

hebrew_text: ואידך נמי הא כתיב (במדבר ב, יז) כאשר יחנו כן יסעו לאידך גיסא מה בחנייתו כי לא יצא ממקומו לא מיפסיל אף בנסיעתו כי לא יצא ממקומו לא מיפסיל
human_translation: But also the other isn’t it written: “As they encamp, so shall they journey,” in the other direction: Just as when encamped, if does not leave its place not disqualified, so too, when journeys, if it does not leave its place not disqualified.
llm_translation: And the other one also, this is what is written (Numbers 2:17) "As they camp, so they shall journey." The other side, what is the law regarding his encampment, for he does not depart from his place, he does not disqualify even in his journeying, for he does not depart from his place, he does not disqualify.

hebrew_text: ואידך נמי הא כתיב ולחם התמיד עליו יהיה אלא כי אתא רב דימי אמר במסודר דכולי עלמא לא פליגי אלא כי פליגי במסולק

llm_translation: And the other one also, this is what is written: "And the continual bread shall be upon it." But when Rav Dimi came, he said: In the case of arranged showbread, everyone agrees; they only disagree in the case of removed showbread.

hebrew_text: מאן דאמר נפסל דכתיב כאשר יחנו כן יסעו מה בחנייתו נפסל ביוצא אף בנסיעתו מיפסל ביוצא
human_translation: The one who says is disqualified as it is written: as they encamp, so shall they journey, just as when encamped disqualified when leaves so too, when journeys disqualified when leaves
llm_translation: The one who said disqualified, as it is written, "As they camp, so shall they journey" - just as in their encampment they are disqualified upon departure, so too in their journeying they are disqualified upon departure.

hebrew_text: למאן דאמר אינו נפסל דכתיב (במדבר ב, יז) ונסע אהל מועד אף על פי שנסע אהל מועד הוא

human_translation: But also the other isn’t it written: “As they encamp, so shall they journey,” in the other direction: Just as when encamped, if does not take out it is not disqualified, so too, when journeys, if does not take out it is not disqualified.
llm_translation: And the other one also, it is written, "As they camp, so shall they journey." What is the comparison in its encampment? That it does not disqualify him, so too in its journeying, that it does not disqualify him.

hebrew_text: ואידך נמי הא כתיב ונסע אהל מועד ההוא לדגלים הוא דאתא

llm_translation: And the other one also, this is what is written: "And the Tent of Meeting shall set out, with the camp of the Levites in the midst of the camps; as they encamp, so shall they set out, each in position, by their standards."

llm_translation: And the other (Numbers 2:17) "from the Levite camp, in the midst of the camps, shall set out."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי בשעת סילוק מסעות קדשים נפסלין ביוצא וזבין ומצורעין משתלחין חוץ למחיצתן מאי לאו אפילו לחם הפנים לא בר מלחם הפנים
human_translation: raises an objection At the time of the dismantling journeys, sacrificial is disqualified as left And zavim and lepers are sent out of the partitions of their What, is it not even the shewbread, No, except for the shewbread.
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: At the time of removal of sacrificial portions, consecrated items become disqualified by means of their being taken out, slaughtered, or afflicted with tzara'at, when they are sent outside their respective enclosures. What is the reason? Is it not because even the showbread is not excluded from the showbread?

hebrew_text: מה נפשך אי אהל מועד דוקא הוא אפילו קדשים נמי אי אהל מועד לאו דוקא הוא אפילו לחם הפנים נמי
human_translation: Whichever you If Tent of Meeting is exactly, even sacrificial If Tent of Meeting is not exactly, even the shewbread
llm_translation: What is your opinion? Is it specifically the Tent of Meeting? Even holy items also, is it specifically the Tent of Meeting? Even the showbread also.

llm_translation: Rather, when Ravin came, the Master said in an orderly manner, and the Master said in a removed manner, and they do not disagree.

hebrew_text: אמר אביי שמע מינה יש סילוק מסעות בלילה דאי סלקא דעתך אין סילוק מסעות בלילה אימת מדלי לצפרא מאי איריא משום יוצא תיפוק לי דאיפסיל ליה בלינה
human_translation: Abaye said: conclude from there be dismantling journeys at night. as if it enter your mind there not be dismantling journeys at night, when would be removed? in the morning, why specifically due to left I may derive that it was disqualified left overnight.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: "Learn from this, there is removal of journeys at night, for if it were not so, when would it be appropriate to recite the Shema? What is the reason that one should bring out a bird? Because he should be occupied with it at night."

hebrew_text: פשיטא (שמות יג, כא) ללכת יומם ולילה כתיב מהו דתימא הני מילי היכא דעקור ביממא אבל היכא דלא עקור ביממא בליליא לא מצו עקרי קא משמע לן
human_translation: obvious is written: that they might go by day and by night” lest you say this statement, where dismantled by day, But where they did not dismantle by day they could not dismantle at night. teaches us
llm_translation: It is obvious. (Exodus 13:21) "to go by day and by night" is written. What might you say? These matters apply where uprooting is done during the day, but where uprooting is not done during the day, it is not necessary at night.

hebrew_text: ורמינהי הוגללו הפרוכת הותרו הזבין ומצורעין ליכנס לשם אמר רב אשי לא קשיא הא ר' אליעזר הא רבנן דתניא
human_translation: And raises a contradiction the curtain was rolled up, the zavim and lepers were permitted to enter into that Rav Ashi said: not difficult; this Rabbi Eliezer that the Rabbis. As it is taught
llm_translation: And they raised a contradiction: If the curtains were rolled up, the menstruating women and lepers were permitted to enter there. Rav Ashi said: It is not difficult - this is according to Rabbi Eliezer, and this is according to the Rabbis as it was taught in a Baraita.

hebrew_text: רבי אליעזר אומר יכול דחקו זבין ומצורעין ונכנסו לעזרה בפסח הבא בטומאה יכול יהו חייבין תלמוד לומר (במדבר ה, ב) וישלחו מן המחנה כל צרוע וכל זב וכל טמא לנפש בשעה שטמאי מתים משתלחין זבין ומצורעין משתלחין
human_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: might zavim and lepers pushed and entered the Temple courtyard during a Paschal offering that is brought in impurity, might they would be liable the verse states: “That they send out from the camp any leper and any zav and anyone impure by reason of a corpse” at a time when those who are impure by a corpse are sent out zavim and lepers are sent out
llm_translation: Rabbi Eliezer says: Could it be that if those who are menstruating, lepers, and those who have entered the Temple courtyard in a state of impurity on the Passover that they came in a state of impurity, they would be liable? The Talmud teaches to say (Numbers 5:2): "Send out of the camp every leper, and everyone who has a discharge, and everyone who is unclean for a soul." At the time when those who are impure are sent out, those who are menstruating and lepers are sent out.

hebrew_text: אין טמאי מתים משתלחין אין זבין ומצורעין משתלחין:
human_translation: those who are impure by a corpse are not sent out zavim and lepers are not sent out,
llm_translation: The impure ones of the dead are not sent away, the ones with gonorrhea and lepers are sent away.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אחת שתי הלחם ואחת לחם הפנים לישתן ועריכתן בחוץ ואפייתן בפנים ואינן דוחות את השבת רבי יהודה אומר כל מעשיהם בפנים רבי שמעון אומר לעולם הוי רגיל לומר שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים כשרות בעזרה וכשרות בבית פאגי:
human_translation: both the two loaves and the shewbread, the kneading of their and the forming of their outside but their baking inside And their does not override Shabbat. Rabbi Yehuda says: All of the procedures their inside Rabbi Shimon says: should always be accustomed to say the two loaves and the shewbread are fit in the Temple courtyard and they are fit in Beit Pagei,
llm_translation: Mishnah: One loaf, two loaves, and one loaf of the showbread to drink, and their arrangement is outside, and their baking is inside, and they do not override the Sabbath. Rabbi Yehudah says: All their actions are inside. Rabbi Shimon says: One should always be accustomed to say, "One loaf, two loaves, and the showbread are valid in the Temple and valid in the House of Pagai."

hebrew_text: גמ׳ הא גופא קשיא אמרת
human_translation: This itself difficult.
llm_translation: Gemara: Ha, gufa kashya amarta.

hebrew_text: לישתן ועריכתן בחוץ אלמא מדת יבש לא נתקדשה ואפייתן בפנים אלמא מדת יבש נתקדשה אמר רבה הקשה אדם קשה שהוא קשה כברזל ומנו רב ששת
human_translation: You said the kneading of their and the forming of their outside apparently, dry measure, was not consecrated. their baking inside apparently, dry measure was consecrated. Rabba says: A formidable man, who is tough as iron, raised difficulty. And who is Rav Sheshet.
llm_translation: To place and arrange them outside, indicating that the measure of dryness has not sanctified them, and to bake them inside, indicating that the measure of dryness has sanctified them. Rabbah said: A person who is difficult is as difficult as iron, and from him Rav Sheshet inferred.

hebrew_text: מאי קשיא דלמא עשרון לא מקדש תנור מקדש
human_translation: What difficulty? Perhaps a tenth does not sanctify oven sanctifies

human_translation: Rather, if is difficult, this is difficult: the baking inside Evidently, oven sanctifies does not override Shabbat. disqualified by left overnight Rather, Rava says: A formidable man, who is tough as iron, raised difficulty. And who is Rav Sheshet.
llm_translation: Rather, if difficult, this is difficult, and their baking inside. This implies that an oven sanctifies and does not override the Sabbath; it invalidates the night. Rather, Rava said: A person is difficult, as he is hard as iron, and Rav Sheshet counted them.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי מאי קושיא דלמא מאי מבפנים במקום זריזין
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: What difficulty? Perhaps what is inside? in a place vigilant
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: What is the question? Perhaps it means "from within" in a place of those who are diligent.

hebrew_text: והא דרב אשי ברותא היא מה נפשך אי אפייה בעינן זריזין לישה ועריכה נמי [בעינן] זריזין ואי לישה [ועריכה] לא בעינן זריזין אפייה נמי לא בעינן זריזין אלא דרב אשי ברותא היא:
human_translation: And this to Rav Ashi is an error [ baruta ], whichever you If we require vigilant baking we also require vigilant kneading and forming And if we do not require vigilant kneading and forming we also not require vigilant baking. Rather, to Rav Ashi is an error.
llm_translation: And this that Rav Ashi said, is it not a contradiction? If we require haste for kneading and arranging, we should also require haste for baking. And if for kneading and arranging we do not require haste, then for baking we should also not require haste. Rather, Rav Ashi is correct.

hebrew_text: ר' יהודה אומר כל מעשיהן בפנים [וכו']: אמר רבי אבהו בר כהנא ושניהן מקרא אחד דרשו (שמואל א כא, ו) והוא דרך חול אף כי היום יקדש בכלי
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: All the procedures inside Rabbi Abbahu bar Kahana says: Both the same verse, they interpreted homiletically. “But it is a non-sacred manner, and yet it shall be consecrated today in the vessel”
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda says: "All their actions are inward etc.." Rabbi Abahu bar Kahana said: "And both of them expounded one verse" (1 Samuel 21:6) "And it is a common way, even though today it shall be sanctified in the vessel."

hebrew_text: רבי יהודה סבר בחול אשכחינהו דקא אפו ליה אמר להו דרך חול קא אפיתו ליה אף כי היום יקדש בכלי איפסיל ליה בלינה
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds found baking on a weekday. said to them: are you baking a non-sacred manner, “Yet it shall be consecrated today in the vessel,” it will be disqualified because left overnight.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda holds: On a weekday, they found that they baked it. He said to them: You baked it in a secular manner. Even though today is a day of sanctification, it is disqualified by overnight cooling.

hebrew_text: רבי שמעון סבר בשבת אשכחינהו דקא אפו ליה אמר להו לא דרך חול בעיתו למיעבדיה מידי תנור מקדש שלחן הוא דמקדש
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds found baking on Shabbat. said to them: Aren’t you required to prepare it a non-sacred manner, Does the oven consecrate it is Table that consecrates
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon holds regarding Shabbat, they found him that they were angry at him, he said to them, "It is not the way of a weekday to do something immediately, but rather the oven sanctifies the table."

hebrew_text: ומי מצית אמרת דבשעת אפייה אשכחינהו והכתיב (שמואל א כא, ז) ויתן לו הכהן קודש כי לא היה שם לחם כי אם לחם הפנים המוסרים מלפני ה'

human_translation: Rather, what a non-sacred manner, which said to This is said to him: no bread except “the shewbread that was taken from before the Lord,”
llm_translation: Rather, what is the way of the world that he said to them thus: they said to him, "There is no bread except the bread of the faces that is removed from before the Lord."

hebrew_text: אמר להו לא מיבעיא האי דכיון דנפק ליה ממעילה דרך חול הוא אלא אפילו האיך נמי דהיום יקדש בכלי הבו ליה דליכול
human_translation: said to It is not necessary this because Since has been removed from misuse it is a non-sacred matter, But even the other which “shall be consecrated today in the vessel,” you should give him, to eat.
llm_translation: He said to them: It is not necessary this, for since he went out from the concealment by way of the secular, it is so. But even so, that today shall be sanctified with a vessel, let him come to be able.

hebrew_text: מסוכן הוא ור' יהודה ור' שמעון בגמרא פליגי
human_translation: he is, dangerously And Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon, they disagree with regard to a tradition,
llm_translation: It is dangerous, and Rabbi Yehuda and Rabbi Shimon in the Gemara disagree.

hebrew_text: דיקא נמי דקתני ר' שמעון אומר לעולם הוי רגיל לומר שתי הלחם ולחם הפנים כשרות בעזרה וכשרות אבית פאגי שמע מינה:
human_translation: is also precise, as it teaches Rabbi Shimon says: should always be accustomed to say the two loaves and the shewbread are fit in the Temple courtyard and they are fit in Beit Pagei. conclude from
llm_translation: Precisely also that which Rabbi Shimon taught: One should always be accustomed to say "the two loaves" and "the showbread" are valid in the Temple and valid in the House of Pagai. Learn from this.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ חביתי כהן גדול לישתן ועריכתן ואפייתן בפנים ודוחות את השבת טחינתן והרקדתן אינו דוחה את השבת כלל אמר רבי עקיבא כל מלאכה שאפשר לעשותה מערב שבת אינה דוחה את השבת ושאי אפשר לה לעשותה מערב שבת דוחה את השבת
human_translation: High Priest’s griddle-cake their kneading, the forming of their and their baking inside and override Shabbat. Grinding their and sifting their do not override Shabbat. Rabbi Akiva stated a principle: Any labor that can be performed on Shabbat eve does not override Shabbat, but that cannot be performed on Shabbat eve overrides Shabbat.
llm_translation: Mishnah: A barrel of wine for the High Priest to drink, inspect, and bake inside, and they push aside the Sabbath for them. Grinding and sifting them do not push aside the Sabbath at all. Rabbi Akiva said: Any work that is possible to be done before the Sabbath does not push aside the Sabbath, and if it is impossible to be done before the Sabbath, it pushes aside the Sabbath.

hebrew_text: כל המנחות יש בהן מעשה כלי בפנים ואין בהן מעשה כלי בחוץ
human_translation: All the meal offerings inside involve use vessel But outside do not involve use vessel.
llm_translation: All the Minchot have in them the work of a vessel inside, and they do not have the work of a vessel outside.

hebrew_text: שתי הלחם ארכן שבעה טפחים ורחבן ארבע טפחים וקרנותיה ארבע אצבעות לחם הפנים ארכן עשרה טפחים ורחבן חמישה טפחים וקרנותיו שבע אצבעות
human_translation: the two loaves, their length is seven handbreadths, their width is four handbreadths, and protrusions four fingerbreadths shewbread, their length is ten handbreadths, their width is five handbreadths, and protrusions seven fingerbreadths
llm_translation: The two loaves, their length is seven handbreadths and their width is four handbreadths, and their horns are four fingerbreadths. The showbread, its length is ten handbreadths and its width is five handbreadths, and its horns are seven fingerbreadths.

llm_translation: Rabbi Yehudah says: "One should not err in the order of reciting the Zichronot, the Gevurot, and the Kedushah." Ben Zoma says: "And you shall place upon the table showbread before Me always" (Exodus 25:30) - showbread that it should have faces.

human_translation: the Table, its length is ten and its width is five the shewbread, its length is ten and its width is five

human_translation: places the length across the width of Table, And he folds two and a half handbreadths on this and two and a half handbreadths on that finds, the length covers the width of the Table. the statement of Rabbi Yehuda.
llm_translation: He places its length opposite its width of the table, and doubles a handbreadth, and half from here, and a handbreadth, and half from here, its length is found to fill the width of the table. These are the words of Rabbi Yehuda.

hebrew_text: ר' מאיר אומר השלחן ארכו י"ב ורחבו ו' לחם הפנים ארכו י' ורחבו ה'

llm_translation: Rava raises an objection: Neither the arrangement of the nests nor the taking of the chicks override the Sabbath. And if it were according to your opinion that it is a biblical law, why do they not override the Sabbath?

The Talmud teaches to say, "And they shall be seen." If so, one might think they should tear the curtain and go out. The Talmud teaches to say (1 Kings 8:8), "They shall not be seen outside." How so?

hebrew_text: דוחקין ובולטין בפרוכת ודומין כמין שני דדי אשה שנאמר (שיר השירים א, יג) צרור המור דודי לי בין שדי ילין
human_translation: pressed against the Curtain and bulged And they appeared like two breasts of a woman as it is stated: “My beloved is to me like a bundle of myrrh that lies between my breasts”
llm_translation: Pressed and protruding in the curtain, and resembling the appearance of two breasts of a woman, as it is stated (Song of Songs 1:13), "A cluster of henna blooms is my beloved to me, among the vineyards of En-gedi."

hebrew_text: ומנלן דבדיו לפותיא דארון הוו יתבי דילמא לארכו דארון הוו יתבי אמר ר' יהודה תרי גברי באמתא ופלגא לא מסתגי להו
human_translation: And from where do we that staves were set along the width of the Ark? Perhaps they were set along the Ark’s length, Rav Yehuda said two men in one and a half cubits cannot walk.
llm_translation: And from where do we know that the boards of the Ark were placed vertically? Perhaps the length of the Ark was placed vertically. Rabbi Yehuda said: Two men in truth, and half does not suffice for them.

hebrew_text: ומנא לן דבארבעה הוו דרו להו דכתיב (במדבר י, כא) ונסעו הקהתים תרי נושאי המקדש נמי תרי
human_translation: And from where do we that was carried by four as it is written “And the Kohathites would travel,” two “The bearers of the Holy Ark,” also two
llm_translation: And count for us that they were four who traveled, for it is written (Numbers 10:21), "And the Kohathites set out, carrying the holy things; the tabernacle was to be set up before they arrived."

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן עשרה שולחנות עשה שלמה המלך שנאמר (דברי הימים ב ד, ח) ויעש שולחנות עשרה וינח בהיכל חמשה מימין וחמשה משמאל
human_translation: The Sages taught: King Solomon built ten tables, as it is stated “He made also ten tables, and placed them in the Sanctuary, five on the right side, and five on the left”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Ten tables did King Solomon make, as it is stated (2 Chronicles 4:8), "And he made ten tables and placed them in the Temple, five on the right side and five on the left."

hebrew_text: ואם תאמר חמשה מימין הפתח וחמשה משמאל הפתח אם כן מצינו ששולחן בדרום והתורה אמרה (שמות כו, לה) והשולחן תתן על צלע צפון
human_translation: And if you say five to the right of the entrance, and five to the left of the entrance, If so, we find that table in the south But the Torah said: “And you shall put the Table on the north side”
llm_translation: And if you will say, five to the right of the entrance and five to the left of the entrance, then we find that the table is in the south, and the Torah said (Exodus 26:35), "And you shall place the table on the north side."

hebrew_text: אלא של משה באמצע חמשה מימינו וחמשה משמאלו
human_translation: Rather, of Moses in the middle five to the right of and five to the left of
llm_translation: Rather, of Moses in the middle five from his right and five from his left.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן עשר מנורות עשה שלמה שנאמר (דברי הימים ב ד, ב) ויעש את המנורות הזהב עשר כמשפט ויתן בהיכל חמשה מימין וחמשה משמאל
human_translation: the Sages taught: Solomon built ten candelabra, as it is stated: “And he made the ten candelabra of gold according to the ordinance concerning them; and he set them in the Sanctuary, five on the right, and five on the left”
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: Solomon made ten menorahs, as it is stated (2 Chronicles 4:7), "And he made the ten golden menorahs according to their ordinance, and placed them in the Temple, five on the right side and five on the left."

hebrew_text: ואם תאמר חמשה מימין הפתח וחמשה משמאל הפתח אם כן מצינו מנורה בצפון והתורה אמרה (שמות כו, לה) ואת המנורה נכח השולחן
human_translation: And if you say five to the right of the entrance, and five to the left of the entrance, If so, we find that candelabrum in the north But the Torah said: and the Candelabrum opposite the Table
llm_translation: And if you will say, "Five to the right of the entrance and five to the left of the entrance," then we find the menorah in the north, and the Torah said (Exodus 26:35), "And the menorah opposite the table."

hebrew_text: אלא של משה באמצע חמשה מימינה וחמשה משמאלה
human_translation: Rather, of Moses in the middle five to the right and five to its left,
llm_translation: Rather, of Moses in the middle five from its right and five from its left.

hebrew_text: תני חדא מחצי בית ולפנים היו מונחין ותני חדא משליש הבית ולפנים היו מונחין
human_translation: It is taught one were set inward of half of Temple, And it is taught one they were set inward of third of Temple.
llm_translation: It was taught: one from the middle of the house, and they were placed inside, and it was taught: one from the third of the house, and they were placed inside.

hebrew_text: ולא קשיא מר קא חשיב בית קדשי הקדשים בהדי היכל מר לא קא חשיב בית קדשי הקדשים בהדי היכל
human_translation: not difficult, Sage is reckoning the Hall of the Holy of Holies, together with Sanctuary, Sage is not reckoning the Hall of the Holy of Holies together with Sanctuary.
llm_translation: The Master does not consider the Holy of Holies as part of the Sanctuary, while the other Master does not consider the Holy of Holies as part of the Sanctuary.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן מזרח ומערב היו מונחין דברי רבי רבי אלעזר בר' שמעון אומר צפון ודרום מאי טעמא דרבי גמר ממנורה מה מנורה מזרח ומערב אף הני נמי מזרח ומערב
human_translation: The Sages taught were placed east west, the statement of Rabbi Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, says: north to south, What is the reason of Rabbi He derives from Candelabrum: Just as Candelabrum east west, so too, these east west.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "East and west were the words of Rabbi. Rabbi Elazar says: north and south." What is the reason? Rabbi Gamliel derived it from the Menorah. Just as the Menorah faces east and west, so too these directions are east and west.

hebrew_text: ומנורה גופה מנלן מדכתיב בנר מערבי (ויקרא כד, ג) יערוך אותו [אהרן וגו'] לפני ה'
human_translation: And Candelabrum itself, from where do we from that it is written with regard to the western lamp Aaron shall set it in order, before the Lord
llm_translation: "And the Menorah itself, from where do we derive it? As it is written, 'He shall arrange it Aaron and so forth before the Lord.'" (Leviticus 24:3)

hebrew_text: מכלל דכולהו לאו לפני ה' ואי סלקא דעתך צפון ודרום כולהו נמי לפני ה' נינהו
human_translation: from the fact that all is not “before the Lord,” But if it enters your mind north south, all should also be “before the Lord,”
llm_translation: From the principle that all of them are not before the Lord, and if you think otherwise, both north and south are also before the Lord.

hebrew_text: ור' אלעזר בר' שמעון מאי טעמא גמר מארון מה ארון צפון ודרום אף הני נמי צפון ודרום ורבי נמי ליגמר מארון דנין חוץ מחוץ ואין דנין חוץ מבפנים
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, what is the reason He derives from Ark: Just as Ark north south, so too, these north south. But Rabbi let him also derive from Ark one derives outer from outer And one does not derive outer from inner
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, what is the reason that he concluded that the Holy Ark was placed from the Ark of the Covenant? Just as the Ark of the Covenant was positioned north and south, so too these the Aron Kodesh in the Temple are to be positioned north and south. And Rabbi also concluded that the Holy Ark was placed from the Ark of the Covenant, that we evaluate its placement from the outside, but we do not evaluate its placement from within.

hebrew_text: ור' אלעזר בר' שמעון ליגמר ממנורה אמר לך מנורה גופה צפון ודרום הוה מנחה
human_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, let him derive from Candelabrum said to you: Candelabrum itself was placed north south.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Elazar, son of Rabbi Shimon, to conclude from the Menorah, he said to you, the Menorah itself, its north and south were facing.

hebrew_text: אלא הכתיב יערוך אותו אהרן ובניו דמצדד להו אצדודי
