human_translation: But isn’t it written “Aaron and his sons shall set it in order, turns to the side,
llm_translation: Rather, it is written: "Aaron and his sons shall set it in order and keep it in order."

hebrew_text: דתניא (במדבר ח, ב) אל מול פני המנורה יאירו שבעת הנרות מלמד שהיו מצדדין פניהם כלפי נר אמצעי אמר רבי נתן מכאן שאמצעי משובח
human_translation: as it is taught the seven lamps shall give light toward the front of the Candelabrum” teaches that would turn the front toward middle lamp, Rabbi Natan says: from here that middle preeminent.
llm_translation: As it was taught (in Numbers 8:2), "Towards the face of the menorah shall the seven lamps give light," teaching that they would incline their faces towards the middle lamp. Rabbi Natan said: From here it is praiseworthy to be in the middle.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למן דאמר מזרח ומערב היינו דהוו יתיבי עשרה בעשרים אלא למאן דאמר צפון ודרום עשרה בעשרים היכי הוו יתבי
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said east west, this is that ten resided in twenty But according to the one who said north south, how could ten reside in twenty
llm_translation: In accordance with the one who said east and west, that is why there were ten sitting in twenty. But according to the one who said north and south, how were they sitting in twenty?

hebrew_text: ותו כהנים היכי הוו עיילי ותו מצינו חמשה שלחנות בדרום ותו שלחן דמשה היכא מנח ליה
human_translation: And moreover, how would Priests enter And moreover, we find five tables in the south And moreover, where would place Table by Moses?
llm_translation: And the priests, how did they bring the showbread? And furthermore, we find five tables in the south, and where did they place the table of Moses?

hebrew_text: וליטעמיך למאן דאמר מזרח ומערב נמי שלחן דמשה היכא הוה מנח ליה
human_translation: But according to your reasoning, according to the one who said east west as well: Where would place Table by Moses?
llm_translation: And to taste according to the one who says "east and west," also the table of Moses, where was it placed for him.

hebrew_text: אלא מי סברת חד דרא הוה תרי דרי נינהו
human_translation: Rather, do you maintain there was one row they were two rows,
llm_translation: Rather, who thought one path was two paths, they are two distinct paths.

hebrew_text: בשלמא למאן דאמר צפון ודרום שפיר
human_translation: Granted, according to the one who said north south, well.
llm_translation: In accordance with the one who says "north and south are good."

hebrew_text: אלא למאן דאמר מזרח ומערב מכדי שלחן כמה משוך מן הכותל שתי אמות ומחצה ואמה דידיה ושתי אמות ומחצה דביני ביני
human_translation: But according to the one who said east west, Now, How far Table removed from the wall two and a half cubits And cubit itself, and two and a half cubits that between
llm_translation: Rather, according to the one who says east and west, since the table is how much it is drawn from the wall, two and a half cubits, and its own cubit, and two and a half cubits in between.

hebrew_text: ואמה ושתי אמות ומחצה דביני ביני ואמה דידיה אישתכח דקאכיל שולחן פלגא דאמתא בדרום
human_translation: And cubit and two and a half cubits that between and cubit itself. it is found that Table occupies half a cubit in the south
llm_translation: "And a cubit and two cubits and a half of linen between them, and a cubit of his own, the measure of a table of half a cubit in the south."

hebrew_text: מי סברת שלחן דמשה בהדייהו הוה יתיב לא דמידלי ליה ומנח ליה ומיתתי להו לדידהו פורתא כתלמיד היושב לפני רבו
human_translation: Do you maintain Table of Moses resided together with not that was raised was placed and were lowered slightly as a student who sits before his teacher.
llm_translation: Who thinks the table of Moses in their presence was sitting not would raise it and place it and die for them for their sake a morsel like a student sitting before his teacher.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן עשרה שלחנות עשה שלמה ולא היו מסדרין אלא על של משה שנאמר (מלכים א ז, מח) ואת השלחן אשר עליו לחם הפנים זהב
human_translation: The Sages taught Solomon built ten tables but would arrange only upon of Moses. as it is stated: and the Table upon which the shewbread was, of gold”
llm_translation: The Sages taught: Ten tables did Solomon make, but they would only arrange them according to the one of Moses, as it is stated (1 Kings 7:48): "And the table that was upon it, of gold."

hebrew_text: עשר מנורות עשה שלמה ולא היו מדליקין אלא בשל משה שנאמר (דברי הימים ב יג, יא) (את) מנורת הזהב ונרותיה לבער בערב
human_translation: Solomon built ten candelabra, but would kindle only on of Moses. as it is stated: the Candelabrum of gold with its lamps, to burn evening”
llm_translation: Ten menorahs made Solomon and not were lighting except for from the one of Moses as it is said (2 Chronicles 13:11) "the golden menorah and its lamps to burn in the evening."

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר בן שמוע אומר על כולם היו מסדרין שנאמר (דברי הימים ב ד, יט) את השולחנות ועליהם לחם הפנים ובכולן היו מדליקין שנאמר (דברי הימים ב ד, כ) את המנורות ונרותיהם לבערם כמשפט לפני הדביר זהב סגור
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Shammua says: They would arrange upon all as it is stated: the tables upon which was the shewbread” And they would kindle on all as it is stated “And the candelabra with their lamps, which they should burn according to the ordinance before the Sanctuary, of pure gold”
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar ben Shamu'a says: Regarding all of them, they would arrange, as it is stated (1 Chronicles 4:19), "the tables and upon them the showbread." And in all of them, they would kindle, as it is stated (1 Chronicles 4:20), "the menorahs and their lamps to burn as it is right before the inner sanctuary, of pure gold."

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי בר' יהודה אומר לא היו מסדרין אלא על של משה אלא מה אני מקיים ואת השלחנות אשר עליהם לחם הפנים זהב אלו שלשה שלחנות שהיו במקדש שנים שהיו באולם מבפנים לפתח הבית אחד של כסף ואחד של זהב
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: They would arrange only upon of Moses. Rather, how do I realize “And the tables upon which was the shewbread… gold” These are three tables that were in the Temple, two that were in the Entrance Hall on the inside to the entrance to the Temple, One of silver, and one of gold.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, says: They would only arrange the showbread on that of Moses. But how do I fulfill "and the tables upon which was the showbread, of gold"? These are the three tables that were in the Temple: two that were in the Hall, from inside towards the entrance of the House, one of silver and one of gold.

hebrew_text: על של כסף נותן לחם הפנים בכניסתו ועל של זהב ביציאתו שמעלין בקודש ולא מורידין אחד של זהב בפנים שעליו לחם הפנים תמיד
human_translation: On of silver places the shewbread before its entrance And on of gold upon its exit that one elevates in sanctity and one does not downgrade. one of gold inside upon which the shewbread always
llm_translation: Regarding the table of silver, one places the showbread upon its entrance, and regarding the table of gold, upon its exit, they ascend in holiness and do not descend. One of gold is not placed inside, upon which the showbread is always placed.

hebrew_text: ומנא לן דאין מורידין אמר רבי דאמר קרא (שמות מ, יח) ויקם משה את המשכן ויתן את אדניו וישם את קרשיו ויתן את בריחיו ויקם את עמודיו
human_translation: And from where do we that one does not downgrade Rabbi said: as the verse states: “And Moses erected the Tabernacle, and he laid its sockets, and set up its boards, and put in its bars, and erected its pillars”
llm_translation: And count to us that we do not descend, said Rabbi, for he said a verse (Exodus 40:18), "And Moses erected the Tabernacle and placed its sockets and set up its planks and inserted its bars and erected its pillars."

hebrew_text: ומנלן דמעלין אמר רבי אחא בר יעקב דאמר קרא (במדבר יז, ג) את מחתות החטאים האלה בנפשותם ועשו אותם רקועי פחים ציפוי למזבח כי הקריבום לפני ה' ויקדשו ויהיו לאות לבני ישראל בתחילה תשמישי מזבח ועכשיו גופו של מזבח
human_translation: And from where do we that one elevates Rabbi Aḥa bar Ya’akov said: as the verse states “The coal pans of these men who have sinned at the cost of their lives, and let them be made beaten plates for a covering of the altar, for they have become sacred because they were brought before the Lord, that they may be a sign to the children of Israel” Initially articles of altar, and now the altar itself.
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that we elevate? Rabbi Ahah bar Yaakov said: as it says (Numbers 17:3), "These sin-offerings' fire-pans, they shall make them into hammered sheets as a covering for the altar, for they brought them before the Lord, and they became holy, and they shall be a sign for the children of Israel." Initially, they served the altar, and now the body of the altar.

hebrew_text: (דברים י, ב) אשר שברת ושמתם בארון תני רב יוסף מלמד שהלוחות ושברי לוחות מונחין בארון מכאן לתלמיד חכם ששכח תלמודו מחמת אונסו שאין נוהגין בו מנהג בזיון
human_translation: which you broke, and you shall put them in the Ark” Rav Yosef teaches teaches that the tablets and pieces of tablets are placed in the Ark. from here that with regard to a Torah scholar who has forgotten his knowledge due to beyond his control, one may not behave toward him a degrading manner.
llm_translation: The verse (Deuteronomy 10:2) "which you broke and you shall place in the ark" - Rav Yosef taught: This teaches that the Tablets and the broken Tablets are placed in the ark. From here we learn regarding a Torah scholar who forgets his learning due to circumstances beyond his control, as they do not treat him with disrespect.

hebrew_text: (סימ"ן ביט"ל סר"ח ושכ"ח)
human_translation: a mnemonic caused dereliction sinned, and forgot
llm_translation: Tractate: Siman Beit-Lamed, Chapter 68, Mishnah 8 and Tosefta 28 אמר רבי יוחנן כל המקיים דברי התורה בעיני עצמו מעלה עליו הכתוב כאילו קיים את כל התורה כולה וכל המבטל דברי התורה בעיני עצמו מעלה עליו הכתוב כאילו ביטל את כל התורה כולה

hebrew_text: אמר ריש לקיש פעמים
human_translation: Reish Lakish says: Sometimes
llm_translation: Said Reish Lakish: "Pamim."

hebrew_text: שביטולה של תורה זהו יסודה דכתיב (שמות לד, א) אשר שברת אמר לו הקב"ה למשה יישר כחך ששברת
human_translation: the dereliction of Torah is its foundation, as it is written: which [ asher ] you broke” the Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Moses: Your strength is true [ yishar koḥakha ] that you broke
llm_translation: The nullification of the Torah, this is its foundation, as it is written (Exodus 34:1), "which you shattered." The Holy One, blessed be He, said to Moses, "Well done for shattering."

hebrew_text: ואמר ריש לקיש תלמיד חכם שסרח אין מבזין אותו בפרהסיא שנאמר (הושע ד, ה) וכשלת היום וכשל גם נביא עמך לילה כסהו כלילה
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: a Torah scholar who sinned, he is not disgraced in public, as it is stated: “Therefore, you shall stumble in the day, and the prophet also shall stumble with you in the night” should conceal like the night
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: A Torah scholar who backslides, they do not disgrace him in public, as it is stated (Hosea 4:5), "And you shall stumble by day, and also the prophet shall stumble with you by night; I will silence your mother."

hebrew_text: ואמר ריש לקיש כל המשכח דבר אחד מתלמודו עובר בלאו שנאמר (דברים ד, ט) השמר לך ושמור נפשך מאד פן תשכח את הדברים וכדר' אבין אמר ר' אילעא דאמר רבי אבין אמר ר' אילעא כל מקום שנאמר השמר פן ואל אינו אלא לא תעשה
human_translation: And Reish Lakish says: Anyone who causes himself to forget one matter from his studies violates a prohibition, as it is stated observe for yourself, and guard your soul diligently, lest you forget the matters And in accordance with Rabbi Avin Rabbi Ile’a says, as Rabbi Avin says Rabbi Ile’a says: Wherever it is stated: Observe, Lest, or: Do not, it is nothing other than a prohibition.
llm_translation: And Reish Lakish said: Anyone who forgets one thing from his learning transgresses a prohibition, as it is stated (Deuteronomy 4:9), "Take heed to yourself and keep your soul diligently, lest you forget the things." And as Rabbi Avin said in the name of Rabbi Ilai who said in the name of Rabbi Avin who said in the name of Rabbi Ilai: Any place where it says "take heed lest" (השמר פן), it is only a prohibition against doing.

hebrew_text: רבינא אמר השמר ופן שני לאוין נינהו רב נחמן בר יצחק אמר בשלשה לאוין שנאמר השמר לך ושמור נפשך מאוד פן תשכח את הדברים
human_translation: Ravina says: “observe” and “lest,” these are two prohibitions. Rav Naḥman bar Yitzḥak says: three prohibitions, as it is stated: observe for yourself, and guard your soul diligently, lest you forget the matters
llm_translation: Ravina said: "Be cautious, for they are two prohibitions." Rav Nachman bar Yitzchak said: "They are three prohibitions, as it is stated: 'Take heed to yourself and keep your soul diligently, lest you forget the things.'"

hebrew_text: יכול אפילו מחמת אונסו תלמוד לומר (דברים ד, ט) ופן יסורו מלבבך במסירם מלבו הכתוב מדבר רבי דוסתאי בר' ינאי אמר יכול אפילו תקפה עליו משנתו תלמוד לומר רק
human_translation: might even due to beyond his control. the verse states: “And lest they depart from your heart.” the verse is speaking of one who causes them to depart from his heart. Rabbi Dostai, son of Rabbi Yannai, says: might even his studies were hard for him the verse states: “Only,”
llm_translation: I might even say that due to his being forced, the Talmud says (Deuteronomy 4:9), "And lest you turn aside and serve other gods." The verse speaks of turning aside from his heart when they turn aside from his heart. Rabbi Dostai son of Rabbi Yanai said: I might even say that if his learning is difficult for him, the Talmud says, "Only."

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן ור' אלעזר דאמרי תרוייהו תורה ניתנה בארבעים ונשמה נוצרה בארבעים כל המשמר תורתו נשמתו משתמרת וכל שאינו משמר את התורה אין נשמתו משתמרת
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan and Rabbi Elazar both say: Torah was given in forty and soul is formed in forty anyone who preserves his Torah his soul is preserved, and anyone who does not preserve his Torah his soul is not preserved
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan and Rabbi Elazar both said: The Torah was given in forty, and the soul was created in forty. Whoever guards his Torah, his soul is guarded, and whoever does not guard the Torah, his soul is not guarded.

hebrew_text: תנא דבי רבי ישמעאל משל לאדם שמסר צפור דרור לעבדו אמר כמדומה אתה שאם אתה מאבדה שאני נוטל ממך איסר בדמיה נשמתך אני נוטל ממך:
human_translation: The school of Rabbi Yishmael taught: a parable, to a person who delivered a sparrow to his slave said Are you under the impression that if you lose it I will take from you an issar , which is the value I will take your soul from you
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: A parable to a person who entrusted a wild bird to his servant. He said, "You are similar to this bird. Just as if you lose it, I will take payment from you, so too, if you lose it, I will take your life in exchange."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שני שולחנות היו באולם מבפנים על פתח הבית אחד של שייש ואחד של זהב על של שייש נותנים לחם הפנים בכניסתו ועל של זהב ביציאתו
human_translation: There were two tables in the Entrance Hall, on the inside to the entrance to the Temple, One of marble and one of gold. On of marble, place the shewbread before its entrance And on of gold upon its exit
llm_translation: Mishnah: Two tables were in the hall, from the inside towards the entrance of the house, one of marble and one of gold. On the marble one they would place the showbread upon its entry, and on the gold one upon its exit.

hebrew_text: שמעלין בקודש ולא מורידין ואחד של זהב מבפנים שעליו לחם הפנים תמיד
human_translation: that one elevates in sanctity and one does not downgrade. And one of gold within upon which the shewbread always
llm_translation: We raise in holiness and do not lower, and one of gold from within, upon which is the showbread always.

hebrew_text: וארבעה כהנים נכנסין שנים בידם שני סדרים ושנים בידם שני בזיכין וארבעה מקדימין לפניהם שנים ליטול שני סדרים ושנים ליטול שני בזיכין
human_translation: And four priests enter, two two arrangements in their hands and two two bowls in their hands. And four precede before them, two to take two arrangements and two to take two bowls
llm_translation: Four Kohanim enter, two of them holding two rows in their hands, and two of them holding two basins in their hands. And four are positioned in front of them, two to take two rows, and two to take two basins.

hebrew_text: המכניסים עומדים בצפון ופניהם לדרום והמוציאין עומדים בדרום ופניהם בצפון אלו מושכין ואלו מניחין וטפחו של זה כנגד טפחו של זה שנאמר (שמות כה, ל) לפני תמיד
human_translation: Those bringing into stand in the north and their faces are to the south, and those removing stand in the south and their faces are to the north. These draw and those place and for handbreadth of this handbreadth of that as it is stated: before Me always”
llm_translation: Those who bring in stand in the north, with their faces to the south, and those who take out stand in the south, with their faces to the north. These draw and those place, and the handbreadth of this one corresponds to the handbreadth of that one, as it is stated (Exodus 25:30), "Before the Lord always."

hebrew_text: ר' יוסי אומר אפילו אלו נוטלין ואלו מניחין אף היא היתה תמיד
human_translation: Rabbi Yosei says: Even these remove and those place too would always
llm_translation: Rabbi Yossi says: Even if these are taken and those are placed, she was always there.

hebrew_text: יצאו ונתנום על שלחן הזהב שהיה באולם הקטירו הבזיכין והחלות מתחלקות לכהנים
human_translation: came out and placed them on the table of gold that was in the Entrance Hall. burned the bowls. And the loaves were distributed to the priests.
llm_translation: They went out and placed them on the golden table that was in the hall; the Bazichin would arrange and distribute the loaves to the priests.

hebrew_text: חל יום כיפורים להיות בשבת החלות מתחלקות לערב חל להיות בערב שבת שעיר של יום הכפורים נאכל לערב והבבליים אוכלין אותו כשהוא חי מפני שדעתן יפה:
human_translation: Yom Kippur occurs on Shabbat, the loaves are distributed at night, occurs on Friday, the goat of Yom Kippur is eaten at night, And the Babylonians, eat it when it is raw, due to that they are broad-minded
llm_translation: If Yom Kippur falls on Shabbat, opinions are divided. According to the evening, if it falls on Erev Shabbat, the Se'ir of Yom Kippur is eaten in the evening, and the Babylonians eat it while it is alive because their opinion is favorable.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תניא רבי יוסי אומר אפילו סילק את הישנה שחרית וסידר את החדשה ערבית אין בכך כלום אלא מה אני מקיים לפני תמיד שלא ילין שלחן בלא לחם
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Yosei says: Even removed the old morning and arranged the new evening, nothing with that. Rather, how do I realize before Me always” that Table should not be left overnight without bread
llm_translation: Gemara: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei says, even if one removed the old bread in the morning and arranged the new bread in the evening, there is nothing in this. Rather, what am I fulfilling before the Eternal One, that the table should not remain without bread.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' אמי מדבריו של ר' יוסי נלמוד אפילו לא שנה אדם אלא פרק אחד שחרית ופרק אחד ערבית קיים מצות (יהושע א, ח) לא ימוש (את) ספר התורה הזה מפיך
human_translation: Rabbi Ami says: From Rabbi Yosei’s statement we may learn even a person learned only one chapter the morning and one chapter the evening, he has fulfilled the mitzva of: “This Torah scroll shall not depart from your mouth,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Ami: From the words of Rabbi Yossi we learn that even if a person studies only one chapter in the morning and one chapter in the evening, he fulfills the commandment (Joshua 1:8), "This book of the Torah shall not depart from your mouth."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יוחנן משום רבי שמעון בן יוחי אפילו לא קרא אדם אלא קרית שמע שחרית וערבית קיים לא ימוש ודבר זה אסור לאומרו בפני עמי הארץ ורבא אמר מצוה לאומרו בפני עמי הארץ
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yoḥai: Even a person recited only the recitation of Shema the morning and the evening, fulfilled shall not depart And it is prohibited to state this matter in the presence of ignoramuses [ amei ha’aretz ], And Rava says: a mitzva to state in the presence of ignoramuses,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yochanan in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben Yochai: Even if a person only recited the Shema in the morning and evening, he has fulfilled his obligation. This matter should not be said in the presence of ignorant people. Rava said: It is a mitzvah to say it in the presence of ignorant people.

hebrew_text: שאל בן דמה בן אחותו של ר' ישמעאל את ר' ישמעאל כגון אני שלמדתי כל התורה כולה מהו ללמוד חכמת יונית קרא עליו המקרא הזה לא ימוש ספר התורה הזה מפיך והגית בו יומם ולילה צא ובדוק שעה שאינה לא מן היום ולא מן הלילה ולמוד בה חכמת יונית
human_translation: Ben Dama, son of Rabbi Yishmael’s sister, asked Rabbi Yishmael: such as I, who has learned the entire Torah, what is with regard to studying Greek wisdom? recited this verse about him: “This Torah scroll shall not depart from your mouth, and you shall contemplate in it day and night.” Go and search an hour that is neither of the day nor of the night, and learn Greek wisdom in it.
llm_translation: Ben Dama, the son of the sister of Rabbi Yishmael, asked Rabbi Yishmael: "For example, I have learned the entire Torah, what is the law regarding studying Greek wisdom?" Concerning him, this verse was recited: "This Torah scroll shall not depart from your mouth, and you shall contemplate it day and night." Go and examine a time that is neither day nor night, and study Greek wisdom in it.

hebrew_text: ופליגא דר' שמואל בר נחמני דאמר ר' שמואל בר נחמני אמר ר' יונתן פסוק זה אינו לא חובה ולא מצוה אלא ברכה ראה הקב"ה את יהושע שדברי תורה חביבים עליו ביותר שנאמר (שמות לג, יא) ומשרתו יהושע בן נון נער לא ימיש מתוך האהל אמר לו הקדוש ברוך הוא יהושע כל כך חביבין עליך דברי תורה לא ימוש ספר התורה הזה מפיך
human_translation: And disagrees of Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani, as Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: This verse is neither an obligation nor a mitzva, but a blessing. The Holy One, Blessed be He, saw Joshua that words of Torah were very precious to him, as it is stated: and his servant Joshua, son of Nun, a young man, did not depart from the Tent” The Holy One, Blessed be He, said to Joshua, are words of Torah so precious to you? “this Torah scroll shall not depart from your mouth.”
llm_translation: And it is in dispute of Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani, for Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said, Rabbi Yonatan said: "This verse is neither an obligation nor a commandment, but a blessing. The Holy One, blessed be He, saw Joshua, that the words of Torah were exceedingly beloved to him, as it is stated (Exodus 33:11): 'And Joshua, the son of Nun, a lad, would not depart from the tent.' The Holy One, blessed be He, said to him: 'Joshua, since the words of Torah are so beloved to you, this Torah scroll shall not depart from your mouth.'"

hebrew_text: תנא דבי ר' ישמעאל דברי תורה לא יהו עליך חובה ואי אתה רשאי לפטור עצמך מהן
human_translation: The tanna of the school of Rabbi Yishmael words of Torah should not be an obligation upon you, but you are not permitted to exempt yourself from them.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Yishmael: The words of Torah should not be a burden upon you, and you are not permitted to exempt yourself from them.

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה מאי דכתיב (איוב לו, טז) ואף הסיתך מפי צר רחב לא מוצק תחתיה בוא וראה שלא כמדת הקדוש ברוך הוא מדת בשר ודם מדת בשר ודם אדם מסית את חבירו מדרכי חיים לדרכי מיתה והקדוש ברוך הוא מסית את האדם מדרכי מיתה לדרכי חיים שנאמר ואף הסיתך מפי צר מגיהנם שפיה צר שעשנה צבור
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya said: What which is written: and also He has allured you out of a narrow opening to a broad place without confines below it, Come and see that the attribute of flesh and blood is unlike the attribute of the Holy One, Blessed be He. The attribute of flesh and blood a person allures another from paths of life to paths of death, but the Holy One, Blessed be He, allures the person from paths of death to paths of life, as it is stated: “And also He has allured you out of a narrow opening,” from Gehenna, the opening of which is narrow that its smoke is collected
llm_translation: Hizkiah said: What is the meaning of what is written (Job 36:16), "And He would have led you away from the mouth of distress to a broad place where there is no constraint beneath it"? Come and see that the measure of the Holy One, blessed be He, is not like the measure of flesh and blood. The measure of flesh and blood, a person entices his fellow from the ways of life to the ways of death, but the Holy One, blessed be He, entices a person from the ways of death to the ways of life, as it is stated, "And He would have led you away from the mouth of distress" - from Gehenna, the narrow mouth that a community made.

hebrew_text: בתוכה ושמא תאמר כשם שפיה צר כך כולה צרה תלמוד לומר (ישעיהו ל, לג) העמיק הרחיב
human_translation: within it. And lest you say: Just as the opening is narrow, so all of is narrow, the verse states: deep and large,
llm_translation: Within her, and perhaps you will say just as her mouth is narrow, so too her entirety is narrow. The Talmud teaches to say (Isaiah 30:33) "He has made it deep and wide."

hebrew_text: ושמא תאמר למלך לא הוכנה תלמוד לאמר (ישעיהו ל, לג) גם היא למלך הוכן ושמא תאמר אין בה עצים תלמוד לאמר (ישעיהו ל, לג) מדורתה אש ועצים הרבה ושמא תאמר זה הוא שכרה תלמוד לומר (איוב לו, טז) ונחת שולחנך מלא דשן:
human_translation: And lest you say it is not prepared for a king, the verse states: “It has been prepared even for the king.” And lest you say there is no wood in the verse states: “Its pile is fire and much wood.” And lest you say this, is reward the verse states: “And that which is set on your table is full of fatness”
llm_translation: And perhaps you will say to the king, "It was not prepared." Scripture says (Isaiah 30:33), "It is also prepared for the king." And perhaps you will say it has no wood. Scripture says (Isaiah 30:33), "Its firepit is deep and wide, with plenty of firewood." And perhaps you will say, "This is its reward." Scripture says (Job 36:16), "And the abundance of your table will be full of fatness."

hebrew_text: חל יום הכיפורים להיות בשבת [וכו']: אמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר ר' יוחנן לא בבליים הם אלא אלכסנדריים הם ומתוך ששונאין את בבליים קורין אותם על שם בבליים
human_translation: Yom Kippur occurs on Shabbat, Rabba bar bar Ḥana says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: are not Babylonians. Rather, they are Alexandrians, But since hate Babylonians, they would call by the name Babylonians.
llm_translation: The Day of Atonement falls on a Sabbath etc.. Rabbah bar bar Ḥanah said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: They are not Babylonians, but Alexandrians. And because they despise the Babylonians, they call them by the name of Babylonians.

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי ר' יוסי אומר לא בבליים הם אלא אלכסנדריים הם ומתוך ששונאין את בבליים קוראין אותן על שם בבליים אמר לו ר' יהודה תנוח דעתך שהנחת דעתי:
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi Yosei says: are not Babylonians. Rather, they are Alexandrians. But since hate Babylonians, they would call by the name Babylonians. Rabbi Yehuda, said to May your mind be at ease, because you have put my mind at ease.
llm_translation: It was also taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yosei also says, "They are not Babylonians, but rather Alexandrians. And because they despise the Babylonians, they call them by the name 'Babylonians'." Rabbi Yehuda said to him, "May your mind be at ease, for you have put my mind at ease."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ סידר את הלחם בשבת ואת הבזיכין לאחר השבת והקטיר את הבזיכין בשבת פסול אין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול נותר וטמא
human_translation: arranged the bread on Shabbat but the bowls after Shabbat, burned the bowls on the Shabbat, unfit one is not liable for them due to piggul notar , or ritually impure.
llm_translation: Mishnah: He arranged the bread on Shabbat and the frankincense after Shabbat, and he burned the frankincense on Shabbat - it is invalid. One is not liable for them due to Pigul, remaining, and impurity.

hebrew_text: סידר את הלחם ואת הבזיכין בשבת והקטיר את הבזיכין לאחר השבת פסולה ואין חייבין עליהן משום פיגול נותר וטמא
human_translation: arranged the bread and the bowls on Shabbat but burned the bowls after the Shabbat, not valid And one is not liable for them due to piggul notar , or ritually impure.
llm_translation: He arranged the bread and the frankincense on Shabbat, and he burned the frankincense after Shabbat - it is invalid, and one is not liable for them due to the prohibition of "Piggul," remaining or impure.

hebrew_text: סידר את הלחם ואת הבזיכין לאחר השבת והקטיר את הבזיכין בשבת פסולה כיצד יעשה יניחנה לשבת הבאה שאפילו היא על השולחן ימים רבים אין בכך כלום:
human_translation: one arranged the bread and the bowls after Shabbat and burned the bowls on the Shabbat, not valid How should act he should leave it until the following Shabbat, as even it is on the Table many days nothing with that,
llm_translation: He arranged the bread and the frankincense after the Sabbath, and he burned the frankincense on the Sabbath - it is invalid. How should he do it? He should leave it for the next Sabbath, even if it is on the table for many days, there is nothing wrong with that.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנן התם אמר להם הממונה צאו וראו אם הגיע זמן שחיטה אם הגיע הרואה אומר ברקאי מתתיא בן שמואל אומר האיר פני כל המזרח עד שבחברון והוא אומר הן
human_translation: We learned there The appointed said to Go out and see if the time for slaughtering has arrived, If has arrived, the observer says: There is light [ barkai ]. Mattitya ben Shmuel would say: Is the entire eastern illuminated, to Hebron? And would say: Yes.
llm_translation: Gemara: We learned there: The appointed one said to them, "Go out and see if the time for slaughter has arrived." If the observer says, "It is dawn," Mattitya ben Shmuel says, "He illuminated the face of the entire east until Hebron," and he says, "Yes."

hebrew_text: ולמה הוצרכו לכך שפעם אחת עלה מאור הלבנה ודימו שהאיר מזרח שחטו את התמיד והוציאוהו לבית השריפה
human_translation: And why did they need to this, because once, the light of the moon rose and imagined that the eastern was illuminated They slaughtered the daily offering, and they had to take it out to the place for burning
llm_translation: And why was this necessary? For once the light of the moon rose, and they thought it had illuminated the east, they slaughtered the continual offering and took it out to the place of burning.

hebrew_text: והורידו כהן גדול לבית הטבילה זה הכלל היה במקדש כל המסיך את רגליו טעון טבילה וכל המטיל מים טעון קדוש ידים ורגלים
human_translation: led High Priest down to the Hall of Immersion. This was the principle in the Temple: Anyone who covers his legs, requires immersion and anyone who urinates requires sanctification of hands and feet
llm_translation: And the high priest shall descend to the ritual bath, this was the principle in the Temple: anyone who covers his feet requires immersion, and anyone who pours water requires sanctification of hands and feet.

hebrew_text: תני אבוה דר' אבין לא זו בלבד אלא אפילו עולת העוף שנמלקה בלילה ומנחה שנקמצה בלילה תצא לבית השריפה
human_translation: The father of Rabbi Avin teaches Not only this but even a bird burnt offering whose was pinched at night, and a meal offering which a handful was removed at night, must be taken out to the place for burning.
llm_translation: It was taught in the school of Rabbi Avin: Not only this, but even a burnt offering of a bird that was licked at night, and a meal offering that became leavened at night, shall be taken out to the place of burning.

hebrew_text: בשלמא עולת העוף משום דלא אפשר לאהדורה אלא מנחה אפשר דמהדר קומץ לדוכתיה וקמיץ ביממא
human_translation: Granted, a bird burnt offering as it cannot be restored But a meal offering possible as can restore handful to its place and remove a handful during the day.
llm_translation: In accordance with the burnt offering of a bird, because it is not possible to bring it as a sacrifice, only as a meal offering. It is possible that one may bring a handful to its place and perform the handful during the day.

hebrew_text: הוא תני לה והוא אמר לה כלי שרת מקדשין שלא בזמנן
human_translation: teaches and he says its Service vessels sanctify when not at time for
llm_translation: He taught her and he said to her, "Keilim of the Temple that are not in their proper time."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי כל הקרב ביום קדוש ביום בלילה קדוש בלילה בין ביום ובין בלילה קדוש בין ביום ובין בלילה
human_translation: raises an objection Any that is sacrificed during the day is consecrated during the day, at night is consecrated at night, both during the day and at night is consecrated both during the day and at night.
llm_translation: The question was raised: Anyone who offers a sacrifice during the day, the day is holy; during the night, the night is holy; whether during the day or during the night, both are holy.

hebrew_text: כל הקרב ביום קדוש ביום ביום אין בלילה לא אינו קדוש ליקרב אבל קדוש ליפסל
human_translation: any that is sacrificed during the day is consecrated during the day, during the day, yes, not at night. are not consecrated to be sacrificed but they are consecrated to be disqualified.
llm_translation: All who approach on a holy day, by day, on a day, there is no sanctity at night, neither is it holy to approach, but it is holy to disqualify.

hebrew_text: מותיב ר' זירא סידר את הלחם ואת הבזיכין אחר שבת והקטיר את הבזיכין בשבת פסולה כיצד יעשה יניחנה לשבת הבאה שאפילו היא על השלחן ימים רבים אין בכך כלום
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira raises an objection one arranged the bread and the bowls after Shabbat and burned the bowls on the Shabbat, not valid How should act he should leave it until the following Shabbat, as even it is on the Table many days nothing with that,
llm_translation: Challenger Rabbi Zeira arranged the bread and the spices after Shabbat, and he burned the spices on Shabbat. It is disqualified. How should he do it? He should leave them for the next Shabbat, even if it is on the table for many days, there is nothing wrong with that.

hebrew_text: ואי סלקא דעתך כלי שרת מקדשין שלא בזמנן (ליפסל) ליקדוש וליפסול
human_translation: And if it enters your mind service vessels sanctify to are disqualified when not at time, it should be sanctified and disqualified
llm_translation: And if it were to your mind, vessels of the Temple service that are not in their proper time (are disqualified) to sanctify and to disqualify.

hebrew_text: אמר רבה מאן דקא מותיב שפיר קא מותיב אבוה דר' אבין נמי מתניתא קאמר קסבר לילה אין מחוסר זמן הא ימים מחוסרין זמן
human_translation: Rabba said: The one who raises the objection, raises the objection well. the father of Rabbi Avin is also stating a baraita , maintains night not whose time has not yet But days whose time has not yet
llm_translation: Rabba said: Whoever is arguing, he is arguing well. Also, the father of Rabbi Avin is saying in a Mishnah: He holds that night is not a limited time, but days are limited in time.

hebrew_text: סוף סוף
human_translation: Ultimately,
llm_translation: End, end.

hebrew_text: כי מטי ליליא דבי שימשי ליקדוש וליפסול אמר רבא בשקדם וסילק
human_translation: when the night arrives, twilight be consecrated and disqualified Rava says: to where removed before
llm_translation: When it comes to the night of the house of Shemshi for sanctification and disqualification, Rava said: "With almonds and peeled."

hebrew_text: מר זוטרא ואיתימא רב אשי אמר אפילו תימא בשלא קדם וסילק כיון דסידרו שלא כמצותו נעשה כמי שסדרו הקוף:
human_translation: Mar Zutra, and some say Rav Ashi, said: Even you say where did not remove before Since arranged that was not in accordance with its mitzva, it is considered as though a monkey had arranged
llm_translation: Mar Zutra and some say Rav Ashi said: Even if you say it was not before and it departed, once they arranged it not according to its command, it becomes like one arranged by a monkey.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שתי הלחם נאכלות אין פחות משנים ולא יותר על שלשה כיצד נאפות מערב יום טוב נאכלות ביום טוב לשנים חל יום טוב להיות אחר השבת נאכלות לשלשה
human_translation: The two loaves are eaten no less than two and no more than three How so? They are baked on the eve of the festival they are eaten on the Festival, on the second the Festival occurs after Shabbat, they are eaten on the third
llm_translation: Mishnah: Two loaves of bread are eaten, not less than two and not more than three. How are they baked? If they were baked on Erev Yom Tov, they are eaten on Yom Tov for two people. If Yom Tov falls after Shabbat, they are eaten by three people.

hebrew_text: לחם הפנים נאכל אין פחות מתשעה ולא יותר על אחד עשר כיצד נאפה מערב שבת ונאכל בשבת לתשעה חל יום טוב להיות ערב שבת נאכל לעשרה
human_translation: The shewbread is eaten no less than nine and no more than eleven How so? It is baked on Shabbat eve and eaten on the Shabbat, on the ninth a Festival occurs on Shabbat eve it is eaten on the tenth
llm_translation: Bread of the Presence is eaten not less than nine and not more than eleven. How is it baked? On Friday and eaten on Shabbat, for nine it is baked. If a festival falls on Erev Shabbat, it is baked for ten.

hebrew_text: שני ימים [טובים] של ראש השנה נאכל לאחד עשר ואינו דוחה לא את השבת ולא את יום טוב רבן שמעון בן גמליאל אומר משום רבי שמעון בן הסגן דוחה את יום טוב ואינו דוחה את יום צום:
human_translation: two festival days of Rosh HaShana it is eaten on the eleventh And overrides neither Shabbat nor a Festival. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Shimon, son of the deputy overrides a Festival but does not override fast day
llm_translation: Two days of Rosh Hashanah we eat festive meals, the eleventh day and it does not override neither the Sabbath nor a festival day. Rabban Shimon ben Gamliel says in the name of Rabbi Shimon ben HaSagane: it overrides a festival day but it does not override a fast day.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רבינא לדברי האומר נדרים ונדבות אין קריבין ביום טוב לא תימא מדאורייתא מיחזא חזו ורבנן הוא דגזרו שלא ישהא אלא מדאורייתא נמי לא חזו
human_translation: Ravina said: According to the statement of the one who says vow offerings and voluntary offerings may not be sacrificed on a Festival, do not say they are fit by Torah law and it is the Sages who decreed that would not delay Rather, are unfit also by Torah law.
llm_translation: Gemara: Ravina said, regarding one who says vows and voluntary offerings, they are not brought on a festival day. Do not say this is from the Torah, for it is a Rabbinic decree so that one should not rely on it. Even from the Torah, they did not see this.

hebrew_text: דהא שתי הלחם דחובת היום הוא וליכא למימר שמא ישהא וקתני אינו דוחה לא את השבת ולא את יום טוב:
human_translation: as the two loaves is an obligation of the day not to say lest delay And teaches overrides neither Shabbat nor a Festival.
llm_translation: The bread of obligation of the day it is, and not to say perhaps it is old, and it teaches: it does not override neither the Sabbath nor the festival day.

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך פרק שתי הלחם
llm_translation: We will return to you, Chapter of the Two Loaves.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ המנחות והנסכים שנטמאו עד שלא קדשו בכלי יש להם פדיון משקידשו בכלי אין להם פדיון
human_translation: the meal offerings or the libations that became ritually impure, have not yet been consecrated in vessel their redemption Once they have been consecrated in vessel their redemption no
llm_translation: Mishnah: The meal-offerings and libations that became impure before they were sanctified in vessels, have redemption. Once they are sanctified in vessels, they do not have redemption.

hebrew_text: העופות והעצים והלבונה וכלי שרת משנטמאו אין להן פדיון שלא נאמר פדיון אלא בבהמה:
human_translation: birds, wood frankincense, and service vessels, once became ritually impure they have no redemption, as redemption was stated only with regard to animal
llm_translation: The birds and the trees and the frankincense and the vessels of service, if they became ritually impure, they do not have redemption, as it is only stated redemption in regards to an animal.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר שמואל ואפילו הן טהורין נפדין מאי טעמא כמה דלא קדשי בכלי קדושת דמים נינהו וקדושת דמים נפדין
human_translation: Shmuel says: Even if they are ritually pure, they redeemed. What is the reason As long as they have not been consecrated in vessel, sanctity value, sanctity value redeemed.
llm_translation: Gemara: Shmuel said, "Even if they are pure, they are redeemed." What is the reason? Because they are not sanctified vessels of sanctity of blood, and sanctity of blood is redeemed.

hebrew_text: והא נטמאו תנן הוא הדין דאף על גב דלא נטמאו ואיידי דקא בעי מיתנא סיפא משקידשו בכלי אין להן פדיון דאפילו נטמאו נמי לא תנא נמי רישא שנטמאו עד שלא קדשו בכלי
human_translation: But didn’t we learn became ritually impure The same is true even if they had not become ritually impure. And since wants teach the latter clause, Once they were consecrated in vessel they have no redemption, that even they became ritually impure still no also taught the first clause: That became ritually impure before they were consecrated in vessel.
llm_translation: And this, we learned: The same law applies even though they did not become impure. And since the latter clause is necessary, it teaches: When they become sanctified in a vessel, they do not have redemption. For even if they became impure, it did not teach. Also, the first clause: If they became impure before they were sanctified in a vessel.

hebrew_text: פשיטא קדושת הגוף נינהו
human_translation: obvious they are inherent sanctity?
llm_translation: It is obvious, they are the holiness of the body.

hebrew_text: איצטריך סלקא דעתך אמינא הואיל ובעל מום איקרי טמא טמא נמי כבעל מום דמי ואף על גב דקדוש קדושת הגוף כי נפיל ביה מום מיפריק הני נמי ליפרוק קמשמע לן דלאו כי האי טמא קרייה רחמנא לבעל מום
human_translation: was necessary enter your mind to say: Since a blemished is called impure, an impure also similar to a blemished And even though consecrated inherent sanctity, when it develops a blemish it is redeemed, these may also be redeemed teaches us that is not this the Merciful One called a blemished “impure.”
llm_translation: It was necessary for your mind to ascend, I say, since a blemished animal is called impure, impure is also similar to a blemished one, and even though it is holy, the holiness of the body, when a blemish occurs in it, it renders it unfit. These also render it unfit, as it is taught to us that this impure one is called by the Merciful One a blemished one.

hebrew_text: דמכלי שרת לא אשכחן דמיפריק
human_translation: since we do not find where a service vessel is redeemed.
llm_translation: From the vessels of the service, I did not find that it breaks.

hebrew_text: ובעל מום היכא איקרי טמא דתניא (ויקרא כז, יא) ואם כל בהמה טמאה אשר לא יקריבו ממנה קרבן לה' בבעלי מומין שנפדין הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: And where a blemished called “impure” As it is taught “And if it be any impure animal, of which they may not bring an offering to the Lord, The verse is speaking of blemished that are redeemed,
llm_translation: "And a blemished animal, where is it called impure? As it was taught (Leviticus 27:11), 'And if it is any unclean animal of which they do not offer an offering to the Lord, then he shall set the animal before the priest.'"

hebrew_text: אתה אומר בבעלי מומין שנפדו או אינו אלא בבהמה טמאה ממש כשהוא אומר (ויקרא כז, כז) ואם בבהמה הטמאה ופדה בערכך הרי בהמה טמאה אמורה הא מה אני מקיים ואם כל בהמה טמאה בבעלי מומין שנפדו הכתוב מדבר
human_translation: Do you say to blemished that were redeemed, or is it only to an actual non-kosher [ tamei ] animal, When states “And if it be of an impure [ tamei ] animal, then he shall redeem it according to your valuation, non-kosher animal is mentioned How do I realize “And if it be any impure [ tamei ] animal” The verse is speaking of blemished that were redeemed,
llm_translation: You say in regards to blemished animals that were redeemed, or is it only with a truly impure animal, as it says (Leviticus 27:27), "And if it is an impure animal and it is redeemed according to your valuation, then an impure animal shall be spoken of." How do I fulfill this? And if every impure animal with blemishes that were redeemed, the Scripture is speaking.

hebrew_text: יכול יפדו על מום עובר תלמוד לאמר אשר לא יקריבו ממנה קרבן לה' מי שאינה קריבה לה' כל עיקר יצתה זו שאינה קריבה היום וקריבה למחר
human_translation: might are redeemed due to a temporary blemish. the verse states: “Of which they may not bring an offering to the Lord,” that is not sacrificed to God at all. exclude this which is not sacrificed today, but is sacrificed tomorrow,
llm_translation: It is possible to redeem for a blemish that passes over the altar, the Talmud says, "which they shall not offer to the Lord." One who does not offer it to the Lord, the main point is this one that does not offer today and offers tomorrow.

hebrew_text: מותיב רב הונא בר מנוח העופות והעצים והלבונה וכלי שרת שנטמאו אין להן פדיון שלא נאמר פדיון אלא בבהמה בשלמא עופות קדושת הגוף נינהו ולא נאמר אלא בבהמה
human_translation: Rav Huna bar Manoaḥ raises an objection birds, wood frankincense, and service vessels, once became ritually impure, they have no redemption, as redemption is stated only with regard to an animal Granted, birds they are inherent sanctity, and stated only with regard to animals,
llm_translation: Challenger: Rav Huna son of Menuchet, birds and trees and frankincense and sacred vessels that became impure, do not have redemption, as it is only stated redemption in regards to animals. Birds are indeed considered holy offerings, and it is only stated in regards to animals.

hebrew_text: אלא עצים ולבונה וכלי שרת ליפרקו אלא לאו משום דטהורין בעלמא אין נפדין
human_translation: But wood, and frankincense and service vessels let them be redeemed. Rather, is it not because pure in general are not redeemed,
llm_translation: Rather, wood, frankincense, and sacred vessels may be redeemed, but not because they are inherently pure.

hebrew_text: והני נמי אף על גב דנטמאו כטהורים דמו דעצים ולבונה לאו בני אשויי אוכלא נינהו אלא חיבת הקודש משוה להו אוכלא
human_translation: And these too, even though they became impure, are like pure. because wood and frankincense are not capable of becoming food, Rather, the regard for the sanctity transforms their food,
llm_translation: And these also, even though they became impure, are like the pure ones, for their blood is like the blood of trees and frankincense, they are not considered food of fire offerings, but the obligation of holiness is compared to them as food.

hebrew_text: דעצים כמה דלא משפי להו לגזירין לא מיתכשרי לבונה נמי כמה דלא קידשה בכלי שרת לא מיתכשרה כלי שרת נמי הואיל ואית להו טהרה במקוה
human_translation: With regard to wood, as long as not trim it into logs, does not become susceptible frankincense as well, as long as not consecrated in a service vessel, does not become susceptible service vessels also, since they have purity in a ritual bath,
llm_translation: Wood, as long as it is not fit for beams, is not suitable for a decree. Incense, too, as long as it has not been sanctified in a sacred vessel, is not suitable. A sacred vessel, too, since it has the ability to become pure in a ritual bath.

hebrew_text: לא לעולם אימא לך טהורין בעלמא נפדין והני משום דלא שכיחי הוא
human_translation: No, actually, I will say to you in general, pure are redeemed; and these because they are not available.
llm_translation: Not forever say to you pure in general are redeemed and these because not common they are.

hebrew_text: בשלמא לבונה וכלי שרת לא שכיחי אלא עצים מישכח שכיחי עצים נמי כיון דאמר מר כל עץ שנמצא בו תולעת פסול לגבי מזבח הילכך לא שכיחי
human_translation: Granted, frankincense and service vessels are not available, but wood readily available. Wood also since the Master said any wood in which a worm is found disqualified for the altar. Consequently, not available.
llm_translation: In accordance with the statement, frankincense and sacred vessels are not common, but wood is common. Wood, too, since the Master said: "Any wood in which a worm is found is invalid for the altar," therefore they are not common.

hebrew_text: אמר רב פפא אי שמיעא ליה לשמואל הא דתניא המתפיס תמימים לבדק הבית אין פודין אותן אלא למזבח שכל הראוי למזבח אינו יוצא מידי מזבח לעולם ואף על גב דקדושת דמים נינהו אין נפדין הואיל וטהורים הם הוה הדר ביה
human_translation: Rav Pappa said if Shmuel had heard that which is taught who consecrates unblemished for Temple maintenance they are redeemed only for on the altar. that any that is fit on the altar may never leave the altar. And even though these sanctity value, they are not redeemed, since they are ritually pure he would have retracted
llm_translation: Rav Pappa said: If Shmuel would hear this, as it was taught: One who designates unblemished animals for inspection of the Temple, they are not redeemed except for the altar, for anything fit for the altar never leaves the altar forever. Even though they possess the sanctity of blood, they are not redeemed, since they are pure. He would retract his opinion.

hebrew_text: ולא היא שמיעא ליה ולא הדר ביה לאו אמרת התם כיון דלא שכיחי לא מיפרקי
human_translation: But is not so; heard by him, and did not retract Didn’t you say there, since not available, are not redeemed?
llm_translation: And not it is heard to him, and not he returned in it. Did you not say there, since not common, not resolved.

hebrew_text: הכא נמי כיון דשכיחי מומין דפסלי בבהמה דאפילו בדוקין שבעין נמי פסלי הילכך לא שכיחי
human_translation: Here, too, since blemishes that disqualify an animal are common, as even as on cornea of the eye also disqualifies therefore, not available.
llm_translation: Here also, since blemishes are common that disqualify an animal, even the most minute ones, are also disqualifying. Therefore, they are not common.

hebrew_text: רב כהנא אמר טמאין נפדין טהורין אין נפדין וכן אמר ר' אושעיא טמאין נפדין טהורין אין נפדין איכא דאמרי אמר ר' אושעיא אפילו טהורין נפדין
human_translation: Rav Kahana said impure are redeemed, pure are not redeemed. And Rabbi Oshaya similarly said impure are redeemed, pure are not redeemed. There are who say Rabbi Oshaya says: Even pure are redeemed.
llm_translation: Rav Kahana said: Impure ones are redeemed, pure ones are not redeemed. And so said Rabbi Oshaya: Impure ones are redeemed, pure ones are not redeemed. Some say that Rabbi Oshaya said: Even the pure ones are redeemed.

hebrew_text: רבי אלעזר אומר כולן טמאין נפדין טהורין אין נפדין חוץ מעשירית האיפה של מנחת חוטא
human_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: to all impure are redeemed, pure, are not redeemed, except for the tenth of an ephah of a meal offering of a sinner,
llm_translation: Rabbi Elazar says: all of them are impure, except for the one-tenth of an ephah of the sin offering.

hebrew_text: שהרי אמרה תורה מחטאתו על חטאתו
human_translation: that the Torah stated for his sin [ meḥattato ] from his sin [ al ḥattato ]
llm_translation: For behold, the Torah said: "His sin offering for his sin."

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אושעיא שמעתי פיגל במנחה לרבי שמעון אינו מטמא טומאת אוכלין דתנן הערלה וכלאי הכרם
human_translation: Rabbi Oshaya says: I heard according to Rabbi Shimon, rendered a meal offering piggul to the ritual impurity of food. As we learned Orla , diverse kinds in a vineyard,
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya said: I heard that Pigul in a Mincha offering according to Rabbi Shimon does not impart ritual impurity of food, as we learned in a Mishnah regarding uncircumcised produce and mixtures of the vineyard.

hebrew_text: ושור הנסקל ועגלה ערופה וצפורי מצורע ופטר חמור ובשר בחלב כולם מטמאין טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: an ox that is stoned, a heifer whose neck is broken,the birds a leper a firstborn donkey and meat with milk are all the ritual impurity of food,
llm_translation: And an ox that is stoned, and a calf that is decapitated, and the bird offerings of a leper, and the firstborn donkey, and meat cooked with milk - all of them impart ritual impurity of food.

hebrew_text: ר' שמעון אומר כולן אין מטמאין טומאת אוכלין ומודה ר' שמעון בבשר בחלב שמטמא טומאת אוכלין הואיל והיתה לו שעת הכושר
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: None of them are susceptible to the ritual impurity of food, And Rabbi Shimon concedes with regard to meat with milk that it is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food since it, had a time fit
llm_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: All of them do not impart impurity of food. And Rabbi Shimon concedes regarding meat in milk that it imparts impurity of food, since it was in a state of fitness.

hebrew_text: ואמר רב אסי אמר ר' יוחנן מאי טעמא דר' שמעון (ויקרא יא, לד) מכל האוכל אשר יאכל אוכל שאתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים קרוי אוכל אוכל שאי אתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים אינו קרוי אוכל
human_translation: And Rav Asi said Rabbi Yoḥanan said: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon’s “All food which may be eaten [ ha’okhel asher ye’akhel ], food that you are able to feed to others, is termed food food that you are not able to feed to others is not termed food.
llm_translation: And Rav Assi said in the name of Rabbi Yochanan: What is the reason for Rabbi Shimon's statement? "Of all the food that may be eaten, it is food that you are able to feed to others that is called food; food that you are unable to feed to others is not called food."

hebrew_text: והא פיגל במנחה נמי אוכל שאי אתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים הוא
human_translation: A meal offering rendered piggul is also food that you are not able to feed to others,
llm_translation: And the case of Pigul in a meal-offering, also the prohibition of eating it applies, for you cannot feed it to others, it is.

hebrew_text: אי הכי בשר בחלב נמי תיפוק ליה דאוכל שאתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים הוא
human_translation: If so, also meat in milk because it is food that you may feed to others,
llm_translation: If so, meat in milk also should be excluded for him, for eating, that you can feed it to others, it is.

hebrew_text: דתניא ר' שמעון בן יהודה אומר משום רבי שמעון בשר בחלב אסור באכילה ומותר בהנאה שנאמר (דברים יד, כא) כי עם קדוש אתה לה' אלהיך לא תבשל גדי בחלב אמו ולהלן הוא אומר (שמות כב, ל) ואנשי קודש תהיון לי ובשר בשדה טריפה לא תאכלו מה להלן אסור באכילה ומותר בהנאה אף כאן אסור באכילה ומותר בהנאה
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon: meat in milk, eating is prohibited and benefit is permitted, as it is stated: “For you are a holy people to the Lord your God; you shall not cook a kid in its mother’s milk” And elsewhere states: “And you shall be holy men to Me; therefore you shall not eat any flesh that is torn by animals [ tereifa ] in the field” Just as there, eating is prohibited but benefit is permitted, so too here, eating is forbidden but benefit is permitted.
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Yehuda says in the name of Rabbi Shimon, "Flesh with milk is forbidden for consumption but permitted for benefit," as it is stated (Deuteronomy 14:21), 'For you are a holy people to the Lord your God; you shall not cook a kid in its mother's milk.' And there it also says (Exodus 22:30), 'And you shall be holy men to Me, and you shall not eat flesh torn in the field.' Just as there it is forbidden for consumption but permitted for benefit, so too here it is forbidden for consumption but permitted for benefit.

hebrew_text: חדא ועוד קאמר חדא דאוכל שאתה יכול להאכילו לאחרים הוא ועוד לדידיה נמי היתה לו שעת הכושר
human_translation: states one and another. One that is food that you can feed to others. And another even for him, it had a time fit
llm_translation: One and furthermore it says, one who eats, that you are able to feed others, he is, and furthermore for himself also there was a moment of fitness.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי ר' שמעון אומר יש נותר שהוא מטמא טומאת אוכלין ויש נותר שאינו מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Shimon says there is leftover that is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food, but there is leftover that is not susceptible to the impurity of food.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A Tanna taught: Rabbi Shimon says, there is leftover that imparts impurity of food and there is leftover that does not impart impurity of food.

hebrew_text: כיצד לן לפני זריקה אינו מטמא טומאת אוכלין לאחר זריקה מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: How so? left overnight before sprinkling to the ritual impurity of food, after sprinkling is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food,
llm_translation: How for us before sprinkling not impure impurity of food after sprinkling impure impurity of food

hebrew_text: (והא) ופיגול בין בקדשי קדשים בין בקדשים קלים אינו מטמא טומאת אוכלין פיגל במנחה מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: And piggul , both in offerings of the most sacred order as well as in offerings of lesser sanctity, the impurity of food. rendered a meal offering piggul , is the impurity of food,
llm_translation: (And) and pigul whether in holy of holies whether in holy items not imparts impurity of food pigul in meal offering imparts impurity of food

hebrew_text: לא קשיא כאן שהיתה לה שעת הכושר כאן שלא היתה לה שעת הכושר
human_translation: not difficult, here, where it had a time it fit There, where it did not have a time fit
llm_translation: It is not difficult here, as she had a moment of fitness; here, as she did not have a moment of fitness.

hebrew_text: היכי דמי דלא היתה לה שעת הכושר דאקדשינהו במחובר
human_translation: What are the circumstances where it did not have a time fit where he consecrated while attached
llm_translation: How is it that it was not the proper time, yet they sanctified it while it was still attached?

hebrew_text: וליפרקינהו הניחא להך לישנא דאמר רבי אושעיא טמאין נפדין טהורין אין נפדין שפיר
human_translation: Let him redeem it This works out well according to this version of Rabbi Oshaya said: Impure are redeemed; pure, are not redeemed. well
llm_translation: And let him (the owner) redeem it (the animal). It is preferable according to that which Rabbi Oshaya said: impure ones are redeemed, pure ones are not redeemed - it is well.

hebrew_text: אלא להך לישנא דאמר אפילו טהורין נפדין לפרקינהו
human_translation: But according to this version of said: Even pure are redeemed, letting him redeem
llm_translation: Rather, according to that which was said, even the pure ones are redeemed for their sake.

hebrew_text: השתא מיהא לא פריק
human_translation: In any event, now he has not redeemed it.
llm_translation: At this time, it is not yet dawn.

hebrew_text: וכיון דאי בעי פריק ליה שמעינן ליה לרבי שמעון דאמר כל העומד לפדות כפדוי דמי
human_translation: Since where if wants, may redeem it, we attribute to Rabbi Shimon that he said any that stands to be redeemed, is as if it is redeemed?
llm_translation: And since if he wants to exempt him, we need to say to Rabbi Shimon who said, "Anyone who stands to redeem is considered as if redeemed."

hebrew_text: דתניא רבי שמעון אומר פרה מטמאה טומאת אוכלין הואיל והיתה לה שעת הכושר ואמר ריש לקיש אומר היה ר' שמעון פרה נפדית על גב מערכתה
human_translation: As it is taught Rabbi Shimon says: heifer, is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food, since it had a time in which it was fit. And Reish Lakish said, Rabbi Shimon would say heifer is redeemed upon its pyre
llm_translation: As it was taught: Rabbi Shimon says, a cow imparts impurity of food, since it had a moment of eligibility. And Reish Lakish said, Rabbi Shimon would say, "The cow was redeemed on account of its value."

hebrew_text: הכי השתא בשלמא פרה עומדת לפדות היא שאם מצא אחרת נאה הימנה מצוה לפדותה אלא הני מנחות מצוה לפדותן
human_translation: How can be compared? Granted, heifer, is stands to be redeemed, since if he found another choicer than it, a mitzva to redeem But a mitzva to redeem these meal offerings?
llm_translation: So now, granted, regarding a cow, it stands to be redeemed, for if one finds another more suitable than it, it is a commandment to redeem it. However, these meal offerings, it is a commandment to redeem them.

hebrew_text: והא לן לפני זריקה דמצוה למיזרקיה ואי בעי זרק וקתני דאין מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: But remained before the sprinkling where there was a mitzva to sprinkle and if he had wanted could have sprinkled And teaches that is not susceptible to the ritual impurity of food,
llm_translation: And this for us before the sprinkling of the blood of the mitzvah to sprinkle it, and if he wants, he may sprinkle, and it is taught that it does not impart impurity of food.

hebrew_text: הכא במאי עסקינן שלא היתה שהות ביום למיזרקיה
human_translation: Here, we are dealing with where there was not time remaining in the day to sprinkle
llm_translation: Here we are dealing with what was the case that she did not have a dwelling during the day to be sprinkled.

hebrew_text: אבל היתה לו שהות ביום מאי מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: But there was time remaining in the day what be susceptible to the ritual impurity of food?
llm_translation: But if he had a temporary residence during the day, what does it render impure with the impurity of food?

hebrew_text: אדתני לן לאחר זריקה מטמא טומאת אוכלין ליפלוג בדידה במה דברים אמורים שלא היתה לו שהות ביום אבל היתה לו שהות ביום מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: rather than teaching left overnight after sprinkling is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food, let him distinguish within itself: In what is this statement said? where there was not time remaining in the day there was time remaining in the day is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food.
llm_translation: We have learned: After the sprinkling, it renders impure with the impurity of food to distinguish by itself. In what case are these words said? That he did not have a dwelling during the day. But if he had a dwelling during the day, it renders impure with the impurity of food.

hebrew_text: הכי נמי קאמר לן קודם שיראה לזריקה אינו מטמא טומאת אוכלין לאחר שיראה לזריקה מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: That is indeed what he is saying left overnight before available for sprinkling, to the ritual impurity of food. after available for sprinkling, is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food.
llm_translation: So too, it is saying to us: before it is seen for sprinkling, it does not impart impurity of food; after it is seen for sprinkling, it imparts impurity of food.

hebrew_text: והא פיגל בין בקדשי קדשים בין בקדשים קלים מצוה למיזרקיה
human_translation: But isn’t renders either offerings of the most sacred order or offerings of lesser sanctity piggul , a mitzva to sprinkle
llm_translation: And this, Pigul, whether in the Holy of Holies or in the lesser sanctified items, it is a mitzvah to sprinkle it.

hebrew_text: ואי בעי זריק וקתני דאינו מטמא טומאת אוכלין מאי לאו דפיגל בזריקה לא דפיגל בשחיטה
human_translation: and if he had wanted, sprinkled teaches that is not susceptible to the ritual impurity of food. What, is it not where rendered piggul during sprinkling? No, where rendered piggul during slaughtering,
llm_translation: And if he desires, he can perform the sprinkling, and it is taught that it does not impart impurity of food. What is it, is it not that it is disqualified through intent during the sprinkling, but it is not disqualified through intent during the slaughtering.

hebrew_text: אבל פיגל בזריקה מאי הכי נמי דמטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: But rendered piggul during the sprinkling, what indeed becomes susceptible to ritual impurity of food?
llm_translation: But regarding Pigul in the case of sprinkling, what is the law? Also, that it imparts impurity of food.

hebrew_text: אדתני פיגל במנחה מטמא טומאת אוכלין ליפלוג בדידה במה דברים אמורים דפיגל בשחיטה אבל פיגל בזריקה מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: rather than teaching rendered the meal offering piggul is ritual impurity of food, let distinguish within itself In what is this statement, said? where rendered piggul during slaughtering, but rendered piggul during sprinkling, is the impurity of food.
llm_translation: We have learned in a Mishnah: If one designates a korban as disqualified (pigul) during the offering of a mincha offering, it imparts ritual impurity of food. This is to distinguish when it comes to pigul in what circumstances it is said: Pigul in the act of slaughter, but pigul in the act of sprinkling imparts ritual impurity of food.

hebrew_text: פיגל במנחה איצטריכא ליה דאף על גב דפיגל בקמיצה דקומץ במנחה כשחיטה דמי אפילו הכי מטמא טומאת אוכלין הואיל והיתה לו שעת הכושר מעיקרו
human_translation: It was necessary for him a meal offering piggul that even though he rendered it piggul at removal of the handful, the removal of the handful of a meal offering is equivalent to the slaughtering even so, is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food, since it initially had a time that was fit for consumption,
llm_translation: "Pigul in a meal-offering requires it, even though pigul in the handful, which is like slaughtering, nevertheless renders it susceptible to the uncleanness of food, since it was fit for its inception."

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי אמריתה לשמעתא קמיה דרב נחמן אפילו תימא לן ממש ואפילו תימא דפיגל בזריקה
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: I related discussion in the presence of Rav Naḥman Even you say actually left overnight and even you say rendered piggul at sprinkling
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: I said before Rav Nachman, even if you say to us explicitly, and even if you say that it is disqualified through the act of casting the blood.

hebrew_text: דאי בעי פריק אמר אי בעי הוה זריק לא אמרינן
human_translation: said if he had wanted, would have redeemed we do not say that if he had wanted, would have sprinkled
llm_translation: If he wants to separate, he said if he wants, he would have thrown, we do not say.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי כלל אמר רבי יהושע כל שהיתה לו שעת היתר לכהנים אין מועלין בה וכל שלא היתה לו שעת היתר לכהנים מועלין בה
human_translation: raises an objection Rabbi Yehoshua states a principle any offering that had a time permitted for by the priests misusing it, and any that did not have a time permitted for by the priests misusing it.
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Yehoshua said a general principle: Anything that had a permitted time for the priests, one does not commit a trespass with it, and anything that did not have a permitted time for the priests, one does commit a trespass with it.

hebrew_text: ואיזהו שעת היתר לכהנים שלנה ושנטמאת ושיצאה
human_translation: And what is a time permitted for by the priests? When, was left overnight; or when became ritually impure; or when left
llm_translation: And which is the time of permissibility for the priests of the watch, when she menstruated and she went out.

hebrew_text: ואיזו היא שלא היתה לו שעת היתר לכהנים שנשחטה חוץ לזמנה וחוץ למקומה ושקבלו פסולין וזרקו את דמה
human_translation: And what is that did not have a time permitted for by the priests? When, was slaughtered, beyond its time or outside its area; or when disqualified collected or sprinkled its blood.
llm_translation: And which is it that did not have its time of permission for the priests, that it was slaughtered outside its time and outside its place, and they received it disqualified, and they threw its blood.

hebrew_text: קתני מיהא רישא שלנה ושנטמאת ושיצאה מאי לאו לנה ממש והכא דאי בעי הוה זריק הוא וקתני דאין מועלין
human_translation: In any event, the first clause teaches that was left overnight, and that became impure, and that left What, is it not actually left overnight, and here is of: If he had wanted, he could have sprinkled teaches that misusing
llm_translation: It was taught in a Baraita: If she was originally pure and became impure, and then she left, what is the case where she is not considered a "Niddah" in actuality? Here, if he wanted, he could have performed a ritual immersion, and it was taught that one does not render something forbidden.

hebrew_text: לא ראויה לצאת וראויה לטמא וראויה ללין
human_translation: No, fit to leave, and fit to become impure, and fit to be left over,
llm_translation: Not fit to go out, fit to become impure, and fit to remain overnight.

hebrew_text: אבל לינה ממש מאי הכי נמי דמועלין האי כל שהיה לו שעת היתר לכהנים וכל שלא היתה לו שעת היתר לכהנים
human_translation: But what actually left overnight? that indeed misusing those Any that had a time permitted for by the priests, and any that did not have a time permitted for by the priests,
llm_translation: But actual lodging, what is the law? Also, because they are considered as having been misappropriated. This applies to anything that had a permitted time for the priests, and anything that did not have a permitted time for the priests.

hebrew_text: כל שיש לו שעת היתר לכהנים אין מועלין בה וכל שאין לה שעת היתר לכהנים מועלין בה מיבעי ליה
human_translation: should have any that has, a time permitted for by the priests, not misusing it. And, any that does not have a time permitted for by the priests, misusing it.
llm_translation: All that has a time of permission for the priests, one does not commit treachery with it, and all that does not have a time of permission for the priests, one commits treachery with it. It is necessary for him.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רב אשי מעילה אטומאה קא רמית
human_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi says: Are you raising a contradiction between misuse ritual impurity?
llm_translation: Rather, Rav Ashi said, "You have raised a question regarding the concept of 'me'ilah' in relation to impurity."

hebrew_text: מעילה משום קדושה ולאו קדושה היא לבתר דפקעה לה קדושתיה במאי הדרא רכבא לה
human_translation: misuse due to the sanctity or lack of sanctity after the sanctity has lapsed, how return be inured in it?
llm_translation: Illegitimate benefit due to sanctity and not sanctity is it, for after it was sanctified to it, with what does one return its sanctity to it.

hebrew_text: טומאה משום אוכלא ולאו (משום) אוכלא היא כל היכא דאי בעי זריק מצי זריק ליה משוי ליה אוכלא ומטמא טומאת אוכלין היכא דאי בעי (מצי) זריק לא מצי זריק לא משוי ליה אוכלא [ולא] מטמא טומאת אוכלין
human_translation: impurity, is due to food or not food. any where if wants sprinkle could sprinkle it, grants food, and is susceptible to the ritual impurity of food. where if wants sprinkle cannot sprinkle it does not grant it food, and is not susceptible to the impurity of food.
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Impurity because of food and not because of food, it is wherever if he wants to sprinkle, he can sprinkle on it, making it food, and it imparts impurity of food. Wherever if he wants to sprinkle, he cannot sprinkle, he cannot make it food, and it does not impart impurity of food.

hebrew_text: מיתיבי המביא אשם תלוי ונודע שלא חטא אם עד שלא נשחט נודע לו יצא וירעה בעדר דברי רבי מאיר וחכמים אומרים
human_translation: raises objection one who brings a provisional guilt offering and it becomes known that he has not sinned, If it became known to him before was slaughtered, should go out and graze in the flock the statement of Rabbi Meir. And the Rabbis say
llm_translation: The Talmudic text: A contradiction was raised: One who brings a suspended guilt-offering, and it becomes known that he did not sin, if it became known to him before it was slaughtered, he should go out and graze with the flock. This is the statement of Rabbi Meir, while the Sages say:

hebrew_text: ירעה עד שיסתאב וימכר ויפלו דמיו לנדבה ר' אליעזר אומר יקריב שאם אינו בא על חטא זה הרי הוא בא על חטא אחר
human_translation: should graze until it becomes blemished, and it is sold, and its money allocated for gift Rabbi Eliezer says: should be sacrificed since if it does not come for this sin, it will come for a different sin,
llm_translation: He shall graze until he becomes fat and is sold, and his proceeds shall be for a donation. Rabbi Eliezer says: He shall bring a sacrifice, for if he does not come for this sin, behold, he comes for another sin.

hebrew_text: משנשחט נודע לו הדם ישפך והבשר ישרף
human_translation: after was slaughtered, it became known to him the blood should be spilled and the meat should be burned
llm_translation: When he slaughters, the blood is known to him, he shall pour it out, and the flesh shall be burned.

hebrew_text: נזרק הדם הבשר יאכל ורבי יוסי אומר אפילו הדם בכוס יזרק והבשר יאכל
human_translation: the blood was sprinkled the meat is eaten And Rabbi Yosei says: Even the blood in the cup, sprinkled and the meat is eaten.
llm_translation: The blood is thrown, the flesh may be eaten, and Rabbi Yosei says even if the blood is thrown into a cup, and the flesh may be eaten.

hebrew_text: ואמר רבא רבי יוסי בשיטת ר' שמעון אמר דאמר כל העומד לזרוק כזרוק דמי
human_translation: And Rava says Rabbi Yosei stated in accordance with the opinion of Rabbi Shimon, who says any that stands to be sprinkled it is as if sprinkled.
llm_translation: And Rava said: Rabbi Yossi in the opinion of Rabbi Shimon said, "One who stands to throw is considered as if he has thrown."

hebrew_text: מידי הוא טעמא אמרי במערבא משמיה דרבי יוסי בר חנינא היינו טעמא דר' יוסי דקסבר כלי שרת מקדשין את הפסולין לכתחילה ליקרב
human_translation: Is that the reason say in the West, in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Ḥanina, that this is the reasoning of Rabbi Yosei: that he holds a service vessel sanctifies disqualified to be sacrificed ab initio ,
llm_translation: The reason they said in the West in the name of Rabbi Yosei bar Hanina, that is the reason of Rabbi Yosei, who holds that disqualified vessels may be used initially to offer sacrifices.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אשי לרב כהנא מדאמר רבי שמעון כל העומד לזרוק כזרוק דמי כל העומד לשרוף נמי כשרוף דמי נותר ופרה אמאי מטמאין טומאת אוכלין עפרא בעלמא נינהו אמר ליה חיבת הקודש מכשרתן
human_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: Since Rabbi Shimon said any that stands to be sprinkled is as if sprinkled, any that stands to be burned is as if burned, why leftover, and the heifer are susceptible to the ritual impurity of food, They are merely dust, said to regard for the sanctity renders them susceptible
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said to Rav Kahana: Since Rabbi Shimon says, "Anyone who stands to throw is like one who has thrown, and anyone who stands to burn is also like one who has burned," why then do the leftover ashes and the cow render impure with the impurity of food? They are merely dust. He said to him: The sanctity of the Holy Temple renders them fit.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבינא לרב אשי נהי דמהניא להו חיבת הקודש לאיפסולי דגופיה ליקרויי טמא נמי למימני ביה ראשון ושני
human_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: Granted that the regard for the sanctity is effective to disqualify the itself also considered impure that counts first- and second-
llm_translation: Ravina said to Rav Ashi: "Although it is beneficial for them, the sanctity of the heave-offering should not be disqualified due to its own deficiency, to be called impure. Also, to count it as the first and second."

hebrew_text: תפשוט דבעי ריש לקיש צריד של מנחות מונין בו ראשון ושני או אין מונין בו ראשון ושני
human_translation: resolve that Reish Lakish raises: a dry portion of meal offerings count first- and second- with it, or not count first- and second- with it?
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Tafshut d'ba'i Reish Lakish, tzarid shel minchot munin bo rishon v'sheni, o ein munin bo rishon v'sheni. English translation: The question that Reish Lakish raised: Do we count the first and second animal in a trap for minchot, or do we not count the first and second animal?

hebrew_text: כי מיבעיא ליה לריש לקיש דאורייתא כי קאמרינן דרבנן:
human_translation: When Reish Lakish raises the dilemma, by Torah law, When we said by rabbinic law,
llm_translation: For Reish Lakish it was necessary, regarding the Torah, as we say concerning the Rabbis:

hebrew_text: מתני׳ האומר הרי עלי במחבת והביא במרחשת במרחשת והביא במחבת מה שהביא הביא וידי חובתו לא יצא
human_translation: one who says: upon me in pan, and he brought in a deep pan in a deep pan, and he brought in pan that he brought, he brought but he has not fulfilled his obligation
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who says, "I undertake to bring a korban minchah," and he brings it in a frying pan, and he brings it in a pot, in a pot, and he brings it in a frying pan, whatever he brought, he brought, and he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: זו להביא במחבת והביא במרחשת במרחשת והביא במחבת הרי זו פסולה
human_translation: This to bring in pan, and he brought in a deep pan in a deep pan, and he brought in pan, this is not valid,
llm_translation: This is to bring in a pan and he brought in a pot, in a pot and he brought in a pan, this is disqualified.

hebrew_text: האומר הרי עלי שני עשרונות להביא בכלי אחד והביא בשני כלים בשני כלים והביא בכלי אחד מה שהביא הביא וידי חובתו לא יצא
human_translation: one who says: upon me to bring two tenths in one vessel, and he brought in two vessels, in two vessels, and he brought in one vessel that he brought, he brought but he has not fulfilled his obligation.
llm_translation: The one who says, "Behold, upon me are twelve dinars to bring in one vessel," and he brought in two vessels, in two vessels, and he brought in one vessel what he brought, he brought, and he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: אלו בכלי אחד והביא בשני כלים בשני כלים והביא בכלי אחד הרי אלו פסולין
human_translation: These in one vessel, and he brought in two vessels, in two vessels, and he brought in one vessel, these are not valid,
llm_translation: These in one vessel and brought in two vessels, in two vessels and brought in one vessel, behold, these are invalid.

hebrew_text: הרי עלי שני עשרונות להביא בכלי אחד והביא בשני כלים אמרו לו בכלי אחד נדרת הקריבן בשני כלים פסולין בכלי אחד כשרין
human_translation: It upon me two tenths in one vessel, and he brought in two vessels, said to him: You vowed in one vessel, he sacrificed in two vessels not valid in one vessel valid,
llm_translation: Behold upon me twelve dinars to bring in one vessel and he brought in two vessels they said to him in one vessel you vowed to bring in two vessels invalid in one vessel valid

hebrew_text: הרי עלי שני עשרונות להביא בשני כלים והביא בכלי אחד אמרו לו בשני כלים נדרת הקריבן בשני כלים כשרין נתנו לכלי אחד כשתי מנחות שנתערבו:
human_translation: It upon me two tenths in two vessels, and he brought in one vessel, said to him: You vowed in two vessels, he sacrificed in two vessels valid. he placed it in one vessel, like two meal offerings that were intermingled
llm_translation: Behold, concerning me twelve dinars to bring in two vessels, and he brought in one vessel. They said to him, "In two vessels you vowed to bring the offering; in two vessels they are valid." They gave to the one vessel like two mixed meal offerings.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ וצריכא דאי
human_translation: And necessary
llm_translation: Gemara: And it is necessary that if

hebrew_text: אשמעינן הך קמייתא משום דאמר במחבת וקא מייתי במרחשת אבל הכא דאידי ואידי במחבת ואידי ואידי במרחשת אימא ידי נדרו נמי יצא
human_translation: because had taught us this first because he said: In pan, and he brought in a deep pan. But here, where both this, and that, in pan, or both this and that in a deep pan, I would say he has indeed fulfilled his vow,
llm_translation: We hear this first case because he said in a pot and he brought it in a pan, but here, where both are in a pot and both are in a pan, say: his hand also fulfilled his vow.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן הך משום דקא פליג להו אבל התם דלא פליג ביה אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And had taught us this because he divided But there, where not divide I would say not necessary
