llm_translation: And if we were to say that, it is because he is arguing with them, but there, where he is not arguing with them, say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן מה שהביא הביא וידי נדרו לא יצא ר' שמעון אומר אף ידי נדרו נמי יצא:
human_translation: The Sages taught that he brought, he brought but he has not fulfilled his vow. Rabbi Shimon says: He has even fulfilled his vow,
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "Whatever one brings, he brings, and if his hands are bound by a vow, he has not fulfilled his obligation." Rabbi Shimon says: "Even if his hands are bound by a vow, he has also fulfilled his obligation."

hebrew_text: זו להביא במחבת: והא תניא לא קידשום כלי שרת אמר אביי לא קידשום ליקרב אבל קידשום ליפסל
human_translation: This to bring in pan, But isn’t it taught the service vessel does not consecrate Abaye says: does not sanctify them with regard to being sacrificed but sanctify them to become disqualified.
llm_translation: This is to bring in a pan: But isn't it taught: They did not sanctify the sacred vessels? Abaye said: They did not sanctify them to offer sacrifices, but they sanctified them to disqualify them.

hebrew_text: ואמר אביי לא שנו
human_translation: And Abaye says taught
llm_translation: And Abaye said: They did not teach.

hebrew_text: אלא שקבען בשעת נדר אבל בשעת הפרשה לא
human_translation: only when he assigned it at the time of the vow. But at the time of the designation not
llm_translation: Rather, he established them at the time of the vow, but not at the time of separation.

hebrew_text: (דברים כג, כד) כאשר נדרת ולא כאשר הפרשת
human_translation: according to what you have vowed and not: According to what you have designated
llm_translation: "As you have vowed and not as you have separated" (Deuteronomy 23:24).

hebrew_text: איתמר נמי אמר רבי אחא בר חנינא אמר רבי אסי אמר רבי יוחנן לא שנו אלא שקבען בשעת נדר אבל בשעת הפרשה לא כאשר נדרת ולא כאשר הפרשת:
human_translation: was also stated Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina says Rabbi Asi says Rabbi Yoḥanan says: taught only he established their at the time of the vow But at the time of the designation not “According to what you have vowed,” and not: According to what you have designated
llm_translation: It was also stated: Rabbi Aḥa bar Ḥanina said in the name of Rabbi Assi who said in the name of Rabbi Yoḥanan: They only taught that one must fulfill them at the time of the vow, but not at the time of separation, neither as you vowed nor as you separated.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ האומר הרי עלי מנחה מן השעורים יביא מן החטים קמח יביא סולת בלא שמן ובלא לבונה יביא שמן ולבונה
human_translation: One who says: upon me a meal offering from barley, should bring from wheat, flour, should bring fine flour, without oil and without frankincense, he should bring oil and frankincense,
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who says, "I am obligated to bring a meal-offering of barley flour," shall bring wheat flour; if he says, "fine flour," he shall bring coarse flour without oil and without frankincense; he shall bring oil and frankincense.

hebrew_text: חצי עשרון יביא עשרון שלם עשרון ומחצה יביא שנים רבי שמעון פוטר שלא התנדב כדרך המתנדבין:
human_translation: half a tenth he should bring a complete tenth a tenth and a half he should bring two Rabbi Shimon deems exempt as he did not pledge in the manner of those who pledge.
llm_translation: Half a shekel shall bring a whole shekel, a shekel and a half shall bring two. Rabbi Shimon exempts one who did not volunteer, like those who volunteer.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמאי נדר ופתחו עמו הוא
human_translation: Why It is a vow and its extenuation together.
llm_translation: Gemara: Why did he make a vow, "and he shall open with him"?

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה הא מני בית שמאי היא דאמרי תפוס לשון ראשון דתנן הריני נזיר מן הגרוגרות ומן הדבילה בית שמאי אומרים נזיר ובית הלל אומרים אינו נזיר
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya said: whose is this It is Beit Shammai, who say: attend the first statement. As we learned I am hereby a nazirite from dried figs and from figs, Beit Shammai say: nazirite, And Beit Hillel say: he is not a nazirite,
llm_translation: Said Hezekiah: This is the opinion of Beit Shammai, for they say: "The first language is binding," as we learned in a Mishnah: "Behold, I am a Nazir from the dried figs and from the pressed figs." Beit Shammai say: "He is a Nazir," and Beit Hillel say: "He is not a Nazir."

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן אמר אפילו תימא בית הלל באומר אילו הייתי יודע שאין נודרין כך לא הייתי נודר כך אלא כך
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan said: You even say Beit Hillel. to says: Had I known that cannot vow this I would not have vowed this but rather that
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even if you say Beit Hillel comes and says, "If I had known that vows are not made in this way, I would not have made a vow in this way, but rather in this way."

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה לא שנו אלא דאמר מנחה מן השעורים אבל אמר מנחה מן העדשים לא
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says taught only where he says: a meal offering from barley, but says: a meal offering from lentils, not
llm_translation: Said Hezekiah: They only taught this regarding if he said a meal-offering of barley, but if he said a meal-offering of lentils, no.

hebrew_text: מכדי חזקיה כמאן אמר לשמעתיה כבית שמאי ובית שמאי משום תפוס לשון ראשון הוא מה לי מן השעורין מה לי מן העדשים הדר ביה
human_translation: Now, Ḥizkiyya said his tradition in accordance with whose in accordance with Beit Shammai’s and Beit Shammai’s due to attend the first statement. what to me from barley from lentils? retracted his
llm_translation: From when did Hezekiah say in whose opinion did he say to his attendants like the House of Shammai, and the House of Shammai because of the first language is it what to me from the barley what to me from the lentils he returned it.

hebrew_text: ומאי טעמא הדר ביה אמר רבא מתניתין קשיתיה מאי איריא דתני מנחה מן השעורים ליתני מן העדשים
human_translation: And what is the reason he retracted Rava said: The mishna a difficulty for him: Why does specifically teach a meal offering from barley? Let it teach from lentils,
llm_translation: And what is the reason that he repeated it? Rava said: I have a difficulty from a Mishnah. What is the relevance that it teaches about a meal-offering from barley, let it teach about a meal-offering from lentils.

hebrew_text: אלא שמע מינה משום דטעי הוא בשעורים טעי בעדשים לא טעי
human_translation: Rather, learn from is because err. With regard to barley, err, with regard to lentils, not err
llm_translation: Rather, infer from this that because he erred in measures, he erred in lentils but did not err in peas.

hebrew_text: ורבי יוחנן אמר אפילו מן העדשים מכדי ר' יוחנן כמאן אמרה לשמעתיה כבית הלל ובית הלל משום דטעי הוא בשעורין טעי בעדשים לא טעי
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: even from lentils, Now, Rabbi Yoḥanan states his tradition in accordance with whose in accordance with Beit Hillel, and Beit Hillel is because err. err with regard to barley with regard to lentils, not err
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Even from lentils, according to Rabbi Yochanan, who did she say it in the name of? In the name of Beit Hillel. And Beit Hillel, because he erred in the measurements, he erred in the lentils, he did not err.

hebrew_text: לדבריו דחזקיה קאמר ליה את מאי טעמא הדרת בך משום דלא קתני מן העדשים
human_translation: to the statement of Ḥizkiyya. What is the reason you retracted because does not teach from lentils,
llm_translation: According to his words, Hezekiah said to him: "You, what is the reason that you have returned to me? Because you did not learn from the lentils."

hebrew_text: דלמא לא מיבעיא קאמר לא מיבעיא מן העדשים דאיכא למימר מהדר הוא דהדר ביה ותפוס לשון ראשון אלא אפילו מן השעורין נמי דאיכא למימר מיטעא הוא דקא טעי אפילו הכי תפוס לשון ראשון
human_translation: Perhaps is speaking It is not necessary. It is not necessary from lentils, because one has to say retracted and attend the initial statement But even from barley, where one has to say he made an error, nevertheless, Attend the first statement.
llm_translation: Perhaps it is not necessary, he is saying, it is not necessary from the lentils, for one can say: "He returns and repents." And the original language is also applicable even from the barley, for one can say: "He made a mistake." Even so, the original language is still applicable.

hebrew_text: אמר זעירי לא שנו אלא דאמר מנחה אבל לא אמר מנחה לא
human_translation: Ze’eiri said: taught only where he said Meal offering [ minḥa ], But not say meal offering not
llm_translation: Za'iri said: They only taught that he said "mincha," but he did not say "mincha."

hebrew_text: יתיב רב נחמן וקאמר לה להא שמעתא איתיביה רבא לרב נחמן קמח יביא סולת לאו דלא אמר מנחה לא דאמר מנחה
human_translation: Rav Naḥman was sitting and reciting this halakha Rava raised an objection to Rav Naḥman flour, should bring fine flour. Is it not where he did not say: a meal offering, No, where he said: a meal offering
llm_translation: Rav Nachman was sitting and saying to her this teaching. Rava raised an objection to Rav Nachman: "Flour should be brought, not that he did not say 'meal-offering,' but that he said 'meal-offering.'"

hebrew_text: בלא שמן ולבונה יביא שמן ולבונה מאי לאו דלא אמר מנחה לא דאמר מנחה
human_translation: without oil and frankincense, he shall bring oil and frankincense. What, is it not where he did not say meal offering No, where he said: a meal offering
llm_translation: Without oil and frankincense, one should bring oil and frankincense. What is it? Is it not that he did not say "meal offering" because he said "meal offering"?

hebrew_text: חצי עשרון יביא עשרון שלם מאי לאו דלא אמר מנחה לא דאמר מנחה
human_translation: half a tenth he should bring a complete tenth What, is it not where he did not say meal offering No, where he said: a meal offering
llm_translation: Half a shekel should bring a whole shekel. What, is it not that he said "mincha"? No, he said "mincha."

hebrew_text: אי הכי אימא סיפא עשרון ומחצה יביא שנים כיון דאמר מנחה איחייב ליה בעשרון כי אמר חצי עשרון לא כלום קאמר הוא
human_translation: If so say the last clause: a tenth and a half he should bring two Once he said meal offering, he is obligated in a tenth when he states Half a tenth, he is not saying anything,
llm_translation: If so, say the latter part: "A tenth and a half he shall bring two." Since it says "a meal offering," he is obligated in a tenth. When it says "half a tenth," it is saying nothing.

hebrew_text: לא צריכא דאמר הרי עלי מנחה חצי עשרון ועשרון דכיון דאמר מנחה איחייב ליה בעשרון כי אמר חצי עשרון ולא כלום קאמר כי הדר אמר עשרון מייתי עשרון אחרינא
human_translation: No, necessary where he said: It upon me a meal offering of half a tenth and a tenth. Since he said meal offering, he is obligated in a tenth When he said: Half a tenth, he is saying nothing, When he then said tenth, brings another tenth,
llm_translation: Not necessary, as he said, "Behold, upon me is a meal offering, half a tenth and a tenth." Since he said "meal offering," he is obligated in a tenth. When he said "half a tenth," he said nothing. When he subsequently said "tenth," he brings another tenth.

hebrew_text: אי הכי רבי שמעון פוטר שלא התנדב כדרך המתנדבין אמאי אמר רבא ר' שמעון בשיטת ר' יוסי אמרה דאמר [אף] בגמר דבריו אדם מתפיס:
human_translation: If so, Rabbi Shimon deems exempt as he did not pledge in the manner of those who pledge, why Rava said Rabbi Shimon stated according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, who said the conclusion of a person’s statement is also accepted.
llm_translation: If so, Rabbi Shimon exempts one who did not volunteer, like those who volunteer, why? Rava said: Rabbi Shimon, according to the opinion of Rabbi Yosei, said: Even in the finality of his words, a person is held accountable.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ מתנדב אדם מנחה של ששים עשרון ומביא בכלי אחד (אם אמר הרי עלי ששים עשרון מביא בכלי אחד) אם אמר הרי עלי שישים ואחד מביא ששים בכלי אחד ואחד בכלי אחד שכן הציבור מביא ביום טוב הראשון של חג שחל להיות בשבת ששים ואחד
human_translation: A person pledge a meal offering of sixty tenths and bring in one vessel. If he says: It upon me sixty tenths he brings it in one vessel. If he says: It upon me sixty-one he brings sixty in one vessel and one in another vessel, as the community brings on the first festival day of Sukkot when occurs on Shabbat, sixty-one
llm_translation: Mishnah: If a person volunteers a meal offering of sixty sela and brings it in one vessel (if he said, "Behold, upon me is sixty sela," he brings it in one vessel), if he said, "Behold, upon me is sixty-one," he brings sixty in one vessel and one in one vessel, for so the public brings on the first day of the festival that falls on Shabbat, sixty-one.

hebrew_text: דיו ליחיד שהוא פחות מן הציבור אחד
human_translation: is sufficient for an individual that one less than the community.
llm_translation: Ink for an individual who is less than the public one

hebrew_text: אמר ר' שמעון והלא אלו לפרים ואלו לכבשים ואינם נבללים זה עם זה אלא עד ששים יכולין ליבלל
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon says: Aren’t these for bulls and those for lambs, and they are not mixed with each other Rather, up to sixty be mixed
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Shimon: "But aren't these offerings for cattle and these for sheep, and they do not mix with each other until sixty are offered?"

hebrew_text: אמרו לו ששים נבללין וששים ואחד אין נבללין אמר להם כל מדות חכמים כן בארבעים סאה הוא טובל ובארבעים סאה חסר קרטוב אינו יכול לטבול בהן:
human_translation: said to him: sixty can be mixed but sixty-one cannot be mixed? said to them: All the measures of the Sages so: in forty se’a one immerses and in forty se’a less a kortov , one cannot immerse in it
llm_translation: They said to him: sixty mixed and sixty-one not mixed. He said to them: all the measures of the sages are the same, with forty se'ahs he immerses, and with forty se'ahs lacking a kav, he cannot immerse in them.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ שאיל שאילה למעלה מרבי יהודה בר אילעאי מנין לאומר הרי עלי ששים ואחד מביא ששים בכלי אחד ואחד בכלי אחד
human_translation: asked a question above, Rabbi Yehuda bar Elai: From where that who says: It upon me sixty-one brings sixty in one vessel and one in another vessel?
llm_translation: Gemara: A question was asked above regarding Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai: From where do we derive that one may say, "Behold, upon me are sixty-one," and bring sixty-one items, each in one vessel?

hebrew_text: פתח רבי יהודה בר אילעאי ראש המדברים בכל מקום ואמר שכן מצינו ציבור מביאין ביום טוב הראשון של חג שחל להיות בשבת ששים ואחד דיו ליחיד שיפחות מן הציבור אחד
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Elai, the first speaker on every occasion, began and said: Since we find the community brings on the first festival day of Sukkot when occurs on Shabbat, sixty-one is sufficient for an individual that one less than the community.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yehuda bar Ilai began: The head of the matters in every place, and he said, "So we find: The community brings on the first day of the festival, which falls on Shabbat, sixty-one inkwells for the individual to use, less than one from the community."

hebrew_text: אמר לו ר' שמעון והלא אלו פרים ואילים ואלו כבשים אלו בלילתן עבה ואלו בלילתן רכה אלו בלילתן שחרית ואלו בלילתן בין הערבים ואין נבללין מזה על זה
human_translation: Rabbi Shimon said to him: Aren’t these bulls and those lambs? these, a thick mixture, and those, a thin mixture, the mixture these in the morning, and the mixture those afternoon, they are not mixed with one another?
llm_translation: He said to him, Rabbi Shimon, but these are bulls and rams, and these are sheep, these with thick wool, and these with soft wool, these with morning wool, and these with evening wool, and they do not intermingle with one another.

hebrew_text: אמרו לו אמור אתה אמר להם הרי הוא אומר (ויקרא ז, י) וכל מנחה בלולה בשמן וחרבה כבר אמרה תורה הבא מנחה שיכולה להיבלל
human_translation: said to him: You state said to them: It says “And every meal offering, mixed with oil, or dry, The Torah has already stated Bring a meal offering that is capable of being mixed.
llm_translation: They said to him: Say it. He said to them: Behold, it says (Leviticus 7:10), "And every meal offering, mixed with oil and dry." But the Torah has already said, a meal offering that can become mixed.

hebrew_text: אמר לו בששים נבללין בששים ואחד אין נבללין אמר לו כל מדת חכמים כן הוא בארבעים סאה הוא טובל בארבעים סאה חסר קרטוב אינו יכול לטבול
human_translation: said to him: of sixty be mixed and of sixty-one cannot be mixed? said to All the measures of the Sages are so: In forty se’a one immerses in forty se’a less a kortov , one cannot immerse
llm_translation: He said to him, with sixty measures they are mixed, with sixty-one measures they are not mixed. He said to him, every measure of the sages is like this: with forty se'ah it is immersed, with forty se'ah lacking a kav it cannot be immersed.

hebrew_text: כביצה מטמא טומאת אוכלין כביצה חסר שומשום אין מטמא טומאת אוכלין שלשה על שלשה מטמא מדרס שלשה על שלשה חסר נימא אחת אינו מטמא מדרס
human_translation: an egg-bulk transmits the ritual impurity of food, an egg-bulk less a sesame does not transmit impurity of food. three by three is susceptible to ritual impurity treading three by three less one thread, is not susceptible to ritual impurity treading.
llm_translation: Like an egg, it imparts impurity of food; like an egg lacking sesame, it does not impart impurity of food. Three by three imparts impurity of a bed; three by three lacking a thread imparts no impurity of a bed.

hebrew_text: וכי אין נבללין מאי הוי והא תנן אם לא בלל כשר אמר רבי זירא כל הראוי לבילה אין בילה מעכבת בו וכל שאינו ראוי לבילה בילה מעכבת בו
human_translation: if do not mix what of it? But didn’t we learn if he did not mix valid? Rabbi Zeira says: any that suitable for mixing mixing does not invalidate And any that not suitable for mixing mixing invalidates
llm_translation: And when it is not mixed, what is the ruling? But didn't we learn: "If it was not mixed properly, it is still valid"? Rabbi Zeira said: Anything fit for mixing, mixing does not prevent it, and anything not fit for mixing, mixing prevents it.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי ביבי אמר רבי יהושע בן לוי מעשה בפרדה אחת של בית רבי שמתה ושיערו חכמים את דמה ברביעית
human_translation: Rabbi Beivai says Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi says: an incident involving a mule to the house of Rabbi that died, and the Sages estimated its blood as a quarter-
llm_translation: Rabbi Bevai said, Rabbi Yehoshua ben Levi said: There was an incident with one cow belonging to the household of Rabbi that died, and the sages estimated its value at a quarter of its original worth.

hebrew_text: מתיב רבי יצחק בר ביסנא העיד רבי יהושע ורבי יהושע בן בתירא על דם נבילות שהוא טהור ואמר רבי יהושע בן בתירא מעשה והיו נוחרין ערודיאות לאריות באיסטריא של מלך והיו עולי רגלים שוקעין עד רכובותיהן בדם ולא אמרו להם דבר
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak bar Bisna raises an objection: Rabbi Yehoshua and Rabbi Yehoshua ben Beteira testified concerning the blood of carcasses that it is ritually pure. Rabbi Yehoshua ben Beteira said: An incident were killing wild donkeys to the lions in the king’s stadium [ be’istarya ], and ascending to Jerusalem on the pilgrimage festival were wading up to their knees [ rekhuboteihen ] in blood, and did not say anything to them
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: Rebbe Yitzchak bar Bisna raised an objection: Rebbe Yehoshua and Rebbe Yehoshua ben Beteira testified regarding the blood of carcasses that it is pure. And Rebbe Yehoshua ben Beteira said: It was an incident that they were sharpening harrows for lions in the royal stable of Istria, and the footprints were sinking up to their ankles in blood, yet they did not say anything to them.

hebrew_text: אישתיק אמר ליה ר' זריקא מאי טעמא לא קא מהדר מר אמר ליה היכי אהדר ליה דאמר רבי חנין (דברים כח, סו) והיו חייך תלואים לך מנגד זה הלוקח תבואה משנה לשנה
human_translation: was silent Rabbi Zerika said to him: What is the reason the Master does not respond said to him: How can I respond to him? as Rabbi Ḥanin said “And your life shall hang in doubt before you”; this who purchases grain from one year for the next,
llm_translation: The man remained silent. Rabbi Zerika said to him, "What is the reason that the master does not respond?" He said to him, "How should I respond to him, for Rabbi Chanin said, 'And your life shall hang in doubt before you; you shall fear day and night, and you shall have no assurance of your life' (Deuteronomy 28:66), opposite one who buys produce year after year."

hebrew_text: ופחדת לילה ויומם זה הלוקח תבואה מערב שבת לערב שבת ואל תאמן בחייך זה הסומך על הפלטר
human_translation: “And you shall fear night and day”; this who purchases grain Shabbat eve to another “And you shall have no assurance of your life”; this who relies on the baker [ hapalter ]
llm_translation: And fear night and day, this is one who takes produce from Friday evening to Friday evening, and do not rely on your life, this is one who relies on the flatterer.

hebrew_text: וההוא גברא על פלטר סמיך
human_translation: And that man, relies on a baker.
llm_translation: And that man on the Platter close by.

hebrew_text: מאי הוי עלה אמר רב יוסף רבי יהודה מוריינא דבי נשיאה הוה ואורי ליה כשמעתיה
human_translation: What was about Rav Yosef said: Rabbi Yehuda was the halakhic decisor of the house of the Nasi , and he instructed according to his tradition
llm_translation: "What is the meaning of 'hoi alah'?" Rav Yosef said, "Rabbi Yehuda, the teacher of the house of the Nasi, was there, and I illuminated it for him as I heard it."

hebrew_text: דתנן רבי יהודה אומר ששה דברים מקולי בית שמאי ומחומרי בית הלל דם נבילות בית שמאי מטהרין ובית הלל מטמאין אמר רבי יוסי בר' יהודה אף כשטמאו בית הלל לא טמאו אלא ברביעית הואיל ויכול לקרוש ולעמוד על כזית:
human_translation: As we learned Rabbi Yehuda says six matters are among the leniencies of Beit Shammai and among the stringencies of Beit Hillel. the blood of a carcass, Beit Shammai deem ritually pure, and Beit Hillel deem ritually impure. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehuda, said: Even when Beit Hillel deemed impure, they deemed impure only in a quarter- since to congeal, could constitute an olive-bulk,
llm_translation: As we learned in a Mishnah: Rabbi Yehudah says, six matters are lenient according to Beit Shammai and stringent according to Beit Hillel. Regarding the blood of a carcass, Beit Shammai declares it pure, while Beit Hillel declares it impure. Rabbi Yosei, son of Rabbi Yehudah, said: Even when Beit Hillel declared it impure, they only did so after a quarter of the blood was spilled, since it is possible to squeeze out and stand on an olive's bulk.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ אין מתנדבין לוג שנים וחמשה אבל מתנדבין שלשה וארבעה וששה ומששה ולמעלה:
human_translation: One does not pledge log , two or five But one pledges three or four or six And six and beyond,
llm_translation: Mishnah: One does not pledge a log of two and five, but pledges three, four, six, and six and above.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ איבעיא להו יש קבע לנסכים או אין קבע לנסכים
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before Is there a fixed for libations, or is there no fixed for libations,
llm_translation: Gemara: It was asked of them: Is there a fixed measure for libations, or is there no fixed measure for libations?

hebrew_text: היכי דמי כגון דאייתי חמשה אי אמרת אין קבע לנסכים משיך ומקריב ארבעה מינייהו דחזי לאיל ואידך הוי נדבה ואי אמרת יש קבע לנסכים עד דממלי להו לא קרבי
human_translation: What are the circumstances? where he brought five If you say there is no fixed for libations, he removes and offers four of them, as are suitable for a ram, and the other is gift if you say there is a fixed for libations is not offered until he adds to
llm_translation: How is it similar? For example, if one brings five, if you say there is no fixed amount for libations, he pours and offers four of them, which is seen as a ram, and the other one is a voluntary offering. But if you say there is a fixed amount for libations, until they are full, do not offer.

hebrew_text: מאי אמר אביי תא שמע ששה לנדבה ואמרינן כנגד מי כנגד מותר חטאת ומותר אשמות ומותר אשם נזיר ומותר אשם מצורע ומותר קינין ומותר מנחת חוטא
human_translation: What Abaye said: Come hear six for gift and we say: For what designated? for left over sin offerings, left over the guilt offerings, left over the guilt offering of a nazirite, left over guilt offering of a leper, left over pairs left over meal offering of a sinner.
llm_translation: Abbaye said: Come and hear, six are for voluntary offerings, and we say: Corresponding to what? Corresponding to the leftover sin-offerings, and leftover guilt-offerings, and leftover guilt-offering of a Nazirite, and leftover guilt-offering of a leper, and leftover bird-offerings, and leftover meal-offering of a sinner.

hebrew_text: ואם איתא ליתקין שופר אחרינא כנגד מותר נסכים
human_translation: And if it is so let them institute an additional horn left over of libations.
llm_translation: And if it comes, another shofar is not valid against the remaining libations.

hebrew_text: הנך לנדבת צבור אזלי הני שכיחי אפשר דמצטרפי דמר ודמר בהדי הדדי וקרבי
human_translation: These go to communal gift offerings, these are common, possible of this person be combined with person together and is offered
llm_translation: These for communal offering go, these common ones, perhaps they combine, master and master together, and offer.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא תא שמע (במדבר טו, יג) אזרח מלמד שמתנדבין נסכים וכמה שלשת לוגין
human_translation: Rava said: Come hear home born “home born” teaches that one may pledge libations And how much Three log ,
llm_translation: Rava said: Come and hear (Numbers 15:13) "citizen" teaches that they may volunteer libations, and how much? Three logs.

hebrew_text: ומנין שאם רצה להוסיף יוסיף תלמוד לומר יהיה יכול יפחות תלמוד לאמר ככה
human_translation: And from where that if one desires to add he may add? The verse states shall be Can decrease The verse states: in this manner”
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that if one wishes to add, he may add? The Talmud teaches to say, "It shall be," indicating that he may add, but not subtract, the Talmud says, "thus."

hebrew_text: מאי יוסיף אילימא ארבעה וששה מאי שנא שלשה דחזו לכבש ארבעה וששה נמי חזו לאיל ופר אלא לאו חמשה ושמע מינה אין קבע לנסכים שמע מינה
human_translation: What one may add If we say four or six what is different three because it is suitable for a lamb. four or six also suitable, for a ram and a bull. Rather, isn’t five And learn from there is no fixed for libations. learn from
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "additional"? If you say four and six, what is the difference? Three saw a lamb, four and six also saw a ram and a bull. Rather, is it not five? And infer from it that there is no fixed measure for libations. Infer from it.

hebrew_text: אמר רב אשי והא אנן לא תנן הכי אין מתנדבין לוג שנים וחמשה קתני חמשה דומיא דשנים מה שנים דלא חזו כלל אף חמשה נמי דלא חזו כלל
human_translation: Rav Ashi said: But didn’t we learn this One does not pledge log , two or five teaches five similar of two Just as two are not suitable at all so too, five also not suitable at all
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: But did we not teach thus: One does not vow to give a log of oil for two and five logs? It was taught: Five logs are similar to two logs, just as two logs that were never seen at all, so too five logs that were never seen at all.

hebrew_text: מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא
human_translation: Are the cases comparable? This, as it is, and that, as it is,
llm_translation: From the Talmudic text: "מידי איריא הא כדאיתא והא כדאיתא" Translation: "Some say this way, and some say that way."

hebrew_text: אמר אביי אם תמצא לומר אין קבע לנסכים הא אין קבע לנסכים אם תמצא לומר יש קבע לנסכים עד עשרה פשיטא לי אחד עשר
human_translation: Abaye said: If you say there is no fixed for libations, then there is no fixed for libations, If you say there is a fixed for libations, up to ten obvious to me. eleven
llm_translation: Abbaye said: If you find to say, "There is no fixed measure for libations," behold, there is no fixed measure for libations. If you find to say, "There is a fixed measure for libations up to ten," it is obvious to me that there is a fixed measure up to eleven.

hebrew_text: מיבעיא לי מאי גברא לשני פרים קא מכוין ועד דממלי להו לא קרבי או דלמא לשני אילים וכבש אחד קמכווין תרי מחד מינא וחד מחד מינא אמרינן או לא מאי תיקו:
human_translation: I ask, what the man intend of two bulls, and until he accumulates that is not brought? Or perhaps he intends with two rams and one lamb, Do we say two with one type, and one with another type, or not? What shall stand
llm_translation: The matter is inquired: What is the status of a man who intends for two bulls, and until they are filled, they do not come close? Or perhaps he intends for two rams and one sheep, two of one kind and one of another kind? We say: Or not. What is the resolution?

hebrew_text: מתני׳ מתנדבין יין ואין מתנדבין שמן דברי רבי עקיבא רבי טרפון אומר מתנדבין שמן
human_translation: One may pledge wine, but one may not pledge oil the statement of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Tarfon says: One may pledge oil
llm_translation: Mishnah: One may donate wine, but one may not donate oil. These are the words of Rabbi Akiva. Rabbi Tarfon says: One may donate oil.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי טרפון מה מצינו ביין שהוא בא חובה ובא נדבה אף שמן שהוא בא חובה בא נדבה אמר לו רבי עקיבא לא אם אמרת ביין שכן קרב עם חובתו בפני עצמו תאמר בשמן שאינו קרב עם חובתו בפני עצמו
human_translation: Rabbi Tarfon said: Just as we found that wine comes an obligation and comes a gift offering so too, that oil comes an obligation and comes a gift Rabbi Akiva said to him: No, if you said with regard to wine, as sacrificed with its obligatory by itself, shall you say with regard to oil, which is never sacrificed with its obligatory by itself but only
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Tarfon: "Just as we find with wine that it can come as an obligation or as a voluntary offering, so too with oil, which can come as an obligation or as a voluntary offering." Rabbi Akiva said to him: "No, if you say that wine, which is brought with its obligation by itself, you should say the same for oil, which is not brought with its obligation by itself."

hebrew_text: אין שנים מתנדבין עשרון אחד אבל מתנדבין עולה ושלמים ועוף אפילו פרידה אחת:
human_translation: Two do not pledge a tenth but they may pledge a burnt offering and a peace offering. And an individual bird,
llm_translation: Two do not contribute one tithe, but they contribute a burnt offering, peace offerings, and bird offerings, even a single dove.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רבא מדברי שניהם נלמוד מתנדב אדם מנחת נסכים בכל יום
human_translation: Rava said: From the statements of both of them, we learn a person may pledge a meal offering with the libations
llm_translation: Gemara: Rava said, from the words of both of them it is learned that a person may voluntarily bring a meal-offering of libations every day.

hebrew_text: פשיטא מהו דתימא מנחת נדבה גלי בה רחמנא הני חמשה מנחות אין טפי לא קא משמע לן הני מילי בסתמא אבל היכא דפריש פריש:
human_translation: obvious? lest you say the Merciful One revealed a voluntary meal offering those five meal offerings indeed additional not. teaches us these matters where unspecified, but where he specified he has specified,
llm_translation: It is obvious. What is the reasoning? "Minchat Nedavah" - the Merciful One revealed in it. These five offerings, no more, are not implied to us. These matters are in general. But where it is specified, it is specified.

hebrew_text: אין שנים מתנדבין: מאי טעמא אילימא משום דכתיב (ויקרא ב, א) תקריב עולה נמי הא כתיב (ויקרא א, ב) יקריב
human_translation: two do not pledge What is the reason? If we say because it is written: brings a burnt offering as well, it is written brings
llm_translation: Two do not volunteer: What is the reason? If you say because it is written (Leviticus 2:1) "he shall offer an offering," it is also written (Leviticus 1:2) "he shall offer."

hebrew_text: אלא עולה מאי טעמא דכתיב (במדבר כט, לט) לעולותיכם מנחה נמי הא כתיב (במדבר כט, לט) למנחותיכם אלא משום דכתיב בה (ויקרא ב, א) נפש
human_translation: Rather, what is the reason a burnt offering that it is written your burnt offerings [ le’oloteikhem ], a meal offering, also written “Your meal offerings [ leminḥoteikhem ].” Rather, because it is written: an individual
llm_translation: Rather, "Olah." What is the reason it is written (Numbers 29:39), "for your burnt offerings"? Also, it is written (Numbers 29:39), "for your meal offerings." Rather, because it is written within it (Leviticus 2:1), "a soul."

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי רבי אומר (ויקרא כב, יח) אשר יקריב קרבנו לכל נדריהם ולכל נדבותם אשר יקריבו לה' הכל באין בשותפות לא סילק הכתוב אלא מנחה שנאמר נפש
human_translation: This is also taught Rabbi states that brings his offering, whether it be any of their vows, or any of their free-will offerings that they sacrifice to the Lord” any be brought in a partnership, and the verse excludes only a meal offering as it is stated: an individual
llm_translation: It was also taught: Rabbi says (Leviticus 22:18), "Which they shall offer unto the Lord for all their vows, and for all their freewill-offerings, which they shall offer unto the Lord." All come in partnership, the verse did not exclude anything except for a meal-offering, as it is said, "a soul."

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יצחק מפני מה נשתנית מנחה שנאמר בה נפש אמר הקדוש ברוך הוא מי דרכו להביא מנחה עני מעלה אני עליו כאילו הקריב נפשו לפני
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: For what is the meal offering different that “an individual [ nefesh ]” is stated with regard to it? The Holy One, Blessed be He, said: Whose practice to bring a meal offering? poor I will ascribe him as if he offered up his soul [ nafsho ] in front of Me.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak: Why is the Mincha offering different, as it is stated regarding it, "a soul"? The Holy One, blessed be He, said: Whoever is accustomed to bringing a poor Mincha offering, I consider it as if he has offered his soul before Me.

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יצחק מה נשתנית מנחה שנאמר בה חמשה מיני טיגון הללו משל למלך בשר ודם שעשה לו אוהבו סעודה ויודע בו שהוא עני אמר לו עשה לי מן חמשה מיני טיגון כדי שאהנה ממך:
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak says: What is meal offering is differentiated that stated these five types of preparations with oil a parable of a flesh-and-blood king whose friend made a festive meal for him, but knows that is poor. said to him: Make for me from five types of fried so that I may benefit from you.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak: How is a Mincha offering different, as it is stated regarding it "these five types of frying"? This can be compared to a king of flesh and blood who made a feast for his beloved, knowing that he is poor. He said to him, "Prepare for me from these five types of frying so that I may derive pleasure from you."

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך פרק המנחות והנסכים
llm_translation: We will return to you, Tractate Menachot and Libations.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הרי עלי עשרון יביא אחד עשרונות יביא שנים פירשתי ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא ששים עשרון
human_translation: It upon me a tenth must bring one tenths he must bring two I specified but I do not know which I specified, he must bring sixty-tenths,
llm_translation: Mishnah: "If one says, 'I undertake to bring a shekel,' he should bring one shekel. If he says, 'two shekels,' and I do not know what I meant by 'two shekels,' he should bring sixty shekels."

hebrew_text: הרי עלי מנחה יביא איזו שירצה רבי יהודה אומר יביא מנחת הסולת שהיא מיוחדת שבמנחות
human_translation: It upon me a meal offering, he may bring whichever that he wishes, Rabbi Yehuda says: He must bring the fine-flour meal offering, as it is the notable of the meal offerings.
llm_translation: Behold, regarding a meal-offering, one shall bring whichever one desires. Rabbi Yehuda says: one shall bring the meal-offering of fine flour, which is unique among meal-offerings.

hebrew_text: מנחה או מין המנחה יביא אחת מנחות או מין מנחות יביא שתים פירשתי ואיני יודע איזה מהן פירשתי יביא חמשתן
human_translation: a meal offering, or: a type of meal offering, he must bring one meal offerings, or: meal offerings of type, he must bring two. I specified but I do not know which I specified, he must bring all five
llm_translation: Mincha or type of mincha shall bring one mincha or type of mincha shall bring two I have explained and I do not know which of them I have explained shall bring five.

hebrew_text: פירשתי מנחה של עשרונים ואיני יודע כמה פירשתי יביא ששים עשרון רבי אומר יביא מנחות של עשרונות מאחד ועד ששים:
human_translation: I specified a meal offering of tenths but I do not know how many I specified, he must bring sixty-tenths Rabbi says: he brings meal offerings of tenths from one to sixty
llm_translation: I have set aside a mincha offering of tenths and I do not know how much I have set aside. He shall bring sixty tenths. Rabbi says: He shall bring mincha offerings of tenths from one to sixty.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ פשיטא עשרונות יביא שתים איצטריכא ליה הא נמי פשיטא מיעוט עשרונות שתים איצטריכא ליה:
human_translation: obvious? was necessary tenths bring two this also obvious? It was necessary minimum tenths two
llm_translation: Gemara: It is obvious. If one brings ten coins, he should bring two. This is also obvious. The exclusion of ten coins requires two.

hebrew_text: פירשתי ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא ששים עשרון: מאן תנא
human_translation: I specified but I do not know what I specified, he must bring sixty-tenths. Who taught
llm_translation: I have explained, yet I do not know what I have explained. Let him bring sixty sela. Who is the Tanna?

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה דלא כרבי דאי רבי האמר יביא מנחות של עשרונות מאחד ועד ששים
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya said: not in accordance with Rabbi As if Rabbi didn’t he say must bring meal offerings of tenths from one to sixty
llm_translation: Said Hezekiah: Not like Rabbi, for if Rabbi said, "Let him bring meal-offerings of tenths from one to sixty."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אביי לרבא לרבנן דאמרי מותר לערב חובה בנדבה הא בעינן שני קמצים דקמיץ והדר קמיץ
human_translation: Abaye said to Rava: According to the Rabbis, who say it is permitted to mix an obligation with a gift Don’t we require two handfuls, that removes a handful and again removes a handful.
llm_translation: Abbaye said to Rava: The Rabbis who say it is permitted to combine a mandatory offering with a voluntary offering, we require two handfuls: one handful taken and then another handful taken.

hebrew_text: והא קא קמיץ מחובה אנדבה ומנדבה אחובה
human_translation: But isn’t he removing a handful from an obligation for a gift and from a gift for an obligation?
llm_translation: And behold, he is gathering from obligation as a voluntary offering, and from a voluntary offering as an obligation.

hebrew_text: דתלי ליה בדעת כהן דאמר כל היכא דמטיא ידא דכהן השתא חובה ולבסוף נדבה
human_translation: as renders it dependent on the intent of the priest, as he says: Wherever the priest’s hand reaches now, obligation, and at the end, a gift
llm_translation: It depends on the opinion of the priest who says, "Wherever the hand of a priest reaches, now it is obligatory, and in the end, it is voluntary."

hebrew_text: ואקטורי היכי מקטר ליקטר נדבה ברישא דחובה היכי מקטר לה דלמא כולה חובה היא וחסרו להו שירים
human_translation: But how does burn will burn gift first, how can he burn of the obligation? Perhaps the entire is obligation, and the remainder to be lacking.
llm_translation: And how does one offer incense to offer a voluntary offering at the outset as an obligation? Perhaps it is all an obligation, and they lack songs.

hebrew_text: ואמר מר שירים שחסרו בין קמיצה להקטרה אין מקטיר קומץ עליהן
human_translation: And the Master said: remainder that became lacking between the removal of the handful and the burning one does not burn the handful on its
llm_translation: And Mar said: "Songs that are missing between the handful and the burning, one does not burn a handful on them."

hebrew_text: ליקטר חובה ברישא דנדבה היכי מקטר לה
human_translation: will burn obligation first, how can he burn of the gift
llm_translation: To burn incense is obligatory at the outset of a voluntary offering, how does one burn it?

hebrew_text: ודלמא כולה חובה היא וכל שהוא ממנו לאישים הרי הוא בבל תקטירו
human_translation: But perhaps the entire is obligation. And Whatever is partly in the fire is subject to You may not make as an offering
llm_translation: And perhaps it is all an obligation, and anything from it to men, behold, it is "You shall not offer strange incense" (Exodus 30:9).

hebrew_text: אמר ר' יהודה בריה דרבי שמעון בן פזי דמסיק להו לשום עצים וכרבי אליעזר דתניא רבי אליעזר אומר (ויקרא ב, יב) לריח ניחוח אי אתה מעלה אבל אתה מעלה לשום עצים
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, said: burns it for the sake of wood, in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer. As it is taught Rabbi Eliezer says: you may not offer up as a pleasing aroma, But you may offer up for the sake of wood,
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yehudah, son of Rabbi Shimon ben Pazi, who was cutting wood for them, like Rabbi Eliezer who taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer says (Leviticus 2:12), "For a pleasing aroma." You do not bring up the wood for its own sake, but you do bring up the wood for the sake of the wood.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב אחא בריה דרבא לרב אשי ודלמא דכולי עלמא מותר לערב חובה בנדבה והכא בדרבי אליעזר קא מיפלגי דרבנן אית להו דרבי אליעזר ורבי לית ליה דרבי אליעזר
human_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: But perhaps everyone agrees it is permitted to mix an obligation with a gift and here disagree with regard to of Rabbi Eliezer As the Rabbis accept of Rabbi Eliezer, and Rabbi does not accept of Rabbi Eliezer.
llm_translation: Rav Aḥa, son of Rava, said to Rav Ashi: "But perhaps everyone agrees that it is permitted to mix obligations with voluntary offerings, and here, in the case of Rabbi Eliezer, the Rabbis are in disagreement. They have Rabbi Eliezer, but Rabbi does not have Rabbi Eliezer."

hebrew_text: אמר ליה אי סלקא דעתך לרבי מותר לערב חובה בנדבה ודרבי אליעזר לית ליה אפשר דמייתי שיתין בחד מנא וחד בחד מנא ומגע להו וקמיץ
human_translation: said to him: if it enters your mind according to Rabbi it is permitted to mix an obligation with a gift and he does not accept of Rabbi Eliezer, one could bring sixty- in one vessel, and one in one vessel, And touch them, and remove a handful
llm_translation: He said to him, "If it is according to your opinion, according to Rabbi it is permissible to combine an obligation with a voluntary offering. And according to Rabbi Eliezer, it is not permissible. Perhaps it is comparable to two who come with one mina and one with two minas, and they touch each other and combine."

hebrew_text: רבא אמר דכולי עלמא מותר לערב חובה בנדבה ודכולי עלמא אית להו דרבי אליעזר והכא בפלוגתא דרבי אליעזר בן יעקב ורבנן קא מיפלגי
human_translation: Rava said Everyone agrees it is permitted to mix an obligation with a gift and everyone accepts of Rabbi Eliezer. And here they disagree with regard to the dispute between Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Rava said: "Everyone agrees that it is permissible to combine an obligation with a voluntary offering." And everyone agrees that they have the opinion of Rabbi Eliezer. And here they are in a dispute between Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: דתנן אפילו מנחה של שישים עשרון נותן לה שישים לוג רבי אליעזר בן יעקב אומר אפילו מנחה של ששים עשרון אין לה אלא לוגה שנאמר (ויקרא יד, כא) למנחה ולוג שמן
human_translation: As we learned even a meal offering of sixty-tenths one adds to it sixty log Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: even a meal offering of sixty-tenths only its log as it is stated for a meal offering, and a log of oil”
llm_translation: We learned in a Mishnah: Even for a meal-offering of sixty sela, one gives it sixty log. Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Even for a meal-offering of sixty sela, it only has one log, as it is stated (Leviticus 14:21): "for a meal-offering and a log of oil."

hebrew_text: רבנן סברי [כרבנן] דאמרי שישים לוג וכל חד וחד עשרון לוגה קא שקיל
human_translation: The Rabbis hold in accordance with the Rabbis, who said: sixty log and each and every one-tenth takes log .
llm_translation: The sages hold like the opinion of Rabbanan who say sixty log and each and every one a tenth of a log is taken.

hebrew_text: ורבי סבר כר' אליעזר בן יעקב דאמר אין לה אלא לוגה ולא ידעינן אי חדא מנחה היא דסגי לה בחד לוג אי שתי מנחות נינהו דבעינן שני לוגין
human_translation: And Rabbi holds in accordance with Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov, who said has only its log And we do not know whether is one meal offering, that one log suffices for it, whether they are two meal offerings, which require two log
llm_translation: And Rabbi holds like Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov who said: She only has a Log, and we do not know if it is one Mincha that suffices with one Log, or if they are two Minchot that require two Logs.

hebrew_text: רב אשי אמר בקטן והביא גדול קמיפלגי רבנן סברי קטן והביא גדול יצא ורבי סבר לא יצא
human_translation: Rav Ashi said They disagree with regard to a small and brings a large The Rabbis hold a small and brings a large he has fulfilled and Rabbi holds he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Rav Ashi said: With regard to a minor who brought an offering and then became an adult, the Rabbis disagree. Some Rabbis hold that if a minor brought an offering and then became an adult, he fulfills his obligation, while Rabbi holds that he does not fulfill his obligation.

hebrew_text: והא איפלגו בה חדא זמנא דתנן קטן והביא גדול יצא רבי אומר לא יצא
human_translation: But didn’t they disagree about this once? As we learned a small and he brought a large he has fulfilled Rabbi says: He has not fulfilled
llm_translation: And behold, they disagreed about it one time as we learned in the Mishnah: "If a minor brought the offering and an adult brought it, he has fulfilled his obligation." Rabbi says: "He has not fulfilled his obligation."

hebrew_text: צריכא דאי איתמר בהא בהא קא אמרי רבנן משום דאידי ואידי קומץ הוא אבל התם דקא נפישי אימורין אימא מודו ליה לרבי
human_translation: necessary as had been stated with regard to this in this the Rabbis say because this and that it is a handful. But there, since the sacrificial portions are greater, say concede to Rabbi
llm_translation: It is necessary, for if it was stated in this case and in that case, the Rabbis said, because both this and that are a handful. But there, where the statements are strong, say to Rabbi, let them agree.

hebrew_text: ואי איתמר בההיא בההיא קאמר רבי אבל בהא אימא מודי להו לרבנן צריכא
human_translation: And had been stated in that in that Rabbi says But in this say concedes to the Rabbis. necessary
llm_translation: And if it was stated in that case, in that case, Rabbi said, but in this case, say to them, the Rabbis require.

hebrew_text: (סימן עצי"ם זה"ב יי"ן עול"ה תוד"ה שו"ר):
human_translation: a mnemonic Wood, gold, wine, burnt offering, thanks offering, bull.
llm_translation: Tractate: (Siman Etzim Zayin Bet Yud Yud Aleph Ayin Vav Lamed Heh Tav Vav Dalet Heh Shin Vav Resh)

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הרי עלי עצים לא יפחות משני גזירין לבונה לא יפחות מקומץ
human_translation: It upon me wood must no fewer than two logs. frankincense, must no less than a handful.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One may not blow the fire with less than two chips, nor kindle with less than a handful.

hebrew_text: חמשה קמצים הם האומר עלי לבונה לא יפחות מקומץ המנדב מנחה יביא עמה קומץ לבונה המעלה את הקומץ בחוץ חייב שני בזיכין טעונין שני קמצים
human_translation: There are five handfuls. One who says: upon me frankincense, may not less than a handful. One who pledges a meal offering must bring with it a handful of frankincense. One who offers up a handful outside liable two bowls required two handfuls
llm_translation: Five handfuls are: One who says "Regarding frankincense, I will donate no less than a handful." One who donates a meal offering must bring with it a handful of frankincense. One who brings the handful outside is liable for two penalties, requiring two handfuls.

hebrew_text: הרי עלי זהב לא יפחות מדינר זהב כסף לא יפחות מדינר כסף נחשת לא יפחות ממעה כסף פירשתי ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יהא מביא עד שיאמר לא לכך נתכוונתי:
human_translation: It upon me gold must no less than a gold dinar. silver must no less than a silver dinar. copper must no less than a silver ma’a . I specified but I do not know what I specified, must bring until where he says: I did not intend to that
llm_translation: Behold, regarding gold, not less than a dinar of gold; regarding silver, not less than a dinar of silver; regarding copper, not less than a ma'ah of silver. I have explained, yet I do not know what I have explained. Let him bring proof until he says "no." This is what I intended.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן (ויקרא ב, א) קרבן מלמד שמתנדבין עצים וכמה שני גזירין וכן הוא אומר (נחמיה י, לה) והגורלות הפלנו על קרבן העצים רבי אומר עצים קרבן הם טעונין מלח וטעונין הגשה
human_translation: the Sages taught ” korban teaches that one can voluntarily give wood And how much Two logs. And as states: “And we cast lots for the wood offering” Rabbi says: wood is an offering and requires salt and requires bringing
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught (Leviticus 2:1), "Offering" - this teaches that one may donate wood. And how many bundles? And so it says (Nehemiah 10:35), "And the lots we cast for the wood offering." Rabbi says: Wood is an offering, requiring salt and requiring offering.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא ולדברי רבי עצים טעונין קמיצה אמר רב פפא לדברי רבי עצים צריכין עצים:
human_translation: Rava says: According to the statement of Rabbi wood requires removal of a handful; And Rav Pappa says according to the statement of Rabbi wood needs wood
llm_translation: Rava said, "And according to the words of Rabbi, wood requires an olive's bulk." Rav Pappa said, "According to the words of Rabbi, wood requires wood."

hebrew_text: לבונה לא יפחות מן הקומץ: מנלן דכתיב (ויקרא ו, ח) והרים ממנו בקומצו מסלת המנחה ומשמנה ואת כל הלבונה מקיש לבונה להרמה דמנחה מה הרמה דמנחה קומץ אף לבונה נמי קומץ:
human_translation: frankincense, may not less than a handful. From where do we as it is written: “And he shall take up from it his handful, of the fine flour of the meal offering, and of its oil, and all the frankincense juxtaposes frankincense with the taking up of the meal offering. just as taking up from a meal offering a handful, so too, a frankincense also a handful.
llm_translation: The frankincense should not be less than the handful. From where do we derive this? As it is written (Leviticus 6:8), "And he shall lift from it his handful of the fine flour of the meal offering, and of its oil, and all the frankincense on the meal offering." It equates frankincense to lifting, just as lifting of the meal offering is a handful, so too frankincense is also a handful.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן הרי עלי למזבח יביא לבונה שאין לך דבר שקרב לגבי מזבח אלא לבונה פירשתי ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא מכל דבר שקרב למזבח
human_translation: The Sages taught It upon me to the altar, must bring frankincense, as you have nothing that is sacrificed on the altar other than frankincense. I specified but I do not know what I specified, must bring of everything that is sacrificed on the altar.
llm_translation: The Sages taught: "One who vows to bring upon the altar, shall bring frankincense, for there is nothing that is brought near the altar except for frankincense. I have explained, and I do not know what I have explained; let him bring from anything that is brought near the altar."

hebrew_text: ותו ליכא והא איכא עולה איכא עורה לכהנים
human_translation: And is there nothing else But isn’t there a burnt offering, there is its hide, to the priests
llm_translation: And there is no "and there is," but there is an elevation, there is a skin for the priests.

hebrew_text: והא איכא עולת העוף איכא
human_translation: But isn’t there a bird burnt offering, There are
llm_translation: And there is a burnt offering of a bird, there is.

hebrew_text: מוראה ונוצה
human_translation: the crop and feathers,
llm_translation: Fear and trembling.

hebrew_text: והאיכא נסכים לשיתין אזלי
human_translation: But aren’t there libations, goes to the drainpipes.
llm_translation: And there are libations to pour out.

hebrew_text: והאיכא מנחת נסכים כיון דאיכא מנחה דאכלי כהנים מינה לא פסיקא ליה:
human_translation: But isn’t there a meal offering libations, since there are a meal offering from which the priests eat, is not a clear his
llm_translation: And there is a meal offering, since there is a meal offering that the priests eat from, it does not interrupt for him.

hebrew_text: הרי עלי זהב לא יפחות מדינר זהב: ודלמא נסכא אמר ר' אלעזר דאמר מטבע ודלמא פריטי אמר רב פפא פריטי דדהבא לא עבדי אינשי:
human_translation: It upon me gold must no less than a gold dinar. But perhaps piece [ naskha ] Rabbi Elazar said: where he said coin. But perhaps perutot . Rav Pappa said: People do not make perutot of gold.
llm_translation: Behold, regarding gold, not less than a dinar of gold. And perhaps it is referring to a coin, as Rabbi Elazar said, for he said "coin." And perhaps it is referring to pieces, as Rav Pappa said, people do not make pieces of gold.

hebrew_text: כסף לא יפחות מדינר: ודלמא נסכא אמר ר' אלעזר דאמר מטבע ודלמא פריטי אמר רב ששת באתרא דלא סגו פריטי דכספא:
human_translation: silver must no less than dinar. But perhaps piece Rabbi Elazar said: where he said coin. But perhaps perutot . Rav Pappa said: with regard to a place where silver perutot do not circulate.
llm_translation: Silver not less than a dinar: And perhaps it is a libation offering, Rabbi Elazar said, for he said currency, and perhaps it is small coins, Rav Sheshet said in a place where small coins of silver are not common.

hebrew_text: נחושת לא יפחות ממעה כסף: תניא רבי אליעזר בן יעקב אומר לא יפחות מצינורא קטנה של נחשת למאי חזיא אמר אביי שמחטטין בה פתילות ומקנחין בה נרות:
human_translation: copper must no less than a silver ma’a . It is taught Rabbi Eliezer ben Ya’akov says: He must no less than a small copper hook. For what is suitable Abaye said: They scrape wicks with it and clean lamps with it.
llm_translation: Copper not less than its value in silver. It was taught in a Baraita: Rabbi Eliezer ben Yaakov says: Not less than a small pipe of copper. What is it fit for? Abaye said: They use it to thread wicks and anoint lamps.

hebrew_text: ברזל תניא אחרים אומרים לא יפחות מכליה עורב וכמה אמר רב יוסף אמה על אמה
human_translation: iron? It is taught others say: must no less than eliminate the ravens [ mikkalya orev ]. And how much Rav Yosef said: cubit by cubit
llm_translation: Iron, it was taught: Others say, not less than its vessel, a raven. And how much? Rav Yosef said, a cubit by a cubit.

hebrew_text: איכא דאמרי לא יפחות מאמה על אמה למאי חזיא אמר רב יוסף לכליה עורב:
human_translation: There are who say must no less than cubit by cubit For what is suitable? Rav Yosef said: for eliminate the ravens.
llm_translation: There are those who say: "Not less than an amah by an amah." What is it for? Rav Yosef said: For its handle.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הרי עלי יין לא יפחות משלשה לוגין שמן לא יפחות מלוג רבי אומר שלשה לוגין
human_translation: It upon me wine, must no less than three log , oil, must no less than a log , Rabbi says: three log ,
llm_translation: Mishnah: Behold, regarding wine, not less than three log. Oil, not less than a log. Rabbi says: three log.

hebrew_text: פירשתי ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא כיום מרובה:
human_translation: I specified but I do not know what I specified, must bring equivalent to day largest
llm_translation: I have explained, and I do not know what I have explained; let Abaye bring a great day.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ תנו רבנן (במדבר טו, יג) אזרח מלמד שמתנדבין יין וכמה שלשה לוגין
human_translation: “native born” teaches that one may pledge libations And how much Three log ,
llm_translation: Gemara: The Rabbis taught (Numbers 15:13), "citizen" - this teaches that they may volunteer wine, and how much? Three log.

hebrew_text: ומנין שאם רצה להוסיף יוסיף תלמוד לומר יהיה יכול יפחות תלמוד לומר ככה:
human_translation: And from where that if one desires to add he may add The verse states shall be might decrease the verse states: in this manner”
llm_translation: And from where do we derive that if one wishes to add, he may add? The Talmud teaches to say "shall be," could it not have said "less"?

hebrew_text: שמן לא יפחות מן הלוג רבי אומר שלשה לוגין: במאי קא מיפלגי
human_translation: oil, he must no less than a log , Rabbi says: three log . With regard to what disagree?
llm_translation: Oil not less than a log. Rabbi says three logs: What are they arguing about?

hebrew_text: אמרוה רבנן קמיה דרב פפא בדון מינה ומינה בדון מינה ואוקים באתרה קא מיפלגי
human_translation: The Sages said before Rav Pappa: disagree with regard to infer from it, and from it, Infer from it but interpret to its place,
llm_translation: The sages said before Rav Papa: in judging one case and another case, in judging one case, and establishing it in its place, they disagree.

hebrew_text: רבנן סברי דון מינה ומינה מה מנחה מתנדבין אף שמן נמי מתנדבין ומינה מה מנחה בלוג אף שמן בלוג
human_translation: The Rabbis hold Infer from it, and from it. Just as a meal offering is contributed, so too oil is contributed, And from Just as a meal offering a log so too here, a log of oil.
llm_translation: The sages hold: Just as a Mincha offering can be voluntary, so too oil can be voluntary. And just as a Mincha offering is a Log, so too oil is a Log.

hebrew_text: ורבי סבר דון מינה ואוקי באתרה מה מנחה מתנדבין אף שמן נמי מתנדבין ואוקי באתרה כנסכים מה נסכים שלשת לוגין אף שמן נמי שלשת לוגין
human_translation: And Rabbi holds infer from it but interpret to its place: Just as a meal offering is contributed, so too oil is contributed. But interpret to its place, like libations, Just as libations three log , so too oil, three log .
llm_translation: Rabbi holds: judgment from it and also in its place. Just as a voluntary meal offering, so too oil is also voluntary, and also in its place libations. Just as libations are three log, so too oil is three log.

hebrew_text: אמר להו רב פפא אי ממנחה גמר לה רבי דכולי עלמא לא פליגי דון מינה ומינה אלא רבי מאזרח גמיר לה
human_translation: Rav Pappa said to If Rabbi derived from meal offering, as everyone Infer from it, and from it. Rather, Rabbi derives from native born
llm_translation: Rav Papa said to them: If Rabbi has completed the Mincha offering, everyone agrees that they do not argue regarding this matter, but rather Rabbi has completed it.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רב הונא בריה דרב נתן לרב פפא ומי מצית אמרת הכי והתניא קרבן מלמד שמתנדבין שמן וכמה שלשת לוגין מאן שמעת ליה דאמר שלשת לוגין רבי וקא מייתי לה מקרבן אמר ליה אי תניא תניא:
human_translation: Rav Huna, son of Rav Natan, said to Rav Pappa: And how can you say that But isn’t it taught [ korban minḥa ]” teaches that one may contribute oil. And how much Three log . Who did you hear that says three log ? This is Rabbi and cites from korban , said to him: If is taught, it is taught,
llm_translation: Rav Huna said to Rav Pappa, "And did you really say so? But isn't it taught in a Baraita that a sacrifice indicates that they donate oil, and how much? Three log. Who did you hear say that three log is the amount? Rabbi, and he brings it from the sacrifice." He said to him, "If it is taught, it is taught."

hebrew_text: פירשתי ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא כיום מרובה: תנא כיום טוב הראשון של חג שחל להיות בשבת:
human_translation: I specified but I do not know what I specified, must bring equivalent to day largest taught: equivalent to the first day of the Festival, when it occurs on Shabbat.
llm_translation: I have explained, yet I do not know what I have explained. Let him bring a large day as today. It was taught: Like the first good day of the festival that happens to be on Shabbat.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הרי עלי עולה יביא כבש ר' אלעזר בן עזריה אומר או תור או בן יונה
human_translation: It upon me a burnt offering, must bring a lamb, Rabbi Elazar ben Azarya says: either a dove or a pigeon,
llm_translation: Mishnah: "If one says, 'I am obligated to bring a burnt offering,' he shall bring a male lamb. Rabbi Eliezer ben Azariah says: 'Or a turtledove or a young dove.'"

hebrew_text: פירשתי מן הבקר ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא פר ועגל מן הבהמה ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא פר ועגל איל שעיר גדי וטלה פירשתי ואיני יודע מה פירשתי
human_translation: I specified from the herd, but I do not know what I specified, must bring a bull and a male calf, from the animals but I do not know what I specified, must bring a bull and a male calf, a ram, a large male goat, a small male goat, and a male lamb. I specified but I do not know what I specified,
llm_translation: I explained from the morning, and I do not know what I explained. He shall bring a bull and a calf from the herd, and I do not know what I explained. He shall bring a bull and a calf, ram, he-goat, kid, and lamb. I explained, and I do not know what I explained.

hebrew_text: מוסיף עליהן תור ובן יונה
human_translation: adds a dove and a pigeon
llm_translation: Adding to them, "Tor" and "Ben Yonah."

hebrew_text: הרי עלי תודה ושלמים יביא כבש פירשתי מן בקר ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא פר ופרה עגל ועגלה מן הבהמה ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא פר ופרה עגל ועגלה איל ורחלה שעיר ושעירה גדי וגדייה טלה וטלייה
human_translation: It upon me a thanks offering and a peace offering, must bring a lamb, and I specified from the herd but I do not know what I specified, must bring a bull and a cow, a male calf and a female calf. from the animals, but I do not know what I specified, must bring a bull and a cow, a male calf and a female calf, a ram and a ewe, a large, male goat and a large female goat, a small, male goat and a small female goat, a male lamb and a female lamb.
llm_translation: Behold, upon me is a thanksgiving offering and peace offerings. I vowed to bring a lamb, I separated it from a cow, and I do not know what I separated. Should I bring a bull and a cow, a calf and a heifer from the cattle, and I do not know what I separated? Should I bring a bull and a cow, a calf and a heifer, a ram and a ewe, a he-goat and a she-goat, a kid and a young goat, a lamb and a young sheep.

hebrew_text: הרי עלי שור יביא הוא ונסכיו במנה עגל יביא הוא ונסכיו בחמש איל יביא הוא ונסכיו בשתים כבש יביא הוא ונסכיו בסלע
human_translation: It upon me a bull must bring and its libations, with one hundred dinars. a calf, must bring and its libations, with five a ram, must bring and its libations, with two a lamb, must bring and its libations, with sela ,
llm_translation: Behold, concerning a bull, he shall bring it and its libations in a mina; concerning a calf, he shall bring it and its libations in five; concerning a ram, he shall bring it and its libations in two; concerning a lamb, he shall bring it and its libations in a hin.

hebrew_text: שור במנה יביא במנה חוץ מנסכיו עגל בחמש יביא בחמש חוץ מנסכיו איל בשתים יביא בשתים חוץ מנסכיו כבש בסלע יביא בסלע חוץ מנסכיו
human_translation: a bull with one hundred dinars must bring with one hundred dinars excluding its libations. upon me a calf with five must bring with five excluding its libations. upon me a ram with two must bring with two excluding its libations. upon me a lamb with sela must bring with sela excluding its libations.
llm_translation: A bull in a mina shall be brought in a mina, except for its libations. A calf in five shall be brought in five, except for its libations. A ram in two shall be brought in two, except for its libations. A lamb in a sela shall be brought in a sela, except for its libations.

hebrew_text: שור במנה והביא שנים במנה לא יצא ואפילו זה במנה חסר דינר וזה במנה חסר דינר
human_translation: a bull with one hundred dinars and he brought two with one hundred dinars, has not fulfilled And even this of one hundred dinars less one dinar and that of one hundred dinars less one dinar.
llm_translation: Ox in a mina and he brought two in a mina, he did not fulfill, and even this in a mina lacking a dinar, and this in a mina lacking a dinar.

hebrew_text: שחור והביא לבן לבן והביא שחור גדול והביא קטן לא יצא קטן והביא גדול יצא רבי אומר לא יצא:
human_translation: a black and he brought a white a white and he brought a black a large and he brought a small he has not fulfilled a small and he brought a large he has fulfilled Rabbi says: He has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Black and brought white, white and brought black, big and brought small, not went out small and brought big went out. Rabbi says not went out.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ ולא פליגי מר כי אתריה ומר כי אתריה:
human_translation: And they do not disagree Sage in accordance with his locale, and Sage in accordance with his locale.
llm_translation: Gemara: And they do not argue, one master in his place and another master in his place.

hebrew_text: תנו רבנן הרי עלי עולה בסלע למזבח יביא כבש שאין לך דבר שקרב בסלע לגבי מזבח אלא כבש שקרב בסלע פירשתי ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא מכל דבר שקרב בסלע לגבי מזבח:
human_translation: The Sages taught It upon me a burnt offering with sela for the altar, must bring a lamb; as you have no that is sacrificed on the altar of sela but a lamb. I specified that is sacrificed of sela , but I do not know what I specified, must bring of every that is sacrificed on the altar of sela .
llm_translation: The Rabbis taught: "If one vows to bring a burnt offering on the rock towards the altar, he shall bring a lamb. For there is nothing that is offered on the rock in relation to the altar except a lamb." I have explained, but I do not know what I have explained. He shall bring from any offering that is brought on the rock in relation to the altar.

hebrew_text: פירשתי מן הבקר ואיני יודע מה פירשתי יביא פר ועגל: אמאי וליתי פר ממה נפשך
human_translation: I specified from the herd, but I do not know what I specified, he must bring a bull and a calf. Why? Let him bring a bull, whichever you
llm_translation: I have explained from the morning, and I do not know what I have explained. Let him bring a bull and a calf. Why not bring a bull? What is the reason for your soul?

hebrew_text: הא מני רבי היא דאמר קטן והביא גדול לא יצא
human_translation: whose is this? It is Rabbi who said a small and he brought a large he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: This is the statement of Rabbi: If a minor brought an adult, he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: אי רבי אימא סיפא שור במנה והביא שנים במנה לא יצא ואפילו זה במנה חסר דינר וזה במנה חסר דינר
human_translation: If Rabbi say the latter clause a bull with one hundred dinars, and he brought two with one hundred dinars, has not fulfilled and even this of one hundred dinars less one dinar and that of one hundred dinars less one dinar.
llm_translation: If Rabbi says, say the latter part: An ox in a Maneh, and he brought two in a Maneh, he has not fulfilled his obligation. And even if this one is lacking a Dinar in the Maneh, and that one is lacking a Dinar in the Maneh.

hebrew_text: שחור והביא לבן לבן והביא שחור גדול והביא קטן לא יצא קטן והביא גדול יצא רבי אומר לא יצא
human_translation: a black and he brought a white a white and he brought a black a large and he brought a small he has not fulfilled a small and he brought a large he has fulfilled Rabbi says: He has not fulfilled
llm_translation: Black and brought white, white and brought black, big and brought small, not left, small and brought big, left, Rabbi says not left.

hebrew_text: רישא וסיפא רבי ומציעתא רבנן
human_translation: the first clause and the last clause Rabbi and the middle clause the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The beginning and the end, Rabbi and the suggestion of the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: אין רישא וסיפא רבי מציעתא רבנן והכי קאמר דבר זה מחלוקת רבי ורבנן:
human_translation: Yes, the first clause and the last clause Rabbi the middle clause the Rabbis. And this is saying: This matter, is a dispute Rabbi and the Rabbis.
llm_translation: The beginning and the end, Rabbi Metzayta Rabbanan, and thus it is stated: This matter is a dispute between Rabbi and the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: תנן התם ששה לנדבה כנגד מי (סימן קמ"ף ש"ע)
human_translation: We learned there six for gift To what correspond? a mnemonic Kuf , mem , peh , shin , ayin .
llm_translation: We have learned there: "Six for a voluntary offering, corresponding to water." (Siman 140, Se'if 1)

hebrew_text: אמר חזקיה כנגד ששה בתי אבות הכהנים שתקנו להם חכמים שיהא שלום זה עם זה
human_translation: Ḥizkiyya says: corresponded to six patrilineal families of priests which the Sages installed for them so that there would be peace between one another
llm_translation: Said Hezekiah: Corresponding to the six ancestral houses of the priests that the sages established for them, that there should be peace among them.

hebrew_text: ר' יוחנן אמר מתוך שהנדבה מרובה תיקנו להם שופרות מרובין כדי שלא יתעפשו המעות
human_translation: Rabbi Yoḥanan says: Since the gift plentiful, installed many horns for them, so that the coins would not decay.
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: Since the donations are abundant, they established for them many shofars so that the coins will not become moldy.

hebrew_text: וזעירי אמר כנגד פר ועגל איל וכבש גדי ושעיר ורבי היא דאמר קטן והביא גדול לא יצא
human_translation: And Ze’eiri says: correspond to A bull, a calf, a ram, a lamb, a small goat, and a large goat. And is Rabbi who says a small and he brought a large he has not fulfilled
llm_translation: And Zeiri said: Corresponding to a bull, a calf, a ram, and a lamb, a kid and a goat. And Rabbi Hyya said: If one said "small" and brought something large, he has not fulfilled his obligation.

hebrew_text: ובר פדא אמר כנגד הפרים והאילים
human_translation: And bar Padda says: correspond to the bulls And the rams
llm_translation: And Bar Pada said: Corresponding to the bulls and rams.

hebrew_text: והכבשים והשעירים והמותרות והמעה
human_translation: And the lambs And the goats And the surplus And the ma’a
llm_translation: And the kevasim (lambs) and the se'irim (goats) and the motarot (surplus offerings) and the me'ah (one hundredth).

hebrew_text: כולהו כחזקיה לא אמרי לאנצויי לא חיישינן דכל חד וחד יומיה קא עביד
human_translation: All of do not say in accordance with Ḥizkiyya as we are not concerned about quarreling as each and every serves on its day
llm_translation: All of them like Hezekiah did not say to the envoys we are not concerned that each and every day he is doing.

hebrew_text: כר' יוחנן לא אמרי לאיעפושי לא חיישינן
human_translation: do not say in accordance with Rabbi Yoḥanan we are not concerned that decay.
llm_translation: As Rabbi Yochanan said: We are not concerned about the Ia'pushi.

hebrew_text: כזעירי לא אמרי כיחידאה לא מוקמי
human_translation: do not say in accordance with Ze’eiri we do not interpret in accordance with an individual
llm_translation: Like small ones not say like individual not established.

hebrew_text: כבר פדא נמי לא אמרי מותרות כולהו נמי מותרות
human_translation: also do not say in accordance with bar Padda the surplus all of also surplus,
llm_translation: Already, it has been redeemed. Also, they did not say "permissible." All of them are also permissible.

hebrew_text: מעה נמי לשקלים אזלא דתניא להיכן קלבון זה הולך לשקלים דברי ר' מאיר ר' אליעזר אומר לנדבה
human_translation: also ma’a , goes toward shekels, as it is taught Where would this premium [ kalbon ] go, to the shekels the statement of Rabbi Meir. Rabbi Eliezer says: for gift
llm_translation: A stomach also goes to shekels, as it was taught: "To where does this offering go? To shekels." These are the words of Rabbi Meir; Rabbi Eliezer says: "As a donation."

hebrew_text: ושמואל אמר כנגד מותר חטאת ומותר אשם ומותר אשם נזיר ומותר אשם מצורע ומותר מנחת חוטא ומותר עשירית האיפה של כהן גדול
human_translation: And Shmuel says: correspond to surplus a sin offering; and surplus a guilt offering; and surplus a nazirite’s guilt offering, and surplus a leper’s guilt offering, and surplus a meal offering of a sinner; surplus the tenth of an ephah by the High Priest
llm_translation: And Samuel said: Corresponding to the leftover of the sin-offering, and leftover of the guilt-offering, and leftover of the guilt-offering of a Nazirite, and leftover of the guilt-offering of a leper, and leftover of the sin-offering, and leftover of the tenth of an ephah of the High Priest.

hebrew_text: ור' אושעיא אמר כנגד מותר חטאת ומותר אשם ומותר אשם נזיר ומותר אשם מצורע ומותר קינין ומותר מנחת חוטא
human_translation: And Rabbi Oshaya says correspond to surplus a sin offering; and surplus a guilt offering; and surplus a nazirite’s guilt offering; and surplus a leper’s guilt offering; and surplus pairs and surplus a meal offering of a sinner.
llm_translation: And Rabbi Oshaya said: Corresponding to the permitted sin-offering, and permitted guilt-offering, and permitted guilt-offering of a Nazirite, and permitted guilt-offering of a leper, and permitted bird-offering, and permitted meal-offering of a sinner.

hebrew_text: ושמואל מאי טעמא לא אמר כרבי אושעיא קינין תנא ליה רישא
human_translation: And what is the reason Shmuel does not say in accordance with Rabbi Oshaya pairs taught the first clause
llm_translation: And Samuel, what is the reason he did not say like Rabbi Oshaya? Kinin taught him the first part.

hebrew_text: ור' אושעיא תני ולא תני קינין והתני רבי אושעיא ותני קינין חד לקינין וחד למותר קינין
human_translation: And does Rabbi Oshaya teach without teaching pairs But doesn’t Rabbi Oshaya teach teaching pairs one for pairs and one for the surplus pairs
llm_translation: And Rabbi Oshaya taught and did not teach Kinin, and it was taught by Rabbi Oshaya and taught Kinin, one for Kinin and one for permissible Kinin.

hebrew_text: ורבי אושעיא מאי טעמא לא אמר כשמואל סבר לה כמאן דאמר מותר של עשירית האיפה של כהן גדול ירקב דתניא מותר מנחת נדבה מותר מנחה ירקב
human_translation: And what is the reason Rabbi Oshaya does not say in accordance with Shmuel? he holds like the one who says surplus the tenth of an ephah of the High Priest rot; as it is taught The surplus the meal offering of gift The surplus a meal offering rot.
llm_translation: Rabbi Oshaya: What is the reason that he did not say like Shmuel? He holds according to the one who says it is permitted. The ephah of the High Priest will rot, as it is taught: It is permitted to burn a voluntary meal-offering, it is permitted to burn a meal-offering that will rot.

hebrew_text: מאי קאמר אמר רב חסדא הכי קאמר מותר מנחת חוטא נדבה מותר עשירית האיפה של כהן גדול ירקב
human_translation: What is saying? Rav Ḥisda said this is saying: The surplus a meal offering of a sinner gift The surplus the tenth of an ephah of the High Priest rot.
llm_translation: What is Rav Ḥisda saying? This is what he is saying: Permitted is the meal offering of a sin-offering, permitted is the tithe of the ephah of the High Priest, it will rot.

hebrew_text: רבה אמר אפי' מותר עשירית האיפה של כהן גדול נמי נדבה אלא מותר לחמי תודה ירקב
human_translation: Rabba said: Even the surplus the tenth of an ephah of the High Priest also gift Rather, the surplus the loaves a thanks offering to rot.
llm_translation: Rabah said: Even the permitted one-tenth of the ephah of the High Priest is also considered a voluntary offering. Rather, it is permitted for the loaves of thanksgiving to become moldy.

hebrew_text: בפלוגתא מותר עשירית האיפה של כהן גדול רבי יוחנן אמר נדבה רבי אלעזר אמר ירקב
human_translation: in the dispute the surplus the tenth of an ephah of the High Priest, Rabbi Yoḥanan says gift Rabbi Elazar says to rot.
llm_translation: In the dispute, permitted a tenth of an ephah of the High Priest. Rabbi Yochanan said "voluntary offering," Rabbi Elazar said "mildew."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי מותר שקלים חולין ומותר עשירית האיפה ומותר קיני זבין וקיני זבות וקיני יולדות וחטאות ואשמות מותריהן נדבה
human_translation: raises an objection The surplus shekels are non-sacred but the surplus the tenth of an ephah and the surplus the pairs of zavim , the pairs of zavot , the pairs of women after childbirth, and sin offerings, and guilt offerings, the surplus gift
llm_translation: The scholars raised an objection: Permitted are ordinary shekels, and permitted is a tithe of the ephah, and permitted are the birds for purification from leprosy, and the birds for purification from leprosy for women who have given birth, and sin-offerings, and guilt-offerings - their permissibility is voluntary.

hebrew_text: מאי לאו מותר עשירית האיפה של כהן גדול
human_translation: What Is it not the surplus the High Priest’s tenth of an ephah
llm_translation: What is the meaning of "Lo Matir Asirit HaEifah Shel Kohen Gadol"?

hebrew_text: לא מותר מנחת חוטא
human_translation: No, the surplus the meal offering of a sinner,
llm_translation: Not permitted offering of a sinner

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן בר רב יצחק מסתברא כמאן דאמר מותר עשירית האיפה של כהן גדול ירקב
human_translation: Rav Naḥman bar Rav Yitzḥak said: It is reasonable the one who said: The surplus the tenth of an ephah of the High Priest rot.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman bar Rav Yitzchak said: It is logical like the one who said, "The tithe of the ephah of the High Priest will decay."

hebrew_text: דתניא (ויקרא ה, יא) לא ישים עליה שמן ולא יתן עליה לבונה כי חטאת היא אמר רבי יהודה היא קרויה חטאת ואין אחרת קרויה חטאת לימד על עשירית האיפה של כהן גדול שאינה קרויה חטאת וטעונה לבונה
human_translation: As it is taught he shall put no oil upon it, nor shall he put any frankincense upon it, for it is a sin offering” Rabbi Yehuda said It is called a sin offering, and no other is called a sin offering. taught that with regard to the tenth of an ephah of the High Priest, it is not called a sin offering, and requires frankincense.
llm_translation: It was taught: (Leviticus 5:11) "He shall not put oil on it, nor shall he place frankincense on it, for it is a sin offering." Rabbi Yehudah said: It is called a sin offering, and nothing else is called a sin offering. This teaches about the tenth of an ephah of the High Priest, which is not called a sin offering and requires frankincense.

hebrew_text: ומדאינה קרויה חטאת מותרה ירקב:
human_translation: And since it is not called a sin offering, its surplus rot.
llm_translation: And from where is it called a "sin-offering"? It is permitted to decay.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ שור זה עולה ונסתאב אם רצה יביא בדמיו שנים שני שוורים אלו עולה ונסתאבו רצה יביא בדמיהן אחד ורבי אוסר
human_translation: This bull is a burnt offering, and it became blemished [ venista’ev ] If he wishes, he may bring two with its money These two bulls are a burnt offering, and they became blemished, he wishes he may bring one with their money. And Rabbi deems prohibited,
llm_translation: Mishnah: An ox that caused damage ascends and is fattened. If the owner wishes, he may bring two equivalent oxen as their payment. These ascend and are fattened. If he wishes, he may bring one equivalent to their value, and Rabbi prohibits it.

hebrew_text: איל זה עולה ונסתאב אם רצה יביא בדמיו כבש כבש זה עולה ונסתאב אם רצה יביא בדמיו איל ורבי אוסר:
human_translation: This ram is a burnt offering, and it became blemished, if he wishes he may bring a lamb with its money. This lamb is a burnt offering, and it became blemished, if he wishes he may bring a ram with its money. And Rabbi deems prohibited
llm_translation: A ram this ascends and is redeemed, if he wishes he may bring with its blood a lamb. A lamb this ascends and is redeemed, if he wishes he may bring with its blood a ram, and Rabbi prohibits.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ והא אמרת רישא שור במנה והביא שנים במנה לא יצא
human_translation: But didn’t you say in the first clause, a bull with one hundred dinars and he brought two with one hundred dinars, has not fulfilled
