llm_translation: Gemara: And this, did you not say in the beginning, "An ox in a Maneh, and he brought two in a Maneh, he has not fulfilled his obligation."

hebrew_text: שור זה ונסתאב שאני:
human_translation: This bull and becomes blemished is different.
llm_translation: This ox and it was impregnated, different.

hebrew_text: שני שוורין אלו עולה ונסתאבו רצה יביא בדמיהן אחד ורבי אוסר: מאי טעמא
human_translation: These two bulls are a burnt offering, and they became blemished, he wishes he may bring with money their one And Rabbi deems prohibited, What is the reason
llm_translation: Two oxen - these are for an offering, and they were intermingled. If he desires, he may bring one with their combined value, and Rabbi prohibits. What is the reason?

hebrew_text: משום דהוה ליה גדול והביא קטן ואף על גב דנסתאב לכתחילה לא שרי רבי
human_translation: Because it is a large and he brought a small And although became blemished Rabbi does not permit ab initio .
llm_translation: Because he was a great person and brought a minor, and even though it is forbidden initially, Rabbi does not permit it.

hebrew_text: ולפלוג נמי ברישא
human_translation: But let disagree in the first clause as well,
llm_translation: And to differentiate also in the beginning.

hebrew_text: רבי אכולה מילתא פליג ונטר להו לרבנן עד דמסקי מילתייהו והדר מיפליג עלייהו
human_translation: Rabbi disagrees with entire matter, but he waited until the Rabbis had completed their statement, and then disagreed with them
llm_translation: Rabbi Akula disputes the matter and guards it against the Rabbis until they reach their words, and then he disputes against them.

hebrew_text: תדע דקתני איל זה עולה ונסתאב רצה יביא בדמיו כבש כבש זה לעולה ונסתאב רצה יביא בדמיו איל ורבי אוסר שמע מינה:
human_translation: Know as teaches This ram is a burnt offering, and it became blemished, he wishes he may bring a lamb with its money. This lamb is a burnt offering, and it became blemished, he wishes he may bring a ram with its money. And Rabbi deems prohibited Conclude from it
llm_translation: Know that it was taught: "If one designated a ram for an offering and it was lost, if he desires, he may bring a lamb in its place. If one designated a lamb for an offering and it was lost, if he desires, he may bring a ram in its place." And Rabbi Osser prohibits.

hebrew_text: איבעיא להו ממינא למינא מאי
human_translation: A dilemma was raised before what from species to species
llm_translation: The question was asked of them: "From Minai to Minai, what?"

hebrew_text: תא שמע שור זה עולה ונסתאב לא יביא בדמיו איל אבל מביא בדמיו שני אילים ורבי אוסר לפי שאין בילה שמע מינה
human_translation: Come hear This bull is a burnt offering, and it became blemished, he may not bring a ram with its money, But he may bring two rams with its money, And Rabbi deems prohibited, because there is no mixing Conclude from
llm_translation: Come and hear: An ox that causes damage, one does not bring it with its value as a guilt offering, but rather brings two rams as its guilt offering. And Rabbi prohibits this, for there is no "bilah" (absorption) - learn from this.

hebrew_text: אי הכי מאי איריא תרי אפילו חד נמי דהא בנסתאב לרבנן לא שני להו בין גדול לקטן
human_translation: If so, why specifically two even one as in became blemished, according to the Rabbis, there is no difference whether a large or a small
llm_translation: If so, what is the difference between two cases? Even one case also, for in the case of Nistav to the Rabbis, it is not different for them, whether the person involved is great or small.

hebrew_text: תרי תנאי ואליבא דרבנן:
human_translation: two tanna’im , and with regard to of the Rabbis.
llm_translation: Two Tannaim and according to the Sages:

hebrew_text: רבי אוסר לפי שאין בילה: טעמא דאין בילה הא יש בילה שרי
human_translation: Rabbi deems prohibited because there is no mixing. The reason because there is no mixing. But been mixing, permitted.
llm_translation: Rabbi prohibits due to the lack of bila: the reason being that there is no bila, whereas there is bila, it is permitted.

hebrew_text: והתנן איל זה עולה ונסתאב רצה יביא בדמיו כבש  כבש זה עולה ונסתאב יביא בדמיו איל ורבי אוסר
human_translation: But didn’t we learn This ram is a burnt offering, and it became blemished, he wishes he may bring a lamb with its money. This lamb is a burnt offering, and it became blemished, he may bring a ram with its money. And Rabbi deems prohibited
llm_translation: And we learned in a Mishnah: "If this ram ascends and becomes mixed, if one wishes, he may bring its value in the form of a sheep. If this sheep ascends and becomes mixed, he may bring its value in the form of a ram." And Rabbi Yehuda prohibits.

hebrew_text: תרי תנאי ואליבא דרבי
human_translation: two tanna’im , and with regard to of Rabbi
llm_translation: Two Tannaim and according to the opinion of Rabbi.

hebrew_text: ובטהורים עגל והביא פר כבש והביא איל יצא סתמא כרבנן:
human_translation: and with regard to pure a calf and brought a bull a lamb and brought a ram he has fulfilled unattributed in accordance with the Rabbis.
llm_translation: And in the case of the pure ones, if one brought a calf and then brought a bull, or brought a lamb and then brought a ram, he has fulfilled his obligation according to the Rabbis.

hebrew_text: רצה יביא בדמיו ב' [כו']: אמר רב מנשיא בר זביד אמר רב לא שנו אלא דאמר שור זה עולה אבל אמר שור זה עלי עולה הוקבע
human_translation: he wishes, he may bring two with its money. Rabbi Menashya bar Zevid says Rav says: taught only where one said: This bull is a burnt offering. But said: This bull upon me a burnt offering, is fixed,
llm_translation: Wants to bring with his money two 26b: Rav Menashya bar Zavid said Rav did not teach except that if one says "this ox is an offering" it is established.

hebrew_text: ודלמא עלי להביאו קאמר
human_translation: But perhaps he said: upon me to bring it
llm_translation: And perhaps it is upon me to bring it, is what he is saying.

hebrew_text: אלא אי איתמר הכי איתמר אמר רב מנשיא בר זביד אמר רב לא שנו אלא דאמר שור זה עולה אי נמי אמר שור זה עלי עולה אבל אמר שור זה ודמיו עלי עולה הוקבע:
human_translation: Rather, if it was stated it was stated as follows: Rabbi Menashya bar Zevid says Rav says: taught only where one said: This bull is a burnt offering, or he said: This bull upon me a burnt offering. But he said: This bull and its value upon me a burnt offering, is fixed,
llm_translation: Rather, if it was stated thus, it was stated thus. Rav Menasheh bar Zavid said in the name of Rav: They only taught this when one says, "This ox shall ascend," or alternatively, when one says, "This ox and its value shall ascend." But if one says, "This ox and its blood shall ascend," it is established.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ האומר אחד מכבשי הקדש ואחד משורי הקדש והיו לו שנים הגדול שבהן הקדש שלשה בינוני שבהם הקדש פירשתי ואיני יודע מה שפירשתי או שאמר לי אבא ואיני יודע מה הגדול שבהן הקדש:
human_translation: one who says: One of my lambs is consecrated, or: One of my bulls is consecrated, and he has two the larger of them is consecrated. three the middle-sized among them is consecrated. I specified but I do not know what I specified or that: My father said to me but I do not know what the largest of them is consecrated.
llm_translation: Mishnah: One who says, "One of the consecrated lambs and one of the consecrated oxen," and he had two, the greater of which is consecrated, three of medium status are consecrated, I have separated, and I do not know what I have separated, or if his father told him, and I do not know which is the greater of them that is consecrated.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אלמא מקדיש בעין יפה מקדיש אימא סיפא בינוני שבהן הקדש אלמא מקדיש בעין רעה מקדיש
human_translation: Apparently, one who consecrates, consecrates generously. say the latter clause the middle-sized among them is consecrated. Apparently, one who consecrates, consecrates sparingly.
llm_translation: Gemara: It is inferred: one sanctifies with a good eye, one sanctifies, say the latter clause, with an intermediate one, in them sanctifies, it is inferred: one sanctifies with an evil eye, one sanctifies.

hebrew_text: אמר שמואל חוששין אף לבינוני דלגבי קטן עין יפה הוא
human_translation: Shmuel said: we are concerned, that the compared to the small is generous.
llm_translation: Said Shmuel: We are concerned even for the intermediate level of regarding a minor as an adult, for "a beautiful eye" is he.

hebrew_text: היכי עביד אמר רבי חייא בר רב ממתין לו עד שיומם ומחיל ליה לקדושתיה בגדול
human_translation: How should he act? Rabbi Ḥiyya bar Rav said: He should wait until becomes blemished and desacralize it onto the large
llm_translation: How does one do it? Rabbi Chiya bar Rav said: We wait for him until daytime, and we defer his sanctity to the greater.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן אמר רבה בר אבוה לא שנו אלא דאמר אחד משוורי הקדש אבל אמר שור בשוורי הקדש הגדול שבהן הקדש תורא בתוראי קאמר
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said Rabba bar Avuh said: taught only when he said: One of my bulls is consecrated. But he said: A bull among my bulls is consecrated, the largest of them is consecrated. he said: The bull among my bulls [ tora betorai ]
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said, Rabba bar Avuhah said: They only taught that if one said "one of the oxen of the sanctuary" it is valid, but if one said "an ox among the oxen of the sanctuary," he is saying, "the greatest of them, the holy ox among my oxen."

hebrew_text: איני והאמר רב הונא אמר ר' חייא משמיה דעולא האומר לחבירו בית בביתי אני מוכר לך מראהו עלייה לאו משום דגריע לא מעולה שבבתים:
human_translation: Is that so? But didn’t Rav Huna say Rabbi Ḥiyya said in the name of Ulla: One who says to another: I am selling you a house among my houses, can show him an loft [ aliyya ], not because worst No, the best [ me’ula ] of houses.
llm_translation: I am not, but didn't Rav Huna say in the name of Rabbi Chiya from Ulla: One who says to his fellow, "A house in my house I am selling to you," showing it to him upstairs, is it not because he is diminishing from the excellence of houses?

hebrew_text: מיתיבי שור בשוורי הקדש וכן שור של הקדש שנתערב באחרים הגדול שבהן הקדש וכולם ימכרו לצרכי עולות ודמיהן חולין
human_translation: raises an objection A bull among my bulls is consecrated, or similarly a consecrated bull became mixed with other the largest of them is consecrated, and all of the must be sold for the purpose of burnt offerings, and the payment for them is non-sacred.
llm_translation: A contradiction was raised: An ox among consecrated oxen, and similarly, an ox of consecrated property that became mixed with others, the greater part of which is consecrated - all of them are to be sold for the needs of burnt offerings, and their value is mundane.

hebrew_text: תרגומא אשור של הקדש שנתערב באחרים והא וכן קאמר תרגומא אגדול:
human_translation: Interpret to a consecrated bull that became mixed with others. But doesn’t say: And similarly, Interpret to the largest
llm_translation: The Assyrian translation of the Holy Scriptures that became mixed with others. And so it says, "The great translation."

hebrew_text: מיתיבי בית בביתי אני מוכר לך ונפל מראהו נפול עבד בעבדיי אני מוכר לך ומת מראהו מת
human_translation: raises an objection I am selling you a house among my houses, and fell, he can show him fallen I sell you a slave among my slaves, and dies, he can show him dead
llm_translation: The question was raised: "If one says to another, 'My house is like your house,' and the roof of his house collapses, or 'My slave is like your slave,' and his slave dies, what is the ruling?"

hebrew_text: ואמאי ליחזי היידן נפל היידן מת
human_translation: But why Let him see which fell, which died,
llm_translation: And why did Yehizkiel see? The hand fell, the hand died.

hebrew_text: לוקח קא אמרת שאני לוקח דיד בעל השטר על התחתונה
human_translation: Are you saying a purchaser? A purchaser is different, as the owner of the document is at a disadvantage,
llm_translation: "Lukach ka amarta, sha'ani lukach, didi ba'al hashtar al hatachtona."

hebrew_text: השתא דאתית להכי אפילו תימא עלייה דגריעה יד בעל השטר על התחתונה:
human_translation: Now that you have arrived at this you even say a loft, which is the worst the owner of the document is at a disadvantage.
llm_translation: At this moment, when you come to this, even if you say "on top of the higher one, the hand of the creditor is on the lower one."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הרי עלי עולה יקריבנה במקדש ואם הקריבה בבית חוניו לא יצא הרי עלי עולה שאקריבנה בבית חוניו יקריבנה במקדש ואם הקריבה בבית חוניו יצא רבי שמעון אומר אין זו עולה
human_translation: It upon me a burnt offering, must sacrifice it in the Temple And if he sacrificed it in the temple of Onias he has not fulfilled upon me a burnt offering that I will sacrifice in the temple of Onias, must sacrifice it in the Temple but if he sacrificed it in the temple of Onias, he has fulfilled Rabbi Shimon says it is not a burnt offering;
llm_translation: Mishnah: If one says, "Behold, upon me is an olah offering," he shall bring it in the Temple. But if he brought it in his private residence, he has not fulfilled his obligation. If one says, "Behold, upon me is an olah offering," and he brought it in his private residence, he shall bring it in the Temple. But if he brought it in his private residence, he has fulfilled his obligation. Rabbi Shimon says: This is not considered an olah offering.

hebrew_text: הריני נזיר יגלח במקדש ואם גלח בבית חוניו לא יצא הריני נזיר שאגלח בבית חוניו יגלח במקדש ואם גלח בבית חוניו יצא ר' שמעון אומר אין זה נזיר:
human_translation: I am hereby a nazirite, he must shave in the Temple and if he shaved in the temple of Onias, he has not fulfilled I am hereby a nazirite that I will shave in the temple of Onias, he must shave in the Temple but if he shaved in the temple of Onias, he has fulfilled Rabbi Shimon says is not a nazirite
llm_translation: I hereby vow to be a Nazirite. He shall shave in the Temple, and if he shaves in his own home, he has not fulfilled his vow. I hereby vow to be a Nazirite, that if he shaves in his own home, he shall shave in the Temple, and if he shaves in his own home, he has fulfilled his vow. Rabbi Shimon says: This is not a Nazirite.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ יצא הא מקטל קטלה
human_translation: fulfilled hasn’t he killed it
llm_translation: Gemara: Yatza ha makatel katala.

hebrew_text: אמר רב המנונא נעשה כאומר הרי עלי עולה על מנת שלא אתחייב באחריותה
human_translation: Rav Hamnuna says: he is rendered like one who says: It upon me a burnt offering on the condition that I will not be responsible for it
llm_translation: Rav Hamnuna said: We should treat it as if one says, "Behold, I will bring a burnt offering," so that he is not obligated in its responsibility.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה רבא אלא מעתה סיפא דקתני הריני נזיר שאגלח בבית חוניו יגלח במקדש ואם גילח בבית חוניו יצא הכי נמי דנעשה כאומר הריני נזיר על מנת שלא אתחייב באחריות קרבנותיו נזיר כמה דלא מייתי קרבנותיו לא מתכשר
human_translation: Rava said to If that is so, the latter clause which teaches I am hereby a nazirite that I will shave in the temple of Onias, he must shave in the Temple but if he shaved in the temple of Onias, he has fulfilled also that he is rendered like one who says: I am hereby a nazirite on the condition that I will not be responsible for its offerings a nazirite as long as he does not bring his offerings, he is not fit
llm_translation: Rava said to him: Rather, now, the latter clause that it teaches, "Behold, I am a Nazirite, on the condition that I am not obligated in the responsibility of my sacrifices," a Nazirite, just as he does not bring his sacrifices, does not become disqualified.

hebrew_text: אלא אמר רבא אדם זה לדורון נתכוין אמר אי סגיא בבית חוניו טרחנא טפי לא מצינא לאיצטעורי
human_translation: Rather, Rava said this person intended to a gift [ doron ], said If it is sufficient in the temple of Onias, I exert more I am not able to afflict myself.
llm_translation: Rather, Rava said: This person intended for charity. He said: If it is abundant in the house of Hananiah, I will exert myself more, but I did not find it to give to the poor.

hebrew_text: נזיר נמי האי גברא לצעורי נפשיה קא מיכוין אמר אי סגיא בבית חוניו טרחנא טפי לא מצינא לאיצטעורי
human_translation: as well: a nazirite this man intends to practice abstinence he said If it is sufficient in the temple of Onias, I exert more I am not able to afflict myself.
llm_translation: Nazir also this man for affliction of his soul is intending. He said: If it is abundant in the house of his sustenance, I would exert myself more, I would not find for affliction.

hebrew_text: ורב המנונא אמר לך נזיר כדקאמרת עולה על מנת שלא אתחייב באחריותה קאמר
human_translation: And Rav Hamnuna said to you a nazirite as you said. a burnt offering he says: upon me a burnt offering on the condition that I will not be responsible for it
llm_translation: And Rav Hamnuna said to you, "Nazir, as you said, 'It ascends for the purpose of not incurring liability for its responsibility,' is what he said."

hebrew_text: ואף רבי יוחנן סבר לה להא דרב המנונא דאמר רבה בר בר חנה אמר רבי יוחנן הרי עלי עולה שאקריבנה בבית חוניו והקריבה בארץ ישראל יצא וענוש כרת
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan also that which Rav Hamnuna as Rabba bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yoḥanan said It upon me a burnt offering that I will sacrifice it in the temple of Onias, and he sacrificed it in Eretz Yisrael he has fulfilled but are punishable by excision from the World-to-Come [ karet ]
llm_translation: And even Rabbi Yochanan holds like that of Rav Hamnuna who said Rabbah bar bar Ḥana said Rabbi Yochanan: "Behold, I have a burnt offering that I should have offered in Beit Ḥoni and I offered it in the land of Israel, he has fulfilled his obligation and is liable to karet."

hebrew_text: תניא נמי הכי הרי עלי עולה שאקריבנה במדבר והקריבה בעבר הירדן יצא וענוש כרת:
human_translation: This is also taught It upon me a burnt offering that I will sacrifice it in the wilderness and he sacrificed it on bank of the Jordan, he has fulfilled but are punishable by karet
llm_translation: It was also taught in a Baraita: "If one vows to bring a burnt offering and then offers it in the wilderness instead of bringing it across the Jordan, he has fulfilled his obligation, but is liable to receive the punishment of excision."

hebrew_text: מתני׳ הכהנים ששמשו בבית חוניו לא ישמשו במקדש שבירושלים ואין צריך לומר לדבר אחר שנאמר (מלכים ב כג, ט) אך לא יעלו כהני הבמות אל מזבח ה' בירושלים כי אם אכלו מצות (בקרב) אחיהם הרי אלו כבעלי מומין חולקין ואוכלין ולא מקריבין:
human_translation: The priests who served in the temple of Onias may not serve in the Temple in Jerusalem; and needless to say, for something else, As it is stated: “Nevertheless the priests of the private altars did not come up to the altar of the Lord in Jerusalem, but they did eat matza among their brethren” these like blemished they receive a share and partake but they do not sacrifice
llm_translation: Mishnah: The priests who served in the house of his abode may not serve in the Temple in Jerusalem. And needless to say for another matter, as it is stated (2 Kings 23:9), "But the priests of the high places shall not come up to the altar of the Lord in Jerusalem, for they may only eat unleavened bread among their brethren." These are considered as blemished individuals, they divide and eat, but do not offer sacrifices.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר רב יהודה כהן ששחט לעבודת כוכבים קרבנו ריח ניחוח
human_translation: Rav Yehuda says: a priest who slaughtered for idol worship his offering is an aroma pleasing
llm_translation: Gemara: Rav Yehudah said, a kohen who slaughtered for idol worship, his sacrifice is a pleasing aroma.

hebrew_text: אמר רב יצחק בר אבדימי מאי קראה (יחזקאל מד, יב) יען אשר ישרתו אותם לפני גילוליהם והיו לבית ישראל למכשול עון על כן נשאתי ידי עליהם נאום ה' אלהים ונשאו עונם וכתיב בתריה ולא יגשו אלי לכהן לי אי עבד שירות אין שחיטה לאו שירות הוא:
human_translation: Rav Yitzḥak bar Avdimi says: What is the verse “Because they served them before their idols and became a stumbling block of iniquity unto the house of Israel, therefore I have lifted up My hand against them, says the Lord God, and they shall bear their iniquity” And it is written afterward: “And they shall not come near to Me, to serve Me in the priestly role” if performed a service is slaughter is not service,
llm_translation: Rav Yitzchak bar Avdimi said: What is the verse (Ezekiel 44:12) "Because they ministered to them before their idols and became a stumbling block of iniquity to the house of Israel, therefore I have lifted My hand against them," says the Lord God, "and they shall bear their iniquity"? And it is written further: "And they shall not come near to Me to serve as My priests or come near to any of My holy things, to the most holy things; but they shall bear their shame and their abominations which they have committed."

hebrew_text: איתמר שגג בזריקה רב נחמן אמר קרבנו ריח ניחוח רב ששת אמר אין קרבנו ריח ניחוח
human_translation: It was stated: unwittingly sprinkling Rav Naḥman says his offering is an aroma pleasing Rav Sheshet says: His offering is not a pleasing aroma
llm_translation: It was stated: If there was an unintentional mistake in the act of sprinkling, Rav Nachman said: His offering is a pleasing aroma. Rav Sheshet said: His offering is not a pleasing aroma.

hebrew_text: אמר רב ששת מנא אמינא לה דכתיב והיו לבית ישראל למכשול עון [מאי] לאו או מכשול או עון ומכשול שוגג ועון מזיד
human_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I say As it is written: “And they became a stumbling block of iniquity unto the house of Israel.” What, is it not either a stumbling block or an iniquity? And “stumbling block” unwittingly, and “iniquity” an intentional
llm_translation: Rav Sheshet said: From where do I know this? As it is written, "And they shall be a stumbling block to the house of Israel, a sin." What is it? Is it not a stumbling block or sin? A stumbling block is unintentional, and sin is intentional.

hebrew_text: ורב נחמן מכשול דעון:
human_translation: And Rav Naḥman a stumbling block of iniquity,
llm_translation: And Rav Nahman is a stumbling block of contention.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן מנא אמינא לה דתניא (במדבר טו, כח) וכפר הכהן על הנפש השוגגת בחטאה בשגגה מלמד שכהן מתכפר על ידי עצמו
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: From where do I say As it is taught And the priest shall effect atonement for the soul that errs unwittingly, when he sins unwittingly, teaches that a priest may receive atonement on his own.
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: From where do I say this? As it is taught (Numbers 15:28), "And the kohen shall make atonement for the soul that sins unintentionally when he sins unintentionally," which teaches that a kohen atones for himself.

hebrew_text: במאי אילימא בשחיטה מאי איריא שוגג אפילו מזיד נמי אלא לאו בזריקה
human_translation: In what If we say through slaughtering why specifically unwittingly even intentionally Rather, is it not by sprinkling
llm_translation: With what? If you say in regard to slaughter, what is the relevance of unintentional sin? Even intentional sin as well, rather, is it not in regard to sprinkling of blood?

hebrew_text: ורב ששת אמר לך לעולם בשחיטה ובמזיד לא נעשה משרת לעבודת כוכבים
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet said to you: Actually, where through slaughtering And intentionally, does not become a servant of idol worship?
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said to you: Always in slaughter and intentionally it is not done, serving for idol worship.

hebrew_text: ואזדו לטעמייהו דאתמר הזיד בשחיטה רב נחמן אמר קרבנו ריח ניחוח ורב ששת אמר אין קרבנו ריח ניחוח
human_translation: And follow their reasoning, as it was stated intentionally in slaughter Rav Naḥman says his offering is an aroma pleasing and Rav Sheshet says his offering is not an aroma pleasing
llm_translation: And they went according to their reasons that were stated: "One who intentionally violates the laws in slaughtering." Rav Nachman said, "His offering is a pleasing aroma," and Rav Sheshet said, "His offering is not a pleasing aroma."

hebrew_text: רב נחמן אמר קרבנו ריח ניחוח דלא עבד שירות רב ששת אמר אין קרבנו ריח ניחוח
human_translation: Rav Naḥman says his offering is an aroma pleasing because he did not perform service Rav Sheshet says his offering is not an aroma pleasing
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: "His offering is a pleasing aroma." He did not perform the service. Rav Sheshet said: "His offering is not a pleasing aroma."

hebrew_text: נעשה משרת לעבודת כוכבים
human_translation: he became a servant of idol worship.
llm_translation: It was made a minister for idol worship.

hebrew_text: אמר רב נחמן מנא אמינא לה דתניא כהן שעבד עבודת כוכבים ושב קרבנו ריח ניחוח
human_translation: Rav Naḥman said: From where do I say As it is taught a priest who served idol worship and repented, his offering is an aroma pleasing
llm_translation: Rav Nachman said: From where do I say this? As it is taught: A priest who served idolatry and then brought his offering, it is a pleasing aroma.

hebrew_text: במאי אילימא בשוגג מאי ושב שב ועומד הוא אלא פשיטא במזיד ואי בזריקה כי שב מאי הוי הא עבד לה שירות אלא לאו בשחיטה
human_translation: In what If we say unwittingly, what And repented? He is already repentant, Rather, obvious of intentional And if to sprinkling when he repents, what of it? Hasn’t he performed service, Rather, is it not to slaughter
llm_translation: With what? If you say, with unintentional sin, what is "and he shall return, he shall return, and stand"? Rather, it is obvious that it refers to intentional sin. And if you say it refers to throwing the blood, when he returns, what is it that he did? Rather, is it not referring to slaughtering.

hebrew_text: ורב ששת אמר לך לעולם בשוגג והכי קאמר אם שב מעיקרו דכי עבד בשוגג עבד קרבנו ריח ניחוח ואם לאו אין קרבנו ריח ניחוח
human_translation: And Rav Sheshet, he said to you actually to unwitting And this is saying: If is repentant from the outset, as when he served he served unwittingly, his offering is an aroma pleasing But if not, his offering not an aroma pleasing
llm_translation: And Rav Sheshet said to you: Always offer a sacrifice for an unwitting transgression, and this is what he is saying: If he repented from the outset, then if he committed the transgression unwittingly, his sacrifice is a pleasing aroma, but if not, his sacrifice is not a pleasing aroma.

hebrew_text: השתחוה לעבודת כוכבים רב נחמן אמר קרבנו ריח ניחוח ורב ששת אמר אין קרבנו ריח ניחוח הודה לעבודת כוכבים רב נחמן אמר קרבנו ריח ניחוח ורב ששת אמר אין קרבנו ריח ניחוח
human_translation: bowed to idol worship, Rav Naḥman says: his offering is an aroma pleasing And Rav Sheshet says: His offering is not an aroma pleasing acknowledges idol worship Rav Naḥman says: his offering is an aroma pleasing And Rav Sheshet says: His offering is not an aroma pleasing
llm_translation: Talmudic text: Bowing down to idol worship, Rav Nachman said, "Its sacrifice is a pleasing aroma," and Rav Sheshet said, "Its sacrifice is not a pleasing aroma." Acknowledging idol worship, Rav Nachman said, "Its sacrifice is a pleasing aroma," and Rav Sheshet said, "Its sacrifice is not a pleasing aroma."

hebrew_text: וצריכא דאי אשמעינן הך קמייתא בההיא קאמר רב ששת משום דעבד ליה שירות אבל שחיטה דלא עבד ליה שירות אימא מודה ליה לרב נחמן
human_translation: And necessary As, had taught us this first in that Rav Sheshet says because he performed a service for But slaughter, since he did not perform a service for say concedes to Rav Naḥman.
llm_translation: And it is necessary, for if we were to hear this first part, in that which Rav Sheshet said, because he performed a service for it, but for slaughter, in which he did not perform a service, I would say that Rav Nachman agrees with him.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן שחיטה משום דעבד ליה עבודה אבל השתחוה דלא עבד ליה עבודה אימא לא צריכא
human_translation: And had taught us slaughter because he performed rite for But bowed since he did not perform rite for say not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say that slaughtering is considered a form of labor, but bowing down, which does not involve labor, one might say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: ואי אשמעינן השתחואה משום דעביד ליה מעשה אבל הודה דדיבורא בעלמא אימא לא צריכא:
human_translation: And had taught us bowing because he performed an action for But acknowledged which is mere speech, say not necessary
llm_translation: And if we were to say bowing down is considered an action, because he the person bowing down is doing a physical act, but if he admits verbally that it is just mere speech, then say it is not necessary.

hebrew_text: ואין צריך לומר דבר אחר [וכו']: מדקאמר אין צריך לומר דבר אחר מכלל דבית חוניו לאו עבודת כוכבים הוא
human_translation: And needless to say, something else, From that it says: Needless to say, something else, by inference, the temple of Onias is not idol worship,
llm_translation: "And there is no need to say anything else etc.: since it says 'there is no need to say anything else,' it implies that the Beit Chonyo is not idol worship."

hebrew_text: תניא כמאן דאמר בית חוניו לאו עבודת כוכבים הוא דתניא אותה שנה שמת שמעון הצדיק אמר להן שנה זו הוא מת אמרו לו מנין אתה יודע
human_translation: It is taught like the one who says the temple of Onias is not idol worship. As it is taught: the year in which Shimon HaTzaddik died, he said to This year, he will die, They said to him: From where do you know?
llm_translation: It was taught: According to whom said the House of Hananiah is not idol worship? As it was taught: In the year that Shimon the Righteous died, he said to them, "This year I will die." They said to him, "How do you know?"

hebrew_text: אמר להן כל יום הכפורים נזדמן לי זקן אחד לבוש לבנים ונתעטף לבנים ונכנס עמי ויצא עמי שנה זו נזדמן לי זקן אחד לבוש שחורים ונתעטף שחורים ונכנס עמי ולא יצא עמי
human_translation: said to them: every Yom Kippur, I would be met by an old man dressed in white, and wrapped in white, and he would enter with me, and he would leave with me. this year, I was met by an old man dressed in black, and wrapped in black, and he entered with me, but he did not leave with me.
llm_translation: He said to them, "Every Yom Kippur, an elder dressed in white would meet with me, wrapped in white, and would enter with me and exit with me. This year, an elder dressed in black met with me, wrapped in black, entered with me, but did not exit with me."

hebrew_text: לאחר הרגל חלה שבעת ימים ומת ונמנעו אחיו הכהנים מלברך בשם
human_translation: after the pilgrimage festival he was ill for seven days and died. And his fellow priests refrained from reciting the Benediction with the name
llm_translation: After the holiday, he became ill for seven days and died, and his priestly brothers refrained from blessing in the name.

hebrew_text: בשעת פטירתו אמר להם חוניו בני ישמש תחתי נתקנא בו שמעי אחיו שהיה גדול ממנו שתי שנים ומחצה אמר לו בא ואלמדך סדר עבודה הלבישו באונקלי וחגרו בצילצול העמידו אצל המזבח אמר להם לאחיו הכהנים ראו מה נדר זה וקיים לאהובתו אותו היום שאשתמש בכהונה גדולה אלבוש באונקלי שליכי ואחגור בצילצול שליכי
human_translation: At the time of his death, he said to Onias, my son, will serve in my stead. Shimi, brother, became jealous as was two and a half years older than said to Come and I will teach you the order of the service dressed in a tunic [ be’unkeli ] and girded him with a ribbon [ betziltzul ] stood him next to the altar. said to his fellow priests: Look what this vowed and fulfilled for his beloved, On the day that I serve in the High Priesthood I will wear your tunic and gird your ribbon.
llm_translation: At the time of his passing, he said to them, "My sons, place Honiyu beneath me." Shimei, his brother, who was two and a half years older than him, said to him, "Come, and I will teach you the order of the service." They dressed him in linen garments and girded him with a belt. They stood him by the altar. He said to his priestly brothers, "See what this vow is, and fulfill it for his beloved." On that day that he served in the high priesthood, he wore my linen garments and girded himself with my belt.

hebrew_text: בקשו אחיו הכהנים להרגו רץ מפניהם ורצו אחריו הלך לאלכסנדריא של מצרים ובנה שם מזבח והעלה עליו לשום עבודת כוכבים וכששמעו חכמים בדבר אמרו מה זה שלא ירד לה כך היורד לה על אחת כמה וכמה דברי רבי מאיר
human_translation: The fellow priests of wanted to kill him ran from them and they ran after him. He went to Alexandria in Egypt and built an altar there, and sacrificed upon it for the sake of idol worship. When the Sages heard of the matter they said: If this who did not enter such all the more so one who enters the statement of Rabbi Meir.
llm_translation: The text reads as follows: "The brothers, the priests, sought to kill him. He ran from them, and they ran after him. He went to Alexandria of Egypt and built an altar there, and offered upon it idolatrous worship. When the sages heard about this matter, they said, 'What is this, that he did not descend to such depths?' How much more so one who descends to such depths!' These are the words of Rabbi Meir."

hebrew_text: אמר לו רבי יהודה לא כך היה מעשה אלא לא קיבל עליו חוניו שהיה שמעי אחיו גדול ממנו שתי שנים ומחצה ואף על פי כן נתקנא בו חוניו בשמעי אחיו אמר לו בא ואלמדך סדר עבודה והלבישו באונקלי וחגרו בצילצול והעמידו אצל המזבח אמר להם לאחיו הכהנים ראו מה נדר זה וקיים לאהובתו אותו היום שישתמש בכהונה גדולה אלבוש באונקלי שליכי ואחגור בצילצול שליכי
human_translation: Rabbi Yehuda said to him: incident was not like this. Rather, Onias did not accept because his brother Shimi was two and a half years older than him, And even so, Onias was jealous of his brother Shimi. said to Come and I will teach you the order of the service And dressed in a tunic and girded him in a ribbon and stood him next to the altar. said to his fellow priests: Look what this vowed and fulfilled for his beloved, On the day that I serve in the High Priesthood I will wear your tunic and gird your ribbon.
llm_translation: He said to him Rabbi Yehuda not so was the matter rather he did not accept upon himself his priesthood for his brother Shimei was greater than him by two and a half years and nevertheless Huni was jealous of him. Shimei his brother said to him come and I will teach you the order of the service and he dressed him in the tunic and girded him with the sash and stood him by the altar. He said to his priestly brothers see what this vow is and he fulfilled it for his beloved that day that he may serve in the high priesthood. "Let my tunic be cast off and my sash be removed."

hebrew_text: בקשו אחיו הכהנים להרגו סח להם כל המאורע בקשו להרוג את חוניו רץ מפניהם ורצו אחריו רץ לבית המלך ורצו אחריו כל הרואה אותו אומר זה הוא זה הוא הלך לאלכסנדריא של מצרים ובנה שם מזבח והעלה עליו לשם שמים שנאמר (ישעיהו יט, יט) (והיה) ביום ההוא יהיה מזבח לה' בתוך ארץ מצרים ומצבה אצל גבולה לה'
human_translation: His fellow priests wanted to kill told them the entire incident, wanted to kill Onias. ran from them, and they ran after him. ran to the palace of the king, and they ran after him. Anyone who saw him would say: This is him, this is him, went to Alexandria in Egypt and built an altar there, and sacrificed upon it for the sake of Heaven. As it is stated: “In that day shall there be an altar to the Lord in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar at its border, to the Lord”
llm_translation: The brothers, the priests, sought to kill him. He fled from them. They ran after him. He ran to the king's house. Everyone who saw him said, "This is he." He went to Alexandria of Egypt and built an altar there and offered upon it to the name of Heaven, as it is said (Isaiah 19:19), "On that day there shall be an altar to the Lord in the midst of the land of Egypt, and a pillar at its border to the Lord."

hebrew_text: וכששמעו חכמים בדבר אמרו ומה זה שברח ממנה כך המבקש לירד לה על אחת כמה וכמה:
human_translation: And when the Sages heard of the matter they said: If this one, who fled from such all the more so one who wants to enter
llm_translation: And when the sages heard about this matter, they said, "If this one fled from her, how much more so one who seeks to descend upon her willingly."

hebrew_text: תניא אמר ר' יהושע בן פרחיה בתחלה כל האומר עלה לה אני כופתו ונותנו לפני הארי עתה כל האומר לי לירד ממנה אני מטיל עליו קומקום של חמין
human_translation: it is taught Rabbi Yehoshua ben Peraḥya said: Initially, anyone who would say Ascend to I would tie him up and place him in front of a lion Now anyone who tells me to leave I throw a kettle [ kumkum ] of boiling at him
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Yehoshua ben Perachiah said, "Initially, anyone who says 'I will ascend to her,' I will push him and place him before a lion. Now, anyone who says to me 'Descend from her,' I will pour a kettle of boiling water on him."

hebrew_text: שהרי שאול ברח ממנה וכשעלה בקש להרוג את דוד
human_translation: As Saul fled from But when he ascended he tried to kill David,
llm_translation: For behold, Saul fled from her, and when he arose, he sought to kill David.

hebrew_text: אמר ליה מר קשישא בריה דרב חסדא לאביי ר' מאיר האי קרא דרבי יהודה מאי עביד ליה
human_translation: Mar Kashisha, son of Rav Ḥisda, said to Abaye: What does Rabbi Meir do with this verse of Rabbi Yehuda?
llm_translation: Said to him Mar Kashisha son of Rav Chisda to Abaye: "Rabbi Meir, this verse of Rabbi Yehuda, what does he do with it?"

hebrew_text: לכדתניא לאחר מפלתו של סנחריב יצא חזקיה ומצא בני מלכים שהיו יושבין בקרונות של זהב הדירן שלא לעבוד עבודת כוכבים שנאמר (ישעיהו יט, יח) ביום ההוא יהיו חמש ערים בארץ מצרים מדברות שפת כנען
human_translation: for that which is taught After the downfall of Sennacherib, Hezekiah emerged and found the princes sitting in carriages [ bikronot ] of gold. He made them vow that they would not worship idols, as it is stated “In that day there shall be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan
llm_translation: As it was taught in a Baraita: After the downfall of Sennacherib, Hezekiah went out and found the sons of kings sitting in golden thrones, not to engage in idol worship, as it is stated (Isaiah 19:18), "In that day there shall be five cities in the land of Egypt speaking the language of Canaan."

hebrew_text: ונשבעות לה' צבאות הלכו לאלכסנדריא של מצרים ובנו מזבח והעלו עליו לשם שמים שנאמר (ישעיהו יט, יט) ביום ההוא יהיה מזבח לה' בתוך ארץ מצרים
human_translation: and swear to the Lord of hosts; They went to Alexandria in Egypt and built an altar and sacrificed upon it for the sake of Heaven, as it is stated “In that day shall there be an altar to the Lord in the midst of the land of Egypt,
llm_translation: "And they shall worship the Lord of hosts, and shall go to Alexandria of Egypt, and build an altar, and offer thereon unto the Lord. As it is said (Isaiah 19:19), 'In that day shall there be an altar to the Lord in the midst of the land of Egypt.'"

hebrew_text: (ישעיהו יט, יח) עיר ההרס יאמר לאחת מאי עיר ההרס יאמר לאחת כדמתרגם רב יוסף קרתא דבית שמש דעתיד למיחרב איתאמר דהיא חדא מנהון וממאי דעיר ההרס לישנא דשימשא היא דכתיב (איוב ט, ז) האומר לחרס ולא יזרח
human_translation: “One shall be called the city of destruction” What “One shall be called the city of destruction”? As Rav Yosef translates the City of the Sun, which will be destroyed in the future, it will be said that it is one of them. And from where that “The city of destruction [ heres ],” the term is to the sun? As it is written: “Who commands the sun [ ḥeres ], and it does not rise;
llm_translation: Talmudic text: (Isaiah 19:18) "City of Destruction" will be said to one. What is "City of Destruction" will be said to one? As Rav Yosef translated: Beit Shemesh, which is destined to be destroyed. It was said that it is one of them, and from where is "City of Destruction" derived? In the language of Shemshai, as it is written (Job 9:7), "Who says to the sun, and it does not shine."

hebrew_text: (ישעיהו מג, ו) הביאי בני מרחוק ובנותי מקצה הארץ הביאי בני מרחוק אמר רב הונא אלו גליות של בבל שדעתן מיושבת עליהן כבנים ובנותי מקצה הארץ אלו גליות של שאר ארצות שאין דעתן מיושבת עליהן כבנות
human_translation: bring My sons from far, and My daughters from the end of the earth” “bring My sons from far”? Rav Huna says: These are the exiles of Babylonia, whose minds are calm, like sons, “and My daughters from the end of the earth”? These are the exiles of other countries, whose minds are unsettled, like daughters.
llm_translation: Bring my sons from afar, and my daughters from the ends of the earth. Bring my sons from afar - Rav Huna said: These are the exiles of Babylon, whose knowledge is settled upon them like sons. And my daughters from the ends of the earth - These are the exiles of other lands, whose knowledge is not settled upon them like daughters.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי אבא בר רב יצחק אמר רב חסדא ואמרי לה אמר רב יהודה אמר רב מצור ועד קרטיגני מכירין את ישראל ואת אביהם שבשמים ומצור כלפי מערב ומקרטיגני כלפי מזרח אין מכירין את ישראל ולא את אביהן שבשמים
human_translation: Rabbi Abba bar Rav Yitzḥak says Rav Ḥisda says, and some say Rav Yehuda says Rav says: from Tyre to Carthage recognize the Jewish people, and their Father in Heaven. But to the west of Tyre and to the east of Carthage recognize neither the Jewish people nor their Father in Heaven.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Abba bar Rav Yitzchak, said Rav Chisda, and some say it was said by Rav Yehuda in the name of Rav Matzur: From Mitzor to Kartigni they recognize the Jewish people and their Father in Heaven, but from Mitzor westward and from Kartigni eastward, they do not recognize the Jewish people nor their Father in Heaven.

hebrew_text: איתיביה רב שימי בר חייא לרב (מלאכי א, יא) ממזרח שמש ועד מבואו גדול שמי בגוים ובכל מקום מוקטר מוגש לשמי ומנחה טהורה אמר ליה שימי את דקרו ליה אלהא דאלהא
human_translation: Rav Shimi bar Ḥiyya raised an objection to Rav “From the rising of the sun until it sets, My name is great among the nations; and in every place offerings are presented to My name, and a pure meal offering; said to him: Shimi, you that they call Him the God of gods.
llm_translation: Rav Shimi bar Chiya raised an objection to Rav: "From the rising of the sun to its setting, great is My Name among the nations, and in every place incense is offered to My Name, and a pure offering." He said to him, "Shimi, you have pierced for him the God of gods."

hebrew_text: בכל מקום מוקטר מוגש לשמי בכל מקום סלקא דעתך אמר רבי שמואל בר נחמני אמר ר' יונתן אלו תלמידי חכמים העוסקים בתורה בכל מקום מעלה אני עליהן כאילו מקטירין ומגישין לשמי
human_translation: in every place offerings are presented to My name, enter your mind in every place? Rabbi Shmuel bar Naḥmani says Rabbi Yonatan says: These are Torah scholars, who engage in Torah in every place. I ascribe them as though they burn and present to My name.
llm_translation: In every place, incense is offered and presented for My name. In every place, "far be it" according to your opinion, said Rabbi Shmuel bar Nachmani said Rabbi Yonatan: These are the Torah scholars who engage in Torah study. In every place, I elevate them as if they are offering and presenting to My name.

hebrew_text: ומנחה טהורה זה הלומד תורה בטהרה נושא אשה ואחר כך לומד תורה
human_translation: “And a pure meal offering,” this one who studies Torah in purity, marries a woman and afterward studies Torah.
llm_translation: "And a pure meal-offering, this is one who studies Torah in purity, marries a woman, and afterwards studies Torah."

hebrew_text: (תהלים קלד, א) שיר המעלות הנה ברכו את ה' כל עבדי ה' העומדים בבית ה' בלילות מאי בלילות אמר ר' יוחנן אלו תלמידי חכמים העוסקים בתורה בלילה מעלה עליהן הכתוב כאילו עסוקים בעבודה
human_translation: “A Song of Ascents, Behold, bless the Lord, all you servants of the Lord, who stand in the House of the Lord at night” What “at night,” Rabbi Yoḥanan says: These are Torah scholars, who engage in Torah at night. The verse ascribes them as though they engage in the service.
llm_translation: Psalms 134:1 "A song of ascents. Behold, bless the Lord, all servants of the Lord, who stand in the house of the Lord at nights." What is meant by "at nights"? Rabbi Yochanan said: These are the Torah scholars who engage in Torah study at night. The verse elevates them as if they are engaged in the Temple service.

hebrew_text: (דברי הימים ב ב, ג) לעולם זאת על ישראל אמר רב גידל אמר רב זה מזבח בנוי ומיכאל שר הגדול עומד ומקריב עליו קרבן
human_translation: This is an ordinance forever for Israel” Rav Giddel says Rav says: This altar built and Michael, the great minister, stands and sacrifices an offering upon it.
llm_translation: (Chronicles 2:3) "Forever this is for Israel," said Rav Giddel said Rav, "This is a built altar and Michael the High Priest stands and offers upon it a sacrifice."

hebrew_text: ורבי יוחנן אמר אלו תלמידי חכמים העסוקין בהלכות עבודה מעלה עליהם הכתוב כאילו נבנה מקדש בימיהם
human_translation: And Rabbi Yoḥanan says These are Torah scholars, who engage in the halakhot of service. The verse ascribes them as though the Temple was built in their days
llm_translation: Rabbi Yochanan said: These are the Torah scholars who engage in the laws of the Temple service, the Scripture regards them as if the Temple was built in their days.

hebrew_text: אמר ריש לקיש מאי דכתיב (ויקרא ז, לז) זאת התורה לעולה למנחה ולחטאת ולאשם כל העוסק בתורה כאילו הקריב עולה מנחה חטאת ואשם
human_translation: Reish Lakish said: What which is written: “This is the law [ torah ] of the burnt offering, of the meal offering, and of the sin offering, and of the guilt offering, anyone who engages in Torah as though he sacrificed a burnt offering, a meal offering, a sin offering, and a guilt offering.
llm_translation: Rabbi Reish Lakish said: What is the meaning of what is written (Leviticus 7:37), "This is the Torah of the burnt offering, the meal offering, the sin offering, and the guilt offering"? Anyone who engages in Torah study is as if he offered a burnt offering, a meal offering, a sin offering, and a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: אמר רבא האי לעולה למנחה עולה ומנחה מיבעי ליה אלא אמר רבא כל העוסק בתורה אינו צריך לא עולה (ולא חטאת) ולא מנחה ולא אשם
human_translation: Rava said This “Of the burnt offering, of the meal offering.” should have “Burnt offering and meal offering.” Rather, Rava says Anyone who engages in Torah need not a burnt offering, nor a sin offering, nor a meal offering, nor a guilt offering.
llm_translation: Rava said: This one, for an elevation-offering, for a meal-offering, an elevation-offering and a meal-offering are required for him. Rather, Rava said: Anyone who engages in Torah study does not need either an elevation-offering (or a sin-offering) or a meal-offering or a guilt-offering.

hebrew_text: אמר רבי יצחק מאי דכתיב (ויקרא ו, יח) זאת תורת החטאת וזאת תורת האשם כל העוסק בתורת חטאת כאילו הקריב חטאת וכל העוסק בתורת אשם כאילו הקריב אשם:
human_translation: Rabbi Yitzḥak said: What which is written: “This is the law of the sin offering” and: “This is the law of the guilt offering” anyone who engages in the law of the sin offering as though he sacrificed a sin offering, and anyone who engages in the law of a guilt offering as though he sacrificed a guilt offering.
llm_translation: Said Rabbi Yitzchak: What is the meaning of that which is written (Leviticus 6:18), "This is the law of the sin offering and this is the law of the guilt offering"? Anyone who engages in the study of the laws of the sin offering is as if he offered a sin offering, and anyone who engages in the study of the laws of the guilt offering is as if he offered a guilt offering.

hebrew_text: מתני׳ נאמר בעולת בהמה (ויקרא א, ט) אשה ריח ניחוח ובעולת עוף (ויקרא א, ט) אשה ריח ניחוח ובמנחה (ויקרא ב, ב) אשה ריח ניחוח לומר לך אחד המרבה ואחד הממעיט ובלבד שיכוין לבו לשמים:
human_translation: It is stated with regard to an animal burnt offering: “A fire offering, an aroma pleasing and with regard to a bird burnt offering: “A fire offering, an aroma pleasing and with regard to a meal offering: “A fire offering, an aroma pleasing to say to you one who brings a substantial and one who brings a meager provided that he directs his heart toward Heaven.
llm_translation: Mishnah: It is stated regarding a burnt offering of an animal (Leviticus 1:9), "a pleasing aroma to the Lord," and regarding a burnt offering of a bird (Leviticus 1:17), "a pleasing aroma to the Lord," and regarding a meal offering (Leviticus 2:2), "a pleasing aroma to the Lord," to teach you that whether one increases or decreases the offering, as long as one's heart is directed towards Heaven.

hebrew_text: גמ׳ אמר ר' זירא מאי קראה (קהלת ה, יא) מתוקה שנת העובד אם מעט ואם הרבה יאכל
human_translation: Rabbi Zeira said: What is the verse “Sweet is the sleep of a laboring man, whether he consumes little or much”
llm_translation: Gemara: Rabbi Zeira said, what is the verse? (Ecclesiastes 5:11) "Sweet is the sleep of the laborer, whether he eats little or much."

hebrew_text: רב אדא בר אהבה אמר מהכא (קהלת ה, י) ברבות הטובה רבו אוכליה ומה כשרון לבעליו:
human_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said from here: “When goods increase, those who consume them increase; and what advantage is there to the owner,
llm_translation: Rav Adda bar Ahava said: From here (Ecclesiastes 5:10) "In the abundance of good, its consumers increase, and what benefit is there to its owner."

hebrew_text: תניא אמר רבי שמעון בן עזאי בוא וראה מה כתיב בפרשת קרבנות שלא נאמר בהן לא אל ולא אלהים אלא ה' שלא ליתן פתחון פה לבעל דין לחלוק
human_translation: It is taught Rabbi Shimon ben Azzai says: Come and see what is written in the portion of offerings: As El and Elohim are not stated, but “the Lord.” so not to give a claim to a litigant to argue.
llm_translation: It was taught: Rabbi Shimon ben Azai said, "Come and see what is written in the portion of sacrifices, that neither 'El' nor 'Elohim' is stated in them, only 'Hashem,' so as not to give the opportunity for the prosecutor to object."

hebrew_text: ונאמר בשור הגס (ויקרא א, ט) אשה ריח ניחוח ובעוף הדק (ויקרא א, ט) אשה ריח ניחוח ובמנחה (ויקרא ב, ב) אשה ריח ניחוח לומר לך אחד המרבה ואחד הממעיט ובלבד שיכוין את לבו לשמים
human_translation: And it is stated with regard to a large bull “A fire offering, an aroma pleasing and with regard to a small bird “A fire offering, an aroma pleasing and with regard to a meal offering: “A fire offering, an aroma pleasing to say to you one who brings a substantial and one who brings a meager provided that he directs his heart toward Heaven.
llm_translation: And it is stated in the verse of the cattle (Leviticus 1:9), "a pleasing aroma to the Lord," and in the verse of the fowl (Leviticus 1:9), "a pleasing aroma to the Lord," and in the verse of the meal offering (Leviticus 2:2), "a pleasing aroma to the Lord," to tell you that whether one increases or decreases, as long as one directs their heart to Heaven.

hebrew_text: ושמא תאמר לאכילה הוא צריך תלמוד לאמר (תהלים נ, יב) אם ארעב לא אומר לך כי לי תבל ומלואה ונאמר (תהלים נ, י) כי לי כל חיתו יער בהמות בהררי אלף ידעתי כל עוף הרים וזיז שדי עמדי האוכל בשר אבירים ודם עתודים אשתה
human_translation: And lest you say needs for consumption, the verse states: “If I were hungry, I would not tell you; for the world is Mine, and everything within it” And it is stated: “For every beast of the forest is Mine, and the cattle upon a thousand hills. I know all the fowls of the mountains; and the wild beasts of the field are Mine” “Do I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?”
llm_translation: And perhaps you will say that it is necessary for eating, it is required to say (Psalms 50:12) "For to Me is the world and its fullness." And it is said (Psalms 50:10) "For Mine is every beast of the forest, the cattle upon a thousand hills. I know every bird of the mountains, and the creatures of the field are Mine. If I were hungry, I would not tell you, for Mine is the world and its fullness."

hebrew_text: לא אמרתי אליכם זבחו כדי שתאמר אעשה רצונו ויעשה רצוני לא לרצוני אתם זובחים אלא לרצונכם אתם זובחים שנאמר (ויקרא יט, ה) לרצונכם תזבחהו
human_translation: I did not say to you: Sacrifice so that you will say: I will do His will, and He will do my will. You are not sacrificing to My will, but you are sacrificing to your will, as it is stated: you shall sacrifice it so that you may be accepted”
llm_translation: I did not say to you, "Sacrifice so that you will say, 'I will do His will,' and He will do My will." Not for My will do you sacrifice, but for your will do you sacrifice, as it is stated (Leviticus 19:5), "For your will shall you sacrifice it."

hebrew_text: דבר אחר לרצונכם תזבחהו לרצונכם זבחו לדעתכם זבחו
human_translation: Alternatively, you shall sacrifice it so that you may be accepted [ lirtzonkhem ]” Sacrifice willingly [ lirtzonkhem ]; sacrifice intentionally.
llm_translation: Another interpretation: "According to your will, you shall sacrifice it; according to your will, you shall offer it; according to your understanding, you shall offer it."

hebrew_text: כדבעא מיניה שמואל מרב הונא מנין למתעסק בקדשים שהוא פסול שנאמר ושחט את בן הבקר שתהא שחיטה לשם בן בקר
human_translation: as Shmuel asked Rav Huna: From where to one who acts unawares of consecrated that is disqualified? as it is stated: “And he shall slaughter the young bull unless the slaughter is for the sake of a young bull,
llm_translation: As requested, here is the word-for-word English translation of the Talmudic text: "As asked by Samuel from Rav Huna, 'From where do we derive that one who is engaged with consecrated items is disqualified?' As it is stated, 'And he shall slaughter the son of the herd,' indicating that the slaughter must be for the sake of the son of the herd."

hebrew_text: אמר לו זו בידינו הוא לעכב מנין תלמוד לאמר לרצונכם תזבחהו לדעתכם זבחו:
human_translation: said to We have this from where indispensable? said to him “With your will you shall slaughter it” sacrifice intentionally,
llm_translation: He said to him, "This is in our hands to prevent. From where do we derive that the Talmud says, 'Say to your desire, "Sacrifice it"?'"

hebrew_text: הדרן עלך הרי עלי עשרון וסליקא לה מסכת מנחות
llm_translation: We will return to you, behold upon me a tithe, and we ascend to it, the tractate of Menachot.
